title: ['eBay Starts Collecting Sales Tax with More States to Come - EcommerceBytes', 'eBay Bikes - Rare Pro Team Issue Bikes | Cycling deals from ... - Road.cc', '1-Of-3 1976 Porsche 924 Shooting Brakes Lands On eBay For Just Under $38,000 - CarScoops', "New 50p 'error' means they're selling for hundreds on eBay - Cornwall Live", 'Birmingham couple who washed and sold used stamps on ebay jailed - Birmingham Live']
summary:
['eBay announced in October it would begin collecting sales tax in 4 states in 2019 due to new laws that extend the tax collection obligation to marketplaces (known as Marketplace Facilitator laws).
Note that online marketplace Etsy had already begun collecting such sales tax in 2018.eBay began collecting sales tax on January 1, 2019, for transactions where buyers are based in Washington and Minnesota, and it said it would begin collecting sales tax in Pennsylvania and Oklahoma beginning July 1, 2019.
But states have been busy passing legislation in the wake of the Supreme Court’s June 2018 “South Dakota vs Wayfair” ruling, and eBay has added to the list of states for which it said it must collect sales tax.
“Based on applicable tax laws, eBay will calculate, collect, and remit sales tax on behalf of sellers for items shipped to customers in the following states,” it wrote on its help pages, and listed the following 8 states along with the dates it would comply: Minnesota, Washington, Iowa, Connecticut, New Jersey, Alabama, Oklahoma, and Pennsylvania.
According to the help page, “Once eBay starts to collect tax in the above states, no action is required on your part, and there will be no charges or fees for eBay automatically calculating, collecting and remitting sales tax.', "We've found a few Team Sky bikes which seem to be the most common on eBay right now.
Many of the bikes here began life above £10,000 so there are some big savings to be had.
Buy nowNow one of the elder statesmen of the peloton, Eisel was a key part of Team Sky's Classics squad in 2013.
Buy nowWhile the paint job is definitely from Trek Segafredo, we think that this is just a Project 1 bike, not an exclusive team issue edition.
Buy nowStrictly speaking, this isn't a team-issue bike but it's a stunning example of a rare bike in 7-Eleven team colours.", 'This rare customized Porsche 924 has been converted into a 5-seater and has 79,638 miles on the clockThere’s nothing more special to a car collector than owning a truly unique vehicle, and this heavily-customized 1976 Porsche 924 certainly qualifies, as there are only three such models out there.
The actual conversion took place in 1986, when the car also received a 924 Turbo spec, with all-turbo running gear, engine and gearbox, 5-spoke alloy wheels and brakes.
The seller claims that his Porsche has 79,638 miles (128,164 km) on the clock and that it has also been “mechanically renovated”, featuring new brakes, tires, windshield and lights.
Ultimately, if you find value in owning this car, then we reckon paying that much for it wouldn’t be something you’d regret, especially if you’re into ultra-rare cars or Shooting Brake conversions.
However, if all you want is a used Porsche 924 in your driveway, you can get one for a heck of a lot less than that.', 'On eBay, a handful of coins have been listed for upwards of £198 because of a so-called error in the coin's production.
This error coin clearly has a blue scarf and James’s hair is a different colour."
"The range of shades found on the commemorative Snowman coin are caused by natural variation during the printing process.
In November it was reported that Snowman coins were selling for upwards of £103 on eBay after selling out in minutes online.
The Snowman coins aren't the only ones selling for huge sums online either.', 'Share your email to get all the latest Court and Crime news from Birmingham Live directly to your inboxA crooked Birmingham couple who defrauded the Royal Mail by “washing” used stamps and selling them on ebay as new have both been jailed.
The couple started buying used first and second class stamps in bulk in July 2013.
The amount they bought and then sold on ebay “dramatically accelerated” from initially £7,262 to £48,518 worth, said Ben Gow, prosecuting at Birmingham Crown Court.
(Image: Birmingham Mail)Mr Gow said the defendants had subjected the stamps to a chemical process to remove their cancellation marks.
The value of the amount of stamps sold was £443,244 while the defendant’s profited to the tune of £149,344.']

title: ['eBay Lets Buyers Shorten Best Offer Window - EcommerceBytes']
summary:
['eBay tweaked its Make an Offer ("Best Offer") feature.
Sellers typically have 48 hours to accept an offer, but now buyers can limit their offers to sellers to 12 hours or 24 hours if they feel 48 hours is too long - at least in some listings spotted on eBay.
eBay explains Best Offers on this page where it wrote:"Best Offer lets you offer the seller a price you're willing to pay on Buy It Now items.
And, it explains, "The seller has 48 hours to decide whether to accept or reject your offer, or suggest another price.
It offered buyers the option to limit their offers to 12 hours or 24 hours.']

title: ['The 10 best items to sell on eBay in January - Better Homes and Gardens', 'The ten best items to sell on eBay in January - Daily Mail', "Transfer Travel dubbed 'eBay for travel' lets you buy unwanted holidays at a bargain price - This is Money"]
summary:
['So what are the best selling items, and how much money can you make?
Before you start listing your unwanted things, read our guide to how to sell on eBay.
If your old mixer or microwave is still in good condition, you can make good money on eBay.
Average selling price for a second-hand Kitchen Aid mixer: $264.642.
Average selling price for second-hand video games: $23.067.', "Before you round up your possessions, you may want to take look at information eBay has shared revealing its top ten best sellers along with the average price for each.
From old DVDs to shoes, perfumes and kitchen appliances, this handy guide outlines the items Australians should sell on eBay in January.
eBay reports items such as Kitchen Aid mixers are hot sellers, so if you have one spare and it's in good condition, the average price you can expect to sell this for is $264.64.
eBay reports appliances such as Kitchen Aid mixers (pictured) hold their value and these items can fetch on average $264.642.
Perfumes which are unopened sell well on eBay and buyers will pay up to 431.20 for a second-hand fragrance (stock image)10.", "It's a situation that Simon Powell, founder of Transfer Travel, knows only too well.
But in spite of the heartache and hit to his wallet, the experience planted the seed of a business idea that has grown into Transfer Travel - a website where users can buy and sell unwanted holidays and travel tickets between themselves.
This means the firm doesn't own, buy, sell, resell, fulfil, transfer or provide any of the tickets listed and on the website.
In a bid to stave off rogue traders, Transfer Travel collects proceeds of sales through a payment processing system called Stripe Pay and then stores it.
While buyers are free to offer more or less than the quoted price, Transfer Travel does not offer a eBay style bidding facility."]

Bought from US but have to ship to China to get refund or replacement.
Make sure you are dealing with US seller and not a foreign seller warehousing in US.', 'eBay has long been the go-to for people buying and reselling hyped sneakers and designer clothing and accessories.
And the selling platform has now revealed how much some of those items have been bought for recently.
In terms of sneakers, eBay data shows that Kanye West and adidas’ YEEZY Boost 350 V2, which retails for $220, doesn’t command the price premium it once did.
The OFF-WHITE x Converse Chuck 70 has a comparatively higher price premium, selling for between $241 and $297 after retailing for $130 in October 2018.
All of these figures are based on the average selling price of new items sold in the past 30 days on eBay and were pulled on January 2.', 'You also get free standard shipping nationwide, as well as free 30-day returns with a firm money back guarantee.
The only downside seems to be the lack of an original retail box, which means the included accessories will be Note 8-compatible, but “might” not be Samsung-branded.
You can choose from Midnight Black and Orchid Gray models with 64GB internal storage space and 6GB RAM, and the savings you’re looking at here are incredibly substantial.
Samsung still sells the Galaxy Note 8 at a whopping $700, while the previous all-time low price for a good (not excellent) condition device with a 60-day warranty was $375 .
The Galaxy Note 8 may not feel like a very smart purchase a full 16 months after its commercial release, but age is just a number... when the price of a reliable old phone like this one drops to a crazy low $319.99.']

title: ['Amazon and eBay evict sellers amid VAT crackdown - BBC', "Lost photographs of Jane Austen's nieces discovered on eBay ... - The Telegraph"]
summary:
['If the hosting sites fail to take action they can be pursued by HMRC for any future VAT that is unpaid.
Seven sites, including Amazon, eBay, Asos and Etsy, have specifically signed up to an agreement with HMRC.', "Lost photographs of Jane Austen's nieces and nephews have been discovered in an old photo album, which reveals their lives - which could have come out of one of the author's own novels.
A leading historian has said the works of the writer foreshadowed the chequered love lives of her family members.
Karen Levers, 51, bought the book of Victorian photographs for $1,000 (£780) from eBay, expecting it to be full of pictures of 19th century aristocrats.
However, she found the book is full of previously unseen photos of Austen's nieces and nephews - many of whose lives reflected the writer's novels.
It was put together by Lord George Augusta Hill, an aristocrat who married two of Austen's nieces, both daughters of her older brother Edward."]

title: ['‘Sitting duck’ eBay sellers take a stand against the scammers - The Guardian']
summary:
['For most eBay sellers the story would end there.
“The police say they do not deal with such cases, so eBay told me to get a crime reference number from Action Fraud.
“Buyer claimed item didn’t arrive, eBay gave refund.
“Professional scammers often never notify eBay, nor leave feedback because, if they do, sellers can respond via feedback which stays forever to warn other sellers,” he says.
“Ebay sellers are like sitting ducks waiting to be scammed.”']

title: ['We bought a mystery box from eBay and this is what we got - Wales 247', "Munich commuter's 'train delay scarf' fetches more than $11K on eBay - CBC.ca", "Stephen Curry's 'Moon Landing' shoes sell for $58,100 on eBay - SFGATE", 'Pre-WW2 bottle of Buckfast selling on eBay for almost £800 - The National', 'Mum earns £1,200 from selling unwanted clothes and junk on eBay – how you can do it too... - The Sun', 'Long-lost Jane Austen family photo album discovered on eBay - Fox News', 'Police: UPS driver stole packages, sold luxury items on eBay - WAVE 3', 'German train-delay scarf sells for €7,550 on eBay - The Guardian']
summary:
['', 'Read Story TranscriptA hand-knit scarf that symbolizes one Munich woman's year of commuter hell has sold for more than $11,000.
Clerk Claudia Weber knitted the scarf after her daily commute, using rows of different colours of yarn to document every train delay she experienced in 2018.
She and her family then put the 1.5-metre long "rail delay scarf" on eBay, where it sold on Monday for €7,550, or $11,487.50 Cdn.
Grey wool means a delay of fewer than five minutes, pink for delays between five and 30 minutes, and red signifies 30 or more.
"It was six and a half weeks, I think, of summer vacation time, when you really want to spend all your time on the train," Weber said.', 'A pair of game-worn Under Armour Curry 6s with images of the moon on them sold for $58,100 on eBay Sunday.
Golden State Warriors star Stephen Curry wore the kicks during a Jan.3 game against the Houston Rockets, a few weeks after he lit the internet on fire by suggesting during an episode of The Ringer's "Winging It" podcast that the moon landing was staged.', 'Jonathan Porter was clearing out his parent's house when he made the discovery in the the loft.
Buckfast makers J Chandler and Co have confirmed that the bottle was made before 1936, meaning that it's over 80 years old and probably shouldn't be drunk.
The label of the unopened bottle claims that the tonic wine inside is "a great cure for depression, insomnia and pregnancy pains".
Interestingly, it's possible to establish if a bottle of Buckfast was made before or after the war by looking at the address on the label.
"It's difficult to date it more accurately than that as the label and bottle changed very little over a long period of time."', 'Karen McTweed, 53, from Elderslie, near Glasgow, uses the money to pay for family holidaysA MUM-OF-TWO earns about £1,200 a year by selling unwanted clothes and household junk on eBay.
5 Karen McTweed, 53, says she's made £12,500 over the course of 10 years by selling unwanted clothes on eBay Credit: Karen McTweedBy auctioning off her kids' old clothes and other unwanted items, GP practice nurse Karen says she's made £12,500 worth of sales in the 10 years she's been selling on eBay.
She sells off her old clothes and junk, her partner Stuart Turner's items as well as unwanted clothes that her two kids have now grown out of.
How to be a successful eBay seller Karen and LatestDeals.co.uk co-founder Tom Church have shared their top tips for making the most money from selling unwanted items on eBay: Karen says: 1.
She said: "Both my grown up children sell unwanted clothes on eBay too now."', 'A long-lost photo album containing extremely rare pictures of Jane Austen’s family has surfaced on eBay, where it was bought for $1,000.
Karen Ievers bought the Victorian photo album expecting it to be full of pictures of 19th-century aristocrats, according to SWNS.
The album, which was advertised as belonging to Lord George Hill of Hillsborough Castle, was offered for $2,800 on eBay.
Ievers contacted Dr. Sophia Hillan, author of “May, Lou & Cass: Jane Austen's Nieces in Ireland,” who uncovered the family link to Lord George Hill.
"Her nieces were very important to Jane Austen, which gives this album a special significance.', 'LOUISVILLE, KY (WAVE) - Detectives arrested a UPS driver in Louisville who they suspect stole dozens of packages and some factory inventory, selling at least some of what he stole.
According to Keen’s arrest report, he admitted to owning the eBay account and selling one of the watches for $2,000.
Keen’s arrest report said police also discovered marijuana, Xanax bars and a drug that appeared to be MDMA, along with scales.
He was arrested in the early morning hours of Jan. 9, his arrest report shows.
Inside the package were luxury perfumes and colognes valued at nearly $1,700, that arrest report states.', 'A scarf knitted by a German woman to document her frustrations with frequent train delays has sold for €7,550 (£6,720) on eBay, as the country’s biggest railway company announces plans for a punctuality tsar.
“In the spring, everything was OK. Lots of grey and pink,” Weber wrote.
Photograph: Twitter/Sara WeberThe scarf, approximately 1.5 metres (4.9ft) long, represented many Germans’ frustrations with train delays, despite their country’s reputation abroad for efficiency and punctuality.
Roughly one-quarter of all trains and one-third of long-distance trains were late in 2018 — a far cry from the days when 95% of German trains ran on time.
“We truly did not expect this,” Weber wrote on the eBay page.']

title: ['To compete with Amazon, Walmart and eBay are spending on logistics - Digiday']
summary:
['Logistics is becoming the battleground for retailers looking to compete with Amazon.
Over the last year, both Walmart.com and eBay have partnered with third-party logistics providers to compete with Amazon’s two-day shipping standard; both marketplaces are also working with installation services, with eBay working with Handy, Porch and Installernet, and Walmart with Handy and Porch.
Two-year-old Deliverr, which works with Walmart, eBay, Etsy, and Shopify, uses a tech platform that connects sellers with a network of warehouses and logistics providers so they can offer two-day delivery.
Walmart recently told Digiday that tie-ups with companies like Handy offer customers added convenience.
“Walmart and eBay are both in experimentation mode and trying to figure out what works,” he said.']

Murphy joined eBay’s leadership team after co-founding WHI Solutions, where he served as CEO, and later sold to eBay in 2012.
Breather founder and previous CEO Julien Smith will remain with the company as chairman of the board.
“Breather has built a remarkable commercial real estate e-commerce and services platform that offers one-click access to over 500 workspaces around the world,” said Murphy.
In October, Breather launched Breather offices, an expansion of its flexible space offering specifically designed for companies looking for occupancy periods of a month or more.']

title: ['eBay Raises Fees for eBay Motors in 2 Weeks - EcommerceBytes', 'Katie Price forced to remove Barbie jeep from eBay after car ... - Evening Standard', 'eBay UK Caps Seller Fees in New Promotion - EcommerceBytes', 'Antique bottle of Buckfast sells on eBay for £10,000 | HeraldScotland - HeraldScotland']

Cardamone emphasized that she had agreed to the probationary sentence only with the condition that Italiano pay back his victims.
Finally, a buyer in California paid $10,850 for his Mercedes, which again arrived rusted and dented, its paint chipping.
That buyer had auction insurance, but Italiano now owes the amount paid to that company, Bush and Cardamone agreed.
He will serve three years of probation as part of the agreed-upon sentence, and be prohibited from selling anything – pristine or not – on any internet auction sites.']

8 Helen was previously spotted in this jacket Credit: Alamy8 She's now punting it online8 Helen Flanagan looked gorgeous in this green dress Credit: Alamy8 Fans can snap up this dress onlineOne fan said: “If only your beautiful clothes fitted my less than desirable body.”Got a story?", 'Here’s a look at what some people are listing for sale on eBay, followed by some eBay listings that Komando readers will actually love.

Probably the most shocking thing being sold is empty toilet paper rolls.
eBay listings you will loveKobwa spinning desk toyYou’ve heard of the fidget spinner, I’m sure.
This will work for an iPhone 6 Plus, iPhone 6S Plus, and an iPhone 7 Plus.']

title: ['eBay Bans Amazon Drop Shipping but Fails to Notify Sellers - EcommerceBytes', "eBay bids for Prince Philip's 'car crash parts' hit £65k - Manchester Evening News", 'Retired NJ firefighter caught selling fire museum artifacts on eBay - New York Post', 'FORMER ISLE OF WIGHT FIRE ENGINE GOES UP FOR SALE ON ... - Island Echo']
summary:
['eBay banned the practice of "Amazon drop shipping," also known as a form of retail arbitrage, but the company failed to notify sellers, as we report today in EcommerceBytes Newsflash.
eBay even provided a map sellers could use to find the Kmart stores in their area.
As for the latter practice that eBay now prohibits, some argue it's irrelevant if an eBay seller uses Amazon "arbitrage" as long as the eBay buyer receives the item they ordered.
This 18-page thread on the eBay discussion boards show how controversial the practice is among eBay users.
Is it okay to copy Amazon listings and post them to eBay and then use Amazon to fulfill the item to eBay buyers?', "Something went wrong, please try again later.
Invalid email Something went wrong, please try again later.
Sign up for our daily newsletter to get the day's biggest stories sent direct to your inboxAn opportunist charity fundraiser is selling debris reportedly from Prince Philip's car crash on eBay.
eBay seller Morbius777 has put them up for sale and says every penny going to Cancer Research UK.
Last Thursday's crash saw the the 97-year-old royal walk away unscathed, while two women and a nine-month-old baby in hospital.", 'A retired firefighter in New Jersey was arrested for stealing artifacts from a local museum and selling the goods on eBay, a report said Monday.
Paul Avery — who rakes in an annual pension of nearly $130,000 — allegedly took items from the John T. Brennan Fire Museum in Bayonne, according to NJ.com.
He allegedly took items that were in storage.
A Bayonne fire captain who runs the museum believes that Avery began stealing items from them in 2016.
Avery retired in 2017 and receives an annual pension of $129,813, the website said.', '']

title: ["Bottle of 'original' Ribena on eBay for £98 made before sugar tax levy - Daily Mail", 'Elliott Management Sends Letter to Board of Directors of eBay - Business Wire', 'eBay Haggling No Longer Optional for Sellers - EcommerceBytes', 'Hedge funds push for overhaul at eBay - Reuters']
summary:
["Sweet-toothed soft drink fans are paying up to eighty times the recommended price for sugar tax free versions of their favourite products on eBay.
Last year, makers Nestlé admitted to slashing an average of 40 per cent of the drinks' sugar from the upmarket range.
But months on, dozens of sellers can still be found touting their pre sugar tax wares online.
The sugar tax is an extra levy placed on soft drink, which came into force in April.
Treasury minister Robert Jenrick said the sugar tax had helped raise much-needed funds for children's physical education.", 'Revitalizing Marketplace: eBay’s Marketplace is a strategically valuable asset that has weathered prolonged, self-inflicted misexecution.
Elliott beneficially owns over 4% of eBay Inc. (the “Company” or “eBay”), making us one of the Company’s largest investors.
The necessary actions, which we refer to as the Enhancing eBay Plan (the “Plan”), have been informed by an extensive amount of research and diligence.
Revitalizing Marketplace: eBay’s Marketplace is a strategically valuable asset that has weathered prolonged, self-inflicted misexecution.
A Unique Value OpportunityThe Enhancing eBay Plan can create significant value for shareholders while resulting in a better and more focused eBay.', 'Dear Ina,Have you seen this option under the "Contact Seller" dropdown before?
It is on a BIN (Buy It Now) listing with no Best Offer enabled, and I don't recall seeing it before.
When buyers select this topic, it sends a message that the seller can respond to with an offer - it doesn't automatically trigger the usual Best Offer widget.
I'm not too happy eBay is encouraging buyers to think they can pay less than full price on my BINs.', "(Reuters) - Hedge funds Elliott Management and Starboard Value have taken stakes in eBay Inc EBAY.O and are pushing for changes including the sale of some of the e-commerce company's businesses.
In a letter to the company’s board, Elliott asked eBay to hive off its StubHub ticket sales business and eBay Classifieds Group as part of a plan the hedge fund says could double the company’s value.
Shares of eBay rose as much as 12 percent before trading up 5.7 percent at $32.78 early Tuesday afternoon.
Elliott, which owns a more than 4 percent stake in eBay, said the company’s share price could reach $55-$63 by 2020 if it implemented the hedge fund’s restructuring plan.
“The eBay Board and leadership team regularly engage with our shareholders and value their input,” the company said."]

title: ['eBay proves a company isn’t always bigger than the sum of its parts - VentureBeat']
summary:
['Google’s parent company, Alphabet, is a $750 billion company, after all.
As such, Elliott Management wants to see some big changes happening at eBay, which it said is massively underperforming on its potential.
The third spinoff would be eBay’s classifieds unit, which operates under various brands around the world.
Using its Q3 2018 earnings as a guide, eBay claimed $2.6 billion in revenue, of which $2.1 billion was attributed to the eBay marketplace.
And it’s one that doesn’t immediately “fit” with the eBay marketplace, despite efforts to cross-promote tickets and merchandise between the platforms.']

title: ['Vintage Maserati Barn Find for Sale on eBay Motors - Road & Track', 'eBay Bikes - Pinarello F10, Cannondale CAAD10, Canyon & Giant ... - Road.cc', 'EBay picks Halifax as first Canadian city for its e-commerce training - CBC.ca', 'eBay Canada announces small business exporting initiative to help ... - Canada NewsWire']
summary:
["Vintage Maseratis are some of the most beautiful cars around, and it's not often one this original comes up for sale.
According to the ad, this car was originally purchased in Italy before being imported into the States in the 1970s.
It was last registered in Louisiana in 1976, and judging by the car's condition, it looks like it's been sitting tucked away somewhere ever since.
Italian cars of this era are known to have severe rust issues, and that doesn't exclude low-production exotics like Maseratis.
The ad claims this Quattroporte is one of about 740 built in total by the factory, making it pretty rare.", "A collection of road bikes from £995 to £6,999eBay has got loads of used bike and we've found some gems.
There is a great range of bikes and as long as you're careful about who you buy from, there are some bargains to be had.
A good aluminium frame will ride beautifully and Cannondale are one of the best.
It's designed more for going uphill so this is a great choice if you like a lot of climbing.
The design is simple and you get very good stiffness from the BB and headtube which are both very chunky.", 'Online shopping and auction giant eBay Canada has chosen Halifax as the first Canadian city for its e-commerce training course, saying the Nova Scotia capital was selected on the strength of its small business community.
"It's going to help local retailers sell their products to a wider audience," he said.
"They don't want to come in and displace retailers, they want to help retailers do well in the online world."
He said he couldn't survive as an antiques dealer in rural Nova Scotia without an online marketplace.
The eBay training program was first launched in Akron, Ohio, Lansing, Mich., and Wolverhampton, U.K., in 2018.', 'This eBay program, the first of its kind in Canada, is supported by all three levels of government.
"Strong, independent small businesses have always played an important role in our local economy and in shaping our character of place," says Halifax Mayor Mike Savage.
In Canada, 99 per cent of small retailers on eBay export, and to an average of 18 markets, compared to 12 per cent of traditional small businesses that engage in global trade2.
"As one of the most robust online marketplaces in the world, enabling entrepreneurs and small businesses is central to eBay's business and purpose," says Andrea Stairs, General Manager, eBay Canada & Latin America.
Cumulatively, these three cities have already helped the small businesses involved generate millions of dollars in sales and export to over 80 international markets.']

title: ['Poshmark, eBay and Buffalo Exchange are cleaning up thanks to Marie Kondo - MarketWatch']
summary: ['Marie Kondo is sparking joy for thrift stores and consignment shops.\nWhile these resale spots generally expect an influx of unwanted clothes, shoes and accessories each January as the New Year spurs many people to clean up their acts (and their closets), numerous online and brick-and-mortar resellers tell Moneyish that they’re seeing record donations this year.\nAnd they credit it to Kondo, author of the best-selling 2014 book “The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying Up,” whose accompanying Netflix series was released on New Year’s...']

title: ["eBay seller asked to refund £465 in a 'cracked' iPhone scam gets her money back - This is Money", "'Hack-proof' phones sold on eBay can erase all data before police get inside - The Mirror"]
summary:
["But the buyer opened a case against her with eBay.
Sacha told This is Money that a number of friends and acquaintances had also experienced similar problems with eBay's Money Back Guarantee refunding buyers.
Have you sold something on eBay in good condition only to have a buyer open a case against you and eBay refund them unfairly?
In an email from eBay customer service on 2 January, when Sacha first raised the case, eBay told her: 'Determining an outcome in these types of cases is always a difficult task.
However, they said they would refund the full £465 to Sacha, including seller fees, as 'a gesture of goodwill'.", "EXCLUSIVE: The Met says top-tier crooks are using the EncroChat handsets which wipe everything unless a 15-character password is entered correctly'Hack-proof' phones sold on eBay can erase all data before police get insideMobile phones that delete all data before police can access it are \xadbeing sold on eBay for £1,400.
EncroChat phones wipe everything unless a 15-character password is entered correctly, meaning detectives cannot access anything incriminating on them.
Det Con Elliot Humphrey of the Metropolitan Police said the Encro phones are being used by top-tier crooks.
The rise of hack-proof phones was \xadrevealed in the trial of contract killer Mark “Iceman” Fellows, 38.
Police seized phones from Fellows and co-defendant Stephen Boyle, 36, who \xad“spotted” for Kinsella’s \xadslaying but could not crack the devices."]

title: ['Seller beware! A new eBay scam using its own return label - The Guardian', 'eBay Crackdown on Black Americana? - EcommerceBytes', 'Get 10% off everything at the AO outlet on eBay - Eurogamer.net']
summary:
['The buyer paid via PayPal and requested the item be delivered to their local Argos, as eBay facilitates that.
A week later, the buyer said he wanted to return the phone as he couldn’t activate it.
We knew this couldn’t be the case, but felt we had no choice but to start the return and refund process.
As eBay sees that the package has been delivered to the postal area, it assumes it was received and issues a refund.
I find it unbelievable that a company as big as eBay can’t put changes in place to stop these practices.', 'Last week sellers found they were unable to relist items in the Black Americana category on eBay.
He called eBay and customer service said the term that eBay considered offensive was "Black Americana."
To be clear, eBay has a Black Americana Collectibles category under Ethnic & Cultural Collectibles.
We found several threads on the eBay boards from other sellers unable to relist items in the Black Americana category.
The eBay policy states sellers can't list reproductions in this category, but the seller emphatically stated their posters are original.', 'Just use voucher PERKUP at checkout to get that small yet sweet discount.
A PlayStation 4 Slim with Red Dead Redemption 2 can be nabbed for £224 with the code, while a PlayStation 4 Pro with Red Dead Redemption 2 sold out earlier today for £314.
PlayStation 4 with Red Dead Redemption 2If FIFA is more your style, there are also PlayStation 4 slim bundles with the popular football sim to be had for the same price.
Neon Nintendo SwitchTellies abound in the AO sale too, with this particularly luscious Panasonic 55" 4K Ultra HD Smart TV going for only £391.
Take a look at what else is available in the AO television section.']

title: ['1983 Audi Quattro for Sale on eBay - Road & Track', '$100,000 set of Bugatti Veyron wheels and tires pops up on eBay - Motor Authority', 'Rarest 20p EVER snapped up on eBay - and now it could sell for thousands - The Mirror', 'Bizarre cashmere jumper advert with model wrapped up in rope confuses eBay shoppers – with some joking i... - The Sun']
summary:
["It's a European-market 1983 Audi Ur-Quattro that just popped up for sale on eBay for a pretty reasonable price.
Welcome to You Must Buy, our daily look at the cars you really should be buying instead of that boring commuter sedan.
According to the description, this Quattro was delivered new in Germany, where it was eventually sold 1991 to a new owner in Colombia.
The car is currently listed on eBay with a Buy It Now price of $47,900 or best offer.
But locating a well-driven, cared-for Euro-market Quattro like this one this side of the Atlantic doesn't happen often.", 'Bugatti Owners likely don't need to save money when it comes to replacement parts, but for the frugal Veyron owner, a set of lightly used wheels and tires have surfaced for sale.
Motor1 spotted the wheels and tires are for sale on eBay in Fort Lauderdale, Florida, with an asking price of $100,000.
According to the seller, a new set of tires and wheels costs $150,000 from Bugatti, which makes this gently used set a "steal."
The OZ Racing wheels are the OEM wheels Bugatti fitted to the Veyron, and the seller says they have never been refurbished.
While any Veyron owner can take advantage of the deal, perhaps someone could scoop them up along with a full Veyron interior.', 'He bought it on eBay for £50, but now Hull man Alun Barker is the proud owner of a coin worth thousands that's thought to be the only one of its kind ever made.
Image: Alun Barker / SWNS) Alun Barker / SWNS)Dad-of-one, Alun, said: "When I saw it I loved it straight away.
Image: Alun Barker / SWNS) Alun Barker / SWNS)Image: Alun Barker / SWNS) Alun Barker / SWNS)Alun purchased the coin on eBay for just £50 in December 2017 and snapped it up as a 'buy it now' item.
Image: Alun Barker / SWNS) Alun Barker / SWNS)Having finally found a coin "worth having", Alun decided to get the coin valued at antique specialists, V Marshall & Sons, in Beverley.
The coin is the first of it's kind seen by ANACS and is the only one registered by coin experts.', 'But now one eBay seller has thoroughly confused shoppers after putting a luxury cashmere jumper on sale alongside a photo of a model wrapped up in rope.
And for reasons we can't quite understand, the model has rope wrapped around her neck, torso and arms in the out-of-place image.
5 One Mumsnet user was left totally baffled by the eBay advert Credit: Ebay/Mumsnet5 Others said it looked like an advert for 'bondage' Credit: Ebay/MumsnetUnsurprisingly, shoppers have been left equally baffled by the eBay advert.
The rest of the photos are normal pictures of the jumper, what possessed them to put that one on?"
Plus this YouTuber tried out Kylie Jenner's budget range for Fashion Nova and says she "looks like a Teletubby".']

title: ['Activist Investors Urge eBay To Separate StubHub And Classifieds Businesses - Forbes', 'Ebay sellers can now list 1,000 items for FREE... - The Sun', 'Royal Marine stole military kit from Faslane and sold it on Ebay - Daily Record']
summary:
['', 'From March 3, sellers will be able to list up to 1,000 items a month free of charge, up from just 20.
But eBay is now increasing the number of free listings by 4,900 per cent to help sellers make more money.
Subscribers who have registered their account as an eBay shop and pay the £19.99 monthly charge will also get 1,000 free listings on top of 100 free short-duration auction listings per month.
And there are some restrictions - the 1,000 free listings per month will not apply to classified adverts, or to items listed in the cars, motorcycles and vehicles category.
After that, it costs 35p to list each item on eBay - though from March 3, you will have 1,000 free listings per month.', 'He said: “He stole kit that his comrades should have been using, potentially putting their lives at risk.”Parkhill, who has served in tours of Afghanistan and Iraq, stole the equipment over the course of 10 years and sold it on Ebay, making £13,956.67.
Cara Watt, fiscal depute, said: “On December 8, 2015, MOD police received intelligence that MOD property was being advertised on Ebay.
“It’s all very well saying he has paid it back but he stole money from the Royal Marines.
“He stole kit that his comrades should have been using, potentially putting their lives at risk and I don’t think that comes forward.
“He has brought disgrace on himself and the Royal Marine Commandos.']

title: ['Artifacts stolen from Bayonne Museum sold on eBay - The Hudson Reporter', 'eBay: Terrifying GMV Performance (NASDAQ:EBAY) - Seeking Alpha', 'Are Warranties Invalid on eBay Purchases? - EcommerceBytes', 'eBay Bikes - Eye-Candy Road Bikes from Specialized, Canyon, De ... - Road.cc', "Weird bondage-like Ebay sweater advert features model's torso ad arms tangled in ropes - Daily Mail"]
summary:
['Several stolen items from the Bayonne Fire Museum that turned up on eBay have been allegedly traced to a retired Bayonne fire battalion chief, according to Bayonne police.
Three helmets and a speaking trumpet were recovered, but other stolen items were not.
How many items were stolen is unclear, but the value of those items likely amounts to several thousand dollars.
The museum is on 47th Street between Broadway and Avenue C and was used as a firehouse until 1928.
- Advertisement -The museum is maintained by the Bayonne Exempt Firemen’s Association, with Captain Don Haiber overseeing the facility from a small office in the back.', 'Quarter after quarter, eBay continues to show that it is a company going nowhere.
Here’s a look at the company’s latest GMV results below:Figure 2. eBay GMV Source: eBay Q4 earnings deckAs can be seen in the chart above, GMV growth decelerated three points to just 2% y/y, down from 5% in the prior quarter.
However, more recently we’ve seen GMV growth drop below active buyer growth, the result of several factors.
Going forward, if eBay wants to drive continued revenue growth, it will have to produce a lift in GMV.
Until eBay can find a way to turn its revenue and GMV growth around, investors should avoid this stock.', "I purchased a Cuisinart new compact bread maker from an eBay merchant.
60 days after purchase, the mixing paddle in the bread pan locked up, and if I continued to use it would have destroyed the motor.
I supplied my PayPal invoice to Cuisinart as proof of purchase and asked for a new bread pan under the warranty.
My claim was denied stating that warranty is void when the item is purchased from eBay.
Don't purchase from eBay.", "The bikes that we have here are some of the nicest-looking that we've seen on eBay and the best thing is that they're brilliant to ride too.
It's now badged up as an S-Works Venge, but if you don't tell, we won't!
The aero frame comes finished with a Dura-Ace 9000 groupset and FSA SL-K Light carbon chainset.
If you're after an S-Works Venge that you can gradually upgrade then this is a brilliant option.
The black-on-black frameset is super stealthy while the build is finished with a CeramicSpeed bottom bracket and Ultgera 6800 groupset.", 'An innocent eBay sale took a turn for the weird when bidders noticed the seller had used a bondage-style picture to feature their item.
The product being sold was a pink cashmere sweater from Scottish brand Brora, however, the choice of picture caught the attention of several users.
The image featured a woman modeling the cowl-neck sweater, awkwardly tangled in thick ropes circling her torso, arms and even her neck.
The advert featured a model with ropes around her torso, arms and even neckA less dirty mind suggested that the sweater owner was merely going for the nauticual look.
The sweater was eventually sold to the highest bidder at £36 after 11 bids.']

title: ['eBay Checkout Hides PayPal Option for Some Purchases - EcommerceBytes', 'eBay Is Back To The Indian Bay, Co Sees Multiple Opportunities - Inc42 Media']
summary:
['eBay buyers are coming across a design change on the Checkout page that appears detrimental to PayPal.
For some purchases, it makes their credit card number the default payment method and "hides" the option to pay with PayPal behind a link that reads "Show payment options."
As a result, he inadvertently paid for an eBay item with his credit card instead of PayPal.
The following screenshot shows how the checkout page appears for some purchases, according to two readers, one of whom noticed the change in mid-January.
Note the graphic above shows a partial screenshot of the eBay Checkout page.', "eBay first launched in India in 2004 On New Years' Eve ebay introduced eBay India again eBay has to begin domestic seller experiencesAfter breaking up with Flipkart in May 2018, eBay has relaunched in India on New Years’ Eve, in its phase 1, shared eBay CEO Devin Wenig while answering analysts’ questions about India during the recent announcement of financials for the quarter ending on December 31, 2018.
He said that the Indian market is still in its early phase and has plenty of growth left.
He believes that there won't be one or two parties that make up the entirety of the Indian ecommerce opportunity and the compan"]

title: ['eBay Glitch Leaves Users Unable to Leave Feedback - EcommerceBytes', 'Spotify, eBay set standard for fertility benefits, study finds - TechCrunch', 'Schoolboy builds £15k a year eBay empire selling kids toys... - The Sun', 'Tesla, eBay, and Spotify rank high on list for workplace fertility ben - Fast Company', 'eBay-style auction site Wish selling ‘Killer Zombie’ machete knives for just £19... - The Sun']
summary:
['eBay users report being unable to leave feedback for trading partners.
A reader reported the problem on the Ecommerce EKG board"I am unable to leave feedback on certain transactions.
I spoke with eBay customer service and they offered to leave the feedback for me, which I confirmed was fine.
The seller followed up: "Now they're trying to blame it on my computer and/or browser even after they (eBay) can't leave the feedback either!"
One reader who called eBay customer service told us that eBay said it was aware of the problem and that they said the ETA for a fix was February 23.', 'The technology sector awards women and same-sex couples the most comprehensive fertility benefit packages, according to a survey by FertilityIQ, an online platform for fertility patients to review doctors and research treatments.
The two companies offer employees unlimited IVF cycles with no pre-authorization requirement, meaning employees do not need permission from insurance providers before seeking certain medical services.
Despite an initial outpouring of skepticism, Facebook and Apple became leaders in the fertility benefit category when they began paying for their female employees to freeze their eggs in 2014.
Since then, smaller firms have opted to beef up those benefits to stay competitive with their much larger and richer counterparts.
“The company that helps you build your family is the company that you remain committed to.”', 'He even cycles after school everyday to take packages to the postman using a trailer he attaches to the back of his bike.
The thrifty entrepreneur realised you could buy a secondhand bundle of the toys on marketplace Gumtree for just £19.
To buy his first batch of weapons, Tommy sold chicken eggs from his family farm.
He priced each of the secondhand Nerf guns at between £20 and £30 - and they sold out within a week.
5 The business is called Dog In A Box and is named after his pet pooch, Oreo Credit: SWNS:South West News ServiceOnce his business took off, he started ringing up wholesalers and placing huge orders.', '', 'Sellers on Wish.com offer a range of the "razor-sharp" blades - some of which come splashed with imitation BLOOD.
AN eBay-style auction site has come under fire for flogging 'Killer Zombie' machete knives for just £19.
Sellers on Wish.com offer a range of the "razor-sharp" blades - some of which come splashed with imitation BLOOD.
3 Some of the blades come splashed with imitation blood Credit: Wish.comOne 17.5-inch machete - labelled the 'Zombie killer' - comes in 'acid' green with a skull-embossed black sheath.
3 Users praised the 'razor-sharp' blades Credit: Wish.com3 The terrifying weapons can be bought for as little as £19 Credit: Wish.comWe pay for your stories!']

title: ['Carolina Panthers 2015 player-issued NFC Championship ring listed on ebay - WCNC.com']
summary:
['For a little over $27,000 you could own a piece of Carolina Panthers history.
CHARLOTTE, N.C. — How much are you willing to pay for a rare piece of Carolina Panthers history?
But just how much is going to the Super Bowl worth?
A 2015 NFC Championship ring that was issued to players is currently listed on Ebay for $27,500.
The ring, which is a size 16, is an authentic Jostens 10k ring with the Super Bowl 50 logo engraved on the inside.']

title: ['1992 Dodge Viper With 34 Miles for Sale on eBay - Road & Track']
summary:
["The original Viper is now nearly 30 years old, so it was only a matter of time until ultra low-mileage examples like this one started to appear.
It's a first-year 1992 model that's been stored in a collection since new, with just 34 miles on the odometer.
The original window sticker is still on the car, as are the original tires.
That's about triple the asking price of your average first-gen Viper, but considering the mileage, the price makes sense.
If you've ever wanted to own a brand-new 1992 Dodge Viper, this is likely as close as you'll be able to get."]

title: ['DOJ busts gang for allegedly selling fake cars on eBay - Engadget', 'EBay-owned horizontal AlaMaula to shutdown in Argentina - AIM Group', '1991 JDM Toyota Crown Hearse Import for Sale on eBay Motors - Road & Track', "Galanthus Woronowii 'Elizabeth Harrison' Snowdrops Sell For ... - Country Living UK", 'Caia Fryer chip shop in Wrexham goes up for sale... on eBay | The ... - The Leader']
summary:
['DOJ busts gang for allegedly selling fake cars on eBay Romanian fraudsters posed as members of the military needing to sell their car before deployment.
The Department of Justice has unsealed information about an organized crime ring that used online sites like eBay and Craigslist to defraud people.
According to the documents, the Romanian team would create fake ads on websites like Craigslist and eBay for pricey goods.
In order to sell the scam, the profiles would claim that they were in the military, and needed to sell the car before being deployed.
If found guilty, the gang can expect up to 20 years in jail and hefty fines that range from $250,000 through to $500,000.', 'EBay-owned horizontal AlaMaula will shutdown on April 4 this year, following increased competition from Naspers-owned horizontal OLX Argentina.
AlaMaula, which used to be the No.
1 horizontal, has struggled to monetize as competition from OLX Argent...', "Looking to attract the most attention possible at your next local car meet?
Or you can get this thing: a 1991 Toyota Crown sedan that's been converted into a hearse.
The car is right-hand drive, obviously, sending power to the rear wheels via a 2.0-liter inline-six and a five-speed manual transmission.
The car is currently listed on eBay in St. Louis, Missouri, with a Buy It Now price of $19,750 or best offer.
That's a bit more than what your average Toyota Crown brings in, but considering the rarity and all the custom work done here, it makes sense.", 'But that’s not the only value snowdrops hold, as news reports suggest that a few rare varieties of the galanthus species are actually worth hundreds of pounds.
The most valuable is the galanthus woronowii, also known as the ‘Elizabeth Harrison’, or giant snowdrop.
Waitrose Garden: Galanthus woronowii, 10 x non-flowering bulbs BUY NOW, £4.49Waitrose GardenSo why is this seemingly common winter bloom worth so much?
It appears that galanthophiles, or snowdrop collectors, are prepared to pay high sums of money for non-native snowdrop varieties that grow in the UK.
The galanthus woronowii originates from north-eastern Turkey, eastern Georgia and southern Russia, according to the RHS.', 'In a statement posted on their Facebook page, owners of the Caia Fryer based on the Queens Court complex on the estate, said the decision to close has been made for personal reasons.
The statement says: "Due to personal circumstances and some unforeseen circumstances I have taken the decision to halt trading.
Above: The Caia Fryer up for sale on eBay"We are up for sale.
I'd like to take this opportunity to thank, staff, who were all amazing, my wife, who is always amazing and of course you lot.
“We enjoy good local support, a constant stream of people come here, the local football team come here and we really have been accepted into the local community.']

title: ['eBay Warns Canadian Sellers about US Sales Tax Policy - EcommerceBytes', 'From driveway to eBay: How cars stolen in Manchester are ending up in China - Manchester Evening News']
summary:
['eBay warned Canadian sellers it had begun collecting sales tax on purchases made to buyers based in certain US states.
eBay is following Marketplace Facilitator laws that require marketplaces to collect sales tax from buyers located in states that have passed such legislation.
eBay Canada announcement follows:How US Internet Sales Tax changes may impact your businessIn June 2018, a US Supreme Court decision removed the requirement for retailers to have a physical presence in a state in order for that state to impose sales tax on these retailers.
Some states have extended the tax collection obligation to marketplaces.
If you have any questions about these new tax requirements, we recommend that you consult with your tax advisor.', 'A minute later we are made aware of another pursuit taking place nearby and Sgt Kabal is back behind the wheel.
One is handcuffed to the stolen car and will need extensive plastic surgery after a police dog was used to help take him down.
The number of cars stolen in the region has gone up from 6,428 in 2014 to 10, 040 last year - or 27 cars a day.
“It is very organised, and we are at the start of this trail, dealing with the burglars", Sgt Kabal says.
“In one 72 hour period recently from 5pm on Friday over the weekend there were 88 vehicles stolen in Greater Manchester.']

title: ['Pa. man defrauds eBay of $320K buying cotton candy maker, ‘Star Trek’ sushi set and more using gift card glit - PennLive', 'Online Insurer Lemonade Hires Former PayPal and eBay Exec to ... - CTech']
summary:
['It appeared Chad Broudy had discovered a way to get anything he wanted on eBay for almost no cost.
According to Philly.com, the 24-year-old from Coatesville figured out how to over-redeem eBay’s gift cards without the cards ever getting charged.
Among the items bought, Broudy acquired items ranging from iPhones and gold bars to a cotton candy maker, a brass eagle statue and even a “Star Trek” sushi set, according to the report.
According to court records, Broudy used four different eBay accounts and 113 gift cards to make 1,100 transactions.
The company expects to be awarded full restitution from Broudy and has recovered $843 so far by charging his gift cards that had remaining balances, Philly.com reports.', 'Online insurance company Lemonade Inc. has appointed Erez Dickman to head its research and development operation in Israel, the company announced Monday.
Before joining Lemonade, Dickman was head of PayPal’s consumer product center in Tel Aviv and head of engineering at eBay’s Israeli innovation center.
In 2009, Dickman co-founded The Gifts Project, a service that allows users to chip in on gifts acquired from online retailers.
The Gifts Project was acquired by eBay in 2011.
Founded in 2015, Lemonade offers property and casualty insurance policies at a flat monthly rate that can be acquired instantly on its website.']

title: ['Join eBay - Highsnobiety', 'Midnight Rodeo Sign Up for Auction on eBay — The Amarillo Pioneer - The Amarillo Pioneer']
summary:
['eBay is heading to NBA All-Star weekend in Charlotte with a curated selection of rare grails, iconic memorabilia, and the hottest sneakers in town.
Discover rare pairs from collectors like Jordy Geller (of ShoeZeum fame), collector Chad Jones (otherwise known as Sneaker Galactus), and specialty sellers like LA-based Sole Stage.
The evening will celebrate all things sneaker culture at All-Star Weekend with sets from DJ Ria, Aurielle Sayeh, and a special performance by MADEINTYO.
If you’re in town for All-Star Weekend be sure to RSVP below and stop by the McColl Center and join the festivities.
Thursday, February 14 7PM - 12AM McColl Center for Art + Innovation 721 N Tryon St Charlotte, NC', 'The neon glow of the Midnight Rodeo can now be yours.
On eBay, the neon sign that once lit up the door for the Midnight Rodeo dance club and bar in Amarillo is for sale.
An eBay listing by atcguy37, says the sign works “beautifully” and could make a great addition to any man cave or memorabilia collection.
Now on the auction block, the sign was once the greeter for the longtime dance club.
The property that once housed the Midnight Rodeo is now being renovated into a new location for Amarillo’s Loft Church.']

By using our websites, you agree to the placement of these cookies.
To learn more, read our Privacy Policy.', '', "Tomato sauce fans are so desperate to get their hands on a rare jar of ketchup 'caviar' that prices have soared to more than £300.
Heinz released the limited edition product, which is made from tiny pearls of tomato sauce that look just like the fish egg delicacy, last month.

title: ['EBay restructuring means layoffs and executive shuffles - Silicon ... - The Business Journals', '1983 Jeep CJ-8 pickup truck | eBay find of the day - Autoblog']
summary:
['', "Unless you've been climbing rocks out on the Rubicon Trail for the past year or so, you're likely aware that Jeep is poised to produce its first new pickup truck since the 1992 Jeep Comanche.
A quick perusal of eBay turns up a treasure trove of Jeep pickups from the past, including the 1983 CJ-8 you see in the image gallery above.
)For a long time, we all thought Jeep was going to resurrect the Scrambler moniker for its new pickup truck.

title: ['Crime ring caught selling fake cars on eBay, Craigslist - WAFB', 'eBay Launches Exclusive, Limited Edition Drop in Celebration of All ... - PR Newswire', "PSA: ebay's All-Star Weekend Drop is a Sneaker Head's Dream - SWAGGER Magazine", 'Hackensack IT consultant accused of stealing 400 phones from ... - NorthJersey.com']
summary:
['RICHMOND, VA (WWBT) - The Department of Justice announced a huge bust involving an organized crime ring in Romania.
Those thieves made off with millions of dollars after ripping off thousands of American car buyers on online auction sites like eBay and Craigslist.
Cars are sold on eBay every 90 seconds or so.
Unfortunately, for the car buyers involved in this enormous scam, the vehicles they paid for never even existed.
The crime ring was working with people here in the US to collect the money, which was then laundered, turned into cryptocurrency and sent overseas.', "eBay's All-Star Line-upThe All-Star line-up features a collection of iconic styles and a comprehensive selection of hype and general releases.
eBay has tapped key collectors in the sneaker community and influential tastemakers to sell the most sought-after styles.
Tucker, sneakerhead Jacques Slade, artist Kickstradomis and stylist Aleali May are selling special pieces from their personal collections for charity.
From friends and family to one-of-one pairs, highlights include every Air Jordan to OG 1985 colorways to NBA PEs and apparel only ever seen on court.
Shoppers can take an advantage of an extra 20 percent off adidas, Puma, Reebok, asics and New Balance sneakers all weekend.", 'With that in mind, we thought a PSA (Public Service Announcement) was in order to share that ebay launched their “All -Star Weekend Drop” this morning at 7am EST.
Being the “OG” of sneaker resellers ebay announces it’s first ever “All-Star Weekend Drop” – a collection of rare of rare and trending kicks, iconic basketball memorabilia and sought-after street wear.
Throughout All-Star Weekend, ebay will host a total of 23 drops online to pay homage to NBA legend Michael Jordan’s iconic jersey number, offering online shoppers an even more robust selection to choose from.
Keep your eyes peeled on Swagger Magazine for more information on future big news from the worlds largest sneaker destination, ebay.
😉ebay All-Star Weekend Drop Editor’s Picks:We know how difficult it could be to loook for the top items to focus your attention, so we helped you out by showcasing some of our favourites.', "An IT consultant allegedly defrauded the Hackensack company he worked for out of 400 phones that he later sold on Ebay, authorities said.
Michael Acosta, 35, of North Bergen, ordered $200,000 worth of phones between October 2015 and September 2018 from the company's service provider that he later sold for his own gain, according to the Bergen County Prosecutor's Office.
Asocta worked at J. Fletcher Creamer and Son Inc. contractors since 2015 as a desktop support technician, according to his LinkedIn page.
One of his listed responsibilities is mobile device management.
Acosta was arrested Feb. 7 and charged with theft by deception and computer-related theft."]

title: ["Why are eBay and Amazon still selling these 'killer car seats ... - Which?"]
summary:
["Surrey Trading Standards first warned about these types of car seats in 2014, dubbing them 'killer car seats' and pushed for them to be removed from sale.
Just over a year later, we've spotted the same types of car seats available on eBay, Amazon and AliExpress.
The law on child car seatsThe law on child car seats states that only EU-approved seats can be used in the UK.
Buy your car seat from a retailer who can provide advice and help you fit the car seat correctly into your car.
For more tips on buying a child car seat that's safe and durable, read our guide on how to buy the right child car seat."]

title: ["Band puts orange beanie on eBay, it's now up to $80,000 and 129 ... - Alternative Press", 'eBay Readies Next Phase of Managed Payments Takeover - EcommerceBytes', 'How to shop products on Amazon, EBay, Walmart, Alibaba for direct ... - Techjaja', '‘Rare’ £1 coin sells for £5,000 on eBay – do you have one at home?... - The Sun']
summary:
['Heart Attack Man's Eric Egan found himself in need of some quick cash, so he posted his beloved orange beanie on eBay.
And yes, that's the infamous orange beanie in question.
The video has been viewed on Twitter almost 54,000 times despite the band having just over 4,300 followers.
Which brings us to the beanie...Vocalist/Guitarist Eric Egan posted his infamous orange beanie on the auction site with the following (hilarious) item description:"Hate to have to do this, but I’m strapped for cash so I am selling my orange beanie.
Heart Attack Man orange beanie loading...[Photo via eBay][/caption]There are also five more photos included of said beanie, just in case one photo wasn't enough for you.', 'The next phase of eBay’s Managed Payments rollout will impact larger merchants.
As we reported in November, eBay is turning off Integrated Merchant Credit Card Accounts (IMCC) in two phases beginning March 1, 2019 – meaning sellers will no longer be able to use their own merchant credit card accounts on eBay.
(eBay had begun prohibiting new sellers from using their merchant accounts beginning last November.)
This week, eBay has reportedly begun notifying sellers who use their own merchant credit card accounts of the impending deadlines.
Merchants who choose to process payments with PayPal must also update their listings to include PayPal as the payment acceptance option prior to May 1, 2019.', 'However, a majority of these shopping websites don’t ship directly to Uganda but instead through couriers who tend to be expensive in return.
Either way, local drop shippers can save you from the bulky cross-continent situation to have your order fulfilled in Uganda.
Nonetheless, these are some of the notable websites you can choose to sub shop from your Amazon, Alibaba or eBay products for delivery in Uganda.
Shopping your products for delivery in UgandaIn order to have your Amazon or eBay order fulfilled in Uganda, simply search for your desired product on any of thee websites and copy the link.
Either way, simply make use of the local based websites to search for your product and complete order to have it delivered to you.', 'The coin was sold with a "minting error" which made it more valuable to collectorsA £1 coin celebrating Northern Ireland has sold on eBay for a whopping £5,100.
That means that the direction of the inscription is completely random and this particular £1 isn't technically an error coin.
These are often deemed the most valuable by collectors.You should check how much the coin is selling for on eBay.
You can either choose to sell the coin on eBay or through a specialist like ChangeChecker.org.
Even if your coin “sells” on eBay for a high price there’s no guarantee that the buyer will cough up.']

title: ['Elderly man sends thank you letter to eBay seller for his VCR - WTVD-TV', 'eBay customer, 86, writes sweet letter to VHS seller - Metro.co.uk', 'Umbrella Academy Booms On eBay - Especially Free Comic Book Day - Bleeding Cool News', 'eBay Bikes - Trek, Ridley, Focus & Ritte | Cycling deals from ... - Road.cc']
summary:
['One of those items he sold was a VCR (or VHS player).
It begins:"Hi M Shoukry,I found many old VHS tapes recently and wanted to see what is on them and realized I had no player.
Shoukry says once he began reading the letter, he couldn't put it down and had to tell his girlfriend.
All thanks to your generous selling of the VHS player.
"I will be offering to allow him to ship his VHS tapes to me so I can digitize them.', 'Like many of us though, they didn’t own a VHS player to play back the memories.
The 86-year-old decided to write a letter to the VHS seller to thank them for selling the device so promptly and enabling such fond memories.
This person sold their VHS player on eBay and got a surprise letter in the mail: pic.twitter.com/oaLV8dUFqR — Yoni (@OriginalYoni) February 17, 2019‘Thank you so much for your care, your efforts, and your promptness,’ they wrote.
‘All thanks to your generous selling of the VHS player.
I thought you would appreciate how much someone enjoyed your offer.’The touching letter was shared on Twitter where it amassed almost 300,000 likes.', '', "If you're in the market for a new bike then eBay is a goldmine!
The Bontrager Aeolus 5 carbon clinchers, Ultegra Di2 groupset and Bontrager XXX 1 piece bar/stem makes this a real bargain.
This ex-team bike comes with a Rotor chainset and Ultegra Di2.

Again, we've got an Ultegra Di2 groupset, this time matched with Vision wheels."]

title: ['How to sell items and make money on eBay - Business Insider', 'Elderly man sends heartfelt letter to eBay seller after buying VHS player, watching old home videos - CBS News', "Don't give in to eBay feedback extortion tactics - Sydney Morning Herald", "Old 'Dillo trolly sells for almost $30K on eBay - Austin Business Journal - The Business Journals"]
summary:
['AdvertisementeBay is one of the largest e-commerce platforms in the world and you can use it to sell items and turn a profit.
Using keywords in your listing's title and offering free shipping on your items can help you to make more money on eBay.
Using eBay, one of the world's largest e-commerce platforms, you can sell just about anything, with a few notable exceptions.
Business Insider spoke to experts and online sellers about some of the best tricks for selling items on eBay.
Advertisement"Shoppers tend to turn to eBay for items that reflect what's happening in the world.', 'A man who sold his VHS player online received a heartfelt letter from a grateful 86-year-old customer.
Matt Shoukry, who posted a photo of the message on Reddit, was touched by the buyer who mailed him a thank-you note.
In the letter dated Feb. 10, the unnamed author recounted how he couldn't play video tapes on his old VHS player anymore and turned to eBay to purchase another one.
"It was so unexpected but so sweet, so I decided to share it with the world on Reddit," Shoukry said.
"There is so much negative in the world today, it's refreshing to have something wholesome and positive to share with everyone."', 'Ebay has strict rules against feedback extortion.
But the seller's next reply changed my mind: After the refund, could you please kindly leave us Positive Feedback, and "Detailed Seller ratings"over 3 stars per each criteria?
Instead, I contacted eBay and asked about the seller's customer service obligations and whether this kind of behaviour was acceptable.
It's not acceptable, eBay has clear "feedback extortion" rules when it comes to buyers or sellers threatening to withhold money unless they get a positive review.
I also left a scathing review, although unfortunately it only reduced their positive customer feedback by .1 per cent.', '']

title: ['1987 BMW M6 Project Car for Sale on eBay Motors - Road & Track', 'Band decides not to sell beanie for $100K, removes eBay listing - Alternative Press', 'eBay Fired Up All-Star Weekend With Insanely Rare Sneaker Drops ... - Highsnobiety']
summary:
["If you're curious about taking up a project car, but don't want to see it sitting around for months (or even years), this vintage BMW M6 might be the perfect solution.
According to the selling dealer's description, this M6 has spent its entire life in California as a daily driver.
Thankfully, the car retains its OEM basketweave-style wheels, but they're far from perfect.
Throw on some modern tires, and you've got yourself a good, solid vintage driver that you can improve at your own pace.
The car is currently for sale on eBay in Miami, Florida with a Buy It Now Price of $16,900 or best offer.", "Earlier this week, Heart Attack Man frontman Eric Egan found himself in need of some quick cash, so he posted his beloved orange beanie on eBay.
Triple Crown Records’ Heart Attack Man have had a unique approach to marketing.
And yes, that's the infamous orange beanie in question.
“I just wanted to update you all on my world famous beanie,” Egan says in the video.
In 2017, Heart Attack Man dropped their full-length The Manson Family.", "This content has been paid for by an advertiser.
If you'd like to appear on Highsnobiety, contact: advertising@highsnobiety.com.
The sneaker frenzy that comes hand-in-hand with All-Star Weekend madness is immediately clear as soon as one landed in Charlotte, N.C. this past weekend, home to ASW 2019; you’d know who was there for the festivities just by scoping the heat on people’s feet.
Not only were fans treated to exclusive access to the hottest releases and game-worn grails on-site, an all-star panel experience was hosted by Highsnobiety’s own Jeff Carvalho to discuss just how important eBay still is as the original online marketplace for sneakerheads.
Tucker, OG collectors Chad Jones and Jordy Geller of “ShoeZeum” fame, as well as stylist Aleali May, sneaker personality Jacques Slade, and customizer Kickstradomis."]

title: ['Jordyn Woods’ makeup prices slashed on Kylie Cosmetics, while eBay demand rises - Fox News', "Vintage Disney VHS tapes listed for thousands on eBay, probably won't fetch that much - WSB Atlanta", '"Near mythical" Michael Jordan basketball card tops $350000 on eBay - JustCollecting News', 'P.J. Tucker, eBay auctioning exclusive sneakers, gifts for charity - The Dream Shake', 'eBay Seller is Moved to Tears Over Heartfelt Thank-You Note From ... - Good News Network', 'Hund gepfändet und bei Ebay verkauft - Die Glocke']
summary:
["Since news of Thompson’s reported infidelity broke, the Calabasas crew has been up in arms – apparently prompting Jenner to slash the prices of the “Kylie X Jordyn” collection sold through her eponymous makeup brand by as much as 50 percent.
Meanwhile, on eBay, prices are shooting up to $400 for the very same products.
In contrast, in the wake of the scandal, prices for goods from the 21-year-olds' joint line are spiking on eBay, as per Page Six.
Bundles available for sale through Kylie Cosmetics for $124 are going for as much as $400 on the commerce platform.
It seems Kylie isn’t sure what to do, but it seems impossible for her to keep Jordyn around.”CLICK HERE TO GET THE FOX NEWS APP", "There are articles being shared on social media claiming that your old Disney VHS tapes, they could be worth big money on the e-commerce site eBay.
But sadly, that's not really the case, most of the time, according the debunking website Snopes.
Some Disney tapes from the Black Diamond Collection, released between 1984 and 1994 with a black diamond on the spine of the case, are going for between $50 and $250 for lots of multiple tapes on the retail bidding website.
The website thegamer.com claimed last year, however, “101 Dalmatians,” released in 1992 was listed at $6,000.
But a VHS tape of “Alice in Wonderland” was listed for $9,999.99 or best offer and a copy of “The Little Mermaid” in the original case is listed for $3,200.", 'This rare Michael Jordan card sold for $305,100 on February 20, becoming the most expensive basketball card ever sold on eBay (Image: PWCC Marketplace)A “near mythical” Michael Jordan card has sold on eBay for over $350,000, making it one of the most valuable basketball cards of all time.
The Precious Metal Gems Green (PMG) Michael Jordan card was released by Skybox in 1997-98, and is one of only 10 examples ever produced.
As the most iconic player in basketball history, Michael Jordan’s card from the series was always going to attract the most attention.
The example offered was #6 of the 10 emerald green Jordan cards produced, and had been authenticated and graded by the Professional Sports Authenticator (PSA) service.
Most people have never even seen an image of one.”Despite the amazing price, the card still falls a fair way short of the all-time record price paid for a vintage basketball card.', 'The Houston Rockets forward and NBA Sneaker King teamed up eBay and other influential sneakerheads for the website’s ultimate All-Star Weekend Drop.
Starting Feb. 16, the OG of the online sneaker-selling community began auctioning some of the most classic and exclusive grails known to man with prices under market value.
Prominent listings include the OG 1985 Jordan 1 lineup and game-worn Jordan 13s signed by Michael Jordan himself.
On top of that, there is a medley of items from the Supreme x Louis Vuittion collaboration, a game-worn Kobe Bryant jersey, and much more.
And if you’re not a hardcore sneaker enthusiast, there are some other fun items for Tucker and Rockets fans alike.', 'This heartwarming letter from an 86-year-old man is being shared across social media after it was posted to Twitter by an eBay seller earlier this week.
Shoukry sold a VHS player to a man in Phoenix, Arizona for $40.
Though most buyers usually leave him an online review, he was surprised when he received a letter from the man who bought the VHS player.
The heartfelt letter has sparked a newfound friendship between Shoukry and Don, and the young eBay seller hopes to offer his elderly pen pal much more than a VHS player in return for the letter.
MORE: Inmates Write Heartfelt Letter to Police Department Offering Condolences for Slain Officer“I’m going to frame (the letter) and put it next to my desk in the house because it means a lot to me,” he added.', 'Hund gepfändet und bei Ebay verkauftAhlen (rad) - Ein Mitarbeiter der Stadt Ahlen hat über ein privates Nutzerkonto einen zuvor von ihm im Auftrag der Stadt gepfändeten Hund auf Ebay-Kleinanzeigen verkauft.
Er soll die Käuferin von Mops Edda über deren Gesundheitszustand arglistig getäuscht haben, wirft die Frau der Stadt vor.
Als „Süße Mopsdame mit Stammbaum“, geimpft, gechipt und kerngesund, wurde die bei einer Ahlener Familie gepfändete Hündin per Ebay-Kleinanzeige verkauft.
Die Käuferin sieht sich wegen falscher Angaben zum Gesundheitszustand des Tieres von der Stadt arglistig getäuscht und zieht vor Gericht.
Am Tag drauf habe sie den Hund bei einer Pflegestelle in Hamm, nach ihrer Kenntnis eine Kollegin des Stadtmitarbeiters, abgeholt.']

title: ['Rare RAF Jaguar T2 Cockpit Section on Sale on eBay. And for 9,999.99 GBP (Plus Shipping) it can be yours. - The Aviation Geek Club', 'Letter From Old Man Personally Thanks eBay Seller for VCR - My Modern Met', 'The secret eBay code to get 20% off Boohoo, SimplyBe and more - Manchester Evening News']
summary:
['According to the seller the Cockpit Section is from “Jaguar T2 XX140 and is being sold as a restoration project.
The cockpit went to BAe Brough for trials work and the fuselage ended up with an aircraft dealer.
The rear fuselage from XX140 was donated to the Boscombe Down Aviation Collection as a parts source to help restore Jaguar XX761.
“We are now offering up the cockpit as a project cockpit as can be seen from the photos it needs some work.
UK shipping would be on a lorry.', '“I don’t even remember where I got the VCR,” Shoukry told Good Morning America.
“I think I sold it for about 30 or 40 bucks.”After receiving the payment, Shoukry shipped the VCR to the buyer.
In a hand-addressed envelope, Shoukry found a letter from the shopper, who turned out to be an 86-year-old man.
While the heartfelt thank you note is inspiring in and of itself, it is the way that the elderly man used the VCR that really touched Shoukry.
“I didn’t think much about it when I sold the VCR and I’m sure that man didn’t think much about it when he sent that letter, but it impacted each of us in such a big way.”Read the heartfelt letter below!', 'Something went wrong, please try again later.
Invalid email Something went wrong, please try again later.
eBay is never one to miss a marketing opportunity and the online shopping giant is giving away coupons to get 20% off fashion retailers including Boohoo, SimplyBe and Superdry to celebrate the second pay day of the year.
The retailer has launched a February pay day discount code that can be used to cut the price of items at 47 eBay stores by 20%.
The code works on any spend over £25 and can save up to £75 depending on how much is spent.']
