summary:
['Not featured a Fiat for a while, but I couldn’t this stunning 1963 Fiat 500D Trasformabile car on eBay.
It dates from 1963 and it is a left-hand drive, ‘sympathetically restored’ and quite obviously a top-end job.
He has been using it with his family to zip about the island, but the car is now looking for a new owner.
If you want a Fiat, I suspect you might struggle to find a better example than this.
If you want to be the next owner of this 1963 Fiat 500D Trasformabile you are looking at £16,750.', '', 'Though Michael Jordan played his last basketball game on April 16, 2003 to many he remains the gold standard when it comes to basketball.
AdvertisementThis 1997 Metal Universe Michael Jordan card is one of only 10 ever produced.
It is not only the most expensive card sold on eBay, it is now the most expensive Jordan card ever sold.
This 1997 Michael Jordan basketball card was sold by @PWCCmarketplace on eBay last night for $350,100.
The card, which was limited to 10 and was graded by PSA as "altered," became the highest priced basketball card ever sold on eBay.', 'With the Captain Marvel film less than two weeks away, Marvel is continuing its ramped-up promotion for the character.
This month the publisher is releasing Captain Marvel: Braver & Mightier, a special one-shot tale starring Earth’s mightiest hero (which you can preview here).To commemorate the occasion, Marvel has teamed with My Comic Shop and eBay to produce an exclusive variant cover to the one-shot.
The cover art by Ryan Brown features a helmeted Captain Marvel in battle against a group of Skrulls.
In addition to the exclusive variant, a collection of over 1,250 key and vintage Marvel Comics will be listed on eBay by My Comic Shop.
Check out the front and back covers to the Ryan Brown Captain Marvel: Braver & Mightier variant below.', "Getting tired of driving your Mazda Miata?
It's an 1966 S2-generation Lotus Elan in great condition.
Mazda based the Miata's ethos on the original Elan, and for good reason.
The wooden dash looks to be in good condition, complemented by a modern radio head unit.
The car is up for grabs in Stratford, Connecticut on eBay with a current high bid of $6500 and six days remaining.", 'Deliveries are estimated between February 28 and March 7 at the time of this writing, with the ETA likely to be extended if you decide to actually order the factory unlocked dual SIM Samsung Galaxy S10 on eBay.
At $799.99, the "international" units sold by Never MSRP are a whole Benjamin cheaper than devices officially available from Samsung and authorized retailers like Best Buy.
The super-early discount certainly comes as a surprise, but just like with the Galaxy S10+ "on sale" yesterday , you need to take a bunch of restrictions and "catches" into consideration.
Finally, while Samsung and Best Buy aren't offering savings yet on the Galaxy S10 list price, they do throw in free Galaxy Buds with pre-orders, which eBay sellers can't hook you up with.
Still, at the end of the day, if you're not interested in gifts, warranties, and CDMA connectivity, an $800 Galaxy S10 is by no means a bad deal.', '']

title: ['Tom Brady rookie card sells for record $400,100 on eBay - JustCollecting News', 'Cellebrite iPhone hacking tools selling on eBay for as little as $100 - AppleInsider', 'The Feds’ Favorite iPhone Hacking Tool Is Selling On eBay For $100—And It’s Leaking Data - Forbes', 'EBay Nears Agreement With Activists Elliott Management and ... - TheStreet', 'eBay scam circulating around Winchester - ABC 36 News - WTVQ', 'Autographed Sugar Rush Steering Wheel Replica On eBay Auction ... - WDW News Today']
summary:
['A Tom Brady rookie card, which sold on eBay for a record $400,100 this week (Image: PWCC Marketplace)A rare Tom Brady rookie card has sold for a record-breaking $400,100 on eBay, making it the world’s most valuable modern-day sports card in existence.
The card in question was a Playoff Contenders 2000 Championship Rookie Ticket Autograph card, one of just 100 examples produced bearing Brady’s signature.
“This auction featured the finest football card we’ve brokered in our 20-year history and achieved the highest-ever hammer price for a football card,” said PWCC Marketplace CEO Brett Huigens in a statement.
Eighteen seasons later Brady led the Patriots to victory over the Los Angeles Rams in Super Bowl LIII, making him the first player in NFL history to win six Super Bowls.
The victory also made Brady the oldest winning quarterback in Super Bowl history – and with no immediate plans to retire, you wouldn’t bet against him perhaps adding another ring to his collection.', "Read our ethics policyImage Credit: AFP/Getty ImagesMeant to be used only by law enforcement, Cellebrite hacking tools for iPhones and other smartphones are reportedly selling on eBay for sums as low as $100.
The forensic data firm is sending letters to clients warning them against reselling its hacking tools, given the potential for illegally breaking into private data.
The devices could even contain chats and contact lists, Hickey said, though he chose not to explore that material.
Still more worrisome is the possibility that Cellebrite's tools could map out vulnerabilities it hasn't shared with Apple and other vendors.
Cellebrite is famously believed to be the third party the FBI turned to crack the iPhone 5c of San Bernardino killer Syed Rizwan Farook.", '', '', 'WINCHESTER, Ky. (WTVQ) – Winchester Police Department is warning residents of a scam currently circulating.
A letter is sent to your home portraying itself as an offer from Ebay to pay you to be a Survey Evaluator.
According to the Winchester Police Department, the letter is sent with an instruction sheet and a fake cashier’s check, but the letter is not from EBAY.
Ebay is aware of the scam and they are working to stop it.', 'If you’re a really, really big fan of Ralph Breaks The Internet or are just looking for an interesting way to donate money to the Make-A-Wish Foundation, look no further than this replica of the Sugar Rush steering wheel that’s on auction now on eBay.
This IRL replica of the steering wheel was donated by Walt Disney Animation Studios, so 100% of the proceeds from the auction will be donated to Make-A-Wish to help grant life-changing wishes to children with critical illnesses.
https://www.instagram.com/p/BuWuchTHrOI/?utm_source=ig_web_copy_linkAs described, the replica is signed by Sarah Silverman, Gal Godot, and Jane Lynch.
As part of the donation package, you get a Blu-ray copy of the movie and a limited edition autographed poster by cast and filmmakers including John C. Reilly, Sarah Silverman, Taraji P. Henson, Jack McBrayer, Phil Johnston, Rich Moore and Clark Spencer.
Bidding ends in 7 days, so if you’re looking to add this unique item to your collection, you should probably start now.']

title: ['Phone-hacking device used by police sells on eBay for $100 - Engadget', "A Family's Pug Was Seized And Sold On eBay Because Of Unpaid Taxes - BuzzFeed News", 'Shoppers selling their Coles Stikeez collections on eBay $200 - Daily Mail']
summary:
["Phone-hacking device used by police sells on eBay for $100 The FBI is among the agencies which reportedly use the Cellebrite tool.
A phone-hacking device that law enforcement officials use to extract data from phones is popping up on eBay for as little as $100.
While he did not delve further, he suspected he'd be able to obtain personal data including photos, contacts and messages.
It seems officials are selling older UFEDs that can't access phones running newer versions of iOS or Android.
UFEDs use vulnerabilities unknown to the likes of Apple or Google to access the phones.", 'A German city seized a woman’s pug because she owed the local government money, then sold the pet via eBay’s classified section.
The story made national news in Germany, prompting outrage among pet owners and animal activists.
The seizure took place in November, and a city employee listed 1-year-old Edda, a black pug, for sale online, the Glocke newspaper reported.
“Sweet female pug with pedigree for sale!
Not spayed!” the listing read, according to Bild.', 'Shoppers are turning to eBay as a quick way to make some extra cash by selling their collection of Coles Stikeez.
The Australian supermarket giant launched the range of collectables on February 13, in association with the Coles Fresh Rainbow Challenge.
The promotion allows shoppers to collect one miniature from the set of 24 miniature fruits and vegetables for every $30 spent.
This collection of nine Stikeez (pictured) is currently listed on eBay for $200The listing explains three of the Stikeez are the rare sort, while the other six are the normal variety.
However, this was strenuously denied by Coles who stated the Stikeez could not be sold on eBay by employees.']

title: ['1991 Lotus Elan | eBay Find of the Day - Autoblog', 'Wisbech secretary defrauded firm and sold items on eBay - BBC', '1960s Dieter Rams-designed Braun RT2 radio on eBay - Retro To Go', 'eBay Announces Strategic Initiatives to Enhance Performance - PR Newswire', 'EBay announces plans for new strategic initiatives under pressure from investors - TechCrunch']
summary:
['You must have JavaScript enabled to experience the new Autoblog.
Please follow the instructions below to enable JavaScript in your browser.', 'Officers were told it started off as a mistake after she accidentally purchased the wrong printer toner and was told to sell it through eBay and give the money back to her company.', 'A hugely influential design and a great example of the 1960s Dieter Rams-designed Braun RT2 radio on eBay.
I think this is the best example of an RT2 I have ever seen.
Judging by the photos (which is all I can go off), this RT2 is pretty much immaculate.
Of course, i is full functionality and with the original switch panel looking like new.
Sold out of Germany (but willing to ship around Europe), the budding for this RT20 radio is up to £411.78 with no reserve.', "SAN JOSE, Calif., March 1, 2019 /PRNewswire/ -- eBay Inc. (NASDAQ: EBAY) today announced several new initiatives with the goal of positioning eBay for ongoing success and value creation.
These initiatives include an operating review and the commencement of a strategic review of the Company's portfolio of assets, including StubHub and eBay Classifieds Group.
Commences Strategic Review of Portfolio Alongside AdvisorseBay, with the assistance of external financial advisors, has initiated a strategic review of its asset portfolio, including but not limited to StubHub and eBay Classifieds Group.
About eBay: eBay Inc. (NASDAQ: EBAY) is a global commerce leader including the Marketplace, StubHub and Classifieds platforms.
Forward-Looking StatementsThis communication contains forward-looking statements relating to, among other things, the future performance of eBay Inc. and its consolidated subsidiaries and the strategic initiatives referred to in this release.", 'In January, eBay received a strongly worded letter from activist investors Elliott Management, outlining a way forward for the company that Elliott saw as floundering.
Two weeks ago, the company announced it was restructuring operations and laying off some of its workers.
Today, the company announced further steps toward reorganizing, much of which sounds straight out of Elliott’s letter earlier this year.
“Today eBay suffers from an inefficient organizational structure, wasteful spend and a misallocation of resources,” Elliott wrote at the time.
These moves come as eBay tries to find a way to increase shareholder value to please activist investors like Elliott Management and Starboard Value.']

title: ['Has There Been a Lawsuit against eBay Unpaid Item Policy? - EcommerceBytes', "A Rare Magic: The Gathering Black Lotus Just Broke Ebay's MTG ... - Bleeding Cool News", "Debt Collectors Seize Family's Pug, Sell It on eBay: Reports - PEOPLE"]
summary:
["Seller waits 48 hours before being allowed to open an unpaid item case, and for what?
eBay is betting that you will not open an unpaid item case, forget to close the unpaid item case so they can charge the fee, and you pay if you don't call to get it refunded.
eBay is banking on the fact that many sellers will not open an unpaid item case, many will forget to close the case, and many will forget to ask for the fee.
There should be no unpaid item policy, and the seller should be able to relist the item if it's not paid within 2 days - which, if it's not paid in 2 days, 90% will never pay.
I speak to the eBay reps and they can't explain how is the unpaid item policy a benefit to me, when 90% of the buyers that don't pay within 48 hours will not pay.", '', 'A city in Germany is facing a possible lawsuit after debt collectors seized a family’s pug and sold it on eBay.
After city authorities were unable to find anything else of value to take in the house to fulfill the debt, they seized the family’s pug, named Edda.
The pug, which has a high monetary value as a thoroughbred dog, was sold online in December for 750 euros — about $853 — Deutsche Welle reported.
A police officer named Michaela Jordan then bought Edda, according to the BBC, via local German newspaper Ahlener Tageblatt.
Jordan spoke to Ahlener Tageblatt, where she said that she was told Edda was healthy when she purchased the dog on eBay.']

['1969 Pontiac GTO Rust-Free Project for Sale on eBay Motors - Road & Track', 'Top 10 bikes sold on Ebay so far this year - Visordown', 'Oxford mushroom farm for sale on Ebay for £50000 - Oxford Mail', 'Chilling Momo masks being sold on eBay for £40 as social media craze terrifies kids... - The Sun', "'Pug of war' over eBay sale of impounded dog in Germany - The Peninsula"]
summary:
["It's a 1969 Pontiac GTO with a stick and air conditioning that's in need of some attention.
It runs and drives, and best of all, there's no real rust to speak of.
This GTO seems to have made it out better than most old, neglected 1960s muscle cars.
Honestly, you'd be better off taking the time to do a proper restoration job than replacing one thing at a time.
For a running, driving 1969 GTO with no rust, we'd say that's a deal.", 'For most, placing a bid on Ebay is about as close as we come to that experience, and it’s revealing to see just how much people are prepared to pay for bikes on the site.
We’ve had a look at results from the UK version of the site since the start of 2019.
Here are the top 10 most expensive machines to have sold between January and the start of March 2019.
A bit of fettling could make this a £20k bike.
8: Yamaha RZV500R: £15,100 View the bike hereRemember when £5k seemed steep for these?', 'Lee Timermanis and Rajo Taylor-Smith are asking for £50,000 for their futuristic fungi farm just outside of Kidlington.
The couple set up The Oxford Mushroom Company less than two years ago in 2017, growing exotic varieties such as Shiitake and Oyster.
Read also: Oxford City Farm calls for communities help to raise £10,000Also included in the mushroom business bundle is equipment such as a commercial fridge, freezer, dehydrator packing materials and more.
The couple say the sale of The Oxford Mushroom Co ‘presents an amazing and rare opportunity for Oxford’ as there are plans for the site to become a local food hub with space for events, cafés and shops.
Unlike their crops, which sprout up in a matter of days, The Oxford Mushroom Co. spent a long time in the making.', 'Parents across the UK have reported being left shocked when they mentioned Momo to their children - with some bursting into tears and others screamingCHILLING Momo masks are being sold on eBay for just £40 after the social media craze left kids across the UK terrified.
Police and schools issued warnings across the UK after reports of the Momo character being seen.
Is the Momo Challenge a hoax?
THE Momo Challenge is believed to have originated in South America.
And YouTube claimed: "We have found no evidence of videos showing or promoting the Momo challenge on YouTube."', 'Picture taken on February 27, 2019 in Ahlen, western Germany, shows pug "Edda".
The buyer, Michaela Jordan, told national news agency DPA she had filed a case against Ahlen city authorities for "fraud".
"It was all lies," she said, adding that her lawyer had filed the lawsuit against city authorities on Thursday last week.
She also noted that impounded items should be publicly auctioned and not simply sold on eBay through a private account.
Amid the howls of outrage, Ahlen city authorities said on their website that they were ready to reverse the sale "if the parties involved are in agreement".']

title: ['Coles now selling food on eBay - Inside Retail Australia', 'Why Alibaba is not competing with Amazon and Ebay for the US consumer - CNBC', 'eBay Canada Adds Warranties by SquareTrade - EcommerceBytes', 'Lucky Charms flavored beer sells out, now listed for up to $450 on eBay - WREG NewsChannel 3']
summary:
['Coles on Wednesday started selling a range of ‘everyday essentials’ on eBay, in a bid to reach some of the marketplace’s 11 million unique monthly visitors.
The offering includes perishable and non-perishable items in Coles’ everyday essentials range across several categories, including select pre-packaged fresh food, pantry, personal care and household items.
For eBay, the partnership seems to be about growing its eBay Plus membership program, which it launched in May 2018 in what many saw as a response to Amazon Prime.
Nestor confirmed to IR that launching Coles’ food offering on eBay has been in the works for some time.
Nestor declined to say how many members are currently signed up to the eBay Plus program, but she described the uptake so far as “really positive” and said the company expects it to continue to grow with the launch of Coles on eBay.', "Alibaba is China's largest e-commerce platform.
In its latest earnings report, the company disclosed having 636 million annual active consumers on its China retail marketplaces.
Its realm now covers cloud computing (Alibaba Cloud), digital media and entertainment, (Youku, Alibaba Pictures, Damai, Alibaba Music, Alisports.com) and logistics services (Cainiao).
Alibaba is also part owner of financial services company Ant Financial.
Watch the above video to find out why Alibaba hasn't won over U.S. consumers and how it has focused on attracting U.S. businesses.", 'eBay Canada announced on Tuesday it has now offers warranties through SquareTrade.
Announcement follows:eBay Canada is happy to announce the launch of SquareTrade warranties on eBay.ca.
SquareTrade (an Allstate company) offers warranties for both standard and accident protection on a wide selection of items.
SquareTrade warranties have been available for some time on eBay.com and we are excited to make this offering available to our Canadian buyers.
eBay CanadaSOURCE: eBay Canada Announcement', 'NORFOLK, Va. – A Virginia brewery made national headlines for its popular “Saturday Morning” beer, and now some people are re-selling the IPA online for hundreds of dollars.
Smartmouth Brewery unveiled the cereal-themed beer this past Saturday.
One post listed it as being sold for $450 for four cans, and another person was selling an empty beer can for $5.
The charm of the beer definitely struck a nerve with those in the craft brewery community.
Hardy said several of their distributors are getting the Saturday Morning beer, but he said there is not a lot of it.']

title: ['Cleveland Indians fan selling Slider’s yellow tail fur on eBay, and we don’t know why - Cleveland 19 News', 'Comic Creators Gail Simone, Cat Staggs Team With Ebay for ‘Superheroine HQ’ - Hollywood Reporter', 'This $35k 2015 Corvette 2LT Is The Cheapest C7 On eBay Right now - GM Authority', '‘I bid on a Coles Stikeez on eBay and I don’t even know who I am anymore’ - Kidspot']
summary:
['GOODYEAR, AZ (WOIO) - The fur is fake, but the news is real: a bundle of Slider’s legendary wool is for sale.
The beloved Cleveland Indians mascot has pleased crowds for years with t-shirt gun antics, a silent demeanor and loud costume colors.
This is where eBay and a fan come into play.
Apparently, the iconic mascot was about to embark on a few shenanigans during a spring training game last month, when its tail fur got snagged and ripped off.
A fan scurried over and scooped up the yellow strands, and now the yarn could be yours.', 'What better way to mark the one-two punch of International Women’s Day this Friday and the upcoming release of Captain Marvel than by buying some comic books featuring women superheroes?
eBay knows what you want, and it’s here to deliver with Wednesday’s launch of its all-new Superheroine HQ.
The new portal is the result of a partnership between eBay and comic book creators Gail Simone and Cat Staggs, and it is intended to be a destination for online customers of female superhero comics, collectibles and related merchandise.
To help with this, eBay will be offering a limited edition Captain Marvel comic book — Captain Marvel: Braver & Mightier No.
“With the rising popularity of superheroes like Wonder Woman and Captain Marvel from comic books to the big screen, we’ve seen this same interest resonate on eBay,” added Sam Bright, vp merchandising, eBay North America.', '', '']

title: ['How to buy a car on eBay safely - Business Insider', 'Cheapest Chevrolet Volt For Sale On eBay Right Now Is Under $8,000 - GM Authority', 'Brand-new Galaxy S9+ scores massive $315 discount in new eBay ... - PhoneArena', 'Somebody’s selling a hunk of Slider’s fur on ebay and we have questions - cleveland.com', 'Star Wars Storm Trooper kids outfit sold on eBay withdrawn over fears it may go up in flames... - The Sun', 'B&M selling Love Hearts and Drumstick Easter eggs found on eBay for TRIPLE the price - The Mirror']
summary:
["Read on to learn about the benefits of shopping on eBay Motors and how to safely navigate the market.
eBayWhy eBay Motors is a safe destination for buying a vehicle:Buying a car of any kind, regardless of where it's listed, comes with some level of risk.
Regardless of what I'm buying on eBay, I always look at a seller's feedback and take these things into consideration.
eBaySecure payment methods and eBay Motors' Vehicle Purchase Protection:Every car purchase on eBay Motors comes with Vehicle Purchase Protection, which covers certain losses associated with fraud.
To successfully pay for your vehicle on eBay Motors, you'll have to use PayPal and eBay's financing center.", '', "That's more than 300 bucks less than the list price of the Samsung Galaxy S9+ , although the downside is (as always) the lack of a valid US warranty.
For what it's worth, you're looking at both free standard nationwide shipping and free 30-day returns from a veteran eBay member with a squeaky-clean track record.
We're talking 99.4 percent positive feedback from the last 12 months, with over 15,000 favorable ratings offered by satisfied (and verified) buyers.
The 3,500 mAh battery, dual 12MP rear-facing cameras, classic rear-mounted fingerprint sensor, 6GB RAM, and IP68 water-resistant construction make the Galaxy S9+ a heavyweight contender even by 2019 standards, which means the bang for buck here is pretty darn impressive.
We are mere hours away from the actual commercial release of Samsung's next big... family of flagship phones , and even though the Galaxy S10 and S10+ bring a number of major upgrades to the table compared to their predecessors, the world's largest mobile device vendor continues to charge an arguably exorbitant $739.99 for an unlocked Galaxy S9+.", 'CLEVELAND, Ohio -- You can find all kinds of weird stuff on ebay from a heart-shaped potato chip (which 17 ebay sellers claim is “very rare”) to pictures of feet (ewww).
A listing for a handful of Cleveland Indians mascot Slider’s tail fur popped up on the auction site over the weekend.
Bid on Slider’s fur on ebay hereAccording to the product description, the glob of yellow fur was acquired during a spring training game in Goodyear on February 24 after Slider’s costume got caught on something as he was climbing on top of the dugout, as our favorite fuschia friend is known to do.
While we cannot verify the authenticity of the fur, the seller, rufusruffcutt, does have a sparkling five-star rating on more than 5,600 transactions on ebay.
Why someone would put it up for auction or why anyone would pay $20 for it are just two of the questions we have.', '1 A Star Wars fancy dress has been withdrawn from sale Credit: Official Star Wars Costumes.comIn its alert, the European Commission has warned that tots "could suffer burns" if the "easily flammable" costume catches fire while being worn.
It says the dress-up outfit, which was made in China, fails to meet the EU's "Toy Safety Directive".
Star Wars is owned by Disney but it's thought this particular outfit was made by a third party manufacturer.
Amazon recently pulled its Crazy Geezers Putty World toy from sale over fears it is dangerous for kids.
Disney’s latest behind the scenes teaser reveals its new Star Wars park is almost finishedWe pay for your stories!', "The budget retailer is selling the retro themed Easter eggs in stores nationwide nowBudget retailer B&M is selling two retro themed Love Hearts and Drumstick Easter eggs this year - and they look amazing.
Despite Easter Sunday falling on 21 April - much later than last year - shoppers are already clamouring to buy Easter eggs, with most retailers already stocking a wide selection.
One user posted the Love Hearts Eggs on sale at £9.95 each, while another has also put the Drumstick Swizzels Squashies Eggs up for sale for the same marked up price.
The new tasty sounding egg is part of Nestle's brand new 'Incredible Easter Egg' range that feature a twist on all their popular eggs.
Each comes with shards of chocolate fans favourite sweets inside the milk chocolate egg for that extra sugar rush."]

title: ['Trend Forecasting: Vintage Polly Pocket Lockets from eBay - Garage', 'Paul Gascoigne has opened an eBay store where he sells signed photos, shirts and memorabilia - Chronicle Live', 'Someone’s Listed A ‘Vintage’ Blockbuster Membership Card For $810 On Ebay - LADbible', 'Rare silver 2p coin sells for £485 on eBay... - The Sun']
summary:
["I'm talking about the spiritual inheritor to Barbie's throne, the portable phenom better known as Polly Pocket.
To be hyper-specific, I'm not referring to today's Polly Pocket, a hale and hearty lass with a full wardrobe of rubber tops and miniskirts who stands about 2 to 3 inches tall.
The Polly Pocket locket has all the hallmarks of a good trend; hard to find (there are only a few of them on eBay), expensive, but not too expensive (they're mostly selling for around $35), and covered with a patina of 1990s-era nostalgia.
Can't you just see a pastel-hued Polly Pocket locket peaking out from the synthetic fuzz of a Marine Serre sweater?
Most important of all for an It Accessory, the Polly Pocket locket carries with it a crucial dose of whimsy that could elevate even the most basic outfit.", "Something went wrong, please try again later.
Invalid email Something went wrong, please try again later.
Gazza's eBay page lists signed photos, football boots and shirts for sale.
The 'sold listings' section shows Gazza has flogged a half-and-half Newcastle United and Wimbledon shirt, signed by the Geordie and ex-Dons star Vinnie Jones.
Video Loading Video Unavailable Click to play Tap to play The video will auto-play soon 8 Cancel Play nowGascoigne sells the signed Dons/Mags shirt for £160.", "Specifically, a Blockbuster membership card that they're selling for a cool $810 (£619).
Advert 10The eBay listing.
The used 'Vintage Blockbuster Video Rental Membership Card' was issued back in August 2005, which means it's almost 15 years old and that it's lived through both the Blockbuster heyday and its demise.
Credit: eBayAlas, all we know is that it's being shipped from Tampa, Florida, and that the eBayer - faxo-bisse - selling the card is a 'Longtime member'.
There's plenty more like it out there as well, with people who viewed this item having also viewed another Blockbuster membership card (that one's listed for just $19), a Blockbuster carrier bag ($4.99), a Blockbuster receipt ($18.99) and an unopened '1990s Blockbuster Music Gift Card' ($169.69), among other things.", "Two pence pieces are normally a copper colour but instead this particular coin was accidentally minted on the same base as a 10p coinA RARE silver 2p coin has sold on eBay for £485 - thousands of times more than face value.
1983 New Pence 2p coin, £1,250 The secret lies in the date.
But in 2016, a silver 2p coin dropped into a charity collection tin sold on eBay for a whopping £1,350.
The seller didn't specify any specific details about this particular silver coin, so we don't know if it's been circulated or not.
Do you have any of these rare 2p coins worth up to £56 in your pocket?"]

title: ['1983 Datsun 280ZX Turbo | eBay Find of the Day - Autoblog', 'Coles shoppers are selling the rare Stikeez Golden Billy Banana on eBay for as much as $7,500 - Daily Mail', "Pen15's nostalgic 2000s look came from eBay finds and spot-on AIM ... - The Verge", 'Nissan Figaro in emerald green on eBay - Retro To Go', "Rare silver 2p coin sells for £485 on eBay – here's why it's so valuable - inews"]
summary:
["By 1983, Datsun's Z car had gone through several major transformations.
It also got an optional turbocharger for its straight-six engine, which bumped horsepower from 145 to 180.The well-kept 1983 280ZX Turbo seen up above is currently for sale on eBay .
It's in good shape, too -- the seller says its red paint is original, and the T-Tops (which seal properly, according to the seller) provide perfect period style.
But sales were very good, and road tests of the era suggest a well-sorted 280ZX Turbo can go from 0-60 in a little over 7 seconds and do the quarter mile in the mid-15-second range.
And even today, the Z's slinky profile is sure to turn heads.The example seen here is priced at $14,950 and is located in Cedar Rapids, Iowa.", "Coles shoppers are making a sweet profit by cashing in on their rare collectable on eBay for as much as a staggering $7,500.
The Australian supermarket giant launched 'Stikeez' last month, with 24 mini fruits and vegetables to collect, including the luxurious 'Golden Billy Banana'.
Anyone who finds one of just 100 gold Stikeez gets a $100 Coles Voucher.
Prices range between $300 to $7,500 for an individual Billy Banana.
And there are more than 5,500 listings for Stikeez on eBay, including the entire set of the collectables for as much as $500.", 'Pen15’s depiction of the early 2000s is frighteningly, uncomfortably accurate, and even that isn’t saying enough.
Creators Anna Konkle and Maya Erskine play their 13-year-old selves among a cast of actual middle-schoolers, but they blend in seamlessly.
Alie and Rubinfeld found them at thrift shops and vintage electronics stores like Homeboy Electronics Recycling in Los Angeles.
The graphics script contained detailed directions on everything from the screen names to the AIM buddy icons.
Other AIM icons include a picture of a spork captioned “Wanna spork?” and an AIM avatar juggling, with the words “Play With My Balls” underneath.', 'Haven’t mentioned one of these in a while, so do check out this Nissan Figaro in emerald green on eBay, which looks in excellent condition.
I think you probably know all about the Nissan Figaro, but for those of you who don’t, let me add in a bit of background about the car.
In fact, I covered Nissan’s retro car range as far back as 2006, which was probably the first thing I ever blogged on here.
But to sum up, the Figaro was one of four retro cars produced by Nissan in the late 1980s and for a limited period.
Thankfully the one here is that lovely emerald green and white finish looks to be in excellent condition.', 'A rare two pence coin has been priced at over 24,000 times its face value on auction site eBay.
The silver coin was minted in error in 1989, when it was accidentally struck onto the cupro-nickel base of a 10p, and sold for a staggering £485 in February.
These mules are extremely rare, as most are spotted by the Royal Mint’s strict quality controls and never released into the world.
That makes them valuable, especially to collectors, who are willing to pay far more than the coin’s face value to add them to their collections.
That’s still 4,500 times its face value.']

['Coles collectable sells for ‘insane’ price - news.com.au', 'This Coles Stikeez character just sold for $20100 on eBay - Who', 'EBay Is the Un-Amazon, for Better and Worse - Bloomberg', "QBP's High-End Whisky Carbon Components will Sell on Amazon & ... - Pinkbike.com", 'Bible signed by Donald Trump sells for Ush1.2m on eBay - Uganda Christian News']
summary:
['', 'The Coles Stikeez craze has hit absurd new heights, after the much coveted Golden Billy Bananas Stikeez sold on eBay for an obscene $20,100.
As first reported by New Idea Food, the item earned frenzied attention from 65 bidders, with bidding on the Stikeez starting at a modest $10.
The Golden Billy is just one of 100 produced, and has become an obsession for fans of the cheaply-produced plastic collectables.
Other golden bananas that have appeared on auction sites have attracted somewhat more reasonable winning bids of $2500, $4500 and $7499.', 'Why did this happen?
Please make sure your browser supports JavaScript and cookies and that you are not blocking them from loading.
For more information you can review our Terms of Service and Cookie Policy.', 'Engin Ti 29er: QBP's Whisky Co carbon components are popular among custom bike makers.
If Amazon is the first stop for shoppers, then a QBP brand like Whisky has to be there.
Sandberg put it simply: "If Amazon is the first stop for shoppers, then a QBP brand like Whisky has to be there."
"How would a Whisky purchase on Amazon would transpire?
If you divided that sum evenly between QBP's 5000 retailers, that works out to 97 thousand more opportunities to sell Whisky components.', 'A Bible said to have been signed by President Donald Trump sold this week on eBay for $325 (about Ush1.2m), according to the listing.
Fox News reports the eBay listing described the item as a 4.5-inch Bible signed by Trump using his full signature at a campaign rally in 2016.
The president signed the books on Friday while visiting Providence Baptist Church, which is operating as a disaster relief center.
Al.com notes that many items signed by Trump have been sold on eBay.
A book Trump signed for his mother and father sold for $25,000, and an inauguration program signed by Trump and Vice President Pence sold for just under $10,000.']

title: ['The Aldi giant ostrich Easter egg is being sold on eBay - YOU Magazine', 'Hold up: Amazon, eBay job offer to work from home could be a fake - WKMG News 6 & ClickOrlando', 'More eBay Apple Pay Transactions Being Found - Appleosophy', "Aldi's Giant 'Ostrich' Easter egg is being sold on eBay for nearly double the price - The Mirror", '1986 Mercedes-Benz 190E 2.3-16 Cosworth for Sale on eBay Motors - Road & Track']
summary:
['Easter is a time of great joy and lots of chocolate, and this year supermarket retailer Aldi has taken their Easter selection to another level with a giant ostrich egg.
The Moser Roth Giant Ostrich Egg is so popular in fact, that it is currently being sold on eBay for nearly double the price of its RRP (£14.99).
If this doesn’t take you fancy, Aldi has a number of new Easter offerings, all as swanky as the last!
Our personal favourite is the Moser Roth Hand Decorated Ripple Egg, which is pretty fantastic to look out, and will only set you back £4.99.
In other Easter egg news, there are plenty of exciting, quirky flavours to try this year if you’re feeling adventurous.', 'When Sandi Bennett got two separate phone calls with at home job opportunities from Amazon and E-Bay, the former Bellsouth, AT&T employee thought she hit the jobs jackpot.
"This sounded like the perfect job for me," said Bennet who suffers from multiple sclerosis.
An Amazon spokesperson said the similarity with the impostor calls ends when the caller asks for money.
“We actively investigate reported employment scams, and as a result, dozens of fraudulent recruiting websites have been taken down.
Amazon does offer work from home positions at www.amazon.jobs.', 'We reported earlier this week that one of our readers had found a transaction on eBay that allowed users to pay with Apple Pay.
Once you tap the Apple Pay icon, then you should be able to pay for it with Apple Pay from there.
In my experience, the most popular spot to find Apple Pay as a payment option was actually searching for football cards.
Needless to say, although it’s a small and slow start, Apple Pay is currently available as a payment option on eBay now.
Let us know in the comments below if you have found some Apple Pay transactions on eBay!', "The massive white chocolate Easter egg is on sale now at budget chain Aldi, but sneaky shoppers are listing the treat on eBay at a hugely hiked up priceAldi's Giant 'Ostrich' Easter egg is being sold on eBay for nearly double the priceAldi has unveiled a new show-stopping giant egg for Easter this year and shoppers are already re-selling it on eBay for nearly double the price.
The Moser Roth Giant Ostrich Egg is made entirely of white chocolate blended with caramel sugar - and it's huge.
Measuring a whopping 28cm long and 22cm wide - it's even bigger than a real Ostrich egg.
The massive egg, which costs £14.99, is so popular shoppers have been selling them for a profit on eBay.co.uk .
Earlier this week Sainsbury's announced it will be selling a Easter egg made entirely of cheese this year .", "If you're looking for a daily-drivable classic, this Mercedes 190E might be a good fit for you.
It's a 2.3-16 Cosworth, the one built to allow Mercedes to go racing in DTM in the 1980s.
The engine in the 2.3-16 started life as the M102 four-cylinder found in the base 190E, but gained a 16-valve, twin-cam head designed by Cosworth.
The only real signs this car is 33 years old are the old, flaking factory window stickers.
That sounds like a whole lot of money for an old Mercedes with less than 200 horsepower, we know."]

title: ['8 secrets to shopping at Argos including getting discounts via eBay and where to get voucher codes... - The Sun', 'Benefits fraudster made £30000 on eBay - 3FM']
summary:
["4 Did you know that you can save money by shopping the Argos Simple Value range?
From cutting back costs by shopping the Simple Value range to checking out the Argos sales on eBay, we've got you covered.
First up, Argos has its own page dedicated to voucher codes which are valid on top of any discounts that might already be applied.
Save money by shopping the Simple Value RangeArgos actually stocks its own value range of products to help you save even more cash.
Email us at money@the-sun.co.ukFind Argos discount and eBay offer codes with The Sun Vouchers", 'A Pulrose man has admitted benefits fraud by making more than £30,000 in undeclared income on eBay.
43 year old Paul Robinson of Laburnum Avenue admitted ten charges of making false representations to obtain benefit.
Magistrates at Douglas Courthouse heard Robinson was charged jointly with his 36 year old partner Toni Milligan, who didn’t enter any pleas.
Robinson was claiming Employed Person’s Allowance between June 2017 and December 2018, but was buying and selling Manx coins on the auction website using two accounts.
But he didn’t declare his income to the Treasury, and wrongly claimed almost £12,000 in benefits.']

title: ['eBay Executive Exodus: Chief Information Officer Departs - EcommerceBytes', 'Helen Flanagan is selling her clothes on eBay for as little as £4 - Daily Mail']
summary:
['eBay’s Chief Information Officer (CIO) is leaving the company, the latest in an exodus of top executives.
Dan Morales joined eBay in 2011 and will become CIO of Universal Music Group (UMG), effective April 15, 2019.
In eBay’s case, CTO Steve Fisher is responsible for the end-to-end eBay product experience and technology platform, and he also leads the strategy and execution of eBay’s major new payments initiative.
“eBay was left with legacy technology when we kind of split our own way,” the CIO told the publication, which also quoted eBay Chief Financial Officer praising his colleague for helping separate the IT infrastructure between eBay and PayPal.
Now eBay is facing another breakup as activist investors urge it to explore selling off StubHub and its eBay Classifieds unit.', "Helen Flanagan is selling her old clothes on eBay for as little as £4 while her footballer fiancé Scott Sinclair is said to earn a hefty £25,000 a week.
Helen is currently on maternity leave from Coronation Street, having given birth to daughter Delilah last summer.
Economical: Helen Flanagan is selling her old clothes on eBay for as little as £4 while her fiancé Scott Sinclair is said to earn a hefty £25,000 a week (pictured in 2018)The Coronation Street star has several items under the headline of Celebrity Helen Flanagan Worn such as a Burberry shoes for £120, a red Gucci skirt for £250 and a Dolce & Gobanna dress for £250.
The most expensive item Helen is currently selling is a Balmain black leather and crocodile patchwork bag for £1,150.
For sale: The actress has a range of items on display for fans to get their hands on'There are plenty of Helen Flanagan fans who will be chomping at the bit to step into her shoes.'"]

title: ["EBay's Patricia Svilik honored with Bay Area Corporate Counsel ... - The Business Journals", "HasLab Jabba's Sail Barge for non-US fans coming to eBay - Fantha Tracks", 'Tupperware eBay frenzy: These old sets could make you thousands ... - Who']
summary:
['', 'Many thanks to Jedi Temple Archives for highlighting some exciting developments on eBay for those wanting The Vintage Collection Jabba’s Sail Barge which was previously a US only release.
JTA reader Ed D. found a listing on his eBay application for Jabba’s Sail Barge (The Khetanna) under eBay seller Hasbro-pulse.
Complete with 3 decks, the Sail Barge was primarily used to transport passengers on extended trips across the dunes on the planet, Tatooine.
Most notably, the Sail Barge was the site of Jabba’s demise at the hands of Princess Leia Organa and her cohorts.
Measuring approximately 4ft long, this vast vehicle is a dream item for any Star Wars collection.', "Nostalgia is one hell of a drug – and it even extends to pining after the mundane, disposable things we once took for granted.
Yes, people are now shelling out a fortune on old Tupperware sets, as we hanker for the days when a tight seal was the answer to all of life’s problems.
Hot on the heels of an unprecedented buying frenzy over old CorningWare – with some of those items raking in as much as $7,000 – there’s a rush on well-preserved Tupperware sets from the glory days of the brand, from the 1950s through to the 1980s.
Hundreds of dollars are now changing hands on eBay and other auction sites, with well-stocked sellers raking in thousands.
Tupperware expert and collector Stacy Verdick Case tells New Idea Food the most popular Tupperware comes in the 'Crystal' colour, as the company still makes replacement lids."]

title: ['Nintendo Switch eBay scammer sells almost 500 consoles for ultra-low price of £230 – but they never ar... - The Sun', 'Random: eBay Scammer Tricks Hundreds Of Customers Into Buying ... - Nintendo Life']
summary:
['5 A Nintendo Switch can cost £280 new Credit: NintendoThe consoles - which retail for £280 new - were sold by eBay shop Gtrade2015 for £230 each.
Contact the seller You can do this via My eBay, and eBay says that in most cases, sellers will fix the problem straightaway.
Contact eBay You'll have to wait eight days before you can contact eBay about your issue if it hasn't resolved.
But you will still be covered by PayPal Protection - so you'll have to contact PayPal instead for your refund.
"I hope that eBay and PayPal can refund my money quickly and can launch criminal proceedings against the person responsible for this."', 'It's time to briefly touch upon the not-so-nice part of the world for just a moment, as "almost 500" people have fallen victim to an eBay scam involving non-existent Switch consoles.
The seller, going by the name 'gtrade2015' on eBay, had multiple Switch consoles listed for £230 (£50 cheaper than the official retail price).
The Sun reports that the consoles were due to arrive by Thursday, 14th March and that the seller even provided buyers with fake tracking numbers.
The eBay seller in question is reportedly a Manchester-based registered company and was classed as a "top-rated seller", which likely helped many buyers in their decision to trust the product listing.
The consoles never arrived, however, and the seller has now removed all products from its eBay store and isn't replying to any contact made from customers or press.']

title: ['(Photo) Some seriously weird Sir Alex Ferguson memorabilia sells for £390k on ebay - CaughtOffside', 'Fake eBay Ad in Google Search Led to Tech Support Scams - BleepingComputer', 'Netflix gift cards are on sale for 50% off at ebay - Mashable', 'Auction Gets Set Up On eBay for Fyre Festival Victims - Dance Music Northwest']
summary:
['The last piece of chewing gum that made its way around Sir Alex Ferguson’s mouth in his final game as Manchester United manager has been sold for £390,000 on ebay.
This quite ridiculous story was brought to our attention by Sport Bible, who provide picture evidence of what must be up there with one of the weirdest sales on the auctioning site to date.
Ferguson was well known for chewing furiously during most of his games in charge of the Red Devils, and the scene of him working his way through various sticks of the stuff has become quite iconic.
But this is a lot of money for something just a bit, you know, disgusting.
Plus if you buy fresh gum from your local shop it’s *so* much cheaper, and tastier.', 'A fake advertisement in the Google search results has been running for the past week that looked just like a legitimate ad for eBay.
Tech support scams have long been the bane of search engines as they have become very adept at masquerading as legitimate companies.
Redirects to Tech Support ScamWhen redirected to the final site, users would be shown a tech support scam pretending to be a "Virus Alert from Microsoft" that states "This computer is blocked".
Doing so will close the tech support scam and the following screen will be displayed.
To illustrate how this seemingly legitimate eBay advertisement redirected visitors to tech support scams, we have created the following video.', 'Learn more about how we select dealsAfter a hefty price hike back in January 2019, Netflix is more expensive than ever.
With new seasons of Queer Eye and Stranger Things lurking, you probably weren't going to cancel anyway — but still.
However, we found the hack of all hacks: ebay is selling $30 Netflix e-gift cards for just $14.99(opens in a new tab), and they can be applied straight to your monthly payment.
Or cross a few gifts off of your "to buy" list and grab some for your friends.
The gift card will be shipped to you through an ebay message within 24 hours of ordering.', 'As many people watched on Hulu and/or Netflix, the Fyre Festival did not go off as expected.
As Billy McFarland is currently serving a prison sentence, others are trying to pay back the victims by an auction on eBay.
At least while Billy McFarland is in prison others are seeing the importance of paying back what he owes.
We do not need anyone else losing money because of the Fyre Festival.
What do you think of the eBay auction?']

title: ['eBay to Begin Rolling Out Google Pay on its Marketplace Platform - PR Newswire', 'eBay adds Google Pay as new payment option - CNET', 'eBay is adding support for Google Pay - The Verge', 'Trump autographed Bible that sold for $325 on eBay likely a fake, experts say - AL.com']
summary:
['Google Pay users will be able to complete purchases on eBay via the app, mobile web and on desktop from sellers participating in managed payments.
eBay to Begin Rolling Out Google Pay on its Marketplace Platform"Google Pay provides users with a fast, simple and secure way to pay online," said Alyssa Cutright, Vice President of Global Payments, Billing and Risk at eBay.
eBay's managed payments experience allows users to check out without leaving the platform, using the payment method of their choice.
Google Pay will be available to Android users starting in early April, joining Apple Pay as the latest payment option on the platform.
About eBay: eBay Inc. (NASDAQ: EBAY) is a global commerce leader including the Marketplace, StubHub and Classifieds platforms.', "eBay is adding yet another new payment option to its online store.
The company said Thursday it will let customers pay for items using Google Pay starting in April.
eBay last year added Apple Pay as a payment option, and it will start processing more of the credit and debit card payments on its site without PayPal.
Cutting payment costs for eBay sellers through this new system might result in lower prices for customers, too.
While eBay works to expand its payment choices, it's also working through a strategic review of its business, brought on by activist investors.", 'The announcement post cites Millennials and Generation Z shoppers who increasingly make purchases from their phones and digital wallets as a reason for the new addition.
eBay has shifted away from its reliance on PayPal since the companies split apart in 2015, and is focusing on offering customers more choices in their payment options.
The post further details that “eBay’s managed payments experience allows users to check out without leaving the platform,” unlike PayPal, which sends users to a different site to finish payment.
Today’s move is part of eBay’s efforts to manage most of its own payments by 2021.', 'The Donald Trump autograph on a Bible recently sold on eBay for $325 was likely a fake, according to experts who examined the signature.
All of them said the signature was likely fake.
“The signature on the Bible definitely does not appear to be an authentic signature from President Trump.
The odds of it being real are zero percent in my opinion.”When contacted, the seller told NBC not to reach out to them again.
An eBay spokesperson told NBC if the signature is fake, the buyer would be covered under the site’s money back guarantee policy.']

title: ['eBay Now Lets Customers Pay With Google Play - Thurrott.com']
summary:
['eBay is introducing support for Google Pay as a payment option on its marketplace.
The company announced on Thursday that it’s rolling out Google Pay as a payment option on its website and Android app.
Google Pay will be joining Apple Pay as one of the other modern payment options.
With the addition of Google Pay users will easily be able to pay for things on eBay from their phone, or their computer, without needing to manually enter their card details and simply use the details from their Google Pay wallet.
For ages, eBay has relied mostly on PayPal for payments on its platform, and moving to systems like Apple and Google Pay is definitely a breath of fresh air.']

title: ['Tax Exempt Buyers Now Able to Purchase on eBay - EcommerceBytes', 'Porsche 911 Turbo Trike Is Real, Up For Grabs on eBay - autoevolution']
summary:
['Buyers who are exempt from paying state sales tax can now purchase items on eBay without being incorrectly charged tax.
eBay began collecting sales tax from buyers located in certain states this year thanks to Marketplace Facilitator laws, but it had no way to accommodate tax-exempt buyers.
On March 20, a reader received a letter from eBay informing him his future purchases would be tax exempt.
Purchases that should not be tax exempt (e.g., not made with the intention to resell) should be made with a different eBay account.
Kind regards,eBay Customer ServiceSee related stories:eBay Opens Registration for Tax Exempt Buyers (March 14 EcommerceBytes Newsflash)eBay Seller Update 2019: Sales Tax Collection (March 6 EcommerceBytes Newsflash)eBay Sales Tax Error?', 'We have to mention this contraption is real.
In fact, the three-wheeler is up for grabs, with the machine having been recently listed on eBay.
Speaking of which, the seller talks about the voice of the vehicle: "The exhaust is a four-branch going into a converted cherry bomb, it sounds like a treat,"As for the front end, this has been borrowed from a Honda Fireblade.
And the gear head who put the whole thing together even talks about the practicality aspects of the vehicle.
Even though the rear seats are quite small, they haven't been a problem.']

title: ['eBay Sold Listings Go Missing for Some Users - EcommerceBytes', 'eBay and Amazon See Opportunity in Rural America - EcommerceBytes', '‘Woah, say what?’: Gold Billy Banana Stikeez sells for $50,000 on eBay - Yahoo Finance Australia']
summary:
['We've been getting reports from readers who can no longer find sold listings on eBay, though it may be caused by a technical issue related to a browser.
"Have you received reports regarding eBay hiding sold listings," one seller asked us.
Another wrote, "eBay has begun hiding Sold Listings Search Results - but all the fields you use to make the query still remain!
Some users began experiencing problems viewing sold listings a few days ago.
A thread on the eBay boards suggests it could be caused by ad blockers.', 'eBay and Amazon See Opportunity in Rural AmericaeBay and Amazon see opportunity in rural America and are calling for better resources to “unlock the digital potential” of rural sellers.
There are 37 million working-age adults in the rural US who account for close to 15% of the adult population, but annual revenues of rural businesses represent only 3.7% of total gross revenues in the US economy, according to Amazon.
“Unfortunately, the national discussion has focused on how to “save” rural America,” he said.
The report, based on a survey of 5,300 businesses in rural America, outlined a number of recommendations for the public and private sectors to help unlock the unrealized economic potential of rural America, including:One-in-five rural businesses are already digital.
29% of rural businesses say that online tools reduce purchasing costs of products and materials.', 'Image: eBayThought a miniature plastic banana from Coles selling for $20,100 on eBay was incredible?
Wait until you hear this: another gold Stikeez has sold on eBay – this time for a staggering $50,000.
The collectable toy reached a winning bid of $50,000 on Saturday 23 March after 64 bids.
“After the last golden Billy banana stikeez sold for $20,100 we thought that was absolutely crazy.
The Golden Billy Banana is one of 100 and entitles the recipient to a $100 Coles gift voucher.']

title: ['eBay expands payment options with Google Pay - Retail Insight Network', "Dave Grohl's 1992 Solo Album Is For Sale Right Now On eBay - iHeartRadio"]
summary:
['eBay expands payment options with Google Pay.
Global online marketplace eBay has announced it will add Google pay its arsenal of payment options to enhance customer payment choice in April.
Available for android users, the new payment option will see Google Pay join Apple Pay as eBay’s latest payment option.
Customers will be able to place orders on eBay via mobile web, desktop and the app, and complete the transaction using Google Pay.
“Offering Google Pay as a form of payment is another significant step toward providing our customers with more choice in their payment options, and creating an experience that is tailored to personal preferences.”The retailer is planning to expand the availability of both Apple Pay and Google Pay payment options to more regions under its managed payments programme.', 'Long before Dave Grohl became a frontman, the young Nirvana drummer decided to release an album of his own.
The album, titled Pocketwatch, dropped in 1992, shortly after Nirvana released its seminal album Nevermind.
Though demo versions, some of the songs ended up being re-recorded for Nirvana, and eventually Foo Fighters, projects.
The tape is currently up for auction on eBay, with the current bid at a staggering $430.
Check out the Pocketwatch album art and tracklist below.']

title: ['eBay Cracks Down on Sellers Who Lie about Item Location - EcommerceBytes', 'Gail Simone talks representation, women in comics, and her new eBay partnership - Polygon', 'Amazon, eBay, Catch and Kogan competing for marketplace sellers - The Australian Financial Review', 'Entire 1957 diner car in New Jersey for sale on eBay, if you can move it soon - PhillyVoice.com']
summary:
['eBay announced a crackdown in the UK on sellers who “misrepresent” their items’ location.
The Item Location Misrepresentation policy states in part:“Buyers should have complete information about an item’s location so that they can be aware of all the costs associated with purchasing the item.
The item location must be clear and accurate.
“From today (28 March 2019), sellers won’t be able to create new listings or revise listings where the item location and postal service don’t match.”Secondly, eBay UK will be reviewing international sellers who state their item location is in the UK, but have excessively high dispatch times resulting in extended estimated delivery dates.
What’s allowed and not allowed in eBay UK Item Location Misrepresentation policy', 'To celebrate the release of Captain Marvel on International Women’s Day, eBay announced a partnership with comics creators Gail Simone and Cat Staggs.
According to eBay, sales for merchandise related to female superheroes have jumped by 34 percent, with an even bigger spike — 63 percent — specifically around Captain Marvel.
Ryan Brown even designed an eBay exclusive variant cover for Captain Marvel: Braver and Mightier.
She told Polygon that when eBay approached her about partnering on a hub for female superheroes, it brought tears to her eyes.
Simone has long been vocal about the importance of representation in comics — for young girls and young boys.', '"FBA (Fulfilment by Amazon) changed the game for us," Mr Mizikovsky said.
"That's 100 per cent because of Amazon," said Mr Mizikovsky, who is now preparing to launch another non-appliances line on Amazon.
Marketplace boomThe success of sellers such as Astivita and Amazon Marketplace has triggered a boom in online marketplaces.
“Since we launched in Australia sellers that have joined FBA … have seen an average uplift of more than 25 per cent,” he said.
AdvertisementMr MacKinnon believes eBay’s key advantage over Amazon, Catch and Kogan.com is that it’s not a retailer and isn’t competing against its own sellers.', 'An entire throwback New Jersey diner car from 1957 is up for sale on eBay, and if you can move it from its current premises, it could be yours.
The former Crossroads Diner in Kearny, New Jersey, was built in 1957 by a briefly-operated dining car company, according to the eBay listing.
(The lister believes the diner might be the only one the Campora Dining Car Company ever actually built.)
The diner car measures 50 feet long and 16 feet wide, and seats between 48 and 50 diners at a time.
The eBay lister is asking for a $6,000 payment within 24 hours of the auction’s completion on Friday afternoon, and the full balance within three days of the auction’s completion.']

title: ['This month in Technical.ly history: That time eBay spent $2.4B on a ... - Technical.ly', 'Are You Impacted by eBay Selling Metrics? - EcommerceBytes', 'eBay launches visual shopping feature on mobile - MobileMarketing Magazine', "Classic 1950's NJ diner for sale on Ebay - NorthJersey.com"]
summary:
['A few more Philly ties to this story:eBay Enterprise bought, in 2013, a California-based ecommerce firm called Magento .
Three years later, Magento — by then a standalone company — bought Philly’s RJMetrics .
bought, in 2013, a California-based ecommerce firm called .
Three years later, Magento — by then a standalone company — bought Philly’s .
Earlier this month, this deal was dethroned by the $4.8-billion Spark Therapeutics exit to Roche, confirmed by PitchBook as the largest ever VC exit in Philly proper.', 'Dear Ina,I think it would be a good idea to poll sellers to see how many have been impacted by the new selling metrics.
I had eight cases opened for items not received four were closed by customer support because tracking showed the items as received.
Two others were closed by the customer.
eBay does not remove the cases that were erroneously opened.
This looks like a clear case of eBay wanting to punish sellers and increase fees.', 'eBay has introduced an AI-powered feature which makes it easier for people to browse and purchase similar-looking items when on mobile.
Using computer vision technology, the eBay app can now find items that bear a resemblance to the product you are looking at.
“Our latest feature lets you use words and pictures in a new way to shop, discover and explore on eBay,” said Jonathan Chard, lead product manager for mobile experience at eBay, in a blog post.
“It’s a feature that couples our advances in computer vision with relevant filters.
Although, it wouldn’t be a surprise to see it introduced globally sooner rather than later, maybe even popping up on mobile web and desktop in the future.', 'And Friday you had the chance to buy a real-life, old-school New Jersey diner, complete with furniture and the ghosts of unfinished Reuben sandwiches.
The Crossroads Diner, a 1950s-style diner in Belvidere, was on the digital auction block, until late Friday afternoon.
The diner is about 50 feet by 16 feet, with a seating capacity of up to 50.
The Crossroads Diner might be the only diner ever built by Campora, according to the listing.
The lucky auction winner not only gets a diner, but all the nostalgic trimmings that come with it.']

title: ['Save $50 on a Set of Tires from eBay and Discount Tire Direct - Off-Road.com', 'A local diner that went up for auction on eBay has sold after 76 bids - lehighvalleylive.com']

Over the course of seven days on the site, it attracted nine separate bidders and 76 bids.
The winning bidder will get the diner along with counter stools, two 6-top booths and two 4-top booths.']

title: ['EBay to shut down the eBay Commerce Network, its third-party ad network, on May 1 - TechCrunch', '1500-HP Twin-Turbo Lamborghini Gallardo for Sale on eBay Motors - Road & Track', 'Sydney kid, 7, drops $10,000 on Billy Banana Stikeez collectable on eBay - The West Australian', 'Topshop’s Austin dress is selling on Ebay for DOUBLE the price – and it hasn’t even sold out yet... - The Sun', 'Mum Refunded After Son Makes $10,000 Stikeez Purchase On eBay - Pedestrian.TV', 'Opening Night Avengers: Endgame Tickets Are Going for $500 on ... - MovieWeb', 'Detectives scour eBay, Craigslist in ivory bust; first charges filed under wildlife-trafficking initiative - The Seattle Times', 'eBay Shutters Third-Party Ad Platform Commerce Network - PYMNTS.com']
summary:
['“Thank you for your partnership with eBay Commerce Network,” the company said in a statement on the site.
As a result, we are focusing on business that complements our core marketplace and discontinuing eBay Commerce Network effective May 1st, 2019.
Other products that will stay online include Promoted Listings and, for publishers, the eBay Partner Network, which covers 1 billion+ listings on eBay.
The eBay Commerce Network first emerged in 2013 as a rebrand of Shopping.com, a comparison shopping site it bought back in 2005 for $620 million.
But in that regard, the eBay Commerce Network, which connected consumers globally through operations in France, Germany, United Kingdom, Australia and USA was a relatively modest effort.', "The new Lamborghini Huracan Evo is cool and all, but honestly, I'd rather have something like this Gallardo.
It has an aftermarket twin-turbo system from Dallas Performance, and makes 1500 horsepower on race gas.
This car started out life as a normal all-wheel drive Gallardo before being sent to Dallas Performance for a swath of performance-minded upgrades.
The manual transmission has been rebuilt with billet gears, a billet differential, and billet axle shafts.
According to the seller, the car was taken back to Dallas Performance to have the engine refreshed just 500 miles ago.", '“Congratulations, you’ve got Billy Banana for $10,000.”That was the message a Sydney mum received after her son spent an eye-watering amount on a Coles Stikeez collectable on eBay.
“It’s certainly nothing that I’ve budgeted for and certainly nothing we can afford,” mum Donna Jacob told Today Tonight.
Camera Icon Donna Jacob told her children the banana was forbidden fruit, her son was desperate to add one to his bunch.
Credit: Today TonightShe didn’t even realise he’d made the purchase until she received a confirmation email from eBay.
Credit: Today TonightShe said they questioned how they could know it was her son who made the purchase and not her.', 'And that certainly seems to be the case with both styles of the newly released Austin dress - being compared to designs from Rixo - already appearing on Ebay for up to double the price.
6 The popular Topshop Austin dress has appeared on Ebay at almost double the price Credit: TopshopThe garment comes in both the newly released floral print as well as a star print in both black and white which have all been listed on the auction site.
And while the star print has now sold out in all sizes online the floral print is still available to buy on the Topshop website in both a size 6 and a size 12.
6 But while the star print dress is sold out online the floral print is currently still available in two sizesAustin Floral Print Angel Sleeve Midi Dress, £39 - buy nowThe floral print "Austin Angel" dress is the perfect style for every occasion, with a floaty fit, double split front and a gorgeous daisy print in clashing colours.
And ever since the floral print dropped, Topshop fans have been going wild for the designs.', 'But most importantly, there is the golden Billy Banana — the rarest of them all.
On eBay, purported authentic golden Billy Bananas are being listed for thousands of dollars.
Perhaps even more strange than that, is the apparent market for replica gold Billy Bananas.
47-year-old NSW woman Donna Jacob found out that her son had made the purchase only when she saw the confirmation email.
According to Coles, only 100 of the golden Billy Bananas were made, which is not a lot, but probably still not enough to make them that valuable.', '', '', '']

title: ['Avengers: Endgame opening-night tickets for sale on eBay for $5,000 - CNET', 'Guard sergeant denies stealing military gear, selling it on eBay - VTDigger']
summary:
['Do you want to see Avengers: Endgame on opening night?
Do you really, really want to see Avengers: Endgame on opening night?
As you likely heard, Avengers: Endgame tickets went on sale Tuesday and sold faster than it takes Iron Man to deliver a smart-aleck quip, which is to say, instantly.
But plenty of people did get tickets, and an enterprising batch of them are selling their opening-night tickets on eBay, as often happens with hot tickets these days.
Avengers: Endgame is scheduled for an April 26 release in the US, April 25 in the UK and April 24 in Australia.', '']

title: ['1963 Abarth-Simca 1300 Painted in Blue for Sale on eBay Motors - Road & Track', '1992 Chevy Silverado Z71 | eBay Find of the Day - Autoblog', "Tax officials consider whether eBay and Alibaba are 'pulling the ... - Interest.co.nz"]
summary:
["Before Abarth was a trim package for Fiat's sportiest models, it was an independent tuner company that modified all sorts of cars.
Around 50 examples were built, and this one looks impressively clean.
Welcome to You Must Buy, our daily look at the cars you really should be buying instead of that boring commuter sedan.
Developed in a partnership with French company Simca, it uses the basic chassis, transmission, and suspension from the Simca 1000 sedan.
The car is currently listed for sale on eBay in Beverly Hills, California with an asking price of $54,500 or best offer.", "Because apparently we just can't get enough of trucks , our eBay find of the day comes with a pickup bed.
And not just any bed, but a step-side one, a trend that was present throughout truck history up until the mid 2000s when things like this seemingly managed kill them.
Currently for sale on eBay is this 1992 Chevrolet Silverado K1500 with an extended cab, that step-side bed, the Z71 package, a 5.7-liter V8 and, oh yes, a 5-speed manual transmission with a shifter that's longer than most toilet plungers.
Plus, there's a good chance it's lived the majority of its life in the Pacific Northwest free of salty roads.Frankly, I would rather own this than the current Silverado .
Would I instantly regret that decision once actually driving it and realizing how insanely far trucks have come in three decades?", 'Yet Alibaba and eBay say they need until April 1 2020 to update their systems to comply with the law.
Asked by Labour MP Deborah Russell how much income tax eBay and Alibaba pay in New Zealand, Hudson and Chakravarthi didn’t provide a response.
“I’ve asked officials, is this a valid reason or are they pulling the wool over our eyes?” he said.
He maintained the likes of eBay and Alibaba saw New Zealand as a growth market, so would take the matter seriously.
For more on what the proposed law change means for New Zealand shoppers, see this story.']

title: ["'Amazon tax' may force Alibaba and eBay to close to Kiwis over ... - Stuff", 'Warning as FAKE McDonald’s Monopoly stickers sold on eBay for up to £50 each... - The Sun', 'eBay Find of the Day | Totally amazing 1991 Japanese hearse - Autoblog', 'Man arrested for running eBay shop stocked with stolen tools out of N.C. storage unit - WHSV']
summary:
['Online shopping giants Alibaba and eBay have warned they may have to temporarily close their marketplaces to New Zealanders if the Government doesn't delay the introduction of its proposed "Amazon tax".
National Party revenue spokesman Andrew Bayly has signalled it is almost certain to back the Amazon tax, but Alibaba, eBay and Amazon all say they would need months more time to comply.
EBay is among the firms calling for the Government to delay an "Amazon tax".
Alibaba's Hudson said the New Zealand law change as drafted would "violate a fundamental principle of free trade upheld by the World Trade Organisation".
However, Levey's letter stopped short of explicitly threatening to close off Amazon to New Zealanders for any period.', 'Selling the tokens online breaches the terms and conditions of the game and makes them worthlessHUNDREDS of "fake" McDonald's Monopoly stickers are being flogged on eBay for more than £50 each.
3 McDonald's is warning players that some of the tokens on eBay are fakes Credit: eBayBut even though the tiles may have come from McDonald's Monopoly packaging, selling them actually makes them worthless.
Another shows an almost-complete set of stickers available for £50.
The rarest McDonald's Monopoly tiles THESE are the most sought-after tokens in the giveaway - so keep hold of them to win, and don't throw them in the bin!
A McDonald's spokesperson said: "We are aware that a very small number of people are using potentially counterfeit McDonald's Monopoly stickers.', '"Hey, imagine what the most Japanese hearse would look like?"
I ask my wife upon discovering this 1991 Toyota Crown Hearse on eBay "Oh no, it's not like kawaii , is it?"
After a quick Google search, it wouldn't seem that utilizing elaborate, classic Japanese design and craftsmanship on a hearse is unusual.
I know I'd sure appreciate that.The ad notes, "The handmade craftsmanship on this unique vehicle is exceptional.
Indeed.For those wondering, this 1991 Toyota Crown has a 2.0-liter six-cylinder engine, and there's only the equivalent of 36,934 miles on it.', 'Charlotte-Mecklenburg Police have arrested a man they say ran “a multi-million-dollar eBay storefront out of Charlotte a storage unit” for three years.
Edwin Barkley pleaded guilty to Interstate Transportation of Stolen Property last month in connection with the investigation by CMPD and the U.S. Secret Service.
Police say Barkley would buy tools stolen from Lowes, Home Depot, and Target and would then resell them on eBay.
Barkley’s eBay store, Tool King USA, sold $3 million in stolen merchandise between August 2015 and October 2018, according to police.
Those “co-conspirators” would bring stolen items directly to Barkley, who bought the items at a price significantly below retail value.']

title: ['Amazon and eBay sell tons of counterfeits. Trump wants them to stop. - Vox.com', 'Captain Marvel Has Tripled the Price of Fonzie Lunchboxes on eBay - ScreenCrush']
summary:
['Marketplaces like Amazon and eBay are riddled with fake goods, to the point that companies like Birkenstock now refuse to let wholesalers post their products on Amazon.
Last week, President Donald Trump signed a memorandum aimed at counterfeits — specifically, according to the White House National Trade Council Director Peter Navarro, against sites like Amazon, Alibaba, and eBay.
Shoppers and sellers have been complaining for years that sites like eBay and Amazon don’t do enough to combat counterfeits.
The company acts as a middleman between Amazon sellers and customers, taking care of the shipping and payment process, but the service ultimately allows Amazon to be protected against liability.)
Companies like Amazon, eBay, and Alibaba have taken some action to fight counterfeits.', 'Without spoiling anything too significant, Captain Marvel and her allies are on the hunt for a MacGuffin, and when they find it, they hide it in this Happy Days lunchbox.
And ever since Captain Marvel opened in theaters last month, prices for that lunchbox have skyrocketed on eBay.
In the month or so before Captain Marvel opened in theaters, six of these Fonzie lunchboxes sold on eBay for an average price of $47.32.
In the month since Captain Marvel debuted, ten lunchboxes have sold for an average price of a whopping $139.42.
The collectibles company Entertainment Earth has announced they will be selling a replica of the Happy Days lunchbox from Captain Marvel this October for the relative bargain price of $14.99.']

title: ['Primark shoppers are flogging their Disney Dumbo finds on eBay for double the price... - The Sun', 'eBay Find of the Day | 1975 Avanti II - Autoblog']
summary:
['The most popular item is the sought-after Dumbo duvet setTHE MUCH anticipated remake of the classic hit Dumbo has officially landed in cinemas, and to celebrate Primark launched an adorable array of products inspired by the cartoon elephant.
7 The Primark Dumbo duvet cover was priced at £18 in store and has appeared on eBay for £35 - listing seen here Credit: Primark / DisneyHowever, the once budget range is now being flogged on eBay for up to double its original price – despite much of it still being in stock.
7 Credit: Ebay 7 Credit: Ebay7 There are currently 666 listings for the range on eBay Credit: EbayThe same goes for a fleece baby blanket, advertised at £6 on the official retailers website but currently being flogged for £11.99 on eBay, where it has attracted nine watchers.
The original Dumbo was released back in 1941 and was awarded the Oscar for best scoring of a musical picture.
Elsewhere first pictures show inside the world’s biggest Primark, including the Disney café and T-shirt printing station.', "When the Studebaker Avanti hit the scene way back in 1963, it was unlike anything the automotive world had seen.
A pair of Studebaker dealers bought the tooling to the original Avanti, and created what you see here, an Avanti II.
The first Avanti II showed up in 1965, made mostly of leftover original bits and pieces after the closure of Studebaker's factory in South Bend, Indiana.
The seller claims that 125 Avanti II models were built in '75, which makes this a pretty rare vehicle.
And, says the seller, this particular example was on display at the Smithsonian Museum as part of an exhibit centering around designer Raymond Loewy's most famous designs."]

title: ['Web giant eBay provides £2m boost to independent high street shops - The Mirror', 'Jeff Bezos made a jab at eBay in annual letter to Amazon shareholders - Business Insider', 'Unannounced Nicalis PS4, PS Vita physical games illegally sold on ... - Gematsu']
summary:

But they felt they needed to expand – and Retail Revival arrived at the right time.
The 46-year-old mother of two said: “When I had the chance to join Retail Revival I thought what can I lose?
The high street here is on its last legs and it is a struggle to get people to come in.
“If it wasn’t for eBay, we would have been another high street statistic.', 'Bezos also wrote that compared to Amazon's sales of its own merchandise, "third-party sellers are kicking out first party butt.
Jeff Bezos didn't hold back in saying independent sellers are better off selling their merchandise on Amazon than eBay in his annual letter to Amazon shareholders.
In the letter published Thursday, Bezos compared the growth in merchandise sales of third-party sellers on the two e-commerce websites.
Register Now Our SpeakersThe numbers in Bezos' letter show that since 1999, Amazon has come from behind and surpassed eBay in third-party merchandise sales.
Amazon's third-party merchandise sales have grown at an annual rate of 52%, hitting $160 billion in 2018.', 'Certain unannounced PlayStation 4 and PS Vita physical games published by Nicalis, including 1001 Spikes for PlayStation 4 and VVVVVV for PS Vita, have been illegally sold on eBay, Nicalis reported.
“If you’ve bought a Nicalis PS4 or PS Vita game with a hole-punched UPC barcode, it’s a promo copy that is being illegally sold,” Nicalis said.

DO NOT get ripped off by overpaying for a promo copy without a warranty on eBay or from another seller.
