title: ['eBay rushes to remove Nipsey Hussle memorial programs auctioned for more than $1,000 - Daily Mail', "Gift Bags From Meghan Markle and Prince Harry's Wedding Selling on eBay for Thousands - Inside Edition", "Cabin crew 'resorting to selling unwashed tights on eBay to make ends meet' - Bristol Live", 'Fiesta San Antonio medals selling for big bucks on eBay - mySA']
summary:
['', 'Wanting to quash any lingering whispers of FOMO felt when you missed out on attending Price Harry and Meghan Markle’s wedding?
Three hessian gift bags given out to 1,200 members of the public invited to the couple’s big day at Windsor Castle in May 2018 have appeared on the e-commerce site.
One from a seller in Epsom, Surrey, is going for £3,000, or about $3,900.
“These gift bags are limited edition and were only given to invited guests,” one of the sellers wrote.
Several gift bags previously appeared on eBay in the days immediately following Harry and Meghan’s wedding, one of which reportedly sold for £21,000.', 'An air steward claims low wages have seen cabin crew resort to selling unwashed uniforms on eBay.
Bristol Live reported on Tuesday that dozens of used cabin crew outfits are available on eBay at any given time, many of which are being sold from Bristol.
We have spoken to a Norwegian Airlines cabin crew member who says “appallingly low” salaries have led to staff selling clothes to people with “perverse interests”.
The air steward, who is from the South West but wished to remain anonymous, has himself been a collector of airline uniforms for many years.
A Norwegian Airlines spokesperson said: “Norwegian cabin crew renumeration is in line with the market rate and in many instances above that of our competitors.', '']

title: ['Air stewardesses ‘selling used tights and unwashed uniforms to perverts on eBay to make ends meet’... - The Sun']
summary:
['Some cabin crew have been offered £500 for a pair of tights 'worn on long hot shifts'AIR stewardesses are said to be selling their used tights and unwashed uniforms to perverts on eBay in a bid to make ends meet, it has been claimed.
One listing for a pair of used tights says: "Worn on many long distance journeys on very long hot shifts."
FOOTS THE BILLSA man who has worked for Norwegian Airlines since 2015 said his colleagues on "every flight" are taking part in the antics.
I don't think people realise we are reduced to selling our used crew shoes to make ends meet."
A Norwegian Airlines spokesperson said: "Norwegian cabin crew renumeration is in line with the market rate and in many instances above that of our competitors.']

title: ['Manual-Swapped Three-Rotor Eunos Cosmo for Sale on eBay Motors - Road & Track', "Childish Gambino's Coachella Blunt Appeared On Ebay For $1000 - UPROXX"]

Though it was more of a grand tourer than a sports car, we've always felt having a stick paired to that high-revving three-rotor engine would've been fun.
The three-rotor engine is said to run strong, making good power from its sequential twin-turbo system.
This is the only three-rotor street car Mazda ever built—the only other triple-rotor cars were Le Mans racers.
That's about double what you'd normally pay for an imported Cosmo, but considering the custom gearbox swap, we say that price isn't totally unreasonable.", 'Fans often try to sell some wild artist memorabilia but perhaps no wilder item has appeared for sale in recent memory than Childish Gambino’s discarded blunt from Coachella.
Someone is selling Donald Glover’s blunt from Coachella on eBay.

The invoice included the eBay logo and appeared to come from an eBay email address.

The only way to buy equipment or a vehicle on eBay is by logging into your eBay account with a user ID/email address and password.
If you are suspicious about an email that claims to be from eBay, sign in to My eBay and click the Messages tab.", 'Auction site eBay has removed a listing which offered “a section of timber” from the remains of Notre Dame Cathedral purportedly recovered after the fire.
The site has also taken down adverts for T-shirts with the slogan “Je Suis Notre Dame” under a policy against items which “profit from human tragedy or suffering”.

title: ['He Listed a T. Rex Fossil on eBay for $2.95 Million. Scientists Weren ... - The New York Times']
summary:
['A fossil hunter’s attempt to sell a young Tyrannosaurus rex skeleton on eBay for $2.95 million set off a furor among scientists who warned that it needed to be studied, not sold to the highest bidder.
The skeleton’s owner, Alan Detrich, defended his decision to try to sell the 15-foot fossil to a wealthy private collector, arguing that it could still be subject to research.
“It’s very hard to reach a billionaire,” he said in an interview on Wednesday, noting that he hoped a wealthy bidder from Europe or Asia would emerge.
“Putting it on eBay is one way to do it.”That outlook has angered scientists who have questioned why Mr. Detrich lent the skeleton to the University of Kansas Biodiversity Institute and Natural History Museum two years ago.
They said that putting it on public view was part of a strategy to sell the specimen to a rich investor.']

title: ['Someone Is Trying To Sell a Baby T. Rex Skeleton on eBay for ... - Popular Mechanics']
summary:
['A Kansas man is receiving the ire of the scientific community for his decision to sell a skeleton of a young T. rex on eBay.
Fossil hunter Alan Detrich posted the relic on the auction site hoping to attract the attention of a wealthy collector.
The T. rex was discovered in Hell Creek Formation in Montana on leased land that Detrich used to search for fossils.
The eBay listing says it has a 15-foot-long body and 21-inch skull, and that the young dinosaur was about four years old when it died.
Detrich also wrote that the specimen is "most likely the only baby t-rex in the world."']

title: ['Ruten.com announces tie-up with eBay - 台北時報', 'T. rex fossil found in Montana being sold on eBay, angering scientists - KTVH']
summary:
['Initially, eBay is to introduce 13 million US products on the ruten.com Web site, with members to be able to search for items in Chinese on the site and pay with Taiwan-issued credit cards, Ruten said.
People can also make inquiries in Chinese to US vendors through the Web site, as they would be translated into English, it said.
Ruten is a subsidiary of PChome Online Inc (網路家庭), the nation’s largest e-commerce operator.
“EBay is the most well-known Internet exchange market globally ... both teams have cooperated intensively on technical issues and platform services to render cross-border transactions effortless,” PChome Online chairman Jan Hung-tze (詹宏志) said on Tuesday.
More than 380 million products are available on its Web site, the company said.', 'Scientists are not happy that a rare baby T. rex fossil found in Montana is for sale on eBay.
The listing, from a fossil hunter named Alan Detrich, says the relic may be the only one of its kind in the world.
Detrich found the fossil here in Montana, adding that it has a 15-foot-long body and a 21-inch skull.
Some scientists and other critics are calling the listing a disgrace, arguing the fossil should remain in the public trust so it can continue to be studied.
The museum also alleges that it believed Detrich planned to sell the fossil to a museum, not a private collector.']

title: ['eBay Find | This 1996 Ford F-250 has 7.5 liters and only 85,632 miles - Autoblog', 'New slides of famed Queen Elizabeth II found on eBay - Clydebank Post']
summary:
["I've gotta hand it to Robert Stevens of AJ Motors in Oregon (aka eBay seller tifjeslil ): He sure knows how to find awesome old trucks in fantastic condition with super low miles.
The combination of Oregonians loving trucks but disallowing road salt probably has something to do with that.
Their teal 1992 Chevy Silverado we found on eBay awhile back was a massive hit with you, dear Autoblog readers, so let's go ahead and dip our toes back into that well.And what we find is something bigger and even tealer: a 1996 Ford F-250 Super Cab with a mere 85,632 miles and a 7.5-liter gasoline V8.
There's also a matching teal fiberglass bed canopy and side step, plus a wicked cool 4x4 graphic on the side.
The tires and original wheels are, um, bad ass.Inside, you get a typical Ford interior sourced from the early 1990s.", 'The slides, which include shots of her being built in Clydebank, were snapped up by fans of the vessel and are now set for their first public display.
The QE2 Story website, is to mark the 50th anniversary of the Cunard liner’s maiden voyage with an event in Glasgow on May 4 where they’ll show the full set of slides.
Read more: Remembering Clydebank-built RMS Queen Elizabeth for her 80th anniversaryHer original and distinctive white funnel was quickly changed to orange and the slides include shots of her proper form.
And there will be a special screening of Magic Ride, a film about the QE2 at the time of her maiden voyage.
The QE2 is now enjoying her new life as the Queen Elizabeth II Hotel in Dubai, which opened last year after a decade languishing without progress.']

title: ['Kennedy Presidential Limo Replica Is On eBay - Ford Authority', 'Jurassic Pluck: $2.95 Million T. Rex Listed On eBay, Montana Law ... - Above the Law', 'Rare Corvette GTR Tuner Car by Specter Werkes for Sale on eBay - Road & Track', 'A Robocop Ford Taurus Police Car Replica Is On eBay - Ford Authority', 'Samsung Gear S3 Frontier with warranty scores massive $140 eBay ... - PhoneArena', 'NAVIFORCE watch or AllCall S5500 phone discounted on Ebay - Gizchina.com', 'McDonald’s plastic straws listed on eBay for £1,000 as customer’s rage over ‘useless’ paper ones... - The Sun']
summary:
['', 'And the law, despite having had since the Cretaceous period to prepare itself, is still lagging behind that reality.
Juvenile T. rex fossils are exceedingly rare.
The problem for the Murrays was that although the previous owners of the ranch had transferred their surface rights, they reserved two-thirds of their mineral rights.
The U.S. District Court for the District of Montana found that dinosaur fossils are not, legally speaking, minerals.
The new Montana law won’t necessarily affect the outcome of Murray.', 'It's a C5-generation Corvette with a "GTR" body designed by Michigan-based company Specter Werkes in the late 1990s.
It's reportedly one of just 26 built, and it's for sale right now on eBay Motors.
Specter Werkes was founded by Jeff Nowicki, a car designer who worked for General Motors in the early '90s shaping IMSA race cars.
Nowicki's first aftermarket offering was this model, the Corvette GTR, with plenty of new body panels that make the C5 base car look wild.
The seller claims this GTR is the third example built, and the sole GTR built from a C5 hardtop rather than a fastback targa.', '', 'On the bright side, we've seen the Gear S3 Frontier substantially discounted many times in the recent past , with a brand-new deal on "open box" units allowing you to save a whopping 140 bucks right now while maintaining standard warranty conditions.
The only small inconvenience is your warranty here comes from an eBay seller rather than Samsung itself.
Quick Ship Electronics will cover functionality issues for a full year after your purchase, while vouching for the mint condition the Gear S3 units on sale today will be shipped in for free nationwide.
Oh, and compared to the smaller Galaxy Watch Active , the ultra-affordable Samsung Gear S3 Frontier on special offer right now also comes with a very convenient rotating bezel.
It's legitimately impressive that Samsung has managed to keep the 2016-released Gear S3 smartwatch alive for so long, even after rolling out a Gear Sport in 2017, the stylish Galaxy Watch last year, and a fitness-centric Galaxy Watch Active just a couple of months ago.', 'The depths of the Ebay marketplace are giving out some new loot again and we have for you once again some interesting deals coming.
This time it’s for a fashionable cheap watch and an affordable smartphone piece with a big battery.
Let’s start with the NAVIFORCE casual men watch model offering hard glass mirror, luminous function to see time clearly even at night, 3ATM water-resistant certification, durable alloy case and genuine leather band.
Gizchina News of the week Join GizChina on TelegramAs a second they have the AllCall S5500 phone model for a special cheap price of $79.99.
And as a bonus you will be getting a 32 GB TF Netac card, so check it out.', 'MCDONALD'S plastic straws are being listed on eBay for £1,000 - as furious customers rage over the "useless" new paper ones.
The fast food chain introduced paper straws amid concerns over plastic pollution in the oceans where items such as straws end up harming wildlife like turtles and fish.
A petition created by Martin Reed this week calling for the return of plastic straws has attracted than 35,000 signatures.
Now people have started to list the plastic straws on eBay - for four figure sums.
"Imagine you're about 50 years older than you are now, telling your grandchildren how you got given plastic straws from McDonald's.']

title: ['eBay’s Q1 marketplace growth plunged into negatives - Business Insider - Business Insider', 'Blancco reveals 42% of used drives sold on eBay are holding ... - PR Newswire']
summary:
["During the quarter its marketplace's gross merchandise volume (GMV) totaled nearly $21.6 billion, decreasing 4% YoY and marking the fourth consecutive quarter of GMV growth deceleration for the marketplace.
Business Insider IntelligenceHere's what it means: eBay's marketplace GMV growth going negative indicates that the e-tailer is behind its competitors and the industry overall.
eBay won't be able to compete with the likes of Amazon if its GMV growth is negative and its net revenue growth is lower than that of the US e-commerce industry.
The bigger picture: While eBay's negative GMV growth is bad for the company, there are reasons to believe it may be able to improve its overall performance going forward.
The marketplace still saw its revenue grow despite its negative GMV, which is partially due to Promoted Listings.", "Blancco data erasure solutions have been tested, certified, approved and recommended by 18 governing bodies and leading organisations around the world.
Blancco Mobile Diagnostics solutions enable mobile network operators, retailers and call centers to easily, quickly and accurately identify and resolve performance issues on their customers' mobile devices.
Additionally, Blancco Mobile Diagnostics solutions empower mobile processors, 3PLs, Recyclers and Repair & Refurbishment Operations to easily, quickly and accurately process used mobile devices to identify any issues and determine overall value.
By incorporating Blancco Mobile Diagnostics, mobile processors automate processes, deliver intelligent routing based on device attributes and increase overall efficiency, while driving incremental revenue and profitability.
For more information, please contact:CCgroup for Blancco Technology Group (UK)Abbie Godward / Josh CobbT: +44 (0) 20 3824 9214E: [email protected]CCgroup for Blancco Technology Group (US)Lori ScribnerT: +1 619 798 0043E: [email protected]Blancco Technology GroupLiz Adams, Global Marketing DirectorT: +44 (0) 7725 010 412E: [email protected]SOURCE Blancco Technology GroupRelated Linkshttp://www.blanccotechnologygroup.com"]

title: ['The Amazing Ways eBay Is Using Artificial Intelligence To Boost Business Success - Forbes', 'Many Used Hard Drives Sold on eBay Still Contain Leftover Data - PCMag', "“Holy Grass” from Kanye's Coachella Sunday Service for sale on eBay - Brooklyn Vegan", 'These New IKEA Rugs Are Already Going for Thousands on Ebay - House Beautiful', "Someone Is Selling A McDonald's Plastic Straw On eBay For £1,000 - LADbible", 'Precious Moments Figurines Are Selling for Thousands on Ebay ... - House Beautiful']
summary:
['', 'If you plan on reselling a PC hard drive, make sure you thoroughly delete everything inside.
A new study(Opens in a new window) from data removal company Blannco reveals that many secondhand storage drives sold on eBay still contain data from the previous owner, including personally identifiable information (PII).
Blannco purchased 159 SSD and HDD storage drives on eBay, and had them analyzed to see if any data could be recovered.
In that study, 67 percent of the hard drives contained personally identifiable information.
To properly clear a hard drive, Blancco recommends you use its own data erasure products(Opens in a new window).', 'It's not the Easter grass you typically see for sale at the drugstore, that's for sure.
People are selling "holy grass," allegedly taken from Kanye West's Easter morning Coachella Sunday Service last weekend, on eBay.
"GRASS FRESH CUT BLESSED BY THE SOUND OF KANYE'S VOICE AND KID CUDI'S HUMMING," the description of one listing reads, while another promises, "authentic product.
Comes with Jesus walks Yeezys socks.
This is the last of the Holy Grass available anywhere!!!!', 'Two weeks before the brand's latest Art Event line of carpets hits stores, Ebay is already littered with Virgil Abloh's design for the collection—selling for as much as $5,000.
Each artist created a carpet that's meant to blend art and design—users can either use the designs as standard rugs, or hang them like wall tapestries.
IKEA KEEP OFF RUG IKEA KEEP OFF RUG Now 60% Off $1,995 at eBayFor Abloh's take, the designer chose a cheeky response to spaces outfitted with beautiful things that don't exactly inspire comfortable living.
"The parental ‘don’t ruin the furniture’ kind of thing I think has really impacted how younger people think of furniture."
If you're not willing to drop $5K for Abloh's rug, head to your nearest IKEA on May 10 when the line officially hits stores—but be prepared to duke it out for the limited number available.', 'Advert 10Fancy an old-school plastic McDonald's straw for a cool £1k?
Credit: eBayThe seller of the 'SUPER RARE' new-condition McDonald's plastic straw writes: "Brilliant uncirculated brand new McDonald's straw this is soon to become the stuff of legend, imagine you're about 50 years older than you are now, telling your grandchildren how you got given plastic straws from McDonald's and they will look up to you like god!
Advert 10One signatory to the petition wrote: "The straws are not working for drinking, they should consider biodegradable plastic straws made from natural products.
Another added: "Absolutely useless, they get soggy and end up giving off a cardboard taste to the drink you have, no point in having a paper straw with a plastic lid, much rather have a paper lid and a plastic straw."
Advert 10Thankfully for the environment, regardless of the online argument about it, the paper straws are here to stay.', 'Precious Moments Original 21 Figure Precious Moments Original 21 Figure $49 at eBay Credit: EbayYou could be sitting on a huge undiscovered cash cow, right this very moment, without even knowing it.
Remember those teeny little Precious Moments figurines that your grandma, aunt, or even mom would go crazy over collecting for each and every occasion?
Scour your attics and basements for any Precious Moments figure you own—especially from the Original 21 collection.
Today reports that the vintage figurines from the collection that was released in 1979 could go for hundreds of dollars on Ebay.
More From House Beautiful play icon The triangle icon that indicates to playIf you happen to have an entire collection of Precious Moments statues in your home, they could even go for thousands of dollars.']

title: ['Selling an old computer on eBay? You may also be giving away data you thought you erased - Phys.org', 'eBay find: 3 classic Jeep Gladiator pickups - Autoblog']
summary:
['Credit: George Hodan/Public DomainYou're donating an old computer storage drive or putting one up for sale on eBay.
Researchers teaming up from a data erasure and mobile security firm Blancco and a data recovery company Ontrack found otherwise.
The companies purchased 159 drives at random on eBay, a mix of hard drives and flash (SSD) drives.
After applying data recovery tools to those drives, they found that 42% of them had at least some data.
"But the entire data in that file remains on the hard drive so anyone can download freeware recovery software, run it, and get all the data back."', "As its brand's first proper fullsize pickup truck , the Jeep Gladiator holds a special place in history.
And now that the badge has been reborn as a Wrangler-based mid-sizer , our wandering minds naturally can't help but wistfully remember the classics that got us here.
So we put on our best pair of rose-tinted glasses, fired up the ol' eBay search engine, and ended up with the three vintage beasts you see here.
It's priced at $17,900 and powered by 350-cubic-inch V8 crate engine mated up to a 4-speed manual transmission.
And finally there's this green Gladiator from 1972 ."]

title: ["Whilst some runners sell their medals on eBay, here's what Chris ... - Runner's World UK", 'Warning over rise of fake watches, trainers and handbags on eBay, Facebook and Gumtree – but can YOU spot a... - The Sun', 'Notes: Wander Franco Autographed SuperFractor Pulled; eBay ... - Sports Collectors Daily', '1-Owner 1980 Toyota Corolla Time Capsule for Sale on eBay Motors - Road & Track', "Chris Packham's 'penis hate mail' fetches more than £2,000 on eBay - Daily Star"]
summary:
['Whilst some London Marathon runners are selling their medals on eBay, Virgin Radio Breakfast presenter Chris Evans, revealed on the radio this morning that he is giving his medal to his wife Natasha.
Neil Mockford // Getty ImagesEvans crossed the line in 4:48:33 and said he was giving his wife his medal after she carted their four children around London to support him.
On the radio this morning he said, “She had the twins in a double buggy, a six-year-old and a ten-year-old.
It’s harder than running the marathon.”This was Evan’s fifth marathon.
His PB of 4:41:06 was at the 2017 London Marathon.', 'The Sun has also heard from scores of readers who've accidentally bought fake items on websites such as eBay and Gumtree.
Facebook didn't want to directly comment on the issue of fake goods being sold on its site when we questioned it.
eBay, meanwhile, has a 30-day time limit from goods arriving to make a complaint via its "eBay Money Back Guarantee".
It simply says it will remove posts about fake goods when reported.
"Most eBay sales go smoothly, but if there’s a problem with a purchase, the eBay Money Back Guarantee ensures that buyers receive the item they ordered, or get their money back.', '', "When it comes to buying an exotic classic car in top condition, you don't have to look far.
Normal cars don't get treated that way.
That's why it's so surprising to see this perfectly normal, extremely low-mileage 1980 Toyota Corolla.
It's for sale right now on eBay Motors.
The car is currently up for bidding via a dealership in Fremont, California on eBay Motors.", "Something went wrong, please try again later.
Invalid email Something went wrong, please try again later.
Chris’ Wild Justice campaign group recently won a legal challenge against the casual killing of birds.
And it appears the cruel stunts didn't stop there, as Packham shared with his 323,000 Twitter followers that her has also received a rude hand-crafted gift.
Making good use of his new present, Chris announced in another post that he will be putting it up for auction."]

title: ['Here’s why Facebook beats eBay for selling everything from old cots to toys online... - The Sun', "McDonald's plastic straws are going for big bucks on eBay - Fox News", "York man's Rembrandt etching purchased on eBay set for Swann ... - York Daily Record"]
summary:
['the research foundFacebook Marketplace is an increasingly popular way to sell items online because unlike eBay, it doesn't charge seller fees.
To find out which platform is really better to sell on, MSE chose 20 items at random to compare selling prices on eBay and Facebook.
eBay says it conducted its own comparison test of 445 products and found that eBay sellers earned 2.7 times more than Facebook floggers on average.
Selling on eBay - and a guide to its fees HERE is all you need to know about selling on eBay: How do I sell on eBay?
"The results of this test showed that eBay sellers made on average 2.7 times more money on a like-for-like basis."', "It turns out, throwing out those plastic McDonald’s straws was a mistake.
In what may be the most surprising twist in the ongoing paper-straws drama at McDonald’s, people have started auctioning off the restaurant chain’s old plastic straws on eBay.
MCDONALD'S CUSTOMERS SLAM 'SOGGY' ECO-FRIENDLY STRAWS: 'PAPER STRAWS AND MILKSHAKES DON'T GO TOGETHER'Other listings have also appeared, asking for much lower, but still expensive-for-straws, prices.
McDonald's has tested out alternative options to plastic straws in the U.S., and it's possible that paper straws are on the way.
Many have just accepted their fate, and have learned to live in a world with paper straws.", 'Granted, at the time Bohr wasn't aware he had an authentic 17th-century art piece on his hands.
“Since I was going up, I decided to take some other things up with me, and one of those things was the Rembrandt etching," Bohr said.
He also happened to have an impressive collection of early Rembrandts, according to Todd Weyman, vice president of Swann Auction Galleries.
Rembrandt was a pioneer in terms of etching, a style that requires a copper plate to be used.
The copper plate could be used multiple times to create reprints, or what is commonly referred to as "states."']

title: ["M&S 'Original Gelatine' Percy Pigs listed on eBay for £1000 - Evening Standard", 'A man put his patriotic tie on eBay. Then he learned the buyer ... - The Washington Post', 'Limited-edition Istana model made with Lego bricks sold on ... - The Straits Times']
summary:
['A bag of Marks and Spencer "original gelatine" Percy Pigs has been listed on eBay for £1,000.
The ebay listing labels the sweets as “super rare” due to the decision by creators Marks & Spencer to make all Percy Pigs vegetarian by removing animal products from the recipe.
Piers Morgan and Susanna Reid discussing Percy Pigs on Good Morning Britain / ITV / Good Morning BritainIt came as M&S revealed plans to form a ‘Percy Pig Panel’ to decide on the future of the sweet.
M&S released a press release saying it would be recruiting “100 mega fans” to form the ‘Percy Pig Panel’, which will convene on May 16 at a ‘Percy Pig party’ to cast their votes.
While another wrote: “The classic Percy Pig is truly unbeatable!', 'I used to wear it on the 4th of July, but I've been downsizing so I decided to sell it.
pic.twitter.com/uvoWHAbmJE — 🌷🐶 𝗠𝗮𝗿𝗰 𝗖. 𝗝𝗼𝗵𝗻𝘀𝗼𝗻 مارک (@BlogGuero) April 30, 2019The man who offered the winning bid on it, Jaques Campher, lives in Ohio.
He said he really wanted it because he wanted to wear it TO HIS SWEARING IN CEREMONY TO BECOME AN AMERICAN CITIZEN.
“I thought about it for a second and just decided to send him the tie gratis,” Johnson tweeted. "
“It was an American-made tie,” Johnson said.', "SINGAPORE - Just a day after they were launched, sets of a limited-edition Istana building model made of Lego bricks are now being sold on online marketplaces Carousell and eBay for between $100 and $300.
The model of the presidential residence was unveiled on Wednesday (May 1) at the Labour Day Istana open house by President Halimah Yacob, to commemorate the Istana's 150th anniversary this year.
Only 500 sets of the limited-edition model were available and all were fully redeemed within two hours of the launch.
The model made of 200 Lego bricks was commissioned by the President's Office and designed by a Lego certified professional.
There was at least one listing on eBay priced at US$199.99 (S$271)."]

title: ['Beware: eBay Now Relists Returns and Cancelled Orders - EcommerceBytes', 'PewDiePie racks up £1 million eBay bid in four hours for Sonic drawing - Metro.co.uk']
summary:
['Sellers, take note - eBay will automatically relist many types of cancelled and refunded orders on your behalf, which could lead to unexpected fees.
With the "Relist cancelled items and remorse returns" change, eBay provides a checkbox for sellers when they process a cancellation or return.
Is there a risk that my returned or cancelled items might be relisted by accident?
And remember, this checkbox would be incredibly welcome - if sellers truly had an eyes-wide-open choice about choosing to relist cancelled items.
If you encounter other dangers lurking in the Spring Seller Update, be sure to let us know so we can alert your colleagues.', 'Felix is flogging his, um, masterpiece (Picture: eBay/Getty)YouTuber PewDiePie has racked up a whopping £1 million bid on eBay for his questionable drawing of Sonic The Hedgehog and we have so many questions.
Pewds – real name Felix Kjellberg – created his, um, masterpiece after fans were horrified by the character’s design in the upcoming Sega movie, which featured teeth, freakishly long fingers, and a weirdly slender physique.
‘Funny enough, I was offered [Sonic the Hedgehog],’ he said.
Meanwhile, Jeff Fowler, the director of the Sonic movie, recently stunned fans by announcing his team would fix the character’s design.
MORE : PewDiePie praises ‘Subscribe to PewDiePie’ banner flown over New York despite declaring slogan ‘over’MORE : PewDiePie calls for end to ‘Subscribe To PewDiePie’ after being mentioned by Christchurch shooter']

title: ['Check Your eBay Global Shipping Settings - EcommerceBytes', 'Rare sets of Lego are selling on eBay for up to $10,000 - Daily Mail']
summary:
['Some sellers have begun reporting that they have been suddenly opted in to eBay’s Global Shipping Program (GSP) without their knowledge, such as the seller on this eBay discussion board thread, and the seller who filed the following report on Ecommerce EKG.
May 3, 2019: “All of my listings (at least all the ones I looked at) have been opted into international shipping.
Global Shipping is now a positive default with ALL listings, even old ones.
NO international shipping used to be a default.
Being randomly opted into the program has been a chronic problem since it launched, and you should periodically check your GSP settings.', 'The Star Wars Millennium Falcon, 1st Edition Lego set, (pictured) reportedly sold on eBay for a staggering $9,500The Star Wars Lego Figurine C-3PO solid gold 14K, (pictured left) recently sold on ebay for $8,507 while The Harry Potter Fantastic Beasts Lego set (pictured right) sold for $8,000What Lego sets are the most collectable?
Star Wars Millennium Falcon, 1st Edition - $9,500 2.
Lego sets which earned the most on eBay include the Star Wars Millennium Falcon, first edition, with a reported sales figure of $9,500 and a Star Wars Figurine C-3PO solid gold 14K, $8,507.
Ranking third on the list of top sellers is the Star Wars 10179 Millennium Falcon, which sold for $8,475.
Star Wars 10179 Millennium Falcon (pictured) sold on eBay for a reported sum of $8,475Other Lego sets to have sold for upwards of $7,000 include Capitol Washington Building, USA Congress, $7,841.']

title: ['PewDiePie Sonic Drawing Goes for Insane Amount on eBay - GameRant', '1991 Aston Martin Virage 5-Speed Manual for Sale on eBay Motors - Road & Track', 'Sophie Turner’s Ring Pop Wrapper From Wedding to Joe Jonas Hits eBay, With Bids of More Than $4K - Us Weekly', "PewDiePie's Sonic Drawing Goes For 13 Million On Ebay Before ... - TheGamer", 'From Armani to eBay: How Stars Sourced Their Style at the Kentucky Derby - Hollywood Reporter']
summary:
['', "Cars from the '90s are all the rage right now, so if you want to stand out, you have to buy something truly obscure.
Take for example this Aston Martin Virage.
The seller says that this Virage has had the same owner for the past 20 years.
Which means the true mileage is unknown thanks to that cluster swap, but judging by the pictures, the car looks to be in good condition.
It's the perfect '90s GT car, with subdued looks to get you through the countryside with ease.", 'The Ring Pop wrapper that reportedly held the candy Sophie Turner received when she married Joe Jonas in Las Vegas on Wednesday, May 1, has made its way to eBay.
In fact, Grice notes he found the wrapper from 23-year-old Turner’s Ring Pop while filming a segment for Entertainment Tonight.
The description also states that the “slightly used” foil wrapper is from “the cherry-flavored candy ring that held the wedding ring that Joe gave to Sophie in Las Vegas on May 1 2019 at 9 pm.” Grice even included photos of Turner and Jonas, 29, sporting their edible jewelry.
The Las Vegas worker initially told TMZ he wouldn’t sell the item for less than $1,000, but he doesn’t need to worry because the price has already climbed to more than four times that.
Furthermore, in addition to being married by an Elvis impersonator, the couple got hitched on Priscilla and Elvis Presley’s 52nd wedding anniversary.', '', 'Whacky, over-the-top looks are never in short supply on the Kentucky Derby red carpet, from fantastical, feather-bedecked hats to ensembles that resemble costume more than fashion.
“She found this on eBay — it cost all of $30,” said the actor, a first-time Derby attendee.
“Because it’s double-breasted and it has sort of a relaxed elegance, I feel a bit retro and Sinatra-esque, which is exactly what I wanted.”Pastels also rank high in style statements on Derby Day.
I get all my hats from J.J., and I love adding this to my collection.”Indeed, sartorial splendor takes myriad forms at the Kentucky Derby, but elegance rules the day.
“It’s impressive to see how much time and effort people put into their style each day, especially the women.']

title: ['Zombie Seller Takes over eBay Account - EcommerceBytes', 'Kids collectable that’s raking it in - news.com.au', 'Royal baby teddy bear on eBay for £900 - The Times', 'Deal with eBay to bring 40 ‘work at home’ jobs and small business resources to Baton Rouge - WAFB', 'eBay find | 1995 Chevy Tahoe Two-Door with 46,697 miles - Autoblog', 'Custom 1983 Honda Civic Wagon for Sale on eBay Motors - Road & Track', 'Early Production Material From Mario Cartoon Revealed In eBay Auction - Pop Geeks', 'The Walking Dead #191 Now Sells For Up to $20 on eBay - Bleeding Cool News', 'Royal baby teddy bear souvenir listed on eBay for TWENTY times official price at £2,500 after selling out... - The Sun']
summary:
["Today I heard a funny sound from my phone and I found out it was a sale through the eBay app.
I never heard that sound before because I have never in 15 years on eBay sold anything or even listed anything.
I don't have a PayPal account, but one was added to my account and I did not receive an email.
The sale is paid to that PayPal account and the listing is still currently up because eBay will not allow me to remove it while they investigate.
I honestly have no idea how this could happen and have changed all the passwords to both my eBay account and my email.", '', 'Only 100 of the bears were for sale and they sold out shortly after the birth was announcedThe official royal baby teddy bear released to mark the birth of the Duke and Duchess of Sussex’s son was last night for sale on online auction sites for seven times its original price at £900.
A limited edition run of 100 bears, made by the English company Merrythought exclusively for the Royal Collection Trust, sold out immediately after the baby’s birth was announced, sparking a frenzied resale market.
SponsoredAdverts for the £125 bears, which were made with alpaca fleece, cotton and silk, swiftly appeared on eBay for up to £900.
Wearing a ribbon around the neck, each bear was also embroidered with a gold crown and the year “2019” on its left foot.
A limited edition £190 Highgrove baby hamper, with a teddy bear', 'BATON ROUGE, LA (WAFB) - Baton Rouge is partnering with retail e-commerce giant eBay by bringing in more jobs and launching a retail revival program.
The announcement was made Tuesday at Red Stick Social to much fanfare, with an event opener from Southern University’s Human Juke Box.
The program was operating in Akron, Ohio and Austin, Texas before the company moved toward the Red Stick city.
The other economic initiative involved eBay launching its Retail Revival program, which provides services to help local entrepreneurs establish their presence in the digital marketplace.
Baton Rouge is the sixth city that’s part of the retail revival program.', "I seriously tried to find another cool truck as an eBay find, but ol' Robert Stevens (or eBay seller tifjeslil ) has quite simply done it again.
I'm starting to think he's in possession of a time portal that allows him to ship trucks from 1997 (such as this F-250 and this Silverado ).Any way, check out this 1995 Chevrolet Tahoe K1500 2-Door with only 46,697 miles.
It's seriously cool and seemingly in excellent shape.Now, for those of you too young to have friends who worshiped this thing in high school, Chevrolet did indeed sell a two-door Tahoe .
I'm not certain the chubby-looking Tahoe of the 2000s would've been as cool with two doors.Now, some tidbits about this particular two-door 1995 Tahoe .
It was that, or tacked onto the tailgate, which is impossible on the Tahoe since the two-door came with the flip-up window/flip-down tailgate design.", "But if you want to stand out from all the other Civics on the road, we have an alternative: This 1983 Civic wagon.
It's been expertly customized with new suspension, a redone interior, and an engine from a '90s Acura.
Welcome to You Must Buy, our daily look at the cars you really should be buying instead of that boring commuter sedan.
This Civic wagon was built by Main Stream Performance in Georgia for Rutledge Wood, former host of Top Gear America.
Matching green upholstery lines the interior, with green and yellow plaid inserts on the Recaro seats and door cards.", 'Facebook Twitter Reddit EmailThanks to the miraculous electronic garage sale known as eBay, we now know more about the production of the Super Mario Bros. Super Show than we did 24 hours ago.
An estate sale from a former executive at animation studio DiC has yielded rare pitch art from the early days of the Mario cartoon.
The “Super Mario Bros. Power Hour,” as it was originally pitched, might have contained segments like THIS!

Some other items in the auction shed light on the development of Captain N, or “Captain Nintendo” as it was originally called.', '', "The commemorative toys were originally sold for £125 by the Royal Collection Trust yesterdayA TEDDY bear released to celebrate the birth of the royal baby is up for sale for £2,500 — a whopping 20 times higher than its original price.
All of the 100 limited edition souvenir bears sold out immediately after the birth of Meghan Markle and Prince Harry's first child was announced.
The commemorative toys were originally sold for £125 — but they quickly appeared on eBay for up to £2,500.
A limited-edition £190 Highgrove baby hamper, which included one of the teddy bears along with bath products, also completely sold out from the Royal Collection Trust website.
ROYAL BABY BIRTHThe Duchess of Sussex, 37, gave birth to a baby weighing 7lb 3oz at 5.26am on Monday morning."]

title: ['Outrage as $20 Aldi item sells out in minutes - news.com.au', 'Sweet Merciful Christ, Those Post Malone Crocs Are Already On ... - Pedestrian.TV', 'Leomie Anderson, Victoria’s Secret’s Newest Angel, Lives on eBay - W Magazine', 'You Can Buy an Original iPod on eBay for $19,995 - Fortune']
summary:

Now that you can’t cop a pair of these (god-awful, let’s be honest) shoes from the internet, they’re already being flogged on eBay for incredulous prices.

READ MORE Those Cursed Post Malone Crocs Are Heading To Oz In Very Limited NumbersPlease, let me bring your attention to the US eBay site.
Considering the rare collab was an Aussie exclusive this time around, they’re all the more lucrative for the American Posty fans.', 'In early April, Leomie Anderson shared on Instagram that she had become a Victoria’s Secret Angel in a post that Bella Hadid, Jourdan Dunn, and more than 43,000 other people have liked since.
Luckily, Anderson is just as eager to share her tips for scouring eBay as she is to talk personal style and her new life as an Angel.
I’ve looked up to the Victoria’s Secret Angels basically all my life, especially ever since I started modeling, and I never thought that I could be one, you know?
Victoria’s Secret was actually one of the only places I could look to see black girls being celebrated, and being able to be themselves as well.
Of course, I’m being biased, but obviously some of my Victoria’s Secret looks.', 'Eighteen years after Apple disrupted the world of music with the iPod, a factory sealed, unopened box containing the first generation of the device is on the auction block.
The rare unopened 5-gigabyte iPod is listed for $19,995 on eBay.
And just as with the collectible toy market, items that are in their original packaging and sealed are much more desirable to enthusiasts.
Five years ago, a factory-sealed first generation iPod sold for $20,000.
A special edition U2 iPod has sold for as much as $90,000.']

title: ['1959 Kellison J5R Kit Car for Sale on eBay Motors - Road & Track', 'NY Giants: Amani Toomer selling road bike on eBay - NorthJersey.com', 'Original iPod hits eBay with insane $20K list price - New York Post', 'eBay opens its first high-street concept store to explore how offline ... - InternetRetailing', "Post Malone's limited-edition Australian Crocs selling for $1100 on ... - Stuff", 'Someone’s Selling The OG iPod On eBay For $20,000 - Ubergizmo']
summary:

It's a Kellison J5R, a kit car designed by an Air Force veteran featuring some stunning lines and a Chevrolet V-8.
Welcome to You Must Buy, our daily look at the cars you really should be buying instead of that boring commuter sedan.

Though it may lack an exotic badge and motorsport pedigree, the design of the Kellison is right on par with the best sports cars of the 1950s.", 'NorthJersey.com Digital DeskAnyone want a bike that was "lightly used" by Amani Toomer?
The former New York Giants wide receiver who was part of the 2007 Super Bowl championship team, is selling a De Rosa Protos "REVO" Custom 2018 on eBay.
The price is listed as $6,499.99, but the starting bid is listed as $999.99.

Oh, and the shipping is free.', 'Indeed, some fan reactions on a MacRumors message board at the time have since taken on a life of their own.
As an illustrative example, one outraged Apple fan wrote the following nearly 18 years ago: “I still can’t believe this!
The original iPod falls into the latter category.
Hopping on over to eBay, someone is selling a completely unused and factory sealed original iPod for $19,995.
Is forking over $20,000 for an original iPod completely unnecessary, if not downright insane?', 'eBay is exploring how online retail and stores work together as it opens its first high street concept store today.
But for eBay this will act as a retail experiment, helping it to understand the interaction between physical and online retail.
Rob Hattrell, vice president of eBay in the UK, said: “The small retailers taking part in Wolverhampton’s Retail Revival have already shown that physical and online retail can survive – and thrive – together.
One business that will be participating in the concept store is Fizzbiz, which sells fabrics, zips, haberdashery and embroidered items online.
“But it’s not just about getting to take part in the Concept Store – Retail Revival has opened so many other doors for Fizzbiz, which started as a hobby.', "If you were hoping to get your hands on some of Post Malone's special Australian Crocs, you're too late - they've already sold out.
Unless, of course, you're willing to pay big bucks for the pairs up for sale on eBay.
The rapper's limited-edition Australian styles launched on Thursday and sold out in 12 minutes flat, according to Pedestrian.
The drop was timed to coincide with Post Malone Aussie tour dates.
Post Malone/INSTAGRAM Post Malone's Australian crocs sold out fast.", 'Apple has, over the years, created a variety of products that has had its share of failures and successes.
While the iPod is no longer as popular as it once was, it’s hard to deny its place in Apple’s history.
So much so that if you have $20,000 to spare, the original first-gen iPod has been spotted available for purchase on eBay.

Read more about Ebay and iPod.']

title: ['The First Two Pontiac Firebirds Ever Built Are Listed on Ebay Right ... - Jalopnik', 'eBay small businesses pop-up shop opens in Wolverhampton - BBC', "Ultra-rare Commodore 65 in on sale at eBay - price might hit $20'000 soon - AfterDawn"]

That team discovered the two cars in rather sad shape back in 2014, but restored them to apparent perfection.', 'While some retailers have been struggling in the decline of the traditional high street in favour of online sellers, eBay said it hoped moving to a "bricks and mortar" shop would have a "powerful effect" on growth.', "Most of the computer fans know the legendary Commodore 54.

title: ['Kim Kardashian is auctioning 176 luxury items from her wardrobe on ... - Evening Standard', 'eBay ads suggest that you will soon accept crypto - My Bitcoin', 'Vintage Porsche 911 Shell Project for Sale on eBay Motors - Road & Track']

The new mum-of-four has rebooted her eBay account 'Kimsaprincess' and is currently selling 176 luxury items straight from her wardrobe.
"Welcome to my store on eBay where you can browse a wide variety of fashion items including clothes and accessories from my favorite designers" states the store description.
Kim Kardashian West Prada Black Nylon Cropped Top With Zipper Pocket / eBayAs expected, Kim's shop is filled with high-end designer clobber, including pre-owned Dior, Balenciaga, Chanel, Fendi, Givenchy, Louis Vuitton, Burberry, Balmain, Lavin, Alaia, Saint Laurant - and many, many more.
Kim Kardashian West Chanel Grey/Black Woven Straw Raffia XL Deauville Tote Bag / eBayThe charitable auction ends in six days and 11 hours, so there's still plenty of time to scroll through the pre-owned Kardashian items and add one to your watch list.', "According to the photographs of the marketing material of the conference, they suggest that eBay could soon start accepting cryptocurrencies.
However, it shows a clear interest of the company for virtual currencies and digital collectables.
In particular, the phrase “is happening on eBay,” in reference to virtual currencies, seems to suggest something imminent.
This is because an eBay executive, Sanja Kon, joined UTRUST last year, an encryption payment company, which could also be indicative of eBay's encryption ambitions.
However, it should be remembered that eBay already has a category called «Virtual currency», so the slogan «Virtual currency.", "It's a 1976 Porsche 911 widebody shell that's been prepped for a restoration, listed for sale right now on eBay Motors.
According to seller, this car was turned into a RUF Yellowbird replica with a 911 Turbo flat-six drivetrain before it was disassembled.
The old suspension is currently on the car, supported by a set of way-too-small steel wheels.

Whether you're looking to create a vintage cruiser or an all-out time-attack car, this car will make a solid base."]

title: ['AI translation boosted eBay sales more than 10 percent - The Verge', 'eBay Loses Chief Technology Officer at Critical Time - EcommerceBytes', 'Rumor: eBay to Accept Crypto Payments, Binance Coin Will Be Main Token - Asia Crypto Today']
summary:
['A recent study from economists at MIT and Washington University in St. Louis offers some proof, though, showing how AI tools boost trade by allowing sellers to cross the language barrier.
Looking at data scraped from eBay, the researchers compared sales between the US and Spanish-speaking Latin American countries before and after the shopping platform introduced AI-powered translation for product listings in 2014.
AI translation helps sellers cross the language barrierPrior to this eBay offered automatic translation, but the use of AI significantly improved the service’s accuracy.
Their data showed that sales from the US to countries affected increased 10.9 percent after the launch of the tool.
The researchers also compared this data with eBay’s rollout of AI translation tools for Russian, Italian, and French.', 'eBay is losing its Chief Technology Officer in 2 days, it announced in a filing with the SEC on Wednesday.
“On May 15, 2019, eBay Inc. announced that Steve Fisher, Senior Vice President, Chief Technology Officer, is stepping down effective May 17, 2019 to focus on health issues that his family is facing.”The news comes 2 months after the departure of eBay’s Chief Information Officer and 3 months after the departure of the head of eBay Marketplaces when the company underwent a reorganization.
Fisher’s departure also comes as eBay undertakes a major technology initiative: taking over payment processing from PayPal.
In June 2018, Fisher had assumed the role of Senior Vice President of Payments, but he resumed his role as Chief Technology Officer 5 months later.
Update 5/16/19: eBay CEO Devin Wenig said of the departure, “Steve Fisher, eBay’s highly respected CTO, is stepping down to focus on health issues that his family is facing.', 'The Consensus event in Manhattan had adverts from eBay that alluded to a crypto future.
The online shopping giants are going to accept Binance coin, BNB, as their main token according to a tweet from a twitter user, Crypto Enthusiast.
In a tweet, he spoke of the benefits a crypto payment could have for ecommerce websites.
It read:“For any internet (non-physical) based business, I don’t understand why anyone would not accept crypto for payments.
The main one being PayPal which is contracted by eBay until 2023 and does not yet accept crypto as a method of payment.']

title: ['In-housing on the Sell-Side: Q&A with Geoff Smith, eBay - ExchangeWire', "'Barn find' 1970 Ford Mustang on eBay is more than meets the eye - Fox News"]
summary:
["'In-housing' is one of the buzzwords currently sitting near the top of the 2019 ad tech lexicon, in an interminable race with other terms such as 'transparency'.
To gain a sense of what the in-housing experience has been like for the sell-side, ExchangeWire speaks to Geoff Smith (pictured below), Director, Ad Tech and Innovation EMEA at eBay for his insight.
ExchangeWire: What are the main reasons for the recent trend of publishers in-housing their sell-side tech?
If in-housing means the disintermediation of partners in the value chain, then I would argue that only the largest of publishers have gone down the in-housing route.
Even as a large publisher, building custom integrations with the world’s largest ad tech companies still takes considerable work and influence, and delays often sit outside of your control.", 'There’s a 1970 Ford Mustang for sale on eBay that you might not give a second glance, but it deserves one.
The Mach 1 appears to have faded paint and its best days behind it, but it’s just a façade.
The seller says he had it covered it in a uniquely-designed wrap and put on rusty steel wheels to give it a “barn find” look just for fun, but it’s actually in pretty nice shape underneath.
He first owned the car in high school and sold it in 1984, but tracked it down and bought it back a couple of years ago.
The “M Code” Mustang, featured on BarnFinds.com, was originally blue and wears a nice coat of yellow paint today.']

title: ['Kate Middleton high street dress is flogged on ebay for four times the price - Daily Mail', 'Shocking $600 iPhone eBay ‘scam’ - news.com.au', 'eBay raises its game in Australia - Parcel and Postal Technology International', '1995 Mitsubishi Eclipse GSX 5-Speed for Sale on eBay Motors - Road & Track']
summary:
["And royal fashion fans were quick to cash in on the sartorial appetite for the mother-of-three's style, with the dress appearing on eBay for more than four times the price just hours later.
Meanwhile another listing for the dress includes pale pink drop earrings similar to those worn by Kate, but is still priced at four times as much as the retail prices.
Meanwhile Kate, 37, looked elegant in her dress, with little Charlotte coordinating in a £65 floral dress by Rachel Riley - both taking the theme of the outing very literally.
Prince George wore H&M’s LOGG line, Label of Graded Goods top, previously worn to the Houghton Horse trials last year.
The family were seen exploring the garden, including its magical woodland playground, before it opens to the public on Tuesday", '', 'eBay Australia is working with Australia Post-owned Fulfilio to help sellers fulfill orders faster.
Beefing up fulfillmentLast year, eBay launched its national Fulfilment Partner program in partnership with Australia Post-owned Fulfilio, providing eBay sellers with excellent prices for picking, packing and delivering their eBay orders.
eBay Australia recently announced that its Fulfilment Partner Program has reduced end-to-end fulfillment and delivery times by 15% for participating sellers.
eBay’s partnership with Fulfilio has been a big boost for many eBay sellers in Australia, especially smaller players, according to Professional eBay Sellers Alliance (PeSA) Australia president Tim Davies.
According to eBay, sellers that offered Guaranteed Delivery saw an average sales lift of 5-7% over non-Guaranteed Delivery sellers between May and August 2018.', "The second-generation Mitsubishi Eclipse was one of several cars from the 1990s that got wrapped up in Fast & Furious tuner culture, meaning there aren't many clean, low-mileage examples left.
This one is the the nicest we've seen in a while, and it's for sale right now on eBay Motors.
The car wears a set of 18-inch Enkei multi-spoke wheels, as well as a big brake kit from Stoptech.
The engine has been upgraded with upgraded valve guides, stronger springs, and a more aggressive cam.
Behind the wheels sit Eibach Pro Kit springs and Tokico Illumina five-way adjustable shocks."]

title: ['Did You Know eBay Built a Lavish NYC Pub Style Lounge? - EcommerceBytes', '1964 Jaguar Mark X Sedan for Sale on eBay Motors - Road & Track', '1992 Subaru Libero | eBay Find of the Day - Autoblog']
summary:

Having a drink at @eBay onsite pub Walker's West with the brilliant #ebay #community team," wrote an employee of one of eBay's contractors who included a hashtag for "yes those are drink tickets."
that eBay has a pub-like lounge on campus - especially one built with what appears to be no-expenses-spared.
In a speech at the grand opening, he said, "Buildings are symbols of your culture and of your brand.
By increasing operational efficiency, eBay can free up capital to invest in capability- and revenue-enhancing activities."', "In 1961, it released the iconic E-Type, which took the world by storm, cementing the brand firmly into the mainstream.
But it wasn't the only car Jaguar sold in the '60s.
There was also the Mark X sedan.
The Mark X was a direct replacement for the Mark IX saloon, first appearing alongside the E-Type in 1961.
You could get the Mark X with a stick, though most models sold in North America, including this one, were optioned with a three-speed automatic.", "Here in the U.S., we've seen such oddities as the Stout Scarab and, more recently, the mid-engine, supercharged, all-wheel-drive Toyota Previa.
Take this Subaru Libero for instance.
A 1.2-liter three-cylinder engine means it isn't a Kei car , despite the van's diminutive dimensions.
At the very least, this little Subaru Libero would definitely strike up lots of interesting conversation at your local Saturday-morning hangout, and that's what's really important, right?
It's currently for sale on eBay with a Buy It Now price of $9,900 and located in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania."]

title: ['Historic stones taken from Cardiff Castle are being sold on eBay for £300 - Wales Online', 'Found on Ebay: This 1994 Ford Bronco Dually Is the Ultimate ... - The Drive', 'eBay Bikes: Canyon Special - Aeroad, Ultimate, Inflite & SpeedMax ... - Road.cc', 'Jason Momoa Is Auctioning Off His Braun Beard Trimmer on eBay for Charity - Pulse Ghana']
summary:
['Keep up to date with the latest stories with our WalesOnline newsletterHistoric stones taken from Cardiff Castle have appeared for sale on eBay - with bids starting from £300.
The stones, advertised as "11th Century limestone rocks", were pinched from the Norman shell tower inside the castle by a tourist in May last year.
Cardiff Castle is a medieval castle and Victorian Gothic revival mansion.
Cardiff Castle has demanded the historic stone is returned and joked that if one stone is worth £300 the entire castle must be worth a fortune.
A spokesman for Cardiff council, which owns the castle, said: “Cardiff Castle is a scheduled ancient monument and one of the most significant historic buildings in Cardiff.', "That could be why the builder of this 1994 Bronco chose to create their own, and now it can be yours.
EbayThe truck/SUV hybrid looks like it came from the factory this way, odd proportions and all.
Its short wheelbase and wide stance make for a particularly quirky look that really isn't bad, but definitely not for everyone.
Still, it isn't without its imperfections and, should you be looking for a showroom-perfect example, it'll need some work.
The aforementioned rust is a bit of a hangup and the undercarriage could use some attention as well.", "A collection of brilliant used bikes from CanyonIf you're after a snazzy new bike, then buying used can save you a huge amount of money.
We've been seeing a few Canyon bikes on eBay lately so here's a roundup of some of the best.
A full Ultegra Di2 groupset is paired with Zipp 303 carbon wheels and Rotor aero rings.
It's one of the most balanced road bikes that we've ever ridden and this Ultegra 6800 version comes with Giant SLR carbon wheels and GP4000S II tyres.
The Sram Force CX1 groupset is smooth and reliable while the Reynolds AR41 carbon wheels are ready to go tubeless.", 'Theres a few things Jason Momoa is deeply committed to: wearing pink , his infamous hair scrunchie, oh, and raising awareness for plastic pollution .
Today, Momoas Braun beard trimmer (signed by the man himself) went up on eBay with all proceeds of the auction going directly to The Nature Conservancy , a global nonprofit environmental charity.
Yes, Momoas biggest fans now have a chance to use the same trimmer as Khal Drogo with their hard-earned dollars going to a worthy cause.
To show their commitment to sustainability and make the charitable donation even greater, Braun will be matching the sale of Momoas trimmer up to $10,000.
So whether you decide to use the trimmer on your own facial hair, or display it in your home to show off to guests, youll be making a major contribution worthy of a haka performance.']

title: ['Ebay sting catches health and safety manager selling fake car service history certificates - Cornwall Live', '1993 Twin-Supercharged V-12 Lister Jaguar for Sale on eBay Motors - Road & Track']
summary:
['Get the best and latest crime stories with our Court Insider newsletterA health and safety manager made nearly £10,000 selling hundreds of fake car service history certificates over eBay.
Paul Skidmore, 32, ran an online stationery business alongside his main job as a health and safety manager for a local clothing company.
A search of Skidmore’s home recovered records that showed he had sold more than 1,500 fake service histories and made more £9,000 in just ten months.
Councillor Rob Nolan, Cornwall Council’s Cabinet member for public protection, said: "Ordinarily, Cornwall Council would condemn the sale of counterfeit goods as a threat to genuine businesses and the people they employ.
"However, in this case the fake service histories could only have been used to facilitate car sales, either to increase the price of the car because of an apparent service history, or to mask high mileages travelled or poor servicing and maintenance.', "If you're looking for a '90s sedan that can spank supercars, we're confident you'll like this Jaguar.
It's a Lister-modified XJ12 with a twin-supercharged V-12 making a claimed 604 horsepower, a manual transmission, and lots of other upgrades.
Welcome to You Must Buy, our daily look at the cars you really should be buying instead of that boring commuter sedan.
According to the seller, this car was purchased in 1993 and sent directly to Lister for a host of mechanical and cosmetic upgrades.
Backing up the increased power are Brembo brakes, a Lister suspension system, 18-inch Lister five-spoke wheels, and a Lister-designed body kit."]

title: ['eBay Find |1981 Volvo 242 GLT Turbo - Autoblog', 'Turbocharged V-8-Swapped Jaguar E-Type for Sale on eBay Motors - Road & Track', 'TEDxPortland Celebrates 10th Anniversary By Auctioning 20 Pairs Of The Nike Air Trainer 1 - Sneaker News', 'Man who sold counterfeit airbag covers on eBay gets federal prison term - OregonLive', 'Hottest Vladimir Guerrero Jr. Rookie Cards on eBay - Sports Collectors Daily']
summary:
['You must have JavaScript enabled to experience the new Autoblog.
Please follow the instructions below to enable JavaScript in your browser.', "The Jaguar E-Type is is a full-on collector's car.
It's a later Series III model that's had its V-12 swapped out for a turbocharged Ford V-8 engine.
And it's for sale right now on eBay Motors.
Save for a one-piece roll bar, this E-Type still looks totally stock from a distance.
The car is currently up for bidding on eBay Motors in St. Louis, Missouri with a high bid of $18,200, five days remaining, and reserve not met.", 'As they head into their tenth year, TEDxPortland is celebrating their first decade by raffling off 20 pairs of their ultra-exclusive Nike Air Trainer 1s.
The Oregon-based series of events is certainly no stranger to Nike collaborations, as they’ve worked with the Swoosh Brand ever since their second year, creating special shoes ranging from the Air Jordan 1 to the Air Max 1.
However, this is truly unique milestone, as it’s the first time that any sneakers they created have been put up for sale.
20 pairs of the TEDxPortland Air Trainer 1 are available via eBay auction, and all proceeds will go straight to the organization’s 2020 scholarship fund, covering the cost of student tickets to next year’s event.
With only 200 pairs of the Trainer 1 ever having been made and the money going to a more than worthy cause, the bids are sure to pile in, so head over to eBay now to try your hand at securing a pair.', 'A California man who sold hundreds of counterfeit airbag covers online was sentenced Friday to six months in federal prison.
General Motors, for example, determined that the covers Ryzhenkov sold lacked a proper tear seam, meaning that airbags within them might not deploy.
Ryzhenkov sold counterfeit covers using at least five eBay seller names between 2015 and 2017, according to the government.
He received at least 20 shipments from China between Feb. 4, 2016, and April 20, 2017, and each contained roughly 100 to 120 airbag covers, according to investigators.
When federal agents raided his home and business with a search warrant, they recovered 735 counterfeit covers, according to Harrington.', '']

title: ['eBay Says It Will Continue To Ban People From Selling CBD Products - Marijuana Moment', '1970 De Tomaso Mangusta Vintage Exotic for Sale on eBay Motors - Road & Track', 'Giambattista Valli x H&M Is Not Doing Well on the eBay Resale Market - Daily Front Row']
summary:
['The massive online shopping site eBay says CBD products will continue to be banned globally on its platform, even as other companies like the payment processor Square are working to make it simpler to market hemp-derived goods.
A quick search of eBay does turn up several listings for CBD products, including oils, gummies and lotions.
However, FDA is holding a public meeting on Friday to further discuss alternative regulatory pathways that may eventually allow people to sell hemp-derived CBD products.
But until then, large companies are testing the waters, with companies like CVS Pharmacy saying they will begin selling CBD products in spite of existing federal restrictions.
It doesn’t appear that eBay competitor Amazon has commented on their policy on selling CBD products, but again, a search of the site reveals thousands of hits for a wide range of hemp-based items.', "It's in good running condition, and looks stunning.
The Mangusta was the predecessor to De Tomaso's more popular Pantera.
Like the Pantera, it uses a mid-mounted Ford V-8 engine, sending power to the rear via a five-speed transaxle.
According to the sellers, this Mangusta is in good running condition, though from the pictures, things are a little rough around the edges.
The car is currently listed on eBay in Los Angeles, California with a price of $225,000 or best offer.", 'The frenzy that used to accompany the release of a new H&M designer collaboration has waned significantly in recent years.
The last truly blockbuster collection was Balmain x H&M almost four years ago.
Take H&M’s most recent collaboration with Giambattista Valli, for example.
Balmain x H&M was sexy and fun.
And if not, well, it’s unlikely anyone will be crying over a bunch of eBay resellers struggling in their attempts to gouge fashion fans out of thousands of dollars by jacking up the prices on yet another high-low collab.']

title: ['2018 Aston Martin Vanquish Zagato for Sale on eBay Motors - Road & Track', "eBay Removes Smoke Alarm Listings After 'Extremely Concerning ... - House Beautiful", "Mod Sun Threatens to Sell Ex Bella Thorne's Stuff on eBay (Exclusive) - TooFab"]
summary:
['The same can be said of "Caribbean Pearl," a type of sky blue, and the Aston Martin Vanquish Zagato.
The Zagato was built as a sendoff for the current Vanquish, which is making way for a new mid-engine car that debuted in March at the Geneva Motor Show.
Like the normal Vanquish, the Zagato sports a 6.0-liter naturally aspirated V-12 engine making 580 horsepower.
Thrust gets to the rear wheels via an eight-speed automatic transaxle mounted in the rear.
The stunning Caribbean Pearl paint is matched with a machined aluminum grille, blacked-out window surrounds, two-tone multi-spoke wheels, and red brake calipers.', "eBay has removed the listings for smoke alarms that failed to detect smoke after a series of tests were conducted by consumer watchdog Which?.
A new warning has been issued over the safety of cheap smoke alarms bought online after devices purchased from eBay and Wish failed every mock test, according to Which?.
Always buy a smoke alarm with a recognised brand and retailer – follow the manufacturer’s guidance on the installation, location and maintenance of the alarm.
It's recommended that you write on the smoke alarm the day that it was installed, and the date that it, or the battery, should be replaced.
You should always replace your smoke alarm after 10 years.", 'TooFab / GettyHe also insisted he would not get back together with her.
That was Mod Sun's message to ex Bella Thorne when he spoke exclusively to TooFab about the break-up on Tuesday night.
"It's at the storage unit, the Mod Sun storage unit...
I figured if she doesn't get it soon I'm gonna have a really, really poppin e-Bay site," he (hopefully) joked to us in LA.
"The best thing I heard recently was if I keep saying 'poor me, poor me', I'm going to 'pour me' another drink.']

title: ['eBay Adds Tire Installation Services from CarAdvise - EcommerceBytes', 'Top-rated eBay seller brings the iPhone X down to insanely low ... - PhoneArena', 'eBay Find | 1994 Ford F-150 SVT Lightning with just 28,000 miles - Autoblog']
summary:
['eBay added CarAdvise to its Tire Installation Program, a deal that adds 3,500 tire shops to eBay’s network.
eBay first introduced tire installation services in 2017 in the US and Germany.
eBay announcement follows:Today, eBay announced a partnership with CarAdvise, a leading vehicle repair and maintenance technology platform, to expand the marketplace’s Tire Installation Program (eBay.com/TireInstallation).
The new partnership with CarAdvise initially adds 3,500 tire shops to eBay’s tire installer network including top national chains like Firestone, Tires Plus, National Tire and Battery, and Tire Kingdom.
eBay’s Tire Installation ProgrameBay first introduced Tire Installation Services in the Summer of 2017 in Germany and the United States.', 'The highly trusted seller currently has the iPhone X on special offer in both 64 and 256GB storage configurations, fetching as little as $611.99.
Available color options include silver and space gray, which are the same paint jobs you can get a heavily discounted 256GB iPhone X variant in.
The difference is the "manufacturer refurbished" 256 gig units come in "very good" condition, which is apparently a slightly poorer rating than the "excellent" condition of the 64GB devices on sale today.
Nonetheless, a 256GB factory GSM unlocked iPhone X at $625.99 seems like an incredible bargain, what with its modern design, water-resistant build, stunning 5.8-inch OLED screen, powerful Apple A11 Bionic processor, excellent battery life, and versatile dual rear camera setup.
In case you're wondering, the same configuration of the same device costs a whopping $899 in refurbished condition over at Apple, while Best Buy typically charges $1,049 for a brand-new unlocked 256 gig unit.', "We love cool, old trucks here at Autoblog, and this one fits the bill.
Ford made a couple generations of the SVT Lightning pickup truck , and this one happens to be the first.
We tend to hear more about the second-gen Lightning truck due to it being newer, but this one paved the way The specific truck we're looking at here is a 1994 F-150 SVT Lightning , and it's billed as being a one-owner truck with only 28,430 miles on the clock.
With miles that low, this old performance pickup was rarely driven.
A lot of new F-150s could outrun it today, but that was a fast pickup truck in the 1990s — Ford produced the Lightning in the 1993-1995 model years."]

title: ["eBay wouldn't let me close my account as it had given me credit - The Guardian", 'Drake Jokes He’s Selling Steph Curry’s Hair Lint on eBay - Just Jared', 'Drake offers to sell Steph Curry’s hair lint on eBay - SF Chronicle Datebook', 'Wrecked rare "1966 Shelby GT350" on eBay is a diamond in rough shape - Fox News', "Drake sparks hundreds of fake eBay listings for Steph Curry's hair lint - Engadget", 'Crashed 1966 Ford Mustang Shelby GT350 Fastback Tribute Car ... - The Drive']
summary:
['I asked eBay to close my account.
It said I need to clear my balance and then wait 30 days with no account activity before this could be done.
At the end of 30 days, a mysterious £0.01 appeared as a credit in my balance, preventing me from closing my account.
I was then told to wait another 30 days.
After 30 days another mysterious 1p appeared.', 'The 32-year-old rapper was at the game to cheer on his home team, the Toronto Raptors.
The team defeated the Golden State Warriors, 118-109.
During the game, Drake wore a jersey for former player Dell Curry, who played on the Raptors from 1999 until he retired in 2002.
If you didn’t know, Dell is Golden State Warriors player Steph Curry‘s dad and they share the number 30!
The rapper pulled a piece of lint out of the athlete’s hair… and then joked he’s going to sell it on eBay.', 'The way Drake carried on from the sidelines of Game 1 of the 2019 NBA Finals on Thursday, May 30, you would think he was actually playing.
The Canadian hip-hop mogul wore an autographed throwback Dell Curry jersey to troll Stephen Curry (the Golden State Warriors star’s father played for the Toronto Raptors from 1999 to 2002).
Drake’s eBay username was created and deactivated shortly after the drama of the game died down — but not before the lint reached a going price of $85,100 in less than five minutes.
DRAKE IS REALLY SELLING HAIR LINT WITH THE USERNAME DRAYMONDSHOULDNTWEAR23 pic.twitter.com/aida5tRk2n — ً (@NYYDJ2) May 31, 2019.
pic.twitter.com/oGUM2oLiK7 — gifdsports (@gifdsports) May 31, 2019It’s so amazing that Drake had to wear a nike sweat band on his arm because he wanted to cover up his Steph Curry and Kevin Durant tattoo’s.', 'This Mustang is no junkyard dog, but someone is going to have to throw it a bone to get its tail wagging again.
A rare 1966 Shelby GT350 has hit eBay after being hit pretty badly in an accident.
The white fastback featured on BarnFinds.com is being offered with a salvage title, and it’s easy to see why.
Commenters on BarnFinds.com speculate that the owner may have had it signed by Carrol Shelby – as many Shelby owners do with their cars – and kept it for a souvenir.
Fewer than 1,400 GT350 fastbacks were built in 1966 and the Hagerty Price Guide says that their values run from about $125,000 to $250,000, depending on the condition.', 'As that was happening, Drake seemingly took a moment to pull lint out of Curry's hair.
He then took to Instagram to post a video and picture with a caption that said, "Steph Curry hair lint for sale on my eBay right now!!!
And even though Steph Curry's hair lint doesn't appear to actually be up for sale -- the username "DraymondShouldntWear23" is "no longer registered," according to eBay -- Engadget discovered hundreds of fake listings on the site.
What's more bizarre about this whole situation is that some of these fake listings are described as "Benefits charity," even though the sellers clearly have no access to Curry's hair lint.
That's clearly not that's happening when people search for "Steph Curry hair lint" on eBay, which brings up more than 200 results -- and it's not as if Drake took 200 pieces of lint out of Curry's hair.', "It features a 1966 Ford Mustang Fastback which, unfortunately, is in a rather sad state after a collision extensively damaged both the front- and rear-end of the vehicle.
At first glance, the for-sale 1966 Ford Mustang appears to be a true Shelby GT350, which would’ve likely saddened many a Mustang or Shelby fan.
From the Shelby GT350 alloys, the engine’s air filter housing, the interior exterior color theme, even down to the Shelby side-sill kick plates and the Shelby placards, which all look factory.
Despite its unofficial status, the eBay ad as of this writing has accumulated over 70 bids, topping out at $50,000.
What isn't clear is if this tribute car has the full-fledged Shelby-modified 289 cu in V8 or if it’s the standard “HiPo” version from the Mustang Fastback of that year."]

title: ["Drake's Steph Curry hair lint joke spawns wave of fake eBay listings - Yahoo Canada Sports", "GLIDE's 20th annual eBay for Charity Power Lunch with Warren ... - PR Newswire"]
summary:
['Draymond Green and Steph Curry’s courtside conversations with Drake made up nearly all of the trash talk expended by the Warriors in the game, and to the victor went the spoils of a gloating Instagram post.
Drake’s troll offering to sell a tuft of lint that he collected from the head of Curry during the game has, predictably, spawned a nation of fake listings on eBay.
Choose wisely: There are many fake Steph Curry hair lint listings to pick from.
None of the listings are real, and there’s no way Drake will ever put a tuft of lint from Curry’s hair up for auction.
More NBA Finals coverage from Yahoo Sports', 'SAN JOSE, Calif., June 1, 2019 /PRNewswire/ -- Today, GLIDE's annual eBay for Charity Auction for a Power Lunch with Warren Buffett, sold to the highest bidder for a $4,567,888.
Bidding for this year's eBay charity auction opened at 7:30 pm PDT on Sunday, May 26, and closed at 7:30 p.m. PDT on Friday, May 31.
GLIDE’s 20th annual eBay for Charity Auction for a Power Lunch with Warren Buffett, sold to the highest bidder for a record-breaking $4,567,888.
"Getting eBay involved changed the experience from a very local lunch to a worldwide lunch," said Warren Buffett recently.
The funds raised through the Power of One Lunch auction go directly to support GLIDE's programs and services.']

title: ['Insane eBay deal for an unlocked Samsung Galaxy S10+ variant will ... - PhoneArena', 'Guy Upgrades Lasers Bought From eBay To Make Them Lethal - Wonderful Engineering', 'Amazon Wants to Be More Like eBay, Less Like Walmart - The Motley Fool']
summary:
["The Samsung Galaxy S10+ is Samsung's top-of-the-line 4G LTE handset, at least until the Galaxy Note 10 is released.
The unlocked non-U.S. variant of the Galaxy S10+ is being offered for $679.99.
Buying the Galaxy S10+ at the sale price will save you 31%.
Everything that is supposed to be in the box along with the Galaxy S10+ will be in the box, although it does come with an international charger.
For those who like to know before they order on eBay, the seller has a 98.8% positive feedback rating.", 'But it appears that a lot of sellers on the eBay are not really worried about the federal law.
The YouTube user Styropyro, an electronics guru, purchased a few laser kits to figure out what is going on.
As it turns out, the lasers are quite dangerous, and some of them can even be lethal.
The lasers were actually strong enough to cause permanent damage to the vision, and would you believe that these kits were advertised as cat toys?
We strongly suggest that you remain careful and vigilant when you are purchasing lasers online.', 'In his letter to shareholders this year, Jeff Bezos said that "third-party sellers are kicking our first-party butt."
Instead, Amazon will encourage them to use its third-party selling services.
It's Amazon's latest effort to become more like eBay (EBAY 2.82%) and less like Walmart (WMT 0.86%).
For vendors used to selling their products wholesale, Amazon offers the easiest way to transition to direct customer sales thanks to its Fulfillment by Amazon service.
It's just the most recent way Amazon is becoming less of a retailer like Walmart and more of a marketplace like eBay.']

eBay stated in its announcement:"Until recently, shipping options outlined for the buyer did not always promote the best value.
eBay will now only show the most cost effective shipping services for a given delivery speed, hiding higher priced options."
