title: ['WSOP Bracelet of ‘Captain’ Tom Franklin on eBay for $50,000 - PokerTube', "You can buy this rare 'Lower Slower' Starbucks mug on eBay for $499 - The News Journal", "'Spotlight' eBay deal brings Samsung Galaxy S10 price down to only ... - PhoneArena", 'Up To 30% Off Authenticity Verified Rolex Watches On eBay Right ... - aBlogtoWatch', 'eBay Says Sellers Can Offer Free Shipping without a Big Risk - EcommerceBytes']
summary:
["07:5504 JunWhile poker players the world over are currently bracelet hunting at the 50th annual WSOP, old-time poker pro ‘Captain’ Tommy Franklin wants to part with his only WSOP bling, listing the item on eBay for the asking price of $50,000.
Franklin's gold bracelet was captured in 1999 in $2,500 Limit Omaha that resulted in a $104,000 payday.
The 68-year-old poker pro has been cashing in live poker tournaments for decades, his lifetime payouts totaling in excess of $3.2 million.
Franklin's exploits both on and off the poker tables have been well-chronicled over the years, including his best-ever cash of $434,025 for winning the $5,000 buy-in Fourth Annual Five Diamond World Poker Classic in 2005.
There are currently no bids listed for his 1999 WSOP gold bracelet, with 15 people keeping an eye on the action - or lack of it.", 'Released in early 2018, according to the blog starbucks-mugs.com, it flubbed the nickname for downstate Delaware, "Slower Lower."
The mug instead said "Lower Slower," a misnomer sure to make any native Delawarean heave a heavy sigh and roll their eyes.
Only a few months after releasing the mug, Starbucks rolled out a new one which replaced "Lower Slower" with a picture of a crab.
Of course, the "lower slower" mug is not nearly so valuable, though relatively rare.
There is no trademark on "slower lower," though "Slower Lower Life" was registered by someone in Dagsboro in 2019, according to the US.', 'Obviously, this will allow you to easily maximize your savings... as long as you don't have a problem making a few compromises.
For one thing, the factory unlocked SM-G973 units sold on eBay by Sobeonline1 come without any sort of a valid US warranty.
Last but not least, it's worth pointing out that the "international" Galaxy S10 model packs an Exynos 9820 processor that's slightly slower than the Snapdragon 855 SoC inside the US-specific variant, according to a number of in-depth tests.
At the end of the day, though, it's still pretty much impossible to argue with the value proposition of a $569.99 Samsung Galaxy S10.
On the bright side, the Galaxy S10 on sale in eBay's "spotlight" today supports dual SIM connectivity, which can be an extremely convenient feature, particularly for traveling purposes.', 'From now until June 17, 2019, the popular online marketplace promises up to 30% off of a large selection of Rolex watches.
Most of these specially selected Rolex watches are sold by trusted sellers on the platform who are also “Authenticity Verified” by eBay (meaning that eBay certifies the items you purchase are authentic).
Advertising MessageOver 4,000 Rolex watches of all model types are part of this special eBay sales promotion.
Advertising MessageBelow are some notable products highlights from the “Time for a Rolley on Your Wrist” eBay promotion.
Finally, to finish highlighting just some of the Rolex watches in this current eBay watch sales promotion, the 114300 Rolex Oyster Perpetual is positioned as Rolex’s entry-level men’s watch.', 'eBay issued an announcement urging sellers to offer free shipping, telling them it’s “almost a must-have,” and telling them they can implement it “without taking a big risk.”While the model works for many sellers, many others say its impractical or too costly for the types of goods they sell.
eBay acknowledged that “every seller’s situation is different,” but said the long-term payoffs are worth it.
One suggestion it made for the faint of heart: “set a threshold and only offer free shipping on orders over a certain dollar amount.”eBay cited four studies to make the case for offering free shipping.
You can read the announcement on the eBay announcement board.
In a separate announcement yesterday, eBay said it would begin limiting shipping options offered by sellers on listing pages and checkout – learn more and leave a comment on the EcommerceBytes Blog.']

title: ['How to Start an eBay Drop Off Store - Small Business Trends', "Amazon delivers items bought on Ebay or Etsy, piques FTC's interest - Business Insider"]
summary:
['eBay drop off stores are businesses that sell items on a consignment basis for those who don’t want to set up their own eBay stores.
How to Start an eBay Drop Off StoreIf you’re interested in starting an eBay consignment store or drop-off site, here are some of the most essential steps you need to keep in mind.
Set Up Your LocationUnlike other types of ecommerce businesses, an eBay drop off store requires a physical location.
But you should also do some initial research to determine what types of items you’ll take and at what price points.
Open Your Online ShopOnce you have some items to stock, you’ll need to open your eBay store.', 'Fulfilment by Amazon, which offers its third-party sellers the chance to have items sold on Amazon's site stored, packaged, and shipped to customers for a fee.
Amazon offers the same service when a seller is selling these items on other marketplaces such as eBay or Etsy.
Amazon operates a logistics service called Fulfillment by Amazon, or FBA.
For a fee, Amazon will store, package, and ship any items bought on its site out to Amazon customers.
"If the item is available for less on Amazon, that can be a problem for eBay sellers," the writer said in the blog post.']

title: ['Is a Glitch Preventing eBay Buyers from Requesting Invoices? - EcommerceBytes', 'Would a $3 eBay Coupon Get First-Time Buyers to Bite? - EcommerceBytes', '1963 Sunbeam Alpine British Convertible for Sale on eBay Motors - Road & Track']
summary:
['Dear Ina,For the second time in a week I have encountered the eBay issue (surprise, surprise) and got to wondering how widespread this is among sellers - especially given that my sales are down over 80% this month (from a norm of $5K-7K).
Anyway, the issue is this: When I have items on sale, buyers are unable to request an invoice (something I push in my listings) and they get an eBay message saying that they can't request an invoice since the items are on sale.
I've checked, and all my items are correctly listed to allow invoice requests.
And given that only a small percentage of customers actually "complain", I have to wonder how many OTHER sales I am missing because of this "glitch".
This is not the first time I've heard of customers running into this issue, but with the sales drop and two messages about it within a week I have to wonder...', 'eBay ran a promotion for first-time buyers (expiring at midnight, June 17 Pacific time).
eBay $3 coupon promotion follows:Who’s eligible for the Coupon?
Coupon must be used within a single transaction (and can include multiple eligible items), while supplies last.
Coupon is funded by eBay; Coupon is subject to U.S laws, void where prohibited, not redeemable for cash, has no face value, and cannot be combined with any other Coupon, or when paying with PayPal Credit Easy Payments or Gift Cards.
SOURCE: eBay Coupon Landing Page', 'Summer is here, which means you need a convertible in your life.

title: ['First World War Scapa Flow battleships put up for sale...on eBay - The Scotsman', 'eBay Plus Weekend: Everything You Need To Know - Pedestrian.TV', 'Global eBay Review Pits Incumbents WPP Against Publicis - Adweek', 'Four WWI shipwrecks are being sold on eBay for $1M - Fox News', "Royal Mail admits trying to re-sell customer's 'banned' item on eBay for £50 - The Mirror", 'Body glitter sold on eBay recalled over fears it contains dangerous chemicals that can inflame your lungs... - The Sun', 'Your old Disney VHS sets could be worth $26k on eBay - Yahoo Finance Australia', 'Your Old Disney VHS Tapes Could Be Worth Nearly £14,000 On eBay - LADbible']
summary:
['The wrecks of four First World War ships that have been lying on the seabed in Orkney for a century have been put up for sale on eBay.
Three First World War German warships and a cruiser that have been lying on the seabed in Scapa Flow for a century have been put up for sale on eBay.
The vessels are part of the German High Seas Fleet, which was famously scuttled at Scapa Flow while interned there as the Treaty of Versailles was being finalised.
Advertisement Hide AdAdvertisement Hide AdIntervening British guard boats were able to beach a number of the ships, but 52 of the 74 interned vessels sank.
Advertisement Hide AdAdvertisement Hide AdThe Royal Navy battleship HMS Royal Oak – sunk in 1939 with 883 crew aboard – also lies in Scapa Flow and has been designated a war grave.', 'PEDESTRIAN.TV has teamed up with eBay Plus to help you grab some goodies.
Every so often, I make a resolution that I will only buy things when they are on sale.
It means that I am absolutely ready for a big ol’ sale to get my shopping fix.
i’m readySo it’s pretty great timing that eBay is holding ‘Plus Weekend’, a massive two days of sales that frankly I am more than ready to get stuck into.
see ya, suckersIt’s exclusive to eBay Plus members, so if you’re not on the train just yet, there’s still time to join up before everything goes live on Saturday.', 'American ecommerce company eBay has launched a review of its global media planning and buying responsibilities in an attempt to streamline that business, a spokesperson confirmed today.
Its goal is to choose a single agency to handle this work around the world.
“With eBay’s new markets organization, regional teams are working together more closely than ever,” a representative said.
“Consolidating our roster of agency partners will allow us to streamline our marketing approach around the world, helping eBay clearly communicate our value proposition for consumers.', 'And you thought your baseball cards were worth putting on eBay.
The current owner, 70-year-old Thomas Clark, bought the shipwrecks in 1981 for an undisclosed sum and has decided he's had enough.
"I look forward to passing them on to the new owner and hope they get the opportunity to realize their aspirations for the vessels."
According to the eBay ads, if someone bought all four shipwrecks, they could "have a sizeable naval fleet amongst the largest in the world."
It, and the other wrecks have become popular for recreational divers, but they are not allowed to touch or go with a meter of the wrecks.', 'Peter Barker tried to sell a TinyPi Pro device on eBay but it was stopped by Royal Mail as it contained a lithium batteryRoyal Mail admits trying to re-sell customer's 'banned' item on eBay for £50Royal Mail has admitted to initially confiscating a customer's eBay item which was 'bound for destruction' before trying to resell it for nearly £50.
He noticed the item was up for sale on eBay until June 10 for £49 despite being told by Royal Mail it had been destroyed.
Image: Deadline News) Deadline News) Image: Deadline News) Deadline News)Peter said: "I was of course shocked.
A Royal Mail spokeswoman explained why the product was confiscated and admitted that selling items on does happen.
Staffordshire Police said they could only comment if Royal Mail confirm a crime had taken place.', 'BODY glitter sold on eBay is being urgently recalled because it contains dangerous chemicals that can irritate your lungs.
Pots of silver "all over glitter" sold under a brand called Saffron were found to be made with a chemical called antimony.
1 Body glitter sold on eBay is being recalled over fears it contains a dangerous chemicalEuropean guidelines state that cosmetic products shouldn't contain any more than 0.5mg/kg of the chemical.
Your product recall rights PRODUCT recalls are an important means of protecting consumers from dangerous goods.
Both make-up products have been imported from China and come in a black plastic container with a clear cap.', 'Images: Disney, eBayNo one likes losing money, but if you threw out your old Disney VHS you could have thrown out $25,746 without realising.
Disney VHS’ are popping up on eBay, with some asking for extraordinary prices.
“Overall a great set.”Another vendor is selling The Little Mermaid on VHS with a framed poster for $14,549.38.
“Extremely rare Little Mermaid VHS 1990, banned art work, showing a ‘Little mermans’’ you know what,” the description reads.
Both of these sets were Black Diamond tapes which were sold between 1984 and 1993.', "Because old classics like The Little Mermaid and Aladdin are being flogged on eBay for upwards of £14,000 ($17,500).
Advert 10One seller is flogging 10 'Rare Black Diamond Disney' films which include some of our childhood favourites like Cinderella, Bambi, Aladdin and 101 Dalmatians.
This The Little Mermaid tape could set you back nearly £8,000.
This can be found in the upper spine of the case, which will also have a black diamond (funnily enough) around the outside.
Credit: eBayAnother collection is being sold without the 'Black Diamond' bragging rights and that's going for a cool £4,576.32 ($5,743.51)."]

Other framed shirts that are available are ones from the 2013/14 season which comes with the signature of Aston Villa star Jack Grealish who spent time on loan at the club.', 'Image: MEN Media) MEN Media) Image: MEN Media) MEN Media)One airport worker said: "Loads of the girls are doing it.

Image: MEN Media) MEN Media) Image: MEN Media) MEN Media)A spokesman for Manchester Airport said that as cabin crews are employed by airlines it would not be relevant for them to comment.', 'But word around town is that VHS tape versions of Disney classics like The Little Mermaid, The Fox and The Hound and Beauty and the Beast are being sold for over $17,500.
From the UK to Australia, these rare limited edition collectables cost more than what any of the evil queens are probably worth.

The Balance Small Business Blog pointed out back in 2018 that a product’s asking price on eBay is kinda different from its actual selling price.', "Want to live out your '70s Lancia rally fantasies this summer?
It's not the Lancia 037 of your dreams, but it still has the same mid-engine, rear-wheel drive architecture, and certainly looks the part.

title: ['Disney VHS tapes being offered on eBay for up to £15,000 - Cornwall Live', 'Scapa Flow: WW1 Battleship Wrecks up For Sale on eBay - War History Online', "eBay treasure: A Supermercati Brianzoli–Chateau d'Ax vintage jacket - Cyclist"]
summary:
["Sign up for our Daily Newsletter for the latest local news straight to your inboxIt's time to get into the loft and dig out your old Disney VHS tapes as some believe they could be worth close to £15,000.
It is just one of a number of lots currently listed on eBay with rare Disney moves being offered for several thousand pounds.
The Disney Black Diamond collection refers to the original Walt Disney Classics series of Disney VHS tapes that were released between 1984-1994.
It seems like it could be a good money-spinner, but would anyone really pay that extortionate amount for old VHS tapes?
The 10 most valuable VHS tapes:", 'Scapa Flow – SMS Markgraf was the third battleship of the four-ship König class.
Markgraf’s 8.8 cm guns were removed and replaced with four 8.8 cm anti-aircraft guns.
Unlike most of the scuttled ships, Markgraf was never raised for scrapping; the wreck is still sitting on the seabed.
Mr Clark has now retired and Markgraf is being offered for sale complete with her contents, is being offered for sale.
The sale will be according to the Conditions of Sale (Wrecks) (See Photo)The sale will require the consent of the Ministry of Defence.', 'Outside one of those quirky cafes, sipping down a warm soya milk, caffeine-free coconut latte were a man and a woman.
The man was sitting, legs crossed, nonchalantly taking drags from his menthol cigarette probably talking Neitzche.
I’d bet a pound note on that menthol-smoking hipster not having a clue at the history he wore on his shoulders.
So why wouldn’t you buy this vintage Chateau d’Ax-Supermercardo Brianzoli cycling jacket from eBay for £140?
The item description states a 44-inch chest – just right for that oversized look – and even promises 1st class postage.']

title: ['Creepy way hosties earn extra money - news.com.au', 'Four German battleships scuttled 100 years ago for sale on eBay - Military Times', 'eBay Bikes: Specialized Special - Venge, Tarmac, Roubaix, Diverge ... - Road.cc', 'eBay Plus Weekend sale offers huge discounts on some of the biggest tech brands - Tech Guide', 'Is Google Sign-In Causing Havoc for eBay Mobile Users? - EcommerceBytes', 'EBay sends Buzz Lightyear into space (for real) in Toy Story 4 ... - CampaignLive', 'Facebook and eBay told to tackle trade in fake reviews - TechCrunch']
summary:
['', 'Well, you can, via a sale on eBayBut there’s a catch.
Four German battleships that were scuttled in Scapa Flow near the Orkney Islands of Scotland are for sale for a total asking price of more than $1 million, according to Scotland’s national newspaper, The Scotsman.
Diving contractor Thomas Clark, 70, first purchased the German High Seas Fleet vessels in 1981, but is ready for another to own them.
The vessels, along with 48 other German battleships, were scuttled by the Germans 100 years ago on Friday in 1919.
“We've been pleasantly surprised at the number of people who've been in touch, and the interest that we've had to date."', "Road race, endurance and gravel bikes.
Specialized's bump-taming road bike was designed for the cobbled races of the spring classics, but it's a really popular bike with UK riders too.
Buy Now at £2,799If you're going to be sticking to the tarmac and looking to go very fast then you'll be well served by the Venge.
This Venge makes a cracking race bike as it's easy to handle in a sprint and seriously quick.
This one comes with an S-Works carbon seatpost, Ultegra 6800 groupset and Mavic Open Pro wheels.", 'eBay Plus Weekend sale offers huge discounts on some of the biggest tech brandseBay Australia has kicked off its 48-hour shopping event Plus Weekend which is available exclusively to eBay Plus members and offer some impressive savings on some of the biggest tech brands.
The Plus Weekend sale starts at 10am on Saturday, June 22 and will run until Monday, June 24.
An eBay Plus membership costs $49 per year but you can try it out with a free 30-day trial.
Apart from access to amazing sales, members can also enjoy other benefits including free delivery and free returns on eBay Plus items along with double Flybuys points.
eBay Australia’s Julie Nestor said: “We’re excited to bring back Plus Weekend and reward our community of eBay shoppers with deals that are out of this world.', 'eBay promised to investigate reports from some users who received notices that their accounts had been suspended after signing into eBay with Google.
“eBay automatically created a new account for me,” the user wrote – but they were not aware of that at the time.
Google asked me to sign in with my Password and I did without thinking.”It is possible that the eBay sign-in experience on mobile devices is more confusing to existing eBay users than the desktop sign-in page, shown below.
The eBay moderator who addressed the issue on the eBay boards wrote, “this has actually been on my radar this week.
Thank you!”The reader noted the Google Sign-In feature could also artificially inflate eBay active-user numbers.', 'EBay has partnered Disney to create an unusual listing on the site to mark the release of Toy Story 4.
It challenged YouTube personality Ladbaby to launch Buzz Lightyear, the space ranger character from the Pixar film series, into space.
The action figure is now being auctioned on the site, with the listing ending on 23 June.
"EBay for Charity is thrilled to support the release of Toy Story 4 and hope to raise as much money as possible for Together for Short Lives."
The video was created in-house by eBay and Ladbaby.', 'Facebook and eBay have been warned by the U.K.’s Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) to do more to tackle the sale of fake reviews on their platforms.
The regulator says it crawled content on eBay and Facebook between November 2018 and June 2019 — finding more than 100 eBay listings offering fake reviews for sale during that time.
Over the same period it also identified 26 Facebook groups where people offered to write fake reviews or where businesses recruited people to write fake and misleading reviews on popular shopping and review sites.
“Fake reviews mean that people might make the wrong choice and end up with a product or service that’s not right for them.
A search of U.K. Facebook groups returned multiple examples of closed groups where sellers appear to be soliciting reviews, either in exchange for goods and/or payment…Reached for a response to the CMA’s call for measures to be put in place to tackle the illegal trade in fake reviews, Facebook sent us the following statement — attributed to a spokesperson:Fraudulent activity is not allowed on Facebook, including the trading of fake reviews.']

title: ["The haunted dolls and 'evil spirits' being sold in Manchester on eBay - Manchester Evening News", 'Mum begs for help after being told ‘disaster’ £50 eBay wedding dress will cost £600 to fix... - The Sun']
summary:
['Dolls that can turn on taps, glass bottles that hold evil spirits, and cursed rings that make the wearer feel overcome with jealousy.
There are loads of items being sold on eBay that sellers claim are haunted.
Haunted dollMeet 'Baby Ally', the porcelain doll based being sold from a home in Manchester.
This lovely brown pottery jug is being sold under the antiques and collectibles section of Facebook Marketplace.
The matter-of-fact description states: "A brown pottery jug, could be haunted, I take no responsibility."', 'The Mumsnet user revealed that she has just found out her £50 second hand white gown from eBay will take £600 to have the major repairs done so it fits.
4 A woman has revealed how her £50 eBay wedding dress has become a disaster after she discovered it needed £600 of repairsIn a post titled 'To be freaking the freak out!?'
Fortunately, other Mumsnet users were reassuring.
4 Fellow Mumsnet users were reassuring about her dilemma Credit: Getty - ContributorA third agreed: "I'd first try a different seamstress and get a second opinion."
When the woman revealed in a secomd post that £200 was her budget, people recommended high street brands including ASOS, Monsoon, French Connection, and Needle and Thread.']

title: ['The weird things you can buy on eBay - from haunted dolls to evil spirits - The Mirror', 'Revising Listings May Be Key to Getting Visibility on eBay - EcommerceBytes']
summary:
["Other items including a bottle containing the 'spirit of a 19th century man who hates woman and the poor'The weird things you can buy on eBay - from haunted dolls to evil spiritsDolls that can turn on taps and haunted pottery are among the sinister items being sold on eBay.
The doll is 'an absolute delight, very innocent, kind and playful', the description on eBay says.
'Spirit of Evie' ringImage: Ebay) Ebay)On a small red pouch sits a ring emblazoned with the word 'sister'.
'Potentially haunted' pottery jugImage: Ebay) Ebay)Every respected retailer knows that labelling your products correctly is key to a responsible business.
You know the warnings - 'may contain traces of nuts', 'choke hazard'.....'potentially haunted pottery'.", "In my mind eBay has a technical issue with server banks and software causing this, but I am not as smart as those folks at eBay (wink).
All was well, it showed in our store and in eBay search.
It would find the item however if I used the eBay item number.
Expanding my search to eBay's search engine, the item could not be found there except by direct use of the item number.
Magically in a few minutes, the listing appeared again in our store, in our store search and on eBay's search."]

title: ['eBay Best Offers with a Side of Fees - EcommerceBytes', 'As eBay Dominates Resale Web Traffic for May, These Sites Are ... - WWD', 'Cheap Supercharged BMW Alpina B7 for Sale on eBay for $16,000 - Road & Track', 'Retro modified Marina for sale on eBay - Honest John']
summary:
['He added a specific recommendation: "Advise sellers when reviewing pending offers whether the sale will be subject to additional promoted listing fees."
For example, let's say a buyer sends a seller a Best Offer of $35 for an item listed at $40.
The seller might be willing to reduce his or her margin by $5 and agree to the Best Offer.
But if the buyer had clicked on the seller's ad before making the offer, the Promoted Listing fee would apply.
Here are the two possible scenarios for Best Offers using that example:Best Offer - No Promoted Listing ad rate fee applies:$40 item, seller agrees to $35 Best Offer, total reduction in selling price of $5.', 'Courtesy photoBased on the data, Ebay.com is May’s leading resale site in the U.S.
It received 95 percent of total traffic sent to the top 11 sites at 659.1 million visits.
As a peer-to-peer marketplace platform, Poshmark.com is the second runner-up, receiving 2.4 percent of the traffic at 16.4 million visits.
Courtesy ImageSearch engine optimization aside, e-mail marketing and social media are the next largest contributors of traffic to the top resale sites.
“Depop seems to be placing emphasis more so on SEO strategies, with a 9.3 percent increase in organic search year-over-year,” added Marks.', 'This Alpina B7 was sold new in 2007 with an MSRP north of $117,000.
Now, 12 years and 139,000 miles later, it can be yours for the price of a base Fiesta hatchback.
Listed for sale on eBay now, it comes with a bunch of recent maintenance and 500 horsepower of supercharged V-8 goodness.
Signature 21-inch, 20-spoke Alpina wheels and Alpina-specific lip spoiler, badges, and bumpers complete the aesthetic.
If you want supercar-rivaling performance for an economy car price, better act fast.', "Some cars need no explanation - but this isn't one of them.
This 1971 Morris Marina is currently for sale on internet auction site eBay.
According to the description, this 1800TC has been dry stored in a council garage for 35 where it’s remained untouched.
The seller says: ‘Saved from the scrapyard for someone to restore and get back out on the road to shows.’As well as the eye-catching registration plate FRE681K, it’s been given quite the period makeover.
Obviously, the paperwork is in the post and the winning bidder will need to trailer the car away."]

Wait… What? - Lifehacker Australia', "eBay pulls listings for blood splattered T-shirts after victims' families hit out - The Mirror", '8 Absurdly Expensive Flamin Hot Cheetos You Can Buy on eBay Right Now - PopCulture.com', "Smugglers run: Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge visitors are snatching ... - The Arizona Republic", 'Sneaker site StockX raises funds, hires eBay executive - Reuters', 'eBay comes for Amazon Prime Day 2019 with a concurrent “Crash Sale” - Polygon']
summary:
['She drives strategic partnerships and strategy as they relate to procuring inventory to be sold on the eBay ecommerce platform.
Q: Are all B2B sales done through the eBay Business & Industrial section of eBay, or also in other sections?
advertisementQ: How many B2B sellers currently sell on eBay and what measures are eBay taking to grow that number?
advertisementQ: How many B2B SKUs are currently listed on eBay and eBay Business and what new B2B categories have you most recently added?
advertisementQ: How is eBay marketing eBay Business, and what are some of the newest ways eBay is marketing it?', "A psychic medium who appeared on Channel 4 show The Circle was left shaken after purchasing a 'haunted' doll on eBay - and connecting with its ghost.
He told FEMAIL: 'At first I did not believe the doll was haunted and really thought this was going to be a money making scheme.
'I felt that anyone could say a doll is haunted to make more money selling it.
Now I believe the doll is haunted.
'It was very clear and came towards Sinead,' Ryan said.", 'The new VA female condom on eBay.
Direct-to-consumer online sales, shipping anywhere worldwide, begin June 26th for the new VA® worn-of-women brand female condom.
The VA breaks ground for female condom marketing with photographs displaying the new pink VA in demonstration models at vawow.com.
“The VA is the first female condom that is very feminine in design and elegant in appearance.
The VA is made for IXu in India by HLL Lifecare Ltd., the largest combined manufacturer of male and female condoms in the world.', 'Ebay Is Having A Sale On Furry Masks.
For a limited time, you can score 34% off furry masks with moving mouths on eBay!
Currently, you can score 34% off furry masks at Global Gear’s eBay store.
The store also has a range of movie memorabilia for sale, including replica swords from The Hobbit and Transformers.
(Personally, we think the furry masks are more socially acceptable.)', 'The white tops made to look like the wearer had been shot or stabbed were on sale for just £2eBay pulls listings for blood splattered T-shirts after victims' families hit outSick blood-splattered T-shirts have been pulled from online seller eBay after families of victims lost in Britain's knife crime epidemic hit out.
But it has now banned the items after being alerted to the pain the T-shirts were causing to the families of knife crime victims.
Peguy Kato, 42, who lost her 17-year-old son Champion Ganda to knife crime slammed the T-shirts.
Image: PA) PA)"This shows no respect for the families of knife crime victims who love their sons."
"To see blood on the t-shirt and to see families saying I'm fine, it normalises and glorifies stabbing.', 'Naturally, crunchy Cheetos and Flamin' Hot Cheetos make for a worthy medium for these kinds of fares.
Flaming Torch (Photo: eBay) A Virginia merchant has started the bidding at almost $200 on a Flamin' Hot Cheeto with two possible interpretations.
Standing on its edge, the snack resembles a flaming torch, while on its side, it looks more like "a dragon."
prevnextLion King (Photo: eBay) On eBay seller is asking $100 for a Cheeto that they claim resembles Mufasa and/or Simba from Disney's The Lion King -- the original animated version.
prevnextPope Hat (Photo: eBay) One seller is striking out for their first attempt on eBay with a Cheeto that they say resembles Pope Francis himself.', "With the recent opening of Disneyland's Star Wars: Galaxy’s Edge, guests by the thousands have descended to mingle with the rogues and scoundrels laying low in this remote planetary outpost.
Galaxy's Edge versions of these hybrid utensils were selling on eBay for $30-$76.
Many people are selling Galaxy’s Edge maps and pamphlets that were handed out free to guests.
There also are dozens of Galaxy’s Edge souvenirs and collectibles offered far above the retail price.
But such practices are hardly limited to the Black Spire Outpost, as anyone who’s ever bid for a limited-edition anything well knows.", 'BERLIN (Reuters) - StockX, an online market place which specializes in reselling limited-edition sneakers, has raised $110 million from investors to fund its expansion and poached Scott Cutler from eBay as its new chief executive, it said on Wednesday.
Prior to his role as senior vice president, Americas at eBay, Cutler was president of ticket marketplace StubHub, and an executive vice president at the New York Stock Exchange, where he led tech listings including LinkedIn, Twitter and Alibaba.
He takes over from StockX co-founder Josh Luber, who will continue to be part of the firm’s leadership team.
“All we did was copy how the stock market works and apply it to new commodities,” Luber told Reuters during a visit to Berlin last week.
Sneakers currently account for about three-quarters of sales on the StockX site, with streetwear making up 20 percent.', 'Following Amazon’s announcement that its annual Prime Day sale will take place on July 15 and 16, eBay was ready with its own big summer sale announcement.
Dubbed the Crash Sale, eBay plans to “crash the [Prime Day] party” on the 15th with deals of its own.
Other retailers have tried to grab a slice of the Prime Day pie in the past few years, but none have been as aggressive as eBay.
Last year the online retailer offered “Primo Deals,” a blatant Prime Day nod, but didn’t go so far as to mention Amazon by name.
If you do shop eBay’s Crash Sale (last year the retailer did have better deals than Amazon on video game consoles), make sure that whatever you’re buying shows eBay’s Best Price Guarantee icon.']

title: ['Your Old Furbies Could Be Worth Up to $5,000 on EBay - House Beautiful', "The Latest Landing Spot For Racing's Most Cherished Trophy: eBay - Thoroughbred Daily News", 'The man who left his call centre job and is now an eBay business ... - The Northern Echo', 'Ultra-Rare 1979 International Scout Midnitestar for Sale on eBay - Road & Track', 'Why eBay Mobile-Friendly Checker No Longer Works - EcommerceBytes', '5 types of eBay scams - Komando', 'Inside the world of flipping Star Wars land merchandise on eBay - Polygon']
summary:
["From Precious Moments figurines to retro Cabbage Patch dolls, relics of our past are going for hundreds—even thousands—on resale sites like eBay.
Everyone's favorite (or most terrifying) furry, electronic, gibberish-speaking pets, Furbies dominated the late 1990s toy scene—and yours might be worth a cool $4,550, according to eBay.
Tiger RARE Vintage 1999 Tiger Electronics FURBY Tiger RARE Vintage 1999 Tiger Electronics FURBY BID NOW Credit: EBayHouse BeautifulOf course, your Furby will be worth tons more moolah if it's in pristine condition—aka, still in the box—which might be a deal breaker, since, you know, they're literally meant to be played with.
These aren't the only valuable Furbies out there—editions from different years are up on eBay, like a rare Valentine's Day Furby and a Tiger Furby with Blue Eyes.
Hasbro still makes Furbies and currently has a ton of options to choose from on Amazon—grab yours today so you can relive your childhood.", "By Bill FinleyEveryone in racing understands that adding the Triple Crown trophy to your collection is about the most difficult thing that one can accomplish in this sport.
He said the story begins when Barrera's family decided to sell the trophy because it needed help paying medical bills.
Wulkan said that his company does not actually own the trophy but is selling it on behalf of a client.
The trophy appeared in the public eye once again earlier this year when it was featured on a episode of the popular reality show Pawn Stars.
Someone identified only as “Patrick” showed up at the Las Vegas pawn shop and asks for $500,000 for the trophy.", 'The Peterlee-based entrepreneur spotted an opportunity selling surfing gear, and since leaving his call centre job 15 years ago, has never looked back.
Still growing, the business now has a team of seven and turns over £2 million a year.
There were 1,300 new eBay millionaires in the UK in past 12 months – the most since 2009, with under 30s and over 60s are fastest growing age-groupsHome, furniture and DIY entrepreneurs the most successful.
Rob Hattrell, vice-president of eBay in the UK, said: “The uplift in the number of eBay millionaires demonstrates how entrepreneurs up and down the country are keeping up with the ever-changing needs of consumers, despite some tough economic conditions.
"There are 200,000 UK small businesses at the heart of eBay and we want to celebrate seller stars through this year’s eBay for Business Awards.', 'Special-edition vehicles have a place in our heart, which is why we think this International Scout II is so cool.
It's an ultra-rare 1979 "Midnitestar" edition with a lots of custom upgrades that make it about 37 times more interesting than your average Scout.
The Midnitestar was one of several star-themed special-edition Scouts offered by International.
They include gold decals running along the sides of the car, a gold grille surround, gold wheels, a hood scoop, and Midnitestar badges on the rear quarter panels.
It's estimated around 150 examples of the Midnitestar Scout II were built, making this a pretty special find.', 'In the announcement, eBay wrote, “Sellers no longer need to use the Mobile Friendly Checker to add the viewport meta tag in order to make their listings mobile friendly.”Sellers have been reporting problems using mobile friendly checker for the past 2 weeks.
So is Mobile Friendly Checker working?
90% of the time the mobile friendly checker cannot find problems eBay reports in my listings.
If your description does not have embedded images, you won’t need to use the Mobile Friendly Checker.
If you have questions about the mobile friendly checker, let us know!', 'I’m a pretty tech-savvy person, but I still fell for an eBay scam.
Fake eBay emails try to steal informationPhishing attacks are emails aimed at stealing personal information.
Scammers may try to make a dangerous email look like it came from eBay by including the eBay logo and even a fake eBay email address.
For some categories, including many subsections of eBay Motors, eBay allows for payments other than credit cards or PayPal.
Protecting yourself from eBay scams involves using common sense, looking out for warning signs and properly documenting your sales and deliveries.', 'Perhaps that’s why eBay has become a popular destination for exclusive merchandise that you can only purchase inside Disney Parks.
It says that on the park’s opening day fans executed more than 360,000 searches for Star Wars: Galaxy’s Edge related items.
Most of their items, including Disney Parks passholder exclusives and limited edition pins, are going for about $10 over retail price.
Scalping Disney Parks merchandise has been a problem for a while now.
I reached out to Disney Parks about the email I received from eBay, and about what I found when I visited the online auction site.']

title: ["People Are Reselling Cups and Cutlery From Disney's Star Wars: A ... - House Beautiful", 'Larger-than-life Dolly Parton puppet sells on eBay - Knoxville News Sentinel']
summary:
['Disneyland's newest section of the park, Star Wars: A Galaxy's Edge in Anaheim, CA, has already drawn hundreds of thousands of eager visitors and galactic fanatics—and they're taking as much as they can get from the experience.
According to the Ocean County Register, park guests have been selling "anything not nailed down" on eBay for a pretty penny.
eBayHouse BeautifulCardboard coasters seem to be a hot-ticket item to resell, and they've been appearing on eBay for $10 each.
The orange coasters have sayings written in Aurebesh, a Star Wars language.
Also, color-coded crew cards handed out to park visitors who ride the Millennium Falcon: Smugglers Run attraction have also been found on the resale site for as much as $400 each, according to People.', 'A larger-than-life puppet of Dolly Parton has a new home after selling on eBay for $555.00.
The puppet of the East Tennessee songstress stands over 12 feet tall when worn, according to the sale page, and has movable arms.
The Giant Dolly creation gained local fame after appearing with the Voices for Trans Youth Campaign in the Knox PrideFest parade last weekend.
The puppet was put up for bid on eBay earlier this week by Cattywampus Puppet Council, a nonprofit organization that builds up community and promotes play through puppetry.
They plan to create another Giant Dolly puppet in its place.']

It's one of the most rare Bob Marley posters ever, but as the seller is offering it since November 2018, the price of $15,000 seems to be too expensive.", 'Get the inside track on the big stories from Liverpool Crown Court with our weekly newsletterA woman who ran a £228,000 stamp and printer cartridge scam at work could now lose her home.
But a review by the firm after she left the job revealed Belton had bought stamps and printer cartridges on an industrial scale .

title: ["eBay's crash sale trolls Amazon over Prime Day 2018 crash - Business Insider", 'Online Auctions: Are eBay and LiveAuctioneers a good fit? - Antique Trader', "There's a 53-Mile Chevrolet Camaro Z28 for Sale on eBay Motors - Road & Track", 'A prototype of an unreleased Nokia Android phone shows up on eBay - XDA Developers', 'Unreleased Nokia smartphone prototypes show up on eBay - Liliputing', 'Unreleased Nokia Prototype Android Phones Listed on eBay - Beebom']
summary:
['AdvertisementEBay has announced a "Crash Sale" to rival Amazon's Prime Day, with the promise of extra deals if Amazon crashes again like last year.
This was the company's highest single sales day until Cyber Monday a few months later in November 2018.
Register Now Our SpeakersRead more: Amazon Prime Day, the made-up holiday that rivals Black Friday, is coming soon.
The eBay Crash Sale will run on July 15, overlapping with the first day of Amazon's now 48-hour Prime Day.
"July has become a massive shopping season," said eBay COO Jay Hanson in the Crash Sale press release.', '', "Consider this Chevy Camaro Z28.
It has just 53 miles on the clock, and it's for sale right now on eBay Motors.
It's been very sparingly driven—averaging less than 1.4 miles a year!—and stored in a climate-controlled garage with the rest of the seller's collection.
From the factory, this Z28 was equipped with T-tops, air conditioning, a limited-slip differential, a tilt steering wheel, and an automatic transmission.
You've only got one chance to buy a Z28 with mileage this low, so if that's what you're looking for, you better get your bid in.", '', 'Nokia phones have been making a comeback in recent years… but the new Nokia is quite literally a different company, with Nokia-branded devices coming from a new-ish company called HMD Global that bought back the rights to the name from Microsoft a few years ago.
Before Microsoft acquired Nokia’s smartphone division and started selling Lumia-branded phones with Windows software, Nokia was trying a few different strategies for staying relevant in the smartphone space.
And now two alleged prototypes that never saw the light of day are up for auction on eBay, providing a look at an alternate history where Nokia kept making its own smartphones.
The Nokia Ion Mini, meanwhile, is an Android-powered phone with a Qualcomm Snapdragon 400 processor, 1GB of RAM, 8GB of storage and a tiny 800 x 480 pixel display.
It’s going for $1,999 on eBay and totally isn’t worth it if you plan to actually use the Ion Mini as a phone.', 'An old prototype Android smartphone from Nokia has been listed on eBay, showing how the company was actively working on Android devices before choosing Windows at the behest of the company’s then-CEO, Stephen Elop.
Called Nokia Ion Mini, the phone is listed on eBay UK for $1,999 (around Rs.
Interestingly, the seller has also listed another old, prototype Nokia smartphone, known as Nokia Kataya, on eBay’s US site for $1,499 (around Rs.
This one, however, runs an ‘unknown OS’ that Nokia Power User (NPU) speculates could be Sailfish OS.
Neither phone was announced officially by Nokia, but both are in working condition and are fully-unlocked, ensuring compatibility with all networks.']

title: ['$900 "Betsy Ross" Sneakers Listing Disappears from Ebay After Pair Reportedly Sold on StockX for $2,500 - Newsweek', 'eBay bidder who paid $555 for giant Dolly Parton puppet gifted it back to the nonprofit - WBIR.com', 'Rare Atari 2600 game is going for $90,000 on eBay - Polygon', "Two unreleased Nokia phones are on sale on eBay − and we'd ... - TrustedReviews"]
summary:
['', "The group posted on Facebook Tuesday night that the community member who purchased the puppet donated it back to them!
There were 20 bids made on the puppet and the proceeds were to go to Cattywampus Puppet Council, a Knoxville-based arts nonprofit, to benefit their community-based arts programming which primarily serves youth.
Well, the group posted on Facebook Tuesday night that the community member who purchased the puppet donated it back to them!
The nonprofit said the lucky bidder told them they believe in the power of Cattywampus's work and wanted that work to continue.
If you'd like to donate to Cattywampus Puppet Council, click here.", 'It seems like “rarest video game ever” is a fungible label, or at least one for which there is no consensus.
But there is no dispute that very few copies of Extra Terrestrials (a knockoff, not that game), a 1983 game for the Atari 2600, made it into the wild, and that 36 years later, one of them is for sale.
Other claimants to rarest-game honors include Air Raid, previously billed as the rarest Atari 2600 game ever.
But what it does have going for it is its manufacture date: 1984, making it one of the last Atari 2600 games made after the video game crash of 1983.
In a way, sticking a $90,000 price tag on the game is emblematic of its wild west origins — the only thing really verifying that this is the rarest video game, or that it’s worth this much, is the opinion of the seller themselves.', 'Some prototype Nokia smartphones have emerged on eBay, giving you the chance to buy yourself a slice of delicious, once-classified, tech history.
Two unreleased smartphones, namely the Nokia Kataya and the Nokia Ion Mini, have appeared on eBay priced at $1499 (~£1200) and $1999 (~£1600) respectively.
According to Liliputing, the Nokia Kataya runs the “Linux-based Maemo/MeeGo operating systems and/or a version of the Meltemi/Asha OS”.
Meanwhile the Nokia Ion Mini runs Android 4.3, but it’s a tiny device with a screen resolution of just 800 x 480.
The above image compares it side-by-side to an iPhone 5S, which itself only measures 123.8 x 58.6 x 7.6mm.']

title: ["Atari 2600's Rarest Game Is Selling for $90000 USD on eBay - HYPEBEAST", 'eBay Find: This 1992 Camaro Anniversary Edition is an affordable future classic - Autoblog']
summary:
['the Extra Terrestrial game for the Atari 2600, is going for $90,000 USD on eBay.
It’s obscurity, alongside being manufactured a year after the video game crash of 1983, gives credence to its huge price tag, although an actual exact estimate is currently unknown.
It’s going price has even beaten out the previously known rarest game for the Atari 2600, Air Raid, which went for $33,000 USD.
This self-published title from Burlington, Ontario’s Skill Screen Games currently has a copy reserved in The Personal Computer Museum of Brantford as well.
The eBay seller, gamewizard69, states he is “the only confirmed private owner of this game right now” outside of the museum.', 'There was this 1996 Corvette Grand Sport with a measly 6,640 miles, as well as a pretty cool Mustang Cobra with that crazy green-purple color-changing paint.
That's why this 1992 Camaro RS 25th Anniversary Edition stood out for me.
Now, 1992 was actually the last year for the third-generation Camaro, which also coincided with the nameplate's 25th anniversary – hence the special-edition car you see here.
Although every 1992 Camaro apparently had a 25th anniversary badge on the dashboard, this car would have the "Heritage Package" option that only consisted of some badges and stripes.
So maybe this Camaro RS isn't the most special recent American sports car out there, but for the money, I think it's a pretty cool eBay find.']

Hot Deals for Hot DaysAlong with the Summer Brand Outlet launch, today eBay is releasing sales on things shoppers actually want.', "If you're seeking a quirky car to drive to the beach in style this summer, look no further than this 1977 Datsun F10 wagon.

It's currently listed on eBay in Torrance, California with a Buy It Now price of $9000, or best offer.", 'Police in Southington, Connecticut arrested Joshua Moore who is accused of robbing numerous ATMs of $200,000-$300,000 in cash.

He got the right tool for the job.
According to the investigators, "the suspect utilized a battery powered hydraulic spreader similar to what is used by firefighters during vehicle extrications (Jaws of Life) to gain access into the ATM machine."

PMG Expert Review offers two services for US and world paper money on eBay:Authenticity Review ($5 per note): A PMG expert examines the photos from the eBay listing and provides a preliminary opinion of the note’s authenticity.
To use this service, eBay buyers should look for the PMG Expert Review link near the bid or buy section on the eBay listing page for an uncertified note.

title: ['People Are Already Selling Woolworths Ooshies For Up To $45,000 On eBay - LADbible', 'EBay selects MediaCom as new global media agency - AdAge.com', 'eBay Consolidates $250 Million Global Media Account With WPP - Adweek', 'eBay expands presence in India through Paytm Mall integration - The Siasat Daily', 'How Amazon and eBay are selling car tracking devices to controlling partners searching for ‘stalker’ kit... - The Sun']

Complete sets are where the real money lies with rare sets fetching thousands."', 'EBay has a new media agency.
Following a review that began earlier this summer, the San Jose, California-based retailer is consolidating its media buying with MediaCom.
MediaCom was first tapped by eBay to handle planning and buying duties for Europe, the Middle East and Africa in May 2014 and then in July of that year was awarded its full global media account.
In 2017, eBay named 72andSunny its global creative agency of record; the shop was responsible for the retailer’s “Fill Your Cart With Color” campaign later that year.
He noted that eBay is moving away from Google and search channels into more social channels.', 'MediaCom has been the brand’s media agency of record in Europe and Australia, while Publicis handled the business in North America.
The appointment follows a closed review between MediaCom parent company WPP and Publicis.
According to a source with direct knowledge of the matter, the appointment excludes Asia, a region where eBay operates a number of brands and employs a different approach.', 'New Delhi: eBay Inc has invested about 150 million (nearly Rs 1,000 crore) in domestic e-tailer Paytm Mall for a 5.5 per cent stake.
As per the deal, eBay will make its inventory accessible to the customer of Paytm Mall in India.
Before investing in Paytm Mall, eBay invested in rival Snapdeal and Flipkart.
“This new relationship will accelerate our cross-border trade efforts in a rapidly growing market, providing hundreds of millions of Paytm and Paytm Mall customers with access to eBay’s unparalleled selection of goods.”Indian consumers have expanded their horizon and now like shopping for unique products from international platforms, said Rudra Dalmia, Executive Director of Paytm Mall.
“This new strategic collaboration will ensure Indian consumers are given greater access to eBay’s vast selection of inventory.', 'ONLINE retailers including Amazon and eBay are selling car tracking devices to controlling lovers who search for "stalking" kits.
The tracking device is as small as a lighter and the whereabouts of the victim are delivered right to your mobile.
eBay claimed that spying and stalking devices are banned from their site and "constantly monitor" their marketplace to block these items.
LAWS ABOUT TRACKING YOUR PARTNER'S CAR While it is legal to buy a car GPS tracker, the way you use it could be illegal.
Installing a GPS tracking device on a car can be considered spying or an infringement of privacy.']

title: ['eBay CEO: Why We Should Teach All Students to Code - Fortune']
summary:

I see many debates about technical skills versus liberal arts.
The future is about integrating the two in a way that builds technical proficiency informed by a sense of humanness.
Navigating this and many other complex ethical and societal questions is where the liberal arts play a vital role.
Devin Wenig, president and CEO of eBay, studied political science at Union College and law at Columbia University.']

We've also reported a related issue - sellers are unable to use PayPal to make a onetime payment for eBay selling fees.', 'eBay filled the position of Chief Product Officer after a 1-year vacancy following the departure of RJ Pittman in July 2018.eBay also found a replacement for Chief Technology Officer Steve Fisher who abruptly stepped down in May to focus on his wife’s health issues.
Pete Thompson has joined eBay as Senior Vice President and Chief Product Officer, and Mazen Rawashdeh was promoted to Senior Vice President and Chief Technology Officer.
He comes to eBay from Amazon where he served as Vice President of Alexa Voice Service.
As Chief Technology Officer, Rawashdeh will continue to lead platform engineering and the company’s infrastructure and platform architecture, as well as AI, research and data science, payment and risk engineering, and eBay’s third-party developer ecosystem and APIs.
VP, Product Analytics: Steve Metz is returning to eBay, where he has spent most of his career, from Amazon.', '', 'If you thought that you could avoid Ed Sheeran by turning your radio off, think again.

Advert 10"Unopened obviously," which to me is the minimum I'd expect for a £72 bottle of sauce.
Advert 10Another person who has been capitalising on Ed Sheeran's rise to fame is Ty Jones, a doppleganger who works in a bingo hall.
Not Ed (left), Ed (right) Credit: Ty Jones', 'Something went wrong, please try again later.

title: ['Mum made £1m selling clothes on eBay and this is how she did it - Liverpool Echo']
summary:
['A mum has made over £1m selling clothes on eBay after being inspired to join the auction site to flog an old CD.
I'd visit brand warehouses and buy remnant stock to sell online.
"I then went on eBay, started looking at completed sales data and worked out how much I could sell each product on for to make a profit.
"Success took off and now we're selling around 1,300 items a week on eBay and through our website - we can't believe the success."
Speaking on her advice for anyone else looking to cash in on eBay, Roanna says the secret is to "not be greedy".']

title: ['eBay To Launch Managed Delivery, An End-To-End Fulfillment ... - PR Newswire', 'EBay to launch warehousing and shipping services next year - Reuters', 'Cheap 1971 Ford Mustang Mach 1 for Sale on eBay Motors - Road & Track', 'Jimmy Fallon Has a Heart-to-Heart With That Infamous Timothée Chalamet Puppet - TIME', 'Speculator Corner: Creepshow #0 SDCC Exclusive $150 on eBay ... - Bleeding Cool News']
summary:
['SAN JOSE, Calif., July 24, 2019 /PRNewswire/ -- eBay is introducing Managed Delivery, a cost-effective fulfillment service to launch next year, beginning in the U.S., that will provide shoppers faster and more reliable delivery on millions of popular products.
eBay's Managed Delivery InfographicManaged Delivery will provide sellers the ability to store, pack and ship their products through expert logistics partners managed by eBay.
"Managed Delivery will be a competitively-priced logistics solution for businesses selling high-volume goods in popular categories like electronics, home and garden, and fashion.
With approximately 1.5 million packages being sent daily in the U.S. by eBay sellers, Managed Delivery will also result in hundreds of millions of eBay branded boxes and packages being placed on front porches across the United States within the next few years.
Managed Delivery is the third pillar of eBay's ongoing evolution to create a more managed marketplace.', '(Reuters) - EBay Inc EBAY.O said on Wednesday it would launch a warehousing and shipping service for merchants selling through its site starting next year, a new strategy that is expected to attract more sellers to the e-commerce platform.
EBay sellers send about 1.5 million packages daily in the United States.
At the same time, improved logistics networks and high warehouse capacity made a delivery service more feasible for eBay.
Sellers in the program will be charged a fee for warehousing and for shipping once an item is sold.
The service will let them fulfill orders placed on eBay or on other online platforms, the company said.', 'This cheap 1971 Ford Mustang Mach 1 is calling your name.
Soon after the restoration was completed, the car was sold to someone in Pennsylvania, but a medical issue prevented the new owner from driving it.
After a carburetor rebuild and an oil change, the car started right up, and drives as it should, the seller claims.
The seller says a four-barrel carburetor previously fitted to the car will come along with the sale.
The car is currently listed on eBay in Newark, New York with a Buy It Now price of $7000 or best offer.', 'In case you were wondering what happened to that notorious (some would say creepy) puppet made in the likeness of teenage dream Timothée Chalamet and listed on EBay for $122,795, look no further than late night funnyman Jimmy Fallon, who took it upon himself to purchase the puppet.
Timothée the puppet made his first appearance on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon, where he showed off a French accent — courtesy of Fallon’s fairly impressive ventriloquist skills — and a surprisingly sensitive disposition (his favorite turn-of-phrase appears to be “You mock me?
During the segment, Timothée the puppet discussed his greatest roles so far and helped Fallon introduce the featured books for his second-annual Tonight Show Summer Reads book club, with only a few minor disputes about the titles.
Later, the puppet deigned to sing a song with fellow guest Fred Armisen, although they shared heated words about Armisen’s new show, Los Espookys.
Watch the full clips of Timothée the puppet, Fallon and Armisen below.', '']

title: ['EBay will offer long-overdue Amazon shipping competitor next year - TechCrunch', 'eBay will launch its own delivery service in 2020 - CNET', 'eBay Matches Amazon With Logistics Option - CFO - CFO.com', '‘I put Ooshies on eBay and this is what happened’ - Kidspot']
summary:
['That ship has almost certainly sailed, but eBay’s finally readying a service to take on Amazon’s offering more directly.
Launching in the U.S. next year, Managed Delivery is an end-to-end fulfillment offering for eBay sellers.
Those aren’t the only lessons eBay has learned from Amazon, either.
Per the press release:With approximately 1.5 million packages being sent daily in the U.S. by eBay sellers, Managed Delivery will also result in hundreds of millions of eBay branded boxes and packages being placed on front porches across the United States within the next few years.
Per Reuters, the new offering should apply to up to half the items currently listed on the auction site.', 'The Managed Delivery service will launch in 2020, beginning in the US.
Currently, eBay sellers handle shipping themselves.
The new service will be voluntary for sellers, but eBay says it will provide faster, cheaper and more reliable shipping.
Through the service, eBay will partner with logistics providers to fulfill orders via "strategically located warehouses across the country."
Devin Wenig, eBay CEO, said the solution will be "competitively priced" and aimed at sellers of high-volume electronics, home, garden and fashion products.', 'eBay has unveiled a logistics service aimed at enabling sellers to deliver products more quickly to customers, matching Amazon’s in-house shipping option.
eBay is partnering with several yet-to-be-announced warehousing and shipping companies for the new service, rather than doing it all in-house as Amazon does with its “Fulfillment By Amazon” (FBA) service.
According to Wenig, 40% to 50% of those sales could be processed through the Managed Delivery service.
“What this is not about is us trying to win a fast shipping war,” Wenig told Business Insider.
“Our 182 million consumers shop on eBay because of the value and uniqueness of our inventory.', '']

title: ['Sellers Run into Roadblocks Paying eBay Fees - EcommerceBytes', 'eBay Find: 1969 Corvette Stingray in classy Fathom Green - Autoblog']
summary:
['eBay sellers have had problems this month when trying to pay their fees.
It turns out eBay changed the process by which sellers make one-time payments (unannounced), and that it was glitchy ("a known issue," in eBay parlance).
Today when I went to make a one-time payment, it automatically came out of my bank account."
In a roundup of the weekly chat session ( post #58 of the thread ), an eBay moderator addressed payment issues in two places.
Is there a glitch processing credit cards that's causing these problems," the eBay moderator stated there was "a known issue related to paying selling fees at this time."', "As such, it seemed like a good idea to take a look around the old eBays for a classic Vette to share.
Painted Fathom Green with a saddle interior, this 1969 Corvette Stingray coupe is classy in a way that most Vettes throughout the ages have not been.
It is paired in this car to a four-speed manual, because of course I was searching for cars with the manual.
Now, a 1969 with a 427 would obviously be more desirable, but it would also fetch a much higher cost.
It at least looks well-done, although as always, you wouldn't know for sure unless looking underneath and getting a proper pre-purchase inspection."]

title: ['eBay and Amazon Executives Sound Off on Fast Shipping - EcommerceBytes']
summary:
['During his keynote address at the eBay Open conference last week, eBay CEO Devin Wenig discussed shipping speed and said, “If you need paper towels in 4 minutes, peace!
– I’m not your guy.”It’s true most people would likely think of Amazon (or retail sites like Walmart or Target) before eBay when purchasing paper towels – emergency or not.
But despite Wenig’s remarks, he’s rolling out changes that indicate he may not be as blasé about fast shipping as his joking implied.
It’s interesting to note that at one time, eBay did try to provide paper towels (and other items) for those who wanted near-instant delivery.
However, former eBay CEO John Donahoe’s “eBay Now” service that charged shoppers $5 for same-day delivery ended in failure.']

title: ['Super rare Woolworths Lion King Simba Ooshie back on eBay after bidder fails to pay - 7NEWS', 'eBay partners with third-party logistics on fulfillment - FreightWaves', '1994 Toyota Celica GT-Four for Sale in the US on eBay Motors - Road & Track']
summary:
["A rare furry Simba Ooshie is back on the market after a bidder failed to pay their $100,000 auction bid.
UPDATE: Woolworths' issues an Ooshies warning to collectorsThe Woolworths Lion King collectable was earlier on Monday sold on eBay for an eye-watering $99,900, with 108 bids made over five days.
For more Woolworths related news and videos check out Woolworths >>Watch the related video above: Woolworths unveil new home-brandIt had first appeared with a starting bid of $10,000.
But the seller behind the rare Ooshie has revealed the same item is up for grabs after the bidder didn’t pay the amount.
The Woolworths Lion King promotion finishes on August 13 or until stocks run out.", 'E-commerce retailer eBay (NASDAQ: EBAY) announced on July 24 that it would launch an end-to-end fulfillment service called Managed Delivery in 2020.
Unlike Amazon, though, eBay will partner with a number of third-party logistics providers (3PLs) on transportation, warehousing and packaging services.
Lockard said that eBay was trying to gain more visibility into and control over its inventory and supply chain so that it could improve service.
“The more control eBay has over the inventory and the supply chain, the more it can meet the demands of its customers,” Lockard said.
“Too often shippers are trying to solve a warehouse or supply chain issue with a transportation solution,” Lockard said.', "Toyota never sold the third-gen Celica GT-Four homologation special in America.
Built so Toyota could race in the World Rally Championship's Group A class, the Celica GT-Four is a real-deal race-bred machine.
This particular car has 131,286 kilometers (around 81,000 miles) on the clock, and looks to be in great condition.
Toyota built just 2500 ST205-generation Celica GT-Fours over five years of production.
It's a unique alternative that, considering its limited production and WRC heritage, might not stay affordable for long."]

title: ['Fulfillment by eBay - Marketplace Pulse', 'Sustainable Stock Showdown: Amazon vs. eBay - Corporate Knights Magazine', 'Dublin jobs: eBay wants to hire Irish people to work from home - Extra.ie', '668-Mile 1993 Ford Mustang Cobra Fox Body for Sale on eBay Motors - Road & Track', '€1million in sales generated by Irish SMEs taking part in eBay pilot programme - Irish Tech News - Irish Tech News']
summary:
['Last week eBay introduced Managed Delivery, a fulfillment service not unlike Fulfillment by Amazon (FBA), enabling sellers to store, pack and ship their products through logistics partners managed by eBay.
Roughly 1% of products for sale on eBay are available with two-day delivery, despite eBay launching the Guaranteed Delivery program in September 2017.
Orders shipped by the new eBay service will come in eBay branded packaging.
Thus Walmart won’t allow eBay packaging either, forcing sellers to use at least three separate services for Amazon, Walmart, eBay and other marketplaces they sell on.
eBay’s fulfillment service is not a competitor to FBA, but instead, an additional service sellers will want use to achieve fast shipping on other marketplaces as well as eBay.', 'Over 8,100 Amazon employees have signed a letter asking tough questions about the Shipment Zero strategy and calling for Amazon to do more.
Online retail is incredibly popular but accounts for only about 12% of all retail sales globally.
So, we present a more sustainable alternative to Amazon: eBay.
EBay is the next largest online retail company and is a much better performer when it comes to sustainability metrics.
Amazon’s market capitalization — the size of the company as measured by the stock market — is more than 25 times larger than eBay’s.', "Tech giant eBay has announced that it wants to hire Irish people to work from home.
Working for eBay entails a multitude of benefits, including a quarterly bonus plan, 25 days holidays, educational assistance, and pension, healthcare, and life plans.
While working from home, employees will be expected to 'interact and provide customer support to our UK and Irish sellers and buyers.'
'You will be representing eBay in such a way that our customers are blown away by the service you provide.'
'Going forward you will participate in the ongoing training and upskilling, to set you up for a long-term career with eBay.'", "It's hard to find a clean one with the right options checked.
This 1993 Cobra has just 668 miles on the odometer from new, and it might be the cleanest, most unmolested Fox in existence.
The 5.0-liter V-8 got high-flow heads, an underdrive crankshaft pulley, a unique intake manifold, and a free-flowing exhaust.
That's a whole lot of money for a Fox-body Mustang, we know.
But considering just how clean and original this one is, we understand why someone would spend this kind of cash.", '']

title: ['EBay Accuses Amazon Managers of Conspiring to Poach Its Sellers ... - The New York Times', 'Couple distraught after falling victim to £5500 eBay motorhome scam - Lancashire Telegraph', 'eBay: Current Risk Factors (NASDAQ:EBAY) - Seeking Alpha', 'Viral Timothée Chalamet ventriloquist dummy -- that was on eBay for ... - LNP | LancasterOnline', 'eBay hiring in Ireland with work-from-home jobs available for a decent wage - Irish Mirror']
summary:
['SEATTLE — EBay has accused three Amazon managers of illegally conspiring to poach its sellers, escalating a monthslong feud between two of the country’s largest e-commerce companies.
In a lawsuit filed Wednesday in the United States District Court for the Northern District of California, eBay says the Amazon managers directed dozens of workers to illegally use eBay’s private messaging system to solicit sellers onto Amazon’s platform.
In the new case, eBay says the outreach was not a few rogue employees but part of a larger effort within Amazon, with managers giving lower-lever employees lists of eBay sellers to target.
Regulators and lawmakers in Washington are intensifying their scrutiny of the company’s market power, with some looking at its relationship with third-party sellers.
In a recent hearing, for example, lawmakers pressed Amazon on whether the company used data from marketplace sellers to inform its own competing lines of private label products, which Amazon said it did not do.', 'Mr Harrison, a former tank driver, messaged the seller, “Kirsty” under the username “Kirstwhittake_0”, who had valued the motorhome at £5,500.
Mr Harrison, 65, claimed he contacted eBay to help with payments as he did not feel comfortable using PayPal and had not used eBay before.
Three days later Mr Harrison contacted customer services and was informed he had been conned and had lost all his money.
Mr Harrison said: “My wife broke down in tears when we found out.
“It’s made us feel really, really sick.', "Q2 2019 earnings) is all green, and the measure of surprise is getting larger as well.
That's not an encouraging sign, especially when we've been seeing mid-to-high-single-digit revenue growth for the past three years or so.
Source: Seeking Alpha EssentialMarginsWith revenue growth rates coming down to low single digits, strong EPS growth means margin pressure.
That means Alibaba is trading too low or eBay is trading too high, considering their respective sizes and revenue growth rates.
The market rewarded eBay's earnings beat with a 5.8% jump during aftermarket hours post the Q2 earnings announcement.", 'In early June, a ventriloquist dummy of "Call Me By Your Name" actor Timothée Chalamet was listed on eBay for an astounding $122,795.
The puppet master behind the viral ventriloquist dummy?
How do you decide to create a Chalamet puppet?
He said he grew up with what he described as a "love-hate relationship" with iconic ventriloquist dummy Charlie McCarthy.
Now, instead of being scared of ventriloquist dummies, he said he "embraces the creepiness."', 'Something went wrong, please try again later.

title: ['Samsung Gear S3 hits new all-time low price on eBay in open box ... - PhoneArena', 'eBay Bikes - S-Works, Trek, Cannondale, and Pinarello | Cycling ... - Road.cc', 'EBay is suing Amazon for “racketeering” and anti-competitive practices - Vox.com', 'eBay Over Billed Sellers in GTC Renewal Glitch - EcommerceBytes', '13B-Powered 1986 Mazda Luce for Sale on eBay Motors - Road & Track']
summary:
['Quick Ship Electronics is certainly part of the latter group, with a stellar 99.9 percent positive feedback score based on over 25,000 customer ratings from the last 12 months, and for a no doubt limited time only, its killer recent deal on an open box Samsung Gear S3 Frontier is further sweetened with an even heftier price cut.
If you hurry, you can get the Android and iOS-compatible wearable device for $149.99 with a 1-year warranty included, which makes this thing about as reliable as a brand-new unit fetching $300 at Best Buy or on Samsung's own US e-store.
Obviously, these are not all-new, unused, unopened, and undamaged items on sale here, but other than shipping with "distressed" packaging, they should be essentially identical to new units in terms of both functionality and their cosmetic condition.
At 150 bucks, the Gear S3 is an arguably better deal than the Galaxy Watch Active , which typically costs $200.
Despite its advanced age, the substantially marked-down device comes with a handy rotating bezel, a large and sharp Super AMOLED display (which is not necessarily a strong point), as well as everything from a built-in heart rate monitor to standalone GPS functionality, Samsung Pay support, and a massive battery capable of keeping the lights on for 3 to 4 days on a single charge (at least in theory).', "If you're after a new bike, but you want to save a bit of cash, then eBay is the place to go.
This one comes with the excellent Dura-Ace 9000 Di2 groupset and tubeless Giant carbon wheels.
The lightweight carbon frameset is combined with a Dura-Ace grouspet made up of a mix of 9000 and R9100 parts.
This lightweight build features a Quarq carbon chainset, carbon Hollowgram wheels and Vittoria Corsa G+ sidewalls.
The custom wheelset consists of Mavic rims laced to Hope hubs, an excellent wheelset that will climb very well.", 'EBay is suing Amazon for an alleged “conspiracy” to steal high-volume sellers off its platform through its user messaging system, the New York Times reported Thursday.
The previous lawsuit took care to paint Amazon as metastatic and insatiable, a big bully eating everyone’s lunch.
The previous lawsuit also didn’t say whether Amazon had succeeded in stealing sellers, while this one does: “The racketeering conspiracy that the Defendants and other Amazon managers directed was a success.
Amazon representatives satisfied significant portions of their seller recruitment quotas through the illegal activity, and filled holes in Amazon’s product offerings[.
The managers listed in the suit are accused of training sales reps “on how to solicit eBay sellers … referred to internally as ‘prospecting.’”The rivalry between eBay and Amazon is openly bitter, and has only escalated in recent months.', '(and why sellers frequently complain about eBay technical issues).
Today, an eBay moderator confirmed eBay overcharged some sellers this week and said the company is working to identify listings that were impacted.
Additionally they are currently working to identify and credit listings that were double charged incorrectly in July.
Remarkably, eBay never announced this over-billing incident - we happened to stumble upon the post in the discussion boards.
Some sellers had already reported that eBay had caused them to overpay because of a "fix" it rolled out this month due to a botched implementation.', 'Interested in owning an obscure piece of Mazda rotary history?
This 1986 Luce sedan, which came from the factory with a turbocharged 13B Wankel engine, just popped up for sale on eBay.
Welcome to You Must Buy, our daily look at the cars you really should be buying instead of that boring commuter sedan.
Mazda offered a host of engine choices for buyers, most of which were inline-fours or V-6s.
But there was always at least one rotary engine available.']

title: ['Endeavor Hires eBay Exec Guy Schory As First Chief Digital Officer - Deadline', "Mahomes' cereal soars in popularity and spurs hefty price tag on ... - Kansas City Business Journal"]
summary:
['Endeavor has hired former eBay and PayPal executive Guy Schory as the company’s first Chief Digital Officer.
He will be tasked with overseeing digital efforts across Endeavor’s product management, marketing, data platforms, advertising and commerce, and also operate its digital direct-to-consumer and business-to-businesses units that include Endeavor Streaming.
“As Endeavor continues to evolve, our ability to create innovative digital businesses, products and experiences for our clients and platform matters now more than ever,” Endeavor CEO Ari Emanuel said.
“Guy is a strategic executive who has the experience operating world-class businesses at scale and the expertise required to take us to the next level.”At eBay and PayPal, Schory led several global strategic initiatives and was responsible for many of eBay’s consumer mobile products and digital marketing platforms.
“Endeavor is uniquely positioned to deliver exceptional digital products and experiences for a wide variety of audiences given our global network across entertainment, sports and content,” Schory said.', '']

title: ['Ebay fraudsters scammed me 11,000 separate times and cost my business £54,000 - This is Money', "Log flume from Kennywood's Log Jammer sells for $11100 in eBay ... - Pittsburgh Post-Gazette", "Leicester taxi driver's £70k eBay scam tricked buyers of BMW, Ford and Vauxhall cars - Leicestershire Live"]
summary:
["That's how much money Richard Crisp lost after fraudsters managed to hack his Peterborough business's eBay account and siphoned off some of his sales for 17 months.
Richard immediately changed his eBay password and edited all 3,300 of the listings he currently had on his business's page, and contacted eBay, PayPal and the police.
In total, the highest value item that was diverted into the PayPal accounts of fraudsters was worth £43.95.
It is unclear how the fraudsters managed to initially hack his eBay account, and Richard says eBay refuse to tell him.
He estimates the cost in lost sales and postage amounts to between £35-£40,000.", '', 'The latest crime and court news from Leicester and LeicestershireA Leicester taxi driver made tens of thousands of pounds in an elaborate eBay fraud ripping off car dealerships.
He would design and order the fake stamps, seemingly from dealerships including BMW, Jaguar Land Rover, Ford, Vauxhall and Evans Halshaw, which he would then sell using an eBay account called RetroJamie.
However trading standards later discovered he had simply continued his illegal business using his son’s eBay account.
She said Walker had also been using the eBay accounts of his son and partner.
“There is no legitimate purpose behind ordering service stamps save to make an unlawful profit at other peoples’ expense.']

title: ["How eBay built a 'human ecosystem' on customer-centricity - Marketing Week", 'Jeffrey Epstein merch removed from eBay and Shopify, still on Amazon - Business Insider', 'Sadiq Khan blimp flown over Parliament sold for £16k on eBay - Evening Standard']
summary:
['Online auction giant eBay is extending its customer-centric approach to help SMEs in Wolverhampton revive the struggling high street.
The eBay Retail Revival project in Wolverhampton.
Indeed, the auction site has a 60% penetration rate among UK shoppers who buy online.
“Despite being technology-based, eBay has always been a human ecosystem,” explains CMO Gareth Jones.
The auction site has partnered with the City of Wolverhampton on a pilot scheme designed to help revive the high street.', 'At least six such websites where users can list and sell their own merchandise have listings for Epstein-inspired merchandise, from t-shirts depicting a bullseye over Epstein's mugshot, to mugs and tote bags that ask, "Who killed Jeffrey Epstein?"
Register Now Our SpeakersAs of Tuesday morning, Epstein-inspired merchandise was found on Amazon, Etsy, and Redbubble, as well as lesser-known marketplaces Teespring, TeeChip, and TeePublic.
Redbubble told Business Insider in a statement it had become aware that "supportive Jeffrey Epstein-themed merchandise" had been uploaded to its site, but the products have been removed.
"We do not promote user-generated content of this nature and find it unacceptable," Teespring told Business Insider.
Shopify told Business Insider it removed a store from its platform selling Epstein-inspired apparel, as its merchandise violated the company's "acceptable use" policy.', 'A massive blimp of Sadiq Khan in a yellow bikini has sold on eBay for £16,100.
An auction for the blimp, which was flown over Parliament Square by activists last year, ended this morning.
The balloon was launched after Mr Khan supported a Donald Trump being flown over London to protest a visit from the US president.
Yanny Bruere, who created the campaign to fund the blimp, told the Standard last year: “I set up the crowdfund on the day that Sadiq Khan gave permission to the fly the Trump blimp.
The balloon was launched in Parliament Square last year / REUTERS/Simon Dawson“I think in the UK there’s this problem where you’re only allowed to speak about certain things.']
