After several months of investigating, police searched a storage unit they claim Walker rented, as well as his home.', "The original Opel Manta was sold in the United States in the early 1970s, but you almost never see them for sale.

eBay Vintage Electronics PageGood luck and see you next time!', 'But as of today, the "used" category no longer exists.

This particular Mustang SVO looks immaculate, which isn't surprising considering it's traveled less than 13,000 miles since new.", '“The responses came back so fast that we filled up [the art auction] within a day or two,” says Sag Harbor Cinema Restoration Campaign Chair April Gornik.

To bid in the eBay for Charity Auction, visit ebay.com/rpp/sag-harbor.', "This carbon cyclocross bike is ideal for getting stuck straight into racing.

Like the factory team McLaren version, the M8E is powered by a big-block Chevrolet V-8 mounted behind the driver, sending power to the wheels via four-speed manual transmission.
It's equipped with a Lucas injection system, inboard brakes, Lockheed brake calipers, adjustable Koni shocks, and rare original McLaren springs.

That's a lot of money for an old race car, we know, but considering how cool this one is, we'd say it's worth it.", 'A WOMAN has revealed how she "upcycled" a dresser she bought for 1p on eBay with just a lick of paint.

title: ['Quantifying the Influence of the N.R.A., With the Help of eBay ... - The New York Times', "Popeyes' Sold Out Chicken Sandwich Selling For Insane Prices On Ebay - ComicBook.com"]
summary:
['Times Insider explains who we are and what we do, and delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how our journalism comes together.
Earlier this year, as I was reporting an article about how the gun control movement had evolved since the Sandy Hook shooting, one of my sources told me he saw the National Rifle Association’s influence waning in an unprecedented way.
If you report on gun politics, you hear versions of it all the time from gun control advocates.
The N.R.A., meanwhile, vehemently denies that it has lost any influence at all.
What if, I thought, I could comprehensively quantify the N.R.A.’s influence and see whether it had changed?', 'Popeyes has unleashed something dangerous with their new chicken sandwich.
"The demand for the new Chicken Sandwich in the first few weeks following launch far exceeded our very optimistic expectations," the statement continues.
As a result, Popeyes restaurants across the country are expected to sell out of the Chicken Sandwich by the end of this week.
How much would you be willing to pay for the sold out Popeye's Chicken Sandwich?
Feel free to let us know in the comments or hit me up directly on Twitter @EVComedy to talk all things comics, anime, and the "Chicken Sandwich Wars"!']

title: ["If you invested $1,000 in eBay 10 years ago, here's how much you'd have now - CNBC", 'eBay UK Launches New Ad Campaign - EcommerceBytes', '11,000-Mile 1980 Chevy Camaro for Sale on eBay Motors - Road & Track', 'Chris is selling all of his Love Island merch on eBay for hundreds of ... - The Tab', 'Single mum who set up own eBay business while pregnant now rakes in £1m a year - The Mirror']
summary:
['Online shopping and auction website eBay turns 24 this week, and for early investors in the company, they also have reason to celebrate the company's anniversary.
If you invested in eBay 10 years ago that decision would have paid off: According to CNBC calculations, a $1,000 investment in 2009 would be worth more than $4,500 as of Sept. 3, 2019, a total return of 350%.
CNBC: EBay Inc. stock as of Sept. 3, 2019.
When eBay announced in 2018 that it would be going with PayPal competitor Adyen to process payments, PayPal's shares plummeted 10%.
However, eBay CEO Devin Wenig says he's not "trying to win a fast shipping war," according to Reuters.', 'eBay UK launched a new ad campaign, it announced on Tuesday.
In describing the ads, the company wrote, “eBay plays up family emotions in new advertising campaign.”eBay launched the campaign in the UK on September 2 on TV, VOD and social, and it will run for eight weeks.
Our latest ad helps bring that emotion to life for the 26 million UK consumers who use eBay every month”.
The campaign broke in the UK last night (Monday, September 2) on TV, VOD and socials and runs for eight weeks.
SOURCE: eBay UK Press Release', "This 1980 Camaro is a late second-generation car built shortly before the line got a major refresh.
Sporting white paint, a white grille, white wheels, and white trim, it just screams 1980s.
The seats, carpet, floor mats, headliner, seatbelts, and door cards are all red, contrasting perfectly to the decals and white exterior.
This particular Camaro has just 11,000 miles on the clock, so everything is original and in supremely good condition.
That's a good chunk of change for an old Camaro, but considering the shape of this one, we'd say that's pretty fair.", '4 years agoChris Taylor from Love Island 2019 is selling all of his personalised villa merchandise on eBay.

Also up for sale is his personalised Love Island suitcase.', 'Now, it's about to go globalExclusive: Single mum who set up own eBay business while pregnant now rakes in £1m a yearA mum who launched her own clothing line on the back of her own struggles during pregnancy has revealed she's now making £1million a year.
Let us know: emma.munbodh@mirror.co.ukImage: Monika Milcarz Clark) Monika Milcarz Clark)Now, 16 years on, and with Maria recently celebrating her 13th birthday, the company is turning over £1million through eBay alone - and she's got no plans to stop any time soon.
"It proved to be a very good idea and the business started growing very quick, my sales were literally doubling every day.
"As soon as we launched on eBay and started selling ladies clothing, the business took off like a bullet.
Image: Monika Milcarz Clark) Monika Milcarz Clark)"It got to the point that I needed help.']

David B wrote: “Love the email profile photo.
I just received emails from ebay with an inappropriate profile picture?!!
A spokesman said: “We are in touch with Microsoft — one of our email service providers in the UK — who are investigating the root cause of the matter."]

title: ["CHE Proximity releases 'Posties' for eBay - AdNews"]
summary:
['CHE Proximity has released Posties, its first work for eBay since being appointed creative agency earlier in the year.
eBay is the country’s most visited online shopping site, with two out of three Aussies having made purchases within the last twelve months.
In the new platform, CHE Proximity decided to shine a light on the delivery room and the people that have more insight into Australians' online shopping habits than anyone else: posties.
“We all know that Aussies love a bargain and hate to feel ripped off," CHE Proximity chief creative officer Ant White says.
Although unbiased, they know everything about the nation’s shopping habits, with millions of parcels passing through their dexterous fingers daily," CHE Proximity Sydney executive creative director Wesley Hawes says.']

summary:

According to Organ Donation Scotland, more than 400 people are on the transplant list waiting for a kidney.

eBay availed the benefits of Figure Eight’s workflow management and accuracy check of the data returned to enhance its crowdsourcing process.
Both the companies collaborated to design an ML workflow in order to improve product categorization algorithm.
The collaborative effort of eBay and Figure Eight also developed an exhaustive search process for product GTINs.
The large online contributor pool of the provider company completed product categorization 5X faster than a conventional outsourcing team with great accuracy.', "With the ‘stuff drawer’ now often dubbed as a ‘tech graveyard,’ eBay UK is encouraging consumers to revive and cash in on their unused, second-hand tech ahead of Apple ’s highly anticipated iPhone launch this week.
The average re-sale price for a 64GB iPhone 6 is £87, an iPhone 6 plus is £154 and a 128GB iPhone 7 is £197.
If you've got iPhone X you could make £533 and if you have an iPhone XS at 64GB you could sell it on for £650.
However, many people admit they’ve held on to old devices due to a lack of time and energy, as well as knowledge on selling.
So with help from eBay, here's five top tips for a smooth, stress free and profitable tech sale.", 'MEGHAN Markle today launched her hotly anticipated charity clothing line for Smart Works – and within hours fans were looking to make a profit.
The M&S ‘Smart Set’ crepe dress already has several listings on eBay where sellers are asking for over double the asking price.
Any dresses purchased on eBay will also not benefit the Smart Works charity – unlike those bought from an official seller.

"Thank you to the four brands who came together in supporting Smart Works on this special project - placing purpose over profit and community over competition.']

title: ["eBay, people's stuff, and a Pittsboro man's effort to link the two - The Chatham News + Record", "Ovi O's Cereal - on eBay - Capitals Outsider", 'Man donates kidney to stranger after finding heartbreaking note in eBay package - New York Post', 'Ebay Fiestaware Selling Price - Apartment Therapy', 'Cornwall seller offers bran flake shaped like Ireland for £1,000 on eBay - Cornwall Live']
summary:
['', '', 'A man donated a kidney to a stranger after receiving a heartfelt note in an eBay parcel.
Ray Duffy, 53, went under the knife two years ago at the Royal Infirmary of Edinburgh, to become a living kidney donor.
But the idea first came to him in 2013, when his partner bought a top on eBay — which was accompanied by a note explaining the heartbreaking predicament faced by the sellers’ family.
The woman who posted the package had wrapped it in paper illustrated with hand-drawn cartoons and a note explaining how her husband needed a kidney transplant and had lost his job so the family would sell things online to generate cash.
Father-of-two Duffy was so moved that he kept the note, but had no idea how he could help.', 'This large utility pitcher was still in very good condition with no chips or cracks after many years.
It did have a pin size dimple in the glaze, but that didn’t deter the buyer from offering up a high price.
Only a few of the Medium Green pitchers exist.', "Something went wrong, please try again later.

Simply send the coupon received to the address on the coupon and you will receive this amazing bran flake."]

title: ['Sick stuffed animal corpses of rare protected monkeys sold on UK eBay website - The Mirror']
summary:
['EXCLUSIVE: Stuffed corpses of rare protected monkeys and rare birds of prey are available for anyone to buy in the UK via eBayThe stuffed corpses of rare, protected monkeys that have been hunted down and slain are being sold in the UK on eBay.
And the furs of another protected species, the red fox, are being flogged still riddled with holes from the bullets used to slaughter them.
Yet one overseas seller bragged he has sold more than 250 stuffed kills to the UK through the site.
The Red Fox is protected under CITES Appendix II – but pelts from the animals are available from Ukraine for around £50.
Does not molt.”Another seller in Israel advertised a stuffed kestrel falcon –another creature protected under CITES Appendix II – for £235.']

About Best Defense FoundationIn April of 2006 Best Defense Foundation Founder, Donnie Edwards brought WWII veterans back to their battlefields for the first time.', 'So, Apple announced a new iPhone (if you didn’t hear about that already…) and to some, it’s a little expensive.
We’ve found all the best deals for the iPhone 11, Pro and Pro Max – while they are really good, we can completely sympathise with anyone who simply can’t shell out for these contracts.

You need to spend a minimum of £25 to get this deal (with a maximum discount of £75) and you’re limited to just one redemption, so choose wisely!', 'On Thursday, the Duchess of Sussex finally dropped her capsule workwear collection in aid of women’s charity Smart Works, of which she is patron.

title: ["eBay to Collect More States' Sales Tax on October 1st - EcommerceBytes", 'eBay launches new delivery service for sellers in Asean - The Phnom Penh Post', "Wacky Jet Fighter-Like '80s Pulse Autocycle for Sale on eBay - Road & Track", "JJ Abrams' Spider-Man #1 Booms on eBay After Rumours Spread... - Bleeding Cool News", 'Meghan fans warned by John Lewis against buying capsule collection on eBay - Daily Mail', 'Vets4Pets worker from Leeds stole £17k of medication to sell on eBay - Leeds Live']
summary:
['eBay will collect and remit online sales tax for additional states beginning October 1st, it announced on Tuesday.
eBay announcement follows:Beginning October 1, 2019, eBay will collect sales tax on applicable transactions for buyers in Arizona, California, Colorado, Maine, Maryland, Massachusetts, Nevada, North Dakota, South Carolina, Texas & Utah.
For states that we are collecting tax, you do not need to take any action.
Sellers may not opt-out of selling items in the states that we are collecting tax, or out of eBay automatically collecting sales tax for applicable orders.
If you are exempt from paying sales tax on your eBay purchases, visit ebay.com/salestax to learn more about our buyer exemption program for tax-exempt buyers (e.g.', 'SUPPLIED/THE NATIONeBay launches new delivery service for sellers in AseanOnline retailer eBay has launched the “eBay SeaPass” shipping platform to support eBay sellers in Asean by simplifying retail order fulfilment and providing automated shipping.
In Thailand, eBay said it would enable the faster handling of paid orders, saving eBay sellers time and money through an easy-to-use system that is available to them at no charge.
eBay is also collaborating with Thailand Post to offer special discounts and privileges to sellers who use eBay SeaPass together with Thailand Post’s ePacket service.
Boonphan Boonprayoon of eBay Thailand said: “To help eBay sellers in Thailand and Southeast Asia effectively run a borderless business in our global online marketplace, eBay developed ‘eBay SeaPass’.
Thailand Post’s ePacket service is currently available for China, South Korea, Japan, Hong Kong, Taiwan, Singapore, Malaysia, Maldives, Vietnam, Indonesia, Australia and the US.', 'The Pulse was the brainchild of engineer Ed Butcher, president of the Michigan-based Owosso Motor Car Company.
Though it has four wheels, it's designed in such a way that only three of them are touching the ground at any one time.
The side wheels, at the tip of either "wing," essentially work like training wheels, coming into play as the Pulse goes around turns.
This in-period Pulse review gives you a good idea of what it was like to drive:This content is imported from YouTube.
You may be able to find the same content in another format, or you may be able to find more information, at their web site.', '', "And within hours the £109 sold-out John Lewis tote was already being listed on eBay at twice the price.

John Lewis told Femail: 'We are delighted with the customer response to the tote bag so far.
The £109 John Lewis tote bag in tan, which sold out within hours of being launched, is already online at £295, with one person viewing it every hourOn Friday the £109 John Lewis tote bag in tan, which sold out within hours of being launched, was already on eBay at £295, with one person viewing it every hour.
The range has been created in collaboration with M&S, John Lewis, Jigsaw, and Meghan's designer friend Misha Nonoo.", 'Something went wrong, please try again later.

Police say a Proceeds of Crime Act confiscation proceeding will now get underway, so they can recover the money Jowers stole from her employer.']

title: ['eBay Has Sold More Than 24 Million Vinyl Records Since 2007 ... - Digital Music News', '1992 Ford Bronco Modified Pre-Runner for Sale on eBay Motors - Road & Track']
summary:
['eBay Has Sold More Than 24 Million Vinyl Records Since 2007 — Now They’re Tying TIDAL Hi-Fi Subscriptions to Vinyl SaleseBay is promoting its second annual ‘Vinyl Obsession Week’ with deals and a focus on physical retail.
That’s been buoyed by retail initiatives like ‘Vinyl Obsession Week‘ in which exclusive albums are highlighted.
eBay says it has sold more than 24 million pieces of vinyl since 2007 and that continues to go up.
The online auction site supports retailers by partnering with them to find vinyl albums new homes.
Last year’s ‘Vinyl Obsession Week’ offerings also offered a free three-month subscription for users.', "Looking for a solid pre-runner to hit the dunes, but don't want something too flashy for the street?
It looks like pretty much any other lightly-modded Bronco on the outside, but sports some serious upgrades underneath.
This Bronco started out as a clean 351 Windsor V-8-powered model that's been totally redone to handle the most serious of off-road challenges.
The brake lines have been replaced, and the front seats are custom-made buckets, paired with a suede MPI racing wheel.
There's also two-inch bump-stops, Warn locking hubs, massive wheel studs, and ARP lug nuts."]

title: ['eBay has sold over 24 million vinyl records since 2007 - DJ Mag', 'The eBay lust list | 8 bikes we dreamed of owning (that are now ... - BikeRadar', 'Stay-at-home mum flogs her kids’ toys on eBay to fund her own £700 private cocktail bar complete with wine... - The Sun']
summary:
["eBay are celebrating their second Vinyl Obsession Week.
With special deals in a bid to sell more physical music, Vinyl Obsession Week allows eBay customers to shop exclusive record bundles, as well as a search function that allows you to shop by featured record stores and records of the year.
The online retail giant states they have sold more than 24 million vinyl records since 2007, with 3.6 million sold in 2017 alone.
For this year's Vinyl Obsession Week, eBay has partnered with Record Store Day, using their Authorised Seller Network so that buyers can shop for collectible releases at reasonable prices.
Vinyl Obsession Week ends on September 22.", 'I did start looking for a Raleigh Team Banana race replica, but tracking down a genuine Reynolds 531c version as opposed to the cheaper 18/23 chromoly model similar to my Sprint is getting harder and harder.
To this schoolboy, then, the Raleigh Vektar pseudo-BMX with its sophisticated onboard electronics — a dangerously positioned digital speedo!
God only knows what Raleigh spent that money on, but I still quite fancy getting one to sit despondently next to my good bikes.
Probably not this one though — the only one currently for sale on eBay — looks like too much of a fixer-upper for me.
The reason so many brands did this was simple; the bike’s geometry was good and its suspension worked.', 'A STAY-AT-HOME mum has flogged her kids' toys to clear up space - and money - for her very own private cocktail bar.
Rebecca Rushworth, from Blackpool, Lancs, spent £700 on the glamorous drinking venue - complete with a wine rack, LED bar sign and crystal glasses.
Taking to Facebook, the 34-year-old showed off the results of the transformation - which she dreamt up while drinking wine one night.
8 The stay-at-home mum came up with the idea after a couple of wines - go figure Credit: Deadline News8 This is what the space looked like six weeks ago Credit: Deadline News8 Now it's an elegant cocktail bar thanks to some joiners and bargain buys Credit: Deadline NewsOther mums gushed about the transformation on Facebook, writing: "That's ace!
8 Rebecca says her son is excited for 'party time' Credit: Deadline News"Then I thought I could just do my own cocktail bar.']

title: ['eBay Admits New Promoted Listing Policy Can Hamper Visibility - EcommerceBytes']
summary:
['He said some ad blockers used by shoppers to block ads across the Internet were blocking eBay Promoted Listing ads, and because eBay now only shows a listing once - either the Promoted Listing or the organic listing - those buyers using ad blockers might never see a seller's listing.
But as the Auction Professor pointed out, if an ad blocker blocks a seller's Promoted Listing in a particular search, that listing would never be seen by the shopper in that search result.
Currently, our data suggests that promoted listings are being blocked for less than 2% of traffic.
While it may be concerning to sellers that some ad blockers block Promoted Listings, the real problem is the new eBay policy.
After all, if you do a Google search for "eBay green hats," you'll see an ad for an eBay listing selling a green hat, followed by organic results for green hats on eBay.']

title: ['eBay successfully rebalances its media spending - Warc', "A Painting of Channing Tatum's Ballsack Sold for $6.6K on eBay - Pride.com", '‘Used Thomas Cook sick bag’ amongst memorabilia already being sold on eBay... - The Sun']
summary:
['Brands need to find a balance between performance marketing and brand building; after years of focusing on performance media, eBay has renewed the emphasis on brand with welcome results.
Kantar’s recent Getting Media Right study confirmed that the industry finds itself in a muddle on this issue, with half of brand respondents not confident that they have the right balance between brand building and performance marketing, and 40% sceptical that their organisations are using the optimal media mix.
eBay presents an extreme case, since, back in 2015, its budget was split 90:10 in favour of performance over brand-building investment.
As an online marketplace, by definition a digitally native brand, it had understandably prioritised digital performance marketing channels.
(For more details, read WARC’s report: Why eBay opted to reduce its reliance on performance media.)', "How much would you realistically pay for some cute wall art for your apartment?
Well that's how much some rich AF art connoisseur paid for a portrait of Channing Tatum showing off his ballsack that was being sold on eBay.
I can't really blame whoever the buyer is though.
At the time it was first discovered and reported on by Vice late last week, the highest bid for Mann's painting (or should I say taint-ing) was only a much more modest $230.
Word obviously got out about the unique and weirdly sensual portrait, however, and while I was monitoring the listing over the weekend (strictly for research purposes), at one point, the highest bid reached a dizzying $11,100.", 'THOMAS Cook memorabilia is already being auctioned off on eBay just hours after the travel firm collapsed.
4 Thomas Cook memorabilia is already being sold on eBay Credit: EbaySome of the Thomas Cook items sprung up on eBay last night, with some of the memorabilia starting from £20.
A Thomas Cook crew manual is currently being sold for £20, while a safety demonstration card is on offer for £10.
Some eBay sellers are also optimistically selling Thomas Cook gift cards for £2.
A flight attendant explained that many crew members sold items as they "don't get paid particularly well" so "everyone does it".']

title: ["How to get $150 off Dyson's Supersonic hair dryer thanks to eBay - finder.com.au", 'Lady Hale spider brooch t-shirts are on eBay - and profits are going to charity - The Mirror', 'Thomas Cook memorabilia from last ever flights is on eBay - including sick bags - The Mirror', 'Top 50 Hottest Gardner Minshew Rookie Cards on eBay - Sports Collectors Daily', '15-ton fighting robot up for auction on eBay - CNN']
summary:
['If you've been looking to get your hands on Dyson's hair dryer, now's your chance – but you've got just five hours to shop the deal.
Starting at 10am today (Tuesday 24 September), eBay will drop limited runs of the Dyson Supersonic hair dryer V2 every hour on the hour up until 3pm.
The deal will see the hair dryer slashed to $399, which is a whopping $150 off the usual retail price.
eBay Plus membership is $49 for a year's subscription and includes a 30-day "try before you buy" period.
View this post on Instagram A post shared by Dyson Hair (@dysonhair) on Aug 30, 2019 at 8:21am PDTeBay's Head of Communications at eBay Australia & New Zealand Sophie Onikul has revealed that the Supersonic V2 is the best-selling hair dryer currently listed on eBay.', "The genius t-shirts based on Lady Hale's viral spider brooch have already raised over £5,000 for homeless charity ShelterLady Hale spider brooch t-shirts are on eBay - and profits are going to charityIn a remarkable moment for British history, today the country's most senior judge Lady Hale delivered the news that the prorogation of parliament was unlawful - whilst wearing a flesh-eating camel spider brooch.
Naturally, social media was soon inundated with pictures of the metaphoric fashion choice, and shortly after, a t-shirt bearing the same venomous spider design went up for sale on eBay.
An ominous black hue with a glittering silver spider motif just like Lady Hale's, the t-shirts cost £10 each - plus £2.95 shipping - with 30% of every sale going to homelessness charity Shelter.
Image: Internet Unknown) Internet Unknown)If that wasn't enough genius for one day, the company behind the t-shirts - Balcony Shirts - is ironically also from Boris' own constituency, based in Uxbridge.
Image: PA) PA)But it seems Lady Hale's penchant for brooches isn't solely limited to allegory-heavy camel spiders, as she's also been pictured touting plenty of other creepy crawlies, including frogs, beetles and even a caterpillar on her profile on the supreme court website.", 'One seller wrote 'won't be needing these' on an eBay advert for a pair of Thomas Cook cabin crew tightsThomas Cook memorabilia from last ever flights is on eBay - including sick bagsMemorabilia from Thomas Cook's last ever flights has been put up for sale online after the travel company's collapse.
There are adverts on eBay for blankets and even Jamaican ginger puddings from some of Thomas Cook's final flights.
In one tongue-in-cheek eBay advert for a Thomas Cook sick bag, the seller wrote: "This is a fine example of an unused Thomas Cook sick bag which after today is likely to become unique.
"Size 24 x 12 cm flat estimated capacity 1 pint of consumed Thomas Cook frothy beer.
Another post advertising a Thomas Cook Jamaican ginger pudding states that the dessert was retrieved from one of the airline's last flights.', '', 'How relevant is this ad to you?
Video player was slow to load content Video content never loaded Ad froze or did not finish loading Video content did not start after ad Audio on ad was too loud Other issues']

title: ['eBay CEO steps down as it continues to weigh selling off businesses - CNN', 'Glasgow Thomas Cook cabin crew selling uniforms and branded goods on eBay for up to £80... - The Scottish Sun', '7 incredible golf driving irons going for less than £50 on eBay - Golfmagic.com', 'Megabots Throws in the Towel and Puts Battle Robots on Ebay - Gizmodo', 'Devin Wenig butted heads with eBay board before resigning as ... - The Business Journals', 'EBay, San Jose Move Toward Sales-Tax Split Ahead of Proposed Ban - gvwire.com', 'MegaBots calls it quits, puts battle robots on eBay - Engadget', 'No Strings Attached Tax Deal Shows Depth of eBay-San Jose Ties - Bloomberg Tax', 'Devin Wenig steps down as eBay CEO - TechCrunch', "Thomas Cook 'last flight' items are being sold on eBay, including pilot's wings - Manchester Evening News", 'Uniforms, wings and sick bags: Thomas Cook items being flogged on eBay - Wales Online']
summary:
['New York CNN Business —EBay announced Wednesday that Devin Wenig has stepped down as president and CEO as the once dominant auction and shopping site continues to weigh selling off parts of its business.
Scott Schenkel, a longtime eBay (EBAY) executive, will take over as interim CEO while the board conducts a search for a permanent replacement.
Devin Wenig, seen here, is stepping down as the CEO of eBay as the company continues to weigh selling off businesses.
Elliott Management also recently took a large stake in AT&T, whose media division, WarnerMedia, is the parent company of CNN.
This year, eBay also announced a restructuring that would bring various regional marketplace units under one global leadership team.', 'THOMAS Cook cabin crew are auctioning off their old uniforms on eBay after 21,000 lost their jobs.
It comes after a shoe fetish creep offered to buy cabin heels from a Scots Thomas Cook stewardess - who joked: "Every little helps."
A Thomas Cook crew manual is currently being sold for £20, while a safety demonstration card is on offer for £10.
Some eBay sellers are also optimistically selling Thomas Cook gift cards for £2.
Passengers on one of the last Thomas Cook flights praised cabin crew as a Scottish passenger organised a £5,000 whip-round for devastated employees.', "The golf driving iron is the perfect option for anyone currently struggling with their driver off the tee or failing to hit clean hybrids off the fairway.
Okay you will need to give up some distance by doing so if you're taking a driving iron over a driver.
Many amateurs we speak to also claim to feel more confident standing over a driving iron than a hybrid, for example.
#6 - Titleist T-MB 3-ironA superb driving iron option, especially for single-figure players.
#7 - Titleist 716 2-ironAnother awesome player's driving iron from Titleist, this time with the 716 2-iron featuring a Project X 6.0 stiff shaft.", 'Megabots, a startup that was dedicated to bringing behemoth battle-robot entertainment to the masses, is selling off its assets before filing for bankruptcy.
On Monday, Megabots released a YouTube video advertising the sale of one of its most visible assets—the 15-ton Eagle Prime battle mech–and explaining why the company had to call it quits.
AdvertisementThe much-anticipated fight finally took place in October of 2017, raising hopes for an international league of warrior machines.
“I believe that the MegaBots league that we’re building will become one of the top three sports in the world within 10 years in terms of global audience, revenue, and engagement,” Megabots co-founder Brinkley Warren told CNBC at the time.
But, as Megabot co-founder Matt Oehrlein explained in the latest YouTube video, the sport hasn’t taken hold quite the way he had anticipated.', '', 'Bloomberg TaxEBay Inc. and its hometown, San Jose, Calif., are negotiating an agreement to split millions of dollars in local tax revenue from sales on the online marketplace, even as California’s governor weighs a bill to ban such pacts starting Jan. 1.
The City Council approved Sept. 24 allowing the city manager to negotiate and execute a 15-year agreement with eBay that would net the city between $5 million and $29.5 million a year.
eBay would get 30% of what’s collected above $5 million, which could add up to $150 million over 15 years.
“The proposed length of the Agreement, 15 years, aligns eBay’s and the City’s interests long-term, locking in the agreement amid the potential for regulatory or operational changes that could reduce the ability to collect these sales taxes in the future,” according to a memorandum prepared for the council.
Read More →', 'The era of giant battle robots appears to be over... although you might have a chance to bring it back.
MegaBots has gone bankrupt after once again running out of money, and it's auctioning its 16-foot-tall Eagle Prime robot on eBay as part of the shutdown.
The real challenges are the support costs, as MegaBots and its co-founder Matt Oehrlein explained.
There is at least some interest in Eagle Prime.
Oehrlein added that this was only the end to MegaBots "in its current form," and that people should "not feel bad" for him or the company.', 'Online marketplace eBay Inc’s long-term relationship with its hometown of San Jose, Calif., birthed a tax sharing agreement unlike any other—millions of dollars with no strings attached.
San Jose City Council on Sept. 24 gave its city manager the go-ahead to negotiate a 15-year pact with the online marketplace giant which could bring about $440 million in newfound taxes to the city and $150 million to eBay.
The agreement, which San Jose officials said was eBay’s idea, leverages the same local sales tax revenue that dozens of other cities have used in similarly structured deals, from nearby Cupertino in its ...', 'This morning eBay announced that Devin Wenig has stepped down from the role of CEO.
A former executive at Reuters, Wenig joined the company eight years ago this month as president of its global market place division.
He was appointed to the CEO role in July 2015, following eBay’s spin-off of PayPal.
“Today eBay suffers from an inefficient organizational structure, wasteful spend and a misallocation of resources,” it wrote in a letter at the time.
As part of these new changes up top, eBay will be appointing Andy Cring, vice president, Global Financial Planning and Analysis, to the position of interim CFO.', 'Invalid email Something went wrong, please try again later.
(Image: eBay)There's even a Thomas Cook Jamaican ginger pudding which was "retrieved from one of the last flights."
In one advert for a Thomas Cook Airlines Pilot Tie, the seller wrote: "Worn in battle on a daily basis!
Another ad, this time for a sick bag, the tongue-in-cheek description reads: "This is a fine example of an unused Thomas Cook sick bag which after today is likely to become unique.
(Image: eBay)"Size 24 x 12 cm flat estimated capacity 1 pint of consumed Thomas Cook frothy beer.', 'Thomas Cook collapsed early on Monday morning.
And it seems staff and customers are squeezing as much as they can out of Thomas Cook by flogging uniforms, wings, and even sick bags.
Leather binder with, pen, paper and wallets: Six beds, £10.50The listing says: "Authentic, made for Thomas Cook employees.
Senior first officer pilot jacket: £50(Image: eBay)The listing says: "Thomas Cook airlines senior first officer pilot jacket.
"This was a boarding pass for Thomas Cook flight MT1843 due to fly out 12.45pm September 23, 2019, the day Thomas Cook filed for voluntary liquidation.']

title: ['A giant fighting robot is on Ebay, no reserve - ZDNet']
summary:
['MegaBots, the innovator of giant fighting robots and the most successful effort to date to make a giant robotic fighting league sustainable, will soon fire for bankruptcy.
Most notably its 15-ton, two-story tall fighting robot, Eagle Prime, is up for no-reserve auction on Ebay.
As we covered back in 2016, the concept of giant robot sports was great for garnering attention but had a tough time getting liftoff.
Giant robot fighting, it seemed was not ready for prime time.
Though only one metric, it was an important indication that the appetite for nation-on-nation giant robot combat had dried up.']

title: ['eBay CEO Devin Wenig Resigns, Citing Differences with Board - Multichannel Merchant']
summary:
['eBay announced the resignation of President and CEO Devin Wenig, who said in departing after eight years at the helm that he’s been out of sync with the company’s new board, of which he was a member.
He will be replaced on an interim basis by Scott Schenkel, eBay’s senior vice president and CFO.
“Whenever (difference happen), it’s best for everyone to turn that page over,” Wenig said in a tweet.
CNBC reported that Schenkel joined eBay in 2007 as vice president of global financial planning and analysis.
Two months ago, Wenig sounded enthusiastic and upbeat about the company’s prospects as he keynoted the annual user event in Las Vegas.']

title: ['Vaping oils aimed at British children sold on eBay without age checks - The Mirror']
summary:
['But these are all vaping liquids for e-cigarettes – enticing kids to risk health issues and potentially develop a nicotine habit.
President Donald Trump said he is banning flavoured vaping liquids amid fears of an epidemic among teenagers.
Dan Marchant, of the UK Vaping Industry Association, said “ we strongly condemn any vaping products being sold to or targeted at youths”.
Krispy Kreme said: “We have no affiliation with these vaping products and this is misuse of our brand logo.
EBay said: “Age verification must be put in place by each seller and this is the responsibilty of each seller.']

title: ['eBay Froze Funds over Managed Payments Verification - EcommerceBytes', "Coles tackles Woolworths' online dominance with major new perk - Yahoo Finance Australia"]
summary:
["They too made it sound like I had to opt in on managed payments by a date in Oct or else.
If you have limited funds you won't be able to make a shipping label, so beware of that.
Right away a red flag came up for me, but the clincher is at this point, they told me they were holding any and all funds in my managed pending payments from eBay until I complied with this!!!!!!
Please tell everyone to NOT opt in to this managed payments because if you do, your money is never really yours and they will use it as blackmail against you.
As an elderly person I am on Social Security alone and eBay has always helped pull me through for bills and heating costs through the winter.", 'Image: GettyColes’ partnership with eBay has hit its “next phase”, with the online marketplace removing two major pain-points for online shoppers.
Coles and eBay partnered in March this year in a bid to tackle Woolworths’ online grocery dominance, offering products for the same price on eBay as they were in Coles’ bricks and mortar stores.
Additionally, shoppers will receive 5 per cent off every Coles on eBay shop under the “next phase”, and shoppers will also be able to select a time frame for products to be delivered.
“We know convenience and health are a priority, with Coles customers increasingly seeking to reclaim their time, with minimum compromise on freshness, quality, and flavour,” Coles Online chief executive Alister Jordan said.
Coles on eBay is available in metropolitan Melbourne, Sydney, Adelaide, Brisbane and Perth, with Coles weekly half-price deals available, as well as its national in-store price guarantee.']

title: ['Lansing punk rock record fetches $5350 on eBay - City Pulse', '‘Massive risk’: How Coles’ unlikely partnership with eBay could backfire - The New Daily', 'Corvette-Powered Battle Mech for Sale on eBay, Bidding Now at ... - autoevolution']
summary:
['', 'Coles and eBay have expanded their online grocery offerings, but retail experts say the collaboration is a confusing – and risky – one.
A lack of “real brand partnership strength” between Coles and eBay risks leaving customers “confused by the offering”, Dr Grimmer said.
‘Redundant’: eBay move could hurt ColesDeakin University marketing lecturer Michael Callaghan described Coles’ decision to partner with eBay as “redundant” considering the supermarket already has an online delivery service.
What Coles has been doing lately is too far too diversified, with far too much redundancy,” Dr Callaghan said.
However, by formally tying itself to eBay “there’s a massive risk” that Coles could dilute its brand and face backlash from customers, Dr Callaghan said.', 'The announcement the robot is for sale was made by the company last week, when they also decided to start the online bidding process at $1.
About seven days later, at the time of this writing, the largest bid sits at $152,000.The Eagle Prime is one of the few – if not the only – operational, piloted battle mechs in the world.
It is powered by an engine that is usually found on the Chevrolet Corvette C6 , the LS3 V8 that develops 430 horsepower.
Replacing them will cost about $7,000.Secondly, despite being a tracked vehicle, the robot doesn’t perform well on dirt.And last, but not least, “it will usually spring a hydraulic leak maybe every 4 hours or so of driving and crushing.”If you can live with those issues, that this robot, which cost an estimated $2.5 million to build, can be yours.
If you bid high enough, will get it complete with spare parts (radiator fans, filters, fuses, cables, and connectors) and extra weapons attachments.You can find out more details about the Eagle Prime in the attached below.']

title: ['Pair jailed for illegal ivory sales on eBay - Lexology']
summary:
['A South London pair have been jailed for illegally selling antique ivory fans worth £145,259 on eBay.
Destined for China, the parcels contained carved ivory fans for which there were no re-export permits.
Officers matched the sender of the parcel to a trader selling carved ivory items on eBay.
Officers from Scotland Yard’s wildlife crime unit raided the pair’s flat in March 2018 and discovered a further 291 carved ivory fans from protected or endangered species.
eBay has self-imposed a ban on selling ivory on its site for over a decade.']

title: ['eBay throws support to local entrepreneurs | Inquirer Business - INQUIRER.net']
summary:
['eBay, one of the world’s largest e-commerce platforms, expressed its support to help Philippine entrepreneurs become successful through its site www.ebay.ph.
In many cases, eBay sellers source their products from other markets so that they can offer brand new global releases not available anywhere else in the Philippines.
“As a platform, we are open to all shapes and sizes of sellers, from brands, retailers, B2C businesses and even casual sellers,” said Kwan.
eBay entered the Philippines in 2004, and remains a champion for local businesses.
This fall, eBay will also be introducing a digital film series, entitled “Together”, aimed at a new generation of online shoppers.']

title: ['eBay Bike Bargains - Bling Winter Bikes from Ribble, Giant ... - Road.cc', "Photo snapped up for £4.50 on eBay 'shows teenage Oscar Wilde' - The Times", 'Rare Sherlock Holmes 50p coin sells for £500 on eBay – do you have one in your spare change?... - The Sun']
summary:
["A good winter bike should be one that you don't mind riding through all weathers.
The classic club rider's winter bike.
These cable-actuated hydraulics are so much better at tackling the winter weather, providing predictable stopping power.
They're very comfy bikes, designed to deal with winter weather and they come with masses of tyre clearance and disc brakes too.
It's about as close to the perfect winter bike as you're likely to get.", 'The picture was taken at a studio in Dublin when Wilde was in his teensAn amateur historian has found on eBay what she claims is the only known photograph of a teenage Oscar Wilde.
Karen Ievers, from Co Clare, bought the picture for £4.50.
The Oscar Wilde Society has yet to verify whether it is a genuine find, but already Mrs Ievers, who has no degree in history, has been asked to give talks at museums and literary festivals.
SponsoredIn spite of offers from Sotheby’s, the auction house, to sell the item, she plans to hold on to it.
Mrs Ievers, 52, a mother of twins, explained that looking for Victorian photographs on the internet had become a hobby at the start of this year after she began researching her husband’s family.', '']

title: ['Climate activists use firetruck bought on eBay to spray U.K. ministry with fake blood - Global News']
summary:
['After the stunt, four activists stood atop the fire engine which had a banner saying “Stop funding climate death.” The steps of the Treasury were soaked in red paint.
Extinction Rebellion said its activists had sprayed 1,800 liters of fake blood at the Treasury.
The activists also sprayed the slogan “Stop funding climate death” on the walls of the building.
“It doesn’t see that eternal economic growth leads to climate death,” Ben said.
The British Treasury, which traces its history back to William the Conqueror, is located in a grand building between Buckingham Palace and the British parliament.']

title: ['Seller Says eBay Sales Turn On and Off - EcommerceBytes', 'Spawn #300 Gold Foil Selling for Over $600 on eBay - Bleeding Cool News', 'Frank Gore Rookie Cards Get No Respect on eBay - Sports Collectors Daily']
summary:
['Dear Ina,I've always been one of those folks who were on the fence regarding the "can't see me" (Cassini) search on eBay.
I am now convinced eBay either hides sellers on a rotating basis or hides individual listings.
Suddenly, on September 9th, I sold four lots to one buyer and then again on September 10th I sold another lot.
My price, including free shipping, would still be the best value on eBay today.
What I don't understand, is why this is happening at a company who is trying to squeeze every single penny out of every single seller.', '', '']

title: ['Reporting Bad Buyers to eBay Can Cost You - EcommerceBytes', 'eBay pays less than £10m tax in UK despite sales rising to over £1bn - inews', 'Adidas trainers that had people queuing for 3 days now on eBay for up to £56,000 - The Mirror']
summary:
['The topic came up in two recent threads on the eBay discussion boards - specifically disputes over returns - so we visited the eBay help pages for a refresher.
Remember, when you ask eBay to step in and help without successfully resolving the issue directly with your buyer and eBay finds on behalf of the buyer, it will result in a defect."
eBay doesn't dispute the fact there are bad buyers on its site.
But if sellers are concerned they may have encountered a bad buyer and ask eBay for help, eBay will penalize them for doing so if it finds in favor of the buyer.
If eBay wanted to root out bad buyers, wouldn't they encourage sellers to tell them when they suspect a customer is abusing its policies?', 'Shopping website eBay paid less than £10m tax in the UK last year, even as profits at its British arm doubled and revenue surged past £1bn.
Excluding this additional payment, tax for 2017 was £6.2m, meaning 2018’s tax bill was 53 per cent higher.
Tech giants save on taxIt is the latest US tech company to unveil its UK tax bill after Netflix’s accounts last week revealed it had paid no tax for 2018 despite raking in about £700m from UK subscribers.
Holiday accommodation booking platform Airbnb has also published its UK accounts over the weekend, revealing it paid under £400,000 in tax last year, despite bringing in more than £300m in sales.
The tech company has previously been vocal on the subject, arguing in August that Britain’s small and medium enterprises should be given a voice in the country’s future trade relationships.', 'Adidas trainers that had people queuing for 3 days now on eBay for up to £56,000A limited edition pair of Adidas trainers that people queued THREE DAYS for are now being sold on eBay for up to £56,000.
Image: Adidas) Adidas) Image: Lee McLean / SWNS) Lee McLean / SWNS)But within hours of their release, trainers were being auctioned off on eBay, with a size five pair having bids of £56,000.
Image: Lee McLean / SWNS) Lee McLean / SWNS)"I'll even throw a green sleeping bag in."
Image: Lee McLean / SWNS) Lee McLean / SWNS) Image: Lee McLean / SWNS) Lee McLean / SWNS)The proceeds from the initial launch day for the shoes are going towards the Nightsafe charity, which helps vulnerable, homeless youngsters.
Image: Lee McLean / SWNS) Lee McLean / SWNS)"The Blackburn shoe coming out tomorrow is a real throwback to the early days.']

title: ['Jared Dines is selling his custom 18-string Ormsby guitar on eBay - Guitar World', 'Adidas trainers are selling on eBay for up to £56,000 - but the reason why might surprise you - Manchester Evening News', 'No wing, no Hemi. This Dodge Charger Daytona is two-tone and tufted - Autoblog', 'The lovable llama hug pillow selling on eBay for less than a tenner that nobody can resist - Daily Record']
summary:
['Back in 2018, YouTuber Jared Dines introduced his Ormsby 18-string, Tasmanian-blackwood-and-stone-top electric guitar to the world.
Now, Dines and Stevie T have teamed up once again, this time putting their combined 38 strings to use for a good cause.
(Image credit: courtesy of Jared Dines)Says Dines, “The 18-string guitar, it’s awesome and I love it.
You can bid on Dines’ guitar here (opens in new tab).
And stay tuned to Guitar World for more information on Stevie T’s 20-string auction.', 'Sign up for our daily newsletter to get the day's biggest stories sent direct to your inboxLimited edition Adidas trainers have been spotted selling on eBay for eye-watering sums of money.
But within hours of being released the trainers started to appear on eBay for huge sums of money.
According to The Mirror , one size 5 pair of trainers had bids for up to £56,000, while another pair looked set to reach £50,100.
The description read: "This is a limited edition release to highlight the homeless people on the streets of Blackburn.
"And as well as the brown SPEZIAL swing tag, you also get a red leather limited edition swing tag.', 'In between the Dodge Charger Daytona's 1969 debut as a wild, winged NASCAR warrior and the current 2020 Charger SRT Hellcat Widebody Daytona 50th Anniversary Edition with its monster 717-hp Hemi V8, the nameplate had some ... less-glorious years.
The nameplate first resurfaced in 1975, when the Charger moved into the "personal luxury" space as a riff on the Chrysler Cordoba.
This 1975 Charger Daytona might not be the model's heyday, but damn if this clean machine, surfaced by Barnfinds.com, isn't striking in its own Me Decade kind of way.
Outside, this dynamic Dodge sports two-tone silver and blue paint, alloy wheels with white-letter tires, and a power sunroof.
It may not be the car that pops immediately to mind when someone says, "Charger Daytona," but with less than 12,000 miles showing, this mid-Seventies example is a time warp to a lesser-known era for the marque.', 'Described on eBay as a “Soft Plush Llama Alpaca Hug Pillow Cushion Fluffy Doll Kid Sofa Home Decor Toy” this 45cm bundle of woolly joy is available in red or white and selling fast.
The product description states the llama is “perfect for all ages” and that the “hair” can be removed and washed.
It also describes how the llama can be used as a neck, head, office or lumbar pillow and for home or garden decor.
(Image: eBay)A brand new “alpaca mokomoko hug pillow” costs £9.99 and comes in the original retail packaging.
There’s also free delivery and a 30-day returns guaratee.']

VIEW THE DEAL HERESRIXON AD333How many balls: 36Current bid: £3.20"Pearl Grade and Mint Grade x21; A Grade x15."', 'Keep up to date with the latest stories with our WalesOnline newsletterA woman who used to work for Thomas Cook has put her wedding dress on eBay as she looks to make ends meet.
Me and my husband were both made redundant form Thomas Cook and it has turned our world upside down.
Some have sold their Thomas Cook uniforms, with full female flight attendant get-up fetching £100.

title: ['Boston Celtics ranked as fourth-most popular NBA team by eBay - Celtics Wire', 'musicMagpie: first business in the world to achieve 10m reviews on ... - Marketing Stockport news feed', 'Just $1050 will bag you a limited-edition Newton MessagePad on ... - Cult of Mac']
summary:
['[jwplayer 5jJoiytU-z6KDnl0B]The Boston Celtics brand remains strong as ever, at least according to one site.
Based on eBay merchandise sales from last October to this October, the Celtics are the fourth-most popular NBA team in the league when considering their overall mercy sales.
The Lakers are the Celtics’ historical rival, so their beating out Boston is particularly notable.
Considering where the Raptors ranked (6th-overall), winning a championship this season may or may not make the team more popular.
However, with an influx of young players with plenty of potential and a larger stage for Walker to shine, Boston may very well be even more popular next season.', 'The UK’s number one phone recycler, Stockport based musicMagpie, has become the first business in the world to have achieved 10m reviews on eBay.
The business is set to exceed £130m in Group revenue this year, and has seen accelerated growth since the introduction of its consumer technology offering and also establishing its US business, Decluttr which is based in Atlanta, Georgia.
Steve Oliver, co-Founder and CEO of musicMagpie, said:“The business has grown significantly again in the past few years and we are immensely proud to have achieved 10 million global reviews on eBay.
It gives us confidence in our business proposition and really solidifies the trust we have gained as a brand that’s recognised worldwide.
In addition to all of its successes this year, the brand achieved 100,000 reviews on Trustpilot, becoming one of only a handful of brands worldwide to do so.', 'The Newton MessagePad is probably the single most underrated product in Apple’s entire history.
The clear, limited production prototype Newton MessagePad 110 was given out to a select few people at Apple’s 1994 developer conference.
“Up for sale is a CLEAR Apple Newton MessagePad 110 PDA + TONS OF EXTRAS all original,” reads the eBay listing.
Newton MessagePad: A device worth an eBay purchaseThe Newton MessagePad 110 was a second-gen model of Apple’s revolutionary PDA device.
Still, as bits of tech history go, this clear Newton MessagePad is certainly a piece that many Apple fans would love to own.']

title: ["Facebook's libra cryptocurrency coalition is falling apart as eBay, Visa, Mastercard and Stripe jump ship - CNBC", "New Nintendo Switch Now Available For $270 In Ebay's Huge Gaming Sale - GameSpot"]
summary:
['A Stripe spokesperson said in a statement that the company "is supportive of projects that aim to make online commerce more accessible for people around the world."
Stripe will "remain open to working with the Libra Association at a later stage," the spokesperson said.
EBay , Stripe, Mastercard , Visa and Mercado Pago are all dropping out of Facebook's libra cryptocurrency project, the companies announced Friday.
The Libra Association, the nonprofit in charge of managing the cryptocurrency, said Friday afternoon it is still looking to move forward.
We look forward to the inaugural Libra Association Council meeting in just 3 days and announcing the initial members of the Libra Association."', "Throughout this weekend, Ebay is offering major discounts on consoles, games, accessories, gaming laptops, and more as part of its first-ever gaming weekend sale.
While originally discounted to $280 this morning, the Switch is now even cheaper, selling for $270.
Nintendo Switch | $270 ( $300 )See at EbayMore great gaming dealsConsoles and accessoriesIf you're looking for a new console this holiday season, multiple Xbox One bundles and the PlayStation 4 Pro are on sale.
The weekend sale features a bunch of awesome Switch games at discounted prices, including the recently released (and wonderful) The Legend of Zelda: Link's Awakening.

title: ['Ceramic Christmas Trees Bring in $100-$200 on Ebay - House Beautiful']
summary:
["Growing up, your parents, grandma, or garage-sale-loving aunt and uncle probably had a ceramic tree on their shelf or console table around the holidays.
According to Today, vintage ceramic trees are selling like mad on eBay for amounts that can range from about $100 to $200.
“Everyone who took a ceramics class and celebrated Christmas made one of these trees,” Bob Richter said.
“People put them on top of the television, back when the TV was a piece of furniture.”More From House Beautiful play icon The triangle icon that indicates to playThe ceramic craze is making a comeback, with vintage ceramic trees featuring stars, light designs and touches of snow.

title: ['Did an eBay Change Impact Auction Sniping Ability? - EcommerceBytes', 'Caramilk chocolate being sold for an extraordinary price on eBay - 7NEWS']
summary:
['Dear Ina,Not sure if this has come up but the bid sniping service that I use on eBay just informed everyone that eBay just changed their logons purposely to kill bid sniping.
The bid sniping service is still trying to find a work around and is estimating at least 2 weeks for a solution.
In the meantime, one seller that I was trying to get some items from lost out big time when my snipe bids didn’t work.
So I’m assuming lots of other sellers are losing out on higher selling prices on auction sales with this latest change.', 'Since it was leaked online that Cadbury Caramilk was coming back to our supermarket shelves shoppers have gone nuts with excitement.

title: ['Use Caution with eBay Multi User Account Access - EcommerceBytes', "Mum 'realises any fingerprint can unlock her Samsung' with eBay screen protector - The Mirror"]
summary:
['A seller published a cautionary tale on the eBay boards about the new Multi User Account Access tool.
Multi-User Account Access can improve your business efficiency by providing additional support for basic listing functions without exposing your password and critical business information to designated users."
- When multi-user access first became available on eBay, I got excited thinking it would be like Amazon has it.
An eBay moderator provided the following response:This situation is something we cover in our Multi-User Account Access FAQ ( here ).
Answer: The MUAA Beta program is currently restricting Delegatee access to new or existing users with a US eBay account.', "Lisa Neilson, 34, from Castleford, bought the cover from eBay in the hopes of protecting her Galaxy S10 smartphoneMum 'realises any fingerprint can unlock her Samsung' with eBay screen protectorA mum in West Yorkshire says she was shocked to discover any fingerprint could unlock her Samsung smartphone after she’d fitted a £2.70 screen protector .
Lisa Neilson, 34, from Castleford, bought the cover from eBay in the hopes of protecting her Galaxy S10 smartphone.
However, once she'd set up her right and left thumb prints to unlock the smartphone, she says she discovered that others could also use their prints to access the device.
The mother-of-two also tested the screen protector on her sister’s Samsung smartphone, and claims she discovered the same effect.
Image: NB PRESS LTD) NB PRESS LTD) Image: NB PRESS LTD) NB PRESS LTD)She added: “We called Samsung because we thought there was a fault with the phone."]

title: ['Live 5 Scambusters: DirecTV imposters scam Lowcountry man using fake eBay promotion - Live 5 News WCSC', 'Florida man uses badge from eBay to impersonate officer, police say - WKMG News 6 & ClickOrlando', 'eBay trader jailed after being caught with elephant tusk - Lincolnshire Live']
summary:
['A Lowcountry man, who asked to be identified as “Rocky,” thought he’d found a great deal to save money on DirecTV.
“They were believable.”Rocky said the scam started with a text message, offering a 50 percent discount on his DirecTV monthly bill.
He called the phone number provided in the text message and spoke to someone claiming to be a sales representative for DirecTV.
Rocky was still eligible for the promotion but needed to buy $690 worth of eBay cards and resubmit the payment.
“I said ‘Hey I got this text’ and the lady kind of chuckled as soon as I said eBay cards,” ROckay said.', "Authorities say a man was attempting to impersonate an officer.
ORLANDO, Fla. – A Florida man used a badge he purchased from eBay and red and blue lights installed in his vehicle in an attempt to impersonate a law enforcement officer, according to the Orlando Police Department.
Santiago told the officer that he is not in law enforcement, but his cousin is a trooper, records show.
Santiago told the officer he's volunteered extensively with law enforcement agencies and didn't think it was illegal to use red and blue lights to gain certain traffic privileges, according to the affidavit.
He was arrested on charges of falsely impersonating an officer, prohibited use of certain lights and unlawful use of a police badge.", 'A judge told Kazmierczak, who is based in Spalding, that the illegal trade in ivory "fed the destruction of elephants."
Carbon dating of the bracelets showed the ivory came from an elephant killed after 1960, and the figurine was carved out of ivory from an elephant killed after 1955.
Kazmierczak told officers he began trading on eBay after he was badly injured in a car crash and could not work to support his wife and four children.
The judge told Kazmierczak he had also taken steps clearly designed to deceive the authorities.
Two of the charges related to Kazmierczak purchasing prohibited sections of unworked elephant tusk between May 2013 and May 2017.']

title: ["'Don't drink and bid': Jared Dines' 18-string guitar eBay charity ... - Guitar World", "'Greedy' Calderdale mum jailed over eBay car parts scam which cost ... - Halifax Courier"]
summary:
['Earlier this month we reported that YouTuber Jared Dines was selling his 18-string, Tasmanian-blackwood-and-stone-top Ormsby electric guitar on eBay, and planned to use the funds to purchase instruments for children whose families were unable to afford them on their own.
But, as Dines laments in the above video, "the highest bidder just messaged me and said, 'Don't drink and bid on eBay.
Except for the fact that, as Dines explains, “the person behind him also messaged me and said, 'I got drunk and bid on eBay.'
(Image credit: courtesy of Jared Dines)Dines goes on to say that he’s hesitant to re-list the Ormsby out of concern he’ll just get “trolled” again.
Stay tuned - and stay sober - for updates on when and how Dines proceeds.', 'Sarah Hardaker from Halifax has been jailedA “greedy” Halifax mum-of-two has been jailed for 18 months for her role in a car parts scam which cost her employer more than £90,000.
Miss Pencheon said checks on eBay revealed that car parts were being sold on the site and some of the photographs of the items even showed the warehouse floor in the background.
She said it had been agreed that between February 2016 and March 2017 Hardaker had been involved in the theft of car parts worth £92,406.56.
Advertisement Hide AdAdvertisement Hide AdShe explained that Hardaker, who now had another job, had saved up about £1200 towards repaying her former employer and she urged Judge Jonathan Rose to suspend any prison sentence.
