title: ['Collector gets police visit after buying endangered crocodile skull on eBay - Daily Mail']
summary:
["Police were called to a man's home in Wiltshire after finding he had snapped up an endangered crocodile skull on eBay for £30.
The man, in his 20s, illegally bought the Siamese crocodile skull online and had it shipped from China.
The Siamese crocodile population is slowly diminishing with only small numbers in Cambodia, Indonesia, Lao PDR, Thailand and VietnamThe Siamese Crocodile is a critically endangered Annex A species under the Control of Trade in Endangered Species (COTES) Regulations.
According to the IUCN Red List, the total Siamese crocodile population size is around 500-1000 mature individuals.
The illegal trade in endangered species is a huge international business, which makes profits for the poachers, traffickers and traders."]

title: ['Unclaimed property in Massachusetts for sale on eBay - WWLP.com', 'Fake cosmetic surgeon admits killing woman by pumping eBay silicone in her butt - Metro.co.uk']
summary:
['Days before the first 100 lots are set to open for bidding in this year’s unclaimed property auction, Treasurer Deborah Goldberg displayed some of the goods in her office.
The pair of rings — which staff in the treasurer’s office believe were converted from earrings, and expect to fetch upwards of $10,000 each — are among the centerpieces in the collection of unclaimed property Goldberg’s office plans to sell in an online auction set to begin Saturday.
Treasurer Deborah Goldberg held an engraved spoon she said is “one of the most fascinating” items in this year’s unclaimed property auction.
[Photo: Katie Lannan/SHNS]The treasurer’s office has said the vast majority of auction items come from safe deposit boxes whose contents have gone unclaimed for at least nine years.
Once the property is turned over to the state, the treasurer’s unclaimed property division attempts to reach owners through outreach and advertising, and holds preview events at various locations.', 'Donna Francis (left) has pleaded guilty to criminally negligent homicide for the death of Kelly Mayhew in 2015.
(Picture: Central News)A unlicensed cosmetic surgeon admitted killing a woman during a botched butt lift which saw silicone bought on eBay pumped in the woman’s butt.
Donna Francis, 39, pleaded guilty on Friday to criminally negligent homicide for the death of Kelly Mayhew in Queens, New York in 2015.
Francis injected Mayhew’s buttocks with liquid silicone on a massage table in a makeshift ‘office’ in her basement.
After Francis pleaded guilty, the judge said her crime was reprehensible and he would give her a longer sentence if he could.']

title: ["Former eBay CEO John Donahoe will become Nike's new CEO as ... - GeekWire", 'Alfa Romeo GTV-6 for Sale on eBay In Need of a Restoration - Road & Track', 'Nike CEO Mark Parker to step down—ex-eBay CEO John Donahoe to replace him - CNBC', "Mike Mignola's First Hellboy From 1991 Sells For $5000 on eBay - Bleeding Cool News"]
summary:
['', "The Alfa Romeo GTV-6 is a steadily appreciating classic, so this 1982 model, recently pulled out of a barn in Michigan, could be a worthwhile project.
Despite sitting inside for so long, it looks as if this Alfa couldn't avoid the typical rust that comes along with car ownership in the mid-west.
The car looks straight and complete otherwise, with the interior, OEM wheels, and glass accounted for.
The GTV-6 came from the factory with a 2.5-liter Busso V-6 when new, sending power to the rear wheels via a rear-mounted five-speed transaxle.
Getting a GTV-6 in this condition road-worthy is no easy task, and will surely cost a lot of money.", 'watch nowNike said Tuesday afternoon its longtime CEO Mark Parker is stepping down, effective January of next year.
In a sign of the company's focus on digital, he will be replaced by John Donahoe, a Nike board member and the CEO of ServiceNow .
Nike shares seesawed in after-hours trading on the news and were last up less than 1%.
Parker, who has been Nike's CEO since he took over from founder Phil Knight in 2006, will become the company's executive chairman, according to the press release.
Parker said in an interview with CNBC's Wilfred Frost that Donahoe is "no stranger" at Nike and decidedly is "the best choice to come in."', '']

title: ['People Are Paying Huge Sums of Money for Movie Props on eBay - ScreenCrush', "Don't Let This Ebay Gift Card Scam Happen To You - WFMYNews2.com", 'Nike CEO Mark Parker hands over role to former eBay chief John Donahoe - The Indian Express', 'eBay calls on garages to use recycled car parts in repairs - Motor Trader']
summary:
['There is also a thriving eBay marketplace for movie props.
Sometimes, it’s easy to understand why; it’s a key object from a beloved movie.
Below are 20 props that recently sold on eBay for top dollar.
They are reminder that there is someone out there who loves basically every movie on Earth.
And they would pay a lot money to own a small piece of that thing they love.', 'Don’t Let This Ebay Gift Card Scam Happen To YouThe man was called and told his grandson was jail.
A man posing as a police sergeant said he needed to get Ebay gift cards in order to bail him out.', 'In this March 16, 2016, file photo Nike CEO Mark Parker speaks during a news conference in New York.
(AP Photo: Mary Altaffer)Nike Inc’s long-time chief executive officer, Mark Parker, will step down next year and be replaced by board member and former eBay CEO John Donahoe, who will be tasked with strengthening the sportswear maker’s online strategy.
Donahoe, who has been on Nike’s board since 2014, will join the sneaker maker from cloud computing firm ServiceNow Inc , where he was CEO for more than four years.
He will become Nike’s executive chairman and continue to lead the board after Donahoe takes over as CEO.
Edward Jones analyst Brian Yarbrough said Donahoe’s e-commerce experience could help with Nike’s online push, while Parker could focus more on product development, one of his key strengths.', 'A commitment to always offer reused or remanufactured vehicle parts by insurance companies and garages would bring the UK in line with France, where the Government passed a Circular Economy Law in February 2019, in which the use of recycled vehicle parts in repairs is mandatory.
Estimates suggest just 2% of vehicle repairs in the UK use recycled parts, well behind nations including New Zealand, the USA, and Australia.
This is despite the fact that most insurance policies allow for the use of reused parts.
Laura richards, senior automotive business manager at eBay UK, said: “Increasing the use of reused car parts in vehicle repairs in the UK would see huge environmental benefits, as well as helping to drastically reduce pressure on premiums.
“With eBay’s support, we’re hoping more insurers and consumers will start to recognise the advantages of using recycled car parts.”']

title: ['The best superbikes you can buy on eBay - Cyclist', 'V-8-Swapped Pontiac Fiero for Sale on eBay Motors - Road & Track', 'Wolverhampton business owner star of eBay billboard campaign - Express & Star', "Supreme's SF store opening draws massive crowds, flurry of eBay ... - Hoodline"]
summary:
['But hey, never let the truth get in the way of a good story and instead bask in the fact this bike comes with a signed letter of authenticity from Matty White himself.
Miguel Indurain’s 1994 Banesto Pinarello, £45,800Own this piece of history by buying hereThis is currently the most expensive bike on eBay, and we can understand why.
This bike comes with provenance in the form of Mig’s own signature on the its top tube.
Colnago Ferrari CF2 with Colnago stand, £3,495Buy now from eBay hereNow, there are plenty of bikes on eBay better than this Colnago Ferrari CF2 mountain bike.
That’s right, that massive red plastic lump comes with the bike, which makes this auction nothing short of spectacularly kitsch.', "Interested in owning a car like the new mid-engine C8 Corvette, but don't want to drop $60,000 on a new car?
This V-8-swapped 1987 Pontiac Fiero is the perfect alternative.
The Fiero, produced in the 1980s, was General Motors' first attempt at a mass-produced mid-engine car.
The car has done 10,000 further miles since the swap, meaning the powertrain still has incredibly low miles.
The two-tone blue and silver paint shines nicely, though judging by the pictures, it needs some work to be perfect.", "Vita Kreslina next to her billboard on Cannock RoadVita Kreslina is the star of the online giant's new billboard campaign which will see her appear on several posters around the city.
She has since seen significant growth of her business, with sales worth around £40,000 since the start of this year.
It feels surreal to see myself on a billboard in the centre of town, but I’m honoured to represent the local business community.
“The Retail Revival scheme was a fantastic opportunity to meet like-minded entrepreneurs and exchange insights, which has been hugely valuable to improving my eBay store.
“We are delighted Vita and all the other city businesses involved are benefitting so greatly from the Retail Revival programme.", '']

title: ['Apple AirPods 2 drop to $125, the lowest price ever, on eBay today only - AppleInsider', 'eBay American Girl Dolls Selling Price - Apartment Therapy', 'This beautiful 1984 Ford F-150 has only 82,000 miles - Autoblog', "The Weird World of 'Haunted' eBay: 'Purchase With Caution ... - The New York Times", "Google's limited edition Pixel 4 cereal boxes are selling on eBay for £2,000 - The Mirror", 'Man who bought illegal pepper spray from eBay ends up in court - Worcester News']
summary:
["Apple AirPods 2 drop to $125, the lowest price ever, on eBay today onlyIf you buy through our links, we may get a commission.
Read our ethics policyArticle Hero ImageAs part of eBay's pre-Black Friday sale, shoppers can pick up Apple AirPods 2 for a record low $125.
AirPods price dropThis deal on 2019 Apple AirPods with Charging Case delivers the lowest price we've seen on the popular accessory and is $20 cheaper than Amazon's lowest price.
To snap up the flash deal, shop through this eBay AirPods page and look for the discounted price.
AirPods 2 eBay deal2019 Apple AirPods with Charging Case : $125 @ eBay ($35 off) - Deal expiredAlternative AirPods dealsAdditional Apple DealsAppleInsider and Apple authorized resellers are also running a handful of additional exclusive savings this month on Apple hardware that will not only deliver the lowest prices on many of the items, but also throw in instant discounts on AppleCare and accessories.", 'Rowland founded the Pleasant Company in 1986 and started a childhood phenomenon with books, detailed dolls, and period accessories overflowing out of the toy chest.
They were so popular that we’re guessing it’s highly likely a doll and a handful of her accessories still reside in your closet or are stowed away in an attic.
These children’s toys are worth a pretty penny these days on eBay, especially the rare, discontinued dolls from the original historical collection that bring in bids of nearly $3,000.', "Some sort of fun upholstery usually helps, too.
Well, this beautiful 1984 Ford F-150 XLT short-bed regular cab pickup for sale on eBay checks all the boxes.
Finally, it has a matching blue interior with complementary wood trim and, ta-da!, tastefully fun upholstery.
Both those items came with the XLT trim along with the aluminum tailgate trim.
The asking price on eBay is $18,500, which may seem steep, but hey, it's a very nice classic truck.", '“BUYER BEWARE,” warns the eBay listing for the “Haunted Vintage Antique Evil Active Possessed Witch Demon Doll.” “So many things have happened when this doll is near,” writes sellintreasures-7.
The item was described as a “haunted box,” and he immediately began searching for others.
Oglander describes himself as a “collector of aesthetics,” and his material is the ephemera of the world around us.
The “haunted” eBay listings include many ordinary objects: feathers, coins, pebbles, pieces of wood.
I want to at least hope that there’s some magic in the world — some underlying thing we can’t see.”Still, he has never bought a “haunted” item.', 'Google sent the limited edition cereal boxes to the first 2,000 customer who pre-ordered the Pixel 4This week, Google fans have finally been able to get their hands on the tech giant’s latest flagship smartphones - the Pixel 4 and Pixel 4 XL.
To celebrate the launch, Google also launched 2,000 limited-edition Google Pixel 4 ‘cereal boxes’.
The cereal boxes feature a back-of-the-box maze that takes customers past ‘Moonlight Mountain’, in a nod to the Pixel 4’s Night Sight astrophotography mode.
They were sent to the first 2,000 customers who pre-orders the Pixel 4 on the Google Store, and now it seems that many crafty customers are already selling the cereal boxes on.
Several cereal boxes have been listed on eBay, with eye-watering price tags.', 'Reece Mason admitted possession of a weapon for the discharge of a noxious liquid when he appeared at Worcester Magistrates Court - but said he believed he was legally allowed to buy it from the auction site.
The court heard he bought it as animal repellent but it was actually pepper spray that can only be carried with ‘the authority of the Secretary of State.’Emily Clewer, prosecuting, said police stopped Mason’s car in Worcester Road, Droitwich.
She said: “Police carried out a search of the car and found the cannister of pepper spray.
“He purchased that spray from eBay,” Mr Murria said.
The magistrates also ordered the seizure of the pepper spray, and the destruction of the drugs.']

title: ['Engineless Lamborghini Espada for Sale on eBay in Italy - Road & Track', "Matt Damon Begrudgingly Accepts $50 In eBay Auction For 'The ... - The Onion", 'Father of three who washed and sold used stamps on eBay is jailed - Birmingham Live']
summary:
["This forlorned Lamborghini Espada might be the perfect candidate.
It's missing its drivetrain and most of its front suspension, and looks to be in desperate need of a restoration.
It's been stripped of its original V-12 engine and manual transmission, as well as its front subframe and suspension parts.
Aside from the missing pieces, the car looks to be in good condition, with minimal surface rust underneath.
If you're on the search for a project you can really dig into this season, this seems like the perfect opportunity.", 'LOS ANGELES—Visibly annoyed after his auction closed with a winning bid far below his expectations, actor Matt Damon begrudgingly accepted $50 Monday from the eBay auction of his cast and crew jacket from the sci-fi thriller The Martian.
“I had assumed there would be a bidding war or something, but almost no one bit.
And I was banking on using the cash from this to cover my acting classes.
As it is, I’m actually losing a little money on the whole thing.
I should have never agreed to pay shipping on this.” Damon’s mood reportedly changed to anger after learning the person who bought the jacket resold the item in two days later for $475.', 'He was caught because he started using the stamps on his own post - alerting Royal Mail staff.
"He sold them on eBay at a significant discount, up to 50 per cent of their face value.
Over the two year period he sold stamps with a face value of £241,000 and received £114,000.
In passing sentence Judge Paul Farrer QC, said that Khan had sold stamps on eBay on 3,000 occasions and that he had "acquired the expertise and equipment to wash them."
It caused very significant losses to Royal Mail and there was some element of sophistication."']

title: ['Ruten to join forces with Rakuten and eBay for Double 11 - 台北時報', 'Woman gives her stairs a glitzy makeover using diamantés and £29 eBay mats... - The Sun', 'Currys PC World latest to be hit by eBay scam after PayPal copycats steal up to £500k - This is Money']
summary:
['Ruten to join forces with Rakuten and eBay for Double 11Staff writer, with CNARuten.com (露天拍賣), a subsidiary of PChome Online Inc (網路家庭), yesterday said that it is to form a strategic alliance with US-based eBay Inc and Japan’s Rakuten Global Market to sell 70 million products during the Double 11 “shopping festival,” with the aim of selling more than NT$10 billion (US$327 million) of goods.
It is the first time that the company is collaborating with eBay and Rakuten by integrating their cross-border e-commerce platforms, Ruten chief operating officer Vicky Tseng (曾薰儀) said.
Ruten.com chief operating officer Vicky Tseng poses for a photograph at a news conference in Taipei yesterday, after the company announced it would be teaming up with eBay Inc and Rakuten Global Market for the Double 11 shopping promotion.
The number of items sold on Ruten’s site is about 420 million, and of the 70 million items introduced for the Double 11 shopping promotion this year, 60 percent would be from the US, 20 percent from the greater China region, and the rest mainly from Japan and South Korea, she said.
Transactions on Ruten’s online platform surpassed NT$8 billion during last year’s Double 11 festival, Tseng said.', 'A WOMAN revealed how she managed to revamp her staircase by adding a touch of glitz and glamour and some eBay bargains.
One woman was tired of her stairs and decided they needed a makeover, but was left reeling at the cost of carpeting them.
Sharing her handiwork on Facebook group Money saving tips and deals, she said: “Done on a budget not everyone’s cup of tea but I love it so easy to do.
She achieved the rest of the look by sanding down the stairs and painting them, before gluing on some diamantés.
Meanwhile this mum spruced up her sofa for just £26 using covers off eBay.', "However, rather than Currys PC World, the money instead went to a fraudster who had set up an alternative PayPal account.
Ebay has continued to deny to our reader that any security issue took place, while Currys PC World has no evidence this was the case.
Our reader told us he thought the fraudster had banked on there not being anyone monitoring the eBay listings from Currys PC World at that time.
'We are working closely with Currys PC World on an investigation into the matter.'
Our reader has not yet received a refund, though has received a £50 Currys PC World voucher."]

title: ['A plants business in West Norfolk is named a winner in the prestigious eBay Business Awards - Lynn News', 'How dad of three who washed and sold used stamps on eBay was rumbled by police after key mistake - Birmingham Live']
summary:
["A couple who own a plants business in Pott Row are celebrating receiving a prestigious UK accolade awarded at this year's eBay Business Awards which took place last night.
Shaun and Karina O’Brien, owners of Direct Plants, based at Mill Hill Nursery, Cliff-en-howe Road, were among 11 eBay sellers recognised for their success at the national event, which took place in London.
The winning business initially began as a small garden nursery selling plants and fish, set up by Shaun’s parents, Linda and Pat O’Brien, 30 years ago.
Shaun and Karina O’Brien, added: “It’s hard to believe how far we have come since we started selling on eBay.
Winning this award is the icing on the cake.”The eBay for Business Awards is designed to recognise and celebrate the most inspiring sellers among eBay UK’s community of 300,000 small and medium-sized businesses.", 'He was passing off used stamps as new and selling them on eBay, and was discovered to have 60 kilos of stamps at his home when it was searched by police.
Khan was purchasing used stamps and he then adapted them so they would pass off as unused.
However Mr Gow said Khan "gave himself away" in a number of ways including using the washed stamps on his own parcels.
Over the two year period he sold stamps with a face value of £241,000 and received £114,000.
It also lead them to Billesley Post Office where they recovered 81 items sent out by the defendant with washed stamps.']

title: ['Buyer Charged Twice through eBay Managed Payments - EcommerceBytes', 'Dad spends £15,000 converting a hearse from eBay into a Ghostbusters car... - The Irish Sun', 'Retro Kenner Family Tree House toy selling for $500 - Kidspot']
summary:
["I ordered some items using eBay's new managed payments system to pay via debit from my account.
I went to balance my account a couple days later and was deducted 2x for the same item.
Called eBay and they said I was only charged once.
Skip all that and go right to the source if that happens to any of you.
They tried to push it to PayPal who had nothing to do with it.", 'A BRITISH father has spent £15,000 converting a former hearse into a Ghostbusters car.
6 Ross Wainwright spent £15,000 converting a former hearse into a Ghostbusters car Credit: Mercury PressThe dad-of-two planned to convert the funeral car into an exact replica of the motor in the 1984 classic over a year.
Along with his wife Kim, the pair spent more than 200 hours working on the car - often until 11pm at night.
“I said to my wife ‘that could be made into a Ghostbusters car’.
When we first started converting the hearse, they asked if we’d be able to do a school run in the Ghostbusters car when it was finished.', '']

title: ['Third of gold sold on Amazon and eBay could be fake – how to spot it... - The Sun', 'People Are Selling Poundland Homeware For 10x The Original Price On eBay - Tyla', '2010 Pontiac Trans Am Camaro Conversion For Sale On eBay - GM Authority']
summary:
['MORE than a third of "gold" jewellery sold on websites such as Amazon and eBay could be fake.
Out of 17,657 online gold listings checked over a 10-day period, 6,377 of them weren't advertised as hallmarked, a study has found.
Overall, eBay sellers alone accounted for 56 per cent of all suspect items of "gold" jewellery being sold online, where there was no mention of a hallmark.
The research suggested there could be around 150,000 items of fake gold jewellery listed for sale online in the UK each year.
A few years ago, deals website Groupon was accused of "conning shoppers by flogging fake gold jewellery".', 'Here's a lesson in checking that things you buy second hand aren't still on sale: people are selling Poundland's vases for ten times the price on eBay.
The animal vases - costing, you guessed it, £1 - are being flogged on the selling site for over £10 in some cases.
"Yes I've heard about people selling poundshop stuff on etsy and calling its vintage and giving it a massive price," said another.
And the vases aren't the only Poundland product to be getting their second wind on selling sites.
Commenters on the Facebook post also shared their discoveries of people selling all manner of Poundland ornaments, wall hangings and tea lights.', '']

title: ['Cheeky eBay sellers flogging Poundland vases for TEN TIMES their original price... - The Sun']
summary:
['CHEEKY sellers are flogging Poundland homeware items for up to ten times their original price on eBay.
One user shared a snap of a set of animal vases which cost £3 altogether to buy for sale on eBay for a whopping £35.
But, many Poundland homeware items are still listed as for sale on eBay at way above their original price.
The fact that these items are reselling so high could be because many are dupes of luxury homeware items.
And, many of the people listing Poundland products have several of the same item on sale, suggesting that they’ve bulk bought the products to sell on later.']

title: ["How to cancel a bid you've made on eBay in 5 steps - Business Insider", 'Sick paedo bought used childrens’ underwear on eBay before teaming up with twisted lover to rape kids... - The Sun', "How to return an item on eBay if it's defective or damaged - Business Insider", 'eBay Launches New International Shipping Option - EcommerceBytes', 'Vans Global Ambassadors Design eBay Charity Auction Items - Shop-Eat-Surf.com', '10 ways to save money on eBay, from secret deal pages to tracking price drops... - The Sun']
summary:
['It's possible to cancel a bid on an eBay item if you've done so in error.
Canceling an eBay bid means you will need to bid again if you're still interested in the item.
But what happens if you want to cancel a bid you've made?
You can also cancel a bid if you've been unable to reach the seller by phone or an email to the seller was returned as undeliverable.
From the drop-down menu which appears, select your reason for canceling your bid and click "Continue" again before clicking "Retract bid."', 'A TWISTED Lolita-obsessed paedo teamed up with his depraved lover to rape kids after buying used children's underwear on eBay.
Oliver Wilson, 38, met Rebecca Holloway, 26, online and the pair exchanged lurid messages about sexually abusing children.
He can now be unmasked after being convicted in a separate trial of 11 serious sex offences - including five rapes.
Vile Wilson was showing "great interest in buying used children’s underwear on eBay".
5 Holloway had a stash of sex toys and indecent photos Credit: MEN Media5 Wilson was obsessed with the book Lolita Credit: MEN Media', 'You can return an item on eBay if your purchase arrives defective, damaged, or does not match the online description.
eBay's Money Back Guarantee ensures you will be refunded if you return an item that didn't match its description, or arrived defective or damaged.
Find the item you wish to return, then click "Return this item."
Click "Request a return."
Now you have to wait until the seller decides whether or not to accept your return request.', 'eBay Send is a new shipping option eBay is making available to US sellers for their international orders.
For either of these options, select "eBay Send International Standard" shipping service from the drop down menu.
"After your item sells, select the "eBay Send International Standard" option when you print a shipping label with eBay Labels for buyers in destinations outside the US.
The program is quite different from eBay's existing Global Shipping Program, powered by Pitney Bowes, as explained by eBay:- eBay Send International Standard is a Delivered Duties Unpaid (DDU) shipping service.
Another major difference: "While eBay has worked with shipping carriers to create the eBay Send International Standard shipping service, you're still responsible for getting the order to the buyer in good shape."', 'Vans is celebrating #VansCheckerboardDay with the launch of a Global Ambassador Charity Auction in partnership with eBay for Charity, featuring a collection of footwear and backpacks designed to inspire creative self-expression.
Vans Global Snow Athlete, Hana Beaman custom hand-painted Vans Slip-On“Vans Checkerboard Day encompasses everything that we as a company stand for,” said Steve Van Doren, Vans’ vice president of events and promotions.
“Vans has always strived to promote out-of-the-box thinking in support of creativity and celebrate what makes each of us unique.
The Vans® brand promotes creative self-expression in youth culture across action sports, art, music and street culture and delivers progressive platforms such as the Vans Park Series, Vans Triple Crown of Surfing®, Vans Pool Party, Vans Custom Culture, and Vans’ cultural hub and international music venue, House of Vans.
Vans, “Off The Wall” Since ’66www.vans.comyoutube.com/vansinstagram.com/vansfacebook.com/vanstwitter.com/vans_66About eBay for CharityeBay for Charity enables members of the eBay community to connect with and support their favorite charities in the U.S. and abroad.', "The retailer's prices are competitive and cheaper than those offered by high street stores, but how do you save money when shopping on eBay?
From making the most of eBay’s secret deals pages that offer some great bargains to using price trackers to make sure you snag products at the best prices.
Price checkNever assume that just because it’s on eBay, the price is the cheapest you can get.
Use next level eBay tools to up your gameTons of items go unsold on eBay including loads of top notch bargains.
Get up to 75 per cent off and free delivery under £20 – 7 little-known tips to save money on Amazon."]

title: ["How to remove a buyer's bid from your listing on eBay - Business Insider", 'eBay: Cautious On Marketplace (NASDAQ:EBAY) - Seeking Alpha', 'How to contact eBay customer support for any issues with your account - Business Insider India', 'eBay Aero Bike Bargains - Cervelo, Specialized, Trek, Giant ... - Road.cc']
summary:
['You can remove a bid on an eBay item you've listed if you don't want a specific user to purchase an item you're selling, though only under certain conditions.
Removing a bid on eBay doesn't prevent the same user from placing another bid on your item.
If you're looking to remove a buyer's bid from an item you're selling, eBay will only allow you to remove a bid for the following reasons:A potential buyer requests a cancellation, and you accept it.
On the page for cancelling a bid, enter the item number, the User ID of the bid you're cancelling, and the reasons you want to cancel the user's bid, then click "cancel bid."
Click "cancel bid" for your final step.', "eBay (NASDAQ:EBAY) is one of the world's largest e-commerce marketplaces processing over $100 billion in annual gross merchandise volume.
The Competitive LandscapeWhen eBay first came to life in the early 1990s, the company was one of the first e-commerce marketplaces.
With business-to-consumer and consumer-to-consumer transactions taking place, items on the eBay marketplace are widespread serving many different verticals.
One example of a specialized marketplace is CarGurus (CARG) which has both B2C and C2C offerings.
Total gross merchandise volume decreased by ~2% y/y, with marketplace GMV also declining by 2% y/y.", 'For customer service issues such as finding an order that never arrived, you can call customer support at 1-866-540-3229; for tech support use 1-866-961-9253.
You can also contact eBay via Twitter or ask questions of the eBay Community, but you can't email eBay for customer support.
eBay has service reps on hand to help you, so just contact eBay and ask for a little assistance.
You can find these articles by punching a few keywords into the search bar under the "Help & Contact" section of the site.
How to contact eBay customer support for specific issues1.', 'Fancy a speed aero bike?
With the iconic, instantly recognisable wheel-hugging seattube, the Cervelo S5 is an aero bike that you can’t mistake.
Add in the Roval CL50 wheelset and this is a great aero road bike for racing and general riding.
BUY NOW AT £2,400Our cheapest aero road bike of the day is this Giant Propel Pro 2 105 which, at this price, is an absolute bargain and would make an excellent budget racer.
The carbon frame has deep tube shapes that help you to cut through the air and the deep carbon wheelset helps here too.']

title: ['How to set up an eBay account for business or personal use - Business Insider', '13 of the Strangest, Creepiest "Haunted" Objects We Found on eBay - Bloody Disgusting', 'LyricFind inks eBay deal for its lyrics-based merchandise - Music Ally']
summary:
['You can easily set up an eBay account for your personal or business needs.
Registering a business account will require more information than a personal account, including the business name, address and type.
Kelly Laffey/Business InsiderHow to set up an eBay account for a businessIf you have a personal account, you can turn it into a business account.
Hit "Account Settings" and under "Account Type" hit "Edit" to begin the process of changing from a personal account to a business account.
If you don't have a personal account, you can set up a business account from the eBay homepage.', 'Haunted objects are lurking all over the same site where you can unearth anything from antique dolls to Star Wars figures.
Spirit trapped inside with a capacity for giving you blood-freezing nightmares?
There must be some reason earthbound spirits seem to be attracted to objects that already look terrifying.
Still, there’s a sort of sick irony that eBay policy says this thing has to be listed as a novelty.
The “strong dark energy” that lurks in this voodoo doll should be obvious just with a glance at what remains of that face, which can hardly be called a face.', "Lyrics-licensing company LyricFind announced its LyricMerch product back in November 2017: a site where people could order physical merchandise emblazoned with lyrics from its catalogue – with publishers (and thus songwriters) earning royalties.
Now LyricMerch is getting an interesting distribution partner: eBay, which will be a new shop-window for LyricMerch, as well as a place for “targeted merchandise campaigns”.
The first of those is live already: a LyricMerch Gift Guide for Christmas 2019.
“Having our products available on eBay for its global shoppers allows us to lean into a marketplace that already caters to our target audiences, making this a natural partnership,” said LyricFind CEO Darryl Ballantyne.
Written by: Stuart Dredge Share:Sign Up For Music Ally's Free Weekly Newsletter The Knowledge - at-a-glance analysis of the modern music industry"]

title: ['eBay’s top toys for 2019: Zuru Booty Shaking Lama, Hasbro’s ... - Kidspot', 'Film prop banknotes available on eBay being used fraudulently to ... - TaxiPoint Taxi News', 'How long does a buyer have to pay on eBay? What you need to know - Business Insider', 'HELCH may be retiring as cryptic eBay post made about West London graffiti artist - My London']
summary:
['', "Taxi drivers are being handed fraudulent ‘film prop’ banknotes, which are available to buy online.
The copies, which are very similar to the legal notes, are available to buy on sites like eBay for less than 80p per £20 note.
The fake banknotes are the same size and design, but don’t include watermarks or a functional silver band.
One seller on eBay described the notes as 'printed money which looks similar to a real note, but with many differences'.
“Oh well, it was only a £9 fare and the chap was gracious enough to let me keep the change!”TaxiPoint approached the Bank of England for more information on the legality of ‘prop money‘ and are awaiting comment.", 'A buyer has two days to pay for an item on eBay from the time of their purchase.
Congratulations on your newly purchased eBay item.
If the buyer does not pay or contact the seller during that window, a seller can open an unpaid item case in the Resolution Center.
If a buyer does not pay for an item within two days, you should fill out the form on the eBay Resolution Center.
If a buyer has not paid within four days of opening an unpaid item case, the seller may opt to close it.', 'Something went wrong, please try again later.
Invalid email Something went wrong, please try again later.
The infamous graffiti artist HELCH might be set to retire after a cryptic listing was made on eBay.

title: ['How to print a shipping label on eBay to mail sold items - Business Insider', 'How to send an invoice on eBay in 4 simple steps - Business Insider']
summary:
['You can print a shipping label on eBay to send out products that you've sold.
You must have a PayPal account to pay for and print USPS shipping labels, whereas UPS and FedEx labels go to your monthly eBay invoice.
Here's how to print eBay shipping labels for USPS so you can mail out sold items from your home or local post office.
Click "Print Shipping Label" beside the order you wish to process.
Click Print shipping label in your shipment details.', 'You can send an invoice on eBay to anyone who buys an item from you, as a reminder that they still owe payment.
If a buyer doesn't send their payment within two days after they secure the purchase, sending an eBay invoice is a gentle way to remind the person to pay up.
Here's how to send an eBay invoice.
Click the words "Send Invoice" on the order in question.
Once the details here are set, click "Send Invoice."']

title: ['eBay Is Stuffing Its Search Results Pages With Ads - Marketplace Pulse', "Woman loses £1,300 after selling camera on eBay due to PayPal 'loophole' - The Mirror", '1969 Chevrolet Camaro Z/28 Barn Find for Sale on eBay Motors - Road & Track', 'Afterpay has announced a deal with eBay Australia, only a week after Zip partnered with Amazon - Yahoo Finance Australia', "PayPal 'loophole' leaves woman £1,300 out of pocket after sneaky eBay buyer 'scam' - Liverpool Echo"]
summary:
['eBay search results now start with five sponsored product ads.
The company has recently adjusted the mix of promoted and non-promoted listings at the top of search results, which previously rarely had ads.
For example, the search below is for “airpods.” The first five results are sponsored placements that appear as search results for affordable Apple AirPods knockoffs.
By putting sponsored products as first results in search, eBay has made them a requirement for sellers since they can no longer rely on organic ranking.
And Etsy search results begin with four ads.', 'Image: Liverpool Echo/Joanna Rose) Liverpool Echo/Joanna Rose)"He asked me to send this to a new address and I thought nothing of it because I have done it before and it was fine.
Image: Liverpool Echo/Joanna Rose) Liverpool Echo/Joanna Rose)Since the buyer changed the address, Joanna says PayPal ruled in his favour.
Image: Liverpool Echo/Joanna Rose) Liverpool Echo/Joanna Rose)"I tried to appeal the case but PayPal said there is nothing they can do."
Image: Liverpool Echo/Joanna Rose) Liverpool Echo/Joanna Rose)Joanna said she has contacted ActionFraud police and they are investigating the matter.
Image: Liverpool Echo/Joanna Rose) Liverpool Echo/Joanna Rose)"Sellers need to be very wary if a seller asks them to change the delivery address.', "Looking for a fun project this winter?
Why not go in on this 1969 Chevy Camaro Z/28?
It's been sitting untouched inside of a garage since the mid-Eighties, and now, it's in need of a full restoration.
The engine bay also appears to be largely complete as well, though it's unclear if the motor is original.
This Z/28 is up for bidding now on eBay in Jackson, New Jersey with a current high bid of $18,000 and four days remaining.", "Australian buy now, pay later platform Afterpay has entered a deal that will see it be used on eBay Australia.
Through the deal, eBay Australia's 40,000 small and medium businesses can have their customers use Afterpay.
Nearly a week after Australian BNPL platform Zip Co announced a partnership with Amazon Australia, fellow Aussie platform Afterpay has entered a similar deal with eBay Australia.
The agreement will see eBay Australia give its 40,000 Australian small and medium businesses the ability to let their eBay customers use Afterpay.
Afterpay's deal comes right on the heels of Zip Co's deal with Amazon Australia.", 'But about a week later he opened a case against me on Paypal saying he had not received the item."
(Image: Joanna Rose)Joanna said the eBay buyer didn't go through the auction site but went straight to PayPal to file the complaint.
(Image: Joanna Rose)Joanna added: "I tried to appeal the case but PayPal said there is nothing they can do."
(Image: Joanna Rose)Joanna said she has contacted ActionFraud police and they are investigating the matter.
"Sellers need to be very wary if a seller asks them to change the delivery address.']

title: ['How to leave feedback on eBay as a buyer or seller - Business Insider', 'Nintendo 64’s eBay consoles sales rocket up 205% over 2018 - VentureBeat', "SCOTT WEILAND's Widow Is Selling His VELVET REVOLVER-Era ... - BLABBERMOUTH.NET"]
summary:
['The eBay feedback feature allows users to leave feedback for multiple items at once or choose individual items one at a time.
Here's how to leave feedback for buyers and sellers on eBay:How to leave feedback on eBay for buyers1.
Click "Leave Feedback" to save and submit your feedback.
Once you've filled out the feedback form, click the "Leave feedback" button.
Click "Leave Feedback" at the bottom of the form to save.', 'Here’s the rest of the top 5 consoles and gaming franchises on eBay:Nintendo Switch Nintendo 64 Super Mario Xbox One Call of DutyIn September, eBay customers bought an average of 2 Nintendo Switch and Nintendo 64 consoles per minute.
One of the possible reasons for N64’s spiking popularity is that Nintendo has filled the demand for NES and Super Nintendo.
And now Nintendo has even released many of its most beloved 8-bit and 16-bit as part of the Nintendo Switch Online service.
So Nintendo fans have a lot of ways to play those early Nintendo games.
“Our focus right now is absolutely on our dedicated platforms such as Nintendo Switch Lite and our flagship Nintendo Switch,” Nintendo of America president Doug Bowser told The Verge in an interview last week.', 'Scott Weiland's widow Jamie Weiland is selling two of his VELVET REVOLVER-era hats on eBay, each with a starting bid of $3,500.
A message on the eBay auction page reads: "Scott Weiland's Black and Red Skull Hat from VELVET REVOLVER Days – Authentic.
This past April, the IRS filed a federal tax lien against Weiland's estate, alleging he did not pay his federal income tax from 2012 to 2014.
Last year, Weiland's estate was hit with a lien by the California State Tax Franchise Board for almost $250,000.
Jamie told Billboard in an interview that Scott had been experiencing episodes of paranoia and mania caused by bipolar disorder.']

title: ['$10,000 BMW M3 Lightweight Wing for Sale on eBay Motors - Road & Track', 'Excitable Edgar £15 toys are already being flogged on eBay at bumped up prices - Daily Mail', 'AEMC wants the energy market to think like Airbnb and eBay - RenewEconomy']
summary:
["It's a genuine rear wing for an E36-generation BMW M3 Lightweight—the super rare and valuable one sold exclusively in the U.S.—listed for sale on eBay.
Personally, if I'm spending $10,000 on an E36 M3 wing, the deal should include the rest of the car.
Obviously, you can't get an M3 Lightweight for ten grand, but normal M3s can be found for that price all day.
Here's a clean one with a bunch of upgrades for sale on eBay right now for just $8500.
That being said, rare car parts are a huge market, and finding another unused, genuine M3 Lightweight wing with all of the right accessories is likely next to impossible.", 'Excitable Edgar teddies and other merchandise are already being flogged on eBay at bumped up prices just hours after John Lewis released their much anticipated Christmas advert.
Meanwhile, Edgar Wellington boots would set you back between £16 and £19 at either retailer, but on eBay buyer is offering a pair for a whopping £60.
The advert tells the heart-warming story of the well-meaning but accident-prone dragon Edgar and his best friend, a girl called Ava.
Within hours of the advert being released there were already 50 listings for the Edgar soft toy.
Previous John Lewis adverts have had budgets of around £1million and putting each ad together has costs a reported £6million.', 'The Australian Energy Market Commission says the emergence of distributed digital technologies means that the electricity market will have to think along the lines of digital marketplaces like Airbnb or eBay for energy.
It comes as the Energy Security Board seeks submissions on what the future energy market might look like as it weighs potential new market designs that it hopes can be introduced in 2025.
Emerging technologies in the energy market are beginning to create similar opportunities, and the AEMC wants the energy market to prepare for a similar disruption.
The rise of distributed energy systems, including rooftop solar and storage, along with smart demand management devices, have begun to fundamentally reshape consumers relationship with the energy market.
Automation has also allowed distributed energy resources to be optimised without constant engagement by market participants.']

title: ['eBay Has a Google Search Problem - EcommerceBytes']
summary:
['Hearing from eBay that it continues to struggle for visibility of sellers' listings on Google search is not good news.
In 2013, eBay published a study that showed Google paid search didn't work - and many wondered why eBay was poking the bear.
Things took an especially worrisome turn in 2014 when eBay took hits in search after Google changed its algorithm and reportedly took action against eBay.
As eBay's problem with Google SEO continued, management promised Wall Street it had a solution.
eBay had another idea to try and help with its Google SEO problem: the eBay Good Til Cancelled mandate (GTC), which makes all fixed-price listings "permanent," so more likely to be picked up by Google.']

title: ["Beware the small print in eBay's £1 seller's fee - The Times"]
summary:
['As an occasional user of eBay, I felt quite smug when I sold my Brompton folding bike on the site for £2,495 — which was £505 more than I’d paid for it in a bike shop only a few weeks earlier.
I had originally splurged out on Brompton’s CHPT3 special-edition model as a way to cut the time I spent each day getting to and from Cambridge station for my commute into London.
But when I saw that other examples of the titanium-framed bike, co-designed by the former professional cyclist David Millar, were fetching a high price on eBay, I put mine up for sale.
SponsoredMy delight at the £505 profit was dampened when I realised that fees would cut this down to about £180,']

title: ['The Power Of Purpose: How The eBay Community Has Raised $1 ... - Forbes', 'Shoppers can’t get enough of eBay’s £16 chunky knit throw – especially as they’ll set you back £30 in Prima... - The Sun', 'CEO of eBay Greater China helps Chinese products go global - EastDay.com', "How a teenage tradie turned his 'hobby' selling products on eBay into a $25MILLION hair care empire - Daily Mail", "The stolen goods being sold by police forces on eBay - and it's totally legal - Birmingham Live", 'eBay For Charity Bursts Through $1 Billion Mark - The NonProfit Times']
summary:
['', 'IT'S official - the season of spending evening after evening snuggled up on the sofa is finally upon us.
3 The shopper posted a picture of this £30 throw in the Facebook group We Love Mrs HinchPosting on the Facebook group We Love Mrs Hinch, one shopper posted an image of a £30 chunky knitted blanket with the caption: "Spotted these in Primark yesterday."
One replied: "I must be tight but I think £30 for a Primark throw is a bit steep.
Where IKEA's £15 throw is more tightly woven that the Primark throw, the £16 eBay offering is almost identical and comes in pink, grey, white and teal.
Plus you can now buy heated mittens which charge up and keep your fingers toasty for over 20 minutes.', 'In order to commemorate the thirtieth anniversary of the Shanghai Magnolia Awards, Huangpu District plans to hold a celebration activity in November.
Eastday has therefore especially launched a series of exclusive interviews to review these award winners’ stories in Huangpu District and Shanghai.
CEO of eBay Greater China helps Chinese products go globalSituated in downtown Shanghai, Raffles City in Huangpu is undoubtedly one of the most bustling places in the city.
Its leader, John Lin, has been working on cross-border e-commerce and promoting the export of cross-border e-commerce in Shanghai and China for many years.
The center will be connected to the permanent exhibition and trading platform of the annual China International Import Expo, so as to boost cross-border e-commerce.', "A former tradie has revealed how his 'hobby' business turned into a $25million empire by selling hair products online with his brother.
Mr Nappa's parents Vanessa and Elio ran OZ Hair Sydney hairdressing salons, so he decided to start selling hair and beauty products on eBay in February 2012.
As his eBay selling became more successful, Mr Nappa focused on creating a proper store.
He set up Oz Hair and Beauty where he sold high end hair and beauty products including brands such as GHD, OPI, Kerastase and Moroccanoil.
The Nappa family plans to combine Oz Hair & Beauty with the OZ Hair salons next year.", 'Have you ever wondered what happens to stolen items after police seize them?
The items could be lost property which has been held at a local police station for too long or stolen items which have been found.
They may also be items seized through the Proceeds of Crime Act.
Bumblebee Auctions - This is a dedicated site where police forces across the country list stolen goods for sale.
Auction Houses - Some forces sell their items through auction events, which you have to attend in person.', 'eBay for Charity has eclipsed $1 billion in total funds raised for charities, reaching the milestone ahead of its original 2020 goal.
To date, eBay for Charity has more than 83,500 global charities registered on the platform, up 26 percent from the 66,000 in 2018.
The eBay community last year raised a record $102 million, from more than 20 million charity listings, some 20 percent more than the $84 million in 2017.
Another record is on the horizon for 2019, with $92 million already raised through October, according to eBay for Charity General Manager Brenda Halkias.
Of the $102 million raised in 2018, charities collectively raised more than $83 million selling directly on eBay.']

While eBay doesn't allow you to change feedback once it's been left, you can leave a follow-up comment with additional information.
Alternatively, you can access this via the My eBay "Leave feedback" shortcut.
On the right-hand side of the eBay Feedback Forum, click the "Follow up to feedback left" link.
Type your next feedback comment in the box provided, then click "Leave Follow-up Comment."', "A RARE Beatrix Potter 50p coin has sold for £430 on eBay - that's 860 times its original value.
2 The Mrs Tittlemouse coin sold for almost £500 onlineThe 50p piece is part of a series of coins launched to celebrate 150 years since the birth of the children's author, Beatrix Potter.
HAVE a rummage through the change in your pocket for rare 50p coins because they could be worth a small fortune.
Another circulated Mrs Tittlemouse coin sold for £7 last month, while a commemorative colour version recently sold for £48 on eBay.
We recently reported how the Sherlock Holmes 50p coin sold for £500 online, while an Olympic error coin sold for almost £600 online.", 'AdvertisementTo fully delete your eBay account, it may take some time to do - the process of purging your eBay account and data from the system can take a month, or longer, to complete.
Once your eBay account is deleted, you will not have the option to reopen your account, and you won't be able to access any of the data from your account either.
If you want to delete your eBay account, however, simple is not a good way to describe the process.
Register Now Our SpeakersHere's how to complete the process of deleting your eBay account and all its associated data:Check out the products mentioned in this article:How to delete your eBay account1.
If necessary, click the "Account" tab, and then under "Account preferences" select "Close account."']

director of advocacy, said: "It's clear that consumer protections have not kept pace with the changes to the retail industry, and it is not acceptable for marketplaces to pass the buck for the responsibility of the items sold on their sites by simply pointing the finger at sellers.', 'You can have up to 5,000 eBay usernames on your blocked list, although if you ever get to that number you may want to reevaluate some of your own life choices.

summary:
['by Melynda Fuller , November 20, 2019As it continues to deepen its commerce experiences, Verizon Media has partnered with eBay as its first brand partner to leverage the media company’s shoppable video formats.
As part of a new holiday campaign — “The Guy’s Guide to Nailing the Holidays” — which aims to help men ace the holiday season, Verizon will publish a series of gift guide videos on Yahoo Lifestyle that highlight eBay products related to style, family, tech, sports and more.
Verizon Media unveiled a new suite of ecommerce capabilities this fall, including shoppable content, interactive videos and images, product guides curated by editors and its Yahoo Shopping hub.
Last month, the company announced a holiday campaign called “30 Days of Savings,” launched in partnership with Walmart.
“At Verizon Media, we’re closing the loop between content and commerce to drive deeper value for our consumers and brand partners,” said Iván Markman, Chief Business Officer at Verizon Media.', 'Crafty mum created Frozen-inspired wreath for only £3.15 using eBay and B&M stealsThe wreath is inspired by Disney's Frozen.
A craft-loving mum has shared how she made her own DIY project Frozen-inspired wreath and it's an 'absolute must' for this Christmas.
The Frozen-inspired wreath was perfect for Danielle's daughters.
In her post, Danielle revealed: "Danielle explained: "[These can cost up to] £50 locally and I made both for under £8."
"Saved about £90 using B&M, ebay and £ land."', '', "At some point in our lives, we all have found ourselves looking for or selling gear on eBay.
I myself recently put a piece of photography equipment for sale on eBay, which was bought by someone outside of my listed postage area.
However, Joanna Rose Hufton, a professional photographer from the UK, wasn't as fortunate and was caught up in a scam when trying to sell her camera on eBay.
Hufton didn't think much of the request because she had done it before and transactions had gone through with no issues.
The scammer didn't file any complaints via eBay but instead went straight to PayPal."]

title: ['Beatrix Potter coins: rare Mrs Tittlemouse 50p sells for £430 on eBay ... - Yorkshire Evening Post', 'Rare Mrs Tittlemouse Beatrix Potter 50p coin sells for £430 on eBay - Heart']
summary:
["Third rarest Beatrix Potter coinAlthough there are numerous coins in the Beatrix Potter series, the Mrs Tittlemouse coin is the third rarest, with only 1.7million coins being released into circulation.
A rare Beatrix Potter 50p coin depicting an image of Mrs Tittlemouse has recently sold on eBay for £430 (Photo: eBay)Advertisement Hide AdAdvertisement Hide AdThe 2018 Flopsy Bunny and Peter Rabbit coins are the two rarest coins in the collection, with a mintage of just 1.4million.
The Mrs Tittlemouse 2018 50p coin received two bids on eBay and sold on the site for £430, which is the same price it was listed for.
How to spot if you've got a Peter Rabbit coinThe 2018 Peter Rabbit 50p coin depicts Peter Rabbit just as Beatrix Potter painted him, with every detail, from his little blue coat to his long whiskers captured on the coin.
The silver 2017 Peter Rabbit coin was the first in the Beatrix Potter 2017 Collection and features an image of Peter Rabbit mid-run, presumably fleeing from Mr. McGregor.", "Rare Mrs Tittlemouse Beatrix Potter 50p coin sells for £430 on eBayA Mrs Tittlemouse coin has sold for £430.
Picture: The Royal MintBy Naomi BartramA rare Beatrix Potter 50p coin has sold for a whopping £430 on eBay.
It’s time to dig around in your old bags and coat pockets, because a rare Beatrix Potter coin has sold for 860 times its original value.
The Beatrice Potter coin sold for £430 online.
And if you’re sitting on the 2009 Kew Gardens design, you’re in luck as this remains the nation's rarest coin."]

title: ['eBay sells StubHub to Viagogo for $4.05 billion - Digital Commerce 360', "Here's what Thames Valley Police are selling on eBay this week - Oxford Mail", "Shoppers 'disgusted' as Aldi's Kevin the Carrot toys on eBay for FIVE times the price - Teesside Live", 'Rochester pawn shop raids: Owners used drug addicts in eBay ... - Democrat & Chronicle', 'Man who sold monkey skull on eBay and gathered skeleton collection avoids jail - Daily Star', 'eBay Motors Group to launch new sales packages for dealers - Motor Trader', 'EBay is selling off StubHub in a $4 billion deal - CNN', 'viagogo Acquires StubHub from eBay for $4.05 Billion - PR Newswire', "'Star Wars' director J.J. Abrams on how a 'Rise of Skywalker' script ended up on eBay - CNBC"]
summary:
['EBay Inc. is selling its ticket marketplace StubHub to European rival Viagogo for $4.05 billion in cash, allowing eBay to focus on its main retail site and address pressure from shareholder activists.
EBay bought StubHub in 2007 for $310 million as it sought to bolster its online marketplace for secondary sales of seats to concerts and sporting events.
Today, it’s the largest resale ticket marketplace in the U.S., with about $4.75 billion in gross merchandise value (GMV) in 2018, according to eBay’s financial statements.
StubHub’s GMV accounted for about 5% of eBay’s $94.58 billion total GMV in 2018.
2022 Global Online Marketplaces Report advertisement Analysis of the 100 leading global online marketplaces .', 'The unusual finds are being flogged on the Thames Valley Police eBay page, which the force uses to sell old evidence and unclaimed items.
Some of it has been stolen and then seized by officers in an investigation, or handed in at stations.
The eBay page is where all of the selling pile ends up, and then the cash raised gets but into the Police Property Act Fund.
The online buying and selling page is regularly updated and this week there are 22 weird and wonderful items.
There is one catch though, winners must collect everything in person from the police eBay HQ in Milton Keynes.', 'Something went wrong, please try again later.
Invalid email Something went wrong, please try again later.
Get the latest breaking Teesside news and updates direct to your email inboxAldi released its Kevin the Carrot toys online over the weekend and they sold out in what felt like record time.
While a single Kevin - with a list price of £3.99 - is being sold for four times as much at £15.99.
Rosemary Willoughby told Mirror Online: "I happened to go on eBay and there were the soft toys Kevin and Katie on sale for nearly three times the price."', 'Your subscription supports:Investigative reporting that keeps citizens in charge of our democracy', 'A bloke with an obsession for collecting the skulls and skeletons of animals, and even humans, has avoided jail for the illegal trade of endangered species.
Michael Tang, 49, admitted to possessing 18 illegal specimens which he had purchased on eBay.
The offences took place over an 18-year period and came to light last year when Tang was found to have sold a monkey skull on eBay.
A total of 18 species were found, all of which were categorised as endangered species according to annex A of the Convention on International Trade of Endangered Species of Wild Fauna and Flora (CITES).
For a man of your education and intelligence you showed an arrogance to flout the regulations designed to protect these endangered species.', 'eBay has launched eBay Motors Group, giving dealers a single point of access for its eBay Motors, Gumtree Motors and Motors.co.uk car sales platforms.
The move comes a year after eBay announced that it was buying Motors.co.uk from Cox Automotive.
eBay Motors argues that that the average car buying process takes 41 days with buyers visiting a number of websites.
Phill Jones, head of eBay Motors Group UK, said: “It is crucial for dealers to be able to reach these consumers at these varying stages.
The sales packages for dealers will be announced in January 2020.eBay Motors Group is operating in a lucrative market.', 'New York CNN Business —EBay is selling its StubHub ticketing businesses to Viagogo, a European rival, in a $4 billion deal.
The website sells tickets for a variety of events, including sports and concerts.
Viagogo is a Switzerland-based company that also resells tickets, mostly for sporting events including European football, rugby and cricket.
The e-commerce company announced in March that it was a initiating a strategic examination of its assets following pressure from activist investors to spin off or sell StubHub and its Classifieds Group.
Earlier this year, eBay (EBAY) also announced a restructuring that would bring various regional marketplace units under one global leadership team.', 'SAN JOSE, Calif. and GENEVA, Nov. 25, 2019 /PRNewswire/ -- eBay Inc. (NASDAQ: EBAY) and viagogo today announced they have entered into a definitive agreement for eBay to sell StubHub to viagogo for a purchase price of $4.05 billion in cash.
We firmly believe in the StubHub business and we are excited about its future growth potential with viagogo as its owner."
About eBay: eBay Inc. (NASDAQ: EBAY) is a global commerce leader including the Marketplace, StubHub and Classifieds platforms.
About viagogo: viagogo was built with the aim of providing ticket buyers with the widest possible choice of tickets to events across the world and to help ticket sellers reach a global audience.
The forward-looking statements in this document address a variety of subjects including, for example, the closing of the proposed transaction and the potential benefits of the proposed transaction.', 'A copy of the "Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker" script briefly appeared on eBay, director J.J. Abrams said.
On Monday, Abrams revealed on "Good Morning America" that a real script found its way onto the e-commerce site.
"It was then given to someone else who went to sell it on eBay ."
The script was discovered by someone at Disney and the company was able to retrieve the script before it was sold, he said.
Good Morning America TweetThe nine-film Skywalker saga comes to a conclusion Dec. 20 with the release of "The Rise of Skywalker."']

Best Price Guarantee Through Cyber Monday, No Blackout DatesHoliday shoppers are guaranteed the best prices with no blackout dates on deals, including Black Friday and Cyber Monday.", 'Aldi’s sold-out Kevin the Carrot merchandise is now on eBay for more than three times its original priceAldi’s Kevin the Carrot merchandise sold out in a matter of hours online.
Picture: AldiBy Alice DearAldi’s Kevin the Carrot merchandise sold out in a matter of hours online, and now people are turning elsewhere to get the festive toys.
Aldi’s beloved character Kevin the Carrot returned for the supermarket’s Christmas advert this year, as Kevin as joined by wife, Katie, and their children.
One person Tweeted this morning: “I would of had better luck getting Glastonbury tickets than bloody Kevin the carrot!
Aldi are encouraging those who didn’t get their hands on a Kevin, Katie or any of the other merchandise to check in their local stores for products.', 'Recently eBay Inc. has announced that it is looking to sell its StubHub business to a Swiss enterprise, Viagogo Entertainment Inc., for a whopping $4.05 billion.
Viagogo and StubHub are important contributors to the live events market, such as sports, music, live entertainment shows, etc.
Viagogo is a Geneva-based ticket vendor and acquiring StubHub would turn it into a major global ticketing giant.
Since StubHub is the ticket marketplace for eBay and Viagogo is already involved in ticket sales, the latter would be able to expand its network to over 70 countries.
In light of the StubHub sale, Schenkel said this combination seemed a viable option, while Baker commented, “the opportunity to combine the two and have true global coverage just made too much sense.”', '']

title: ['EBay is selling off StubHub in a $4 billion deal - FBC News', 'eBay aims to strengthen focus on core business as competition builds - Marketplace', 'John Boyega’s Lost ‘Star Wars’ Script Wound Up On EBay. summary:
['EBay is selling its StubHub ticketing businesses to Viagogo, a European rival, in a $4 billion deal.
EBay is selling its StubHub ticketing businesses to Viagogo, a European rival, in a $4 billion deal.
Selling off StubHub comes amid a broader review of eBay’s businesses.
The e-commerce company announced in March that it was initiating a strategic examination of its assets following pressure from activist investors to spin off or sell StubHub and its Classifieds Group.
Earlier this year, eBay (EBAY) also announced a restructuring that would bring various regional marketplace units under one global leadership team.', 'eBay is set to sell ticket firm StubHub to the Swiss ticket vendor Viagogo for about $4 billion.
For almost a year, eBay has been under pressure from activist investors to focus on its core business in the face of slowing growth.
While eBay was once on a par with Amazon, it’s ceded much of its market share to the ecommerce behemoth.
Elsewhere, apps for secondhand goods with more user-friendly mobile interfaces, like Poshmark and Mercari, have been able to compete favorably in the online auction space.
Click the audio player above to hear the full story.', '', 'John Boyega during the Star Wars Celebration at the Wintrust Arena on April 12, 2019 in Chicago, Illinois.

"It was me," John Boyega said on "Good Morning America" Wednesday, just two days after director J.J. Abrams revealed that a copy of a real screenplay wound up for sale online.
Abrams had said the script was discovered by someone at Disney and the company was able to retrieve the script before it was sold.
The nine-film Skywalker saga comes to a conclusion Dec. 20 with the release of "The Rise of Skywalker."', "Shoppers will find everything from collectible Star Wars retro action figures to an exclusive Star Wars #75 comic, the Nintendo Game Boy of yesterday to the latest Nintendo Switch Lite of today, tons of family fun games, Barbies, plushies, S.T.E.M.

The expert-picked list includes collectible Star Wars action figures, the new Kindi Kids dolls, and Monopoly Game: Disney Frozen 2.", 'The bike comes with a mechanical Dura-Ace R9100 groupset, Shimano C24 wheels, Ritchey bars, and a Zipp stem.

title: ["Apple's iPhone XR is cheaper than ever on eBay with 90-day ... - PhoneArena", "A Duplicate Of Lizzo's Tiny Bag, Perfect For Holding Your One ... - Pedestrian.TV", "Netflix accounts 'reactivated' without permission and sold on eBay - The Mirror", 'Aldi’s sell-out Kevin the Carrot toys being sold on eBay for up to £1,000 hours after going on sale... - The Sun', '2019 Shelby GT350 Is $3,000 Under MSRP On eBay - Ford Authority', 'Exploding UltraFire 18650 batteries on sale on eBay & Amazon - Dispatch Weekly', 'eBay, Gumtree and Motors.co.uk launch eBay Motors Group to ... - Netimperative', 'Amazon and eBay accused of selling cosmetics containing mercury - Cosmetics Business', 'Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker script on eBay belonged to John Boyega - CNET']
summary:
['Commercially released a little over a year ago, the 6.1-inch iOS powerhouse can be purchased at the time of this writing in exchange for a very reasonable $429.99 from a long-time eBay seller called Cellfeee.
This has earned a 99 percent positive average rating from almost 10,000 customers in the last 12 months, vouching for the flawless functionality of refurbished iPhone XR units available in black, coral, and red paint jobs with unlocked support for all major US carriers.
Shipping free of charge nationwide within two days of your order, the iPhone XR sold at a big discount in a "limited quantity" will be accompanied by an MFi-certified Lightning cable and UL-approved power adapter in an aftermarket box.
In case you're wondering, Apple sells brand-new iPhone XR units at $599 and up, and discounts on unlocked variants with no strings attached are pretty hard to come by at major third-party retailers.
Although eBay is not running a Black Friday sale per se in the US right now, many top-rated vendors on the popular e-commerce platform are offering great devices like Apple's iPhone XR at unbeatable prices in full working condition.', 'When Lizzo and her extra tiny Valentino Garavani VSLING toybag hit the red carpet at the AMAs this week, she forever changed my ability to love something so small.
The limited edition, miniature Valentino bag – made in collaboration with @obviousplant – was one of a kind… until now.
“You may or mayn’t have seen Lizzo holding one of these mini Valentino handbags at the AMAs,” the announcement was captioned on the ‘gram.
“Perfect for holding eye shadow, two dimes, several beans, a small lizard, and MORE!” the iconic packaging reads.
Unfortunately, the tiny bag can only be shipped to US or Canada.', 'Some Netflix customers who cancelled their subscription months ago have seen their accounts reactivated without their consent - and it could be leaving many people out of pocketA number of Netflix customers who cancelled their subscriptions have found their accounts reactivated without their knowledge.
"When you cancel your @netflix account yet somehow it gets reactivated the next month?," one user wrote.
Another tweeted: "@netflix someone logged into my Netflix account & reactivated it without my consent & ive been charged.
There is a lucrative market for Netflix login details, with criminals selling "lifetime" accounts on eBay for as little as £3.
A Netflix spokesperson told Mirror Money: “The safety of our members' accounts is a top priority for us, and we are always working to improve this.', 'SHOPPERS have been left "disappointed" and "disgusted" after Aldi's sold out Kevin the Carrot toys have been listed on eBay for hundreds of pounds.
The toys had gone on sale online earlier this week but within hours listings had appeared on eBay by sellers hoping to make a sweet buck.
@AldiUK Yet again... people queuing, buying and then selling on these Kevin the carrot characters for extortionate prices on eBay.
Natasha wrote: "Yet again... people queuing, buying and then selling on these Kevin the carrot characters for extortionate prices on eBay.
"We know our Kevin the Carrot soft toys and merchandise are incredibly popular with our customers and this year we increased the amount on offer."', '', '** First warning be careful we had 3 cell exploding in our labs while charging them **How did the 18650 battery become so popular?
18650 batteries became popular in the early 1990s when they became the standard for laptops batteries.
Tesla has been using 18650 cells manufactured by Panasonic in Asia in the Models S and X cars since 2013.
Nowadays DIY power wall enthusiasts are using 18650 cells to build power walls to store solar energy for their homes.
In order to test true battery capacity, batteries needs to be charge and discharge several times.', 'eBay Motors, Gumtree Motors and Motors.co.uk have today announced they are launching a combined platform for automotive dealers under a new B2B brand – eBay Motors Group.
Designed to ensure dealers keep pace with customers, whose expectations and shopping behaviours have shifted significantly in the digital era, the eBay Motors Group will combine the best of eBay Motors, Gumtree Motors and Motors.co.uk and its network.
Car buyers will continue to enjoy separate ‘shop windows’ across existing all websites.
Phill Jones, Head of eBay Motors Group UK, said: “Consumer demands are changing, with nearly all (89%) used car buyers visiting multiple online marketplaces to help make their purchasing decisions.
“Our research shows that the average car buying process is 41 days long and spans a number of websites.', 'By Becky Bargh28-Nov-2019More than half of 158 products bought through the sites were found to contain illegal levels of the chemicalOnline retailers Amazon and eBay have been accused of selling illegal skin-lightening products containing mercury.
According to test results released by Zero Mercury Working Group, The Beautywell Project and Sierra Club, more than half of 158 tested products contained illicit levels of the chemical.
The products came from 12 markets around the world, including Europe, India, South Africa, Kenya and the US.
“It is time for Amazon, eBay and others to put in place protocols to keep these toxic products off their websites for good.”The news comes after councils in England and Wales, UK, urged consumers to avoid using skin-lightening products at all costs last month.
EBay told Cosmetics Business: "These items are banned from eBay’s platform.', 'Two days after Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker director JJ Abrams revealed that one of his actors' scripts ended up on eBay, the culprit has stepped up: John Boyega admitted it was his copy during a Wednesday Good Morning America interview.
Turns out Boyega left the script under his bed while he was moving apartments.
In a subsequent interview, Boyega told Jimmy Fallon that he didn't think whoever tried to sell the script had even read it or the price would have been higher.
Watch this: Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker - Official Trailer (2019) 02:20"Even Mickey Mouse called me, 'What did you do?!'"
We can see what Star Wars spoilers Disney is keeping under wraps when The Rise of Skywalker opens Dec. 20 worldwide, with previews Dec. 19.']

title: ['Amazon and eBay accused of selling high-mercury content cosmetics - GlobalCosmeticsNews', 'Kevin the Carrot merchandise put on eBay for up to £1,000 hours after huge queues at Aldi stores - Daily Mail']
summary:
['Amazon and eBay are facing accusations of selling cosmetics products that feature high mercury levels, according to a report by Bloomberg.
The products were purchased from eBay and Amazon marketplaces from 12 countries including the U.S., with many of the brands already known to the U.S. Food and Drug Administration and other government agencies for mercury contamination.
The discovery of mercury-laced cosmetics highlights the ongoing dangers of purchasing products on third party marketplaces.
Talking to Bloomberg, Janet Nudelman, Director of the Campaign for Safe Cosmetics launched by Breast Cancer Prevention Partners, said, “This is really just the tip of the iceberg of a much bigger problem.
The real problem is big companies like Amazon don’t have adequate processes in place to make sure the beauty products they are selling are safe, so watchdog groups have to police the site for them.”', "Aldi's Kevin the Carrot is being put on eBay for up to £1,000, just hours after huge queues and mad scrambles for the festive toy.
One has posted a 'Kevin The Carrot Plush 2019' for £1,000, while another has posted a full set for £1,230.
While another, Emma Louz, said: 'Gutted I didn't get a Kevin the Carrot again this year from Aldi.
Danyoungman on Twitter posted: 'This is not a drill, there are people in Aldi's fighting over Kevin the carrot toys!'
Terri Spencer, of Cleethorpes, was happily holding a large Katie the Carrot toy as she left the store after joining the queue at 7.40am."]

title: ['eBay Now Lets Android Users Use Face/Fingerprint Recognition on its Mobile Website - Beebom']
summary:
['Tired of entering passwords every time you log in to eBay on a mobile web browser?
Worry not, the e-commerce giant has implemented a password-less login experience that will allow Android users to make use of biometric sensors to seamlessly login to eBay.
eBay has implemented this new authentication technique based on WebAuthn, a new standard of biometric-based authentication for web browsers.
You will be prompted to enable fingerprint/face recognition the next time you visit the web version of eBay on Chrome as you can see below.
It is worth noting that this is not the first time we’re seeing biometric authentication on eBay.']

Mr Tannahill commented that this same business, named Classic Football Kits, had landed the defendant in trouble in the past.
Mr Tannahill revealed the defendant had fraudulently claimed a total of £8,534 in income supports and £7,745 in housing benefit.
Defence barrister Aaron Thompson stated: “The key issue in this case is that it is a breach of a suspended sentence for an almost identical offence.']

The tunics fit a 43in chest size and are for sale a £1.04, with £7 postage costs.", 'CR’s ongoing investigation of infant inclined sleepers has already led to the recall of more than 5 million of the products, including the Fisher-Price Rock ’n Play Sleeper and Kids II rocking sleepers.
But several brands of infant inclined sleepers remain on the market, despite warnings from experts.
In the meantime, “eBay’s ban of infant inclined sleepers will help save lives and prevent tragedies worldwide,” says William Wallace, CR’s manager of home and safety policy.
You Are My Everything, like eBay, told CR that the company would no longer stock infant inclined sleepers or sell the products on its website.
All infant inclined sleep products and accessories run counter to that advice.', 'eBay is using an application/infrastructure knowledge graph to manage its vast service architecture and provide a better experience for the roughly 200M buyers visiting the site.
eBay’s vision – known as INAR, Intelligent Architecture – is to build sustainable service architecture by providing automated visibility, assessment, and governance Intelligence.
In this pursuit, we developed a new approach to model and process the application ecosystem using a knowledge graph.
Using this approach, eBay engineers could organize their service ecosystem in clusters (galaxies) based on how active they were.
Other dimensions explored by eBay architecture knowledge graph are dependencies between services and criticality.', "Sellers have been told that they will receive a notification from eBay telling them their payment business policies have been updated, according to Tamebay, which first contacted us about the scam.
For example, one eBay seller had reported the scam taking place in October 2017, four months before Richard Crisp was targeted.
Victims have found it hard to get to the root of the problem, with eBay and PayPal blaming each other for the scam.
However, eBay is now finally taking action that will hopefully make it easier for sellers to detect the scam.
eBay told us in a statement: 'As part of a set of improvements that we constantly make to keep our marketplace a safe place to buy and sell, we are rolling out a change notification to alert business sellers if their eBay Business Policies are amended.", 'CR’s ongoing investigation of infant inclined sleepers has already led to the recall of more than 5 million of the products, including the Fisher-Price Rock ’n Play Sleeper and Kids II rocking sleepers.

You can even check your gift card balance at any time using eBay's online tool .
If you've received an eBay gift card and are unsure how to use it to pay for your purchase, doing so is relatively straightforward.
On the payment screen, scroll down until you find the "Gift cards, coupons, and eBay bucks" field and enter the 13-digit card on the back of your eBay gift card.
This will happen even if your eBay gift card covers the entirety of your purchase.', 'You can use an eBay gift card to pay for all or some of your purchases on the site.
