This will happen even if your eBay gift card covers the entirety of your purchase.', "Fisher Price Rock N PlayeBay's decision to ban infant inclined sleepers from its platform, including nonrecalled sleepers, was welcomed by Consumer Reports, which urged other companies to do the same.
Consumer Reports said eBay's ban was based on information from Consumer Reports and the U.S. Consumer Product Safety Commission (CPSC) about the dangers posed by inclined sleepers.
Last week, Consumer Reports sent letters to 15 retailers, online platforms, and trade groups urging them to immediately halt sales of all infant inclined sleep products.
Earlier this year, a Consumer Reports investigation revealed that inclined sleepers were linked to dozens of infant deaths, and the CPSC has reported 73 infant deaths associated with the products.
More than 5 million infant inclined sleep products have been recalled, but many inclined sleepers are still for sale and in use, according to Consumer Reports."]

title: ["Bunnings' online marketplace to impact eBay - Inside Retail Australia", 'Former eBay Exec Named CEO of Tractor Supply Company - EcommerceBytes']
summary:
['Bunnings has partnered with several kitchen, homeware and furniture retailers to offer thousands of products from leading brands like Braun, Tefal, Jamie Oliver and Sheridan on MarketLink, its new online marketplace which launched on Wednesday.
Bunnings’ marketplace products are available online only and will not be stocked in stores.
This will help the marketplace to hit the ground running, according to Peter Macaulay, CEO of KitchenWarehouse, one of the retailers selling through MarketLink.
The retailer, which stocks thousands of cookware, appliances, tableware and other kitchen products, has an online presence and 15 bricks-and-mortar stores and also sells through eBay and Catch Marketplace.
Like most marketplaces, Bunnings’ MarketLink works on a drop-ship basis.', "Former eBay executive Hal Lawton was named CEO of Tractor Supply Company, effective January 13, 2020.
Macy's President Hal Lawton is leaving to be…CEO of Tractor Supply Company???
!https://t.co/vkoMiiCi0U — Sarah Halzack (@sarahhalzack) December 5, 2019The move from eBay to Macy’s was lucrative for Lawton, as we noted in this August 21st news story.

His compensation package for Tractor Supply has not yet been published to the SEC.gov website."]

title: ["Fake 'movie money' from Amazon, eBay making bank in NYC: Chuck Schumer - New York Post", 'Out-of-date IT forces public sector to buy parts on eBay - Jersey Evening Post', 'Ebay Nintendo Console Selling Price - Apartment Therapy', 'eBay Cyclocross Bike Bargains - Trek, Specialized, Cannondale ... - Road.cc']
summary:
['New York’s streets are awash with counterfeit cash this holiday season — and lawmakers say it’s very real-looking Hollywood movie prop money that’s been bought on \xadAmazon and eBay.
Bundles of realistic-looking bills are being sold for as little as $7.99 on the shopping Web sites, Sen. Chuck Schumer said Friday, announcing the fun money was becoming a “major problem” for Big Apple retailers.
The Secret Service last month issued a warning about fake cash used in movies flooding into the real world.
As part of their blitz on fake bills, the Secret Service announced “Operation Quick Glance,” which urges businesses and shoppers to take a quick glance at cash when they receive it.
The victim handed over her phone and didn’t think twice when she got an envelope of realistic-looking fake $100 bills meant to be used as props by Hollywood filmmakers.', '‘It’s running on a server platform that goes out of support next year and it’s running on hardware that is so old that we can’t buy new replacement parts for it.
He described e-gov, a multi-function online portal system which received £10 million of funding, as a ‘expensive roof with rocky foundations’.
‘You have got very old systems and the simple way of integrating them through APIs [application program interfaces] doesn’t exist because a lot of these old systems just don’t have them‘We’ve got an expensive roof, sitting on a very rocky foundation.
‘If you don’t invest in those systems that people don’t see, then you get that sort of attack.
Baltimore was criticised for leaving itself vulnerable to its cyber-attack due to its decentralised and dated IT systems.', 'It may have been released in 1985 as a redesign of the original Famicon, but this vintage console was brand new and still in the box.
It was fully functional and has the old-school color palette of 48 colors and six grays.
The display resolution was a distinctive 256 x 240 pixels.
The seller also suggested the Nintendo console can be used as a vintage display item.
Buy: Nintendo NES Sports Set System Console, $779.99', 'You might not be looking to win road races in the summer, but we’d really recommend getting stuck into some cyclocross racing.

About Gamers OutreachGamers Outreach is a 501(c)(3) charity organization that provides recreation to children in hospitals through the power of video games and the gaming community.
We are known for our medical grade gaming kiosk called the Gamers Outreach Kart, “GO Kart” for short.']

title: ['2020 Shelby GT350R Hits eBay At $2,000 Over MSRP - Ford Authority', 'Pictionary Air TRIPLE the price on Amazon and eBay as top Christmas gift sells out in shops... - The Sun', 'Amazon and eBay account for 40% of UK ecommerce - Ecommerce News']
summary:
['', 'PARENTS are up in arms as must-have Christmas gift Pictionary Air is being sold for triple the price on Amazon and eBay after selling out in stores.
For example, the cheapest Pictionary Air is selling for on Amazon is £48.87 - £33.87 more expensive than what Argos was charged.
Pictionary Air is a modern take on the classic game, where what you draw in the air appears on your smart phone.
Smyths was selling Pictionary Air for £19.99, while it was going for £20 on The Entertainer website - making Argos the cheapest of the bunch.
"I was going to get Pictionary Air when I spotted it a few weeks back.', 'Amazon and eBay dominate the UK ecommerce market.
This year, the two ecommerce giants have a market share in the United Kingdom of 39.9 percent.
Amazon even saw its ecommerce market share in the United Kingdom increase.
Sainsbury’s ranks thirdThe next biggest player, according to insights from Edge by Ascential, is eBay with a 9.8 percent share of the online market.
Currently, ecommerce in the UK is the third largest market, only behind China and the United States.']

title: ['Luxury Mercedes and Rolex watches sold by police on eBay after jailing gang - Daily Mail', '‘Zybourne Clock’ original art is selling for over $4,000 on eBay - The Daily Dot', 'eBay relaunches Motors app with AI and automation at its core - VentureBeat', 'Mikaela Shiffrin signed swag available on eBay auction to support ... - Vail Daily', 'Buy or Sell a Car via Mobile with the New eBay Motors App - PR Newswire', '¿Tienes viejas cintas de la época dorada? Si es así, podrías estar sentado en una pequeña fortuna - El Nuevo Herald', 'Tempt Fate With This Federalized 2003 Audi RS 6 Avant for Sale on ... - Road & Track']
summary:
["Thrifty Brits looking for a deal before Christmas can get discounted cars, jewellery and designer clothing, with just one catch - they used to be owned by a criminal gang.
The gang loved the high life, and would blow their ill gotten gains on high-end motors such as BMW and Mercedes, expensive designer clothing and Rolex watches.
Their stolen goods will also be sold in the coming weeks on Leicestershire Police's eBay site.
Mr Wenlock continued: 'As well as goods from Leicestershire cases we also sell items on behalf of our regional forces.
'He was issued with a confiscation order and designer clothing and jewellery was sold on Leicestershire's eBay site on their behalf.'", 'The sketches were created sometime around 2006 for a video game called “Zybourne Clock,” which never came to be.
The team behind the game came together on the Something Awful forums.
The original map of the city where Zybourne Clock takes place/A character sketch of “Johnny Five Aces” one of the main characters from Zybourne clock.
While the majority of people might have never heard of “Zybourne Clock,” it’s the stuff of legends amongst hardcore gamers.
But I’ve spent the last 13 years randomly stumbling upon people bringing up the Zybourne Clock on a semi-regular basis.', 'The eBay Motors app has been in beta for a few months, and version 1.0 is now live for Android and iOS.
The photo factorIt’s worth noting that eBay is no stranger to computer vision — the main eBay app has offered visual search tools for a few years.
“User testing of the eBay Motors app showed that photos which are well-organized into three buckets make buyers feel the listing is more trustworthy,” eBay wrote.
As an aside here, while eBay already allowed users to embed videos directly from sites such as YouTube, the new eBay Motors app will now support video uploads — a first for any eBay app.
In other words, eBay Motors taps a gargantuan market, and that is why eBay has elected to relaunch a dedicated mobile app for the segment.', "Ski Team's Mikaela Shiffrin signed some gear to help the Berlack/Astle Fast Skier Award.
Money raised from the online eBay auction will go toward the Fast Skier Award, supporting youth ski racers who excel on and off the mountain.
Special to the DailyProceeds from an online eBay auction featuring exclusively autographed ski race items from Mikaela Shiffrin will go toward supporting the Berlack/Astle Fast Skier Award, recognizing young alpine ski athletes who excel on and off the hill.
The award is given out twice and has a minimum cash prize of $1,000 — as well as ski race products and swag from World Cup Supply, SYNC and Nordica.
Other auction items include a new Atomic race backpack , signed by Shiffrin and tagged with a smiley face.", "Sell a car in five minutes or less on the new eBay Motors app.
Meet the eBay Motors AppeBay Motors' new tailored mobile shopping platform allows consumers to bid on or buy any vehicle, virtually anytime, anywhere.
For a more in-depth look at the technology under the hood of the eBay Motors app, check out this behind-the-scenes break down from the marketplace's tech team.
Buy a Car on eBay MotorsSearching thousands of vehicles for that perfect car or truck can be daunting, but not with eBay Motors' refreshed buyer experience.
Download the eBay Motors app today via the Apple App Store or Google Play Store.", '', "Can't afford to shell out $112,000 for the new-for-America 2020 Audi RS 6 Avant, but still want that big fast Audi wagon experience?
This 2003 RS 6 Avant, which was never sold in America, just popped up for sale on eBay Motors in Arizona.
The seller claims it's been fully federalized for use on U.S. roads, with approvals from the DOT, EPA, and NHTSA.
The seller, a dealer in Mesa, Arizona, says the car will come with a clean Arizona title and a VIN.
Interestingly, it's one of two federalized RS 6 Avants it currently has in stock."]

title: ['YouTuber Buys A Laser On eBay That’s So Terrifyingly Powerful, It Instantly Fries His Camera - Gizmodo Australia', 'You could be sitting on a fortune if you have some old VHS tapes. Here’s how to cash in - Miami Herald', "You can buy million-watt tattoo-removal lasers on eBay, but don't - Boing Boing", "eBay Motors' AI-powered tools will let you list a car in minutes - The Verge", 'New eBay Motors App: User can buy, sell vehicles with AI - Auto Remarketing', 'Woman raves about £2 eBay plug hole hook which instantly removed 2 YEARS’ worth of clogged hair... - The Sun']
summary:
['YouTuber Buys A Laser On eBay That’s So Terrifyingly Powerful, It Instantly Fries His CameraYou can now add ‘30 million-watt peak power tattoo removing laser’ to the long list of things you probably shouldn’t be able to buy on eBay.
YouTuber Drake Anthony, better known as Styropyro, is an expert on all things lasers, and even he was taken aback by the power of a laser that he, or really anyone, can buy on eBay.
A set of included tips allows the colour of the laser to be altered, and at peak power, Anthony estimates it has an output of close to 30 million watts.
That’s only enough time for the emitted light to travel about three meters, whereas if you pointed a laser pointer at the sky for a full second, it would travel over 300,000 kilometres.
The laser easily leaves giant craters when pointed at various metals, including Tungsten, which has the highest melting point of all pure metals at over 3,400 degrees Celsius.', '', "Styropyro plays with fire on his YouTube channel, and the latest video shows him playing with a ridiculously dangerous laser, intended for tattoo removal, that he bought on eBay.
I was searching for a Nd:YAG laser cavity for a future project when I came across a bunch of tattoo removal devices on eBay.
They claimed to contain a Nd:YAG laser but at a small fraction of the cost of buying the parts separately.
Skeptical, I bought one anyway since I had the option to return it if it didn't live up to the seller's claims.
Much to my surprise my unit turned out to be INSANELY powerful.", 'eBay Motors is a new app from the auction site aimed at streamlining the process of buying and selling used cars, and it includes a couple of AI-powered features that eBay claims will help sellers list a car in under five minutes.
The app is available in the US for both iOS and Android, and replaces the old eBay Motors app that was discontinued back in 2015.
There are a couple of different features that eBay claims will help you list a car in minutes.
As well as being the first time an eBay app has offered direct video uploads, according to VentureBeat, these categorization features could potentially boost sales.
In the future, eBay is also hoping to let its AI-tools loose on a listings’ descriptions, reports VentureBeat.', 'SAN JOSE, Calif. -New features of eBay Motors’ all-new, automotive-focused app for Apple iPhone and Android include a personalized homepage, streamlined listing capabilities and improved search filters.
Once they do that, shoppers can access eBay Motors’ vehicle inventory, including new or pre-owned, classic, rare and collectible vehicles.
eBay Motors says that through its new tailored mobile shopping platform, consumers can bid on or buy any vehicle, “virtually anytime, anywhere.”Through its new AI-driven vehicle pages, users can populate and showcase a vehicle for purchase.
The app will use that information to automatically populate details such as make and model, year and VIN.
In less than 5 minutes, a seller can create and populate a listing in just a few steps.', 'But rather than trying to get the worst of it out with your hands - *shivers* - Mrs Hinch superfans are going wild for a £2 eBay gadget which promises to remove the slimy, clogged hair in an instant.
In other words, what hope is there for the rest of us who happily rinse our stray strands down the plug?
3 Other members of the group raved about the gadget Credit: FacebookOther members in the group have also been raving about the affordable product.
For more genius home hacks, this cleaning-mad mum used a lint roller to get her dusty lamp shade fleck-free.
Plus a Mrs Hinch fan used a 59p Home Bargains squeegee to get hair out of her carpet - and the amount she gets up is horrifying.']

title: ['Conscious Christmas Consumption: eBay or Depop? - Study Breaks']
summary:
['When the best gift option is probably clothing, the best platform is probably Depop — or eBay.
It depends on what you’re looking for and whether or not you’re a member of Generation Z.
If you’re looking for a mid-range, popular clothing item and want to feel like you’re on Instagram, then Depop is for you.
The OG site has arguably more to offer overall, but Depop is better by far if you’re looking for a specific trendy aesthetic.
If you’re looking for clothing, both eBay and Depop can be solutions to the problem, and if they don’t work out, try eBay again.']

title: ['eBay Eliminates Sneaker Seller Fees for the First Time and Unveils ... - PR Newswire', 'Why eBay believes in open-sourcing Krylov, its AI platform - VentureBeat', 'British Heart Foundation raises funds by selling on eBay for charity - Daily Mail', 'Shoppers praise a £1.99 silver cleaning cloth from eBay for rescuing their jewellery - Daily Mail']
summary:
['Today, eBay announced the marketplace is eliminating sneaker seller fees in North America on any sneakers sold at $100 or more, and unveils a new December Drop series.
eBay's new "2019 Sneaker Resale Report" reveals the top trends in sneaker culture in 2019 according to sales data.
New "2019 Sneaker Resale Report" | Five Biggest Trends in 2019To celebrate 2019, eBay tracked what's on every sneakerhead's wish list with its "2019 Sneaker Resale Report," detailing the year's top trends according to sales data8.
1 Applies to sneakers sold in Men's and Women's Athletic Shoes; qualifying price does not include shipping, handling, taxes, or fees.
7 Applies to sneakers sold in Men's and Women's Athletic Shoes; price does not include shipping, handling, taxes, or fees.', 'Learn MoreIt’s hard to find a tech company that isn’t attempting some sort of AI-related product, service, or initiative these days, but eBay went all-in by building its own AI platform, called Krylov.
Katariya described how the company built the platform and explained why he believes in open-sourcing it.
Why build an AI platform?
Katariya discussed how eBay approached the challenge of creating a unified AI platform in a company that wasn’t yet sufficiently unified.
“One of the fundamental principles that we know, [that] we have leveraged, is that we have a global internal audience building a machine learning platform for us.', "'One in five' mobiles brought from eBay contain 'highly sensitive' information about the previous owner including national insurance numbers and 'private photos'.
Researchers at the University of Hertfordshire brought 100 phones listed on eBay and found 19 per cent contained personally identifiable information.
'One in five' mobiles brought from eBay contain 'highly sensitive' information about the previous owner including national insurance numbers and 'private photos'.
Researchers say this is 'evidence of an attempt by the user to erase personal data'.
A similar study examining secondhand memory devices found over half still contained data from previous owners.", "A cleaning enthusiast convinced her blackened 14-year-old Tiffany ring was no longer wearable is hailing a cheap silver cleaning cloth for restoring it to its former glory.
She managed to find two Pandora cleaning cloths, which retail at £5 in branches of the jewellery store, for just £1.99 on eBay - and her silver ring is now clean and shiny.
After seeing another member of the group had recommended a £5 cloth from Pandora to rejuvenate oxidised silver, Katie set about finding a cheaper option online.
Impressed by Katie's results, members of the group vowed to order the cloth and try it for themselves.
Lisa Winstanley shared pictures of her oxidised bracelet, which was a gift from her best friends for her 30th birthday 15 years ago."]

Southport's near the coast - I didn't want my house being taken into the sky by this giant Santa.
Downstairs in the front room, when you opened the curtains, there was a big Santa bum in your face.
"At Halloween I had some inflatable zombies so I thought I'd just do that for Christmas.', 'If you’re a fan of Aldi’s Kevin the Carrot, we have some good news for you.

title: ['EBay drops all sneaker selling fees to compete with GOAT, StockX - Glossy', 'Bought Boat on eBay, Beached It in Montauk, Beat the Charges and ... - East Hampton Star', "You can own this motorcycle-engined road 'rocket' - Autoblog"]
summary:
['But eBay, in a play to siphon sellers from other players in the sneaker resale space, has dropped selling fees for sneakers entirely.
But as of Tuesday, sneakers no longer carry any selling fees for pairs sold for more than $100.
As competition between all those players heats up, removing selling fees entirely is one way the company is looking to get back on top and stimulate its own internal sneaker economy.
In 2019, 6 million pairs of sneakers were sold through eBay, and $10 million worth of sneakers were sold on eBay in 2018, up from $2 million the year before.
Competing on selling fees is also important since eBay does not compete with other resellers on authentication.', 'On Sept. 27, Matthew Hunt, a 21-year-old from Arizona, ran into trouble in his newly purchased sailboat, the Vanna White.
The boat sank on Sept. 26 as it was being towed to Montauk Harbor.
A handwritten note in Mr. Hunt’s court file indicates that the town never filed a supporting deposition.
He flew to New York two days later, took a train to Montauk, and picked up his boat there.
Mr. Hunt later hit it off with Edward McFarland, the owner of Ed’s Lobster Bar East in Sag Harbor, and worked there for a short time.', "It's a car, it's a plane, it's a motorcycle, it's street-legal, and it could be yours.This weird mashup is available now on eBay.
Designed by aircraft engineer Jim Bede, the vehicle initially was known as the Litestar Autocycle, but the the name changed to Pulse Autocycle after Bede sold out to the Owosso Motor Car Company.
Owosso built the vehicles from 1984 to 1990.
The rocket-shaped fiberglass body is built around motorcycle mechanicals.
Although there are four wheels, only three are used at a time, as the outrigger wheels don't both touch the ground at the same time."]

title: ['Avoid making this big mistake when selling your old phone on eBay ... - Komando', 'Extra Step Required When Reporting eBay Sales to IRS - EcommerceBytes', 'Mum creates incredible Lion King-themed bedroom for son using eBay & Asda bargains... - The Irish Sun']

To get your phone in shape for selling, you’ll want to erase it back to factory settings.
Select Factory data reset and then tap Reset device.
Then tap Reset phone.
Then, select Factory data reset and tap Reset Phone.', 'eBay sent a notice to sellers advising them of an extra step required when reporting sales to the IRS.
You will need to remove the total amount of sales tax collected (will be outlined in the report)."
Internet sales tax was collected and applied to sales transactions for states that required eBay to collect tax in 2019.
PayPal will send a tax form 1099-K to you and the IRS by January 31, 2020.
You will need to remove the total amount of sales tax collected (will be outlined in the report).', 'A PROUD mum has revealed how she created an incredible Lion King-themed bedroom for her Disney-obsessed son using bargains from eBay and Asda.
6 Simone created an incredible Lion-King room for her son Declan using Asda and eBay bargainsSharing photos of her hard work on the Facebook group DIY On a Budget, the mum-of-two wrote: "My little boys new Lion King bedroom!
The lucky little boy now has his own Lion King mural in his room complete with all the characters (which his mum bagged for £50 on eBay) and Simba bedding from ASDA.
She said: "He’s been a lion king fan since being a baby and loved going to Florida last Christmas and meeting the characters.
Declan absolutely loves it - he tells everyone he meets about his lion king bedroom and his big boy bed!"']

Starting in January 2020, listing vehicles in Other Vehicles & Trailers, Boats, Powersports in eBay Motors will be faster and easier with simplified package pricing.
With this change all categories will have simplified pricing.”eBay is introducing three pricing options for sellers who list six or fewer vehicles during a calendar year, saying they include “bundles of assorted features for auction and fixed price listings.”It’s also introducing options for high-volume sellers (sellers who list more than six vehicles during a calendar year) in certain categories.
For additional context, take a look at section 6 of the September 7th “Online Sellers Guide to eBay Fall Seller Update 2019” in EcommerceBytes Update to see how eBay “simplified” fees for eBay Motors in October.

title: ["How to use eBay Bucks or sign up for eBay's rewards program - Business Insider"]
summary:
["You can use the eBay Bucks Rewards Program to receive a percentage back on qualified eBay purchases in the form of an eBay Certificate.
First, you need to sign up for eBay Bucks, and then eBay will issue you a Bucks Certificate every quarter.
The eBay Bucks Rewards Program is eBay's free rewards program.
The program can be lucrative — users can earn up to $100 in eBay Bucks per transaction, and up to $500 in eBay Bucks per quarter.
Once you're signed up and logged into your account, you'll automatically begin earning eBay bucks on purchases that have the eBay Bucks icon."]

title: ['Here are the most expensive purchases on eBay in 2019 – and one includes lunch with Warren Buffett - CNBC', 'How to get a refund on eBay with Money Back Guarantee - Business Insider']
summary:
['The most expensive purchases on eBay in 2019 varied, including high-end experiences – like a lunch with Warren Buffett that cost more than $4.5 million – to costly luxury items – like a $350,000 2015 Lamborghini Aventador Roadster.
In eBay's "Most Interesting and Expensive Purchases" list for the year, the company analyzed data from global eBay purchases between Jan. 1, 2019 to Dec. 6, 2019, finding the biggest sales on the e-commerce platform in 2019.
Here are the top five overall most expensive purchases on eBay this year:', 'You can get a refund from eBay under the company's Money Back Guarantee.
While eBay sellers should hopefully offer you a refund willingly, eBay will step in to mediate if necessary.
If you never received your item, click on "More options" and then "I didn't receive my item."
The seller has three days to respond to your request and send your refund.
If they don't, you can escalate things via the eBay Resolution Center and eBay will step in within 48 hours to assure your money is refunded to your original payment method.']

The 2015 Lamborghini Aventador LP700-4 Roadster sold for $349,800 while the later 2019 models of the Lamborghini Urus "Bianco Icarus” and Lamborghini Huracan sold for $245,995 and $209,900, respectively.

title: ["How to delete an eBay listing you've posted in 5 steps - Business Insider", 'These Were The Most Expensive Cars Sold On eBay In 2019 - Motor1', 'eBay Find of the Day | 1993 Toyota Previa - Autoblog']
summary:
["You can delete an eBay listing you've posted if you no longer want to sell the item, though certain restrictions apply.
Deleting your eBay listing will cancel all active bids and remove it from users' watchlists.
While the process is relatively simple and straightforward, there are times when sales don't go smoothly on the seller's end and you might need to delete your eBay listing.
You cannot cancel an auction listing early if you've received bids and there are fewer than 12 hours left on the listing.
How to delete an eBay listing you've posted1.", 'The online auction platform eBay has released the results of its annual Most Interesting and Expensive Purchases internal research.
Indeed, there have been some quite interesting purchases during the last 12 months but we’ll focus on the most expensive cars sold on eBay from January 1, 2019 to December 6, 2019.
The Top 5 list includes a 2019 Lamborghini Huracan LP580-2 sold for $209,900 as the "cheapest" car, just 10 grand short of a 2019 Mercedes-Benz G-Class that changed hands for $219,000.
Above that, there’s a 2005 Ford Ford GT sold for $220,000, plus two more Lambos - a 2019 Lamborghini Urus "Bianco Icarus" ($245,995) and a 2015 Lamborghini Aventador LP700-4 Roadster which sold for $349,800, making it the most expensive car sold on eBay in 2019.
2015 Lamborghini Aventador LP700-4 Roadster: $349,8002019 Lamborghini Urus "Bianco Icarus": $245,9952005 Ford Ford GT:$220,0002019 Mercedes-Benz G-Class: $219,0002019 Lamborghini Huracan LP580-2: $209,900Good eBay Finds From 2019:The Aventador Roadster ranked fourth in eBay’s most expensive purchases list for 2019, where lunch with Warren Buffett was sold on eBay for Charity for a whopping $4,567,888.', 'The Previa is just old enough that they’ve all but disappeared from suburban parking lots, which is good for this ovoid van.
Removed from its banal existence running kids around town, you can better appreciate what Toyota actually built.
A mid-engined van.
While the Previa is much more interesting, any rational analysis would conclude that Chrysler had a better idea.
The Buy It Now price is a not-astronomical $8,950, and it is a claimed one-owner car with 91,000 miles.']

title: ['This Ultra Rare $350,000 Michael Jordan Basketball Card Was One of eBay’s Biggest Sales of 2019 - Robb Report', 'Here Are the 10 Most Expensive Cars Sold on eBay in 2019. Yes, eBay. - InsideHook', 'Samsung Galaxy Note 10 eBay Deal is Over $300 Off - Business Insider', 'Studio worker stole Harry Potter merchandise to sell on eBay - Nottinghamshire Live', 'Younger People Get Scammed on Instagram, EBay, and Amazon - VICE']
summary:
['But most eye-catching of all may have been a Michael Jordan basketball card that sold for $350,100.
Coming in as the third most expensive sale of the year was a 1997-1998 Metal Universe Precious Metal Gems Green card featuring number 23 himself, according to a press release from eBay.
Considered the “Holy Grail” of modern basketball cards, the Precious Metal Gems card is the most expensive basketball card ever sold on the online marketplace.
The card is just one of just 10 Jordan Precious Metal Gems cards produced in green foil, and one of only 100 total, according to collectible sports card publication Beckett.
According to Beckett, the sale marked only the second time a Precious Metal Gems Green Jordan card has hit the public market.', 'For us, eBay is a place to buy vintage concert T-shirts and discount headphones.
For others, it’s apparently a place to buy luxury cars for hundreds of thousands of dollars.
This week, eBay released its annual roundup of the “Most Interesting and Expensive Purchases” made on the site.
But of the top 20 most expensive purchases, 12 were cars.
Despite the gargantuan sum paid for the 2015 Aventador, which defies the logic of ecommerce, it was not the biggest ticket item sold in 2019 — not by a long shot.', 'The Galaxy Note 10 is one of Samsung's flagship smartphones, and one of the best Android phones out there.
You can get the Note 10 on eBay right now for just $643.99.
Our reviewer dubbed the Note 10 "the most 'Android' phone you can buy."
In terms of battery life, the Note 10 should easily make it a full day — it lasted 18 hours in CNET's battery test.
The Note 10 is powered by Qualcomm's Snapdragon 855, which delivers excellent performance as Android phones go.', 'Join us as we follow the magical worlds of Fantastic Beasts and Harry PotterA former Warner Bros Studio employee stole £36,935 worth of Harry Potter merchandise to sell on eBay.
Adam Hill, 35, stole Harry Potter items to order, including wands, ties, badges and key rings, from the Warner Bros Studio stockroom between December 2017 and March 2018.
The thefts were discovered in March 2018 after colleagues noticed Harry Potter stock appearing and disappearing from under Hill’s desk, and reported him to their bosses.
In the internal investigation that followed, they found that Hill had sold 1,040 items of Harry Potter merchandise through his eBay account.
When Hill’s car was searched, they found 12 parcels of Harry Potter items ready to be posted which matched sales he had made on eBay.', 'Close your eyes and picture someone at the wrong end of an online scam.
The FTC’s findings are backed up by the Better Business Bureau, a nonprofit organization that closely tracks scam activity.
Advertisement“We were initially surprised by the results,” said Katherine Hutt, the Better Business Bureau’s national spokesperson.
Unsurprisingly, one area of particularly strong scam growth has been on various social media platforms, according to the Better Business Bureau.
The Better Business Bureau has found one other scam-aligned characteristic that will feel familiar to many internet users: loneliness.']

title: ['Amazon Is Not the Biggest Threat eBay Faces - The Motley Fool', "Children 'at risk' of buying LSD style 'tripper seeds' from eBay at £3 a go - Liverpool Echo"]
summary:
["It's been a tough year for eBay (EBAY 2.82%), as it tries to turn around its marketplace business.
One of those is Etsy (ETSY -2.75%), the fast-growing upstart led by a former eBay executive that's known for its offering of handmade and vintage items.
Gross merchandise sales on Etsy's marketplace grew 30% year over year in the third quarter.
This differentiates Etsy's marketplace from not only eBay but also giants like Amazon.

title: ['eBay reveals most expensive purchases on its site in 2019 - Business Insider', 'Jaipur Lab to Certify eBay India Gemstones - IDEX Online']
summary:
["AdvertisementeBay has revealed the top 20 most expenses purchases from its site in 2019.
The list of purchases included a $4.6 million lunch with billionaire investor Warren Buffett and a $400,000 trading card autographed by six-time Super Bowl winner Tom Brady.
Several cars made the list, as well, including a Rolls Royce, an Aston Martin, and multiple Lamborghinis.
Here's the full list.", '(IDEX Online) - Gemstone sellers using eBay India can now get their goods certified by the Jaipur-based Gem Testing Laboratory (GTL) for a nominal fee.
Under a new agreement between the lab and the trading giant, all gemstones sold through eBay will be accompanied by a GTL certificate.
The move is designed to increase consumer confidence in gemstones sold online and to boost exports of gemstones and gemstone-studded jewelry from India.
"It will help the sellers on eBay to build customer confidence as well as assist in increasing sales of Indian handcrafted gemstones and allied jewelry in overseas markets."
Agrawal also said the GJEPC believes other ecommerce platforms will sign similar agreements with GTL, one of the oldest labs in India, this year.']

title: ['Facebook and eBay promise to crack down on fake reviews - The Guardian', "Now on eBay: burnt bits of Aleister Crowley's infamous Boleskine House - Boing Boing"]
summary:
['Facebook and eBay have pledged to crack down on the trade of fake and misleading reviews on their sites, the UK’s competition watchdog has announced.
Both online platforms have signed up to agreements to better identify, investigate and respond to illegal reviews, the Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) said.
After the the CMA raised concerns about the proliferation of fake and misleading reviews on the technology giants’ platforms last summer, Facebook removed 188 groups and shut down 24 accounts, while eBay has banned 140 users.
“Fake reviews are really damaging to shoppers and businesses alike,” said the CMA’s chief executive, Andrea Coscelli.
Sign up to the daily Business Today email or follow Guardian Business on Twitter at @BusinessDeskA Facebook spokesperson said: “Fraudulent activity is not allowed on Facebook or Instagram, including offering or trading fake reviews.', 'Last year, the almost entirely charred remains of Boleskine House, occultist Aleister Crowley's infamous digs on the shores of Loch Ness in Scotland that Jimmy Page later owned, went up for sale.
Just days after Keith and Kyra Readdy purchased the property, the remaining wing burned in a fire.
To raise funds, they're selling bits of the burnt house on eBay for £35.00 to £49.00 with a certificate of authenticity.
"The Boleskine estate is a treasure of heritage and history that must be secured for future generations.
I believe it can stand as a landmark for culture, research, and well-being that all can benefit from."']

title: ['The EBay Veteran Cashing In On The $369 Billion Returns Boom - Forbes', 'Iranian-American owned or operated companies: Uber, Tinder, eBay - Business Insider', 'NFL Player Says He Was Tricked Into Donating Gloves for Charity ... - PEOPLE', '1969 Ford Mustang Mach 1 428 Cobra Jet On eBay - Ford Authority', 'Currys PC World add sale items to official eBay store - Daily Record']
summary:
['', 'Despite increasing tensions between the two nations, there are Iranian-American communities across the country, and they make up a vital part of the US.
The Census Bureau estimates that nearly half a million Americans self-identify as having Iranian heritage.
The over 27,000 Iranian-Americans living in the San Francisco-Oakland-Hayward metropolitan area are especially crucial to Silicon Valley, where skilled tech workers are in high demand.
Business Insider has assembled a list of major companies helmed or founded by Iranian-Americans.
Many of the business leaders included on this non-exhaustive list fled Iran in the late 1970s and early 1980s following the Iranian Revolution that overthrew a monarchy and implemented an Islamic Republic.', 'Minnesota Vikings player Kyle Rudolph used social media this week to voice his disappointment after spotting a pair of his donated gloves on eBay instead of the charity event he was told it would benefit.
Then, just three days later, a Twitter user alerted Rudolph to an eBay listing featuring the gloves.
Well he got me, sold on eBay 3 days later.”The gloves sold for just $375.
“I will gladly donate to a charity of your choice.”Rudolph wrote back requesting the gloves go to the University of Minnesota Masonic Children’s Hospital.
“If I end up receiving the gloves, I would like them to be displayed at the children’s hospital in honor of Kyle,” he told the outlet.', '', "Currys PC World has delivered some great tech deals of late giving savvy shoppers the opportunity to upgrade their home for less.
And if you’re still keen to pick up a bargain this month, take a look at Currys official eBay outlet store where you can bag even more bargains.
The Mirror Online recently reported that Currys had kicked off a huge New Year clearance sale, with some top branded tech and electricals slashed to almost half price.
The sale deals, are also available on the Currys clearance outlet on eBay and includes everything from Apple MacBook laptops to kitchen appliances from Philips and Kenwood.
(Image: Currys PC World)If you're wondering what sort of items are included in the incredible savings, here are a few of our top picks below."]

title: ['The ‘Uncut Gems’ Bedazzled Furby Reselling for Nearly $1,000 on eBay - IndieWire']
summary:
['Anyone who watches Josh and Benny Safdie’s “Uncut Gems” walks away wanting one piece of jewelry: A bedazzled Furby pendant necklace.
The Furby appears as an item for sale in the jewelry shop owned by “Uncut Gems” protagonist Howard Ratner, played in a virtuoso performance by Adam Sandler.
A24 was selling the Furby necklace for $250, but eBay users are fielding offers for nearly $1,000.
Josh Safdie told Vulture shortly after “Uncut Gems” opened in select theaters that creating the Furby pendant was a natural extension of Howard’s character.
“Uncut Gems” is now playing in theaters nationwide.']

His solicitor told Kirklees magistrates that he feared further attacks after being the victim of a serious assault.
Harrison's Fiesta caught their attention because of an unusual manoeuvre and the officers decided to follow it, Mr Bozman said.
Mr Bozman said: “He told the officers that the cosh was his and he'd bought it from eBay.
They fined him £1,066 and ordered him to pay £106 victim surcharge plus £85 costs.", 'Now, nearly 18 years after the show ended, the van is up for grabs for a memorabilia hunter.
Denise Cartledge, who bought the van four years ago from a seller in St Helens, is hoping the van will appeal to a fan.
“With Peter Kay doing the Phoenix Nights charity screenings, I felt like now is the right time.
The van appeared in a couple of episodes of Phoenix Nights, where Peter Kay and Paddy McGuinness played Max and Paddy, the club’s two bouncers.

title: ['Peter Navarro puts Amazon and eBay on notice: The China trade deal cracks down on counterfeits - CNBC', 'eBay coupon: Save 15% on AirPods, Apple Watches, iPads - AppleInsider', 'Toxic skin whitening products being sold on eBay despite warnings - The Telegraph']
summary:
['China agreed to consider revoking operating licenses if e-commerce platforms repeatedly sell counterfeit goods.
The U.S. agreed to discuss further measures to combat online sales of counterfeit goods.
"We don't love regulations in this administration, but what we do love is corporations accepting their appropriate responsibility," Navarro said in Thursday's "Squawk Box" interview.
"I've told Amazon, I've told eBay , I've told all these platforms we had here at the White House, it's like, look, this is harming your consumers.
You're making a bunch of money off these folks selling this counterfeit stuff, but you're not accepting your full responsibility," Navarro said.', "Read our ethics policyArticle Hero ImagePromo code deals are back at eBay, with a number of Apple products eligible for a 15% discount, including AirPods, current iPads, Apple Watches and more.
eBay coupon savingsNow through Jan. 22, shoppers can save 15% instantly on select tech products at eBay with coupon code PLUGGEDIN.
Whether you're looking for the lowest price on AirPods, Apple's latest 10.2-inch iPad or a budget-friendly Apple Watch, there are a number of Apple devices in new, used and refurbished condition to choose from.
Top picks can be found below, while a full list of items eligible for the coupon can be found on this eBay sale page.
Top picksAdditional Apple dealsAppleInsider and Apple authorized resellers are also running additional exclusive savings on Apple hardware that will not only deliver the lowest prices on many of the items, but also throw in bonus offers on AppleCare, software and more.", 'Two skin whitening products, that had been removed by Amazon UK for containing more than 10 times the legal amount of mercury, still being sold by eBay.
Thirty six of those products could be purchased from Amazon and eBay stores within Europe and the US.
Despite the growing scrutiny on online retailers to clamp down on skin lightening products, eBay continues to sell the two creams for as little as £6.49.
Unless prescribed by a doctor, skin lightening creams containing mercury, hydroquinone or steroids are banned within the UK.
She said: "Illegal skin lightening creams can cause serious health problems including thinning of the skin, kidney damage and liver damage."']

Bamber, 58, is serving a life sentence for wiping out five members of his family – including his six-year-old twin nephews - in the sickening White House Farm murders.
5 Jeremy Bamber was convicted of murdering five members of his family Credit: PA5 The letter has been listed for sale for £250The killer still claims he is innocent of the 1985 murders in the family's remote Essex farmhouse.
The seller tells potential buyers: “Excellent two page, (7x5), three sided letter from Jeremy Bamber, wrongly accused in the White House Farm murders?
The shooting of the family in August 1985 in his parents' farmhouse in came to be known as the White House Farm murders.", 'Today at the World Economic Forum (WEF), its Head of Blockchain & DLT, Sheila Warren chaired a panel exploring blockchain tokenization.
Jeremy Allaire, the CEO of Circle, gave a metaphor for tokenization as enabling the long tail of capital.
He pointed to the early days of the internet, where nobody imagined there would be an industry in creating cat videos.
Without mentioning Etsy or eBay, he pointed to the trust mechanisms that were created to allow us to buy goods with confidence, sometimes hand-made, from complete strangers.
Likewise, he believes that particularly for entrepreneurs, in future access to capital will be far broader than is currently available from venture capitalists.']

summary:
['SAN JOSE — eBay has decided to jettison more than 100 jobs in the Bay Area, including employment reductions at the company’s Silicon Valley offices and in San Francisco, according to official state government documents.
The employment reductions began on Jan. 15, a notice filed with the state’s Employment Development Department showed.
Two San Jose locations, including the company’s San Jose headquarters, were affected by the job cuts.
The locations of the staff cuts, according to the state labor agency filing: 2525 N First St. in San Jose; 2145 Hamilton Ave., which is part of the eBay headquarters complex in south San Jose; and 199 Fremont St. in San Francisco.
San Jose-based eBay didn’t detail how many positions would be lost at the three locations, respectively.', "When the 2020 Hall of Fame class was announced on Tuesday, there were shouts of happiness.
Derek Jeter fans -- essentially the entire city of New York, if we're honest -- erupted with joy.
People who aren't Jeter fans -- looking at you, Boston -- were thrilled one writer left The Captain off his ballot.
And when Larry Walker made it in on his final trip on the ballot, sabermetrically-inclined fans and Spongebob Squarepants viewers were united in their glory.", "If you grew up in the '80s or '90s, then chances are you or someone you knew had a Polly Pocket.
But you should be aware that you can make some serious coin if you've got the right type of Polly Pocket.
The most expensive being listed at the moment is titled on the site as a Vintage Polly Pocket BlueBird 1992 Partytime Stampers New In Box.
Imagine a young girl not ripping off the plastic after being gifted a Polly Pocket back in the day.
Another classic Polly Pocket that is attracting a big sum of cash is listed as a 'Ultra Rare' Vintage 1996 Jewel Case.", '', '', 'As state officials make plans to destroy thousands of recalled condom wrappers emblazoned with sexy Utah-themed slogans, a complete set of the 13 condoms appeared on eBay.
The Utah Department of Health ordered 130,000 condoms as part of an HIV awareness campaign launched this month with a coalition of patient advocates.
The Health Department already had sent more than 40,000 of the condoms to community groups and health providers statewide when Gov.
On Tuesday, health officials confirmed they planned to remove the condoms and destroy the cardboard covers.
“I gathered what I could and feel that rather than destroying these, they could help raise money for Utah HIV charities such as the Utah AIDS Foundation,” the eBay seller, identified as “pinkchampagne,” said in a message.', 'eBay hires UK head of corporate comms from GumtreeeBay has hired Gumtree head of PR Fergus Campbell as head of corporate communications.
by John Harrington']

title: ['EBay Q4 2019 earnings: Shares fall as profits decline - Silicon ... - The Business Journals', 'eBay Delivers An Update On Latest Market Trends With 2020 Luxury ... - aBlogtoWatch', 'Rolex Tops Luxury Watch Resale in EBay Report - WWD']
summary:
['', 'As part of the site’s recap of the 2019 sales year, eBay has released a detailed breakdown of current market trends and prices in its 2020 Luxury Watch Report.
Not surprisingly, Rolex continues to dominate on eBay in terms of sheer sales volume, with Rolex timepieces making up a whopping 25 percent of total luxury watch sales on the platform in 2019.
Overall, however, this news confirms the strength and staying power of the current Rolex secondary market.
Despite fears from some collectors wary of the platform, eBay was a sales hub for several ultra-luxury watch purchases over the past year.
Advertising MessageWhile the luxury watch market continues to grow in 2020 and beyond, the eBay 2020 Luxury Watch Report shows that the seminal online auction platform looks to be here to stay in this vibrant and shifting field.', 'EBay has released its 2020 Luxury Watch report and Rolex is leading the way for luxury watch resale.
The Rolex Daytona at one point held the record for the highest priced wristwatch ever sold at auction, selling for $17.8 million in 2017.
(The watch that sold at auction was owned by Paul Newman.)
Patek Philippe is described by eBay as “one of the most worn celebrity watches.” Drake recently sported a Nautilus Ref.
EBay is predicting rose gold and retro styles will be popular trends for 2020, as well as brighter colors such as emerald, salmon and bold blues.']

title: ['EBay shopper wonders why she had to pay sales tax on a used flip phone: Money Matters - cleveland.com', 'A $4.5 Million Lunch With Warren Buffet Tops eBay’s Most Expensive Purchases of 2019 - Robb Report', 'Impeachment press pass pops up on eBay - Roll Call', 'Samsung Galaxy A81 protective case eBay listing seems to confirm ... - gizmochina']
summary:
['Q: I just bought a used flip phone for $13 plus $6 shipping on eBay.
EBay charged me $1.52 in sales tax.
The Ohio website says they don’t charge sales tax on personal sales like garage sales, etc., in part because tax was already charged when it was new.
I’ve never paid sales tax on eBay before, except a few times when the seller had an actual store.
EBay began collecting sales tax from buyers living in Ohio beginning last Sept. 1.', 'Just look at eBay’s annual Most Interesting and Expensive Purchases report for 2019.
Although luxury timepieces didn’t make the top 10, watches represent a large portion of eBay’s most expensive sales.
According to eBay’s 2020 Luxury Watch report released yesterday, Rolex is the most popular brand with its timepieces accounting for 25 percent of luxury watch sales on the site.
To celebrate all those watch sales, eBay is currently offering up to 30 percent off luxury timepieces by Rolex, Omega, Tag Heuer and more.
Get to shopping and maybe even you could make eBay’s “Most Expensive” list next year.', 'Updated 10:16 p.m. | At least one press credential granting media access to the Senate during the impeachment trial of President Donald Trump has been spotted for sale on eBay for $710.
A media “overlay” must be paired with a hard press pass to enter the Senate portion of the Capitol during the impeachment proceeding.
And, to get into the viewing gallery, the reporter must also have a ticket dated with the current day.
The listing for the media overlay and ticket pair had received at least 14 bids before it was removed.
A new listing for only the ticket dated Jan. 23 appeared on the seller’s eBay page late Wednesday.', '']

title: ['Kobe Bryant memorabilia is selling for up to $3 million on eBay - FOX61 Hartford', 'Rolex Leads in eBay Luxury Watch Report 2020 - HYPEBEAST']
summary:
['Demand for Kobe Bryant merchandise reached a fever pitch almost immediately after the legendary Laker perished in a helicopter crash Sunday along with his 13-ye...Demand for Kobe Bryant merchandise reached a fever pitch almost immediately after the legendary Laker perished in a helicopter crash Sunday along with his 13-year-old daughter, Gianna, and seven other victims.
Many fans have since turned to eBay and other auction sites to purchase any Kobe-related memorabilia they can find.
One eBay user wanted $3 million for a basketball signed by Bryant and the rest of the Lakers’ 2002 “3-peat” championship team on Wednesday.
Another asked Bryant fans for $2.88 million for a “one-of-a-kind” ball Bryant signed after winning his first NBA title.
Julien also criticized the prices for Kobe merchandise currently being auctioned on eBay.', 'Online auction site eBay has released its Luxury Watch Report for 2020, highlighting the best selling brands, models, most expensive sales and trends across the two million pieces sold in the past year.
The report states that Rolex rules the roost as it accounts for 25% of all luxury watches sold, dominated by its stainless steel models like the Submariner and GTM-Master.
Brands including Omega, Breitling, Tag Heuer and Patek Philippe make up the top five alongside the category leader, Rolex.
Check out eBay’s full Luxury Watch Report for 2020 online.
In other news, MAD Paris has crafted a trio of blacked-out Patek Philippe timepieces.']

title: ["Warren Buffett's $4.6 million crypto lunch tops eBay's biggest buys - Markets Insider", 'Mum raves about bargain £7 hairbrush from eBay that prevents detangling tantrums - Heart', 'Should I Buy RealForce 108UG-HiPro Keycaps for Sale on eBay? - Gizmodo', 'Warning over fake Brexit 50p coins for sale on eBay as real one goes into circulation today... - The Sun']
summary:
["Warren Buffett's $4.6 million charity lunch was the biggest purchase on eBay last year.
The billionaire investor and Berkshire Hathaway CEO donated the auction proceeds to GLIDE, a homeless charity.
Cryptocurrency entrepreneur Justin Sun made the winning bid but dropped out days before, sparking conspiracies he was in trouble with Chinese authorities.
Justin Sun — the founder and CEO of Tron, which operates the world's 12th largest cryptocurrency — made the winning bid last year.
Sun, a protégé of Alibaba founder Jack Ma, invited a raft of crypto bosses and President Donald Trump to attend the lunch.", "Mum raves about bargain £7 hairbrush from eBay that prevents detangling tantrumsThe brush will transform mornings.
Picture: GettyBy Mared ParryIt's an absolute steal and will make life a lot easier for parents whose children have long hair!
Anyone with young children will relate to the horror of having to brush their youngsters' hair in the morning - and the tantrums that come along with it!
Well fear no more, as a mum has shared her amazing online find after she discovered a cut-price hairbrush that easily detangles her daughter's hair.
READ MORE: Barbie unveils new range which aims to diversify the dolls, including one with no hairThe brush is an absolute bargain.", 'Topre switches are fairly unique in the big, complex world of key switches.
This means CherryMX keycaps won’t work with a Topre keyboard.
AdvertisementSo, if you want to customize a Topre keyboard, you have two options.
The second option for customizing a Topre keyboard is finding Topre keycaps.
An actual, and less rare, RealForce Topre keyboard with similar caps (and fewer colors) can be found on Amazon for $250.', 'COIN hunters are being warned to watch out for fake Brexit 50p coins being sold on eBay as the real deal goes into circulation today.
Some sellers are advertising 50ps that feature a circle of hands marking the UK's entry into the EEC as the "new Brexit" coins, despite being minted back in 1973.
An initial batch was made featuring the original Brexit date of March 31 2019 before an extension was granted, and a second coin was made featuring October 31 2019.
Colin Bellamy from Coin Hunter warns that coins with one of the earlier dates on them being sold on eBay are highly unlikely to be real.
Plans to produce 10,000 special Brexit coins were first announced by former chancellor Philip Hammond in the 2018 Budget.']

title: ['Shortest Shipwreck: Vanna White, Matthew Hunt, eBay, the Montauk ... - Dan’s Papers']
summary:
['In late September, a 21-year-old Arizona man named Matthew Hunt purchased a 27-foot sailboat on eBay.
Hunt flew to La Guardia Airport carrying his possessions, then took the train to Montauk to meet up with Vanna White, for that was the name of his newly purchased ship.
Just 45 minutes after Hunt started his new life, the Vanna White slid up onto the beach, dug in its keel and came to a halt, listing sideways to starboard.
Sea Tow Montauk, an outfit that hauls in crippled ships, was called, and soon thereafter the Vanna White was refloated and towed back toward the dock at Montauk Harbor.
On its way, Vanna White sank in shallow water just at the jetties, (where it had to be dragged up later).']

The service wasn't being used by enough employees to justify the cost, according to a person close to the company.
The majority of eBay's shuttle service operated between San Francisco (the North Bay) and San Jose (the South Bay), where the company already has two offices respectively, this person said.
Silicon Valley tech companies including Facebook , Google and Apple contract shuttle services for employees who commute from various areas around San Francisco Bay Area's sprawling region.
Tech workers often live far outside of San Francisco and Silicon Valley in search of lower housing prices.", 'The Evergreen State ferry was up for auction by its Florida owner on eBay.

title: ['Local Residents Scammed Using ebay Gift Cards - Kfiz', "eBay's Missing Fast Shipping Flywheel - Marketplace Pulse", 'eBay CEO Takes a Vertical Approach to Compete with Rivals - EcommerceBytes']
summary:
['Local NewsLocal authorities are reminding residents to, again, be aware of online scams.
Police were called to the 600 Block of West Arndt St, where a 69-year old female told police she had been purchasing eBay gift cards through Western Union and sending those cards to Nigeria.
The female told police she had sent close to $7000 in gift cards between June and November of 2019.
A 55-year old Fond du Lac man reported he had found a truck for sale on eBay, and had paid for it using eBay gift cards.
Police again reminding residents to make sure the sites you are ordering from are legitimate ones.', 'Years after announcing fast shipping options on eBay, less than 1% of the over 800 million listings for sale on the platform offer three-day shipping.
Only 340 of which offer guaranteed three-day delivery, and just 30 come with free three-day delivery.
This behavior is the fast shipping flywheel, an economic engine that incentivizes sellers to improve customer experience through a greater selection of products with fast shipping.
And that incentive should be that shoppers are more likely to buy their products if they offer fast shipping.
All of this to say that the reason so few items on eBay offer fast shipping is because there is no incentive for sellers.', 'eBay is looking at getting back to its roots and is willing to experiment more in vertical markets, according to eBay interim CEO Scott Schenkel.
They tend to index towards collectibles, vintage, last year's model - it's the "spectrum of value" eBay provides, Schenkel said.
When asked about growth, Schenkel said, "Regardless of who's running the company, it's about what categories or verticals make sense for us."
When asked where eBay was seeing incremental competition, Schenkel said ecommerce is seeing a lot more funding into vertical niche players.
They're bringing in a user experience that's more fresh, that's differentiated, that's mobile only, etc.']

title: ["Unique £1 'mistake' coin sells for a whopping £112 on eBay - Heart", "Rare 'Fried Egg' Minting Error £1 Coin Sells For £112 On Ebay - LADbible", 'Cheeky eBay sellers flogging McDonald’s 50p Big Mac sauce for £5 a pot... - The Sun']
summary:
["Unique £1 'mistake' coin sells for a whopping £112 on eBayThe unique-looking coin has fetched over £100 on eBay.
Picture: eBayThe unique one pound coin has twelve sides to it and has taken the fancy of a collector on eBay.
An unique coin, which was from an error batch has fetched over a hundred pounds on eBay, after it was listed last month on the online marketplace site.
Usually, in a perfect coin the inner circle fits the outer one but this particular unique coin is different in that respect.
The coin fetched £112.", "Some lucky sod has managed to make themselves £111 on eBay, having turned over a nice profit from a dodgy £1 coin.
The seller claimed a minting error left it looking like a 'fried egg', with the silver-coloured part of the coin sitting slightly off-centre, overlapping the golden-coloured ring around the edge.
The 2019 'Rare Mis-struck £1 Coin Fried Egg One Pound' that was sold on eBay ended up attracting just two bidders, but between them the demand was high - pushing the price up from the starting bid of £100 up to £112.
That one was made using the blank from an old pound coin - something that's not only very rare, but also very collectable.
If you're one of the lucky people with a genuine rare coin, you can then look into flogging it through a coin sealer, at auction or via online listings sites like eBay.", "MCDONALD’S Big Mac sauce finally went on sale today - and cheeky eBay sellers are already selling pots for 10 times their original price.
The fast food chain has added 50ml dipping tubs of so-called Special Sauce to the menu for 50p each.
Big Mac sauce is a closely guarded secret and is usually only found in the signature burger.
To mark the release of the Big Mac sauce, McDonald's is also giving away 250 bottles of the stuff at one London restaurant today, February 12.
McDonald's last gave away bottles of Big Mac sauce in 2017 - but only in the US."]

title: ['eBay Completes Sale of StubHub - PR Newswire', 'Top 10 All-Star sneakers on eBay are led by Air Jordan - Business Insider', 'Rare 20p error coin sells for £59 on eBay – how to spot if your change is worth a mint... - The Sun', '2011 Chevrolet Camaro With A Duramax Diesel Engine Pops Up On eBay - GM Authority', 'Macca’s sauce on sale for insane price - news.com.au']
summary:
['SAN JOSE, Calif., Feb. 13, 2020 /PRNewswire/ -- eBay Inc. (Nasdaq: EBAY), a global commerce leader that connects millions of buyers and sellers around the world, today announced that it has completed the sale of StubHub to viagogo for $4.05 billion in cash.
On behalf of the eBay team, we're excited to see how StubHub evolves in its next phase and benefits fans, partners and employees."
Capital allocation – eBay is expanding its share buyback plans for 2020 from $1.5 billion to $4.5 billion.
First quarter 2020 – The Company now expects net revenue between $2.31 billion and $2.36 billion, reflecting the impact of removing StubHub.
Non-GAAP Financial MeasuresThis press release includes the financial measures defined as "non-GAAP financial measures" by the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), including non-GAAP earnings per diluted share.', 'The Air Jordan 11 sneakers that Michael Jordan wore during the 1996 All-Star Game remain one of the top All-Star Weekend sneakers to sell on eBay to this day.
eBay combed through its sales data for the last year to find the top 10 best-selling All-Star Weekend sneakers.
The Air Jordan 11 sneakers that Michael Jordan wore during the 1996 All-Star Game are still one of the top pairs of their kind to sell on eBay.
AdvertisementMichael Jordan's Air Jordan 11 sneakers earned the top spot.
In December, eBay sold out of its pre-release drop of the Air Jordan 11 "Bred" in under four minutes.', "A RARE 20p coin has fetched an impressive £59 on eBay because it's been minted with a mistake on it.
The coin has been circulated but doesn't come with verification from the Royal Mint that it is genuine.
What to do if you've got a rare coin FIRSTLY, you need to make sure the coin is legit and not counterfeit.
The Royal Mint is unable to value a coin but it can confirm whether it is real or not.
If you want to sell the coin you’ve found in your spare change on eBay then you need to know the risks.", '', '']

title: ['eBay: A Case Study Of 2-Sided Marketplaces (NASDAQ:EBAY) - Seeking Alpha', 'The fastest and slowest selling petrol, diesel and electric cars on ... - Motor Trader']
summary:
['eBay Inc. (NASDAQ:EBAY) is one of the most famous two-sided marketplaces, which is connecting buyers and sellers.
Today, eBay is a global commerce platform, which includes the eBay Marketplace, StubHub (which eBay is about to sell to viagogo for a purchase price of $4.5 billion) and classified platforms, which include brands like mobile.de, Kijiji, Gumtree or eBay Kleinanzeigen.
But 44 million active buyers are quite a lot, and Etsy can, therefore, be a threat to eBay.
Amazon launched its marketplace already in 2002 - seven years after eBay - and might therefore be the major competitor of eBay.
With 1.6 billion daily active users and almost 2.5 billion monthly active users, it is easier to start a 2-sided marketplace like eBay.', 'For example dealers saw their used car return on investment fall to just above 75% in November.
The market was hit by a freefall in demand for diesel cars with registrations for the year down -21.8%, the 33rd month of diesel decline.
In fact fewer new car diesel sales mean fewer diesels entering the used market down the road, propping up values in the chain.
The Volvo XC90 sold in 34 days followed by the Renault Zoe (36 days) and BMW 2 Series (37 days).
With the used car return on investment coming under pressure, buying well in the first place has never been more important.']
