summary:
['An eBay user is currently advertising three miniscule 25ml packets of Big Mac sauce for A$114.
Few fast food items elicit the kind of consumer hysteria that the Big Mac's iconic "Special Sauce" does.
And it's diminishing value didn't deter one enterprising eBay seller from listing a bottle for more than A$19,000 (£10,000).
For those hankering for some of that elusive Special Sauce goodness, may we suggest following one of a thousand recipes for it online, or giving our own version a whack below.
EBAY One enterprising eBay seller has listed a bottle of Big Mac sauce at a huge buy-now price.', 'FOUNTAIN VALLEY, Calif.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Today, HyperX, the gaming division of Kingston Technology Company, Inc., and eBay, one of the world’s most popular destinations for everything gaming, are together auctioning 19 limited edition JuJu Smith-Schuster Cloud MIX gaming headsets with proceeds going to charity.
As both a gaming and lifestyle representative of HyperX, Smith-Schuster brings his passion both on and off the field with flair.
Gamers can bid on the JuJu Smith-Schuster edition of Cloud MIX while inventory lasts and browse eBay’s broad selection of must-have command center equipment from HyperX.
A Cloud MIX JuJu Smith-Schuster Limited Edition video can be seen here.
Kingston, the Kingston logo, HyperX and the HyperX logo are registered trademarks or trademarks of Kingston Technology Corporation in the U.S. and/or other countries.']

title: ['EBay to invest in returns optimization startup Optoro as part of pivot ... - The Business Journals']

['Should eBay Require Photos to Back Up SNAD Claims? - EcommerceBytes', 'Supreme Oreos are selling on eBay for over $10,000 - CBS News', 'Over half a million Pokémon Trading Cards were sold on eBay in 2019 - Dot Esports', 'eBay Stops WWE NXT Superstar From Selling TakeOver Gear For Kobe Bryant Related Charity - Ringside News']
summary:
['In a question submitted for next week's eBay Town Hall session, a seller asked if eBay would raise the bar for buyers who make INAD claims (Item Not as Described, previously called SNADs).
"Is it possible to make buyers have to provide more actual and substantial proof with an INAD claim," the seller asked.
Some sellers commenting on the post agreed, pointing out that sellers need photos of damaged items to submit claims with shipping carriers.
Another seller pointed out that it was difficult for eBay to impose stricter requirements on buyers because other marketplaces don't - "You cannot ask buyers to send photos when Walmart and Amazon does not require it."
It will be interesting to see if eBay tackles this issue during next week's Town Hall meeting, set to take place on Tuesday, February 25, 2020.', 'Oreo's latest collaboration with streetwear brand Supreme isn't such a sweet deal.
Supreme's designer Oreos launched in New York City Thursday, and they're already selling on eBay for more than $10,000.
The Supreme Oreo cookies allegedly retail at $8 for three cookies — an already steep increase from the originals — and can only be purchased at Supreme stores, not in supermarkets.
But following their Soho, New York, launch Thursday, some of the cookies started selling on eBay for thousands of dollars.
As of 6:15 pm EST on Thursday, the current bidding price for one pack of three "rare" Supreme Oreos is $10,800 on eBay, with 56 bidders participating.', 'The new Pokémon Sword and Shield expansion added more than 200 cards and brought the eighth generation of Pokémon into the TCG for the first time, which means there are more cards for players to add to their collection.
TCG collecting is a common hobby and eBay is where most collectors go to try and grab some good deals on cards they don’t already have or need to build a deck around for competitive play.
Throughout 2019, there were more than 19 million searches for Pokémon on eBay and more than 500,000 Pokémon Trading Cards sold on the website during that period.
Those numbers come directly from eBay’s internal research based on search and sales data for the previous year.
It also isn’t a surprise seeing Detective Pikachu top the movie list considering it was the first live-action Pokémon movie and was only released last year.', 'Kobe Bryant and his daughter Gianna Bryant died in a tragic helicopter accident.
Seven other people died in that same event and WWE NXT Superstar Dominik Dijakovic wanted to help them out.
Dijakovic wrote a message on Twitter saying that he put his NXT TakeOver: Portland gear up for auction.
eBay took his listing down for some reason.
Hello, unfortunately eBay felt this charity auction violated their TOS, so they removed the listing.']

title: ['eBay Closer To Offloading Classifieds Business - PYMNTS.com', 'Carmel man indicted in alleged $2 million eBay, PayPal fraud scheme - FOX 59 Indianapolis', 'Marketplace purchased dozens of products online. More than half ... - CBC.ca', 'Carbon-Fiber C8 Corvette Wheels Posted on eBay for C8 Z06? - MotorTrend', 'Supreme Oreos: Ultra-rare, red, 3-pack of Oreos on eBay for $4,000 - USA TODAY', 'More Than Half A Million Pokémon Cards Sold On eBay Last Year ... - Nintendo Life', 'New £20 notes selling for more than £30 on eBay - the serial number to look for - The Mirror']
summary:
['', 'INDIANAPOLIS, Ind.– A Carmel man is facing charges after federal authorities say he tried to gain $2 million from PayPal and eBay through fraud.
He was indicted on 28 federal charges including wire fraud, aggravated identity theft, credit card fraud and money laundering.
The DOJ says Ho had more than 500 PayPal accounts linked to his bank accounts.
Proceeds from the eBay accounts, totaling more than $2 million, flowed through the PayPal accounts.
Today Mr. Ho’s streak of fraud and identity theft comes to an end.”“This case began in October of 2018,” said Carmel Police Department Major Charlie Harting.', 'To test how prevalent counterfeits are online, Marketplace purchased dozens of well-known products — ranging from electronics to sportswear to cosmetics — from five popular online retailers: AliExpress, Amazon, eBay, Walmart and Wish.
More than half of the products Marketplace received were suspected or confirmed counterfeits, with knockoffs found on every platform.
In cases where there was no response from the manufacturers, three counterfeit products experts were consulted and asked to verify the products' authenticity.
Five of the products purchased — three packages of Crest WhiteStrips and two cellphone chargers — could not be verified, mainly due to missing packaging.
Folks purchased the same model he had previously bought, from a seller listed as "MARPAC," the brand name of the sound machine.', 'An eBay ad for C8 Corvette wheels may have just revealed the style and design of the upcoming next-generation Corvette Z06's rollers.
The ad for "2020 Corvette C8 Carbon Revolution [20/21-inch] Factory Original OEM Wheels Rims Set'' was recently posted to the auction site by user certifiedfactorywheelsinc with an asking price of $4,500.
Given the seller claims the wheels were used by GM for "OEM/Test Validation" purposes, it's possible the set of four C8 wheels is intended for the upcoming Corvette Z06.
It's no stretch of the imagination, though, to foresee GM tasking Carbon Revolution with making carbon-fiber wheels for the C8 Z06, given the Australian company also supplies similar equipment to the likes of Ford and Ferrari.
And while it's unlikely, wouldn't it be something if they were the very ones recently stolen from a GM-owned 2020 Corvette in Detroit, Michigan?', 'Supreme Oreos: Would you pay $4,000 for three of these special red cookies?
Oreo cookies are great and all but would you pay $4,000 for a promotional package of limited edition, of red, Supreme Oreos?', "The Pokémon Trading Card Game appears to be as popular as ever - indeed, the first Pokémon Sword and Shield expansion launched just a few weeks ago - and players have been snapping up cards for their collection like crazy.
According to data provided to Nintendo Life by eBay, there were 19 million searches for 'Pokémon' in 2019, resulting in more than half a million trading cards being sold in that time.
A list of the top five most expensive cards has also been presented, based on eBay sales data from January 2016 to February 2020 ('PSA' refers to a grading system, with 10 being the best condition possible):Top 5 Most Expensive Pokémon Trading Cards: 1.
1999 Pokémon Game 1st Edition Holographic Charizard [4/102] - $14,0005.
Of course, some cards have sold for much more than those listed above, including one that went for a whopping $195,000!", 'LOOK AT THE NEW AUGMENTED REALITY FEATURES OF THE £20 NOTELOOK AT THE NEW AUGMENTED REALITY FEATURES OF THE £20 NOTEIt's been in cash points for barely a day, but people lucky enough to get hold of one of the new £20 look like they can turn it into £30 or more as collectors get excited about one serial number in particularNew £20 notes selling for more than £30 on eBay - the serial number to look forPeople lucky enough to have got their hands on one of the first of the new, polymer, £20 notes are already cashing in - selling them for more than £30 each on eBay.
But that's not what's selling with the new £20 - instead it's the "AB" £20 notes that people are cashing in on.
One person has sold two "AB" notes for £75 (£32.50 each), another has sold 10 at an average price of £31 each and a third sold two sets of three for £99.97 (£33.32 each).
The better news is the Bank of England told Mirror Money that some AA notes would definitely be entering circulation - giving people another chance to find a £20 worth more than £20.
And they could pop up anywhere, with the Bank itself admitting it has no idea where they will be distributed as it simply doesn't store its notes by serial number.']

title: ['"Majority of items sold on AliExpress, eBay of Amazon is unsafe" - Retail Detail Europe', 'You Can Buy Supreme Brand Oreos For $17,000 USD On eBay - Refinery29', 'Former eBay boss joins Skyscanner as finance chief - Insider.co.uk', 'A Packet Of Supreme Oreos Is Currently Selling For $140,000 On ... - Boss Hunting']
summary:
['According to research by several consumer organisations, non-EU online platforms like AliExpress, Amazon or eBay) sell a huge number of products that do not comply with European safety regulations.
Their advice is clear: do not buy items on such sites.
Not conform165 of the 250 products concerned did not adhere to the European safety standards.
Belgian consumer organisation Test Aankoop told local news station VRT that “We advise to only buy in European web shops, which do adhere to European safety regulations, or to buy offline in a shop.
Six consumer organisations (Belgian Test-Aankoop, British Which, Danish Forbrugerrådet, Dutch Consumentenbond, German Stiftung Warentest and Italian Altroconsumo) bought 250 products on five major foreign platforms (AliExpress, Amazon, eBay, LightInTheBox and Wish) and had them tested for safety in laboratories.', 'Hypebeasts with a sweet tooth have gone wild over the latest Supreme drop.
Earlier this week, as part of their Spring/Summer 2020 collection , the cult streetwear brand debuted red and white Supreme-branded Oreo cookies.
Taking their own spin on the classic creme-filled cookie, double stuf’d Supreme Oreos were priced at $8 USD per pack of three.
Now, they are being resold for a whopping $17,000 USD on Ebay .
With four days still left for bidding, the price of these novelty Oreos is expected to keep climbing.', "Sign up to FREE email alerts from businessInsider - Business Newsletter sent Mon to Fri, twice each day with a full week's round up every SatTravel search business Skyscanner has hired former eBay executive Kris Beyens as its chief financial officer.
Beyens has been VP and chief operating officer of eBay EMEA and CFO of eBay International.
Skyscanner chief executive Bryan Dove said: “Kris brings to the team a deep marketplace understanding coupled with impressive international experience.
With over 100 million people using Skyscanner every month, the business put over 172 million flight passengers in the air last year.
Beyens' arrival follows the appointment of former Deliveroo executive Rob Miller as chief legal officer last August and promotion of Piero Sierra from VP of Product to chief product officer in February.", 'It’s no secret that Supreme branded items – whatever they may be – always resells at an incredible markup value.
And the stories that result from Supreme related resales often provoke eye rolls and head shakes from anyone who isn’t under the age of 17.
As in the case of the enterprising bloke currently selling a packet of Supreme Oreos for US$92,000 (~AU$140,000).
And yes, while this is a limited run, keep in mind that on eBay alone – there are currently cheaper packets being listed.
Check out the anecdote below:I used to live around the corner from the Supreme store on Lafayette.']

title: ['eBay To Expand Payment Options In The UK - PYMNTS.com', 'Aura Hires eBay Veteran Joe Martin to Lead Engineering - Business Wire', '5 Budget eBay Pickups to Bid on This Week - Autoweek', 'Supreme Oreos Are Selling for Over $80k on Ebay, and We’re ... - STYLECASTER', "McDonald's auctioning $90G Golden Shamrock Shake on eBay for charity - Fox News", 'Rare 50p coin sells for £202 on eBay - and there are 210,000 more out there - The Mirror']
summary:
['', 'SAN FRANCISCO--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Aura, a mission-driven financial technology company that offers affordable loans to hard-working families, today announced that Joe Martin has joined the company as Senior Vice President of Engineering.
Mr. Martin reports to Aura CEO James Gutierrez and oversees all engineering and development for Aura’s suite of financial services products.
“Aura is thrilled that Joe is leading our engineering teams at a critical moment in our growth,” said James Gutierrez, CEO of Aura.
“I decided to join Aura for a very simple reason: Aura’s mission is close to my heart,” said Joe Martin.
Mr. Martin holds a B.S.', 'The allure of the classic pickup truck is two-fold.
As a bonus, vintage pickup trucks are rear-wheel drive by nature, so if you get one with a powerful engine, burnouts come easy and often.
They were cheap, easy to fix and generally reliable.
Those first two will ring true with this list of five classic pickups for less than $7,500.
Still, if you’re looking to get into old-car ownership, today could be your day.', 'The level of buzz surrounding the new Supreme Oreos is absolutely astounding, but it’s for good reason.
Some Supreme fans (and I’m talking nearly 100 at this point) have been in a bidding war over a pack of the sold-out Supreme Oreos on Ebay.
As of today, though, a pack of these Oreos is selling on Ebay for over $80,000, and honestly, I’m in shock.
Compared to the pack of Supreme Oreos that’s selling for $89,088 as of this moment, that $300 is sounding like one hell of a deal.
As for me, I think I’ll just head down to the grocery store and buy a normal pack of Double Stuf Oreos for under $5.', 'McDonald’s is looking to give away a pot of gold – or more accurately, a cup of gold – in honor of its legendary Shamrock Shake.
Sales from the Shamrock Shake helped build the inaugural Ronald McDonald House in Philadelphia in 1974, the company said.
“We invite all our fans to join us in this celebration as we cheers to 50 delicious years with the Golden Shamrock Shake and help raise funds for RMHC and its incredible cause.”Though the opening bid for the Golden Shamrock Shake began at $1, bids had rocketed to over $15,000 as of Tuesday morning.
Customers can also try their luck at winning a Golden Shamrock Shake by purchasing the drink or an Oreo Shamrock McFlurry through McDonald’s mobile, and be automatically entered to win.
CLICK HERE TO GET THE FOX NEWS APPThe 2020 Shamrock Shake became available at McDonald’s across the US, Canada and Ireland starting Feb. 19.', 'The edition has long been topping rare coin indexes, and over the past few years has been named the most valuable 50p by money experts at ChangeChecker.
According to the Royal Mint, around one in every 300 households in the UK could own a Kew Gardens 50p.
Eventually, the 50p coin sold for 405 times its face value, making the seller a tidy profit.
But even though they never entered into circulation, Kew Gardens 50p coins stamped with the year "2019" have been known to fetch up to £74 on eBay.
See our guide on rare 50p coins and valuable money, here.']

title: ['eBay now uses computer vision to remove product photo backgrounds - VentureBeat', "A Muses shoe is selling for $182 on eBay; see other Mardi Gras throws' starting bids - NOLA.com", 'The already affordable Fitbit Versa Lite is insanely cheap on eBay ... - PhoneArena']
summary:
['eBay is introducing a new computer vision-powered feature to help sellers’ listings stand out.
After the seller snaps a photo and uploads it through the app, eBay will attempt to remove any background noise automatically.
Register NowWhile the tool is mainly aimed at making images more attractive, eBay said it will also help with SEO (search engine optimization).
For example, in 2017 eBay rolled out computer vision search that allows shoppers to find goods using existing photos.
And a few months back eBay relaunched a dedicated Motors app centered around AI and automation — including an image-categorization tool that automatically groups seller photos by type.', 'Just like that, Carnival season is over, therefore it's time to throw out the leftover king cake, recycle unwanted beads and give your signature throws a space on a mantle or office desk.
Maybe you couldn't get your hands on that iconic shoe, purse or coconut this year.
That's OK -- you can bid for one, if you're yearning enough for it.
The most coveted item as of Wednesday evening was a sparkly blue Muses shoe, with feathers at the center and surrounding the iconic "Blue Dog" from artist George Rodrigue.
Its going price was $182.50 with 48 bids and 20 hours left on the clock as of 8:30 p.m.', 'That compares relatively favorably to the $200 regular price of the Fitbit Versa 2 or Samsung's original Galaxy Watch Active , but without significant discounts, there's absolutely no way the Versa Lite would ever stand out from a constantly growing crowd of budget-friendly Apple Watch alternatives.
Enter top-rated eBay vendor VIPOutlet, which currently lists one specific (and specifically eye-catching) variant of the Fitbit Versa Lite at 90 bucks.
That's already pretty affordable, but believe it or not, you can also shave an extra 20 percent off that reduced price until March 3.
While these are naturally refurbished products on sale at that absolutely insane price, VIPOutlet vouches for their full functionality, having inspected, tested, and restored the massively marked-down devices to the "original manufacturer's operating specifications."
As its name very clearly suggests right off the bat, the Fitbit Versa Lite is not quite the world's most feature-packed smartwatch.']

title: ['Rare Kew Gardens 50p coin sells for £200 on eBay and there are thousands more in circulation - Heart']
summary:
["Rare Kew Gardens 50p coin sells for £200 on eBay and there are thousands more in circulationA Kew Gardens 50p coin has sold for £200.
The rare 50p coin which was created to celebrate 250 years since London's Kew Gardens opened has recently sold for almost £203 on eBay.
The Kew Gardens coin is worth hundreds.
Read More: Unique £1 'mistake' coin sells for a whopping £112 on eBayThis comes after a Paddington Bear 50p coin recently fetched its lucky owner a whopping £300.
Read More: Rare Paddington Bear 50p coin sells for whopping £300 on eBay"]

title: ['eBay Removes All Kobe Bryant Memorial Items - Black Enterprise', 'Muses members vexed when their handmade shoes appeared on eBay: Here’s how they got them back - NOLA.com', "Plus-size mum recreates Katie Middleton's iconic looks with clothes from eBay - Heart"]
summary:
['Capitalizing on items related to the memorial for Kobe Bryant will not be taking place on the eBay website, according to TheGrio.
It has been widely reported that one extra-large t-shirt was sold for $2,025 before eBay enforced its longstanding policy.
Bryant played his entire 20-year NBA career with the Los Angeles Lakers.
During his career, Bryant made the All-Star team 18 times and became the youngest player to ever reach 30,000 points.
He retired from the NBA in 2016, scoring an NBA-season-high 60 points in his final game.', 'Hand-decorated shoes created by members of the Krewe of Muses are among the most coveted parade throws in all of Carnival.
Elaborately encrusted with glitter, costume jewels and toys, the shoes often rise to the level of works of art.
They’re meant to be coveted gifts ceremoniously tossed or handed to lucky spectators in the curbside crowds.
So Muses member Amy Sins was irked when friends informed her that someone was selling one of her laboriously made Muses shoes on eBay.
She’d spent hours decorating it and may well have gotten hot glue burns in the process, she said.', "Plus-size mum recreates Katie Middleton's iconic looks with clothes from eBayThe mum recreates Kate's looks on Instagram.
Picture: GettyKatie Wolfe regularly treats her followers to photos of her recreating the Duchess of Cambridge's iconic looks in affordable versions of her outfits.
Katie Wolfe, 34, from Pennsylvania, has been overwhelmed by the support she's received - and admitted that she struggled to find clothes she felt comfortable in before becoming inspired by Kate.
Katie - who is a size 16-18 - searches through eBay to find affordable versions of the looks, but was initially nervous to post them as she has a curvier frame than the Duchess.
NOW READ:Kate Middleton pays tribute to George, Charlotte and Louis with engraved necklace during royal engagement"]

title: ['eBay Founder Pierre Omidyar Continues His Annual Tradition Of Giving away TONS Of Money - Celebrity Net Worth']
summary:
["eBay Founder Pierre Omidyar Continues His Annual Tradition Of Giving away TONS Of MoneyPierre Omidyar overcame incredible odds to build eBay from nothing into a company that changed the face of e-commerce forever.
Stunned, Pierre actually reached out to the buyer to explain that he was aware that the laser pointer was broken.
In fact, they have an end goal of giving away 99% of their wealth by 2020.
Pierre Omidyar has a current net worth of $7.8 billion, so he has some work to do to meet his goal of donating 99% of his net worth by the end of 2020.
After all, when your net worth keeps growing and you've committed to giving most of it away, you can barely give it away fast enough."]

title: ['EBay introduces image tool to help sellers display better product ... - Retail Dive', 'No Kidding, This Is The Most Expensive Porsche On eBay - CarScoops', "Mum's £37,000 stolen designer goods set to be flogged on eBay - Nottinghamshire Live", 'Thrifty mother reveals she transformed her kitchen using eBay stickers - Daily Mail', 'Adidas trainers people queued overnight in Liverpool for are now on eBay for £400 - Liverpool Echo']
summary:
["Dive Brief:EBay last week introduced Image Cleanup, a computer vision tool, which removes the background of a seller's listing photo and replaces it with a white background.
The feature is aimed at small businesses and individual sellers who may not have a budget for a professional photographer, eBay said.
Dive Insight:The inclusion of the Image Cleanup tool is one of the most recent additions eBay has added to its platform in the past year.
The Image Cleanup feature is another tool the platform has introduced to court up-and-coming merchants.
Back in July 2019, the platform also launched Managed Delivery, an end-to-end fulfillment service for its high-volume sellers.", 'This 1963 Porsche 356 B Carrera 2 GS Cabriolet isn’t just one of the very finest classic Porsche models on earth but it is also the most expensive Porsche currently listed for sale on eBay, outgunning a Porsche 918 Spyder Weissach.
The Porsche 356 has a long and proud racing history and in 1961, the Carrera 2 variant was launched at the Frankfurt Auto Show complete with a 2.0-liter flat-four cylinder engine, increased over the 1.5-liter displacement of earlier models.
Read Also: Custom 1959 Porsche 356 Speedster ‘Transitional’ Was Originally A Coupe, But Do You Care?
Before landing in the showroom of Daniel Schmitt & Co Classic Car Gallery in Saint Ann, Missouri, the vehicle had spent all of its life in Europe.
In 2017, a thorough technical inspection was completed and a mechanical restoration was performed in Leverkusen, Germany.', 'Leicester Crown Court was told that police will be selling off Sophie Ingram's designer shoes, clothing and other valuables on eBay.
Ingram, 30, was jailed for two years in October, after being caught with a kilo of drugs hidden in her garden, handling £11,642 worth of stolen Mulberry handbags and numerous shoplifting offences.
She sold stolen goods from a loss-making tanning shop, that she formerly ran in Raven Road, Braunstone, Leicester.
Of the Mulberry handbags, the recorder said: "You were offering them to friends at just over half price – cynically seeking to carve yourself a profit from the theft."
She said it was Bullock who sourced the stolen Mulberry handbags and asked her to sell them on.', "A thrifty mother has shared her impressive kitchen makeover, revealing how she spent just £80 transforming the space with bargain buys.
The business owner explained how she lifted the whole space simply by adding a statement wall to 'centre' the kitchen.
Using £30 chic shadow easycare dulux paint as a base, she covered it with £10 blackboard paint and spent £40 on eBay for accessories, spice racks and stickers to add to the wall.
However with the addition of the vibrant wall, covered in stickers and positive messages, the kitchen immediately has a new focal point, brightening it up.
We use ebay stickers, dulux chic shadow easycare paint and blackboard paint'.", 'Something went wrong, please try again later.
Invalid email Something went wrong, please try again later.
Last week, shoppers queued for days in advance in the hopes of getting their hands on the new Adidas Originals trainers.
Now, just days after the release the trainers have made their way on to eBay - and they’re being sold for £400.
The new trainers continue the iconic series, taking inspiration from the twin cities of the original six, Liverpool and Dublin.']

title: ['EBay Wants To Sell Off S Korean Unit - PYMNTS.com', "Ebay bans sellers from using coronavirus to 'profit from tragedies and disasters' - Yahoo Finance UK", 'Ebay sale: Save even more on Dyson products for a limited time - USA TODAY']
summary:
['', 'The large group of "feral" youths have been causing havoc across the sleepy Worcestershire town of Malvern Link for the past several months.
"We were driving back home after we found out but we were told by a neighbour that they had already left and had made their way to Malvern Link station.
"One said they were too scared to let their children play out after a boy was beaten up by them.
"I want to make the people of Malvern Link aware of this because things are getting worse here.
Residents say the group was the same that had previously been banned from Malvern Link Station by police at the weekend.', "The brand is synonymous with quality and makes some of all-time favorite cordless stick vacuums, lightweight vacuums, and handheld vacuums, just to give a few shout-outs.
The Dyson outlet on eBay features a mix of new and refurbished items.
If you have pets, you may want to grab the a refurbished V10 Animal for $279.99, which is $70 off its usual price on eBay.
Specifically, we've got our eye on this refurbished Dyson Supersonic Hair Dryer, which is going for $223.99, and this refurbished Dyson Airwrap Complete Styler, on sale for $439.99, thanks to this sale.
We break down the pros and cons of buying refurbished items here—and spoiler alert, eBay's one of the best places to buy refurbished, especially if you're buying though Dyson."]

title: ['El gel desinfectante de Lidl llega a precios desorbitados en Ebay - Economía Digital']
summary:
['La psicosis por el coronavirus (COVID-19) está empujando al alza el precio de los productos que provienen el contagio.
Este producto, que en los supermercados está arrasando, está vendiéndose también en portales como Milanuncios y Wallapop.
Y, según explican los medios británicos, en Inglaterra el portal Ebay está comercializando el gel desinfectante a precios desorbitados.
Uno de los casos que mencionan los británicos es el del gel desinfectante de la marca Cien, de la cadena de supermercados alemana Lidl.
El organismo igualmente ha afirmado que tiene esperanza de que el COVID-19 se podrá contener.']

title: ['EBay bans sales of all face masks and hand sanitizers to combat coronavirus price gouging - CNBC', 'Permira plots joint bid for $10bn eBay classified ads division - Sky News', 'Coronavirus: Panic-buyers bidding thousands for toilet paper on eBay - Newshub']
summary:
["People wearing protective masks use hand sanitizer while sitting in Union Square in San Francisco, California, U.S., on Wednesday, March 4, 2020.
EBay has stepped up its efforts to prevent price gouging by banning all face masks and hand sanitizers from its site.
California Attorney General Xavier Becerra on Wednesday issued an alert to consumers reminding them of the state's price gouging laws and other states have similar approaches to price gouging.
Issuing a blanket ban was viewed as a more comprehensive solution to the problem, rather than enforcing a price gouging cap on individual items, eBay said.
It comes after CNBC previously found listings offering hand sanitizer and face masks at inflated prices.", "Permira, the London-based private equity firm which owns Dr Martens, is plotting a $10bn (£7.6bn) takeover of eBay's classified advertising division.
Sky News has learnt that Permira is in talks with Carsales.com, an Australian-listed company, about a joint bid for the eBay unit, which has been put up for sale amid mounting pressure from activist investors.
Sources said that eBay was only allowing private equity firms to submit offers for its classifieds unit if they were the owner of, or partnering, a relevant strategic bidder.
EBay, which is best-known for its core marketplace operation, signalled last month that it was exploring a sale of the division.
EBay was recently approached by Intercontinental Exchange, the owner of the New York Stock Exchange, about a takeover, but the talks were rapidly curtailed.", 'On one listing, the top bidder has offered AU$10,100 (NZ$10,500) for a 20-pack of Quilton, showing just how priceless toilet paper has become.
The "Quilton three-ply white toilet paper 20-pack softness white 180-sheet 1110cm" has attracted 57 bidders, with international postage an additional AU$106.20.
A 24-pack of three-ply Quilton toilet paper has also been listed with a starting bid of $15,000.
"So you run and get toilet paper not because you need dozens of rolls, but because you fear that others are going to stockpile leaving none for you.
So in case shit really hits the fan and everyone is forced into self-isolation, maybe try stocking up on your savings - because toilet paper is going to come at a cost.']

title: ['Seller Says eBay Omits Relevant Listings from Search Results - EcommerceBytes', 'Philadelphia Flyers Zamboni shows up on Ebay - Puck Prose', '1970 Mustang Boss 302 racer and matching transport truck relive the glory days of Trans Am - Autoblog', 'You can buy Mrs Hinch’s exact personalised chopping board on eBay and it’s the ideal Mother’s Day prese... - The Sun']
summary:
['On each search there was an alert at the top that said "We removed some search results to show you the most relevant listings."
Both times I clicked on the "View All Listings" link and more listings appeared, some priced BELOW the lowest price of the previous search.
So eBay thought that the lowest priced listing was irrelevant to me even though I was searching by Lowest Price!
On the other subject, not sure if it's category-specific, but previously on searches I performed (Time: Newly Listed), eBay scattered in some Sponsored Listings.
I am already accustomed to ignoring the carousels, so now I can breeze past the Sponsored Listings much more easily.', '(Photo by Minas Panagiotakis/Getty Images)Do you love the Philadelphia Flyers and driving on ice at about five miles per hour?
Well if you’re a Philadelphia Flyers fan, you might be in luck.
A 2005 model Zamboni adorned with the famous Flyers logo recently appeared on eBay for the low, low price of $2,200.
Used Philadelphia Flyers Zamboni 500 with 5995 orig hours, not sure if it runs or not may need simple repair or just a battery charge.
So if you’re a Philadelphia Flyers fan who has everything the choice is yours.', "It's hard to imagine you wouldn't have the coolest setup at pretty much any vintage racing event or car show if you showed up with this duo: a 1970 Ford Mustang Boss 302 Trans-Am racer replica and matching Ford C-800 cab-over transport truck.
The throwback pair is up for auction right now on eBay motors.
As detailed in a post on Boss302.com, the Mustang is an original Boss 302 that was restored to be as close as possible to the #16 Mustang campaigned by Parnelli Jones in the Trans Am racing series.
According to the original builder, the construction followed that laid out by Ford Motor Company published in period instructions telling owners how to prep their Boss 302 Mustangs for Trans Am racing.
The 302 V8 features a custom-fabricated Bud Moore-spec air box and intake manifold.", "MRS Hinch fans can snap up the cleaning queen's exact chopping board - and it will make the perfect gift for Mother’s Day.

And Mrs Hinch recently revealed her new kitchen and finally tells fans what she’s done with the old one."]

['3Dsellers launched a new tool that allows eBay sellers to optimize their product pricing.
The tool calculates eBay fees and factors other costs to help sellers determine each item’s profit margin.
This calculator provides these calculations whether a seller sets their own price or if the calculator suggests a price.
Underneath the 3Dsellers eBay fee calculator, sellers can also have access to basic information graphs regarding eBay category listing fees and listing marketing upgrades.”The calculator is available to all eBay sellers at no charge – they do not have to subscribe to 3Dsellers for access to the tool.
You can find the free eBay tool on the 3dsellers.com website, and it posted an explanatory video on YouTube.', '']

["eBay users 'duped' into buying poor products that mimic big brands - Daily Mail", 'Italian antitrust watchdog probes Amazon, eBay over price spikes in ... - Reuters']
summary:
["eBay shoppers are being tricked into buying counterfeit products including shoddy chargers and even smoke alarms due to a flaw in the website's review system.
claims that sellers are able to easily exploit the shopping platform's review system to attach glowing reviews to their inferior products.
This means dodgy sellers can pinch positive reviews of popular products from Apple and Samsung and attach them to their own inferior knock-offs.
'eBay's product review system is confusing for consumers and could even direct them towards counterfeit or dangerous products sold by unscrupulous sellers.
The CMA estimates £23 billion a year of consumer transactions are influenced by online reviews.", 'Slideshow ( 2 images )MILAN (Reuters) - Italy’s antitrust watchdog said on Thursday it was investigating e-commerce giants Amazon and eBay for an allegedly excessive rise in the price of products such as hand sanitizer during the coronavirus crisis.
Italy is the country hardest hit by the virus in Europe, with more than 1,000 deaths and a nationwide lockdown.
It said it would also investigate allegations of misleading advertisements for some items put up for sale on the e-commerce platforms where they were described as being effective against the coronavirus.
In a emailed statement to Reuters, eBay said the company stands ready to cooperate with relevant authorities to identify any abuse.
An Amazon spokesman said the company had no immediate comment because it was still looking into the matter.']

title: ['Starboard nominates minority slate of directors to eBay board: WSJ - Fiji Times', 'Mum raves about £2 lint remover from eBay which got her carpet the fluffiest it’s been for years... - The Irish Sun']
summary:
['FILE PHOTO: The German headquarters of online marketplace eBay is pictured at Europarc Dreilinden business park south of Berlin in Kleinmachnow, Germany, August 6, 2019.
REUTERS/Fabrizio Bensch(Reuters) – Activist investor Starboard Value LP has nominated a minority slate of directors to eBay Inc’s board, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.
It privately nominated the slate of directors recently, the report said, adding that if the two sides do not reach a settlement, the nominees would be up for election at the annual meeting in June.
Starboard called on the online marketplace last month to sell its classifieds business, arguing that it has not made enough progress to improve shareholder value.
Both eBay and Starboard did not immediately respond to Reuters request for comment.', 'A SAVVY mum is raving about a £2 lint remover from eBay which transformed her carpet by restoring it to its original fluffiness.
The Mrs Hinch fan picked up the tool online for her clothes, but it worked so well she decided to see how it would work on her carpet.
5 The mum bought the lint remover for just £1.98 off eBay Credit: FacebookShe spent 20 minutes scraping the landing at the top of the stairs, and was amazed by the results.
The cleaning fan shared snaps of her carpet on Facebook group Mrs Hinch Made Me Do It, saying after successfully using it on her carpet she was eyeing up her mattress cover next.
“So today, I sat on my recently hoovered yet filthy & dusty carpet linting a pillow, then thought why not?!']

title: ['Single item behind $30m Aussie empire - news.com.au', 'Do eBay and Etsy Have a Search Problem? - EcommerceBytes', 'This Samsung Galaxy S20+ deal from a top-rated eBay vendor is ... - PhoneArena', 'Flutter Golden Tests Powering Automated UI Testing at eBay - InfoQ.com']
summary:
['', 'For example, in last week's eBay weekly chat session , a seller asked, "Why does the search engine bring up items that do NOT pertain to what you search for?
Etsy users are also discussing their frustration with search on this ongoing thread on the Etsy boards , with some saying sellers contributed to the problem by practicing deceptive tagging.
Two Etsy data scientists wrote recently about testing the effectiveness of recommendation modules and noted that they "cannibalize" search results.
Xuan Yin and Ercan Yildiz said Etsy serves up recommendation modules and promoted listings that enable users "to find interesting items."
Seller frustration with search is nothing new, but now that marketplaces use sophisticated technology such as Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning, are search results on eBay and Etsy getting more relevant or less?', 'They also do so at significantly lower prices than the $1,400 and up S20 Ultra, and if you hurry, you can get a factory unlocked Galaxy S20+ at a frankly unbelievable discount.
Finally, Samsung's "international" Galaxy S20+ are powered by the company's own Exynos 990 processor instead of Qualcomm's US-first Snapdragon 865 silicon, which might be considered by many yet another small weakness.
Still, this is clearly a lot of phone for 800 bucks, and Sobeonline1 is a highly trusted eBay vendor, rocking a pretty much flawless 99.8 percent positive feedback record in the last 12 months alone.
Available in a "limited quantity" at the time of this writing in Cosmic Black, Cosmic Grey, and Cloud Blue paint jobs, the deeply discounted Galaxy S20+ also offers dual SIM support.
While the Galaxy S20 Ultra may well be the most impressive Android phone money can buy right now, Samsung's slightly humbler Galaxy S20 and S20+ undoubtedly offer plenty of raw power, screen real estate, and exceptional camera capabilities for all but the most demanding consumers out there.', "Automating UI tests to ensure the visual appearance of your app is correct on all supported devices and form factors is usually challenging.
Flutter golden tests may help simplify this task, as eBay's approach to UI screenshot testing for its Motors app shows.
Visual UI testing, as opposed to behavioural UI testing, can easily become a cumbersome and expensive process, especially with rich client applications:How the UI looks on a single device is only one consideration.
This is how Gojko Adzic, creator of visual testing tool Appraise, explains why it is so:With visuals, it's often difficult to express correctness.
This compounded with the complexity of managing a large number of UI tests."]

title: ['Callous eBay traders cash in on corona selling baby milk for DOUBLE the price - Daily Record', 'Classified German military documents sold on eBay - DW (English)', 'eBay: Sell, If Not Already Sold! (NASDAQ:EBAY) - Seeking Alpha', 'eBay urged to clamp down on coronavirus profiteering - The Guardian']
summary:
['Get the latest top news stories sent straight to your inbox with our daily newsletterCallous eBay sellers have been branded 'disgusting' for cashing in on the coronavirus crisis after listing cartons of baby milk for treble the usual price.
A tub of Aptamil usually retails at around £10, but one selfish eBayer is selling two cartons for £60, while another is selling six cartons for £94.
Scots mum Kerry Lusk shared a screengrab to Facebook, blasting the sellers and calling for them to be banned from eBay.
These sellers should get into bother and banned from selling baby milk and all other baby products for a quick profit.
She said: "Just looked on eBay and someone’s selling 6x tubs of Aptamil which is usually a tenner for £158.70??!!!', 'Inside were classified documents on a mobile missile system used by the German armed forces.
German security researchers discovered easily accessible, classified military information on a laptop sold on eBay.
On the computer were a series of documents, including instructions on how to destroy the LeFlaSys Ozelot air defence system.
"The notebook PC we acquired contains extensive technical information on the LeFlaSys system, including step-by-step instructions for operation as well as maintenance.
In 2019, a forest ranger from Upper Bavaria found classified instructions for the Mars mobile rocket artillery when he bought four laptops from an auction run by federal authorities.', 'For 2022, eBay expects its payments business to deliver an incremental $2 billion in revenue and $0.5 billion in operating income.
For 2022, eBay expects its payments business to deliver an incremental $2 billion in revenue and $0.5 billion in operating income.
We think this increase is mostly set to continue until the payments business is fully launched.
PaymentsSellers: We think much of the seller on eBay Payments will be the ones already on the core marketplace platform.
By the end of 2022, we expect 5-11% of the sellers on the core platform to have adopted eBay payments.', 'EBay has been urged to clamp down on people profiteering from the coronavirus outbreak as sellers rake in hundreds of pounds from vastly inflated prices on household goods.
The Guardian found one UK-based seller who had pocketed £1,000 from selling packs of Andrex toilet roll at £50 each – more than double the retail price – on eBay since Saturday morning.
Another had sold a 72-pack of toilet roll for £99.90, quadruple its regular price of £27, while the same product was advertised by another seller for £84.99.
Most of these products were removed from sale hours after the Guardian contacted the seller and eBay on Monday morning.
An eBay spokeswoman said: “eBay does not tolerate sellers exploiting other users.']

title: ['Road 2 Recovery Announces eBay Auction To Benefit Brian ... - Cycle News', 'Arkansas attorney general sends letters to Amazon, eBay, Walmart amid COVID-19 price gouging - THV11.com KTHV', 'Selfish eBay sellers are flogging baby milk for more than FOUR times its retail price - Daily Mail', 'Ex-MoD anti-Covid bunkers selling on eBay for £15000 each - Surrey Live']
summary:
['Press Release | March 18, 2020Road 2 Recovery Announces eBay Auction To Benefit Brian Moreau’s R2R FundThis is a press release from Road 2 Recovery…Encinitas, CA (March 18, 2020) – The Road 2 Recovery Foundation (R2R) has announced details for an eBay auction to benefit Brian Moreau.
The Troy Lee Designs/ Red Bull/ KTM Racing team rider, suffered a serious crash on February 15, 2020, during Round 7 of the AMA Supercross Championship in Tampa, FL and is currently back in France focusing on his rehabilitation.
The best part is that it all goes to a great cause as 100% of the proceeds will go to Brian Moreau’s R2R fund.
The Road 2 Recovery Foundation would like to thank Alpinestars, WPS, Team Honda HRC, Monster Energy Kawasaki, Troy Lee Designs/ Red Bull/ KTM, Red Bull KTM Factory Racing, Monster Energy Yamaha Factory Racing, AutoTrader/Yoshimura/Suzuki Factory Racing- JGR, Rockstar Energy Husqvarna Factory Racing and for their contributions for this auction.
For more information on Road 2 Recovery, upcoming events and athlete updates, visit road2recovery.com or https://road2recovery.com/cause-view/brian-moreau/ to make a donation.', "“Arkansans have enough on their minds right now and paying exponentially inflated prices for basic necessities shouldn't be one of them.”Example video title will go here for this videoLITTLE ROCK, Ark.
— Attorney General Leslie Rutledge sent letters to Amazon, eBay, and Walmart, to notify the companies' CEOs that Arkansas's price gouging laws automatically went into effect on March 11, 2020, after Governor Hutchinson's state of emergency declarations.
Her letters were sent to these three companies because all of them allow third-party sellers to offer consumer goods through online retail platforms.
“Arkansans have enough on their minds right now and paying exponentially inflated prices for basic necessities shouldn't be one of them,” said Attorney General Rutledge.
Violators can face criminal charges and fines, as well as civil penalties of up to $10,000 per incident.", "Selfish eBay sellers are making a profit from the shortage of baby milk on the supermarket shelves amid the coronavirus pandemic - by selling it for more than quadruple its price.
On eBay, one seller is flogging Cow and Gate 2 baby milk formula, 800g, for £30, while its original retail value on Boots is £7.99.
Sellers are even inflating prices on Cow and Gate premature baby milk - designed to help early babies grow - as it's on sale for £5.40, rather than the usual price of £2.99.
And it seems Aptamil 800mg baby milk, which usually retails at £10, is in huge demand as it's out of stock everywhere - and is being flogged for £28 on eBay.
A spokesperson for eBay commented: ‘eBay does not tolerate sellers exploiting other users.", 'Something went wrong, please try again later.

A strict no return policy operates for buyers and the cabins come with no internal or external equipment.']

title: ['Coronavirus: Advice for parents struggling to find baby formula as eBay sellers try to cash in - Sky News']
summary:
['Parents struggling to find baby formula during the coronavirus outbreak have been issued advice after it emerged it was being sold on eBay for more than £300.
"We are aware that some people are feeling as though they need to stockpile infant formula milk leaving some shops empty or short of infant formula - also that there are several myths circulating across various social media sites," the trust said.
"Your GP is unable to write prescriptions for infant formula milk which would normally be available via supermarkets and other shops.
Advertisement"If you are unable to obtain your infant formula from your usual shop please try other shops.
An NHS England spokesman declined to offer advice for parents struggling to find baby formula, saying: "Questions about any shortages in supermarkets would be for government."']

title: ['Nessel warns consumers about phishing emails, eBay gift card scams - WZZM13.com', 'Prototypes of the very first unreleased Android smartphone pop-up ... - 9to5Google', 'Sale of masks and hand sanitiser restricted on eBay to stop price ... - Jersey Evening Post', 'Buy this wild custom 1983 Chevy C30 camper and shelter in style - Autoblog']
summary:
["No one is immune to phishing scams, not even staff at the Attorney General's office.
LANSING, Mich — Michigan Attorney General Dana Nessel issued an urgent reminder Friday to be aware of phishing emails sent by scammers seeking to obtain personal information and money.
They will then continue to send spam emails via various email addresses and also attempt to hack the recipient's account.
The Attorney General’s Consumer Protection web page is available as a resource for consumers to turn to.
Those who wish to make a report about potential scams can do so with the Attorney General’s Consumer Protection team by filing a complaint online or by calling 877-765-8388.", 'If you simply must have a piece of Android memorabilia, some unreleased prototypes of the very first Android smartphone have now popped up for sale on auction site eBay.
Often a treasure trove for cheap gadgets and tech, eBay is normally the first place unreleased tech appears when unearthed.
The listing of the Google device codenamed “Sooner” was spotted by the guys over at Android Police, which never ended up making it to market.
The seller “drumsticks” has listed nine of these prototype Android devices for sale at just $195 plus shipping.
Everything looks in order from our perspective, with each prototype device coming boxed, along with a charging cable but no documentation.', 'EBay is restricting the sale of masks and hand sanitiser in a bid to crack down on profiteering during the coronavirus pandemic.
Only a trusted “whitelist” of vetted eBay sellers will be able to continue trading these items, the company said.
The online marketplace said it was continuing to take “aggressive action” against price gouging from a “small but growing” number of sellers.
“Price gouging, particularly during this period when people are worried, will not be tolerated on eBay.
“We will implement new measures designed to ensure only legitimate sellers are permitted on site and customers will only see fairly priced items.”', 'If the current coronavirus situation makes you want to get away from it all, this 1983 Chevy C30 pickup and camper let you head for the hills in absolutely imitable style.
Currently on offer at eBay motors, this visually stunning rig is dubbed Brown Sugar — for reasons that are plain to see — and was built for the 2019 SEMA show.
A Vintage Air setup keeps the driver and passenger cool as they lounge on the oh-so-plaid bucket seats.
Inside, Brown Sugar has a rustic theme, with wood block walls, wood floors, a sink fashioned from a Coke cooler, and sub-woofers housed in whisky barrels.
The comforts of home include a toilet with black water tank, a forward sleeping area, a fridge, microwave and a TV.']

title: ["Samsung's Galaxy S20+ is getting cheaper and cheaper on eBay ... - PhoneArena", 'The BoatCar is part Ford, part Sea Ray, 100% awesome, and for sale - Autoblog']
summary:
['While early reports suggest the 6.9-inch S20 Ultra beast is substantially outselling its baby brothers , the smaller and slightly less impressive members of Samsung's newest flagship family could objectively be considered the better deals at recommended prices of $1,000 and $1,200 respectively in the US.
That doesn't qualify as classically affordable, of course, but an unlocked Galaxy S20+ at $739.82 comes extremely close to bargain territory.
Given that absolutely massive discount of more than 460 bucks, you shouldn't be surprised to hear you're not actually looking at a US 5G-enabled variant here.
On the not so bright side of things, buying an "international" Galaxy S20+ also means you'll need to settle for an Exynos 990 processor rather than the Snapdragon 865 SoC powering the ultra-high-end device in the US and delivering significantly superior performance.
Although the Galaxy S20 and S20+ certainly don't look as impressive as the Galaxy S20 Ultra on paper, our in-depth reviews have confirmed the differences between Samsung's three new high-end smartphones are not exactly crucial to the real-world user experience.', "There are thousands of used boats listed on eBay, but only one of them features power steering and a new set of tires.
The process of dropping a 24-foot Sea Ray boat hull onto a ladder frame sourced from a 1995 Ford E-350 passenger van took six months, according to the seller.
We're not sure what effect the new body has on handling, but we hope you're really, really good at parallel parking.
The E-350 is already a bit of a barge, and the Sea Ray body certainly doesn't help maneuverability.
Located in Roswell, Georgia, the BoatCar is listed at $55,000 on eBay, meaning it's more expensive than buying a 1995 E-350 and a used, sea-worthy 24-foot boat separately."]

Bloice would then sell the items on eBay to pay for a debt he had accumulated from renovating his home in the East Yorkshire village of West Newton.

title: ["Walmart, Amazon, eBay, Facebook, and Craigslist cited for ... - People's World", 'New Supreme Oreos are selling for thousands of dollars on eBay - Fortune', "People are selling Big Macs and nuggets on eBay after McDonald's closes - Metro.co.uk", 'Amazon and eBay to remove NHS lanyards after fraud concerns - Health Service Journal']
summary:
['Two of the offenders are online platforms of Walmart and Amazon, who are also notorious for exploiting their workers – associates (Walmart) and warehouse workers (Amazon).
“We believe you have an ethical obligation and patriotic duty to help your fellow citizens in this time of need by doing everything in your power to stop price gouging in real-time,” Shapiro wrote the five.
“Our Consumer Protection Division has received reports of price gouging from all over Maryland since the beginning of the COVID-19 pandemic.
One-sixth of Amazon’s own products had price spikes “averaging 65% greater than the average” hike by all sellers of the same goods.
J.B. Pritzker’s March 17 executive order banning price gouging, but concentrating on “essential medical supplies.”', 'Amid all the uncertainty and fear surrounding the COVID-19 coronavirus pandemic, it’s oddly refreshing to hear that people are still losing their damned minds over a new cookie.
Supreme, the well-known streetwear company, rolled out a collaboration with Oreo cookies today, and even in the midst of a global crisis, fans couldn’t buy them fast enough.
Technically, the cookies are $3 for a pack of three, but hop over to eBay, and the price escalation is straight-on bonkers.
The cookies themselves are red, double-stuffed Oreos with the word “Supreme” imprinted on them in place of the usual Oreo branding.
More must-read stories from Fortune:—Which stores are open—and closed—during the coronavirus pandemic in the U.S.?', '(Picture: eBay)eBay is normally used for selling old toys and clothes to make space in your home.
In the wake of COVID-19, however, it’s taken a very strange turn, and people are now selling Big Macs and McNuggets on the platform.
McDonald’s announced the closure of all their locations (for takeaway and delivery) this week, for the safety of staff and customers alike.
McFanatics were miffed at this, though, and desperate to get their hands on those sweet nugs however they could.
**‘100% of all proceeds of the sale will go to our amazing NHS staff on the front line battling this virus.', 'Amazon and eBay have said they will remove NHS staff lanyards and pass holders from sale after HSJ raised concerns to the online shopping giants they could be used for fraudulent purposes.
HSJ contacted both companies after being approached by concerned NHS staff.
While there is no evidence this has happened yet, HSJ also established sales of some of the lanyards appeared to have increased dramatically since supermarkets introduced protected shopping hours for NHS staff over the last week.
One lanyard advertised on ebay had been purchased seven times up to March 21, but more than 40 since then.
NHS staff can currently access special shopping hours at several supermarket chains — often early in the day when the shelves are likely better stocked — while others are holding back supplies of sought after products, such as loo rolls and pasta, specifically for NHS staff.']

title: ['The Supreme Oreo is Selling for Thousands of Dollars on Ebay - Yahoo Life', 'Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn leads applause for NHS workers - Daily Mail', "McDonald's fans selling Big Macs and nuggets on eBay during lockdown - Wales Online", 'NHS doctors and nurses reveal they’ve bought masks off eBay and cancelled honeymoons as fighting a ‘war’ on... - The Sun']
summary:
['You might think those size variations explain why an ultra-rare “Supreme” Oreo is going for hundreds—even thousands—of dollars on Ebay, but it turns out the real story is very different.
In fact, the Supreme Oreo is a collaboration between the Nabisco brand and much-hyped streetwear company Supreme.
After selling out almost instantaneously when the Oreos initially dropped in late February, the three-packs of Supreme Oreos sold out again just as fast this week.
Currently, there are more than 100 eBay listings for Supreme Oreos with asking prices of at least $125.
Obviously, spending anything greater than a dollar or two on three Double Stuf Oreos is absurd.', "Viruses break into cells inside their host and use them to reproduce itself and disrupt the body's normal functions.
The disease that the virus causes has been named COVID-19, which stands for coronavirus disease 2019.
Tests were developed for the new virus and recorded cases started to surge.
How does the virus spread?
The National Institutes of Health in the US, and Baylor University in Waco, Texas, say they are working on a vaccine based on what they know about coronaviruses in general, using information from the SARS outbreak.", 'Something went wrong, please try again later.
Invalid email Something went wrong, please try again later.
However a few more enterprising fans decided to use the closure as an opportunity to make some cash, by selling items off the menu, such as Big Mac burgers and McNuggets on eBay.
Bidding on one Big Mac has so far reached £106, with more than 30 people attempting to nab themselves what has been dubbed the "last Big Mac of 2020", reports the Mirror.
(Image: eBay)"Here we have the last Big Mac of 2020.', 'But few of us will understand the brutal reality that doctors and nurses are facing on the frontline of the battle against coronavirus.
⚠️ Read our coronavirus live blog for the latest news & updates10 GLAMOUR magazine has celebrated nine extraordinary women working in the NHS Credit: Glamour MagazineTo celebrate our heroes, GLAMOUR magazine has interviewed nine inspiring women working in the NHS.
Ellie Pantlin, 26, emergency nurse10 Ellie is determined to remain positive throughout Credit: Glamour MagazineThe way in which we deal with patients is now different to normal.
Luckily my dad bought me a mask off eBay a few weeks ago so I’ve got one if things get bad!
In other coronavirus news, Prince George, Princess Charlotte and Prince Louis joined the rest of the country to applaud the NHS.']

title: ['Police stop driver making 224-mile trip to buy eBay item – with wife ... - Guernsey Press', 'Max Acquires Ebay Palladium, Platinum and Rhodium Project - The Deep Dive']
summary:
['A motorist was stopped by a motorway patrol on a 224-mile round trip to buy a £15 item off eBay, police said.
The driver travelled from Coventry to collect the eBay purchase of windows in Salford, Greater Manchester, despite the public being warned only to make “essential” journeys due to the coronavirus pandemic.
After picking up his purchase in Salford, unfortunately the driver’s wife could not fit in the vehicle for the two-hour return journey south.
A driver has travelled from Coventry to Salford to collect a £15 EBay purchase of windows.
— North West Motorway Police (@NWmwaypolice) March 29, 2020', 'In 2005, more select grab sampling returned 3.04 g/t palladium, 1.39 g/t platinum and 0.18 g/t rhodium.
The considerable come-back of these metals has put the Palladium, Platinum and Rhodium Project back on the front burner, so to speak.
The Ebay Palladium, Rhodium and Platinum Project in Quebec is another iron in the fire that is a perfect fit for Max’s PGE focus, in this era of high palladium, rhodium and platinum prices.
Max offers shareholders potential exposure to many different metals:PGE Americas Choco and Ebay projects: palladium, rhodium and platinum while re-assaying for iridium, osmium and ruthenium and more rhodium.
North Choco Gold and Copper Project: gold and copper.']

summary:
['The sneakers featured in the Stadium Goods x eBay "Sneaker Showdown."
Stadium Goods and eBay are going to drop the price of a sneaker grail next month and you can help decide which one goes on sale.
The collaborative models include the Travis Scott x Air Jordan 1 Low, Sacai x Nike LDWaffle Trainer “Varsity Blue,” Off-White x Nike Air Force 1 Low “Black,” Off-White x Nike Air Presto “Black,” Nike Air Max 1/97 VF SW “Sean Wotherspoon,” Off-White x Nike Blazer “All Hallows Eve,” Nike Air Max 1 “Atmos Elephant,” Off-White x Nike Air Max 97 “Menta” and the Travis Scott x Air Jordan 1 High OG.
The Stadium Goods x eBay “Sneaker Showdown” bracket.
Stadium Goods Announces a New Chicago Store Is Opening in Spring 2020Stadium Goods and Watches of Switzerland Showcase Hype Culture Through an Exhibit of Rare Sneakers and WatchesSneaker Collection Curated by Sotheby’s and Stadium Goods Sells for $850K', 'Stadium Goods and eBay are going to drop the price of a sneaker grail next month and you can help decide which one goes on sale.
The polls will be featured on the Twitter and Instagram accounts of eBay and the Instagram of Stadium Goods.
Stadium Goods and eBay selected 16 coveted styles and will put them head-to-head in brackets.
The collaborative models include the Travis Scott x Air Jordan 1 Low, Sacai x Nike LDWaffle Trainer “Varsity Blue,” Off-White x Nike Air Force 1 Low “Black,” Off-White x Nike Air Presto “Black,” Nike Air Max 1/97 VF SW “Sean Wotherspoon,” Off-White x Nike Blazer “All Hallows Eve,” Nike Air Max 1 “Atmos Elephant,” Off-White x Nike Air Max 97 “Menta” and the Travis Scott x Air Jordan 1 High OG.
The “Jumpman vs. Yeezy” competition will feature the Yeezy Boost 700 “Wave Runner,” Yeezy 700 v3 “Azael,” Air Jordan 1 Retro High OG 85, Yeezy Boost 350 V2 “Black” (non-reflective), Union x Air Jordan 1 “Black Toe,” Union x Air Jordan 1 “Storm Blue” and the Off-White x Air Jordan 5.', 'In case you missed it, golfers all over the world are blowing off some quarantine steam by hitting golf shots indoors.
Of course, using a real golf ball can be hazardous to your family, furniture and windows.
Dust off the PS2 or Xbox in your attic and take a walk down memory lane with Tiger Woods ’04.
The product comes from Seamus Golf, but don’t bother trying to find it (or any others) on the company website.
That same concept has been formalized into a “People You Want to Hit” golf ball series.', 'Seven has announced its line-up of sponsors for House Rules: High Stakes, featuring new and returning partners.
House Rules: High Stakes features a new host and new judges with all teams coming together in the transformation of a Gold Coast penthouse.
Commenting on the sponsors of House Rules: High Stakes, Seven’s network sales director, Natalie Harvey, said: “House Rules is much-loved by our partners, and this year we’re taking it to the next level with House Rules: High Stakes.
Together with House Rules host Jamie Durie, we will be shining a light on sustainable living and looking at how we can protect our homes now and into the future.”eBay has partnered with House Rules: High Stakes for the first time.
Using customer data in-store we are able to see an influx of customer enquiries and interest for products featured on House Rules.']

title: ['eBay Appoints Ishai Froind to Lead Israel Operation | Ctech - CTech']
summary:
['Ishai Froind, eBay’s senior director of product management and data operations, has been appointed the general manager of eBay Israel, the company announced Monday.
Froind will succeed Moti Eliav, who served in the role since 2018.
Froind joined eBay in 2007 in the San Francisco Bay Area, and moved to Israel in 2016 to serve as the company’s director of product management of structured data.
In October, eBay’s chief scientist in Israel and director of data science Kira Radinsky stepped down after a three-year tenure.']

title: ['eBay Finds: Signed Andy Hampsten 7-Eleven Tour de France jersey - Cyclingnews', '1969 Mustang Boss 429 Barn Find for Sale eBay - Numbers-Matching - Road & Track', 'eBay Finds: Bianchi Mega Pro Mercatone Uno - Cyclingnews', 'KISS Hello Kitty Toilet Paper Stock Sold Out Amid Coronavirus ... - Ultimate Guitar', 'Ben Stokes slams eBay on Twitter for selling replica of 2019 World Cup shirt - Republic World']
summary:
["Image 1 of 4 Andy Hampsten’s signed 1988 Tour de France 7-Eleven jersey (Image credit: jayhawk6014 / eBay) Andy Hampsten stays cool alongside 7-Eleven teammate Ron Kiefel at the 1987 Tour de France (Image credit: Bettini Photo) Andy Hampsten’s signed jersey, with two other 7-Eleven team jerseys, and Steve Bauer’s 1990 Tour de France yellow jersey (Image credit: jayhawk6014 / eBay) 7-Eleven’s Andy Hampsten – in the blue 'combined' jersey – leads hitherto race leader Franco Chioccioli on the famous, snowy Passo di Gavia stage of the 1988 Giro d'Italia (Image credit: Getty Images Sport)We've been looking closely at the latest cycling deals on eBay, and have come across this 1988 7-Eleven jersey, worn by Andy Hampsten at that year's Tour de France and signed by the man himself.
Hampsten then went into the 1988 Tour as one of the favourites, but could 'only' finish 15th in a race won by Spain's Pedro DelgadoTake a look at the jersey on eBay here.
(opens in new tab)Hampsten joined US team 7-Eleven from La Vie Claire for the 1987 season, having already ridden for them on a special 30-day contract at the 1985 Giro.
Hampsten then had a strong 7-Eleven team built around him for the 1988 Tour, which included US road race champion Ron Kiefel, young Mexican climber Raul Alcala, Norwegian star Dag Otto Lauritzen, with sprinter and two-time Tour stage winner Davis Phinney also on the squad.
The two signed garments – Hampsten's Tour jersey and Bauer's yellow jersey – are the pick of the bunch, though.", "Looking for a halo car to top off your vintage Mustang collection?
This 1969 Boss 429 might be just the thing.
It's been sitting in a garage untouched since 1981, and has just over 13,000 miles on the odometer.
The Boss 429 is one of the rarest and most desirable vintage Mustangs out there, so if you're in the market, you should be ready to pay the price.
According to Hagerty's valuation tool, a Boss 429 is worth $200,000 on average.", "Image 1 of 12 The Bianche Mega Pro Mercatone Uno (Image credit: bahoro / eBay) Another look at the bike (Image credit: bahoro / eBay) The ITM cockpit (Image credit: bahoro / eBay) The front brake, Campagnolo Mirage (Image credit: bahoro / eBay) Campagnolo Mirage 53-39 chainset (Image credit: bahoro / eBay) A look at the seat tube (Image credit: bahoro / eBay) A short-cage Mirage rear mech, plus the Mavic Open Pro rims (Image credit: bahoro / eBay) The downtube and chainset (Image credit: bahoro / eBay) The bike's fork (Image credit: bahoro / eBay) Skinny 23s on the rims for now (Image credit: bahoro / eBay) A Selle Italia Radius saddle completes the bike (Image credit: bahoro / eBay) Pantani during a rider's protest at the 1998 Tour de France (Image credit: Getty Images Sport)We've been scouring the web for retro bike deals and found this Bianchi Mega Pro Mercatone Uno team replica bike for sale on eBay.
Check out the bike on eBay here (opens in new tab)Pantani did the Giro d'Italia - Tour de France double using the Mega Pro in 1998, the last rider to have achieved the historic feat.
This Mega Pro, listed for £1,327 (€1,500) comes decked out in the same colour scheme as the bikes the Italian and his Mercatone Uno team raced that year.
The wheels are built around 360-hole Mavic Open Pro rims, while the cockpit comes from ITM, just like Mercatone Uno used.
You likely won't be able to replicate what Il Pirata did on his Bianchi Mega Pro, but if you're a fan then it's going to be hard to get any closer.", '', "England all-rounder Ben Stokes has slammed online shopping site eBay for auctioning his replica cricket World Cup shirt.
Ben Stokes took to Twitter and posted a message to warn his fans over the same.
Also Read: Jos Buttler Asks Virat Kohli To Retweet Post On Auctioning England World Cup 2019 JerseyBen Stokes warns people about his cricket World Cup replica jerseyIn a tweet, Ben Stokes said that he has just been made aware of his Cricket World Cup jersey being sold on eBay.
According to reports in the media, Jos Buttler's Cricket World Cup jersey already received a bid in excess of £60,000.
Also Read: Ben Stokes Fires Twitter User With Four Words For Misintepreting Latest IPL 2020 RemarksIPL 2020: Ben Stokes preparation for T20 world Cup hits roadblockRecently, during an interview with BBC, Ben Stokes said that he hopes to play in IPL 2020 if the tournament is played."]

title: ['eBay Launches "Up & Running" To Immediately Bring Small ... - PR Newswire', 'Price gouging on eBay leads to disinfectant spray selling for hundreds of dollars - KMPH Fox 26']
summary:
['eBay launched "Up and Running," an accelerator program for retailers without an e-commerce presence who are looking to move their stores online.
From waiving selling fees and providing seller education to individual support and guidance from the marketplace’s experienced seller community, eBay is committed to supporting small businesses.
Small businesses get the boost they need by connecting with customers online.
Through "Up & Running," eBay will provide educational webinars, individual support, and access to experienced sellers willing to mentor those who are new to eCommerce.
3 U.S. Small Business Association, Civic Economic Study, Federal ReserveSOURCE eBay Inc.Related Linkshttp://www.ebay.com', '']

title: ['eBay Finds: Late 2000s Cannondale SystemSix frameset - Cyclingnews', 'eBay finds: Lance Armstrong replica Trek 5500 OCLV - Cyclingnews']
summary:
['Image 1 of 7 The late 2000s Cannondale SystemSix frameset (Image credit: tamir4789 / eBay) Liquigas rider Luca Paolini’s 2007 Cannondale SystemSix (Image credit: Future) The beautiful black-to-blue fade on the Cannondale SystemSix frameset (Image credit: tamir4789 / eBay) Liquigas’s Luca Paolini rides his Cannondale SystemSix alongside Quick-Step’s Peter Van Petegem at the 2007 Tour of Flanders (Image credit: Getty Images Sport) The top tube on the Cannondale SystemSix frameset (Image credit: tamir4789 / eBay) Francesco Chicchi (Liquigas) proudly shows off his Cannondale SystemSix at the 2007 Tour of Qatar (Image credit: Getty Images Sport) A carbon fork is used on the Cannondale SystemSix frameset (Image credit: tamir4789 / eBay) Our latest find on eBay is this rather rare, and brand-new, original Cannondale SystemSix frame and fork, as used in the late 2000s by the Italian Liquigas squad.
Our latest find on eBay is this rather rare, and brand-new, original Cannondale SystemSix frame and fork, as used in the late 2000s by the Italian Liquigas squad.
Check out the frameset on eBay here.
"The SystemSix was designed for one purpose, and that's performance," team liaison Rory Mason told Cyclingnews back in 2007.
The late 2000s Cannondale SystemSix frameset (Image credit: tamir4789 / eBay)It's a 60cm frame, so up at the larger end of the scale of frame sizes, with an uncut steerer-tube on its carbon fork, and a headset and spacers included.', "Image 1 of 5 The US Postal Trek 5500 OCLV (Image credit: eBay / diggers158) The groupset is a period-specific Dura-Ace 7700 (Image credit: eBay / diggers158) The cockpit (Image credit: eBay / diggers158) Another look at the rear end (Image credit: eBay / diggers158) The saddle and seatpost (Image credit: eBay / diggers158)We've been scouring the web for retro bike deals and found this Trek 5500 OCLV US Postal replica bike for sale on eBay.
The wheels, laid out in a curious 14-spoke front and 16-spoke rear setup, are Rolf Vector Pros with tubular tyres.
Armstrong failed four tests for corticosteroids during the race, though was let off by the UCI after producing a backdated therapeutic use exemption certificate.
Armstrong's Tour 'win' was rescinded in 2012, along with six others, but the bike still remains.
The 5500 OCLV looks to be in mint condition, and a top purchase for anyone looking to invest in a piece of cycling's dubious history."]

title: ['The Marvel Comic With a DC Cover, on eBay for Over a Million Dollars - Bleeding Cool News', 'How to pay for Uber, Ebay, Netflix, Amazon Prime...using MTN ... - Techjaja', 'Mum uses £15 sticky back plastic from eBay to spruce up tired old doors – and the result is amazing... - The Irish Sun']
summary:
['', 'Paying for goods and services online which include; Ebay, Uber, Netflix, Showmax, Amazon Prime, Hulu, YouTube Prime or may be a website hosting service can be challenging using MTN mobile money.
On top of this there is no MTN mobile money connectivity with PayPal unlike MPesa in Kenya.
First, you need an MTN number with Mobile money services activated.
After registration, your MoMocard will be linked to a bank account, and in-turn linked to your Mobile money account.
Registration for MTN MoMocard costs UGX 1,000 and for every payment you make using the MTN MoMocard will be charged 3% of the transaction amount.', 'A MUM has revealed how she spruced up her tired old doors with sticky back plastic - and they look completely different.
Taking to the Facebook group Extreme Couponing & Bargains UK, she shared dramatic before and after photos of the transformation.
But after using £15 oak effect vinyl wrap from eBay and handles from the Range, the doors look brand new.
Used dc-fix sticky back plastic (from eBay) and door handles (from the Range).
Plus this mum made her own "petting zoo" in her back garden when her daughter's birthday trip was cancelled.']
