He said: “I was on eBay looking for a herbal sleep medicine and saw this for sale.', 'Samsung originally released the Galaxy Note 10 last year alongside the larger Note 10 Plus.
The base Note 10 includes a 6.3-inch display, 8GB of RAM, 256GB of storage, plus a three-lens rear camera.
When stacked it up against its successor, the Galaxy Note 20 , the Note 10 offers a similar experience, but with a smaller size.
The Galaxy Note 10 is the smallest phone to support the S Pen to date.
You can check out all of the early Prime Day sales here and be sure to check back for more coverage as the event continues.']

title: ['eBay launches sneaker authentication service to combat counterfeit ... - The Verge', 'eBay Launches a Sneaker Authentication Service for Air Jordans, Yeezys and Other Rare Kicks - Robb Report', '20-year-old makes $100K a month online - news.com.au']
summary:
['eBay is launching a new sneaker authentication service to verify that shoes sold on the platform match what their listings claim.
According to CNN, the service will start the week of October 25th and cover the most popular sneaker styles and brands.
But by early 2021 it will expand to cover all sneakers sold for over $100 on eBay in the US.
More sneaker-focused marketplaces like StockX and GOAT already offer authentication services, which has previously given them an advantage over eBay.
As with its previously-announced watch authentication service, eBay has partnered with a third-party company, Sneaker Con, to authenticate items.', 'It may not be as trendy as Flight Club or Stock X, but real sneakerheads know there are few better places to find your dream pair of Air Jordans or Yeezys than eBay.
And now the online marketplace is taking serious steps to make sure that every pair of rare kicks sold on the popular platform is the real deal.
The company has just announced a new authentication service for high-end sneakers as part of its Authenticity Guaranteed program.
As part of the new program, eBay is partnering with Sneaker Con to make sure you’re getting exactly what was promised from a listing, according to a press release.
Once they’ve passed a multi-point examination, ensuring “they are consistent with the listing title, description and images,” the sneakers will be fitted with an eBay authentication tag and sent to you.', '']

title: ["eBay's 'Entrepreneurs of the Year Awards' recognize Puerto Rican ... - newsismybusiness.com", 'eBay Bike Bargains - second-hand deals on Cannondale ... - Road.cc', 'Thrifty woman uses £30 eBay rug to give her bare staircase a fluffy makeover & saves £150... - The Sun']
summary:
['Local entrepreneur Iván Blázquez received the “New Business Award” for creating Tropical Plantae.
Online marketplace eBay recently held the second edition of its “Entrepreneurs of the Year Awards,” which this year included a Puerto Rican business owner among the winners.
Pursuing his vision of supporting the Earth’s reforestation, Blázquez launched Tropical Plantae worldwide by capitalizing on eBay’s e-commerce platform, in which he promotes and sells local trees and fruit plants.
“The eBay e-commerce platform accelerated the growth of my business, which I began as a means of generating supplemental income, and has become my family’s main source of income,” Blázquez said.
Winners will receive a 100% scholarship from the eCommerce Institute for a training program of their choice to further professionalize their businesses, eBay officials said.', 'Getting hold of a brand new bike right now is like getting blood from a stone.
Buying second-hand is great and, like when buying a second-hand car, you can save a huge chunk of cash over buying new.
This is a very tidy package which, should the price stay low enough, would turn out to be an absolute bargain.
This bike looks to be in great condition and the power meter and carbon clincher wheels make it a complete package.
It has a relaxed position and mudguard eyelets too, making it an ideal commuter if your riding is simply taking to and from work.', "A WOMAN has revealed how she gave her boring staircase a stylish makeover by cutting up her £30 eBay rug.
Kayleigh shared her incredible DIY project on Facebook, writing: 'Put a video of the rug cut, it’s foam based so it doesn’t fray.
She said: ‘I originally ordered the eBay rug for my bedroom but when it arrived it wasn’t as thick on the bottom as I thought it would be.
The whole staircase took Kayleigh just an hour-and-a-half to complete and she is now totally in love with her stylish new staircase.
6 People say Kayleigh now has 'no need for fluffy slippers' Credit: Kayleigh BushellOne user wrote: ‘It’s so fluffy."]

title: ['eBay CEO Jamie Iannone Attracted by Non New In-Season - EcommerceBytes', 'LEGO paper bag prototypes listed on eBay for an eye-watering price - Brick Fanatics']
summary:
['eBay CEO Jamie Iannone wants to use next-gen technology to sell used or new-but-out-of-season items, as well as vintage and collectibles, he told Yahoo Finance’s Julia La Roche in an interview today.
Another thing unique to eBay is consumer sellers who bring unique items to the site, he told La Roche.
And when people come to sell things around the house, they become twice as valuable as a buyer.
He sees next generation technology, including artificial intelligence and machine learning, to change the experience on eBay.
Managed payments is one example of his “tech-led reimagination” strategy that makes it seamless for sellers.', 'Prototypes of the newly-announced LEGO paper bags have turned up on eBay in Germany.
According to the listing, the paper bags were obtained from an employee who was permitted to keep them for his son.
And they can now be yours, for the low, low price of just €10,999 (or roughly £9,960).
The LEGO Group announced the impending shift to paper bags last month, as part of the next stage in its drive towards sustainability.
The paper bags have been in development for two years, and the first batch will be rolled out early next year.']

title: ['What to do when a thief hacks your eBay account - The Boston Globe']
summary:
['I opened a new browser window to log into my eBay account.
My eBay account had been hacked.
At that point the hacker and I were fighting a virtual battle to gain control over my eBay account.
I’ve had the same eBay account for more than a decade, and never had any problems until this.
I’m just thankful that I read that e-mail from eBay and realized that my account had been compromised.']

title: ["'SNL' ad pitches eBay as a dumping ground for all the useless crap ... - Mashable"]
summary:
["Retail therapy has played a big role in keeping many of us together during a trying year that's kept everyone at home under the threat of a pandemic.
But now, more than half a year in, we're surrounded by piles and piles of stuff from abandoned projects and hobbies that were the understandable victims of pandemic malaise.
Saturday Night Live gets it.
This fake eBay commercial suggests that the long-lived auction website is the perfect destination for all that stuff you've spent money on, only to let it go unused.
It's sharp and funny because it's true."]

title: ['eBay Canada announces its Hall of Fame to celebrate 25 years of ... - Canada NewsWire', 'Outrage as greedy eBay sellers flog hidden disability lanyard for PENNIES so people can avoid wearing face... - The Irish Sun']
summary:
['"Sellers are the foundation of eBay," said Rob Bigler, General Manager of eBay Canada.
After his eBay store launched in 2019 as part of the Retail Revival program, Eric's customer base expanded to include eBay's large community of international buyers.
Royce Hall - CanadaworldcoinsNewdale, ManitobaLooking for ways to keep busy after retirement, Royce Hall started selling collectible stamps and coins on eBay.
Now, the brothers cater to international collectors through their eBay store, and local clientele through their retail store on Toronto's Queen Street West.
SOURCE eBay CanadaFor further information: Media Contact, Nicole Macharacek, Communications Manager, eBay Canada, [email protected], 416-305-8677; Tom Horn, Consultant, Proof Inc., [email protected], 416-969-2781', 'GREEDY eBay sellers are flogging hidden disability lanyards online so that buyers can avoid wearing mask.
The sunflower lanyard was introduced to supermarkets in 2016 to help staff recognise those who may need extra help.
Meanwhile unofficial versions of the lanyard are also being sold to those wishing to avoid wearing a mask.
In other news, this woman with endometriosis was abused in Tesco for wearing a sunflower lanyard.
And this mum praised Tesco for sending her the discreet sunflower lanyard.']

title: ['eBay Pulls the Plug on Completed Item Data - EcommerceBytes', 'Beware the eBay Shipping Label Switcharoo - EcommerceBytes']
summary:
['Sellers who use tools to help them research historical eBay sales and pricing data may be out of luck.
eBay abruptly dropped the findCompletedItems API, meaning third-party developers who provide tools to eBay buyers and sellers are left without the ability to return data about completed items.
The news hit eBay affiliates hard, especially due to the short notice eBay provided - just 9 days.
"If you're looking at a current listing and assuming the item will sell for a certain price, you may be sadly mistaken!
"If you're looking at a current listing and assuming the item will sell for a certain price, you may be sadly mistaken!', 'eBay is intermittently changing First Class shipping labels to more expensive methods, according to sellers who began reporting the problem 5 weeks ago.
A seller emailed EcommerceBytes today, October 20, writing, "My last 2 sales have both defaulted to crazy shipping.
One changed my Priority Mail selection to Fedex Overnite, the other from 1st Class Mail to Priority Mail."
That appears to be the same problem a seller told us about in a letter we published on September 7 .
The chronic, intermittent problem seems to impact orders where the buyer has selected the less expensive First Class postal option and causes the seller to print a more expensive shipping label.']

title: ["eBay Starts Offering 'Certified Refurbished' Products Direct From ... - PCMag", 'Couple To Become Millionaires After Starting eBay Business While Unemployed - LADbible', 'Ebay UK creates "new wave" of millionaires amid uncertainty - Retail Gazette']
summary:
['(Image: eBay)eBay is launching a new destination on its online marketplace dedicated to offering products classed as "Certified Refurbished(Opens in a new window)" that enjoy an extended warranty and ship directly from brands.
"eBay shoppers tend to focus on value, which has helped make these products so popular.
With this new Certified Refurbished destination, we’re doing a better job of helping customers discover inventory sold direct from the brands they love and feel confident they will be blown away by the quality."
To begin with, five priority categories will offer Certified Refurbished products, which include laptops, portable audio, power tools, small kitchen appliances and vacuums.
eBay clearly has Amazon in its sights with this new initiative, and in particular the company's Warehouse Deals.', 'A couple who founded an eBay company in 2010 after losing their jobs in the financial crash of the noughties have now become millionaires - their firm rocketed to success during lockdown this year.
Credit: PetShopBowlAdvert 10"Our business has gone from strength to strength, particularly in lockdown," the couple from Stratford-upon-Avon told The Daily Mirror.
Advert 10The pair are among a record number of eBay sellers who have reached £1 million in takings this year, with the online market place claiming there's been a 35 percent rise in eBay millionaires this year.
"We now run our business, Far East Direct, from two continents - Kevin is based in Hong Kong, while I'm here in the UK."
Credit: PAThe success of Rodney's business bears out the report from eBay that home, furniture and DIY sellers have benefitted most from the lockdown.', '// Ebay UK self-made millionaires rise by 35% in the last year// Economic uncertainty has led to a “new wave of entrepreneurs”// London tops the list of producing the majority of the millionairesEbay has found that the number of new, self-made millionaires on its platform has risen by 35 per cent in the last 12 months across the UK.
The online retailer said it expects economic uncertainty and unemployment to create a “new wave of entrepreneurs”.
The UK capitals creating the majority of the millionaires include London, Manchester and Birmingham.
Home, Furniture & DIY topped the list of the top ten categories for Ebay millionaires, with Vehicle Parts & Accessories, Clothes, Shoes & Accessories, and Business, Office & Industrial following closely behind.
“The uplift in new self-made millionaires on eBay proves that Britain’s entrepreneurial spirit is alive and kicking, despite the challenging economic times we are facing,” Ebay UK general manager Murray Lambell said.']

title: ["EBay creates 'Certified Refurbished' program for reselling used goods - Retail Dive"]
summary:
['Dive Brief:EBay on Wednesday debuted its "Certified Refurbished" feature for gently used items.
The platform has teamed up with companies like Dirt Devil, Hoover and Philips to sell refurbished items with a two-year Allstate Warranty.
To participate in eBay's program, refurbished items must be cleaned, inspected, in like-new condition and refurbished by the product manufacturer.
Dive Insight:With the Certified Refurbished program, eBay wants to help customers feel more comfortable shopping for refurbished products over its platform, Jordan Sweetnam, senior vice president and general manager for eBay's North American market, said in a statement.
With the economic uncertainty the coronavirus pandemic has brought on, it's possible even more consumers will turn to used goods this holiday season.']

title: ["eBay Sellers Don't Need Printer for Shipping Labels - EcommerceBytes", 'Beware the eBay Shipping Label Switcharoo - EcommerceBytes', 'Entrepreneur who sells second-hand books now an eBay millionaire - Reading Chronicle']
summary:
['eBay sellers no longer need a printer to purchase USPS postage through its shipping label program – though they will need a mobile phone.
“Now you can use eBay Labels to get digital QR codes that allow you to print shipping labels at participating post offices or shipping retailers,” it announced on Friday.
Initially it works with USPS shipping labels, but eBay revealed it would also be coming out with a similar option for FedEx and UPS shipping labels.
The Postal Service made a similar announcement about its Click-N-Ship program that allows consumers to purchase shipping labels through its website, which we reported on Monday.
eBay told sellers they would be able to take advantage of eBay Label discounts and automatic tracking through its program even when using the QR codes.', 'eBay is intermittently changing First Class shipping labels to more expensive methods, according to sellers who began reporting the problem 5 weeks ago.
A seller emailed EcommerceBytes today, October 20, writing, "My last 2 sales have both defaulted to crazy shipping.
One changed my Priority Mail selection to Fedex Overnite, the other from 1st Class Mail to Priority Mail."
That appears to be the same problem a seller told us about in a letter we published on September 7 .
The chronic, intermittent problem seems to impact orders where the buyer has selected the less expensive First Class postal option and causes the seller to print a more expensive shipping label.', "eBay UK revealed the number of new, self-made millionaires on the platform has risen by 35 per cent in the last 12 months.
READ ALSO: Thames Valley Police appealing for witnesses following assault in Reading.
London tops the list with 52 new eBay millionaires followed by Manchester with 36 new millionaires and Birmingham with 35 new millionaires.
READ ALSO: Captain Sir Tom Moore inspires Newbury's Ruth Saunders to walk a marathon for Thames Valley Air Ambulance.
Murray Lambell, UK General Manager, eBay said: “The uplift in new self-made millionaires on eBay proves that Britain’s entrepreneurial spirit is alive and kicking, despite the challenging economic times we are facing."]

title: ['eBay Puts the Middleman Back in Online Sales - EcommerceBytes', 'Amazon and eBay Still Selling QAnon Items Amid Crackdown From Other Major Companies - Newsweek', 'Glasgow creates 10 eBay self-made millionaires in the last year - here’s the top selling categories - Daily Record']
summary:
["When it launched, eBay removed the middleman with its model connecting buyers and sellers.
It's further evidence that trust on eBay has eroded.
Sellers may purposefully or unwittingly send buyers fakes.
Each application will help us learn and grow - increasing trust in transactions, and tackling the big problems head on.
Buyers were once kept in check to some extent by the feedback system, but sellers cannot leave negative or neutral feedback for buyers - and it's unlikely eBay will reconsider that policy.", '', 'Get the latest money news from the Daily Record with our weekly newsletterEBay has revealed that Glasgow created 10 self-made millionaires in the last year and is the only Scottish city to feature on its top 10 list.
London snagged the top spot, creating 52 new millionaires, while Glasgow came in 8th place , followed by Bolton in 9th and Oldham, Nottingham and Halifax all tied for 10th.
Murray Lambell, UK General Manager at eBay said: “The uplift in new self-made millionaires on eBay proves that Britain’s entrepreneurial spirit is alive and kicking, despite the challenging economic times we are facing.
"It is these forward-thinking small businesses who will help power the UK’s economic recovery and thrive in the long term.
(Image: Getty)Home, furniture & DIY topped the list of the top 10 categories for eBay millionaires, with vehicle parts & accessories, clothes, shoes & accessories following closely behind.']

title: ['eBay No Longer Credits Fees on Refunded Shipping - EcommerceBytes', 'Finance: No VAT on Amazon and eBay purchases - EyeWitness News', "EXCLUSIVE: EBay's Top Ten Most Expensive Watches Sold This ... - WATCHPRO"]
summary:
['Dear Ina,Each month, for the past 15+ years, I contact eBay support for credit on refunded shipping.
So sad, but I will be adding the following to all my listings: "If you cannot request total, I do refund excess shipping.
Unfortunately because eBay will no longer reimburse my fees on refunded shipping due to the implementation of managed payments system, I am forced to now deduct those fees from shipping refunds.
For over 15 years eBay has refunded these fees so I can give you back proper shipping refund amounts.
So if your shipping refund is $5, I will reimburse you $4.50.', 'NASSAU, BAHAMAS — Acting Financial Secretary Marlon Johnson yesterday clarified that goods brought into the country will only be taxed at the point of entry, as concerns have surfaced on social media that taxes may also be levied on online purchases from online marketplaces such as Amazon and eBay.
Johnson said: “Goods brought into The Bahamas will only be taxed at the point of entry into the country as is done today.
Thus, goods bought from Amazon or eBay will not attract VAT by those companies.”“By existing law (not anything new) all services consumed in the country are subject to VAT provided the vendor meets the minimum $100,000 per annum threshold for sales inside the country.
As they become aware and work through their internal processes, they tend to comply without issue.”Beginning November 1, Facebook ads in The Bahamas will be subject to a 12 percent value-added tax (VAT).
Facebook has announced the tax applies to advertisers whose “Sold To” country of their business or personal address is set to The Bahamas.', '']

title: ["eBay Sneakers - eBay Launches Authenticity Guarantee to Weed ... - Runner's World", 'EBay "Puzzle" by McCann London - CampaignLive', 'Can eBay (EBAY) turn the e-commerce boom to its advantage in ... - AlphaStreet', 'Johnny Manziel Signed Card With ‘F–k Rovell’ Message On It Hits Ebay - BroBible', 'Sold out Liverpool FC limited edition Cadbury bars for sale on eBay for eye watering price - Birmingham Live']
summary:
['Your chances of buying fake Alphaflys from eBay are about to decrease, because the website is now rolling out a program that will authenticate sneakers.
Acording to a press release, the program will expand to all new and pre-owned collectible sneakers sold on eBay for more than $100 in the United States in early 2021.
So naturally the next step is to scour eBay for a resale pair that will inevitably be marked up.
eBay is now rolling out its authenticity guarantee program, which will make sure your shoes are legit.
According to a press release, the program will expand to all new and pre-owned collectible sneakers sold on eBay for over $100 in the United States.', 'EBay showcases the trials and tribulations of moving home.
Set to Come and Get Your Love by Redbone, the ad shows a pair as they attempt to piece together their new house by physically slotting pieces of furniture into the building.
Things take a turn, however, when they can’t find an item to fit above the mantelpiece, prompting the pair to buy a new TV via eBay.
Launched alongside radio activity, the work was written by Matt Searle, art directed by Olly Wood and directed by Dom Hawley and Nic Goffey through Outsider.', 'When eBay Inc. (NASDAQ: EBAY) released its third-quarter numbers this week, the mixed outcome added to concerns that the e-commerce boom is probably waning.
Also Read: eBay Q3 2020 Earnings Call TranscriptStock DipsWhile the company’s earnings barely matched expectations, the slowdown in the gross merchandise volume growth – the total value of goods sold – didn’t go well with investors.
As a result, eBay’s stock slipped into negative territory on Wednesday evening.
Mixed Q3In the September-quarter eBay’s gross merchandise volume rose at a slower pace of 22%, compared to the previous period, raising concerns that the COVID-driven boom is losing steam.
Net transactions, the segment that accounts for about 90% of the total business, expanded 29%, driving up total revenues to $2.61 billion.', 'Getty ImageThe history between Johnny Manziel and Darren Rovell has been well-documented.
Thanks to Rovell’s snooping around, the NCAA took notice and Manziel was suspended for the first half of the 2013 season opener.
The former Heisman Trophy winner stuffed Rovell into a locker back in August and now a card signed by Manziel with the message ‘f–k Rovell’ on it has hit eBay.
The card is listed for $10,000, but you can make your own offer on the epic piece of memorabilia.
eBay/johanmetmanIt’s pretty great to imagine Manziel being asked to sign this card and deciding to write that message on it.', "Something went wrong, please try again later.
Invalid email Something went wrong, please try again later.
Cadbury and Liverpool FC announced they were collaborating to release a limited edition Dairy Milk bar at the start of September.
The chocolate maker released the bar on its website for £2.50 to the joy of many Liverpool fans.
However, Facebook group The Liverpool country has claimed the bar is still being sold in Sainsbury's."]

title: ['Two ex-eBay employees admit to roles in scheme that involved sending live SPIDERS to Mass. couple - Daily Mail', 'Sponsored: eBay Launches “Authenticity Guarantee” for Watch Buyers - Watchtime.com', 'eBay Payments Throwing PayPal Loans into Default - EcommerceBytes', 'eBay Bike Bargains - Second hand deals on Specialized, Cervelo ... - Road.cc', 'Limited edition LFC Cadbury chocolate bar selling on eBay for four times the price - Liverpool Echo']
summary:
["Two more former eBay Inc. employees have admitted to their roles in a campaign to terrorize a Massachusetts couple with threatening social media messages and disturbing deliveries to their home.
They are among seven former eBay employees charged in the scheme to harass the couple, of Natick, who authorities say published an online newsletter with articles that were critical of the company.
Five ex-eBay workers pleaded guilty before Gilbert and Stockwell did, including Philip Cooke, 55, who is a former Santa Clara police captain - as is Gilbert.
The couple was also sent a book on surviving the loss of a spouse, prosecutors said.
He also proposed bringing documents that would make the couple 'look crazy' to police who were helping the couple.", '“Leveraging a team of independent experts, eBay’s Authenticity Guarantee checks all watches sold for $2,000 or more in detail, with a multi-point inspection.
Here’s an inside-look at the new service:Incredible Selection of Authenticity Guarantee Badged Items: Shoppers can browse luxury watches with the Authenticity Guarantee badge with confidence — knowing that after purchase, and before being shipped to the customer, these eligible timepieces are routed to a third-party authenticator for thorough assessment.
eBay Channels: A new content-led experience on the latest versions of eBay’s iOS and Android apps, eBay Channels are targeted to luxury watch enthusiasts, connecting them with inspiration from the luxury watch world and eBay’s vast selection.
For more information on Authenticity Guarantee, visit www.eBay.com/buyauthentic and www.eBay.com/sellauthentic.
To shop luxury watches, check out www.eBay.com/luxurywatches and follow @eBay on Instagram, Twitter, YouTube and Facebook.', 'eBay sellers face defaulting on their PayPal Working Capital loans after being pushed into eBay Managed Payments.
"When the processor for your eBay sales is moved to eBay managed payments, your business's loan will be in default," PayPal wrote, giving him the option of paying off his PayPal loan.
Another seller who said they were in the same boat said it was their understanding that as long as eBay sellers also had a website that processes payments with PayPal, their loans would not go into default.
I was told we have 2 choices, either restructure the loan or close our eBay sales channel, both of which are punitive."
In the summer we reported on the problem facing eBay sellers holding PayPal loans who were being transitioned into Managed Payments, but eBay continues to place additional sellers into the program.', 'We love browsing eBay for bargain second-hand bikes and there is plenty of choice at the moment with so many riders switching steeds for 2021.
You can pick up a brilliant deal on a used bike, so here’s what we found today.
It feels like decades have passed by since this was the case but the SL4 isn’t an old bike by any means.
BUY NOW AT £1,900Another great example of the amount of bike that you can get for your money is this Cervelo R5.
BUY NOW AT £4,750From three second-hand bikes to one that is brand new.', 'Invalid email Something went wrong, please try again later.
Get the latest shopping news straight to your inboxChocolate lovers have been eagerly scooping up Cabury’s new limited edition bar - but some sellers are now putting them on eBay for eye watering prices.
The limited edition bar which sees Cadbury and Liverpool FC collaborate was announced in September, with only 60,000 of the special Dairy Milk bar being made.
One person is selling the limited edition bar alongside an LFC Champions Programme for £50, while another is selling the 100g bar with two empty limited edition Carlsberg cans for £22.99.
Another is also selling the bar for £30, along with a letter that was sent out to fans and a scarf.']

title: ['Alleged Surface Pro 8 Engineering Sample Sold On EBay With Intel Tiger Lake CPU And 32GB RAM - Hot Hardware']
summary:
["It was inevitable that Microsoft would release a Surface Pro 8, but no one expected that we would come across it in this manner.
An alleged Surface Pro 8 engineering sample was sold on eBay for $1,300, and it comes with some interesting specs.
Whereas the Surface Pro 7 is powered by 10th generation Ice Lake processors, this prototype is rocking Intel's latest 11th generation Tiger Lake processor (Core i7-1165G7).
For those keeping score, the Surface Pro 7 topped out at 16GB of RAM.
The Surface Pro 7 launched in October 2019, which means that the Surface Pro 8 is running a bit behind schedule."]

title: ["Slipknot's Corey Taylor is auctioning off his guitars on eBay for ... - Mixdown", 'eBay Seller Gets Surprise Bill for FedEx Shipping - EcommerceBytes', 'Ebay-Kunden können ab sofort CO2-Emissionen ihres Einkaufs ... - Onlinehändler News']
summary:
['The collection, which you can view here, features 13 different guitars, each of which has been signed by the man himself.
There’s a bunch of different models on offer, including two Gibson Dave Grohl signature electrics, an old Ibanez SDGR bass, a handful of Les Pauls, acoustic models and more.
What’s more, eBay have also pledged to match the price of whatever Taylor sells each item for in their own donations.
Taylor also emphasised that all guitars would come with a case and Certificate of Authenticity for collectors, saying “Bid on 13 used and signed guitars I’m auctioning off to benefit Direct Relief’s COVID-19 efforts.
Slipknot guitarist Jim Root recently unveiled his new Fender Signature Jazzmaster V4.', 'An eBay seller received a surprise bill this week, adding to the chronic reports that the marketplace sometimes overcharges sellers for FedEx through its shipping label program.
When she called about her eBay invoice, a customer service rep told her that eBay raised the price of the FedEx labels from the $14 it displayed when she printed the labels to $36 - presumably never notifying her of the post-transaction changes to her fees.
"Supposedly this was because the boxes were bigger than reported, but I know absolutely that the measurements were correct," she told EcommerceBytes.
As sellers know, eBay charges commission and payment processing fees on the cost of shipping, so they pay higher eBay fees when shipping costs are higher.
The seller explained she was writing to EcommerceBytes, "Hoping I can prevent others from making the same mistake.', 'So haben sich ein für die jeweilige Produktkategorie repräsentatives Durchschnittsgewicht und ein Emissionsfaktor ergeben, auf deren Basis der CO2-Ausstoß berechnet wird.
Auf der Artikelseite werden Ebay-User über den CO2-Fußabdruck ihres Produkts informiert und können wählen, ob sie diesen durch die Unterstützung eines Klimaschutzprojekts aus South Poles Portfolio ausgleichen wollen.
Stößt die CO2-Kompensationen bei den Kunden auf die erwartete Resonanz, wolle Ebay die Option im kommenden Jahr auf weitere Kategorien ausdehnen.
Seit 25 Jahren kann man auf Ebay mit gebrauchten Waren handeln – immer wieder betont der Online-Marktplatz deshalb, dass Nachhaltigkeit als Teil der Unternehmens-DNA verstanden wird.
Auch will Ebay bis zum Jahr 2025 gänzlich erneuerbare Energien nutzen und die eigenen CO2-Emissionen bis zum Jahr 2030 deutlich verringern.']

title: ['Alex Kazim Returns to eBay to Head Advertising - EcommerceBytes', 'New Way to Verify Bank Info for eBay Managed Payments - EcommerceBytes', "Don't Dismiss This Weird Business eBay Is Embracing - The Motley Fool", 'eBay, USPS Ready to Offer 75-Cent, Trackable Shipping Option for ... - Sports Collectors Daily']
summary:
['A high level executive at eBay during the days when Meg Whitman led the company returned in July to head eBay’s on-platform advertising business unit.
eBay is currently appealing to brands to advertise for the holidays, enticing them with data about early shoppers.
“eBay’s Early Gifter audience is made up of 258,000 shoppers with real purchase intent,” eBay pitched them on eBay Ads blog.
eBay also provided insight into early-shopper search behavior:“So what are Early Gifters looking for?
And they’re twice as likely to purchase Vintage & Antique Jewelry, and Diecast & Toy Vehicles.', 'eBay announced a new way sellers can verify their bank account when registering for Managed Payments – through microdeposits.
Some eBay sellers have reported difficulties verifying their bank account when required to register for Managed Payments (or after already enrolled, such as this seller).
eBay wrote about the new process on the Payments board and described how it works as follows:“With this new method, eBay will make two microdeposits in unique amounts to your bank account to verify that we have the correct bank account information for you.
The microdeposits will usually post to your bank account within 1-3 business days.
We’ll withdraw the amount of the microdeposits from your bank account typically within 3 business days.', "But there may be far more than meets the eye to the new product category that online auction site eBay (EBAY 2.82%) is officially adding to its mix.
Playing into eBay's unique strengthYes, Amazon and eBay both already offer refurbished items.
There's little room in the Amazon apparatus, however, to deal with unboxed or damaged items returned by its customers.
The seller can sell one unique item at a time, but can also list a bunch of identical refurbished items just as easily.
This is a niche piece of the retailing business that's ripe for the sort of consolidation that eBay -- and maybe only eBay -- can drive.", '']

title: ["Tesla's sold-out tequila is being scalped on eBay for twice its retail ... - TNW", 'Ryzen 5000 CPUs sell out in minutes, appear on eBay with inflated ... - TechSpot']
summary:
['Tesla Tequila went on sale last night and is already sold out.
According to the Tesla store, the tequila has been aged for 15 months in French oak barrels, ooh mais oui.
What’s more, bids are coming in, and at the time of writing bidding is now at $509 — that’s more than twice the tequila’s retail price.
The resell prices on the Tesla Tequila are crazy!
People are literally drinking the Tequila and selling the bottle and stand for 550 each.', "TechSpot means tech analysis and advice you can trustIn a nutshell: The Ryzen 5000 series launched yesterday, and, in what is a surprise to nobody, getting hold of one right now is proving an impossible task---unless you pay a fortune on eBay.
It's a memorable time for gamers, with the Xbox Series X/S, PS5, new RTX and Radeon cards, and the Ryzen 5000 series arriving.
Unfortunately, the Ryzen 5000 chips are suffering the same availability issues as the other big tech products.
The depressingly familiar scenario is that if you want a Ryzen 5000 processor right now, you have to pay way above the MSRP on eBay.
Hopefully, the situation will improve, and we won't have to wait until next year to buy a new Ryzen 5000 CPU."]

['', 'Assets seized from a crime gang responsible for more than 120 thefts in Northamptonshire (SWNS)Police have sold Rolex watches and jewellery seized from a jailed crime gang on eBay for £24,000.
The possessions included a diamond ring which netted £13,433 and two Rolex watches which went for £7,800 and £2,287.
The Home Office will split the total with Northamptonshire Police after the force sold seized assets on its new eBay site.
"Using a new strand of legislation under the Proceeds of Crime Act we have been able to sell seized assets, in this case jewellery, which were found during our investigation.
It sends a message to others that a life of crime does not pay.”Previously the force sold assets via another force’s site paying them a small commission.']

title: ["Why eBay's Calculated Risk to Launch Sneaker Authentication Paid ... - Business Insider", 'eBay Is Auctioning 60 Rare Air Jordans a Day Throughout the Week — These Are the Hard-to-Find Sneakers That Are Available - Footwear News']
summary:
["Here's how eBay launched and scaled its sneaker authentication program during the pandemic.
How eBay set up an authentication center during a pandemicLaunching anything during a pandemic can be risky.
Sweetnam said that eBay made the decision to get into sneaker authentication about six months ago, as the pandemic accelerated interest in the sneaker category overall.
Even before launching authentication, eBay was seeing over 50% growth in gross merchandise value (GMV), or inventory, year-to-date in footwear.
But for its sneaker authentication launch, eBay relied on videos and virtual content to help spread the word to users.", 'Air Jordan fans, eBay has something special for you going on right now.
The secondary marketplace is currently hosting an exclusive auction of rare and hard-to-find Air Jordan sneakers via eBay.com from a collection that is more than 30 years old.
Included in the auctions are undeniable grails such as the first-ever Air Jordan 1 High retros that released in 1994, an original Air Jordan 11 from 1995 that resemble the ones that basketball icon Michael Jordan wore during the 1995-96 NBA Playoffs, an original Air Jordan 14 from 1998 that is reminiscent of what the baller laced up when he hit his last shot as a member of the Chicago Bulls and many more.
An original Air Jordan 11 “Columbia Blue” that’s part of a massive eBay auction.

title: ['eBay Announces "Pokémon Palooza," A Series of Exclusive No ... - PR Newswire', 'Someone Resold A PS5 On Ebay Australia For $50,100 - Kotaku Australia', 'eBay Bike Bargains - Road bikes from Cannondale, Trek ... - Road.cc']
summary:
['SAN JOSE, Calif., Nov. 13, 2020 /PRNewswire/ -- eBay , one of the world's largest destinations for trading cards, unveils Pokémon Palooza, a weeks-long trading card shopping event in partnership with leading CCG seller, TCA Gaming, and auction powerhouse, PWCC.
A snapshot of a few marquee Pokémon trading cards available as part of eBay’s exclusive “Pokémon Palooza” auctions, such as 1st edition PSA 10 Charizards and Blastoises, as well as complete PSA 10 Base, Jungle and Fossil sets.
"Passion for trading cards is thriving and we as a marketplace are uniquely poised to bring our collector community an unrivaled selection of hard-to-find-cards," said Nicole Colombo, GM of Collectibles at eBay.
Chris Callahan, Director of Marketing for PWCC, said "Partnering with eBay allows us to bring these exclusive Pokémon cards to collectors around the world.
Pokémon fans have kept the love of this nostalgic card game alive through online marketplaces like eBay, and auctioning off these rare, exclusive cards allows us to foster that love even more."', 'Someone Resold A PS5 On Ebay Australia For $50,100Lots of Australians were able to get a PS5 yesterday, but many more were not.
Multiple PS5 listings that I’ve reviewed this morning all started with relatively low list prices: $900, $850 or even $800.
But then there’s the worst one of the lot: a console that sold on eBay for $50,100.
The highest listings on eBay Australia at the time of writing are all from September, when the first wave of PS5 pre orders began.
But there are other listings that, while not in the $50,000 territory, are definitely way, way too much to be paying for a goddamn PlayStation.', 'We’ve been back on eBay hunting out some end of season bike bargains on second-hand bikes.
Trek’s Domane was created for a particularly difficult set of road races in northern Europe that take place in the spring.
This Domane gets a full SRAM Red eTap groupset and a set of Bontrager Aeolus 3 carbon wheels.
BUY NOW AT £4,799Another dream bike in many people’s eyes is this Alchemy titanium road bike.
The bike is finished with an Ultegra Di2 groupset, custom carbon wheels on Chris King hubs and an ENVE carbon fork complete this stunning road bike.']

Among its many investments, Elliott did not make any changes to its stake in eBay EBAY.O, another company where it pushed for changes in 2019.

While this is happening on eBay currently, Amazon has suspended all third-party sellers of the PS5 in an attempt to stop scalping and price-gouging.
Retailers in Ireland have had to contend with the fact that not all pre-orders have been fulfilled until after Christmas, which is further driving people eager to get their hands on the next-gen consoles to online scalping.", "The new range hit Aldi's website yesterday, with online queues of hundreds of thousands of people attempting to get their hands on the new products.

Using the code PLENO20, customers can claim discounts of up to $1000 on two purchases (minus postage) from the Lenovo eBay store, excluding gift cards.
Products on sale include Chromebooks, high-end laptops and desktops, tablets, monitors, and accessories like mice and keyboards.
The most expensive item on sale, the Lenovo ThinkPad P53, is a 15-inch mobile workstation laptop launched last year.
Its full price of $5499 can be cut to $4499 with the voucher code – a total discount of $1000.', "Efficiency gainsAccording to Oliver, the COVID crisis has, if anything, led to operational efficiencies for the firm.
The majority of contact between customers and company takes place online, mostly via email:We have become more efficient.
We'll do a call back service if somebody really wants to talk to us because it's just easier to deal with it over the phone.
So somebody can just complete the journey, but equally somebody can walk up and do the whole journey.
As for that at home contact center team, there are now plans for them to return to the pre-COVID working norm."]

title: ['eBay sellers have new resale opportunity - Chain Store Age', 'eBay Defends Its Cloud Hosting Decision - EcommerceBytes', 'Top 10 items to sell on eBay for extra Christmas cash - Yahoo News', 'Upwork taps former eBay exec as chief product and experience officer - Staffing Industry Analysts', 'EBay targets regional pick-up locations through partnership with ... - Inside Retail Australia', 'The clothes to flog on eBay if you want to make a mint & it’s good news if your wardrobe’s stuffed with H&M... - The Irish Sun']
summary:
['A new service called BULQ on eBay enables small sellers to purchase and resell excess inventory from large retailers.
Launched in partnership with end-to-end return platform Optoro, BULQ on eBay allows sellers to seamlessly purchase and resell liquidation lots on the eBay marketplace that include returned and excess merchandise from Optoro clients, such as Staples and Ikea.
Once a lot is purchased, the solution enables sellers to pull product information and create individual listings to edit, review and publish directly to their eBay store.
“eBay was founded 25 years ago on the promise of empowering people and fostering economic opportunity,” said Marni Levine, VP of seller operations and engagement at eBay.
Everything we do at eBay is with our customers in mind — and this BULQ partnership will help transform our sellers’ experience with resale by making the listing process easier and more streamlined.', "eBay's Chief Technology Officer yesterday defended the company's use of its own infrastructure, posting on the eBay Tech blog that it has been able to withstand sudden increased demands in 2020 in part due to its cloud hosting decision.
He said eBay was similarly poised to meet the increased demands of the upcoming holiday season.
At a time when many sites use solutions from IBM, Oracle, Amazon, and Google when moving to the cloud, eBay decided to stick with its own infrastructure.
That's in contrast to Etsy, which announced in 2017 it would migrate from its own data centers to the Google Cloud Platform.
Are they able to use the site efficiently, and are buyers able to easily find and purchase their items?", 'Ebaying 10 of top-selling items likely to be gathering dust in the loft could earn Brits up to £1,311 before fees, according to a study.
Photo: GettySelling your unwanted items on online marketplaces such as eBay (EBAY) can be a great way of making some extra cash before Christmas.
Ebaying 10 of top-selling items likely to be gathering dust in the loft could earn Brits up to £1,311 ($1,741) before fees, according to study by budgeting fintech Thinkmoney.
Make the most of free listings as eBay lets you list 20 items for sale for free each month.
Remember that list fees are different to sold fees, which is where eBay charge you a percentage for a sold item which is never free.', 'Home »Editorial »Daily News »Upwork taps former eBay exec as chief product and experience officerDaily News View All NewsUpwork taps former eBay exec as chief product and experience officerNovember 18, 2020Online staffing platform Upwork Inc. (NASDAQ: UPWK) picked Sam Bright to serve as its chief product and experience officer.
Bright has 16 years of executive experience and comes to Upwork after serving as VP and general manager of verticals at eBay.
Prior to eBay, Bright’s experience included advising on more than $10 billion of tech mergers and acquisition deal process at Bank of America Merrill Lynch.
Smart has also served as an analyst at Forrester Research.
“Sam is an innovative, bold, and visionary leader who will make a major impact on how we help our customers unlock their potential and discover the truly transformational new way of working that is only available through the Upwork marketplace,” Upwork President and CEO Hayden Brown said.', 'EBay will add a further 1200 click-and-collect locations to its offer through a partnership with logistics company Hubbed.
Hubbed is a carrier-agnostic network of parcel pick up and drop off points with 2000 locations across Australia.
Senior director at eBay Australia David Ramadge said the partnership expands eBay’s reach across Australia, especially in regional areas.
“85 per cent of Australians [will be] able to access after hours delivery options when shopping with eBay,” Ramadge said.
“Hubbed is pleased to further broaden eBay’s click-and-collect network.', 'From Nike sportswear to H&M designer collaborations, there are labels that experts believe sell for the most on eBay.
So if you have unwanted garments from these labels stashed at the back of the cupboard, you should list them on eBay now.
11 Topshop has collaborated with other celebs, including Kate Moss, with their pieces always retaining valueNIKEThis brand consistently resells well, Abbey reveals.
She says: “There are certain preloved clothes I suggest to my clients to look out for on eBay.
These labels selling well on eBay come as no surprise as the recent data revealed that female respondents said the lockdown has led them to hunt for more bargains than ever.']

BUY NOW AT 1,350Titanium is also a brilliant frame material for road bikes, the compliance being excellent on rougher road surfaces.", 'Unfortunately, the PlayStation 5 is sold out around the world, and while we’re keeping track of PS5 stock to help you to find a console, systems are inevitably appearing on eBay at upwards of $1,500 or £1,000 a pop.

Our recommendation is to keep an eye on our PS5 stock article and don’t succumb to scalpers.', '‘Well, that seems reasonable,’ said no one (Pic: eBay)Yesterday’s PS5 launch was undeniably messy and now the console’s out in the UK, eBay scalpers appear to have become more brazen.

These bids are certainly not natural (Pic: eBay)Since there’s no reason for one person to bid against themselves, it’s likely that this is a bot.', "eBay converts an iconic gas station in East Hollywood into a drive-thru ‘Authentication Station’ to mark their new Authenticity Guarantee offering, changing the way people shop and sell on eBay.

['Gamers are sharing tips on how to derail auctions for high-end graphics cards and consoles to try to end scalping - where people buy limited-supply goods to sell on at a profit.
Fake bids for the latest consoles have been spotted, but some of the most committed activism is coming from PC gamers, especially those trying to get their hands on the newest hardware.
"The moderators of /r/AMD do NOT condone locating scalper auctions, leaving dozens of absurd bids, so as to repeatedly derail a scalper's opportunity to make a sale and ultimately de-incentivise PC hardware scalping," the title of the post stated.
"We'd urge these gamers to stop artificially pushing up prices and wait for sellers to lower their prices or for there to be more stock," they added.
"People are generally free to list non-essential items - such as games consoles - at the price they want on eBay.', 'A short film believed to be the only official Thelwell animation, which was found for sale on eBay, has been remastered and released to the public.
Charles Sainsbury-Plaice, of Countryside Greetings, spotted the film for sale in the spring.
As the Thelwell estate’s main licensee, who supplies Thelwell merchandise to shops, he snapped it up.

Continues below…“I believe this is the only true animation made by Thelwell,” Mr Sainsbury-Plaice said, adding that there are videos made using various still images.', '', "eBay stock research rationale and Amazon comparisoneBay stock vs Amazon stock - Source: Sven CarlineBay (EBAY) is Seth Klarman's largest holding within the Baupost Group.
eBay stock price historical chartAt first sight, eBay stock didn't perform as well as AMZN did, but we must not forget the PayPal spin-off in 2015.
When Klarman started buying, the free cash flow yield was in the low teens while now we are looking at a free cash flow yield of 7%.
With operating cash flows of $55 billion, high capital expenditures of $30 billion, the free cash flows left are $24 billion.
Amazon stock investment conclusionOwning Amazon is easy, the stock keeps going up, the company continues to expand into new sectors leveraging on its scale and market position.", 'Small Business Trends: Sometimes if I don’t see the right offering for the kind of payment I want to make, I walk away.
Whether I was looking for it on my phone and put it in my cart and then went online and completed the transaction, right?
Small Business Trends: And as an example for me personally, I buy a lot of stuff from Panera Bread.
Small Business Trends: And then they have this whole thing that has accelerated due to the pandemic with cashless.
Small Business Trends: Right.', "Fees are set to change and sellers will no longer have to use PayPal but this means it will take longer to get paid.
PayPal will no longer get a cut of sales for processing payments and instead eBay will take a larger cut than it did before.
Without Paypal, eBay will now take a higher fee of 12.8% and a fixed 30p per transaction fee, which woks out as slightly less overall.
Top tips for selling on eBay NEW to eBay?
The longer your item is listed, the more chance of people seeing it, so unless it's time-sensitive, pick seven days.", 'The head of eBay North America Jordan Sweetnam created a video to thank eBay sellers and shared it on social media on Thanksgiving Day.
Sellers’ energy and passion saw eBay through a “crazy” last year, he said.
“Thank you so much – you are the heart of eBay,” Sweetnam told sellers in the video.
The video showcased sellers in a montage and also featured Harry Temkin, Vice President of Seller Experience at eBay.
Because all of you bring that to eBay.”Also featured in the Thanksgiving Day video was Rebecca Michals, Director of Community, who said eBay sellers truly are a community with each other.']

summary:
['The reader, a Top Rated Seller, said eBay began charging him penalty fees this month - an additional $2,000 in fees so far - and he outlined problems he sees with the marketplace's policy and practices.
As a result, we are being penalized with approximately 60% higher eBay fees."
It's noteworthy that eBay couldn't resist the temptation to further monetize penalty fees just 8 months after instituting them in October 2018.
Sellers have said the penalty fees create a conflict of interest for eBay.
Not having manpower to investigate and correct bogus claims would most certainly contribute to erroneous penalty fees.', "TESCO shoppers can save up to 57% on toys, homeware and tech by shopping from the supermarket's eBay outlet store.
The little-known shop offers bargains on brand-new and refurbished items, which could come in handy in time for Christmas.
1 Tesco's eBay outlet store offers bargains on everything from toys and homeware to electricalsThe supermarket has been offering discounted goods in the store since 2018, when it flogged leftover stock from the Tesco Direct website, which shut in July 2018.
How to get a good outlet deal WE'VE found discounts of up to 57% on Tesco's eBay store, here’s our top tips for shopping from outlet stores.
For example, a 16GB smartphone by brand Imo sets you back just £42.50 on Tesco's eBay store, down from £99.50 - saving you £57 (57%)."]

title: ['eBay to Expand Shipping Label QR Codes to Returns - EcommerceBytes', 'Is eBay Stock a Buy? - The Motley Fool', 'eBay Users Are Trying to Flog Photographs of the PS5 - Push Square', 'eBay Condemns PS5 Photo Scammers, Is Taking Action Against ... - IGN', 'EBay makes winning bid for Asos marketer Eve Williams - CampaignLive']
summary:
['eBay announced today that its QR feature is now available for all users in the US for USPS domestic shipping labels.
It also said it plans to expand the use of QR codes into its return-label flows.
eBay explained that the seller is notified about the QR code option in My eBay and via email.
The seller can select a QR code as the label format and receive it via email or download it directly from the shipping flow.”If plans change, QR codes can easily be voided or reprinted at no additional cost, eBay said.
“Additionally, we’re planning to expand the use of QR codes into our return label flows,” it wrote in Monday’s announcement, found on the eBay corporate blog.', "eBay's (EBAY 2.82%) stock rallied about 40% this year as investors flocked to e-commerce companies that could benefit from store closures and stay-at-home trends during the COVID-19 pandemic.
Shopify (SHOP 8.26%) has risen over 160%, and shares of Etsy (ETSY -2.75%) have more than tripled.
Is eBay's stock cheap relative to its growth?
Based on those estimates, eBay stock looks cheap at 16.6 times 2020 adjusted earnings.
eBay stock is cheap, because investors believe its growth will decelerate after the pandemic ends.", 'We’ve already covered in detail the seedy story of scalpers who’ve been working overtime to secure PS5 stock, but how about this new low?
eBay has issued a warning to sellers trying to flog photographs of the next-gen format.
“We condemn these opportunistic sellers who are attempting to mislead other users,” the website said.
Sony’s new console has caused all kinds of craziness in the UK, which this is just the latest example of.
Meanwhile, the system is completely sold out worldwide, with no signs of demand slowing.', 'Loading PlayConfirmed PlayStation 5 Games 100 ImagesAuction site eBay has condemned scammers listing photographs of PlayStation 5 consoles, and has vowed to take action against the sellers and to remove listings.
Eurogamer , eBay said: "We condemn these opportunistic sellers who are attempting to mislead other users.
"Buyers who receive an item which is not as described are entitled to a refund via our eBay Money Back Guarantee, provided they completed the transaction on the eBay platform.
So while these listings do ‘technically’ abide by eBay’s rules, it’s good to see eBay planning to take action.
If you do already have one, be sure to check out our PS5 console guide and 8 hidden PS5 features and settingsMatt Purslow is IGN's UK News and Entertainment Writer.', 'EBay has appointed Eve Williams, previously global brand experience director at Asos, as its UK chief marketing officer.
Williams starts today (30 November) and succeeds former CMO Gareth Jones, who left the business in March after five years to become CMO at Farfetch.
Williams has been global brand experience director since 2016, a role including responsibility for marketing and customer programmes, creative, content, consumer comms and social output.
Before that, she spent seven years at Omnicom-owned contract publisher Cedar Communications, producing content for brands British Airways, Tesco, O2 and TUI.
"Eve’s brilliant digital and brand marketing experience, creative flair and customer insight is a tremendous asset as we drive eBay forward in a dramatically changing and fast paced environment.”']

title: ['Scammers selling PlayStation 5 photos on eBay - Business Insider', 'eBay Names Julie Loeger Global Chief Growth Officer - PR Newswire', 'A Royal Staffer Sold Stolen Photos of Prince William & Kate ... - STYLECASTER', 'eBay for Charity Partners with The Andy Warhol Foundation, Drops ... - PR Newswire', 'eBay x Sole Collector Announce ComplexLand Scavenger Hunt for ... - Sole Collector', 'Cleaner stole royal items to sell on eBay - The Times']
summary:
['Some scammers on eBay are selling photos of the consoles for hundreds of dollars, and eBay says it is removing them.
AdvertisementThe just-launched PlayStation 5 video game console is sold out everywhere, and only available through resellers at inflated prices, but scams abound too.
Register Now Our SpeakersNow, some scammers are taking advantage of the scramble to get a PlayStation 5, with deceptive listings for photos of the consoles, some of which have prices already bid up hundreds of dollars.
In the November 28 post, EuroGamer said that a search for "Playstation 5 photo" turned up 324 results.
On November 30, a search by Business Insider had 114 results, indicating that eBay may have taken action against some scammers.', 'SAN JOSE, Calif., Dec. 1, 2020 /PRNewswire/ -- Today, eBay announced the appointment of Julie Loeger as Global Chief Growth Officer (CGO).
In a newly created role, as CGO, Julie will lead two critical, global teams that are focused on customer acquisition, retention and service -- Global Marketing and Global Customer Experience.
Together, these teams will form eBay's Global Growth organization.
With more than 30 years of experience, Julie possesses an impressive blend of global marketing, strategy, brand management, and product development experience.
"I am excited to join the eBay team in January," said Julie Loeger, incoming Global Chief Growth Officer, eBay.', 'A Buckingham Palace royal staffer sold Kate Middleton and Prince William’s photos on eBay, U.K. courts revealed.
Prosecutor Simon Maughan said in court that Canto stole items from the palace worth anywhere between $13,300 and $133,630.
Signed photographs of the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge and the Duke of Sussex were those found among the stolen palace goods hidden in his living quarters.
According to the court’s prosecution, 37 of these items stolen from the palace were listed on eBay for “well under” their real value, earning Canto around $10,300.
An additional 77 items were also stolen from the palace shop, the Queen’s Gallery shop, Prince Andrew’s storeroom, and staff lockers.', 'All items from the sale will be sold with a Certificate of Provenance, indicating the work originates from the estate of Andy Warhol and The Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts.
All items will come with a Certificate of Provenance, indicating the work originates from the estate of Andy Warhol and The Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts.
It features unique works from the 1950s featured in the recently released monograph Andy Warhol.
About The Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts, Inc.: As the preeminent American artist of the 20th century, Andy Warhol challenged the world to see art differently.
The Andy Warhol Foundation has incurred costs associated with this sale which may be reconciled from the proceeds it receives.', "To offer diehard sneakerheads access to the most coveted pairs, eBay and Sole Collector have joined forces on the biggest sneaker scavenger hunt during ComplexLand.
RAFFLE CLOSEDCLICK HERE for Day Four's (Dec. 10) shoe reveal and clue.
RAFFLE CLOSEDCLICK HERE for Day Three's (Dec. 9) shoe reveal and clue.
RAFFLE CLOSEDCLICK HERE for Day Two's (Dec. 8) shoe reveal and clue.
RAFFLE CLOSEDCLICK HERE for Day One's (Dec. 7) shoe reveal and clue.", 'Adam Canto took items from Buckingham Palace including a medal belonging to Sir Anthony Johnstone-Burt, master of the royal household, rightA member of the Queen’s staff stole medals, signed photographs of the royal family and other items worth up to £100,000 to sell on eBay.
Adamo Canto, 37, was on coronavirus cleaning duties at Buckingham Palace when he stole insignia of the Companion of the Order of the Bath and Commander of the Royal Victorian Order.
At Westminster magistrates’ court yesterday Canto admitted stealing items including signed photos of the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge and a photo album of the banquet during President Trump’s state visit, which he sold for £1,500.
SponsoredThe items were stolen from the royal household and the shop at Buckingham Palace between November 11 last year and August 7, when Canto was arrested.
The former catering assistant, who had worked']

['eBay is giving away what looks to be potentially the best prize packs of 2020.
They’re giving away 24 PS5/Xbox Series X packs (12 of each).
All you need to do is head here and sign up to be an eBay Plus member.
Weirdly enough, those that are an existing eBay Plus member won’t be eligible, so you’ll need to make a new account.
In the Xbox Series X packs, you get a console, a headset, Assassin’s Creed Valhalla, Dirt 5, Call Of Duty: Black Ops Cold War.', 'One thrifty mum-of-three from Exmouth, Devon, managed to pay back £8,500 of debt in four months and she has shared some brilliant tips ahead of the Christmas crunch for familiesSupersaving mum selling items on eBay and Amazon pays off £8,500 debt in four monthsA supersaving mum who paid off £8,500 debt in just four months partly by reselling items on eBay and Amazon has revealed how she did it.
Combined with her saving habits and frugal nature, she managed to wipe out thousands of pounds of debt in just months.
“I try to save up from December to November, when I open the pot to start buying presents for Christmas.
Image: @mummymakesmoney/Jam Press) @mummymakesmoney/Jam Press)As well as paying off her £8,500 debt, Ms Duigan has saved £335 this year and is aiming for £500 saved in 2021.
“I usually make around £80 a month doing this and I use the money to overpay my mortgage."', "It's complete with links to the tools you should definitely not use to cancel scalper eBay listings with very little risk or effort.
No, these are bots that seek to delegitimize aftermarket CPU and GPU sales entirely by making absurdly high bids on gray market listings using burner eBay accounts.
Ultimately, it would populate eBay with so many false buyers on scalper listings that putting items up for resale on the site becomes useless.
The r/AMD post opens with a link to an eBay auction that was derailed with dozens of bids ranging from $10,000 - $70,000.
In this case, the false bids were almost all placed a day before the guide went live.", 'The recent Batman: Three Jokers #3 1:450 variant is a hot item, but was a little easier for stores to get.
"He doesn't care as much for some of the offshoots, but if it's Amazing Spider-Man and there's a variant cover for it, he wants us to get it.
Batman: Three Jokers #3 1:450 variant (Image credit: DC)(opens in new tab)For the Three Jokers 1:450 variant, D'Angelo had willing buyers as well.
End of the line ValiantIn the last column, we mentioned that scarcity sells, and last-issue Milestone Comics issues were selling at some crazy-high rates.
Another part is that the comic book supply may be slowly melting away.', 'In fact, after torture-testing this $163 cheap eBay knock-off of a Garrett GT45 turbo on eight different engine configurations, he's convinced that it's proof that you don't have to spend tons of money to make more power and have some more fun adding a turbo to your car.
Holdener's test included some of the most popular engines to turbocharge: a 2.4-liter Honda K-Series inline-four, and of course, multiple versions of General Motors' ever-present LS V8.
Likewise, backpressure—where there's more exhaust pressure flowing into the turbo than there is boost flowing out—was an issue on the larger engines.
A turbo like this where this simple math exercise works out horsepower results is said to "follow the formula."
When the real version from Garrett typically costs over $2,000, this $163 eBay special is an incredible value.', 'Buying a used sewing machine from a secondhand seller on eBay can be a daunting process to navigate, especially if you’ve not owned a sewing machine before.
While it can be tempting to snap up the first bargain you see online, it’s important to shop smart when it comes to finding a bargain sewing machine on eBay.
Ask the seller for proof of the machine’s sewing ability with an image or video of the sewing machine in action, stitching a piece of fabric.
Ask what’s includedBefore bidding on eBay, have a look at the sewing machine model on the brand’s website.
It will give you some protection as the consumer when it comes to buying your bargain sewing machine on eBay.']

title: ['Camelot Knightmare carts can be bought on eBay for thousands - Lancs Live', 'PS5 stock UK – eBay seller offers console for £1 MILLION as he mocks gamers who failed to pre-order on Am... - The Scottish Sun', 'Scots mum transforms damp-riddled house into dream family home using eBay and IKEA bargains & adds £100k... - The Scottish Sun']
summary:
["We have more newslettersSomething went wrong, please try again later.
Invalid email Something went wrong, please try again later.
Don't miss out - sign up for our free daily newsletter todayIt once entertained millions of visitors looking for a fun day out on weekends and over the holidays, but now Camelot Theme Park lies in ruins.
Those wanting some memorabilia of Camelot are able to purchase the Knightmare carts online.
However, the carts don't come cheap - with them being priced at more than a thousand pounds with a figure of £1,400.", "AN EBAY seller is offering a Playstation 5 for an astonishing £1 million - and they've mocked gamers who failed to pre-order on sites like Amazon before its release.
PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X u2013 when did they launch and how much do they cost?
Both consoles have sold out repeatedly at major retailers Microsoft launched the Xbox Series X and its smaller, cheaper sibling, the Series S, on November 10.
The disc-free Series S costs £249/$299, while the Xbox Series X comes in at £449/$499.
Elsewhere, members of a scalper group - who buy as many of the consoles as possible before selling them for whopping profits - say they bought more than 1,000 newly-launched Xbox Series X consoles.", 'A SCOTS mum has transformed her damp-riddled house into a stunning family home with budget furnishings - adding £100,000 to its market value in the process.
Savvy Lisa Miller, 37, spent £55,000 doing up the four-bedroom Victorian detached house in Cambuslang, Lanarkshire, with thrifty fittings from eBay and IKEA.
Having extensively renovated their previous property in nearby Burnside, the pair were confident they could transform the rundown house into their dream family home.
They picked up bargain furnishings and fittings from eBay, Dunelm, Wayfair, The Range, IKEA and Facebook Marketplace, and also received help from Lisa’s joiner dad Gordon McTaggart, 60.
Mum-of-two Lisa, a business events manager, said: “We finished it last Saturday, pretty much a year to the day since we bought it.']

The seller has only created listings for a little more than 100 hats so far, of a collection of 1,500.
MC Ren, DJ Train and a LA Kings Sports Specialties hat in 1992.
“To me, the Sports Specialties caps’ script represents a special moment in time, when there was this confluence of music, fashion, art and sports,” he tells InsideHook.
The enduring popularity of Sports Specialties hats may speak to the difficulty the headwear industry has had in replicating it.', "The Dark Truth About Buying PS5s On eBayIt's no secret that the current console generation launch has been a spectacle of disappointment, especially for the PlayStation 5.
Since some scalpers purportedly have more PS5 stock than most retailers, you might think buying one of these consoles from eBay is your only option, but if you thought it was safe to trust these hustlers, guess again.
According to Fox 13 of Salt Lake City, an anonymous man in Orem, Utah, ordered a PS5 from eBay for $878.
Of course, the price was higher than the MSRP of $500, but it was still cheaper than the average eBay price of $1000.
It's the least he deserves for gathering concrete evidence of yet another PS5 eBay scam.", 'Wendy Jones is leaving eBay after 17 years with the company.
Among her responsibilities as Senior Vice President of Global Operations was running the Global Security and Resiliency organizations, of which 10 members were referenced in a criminal complaint in June, seven of whom were charged with felonies.
Wendy began her career at eBay in 2003 as Vice President of Customer Service for North America and Australia.
"The eBay security team that allegedly carried out the crimes reported up to Wendy Jones," according to a June 18th article in Vox , which went on to quote an eBay spokesperson.
Since that article appeared, the government charged an additional member of eBay's security team in its ongoing investigation.']

title: ['How Can eBay Offer USPS Tracking for Under a Buck? - EcommerceBytes', 'Australian coupons site offers big discounts at Woolworths, eBay, Amazon and Myer - 7NEWS', 'Man buys PS5 on eBay for $1000 and gets a concrete block in the box - TalkEsport', 'Cartel purchased military equipment through eBay that was smuggled from Los Angeles to Mexico - Daily Mail', 'Jalisco cartel sources its military equipment on eBay - Mexico News Daily', 'eBay supports work placement scheme - Jersey Evening Post']
summary:
['In its announcement, it said eBay standard envelope offered savings up to 70% over USPS First Class Package Service shipping costs, plus includes shipping protection.
We asked the US Postal service for help in understanding how eBay was able to offer sellers such an attractive postal rate.
A spokesperson replied, “It is an eBay envelope, not a USPS envelope.
In the Terms and Conditions page that eBay had inadvertently published last month, eBay referenced its service providers’ terms of service – naming USPS and Easyship.
Graphic shows eBay Standard Envelope dimension limitations published last month but subsequently removed.', 'All you need to do is tap here for savings and offers from all the leading brands and retailers in Australia.
For more Shopping related news and videos check out Shopping >>The site is operated by a team of people who love to find a bargain.
Make huge savings at your favourite stores Credit: AAP and Getty ImagesThey hunt the internet every day for the best available deals and post them into one easy-to-use convenient place.
The site contains over 2,000 brands from all of your favourite stores in Australia and is an impartial service.
For Christmas, savings tap here.', 'With Christmas right around the corner, the demand for the PS5 is touching new highs every day.
Due to exceptional demand and no sign of an increase in supply, many are left with no option other than contacting a second-hand seller on sites like eBay.
The worst thing about this incident is that the man paid almost $1,000 on this piece of brick that hardly costs a dollar.
Recently another case of fraud where sellers who were trying to sell PS5 pictures instead of the consoles had angered eBay.
eBay released a statement at the end of November saying:We condemn these opportunistic sellers who are attempting to mislead other users.', 'A transnational Mexican drug cartel reportedly made at least 300 military equipment purchases on eBay between 2018 and 2019.
The military instruments were shipped to Los Angeles and then mailed across the border to Jalisco and later provided to cartel membersThe DEA and FBI said the cartel employed two siblings who were in charge of purchasing the military equipment and parts on eBay.
The military equipment and parts for the rifles and machine guns were allegedly sold off to the cartel members by Carlos Almada.
Milenio reported that it was highly likely that the high-tech military equipment and weapon parts have been used by the notorious cartel in numerous criminal acts that have destabilized Mexico.
According to Infobae, the Jalisco New Generation Cartel is responsible for 10,000 of the 29,182 homicides reported in the first 10 months of 2020.', 'Cartel members in Mexico don’t just buy gun parts and tactical equipment from illegal arms traffickers – they also shop online.
An investigation by the United States government found that the Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG) purchased military equipment on eBay between 2018 and 2019 and had it shipped to Mexico from the U.S. by courier companies.
The brothers Ismael and Carlos Almada Castrillo were in charge of the CJNG’s eBay equipment acquisitions scheme, the newspaper Milenio reported.
U.S. authorities detected that Carlos Almada used about 50 PayPal accounts to conceal his identity while he purchased gun parts and tactical equipment on eBay.
According to Mary Lacis, an FBI and DEA agent, other cartels might be using courier services to send gun parts, equipment and cash to Mexico.', 'Online giant eBay is teaming up with business leaders to help support up to 1,000 small companies provide new work placements for young people.
The move is part of the Government’s Kickstart scheme, which launched earlier this year to support firms to offer six-month work placements to 16-24 year olds who are in receipt of Universal Credit and at risk of long-term unemployment.
eBay will also offer training to improve firms’ e-commerce and digital skills.
Head of eBay Europe Rob Hattrell said: “This new initiative recognises that the UK’s small businesses account for 60% of private sector employment in the UK, and have a vital role to play in our economic recovery supporting jobs, growth, and exports.
“Thanks to the partnership created between eBay, FSB and Adecco, small businesses will be at the heart of this collective effort, helping to kickstart our economy and the careers of thousands of young people.”']

summary:
['This week's ComplexLand digital event is filled with sneaker happenings—there are exclusive pairs to buy and even some free footwear to win.
Every pair will include eBay's new Authenticity Guarantee, which provides free, third-party authentication to ensure each sneaker is legitimate.
For Thursday, eBay is giving away a limited number of pairs of "Zebra" Adidas Yeezy 350 Boost V2s.
Answer the trivia question right and be entered to win a pair of the sneakers for free.
This Yeezy lyric hint will be a huge help in entering to win one of the free pairs from eBay.', '', 'Posts 1 to 3 of 3Please login or sign up to reply to this topic', '', "investigation has found Amazon.com, eBay and Wish all selling dangerous products that have been recalled Europe-wide.
is calling on the government to make online marketplaces legally responsible for stopping dangerous products from being sold on their sites, so consumers aren't at risk of buying dangerous products from third-party sellers.
Dangerous recalled products continue to be listedWe checked Safety Gate, the European Commission's database of recalled products, in September 2020 and then searched to see whether any recalled products were still for sale.
Clearly Wish felt that a dangerous recalled item didn't merit urgent investigation as, nearly a month later, the listing remained live.

Or does it fall in the category of urban myth?', 'Thomas landed on a scheme to siphon off unused new tyres that were due to be returned to the manufacturer.
Alec Small, for Waugh, told the court his client was of effective good character, with one unrelated driving matter on his record.
Thomas received 18 months’ imprisonment suspended for 18 months, with 180 hours of unpaid work and 25 rehabilitation activity requirement days.
Waugh was given eight months suspended for a year-and-a-half.
Recorder Power told the two who received suspended sentences: “These are sentences on trust in the hope that you will not be back before this court again.”']

title: ['FDA Issues Warning after Shopping on eBay and Amazon - EcommerceBytes', 'How eBay, Walmart Approach Test Automation - ARC', 'Former eBay and StubHub Exec Lauren St. Clair Joins NerdWallet ... - PR Newswire', "EBay joker lists bottle of 'natural and unpasteurised' murky water from Edinburgh river for £75 - Daily Record", 'Victorian-era photograph of Aaron Rodgers lookalike sells on eBay - theScore']
summary:

The Food and Drug Administration said it found the male enhancement and weight loss products in its warning contained hidden ingredients that might pose a significant health risk.
“The FDA purchased these products on Amazon and eBay and agency testing found that the products contain active pharmaceutical ingredients not listed on their labels, including some with ingredients found in prescription drugs.
“In general, these products are unapproved new drugs and/or adulterated dietary supplements.
In addition, they are misbranded because their labels do not accurately reflect their ingredients.”You can find the full press release on the FDA.gov website.', "At eBay, Rentachintala is responsible for all aspects of quality engineering within the buyer experience group, including test automation, environments and strategy.
In this blog post, learn how Rentachintala and Tang approach test automation at eBay and Walmart, respectively, particularly around test coverage, metrics and shifting testing to the left.

Test coverage and code coverage are two of those many test automation metrics.
So that's where we find maximum value.”In addition to test automation, Tang and Rentachintala also discussed test data and accessibility.", 'SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 17, 2020 /PRNewswire/ -- NerdWallet, a website and app that provides financial guidance to more than 100 million consumers every year, welcomes Lauren St. Clair as its new Chief Financial Officer (CFO).
As the new CFO of NerdWallet, St. Clair will lead the company's financial operations, bringing her experience in financial planning, investor relations and business acquisitions to help continue the company's rapid growth and international expansion.
"I am unbelievably impressed with the fantastic business and solid financials behind NerdWallet, as well as the thoughtfulness, humility, and maturity of my future colleagues," said St. Clair, CFO at NerdWallet.
St. Clair brings more than 18 years of experience working in finance at both startups and multi-national corporations.
Prior to eBay, St. Clair was CFO at StubHub International where she directed all financial forecasting and reporting processes for the company.', 'We have more newslettersSomething went wrong, please try again later.
