['eBay sale of Salamis marble prevented - Financial Mirror', 'Auction for Nvidia RTX 3080 on eBay Is Actually For a Hunk of Ugly ... - PCMag', "Mum Threatens To 'List Kids On eBay' After They Cover Brand New £1,000 Leather Sofas In Talcum Powder. - Tyla", 'eBay Kicks off Month-Long Celebration of (Female) Sneakerheads - PR Newswire', 'Fake 50p Kew Gardens coins flooding eBay and duping coin collectors out of cash – how to spot a real one... - The Sun']
summary:
['A Russian collector attempting to sell on eBay a piece of Cyprus cultural heritage, marble from the ancient ruins of Salamis in Turkish-occupied Famagusta, was stopped by an activist.
Through her organization Walk of Truth, based in the Hague, Netherlands, Hatzitofi obtained a license to prevent any antiquities from being sold on eBay.
Salamis holds cultural and political resonance on the island due to its history and decades-long division.
Hatzitofi asked eBay to withdraw the specific marble piece from the auction and bring her in contact with the collector who was auctioning it.
“Our goal is to find out when and how this piece of marble was removed from Salamis …who the smuggler is.', "(Credit: Nvidia)If you’re desperate to own an Nvidia RTX 3080 graphics card, then you might be on eBay looking to buy from a third-party seller.
The seller “risky_ricky” has been promoting(Opens in a new window) the eBay auction with a main image for a seemingly-real RTX 3080.
The title for the product also says “NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3080 Founder's Edition,” without mentioning it’s merely a replica.
The secondary images for the auction also reveal the product is a cheap-looking, low quality copy of an RTX 3080.
Interestingly, the auction for the 3D printed RTX 3080 began at $0.99 on Sunday.", 'A mum-of-three saw her patience severely tested after her children daubed her entire living room and brand-new £1,000 sofas in talcum powder.
The talc almost ruined the brand new sofas (Credit: Kennedy News Media)She is now jokingly threatening to sell her kids on eBay and has banned talc from her house to avoid any "snow blizzards" in the future.
The cheeky duo look as if butter wouldn't melt (Credit: Kennedy News Media)"I was sat at my desk doing some work and I hear 'Mummy, Soren's had the talcum powder'.
"I'm pretty sure Soren started it all," she added.
I asked what she meant and she said 'Soren, started it.'"', 'The initiative focuses on the fastest growing - yet frequently under-served - community of female sneaker collectors and enthusiasts in an estimated 80-billion-dollar market.
To kick off the month-long initiative, eBay has collaborated with Esther Wallace, founder of Playa Society , to launch limited-edition Female Sneakerhead merchandise - a new line developed to spark a cultural conversation about women and sneakers.
eBay x Playa Society Female Sneaker ShopWith her Female Athlete merchandise line, Esther Wallace's Playa Society has created an iconic and recognizable symbol in sports.
For this event, she created a custom extension of the line, Female Sneakerhead, which celebrates the rising prominence of women in the sneakerhead community.
Yet inclusivity and visibility for women is sometimes missing from the culture," said Esther Wallace, Playa Society founder.', 'COIN hunters are being warned to watch out for scammers selling fake Kew Gardens 50ps on eBay.
5 Here is what a genuine Kew Gardens coin looks likeCollectors pay up to £400 for genuine Kew Gardens 50ps on eBay - 800 times its face value - and there are often hundreds of them listed.
According to experts at change checking website Coin Hunter, the Kew Gardens 50p sells for £156 on average on eBay.
How do you spot fake Kew Gardens 50ps?
There are many different ways to spot a fake Kew Gardens 50p.']

title: ['eBay India signs MoU with GJEPC, to reach 300 manufacturing hubs of gems and jewellery in India - CNBCTV18', "2014-Era GTX 970 Emerges as Value GPU on eBay During Shortage - Tom's Hardware", "eBay Targets Female ‘Sneakerheads’ In Today's Red-Hot Shoe Trend - PYMNTS.com", 'Mum threatens to put kids on eBay after they redecorate house with talcum powder - The Mirror', 'Paige Spiranac laughs off troll who brands her ‘eBay Margot Robbie’ as online auction website leaps to her... - The Sun', 'eBay and Adevinta offer to sell UK classifieds sites to win approval ... - Financial Times', 'Why is eBay Bucks ending? Company unveils new reward program! - HITC - Football, Gaming, Movies, TV, Music', 'Ultimate Lionel Messi Rookie Card Guide, 100 Hottest eBay Auctions - Sports Collectors Daily', 'Prices of scrapped Dr. Seuss books skyrocket on eBay - New York Post', "Fake RTX 3000-series eBay listings claim they're targeting bots, but ... - TechSpot"]
summary:
['eBay India recently tied up with Gems and Jewellery Export Promotion Council (GJEPC).
E-Commerce numbers as far as the jewellery sales and exports have been quite positive.
Naini said it also provides a collaboration where eBay provides the technical know-how, market insights and the policies of how to sell to the world.
This collaboration also enables eBay to reach all the 300 manufacturing hubs of gems and jewellery in India.
In terms of E-Commerce platform and retail market, he said, “Growth in the E-Commerce has been robust.', '(Image credit: Tom's Hardware)Our GPU pricing index shows just how overpriced the latest graphics cards are, if you're even willing to bother with eBay.
The winner, as you've no doubt guessed from the headline, was Nvidia's relatively ancient GTX 970 card from late 2014.
The GTX 970 sports the Maxwell architecture, with 5.2 billion transistors fabricated on TSMC's 28nm high-performance node.
Not surprisingly, the 3060 Ti is over three times as fast as the GTX 970.
So how is the GTX 970 the "best value" on eBay?', '', 'Image: Kennedy News and Media) Kennedy News and Media)"It's funny because I have been threatening to sell them on eBay jokingly and now I think it's about time I create the ad."
Image: Kennedy News and Media) Kennedy News and Media)"We just walked really slowly into the lounge.
Image: Kennedy News and Media) Kennedy News and Media)"It was even on my lampshade and at the top of my curtains.
After a bit of detective work, Bronwyn was quick to give up her sibling, insisting to her mum that "Sorin started it".
One mum wrote: "Ahh you've cheered me up so much, I really thought it was only my kids who owned the ability to trash our house."', 'FORMER golfer Paige Spiranac found the funny side after a fan told her she looks like a version of Margot Robbie 'off Ebay.'
And it even earned a compliment from the online auction site as they leaped to her defence.
But Spiranac is not exempt from social media trolls who have cruelly targeted her appearance in the past.
However this time she could afford to laugh at her own expense when she wrote on Twitter: "Someone just said I look like Margot Robbie ordered off of eBay.
When one fan questioned what it meant, she replied: "I look like the ugly version of Margot Robbie."', 'During your trial you will have complete digital access to FT.com with everything in both of our Standard Digital and Premium Digital packages.
Standard Digital includes access to a wealth of global news, analysis and expert opinion.
Premium Digital includes access to our premier business column, Lex, as well as 15 curated newsletters covering key business themes with original, in-depth reporting.
You may also opt to downgrade to Standard Digital, a robust journalistic offering that fulfils many user’s needs.
Compare Standard and Premium Digital here.', 'People have reacted to the news that eBay Bucks is ending.
eBay Bucks is designed to reward eBay members for buying items on the website.
So, why is eBay Bucks ending?
Why is eBay Bucks ending?
The eBay Bucks reward program is ending on April 1st, 2021 and customers can receive their 1% earnings up until this date.', '', 'The prices of six Dr. Seuss titles exploded on eBay after the beloved author’s publisher said it would stop selling them because they contained racist images.
Prospective buyers placed bids in the hundreds of dollars Tuesday for vintage copies of the books that were listed for as little as $4.44 over the past week.
Dr Seuss (Theodor Seuss Geisel, 1904 – 1991) sits at his drafting table in his home office with a copy of his book, ‘The Cat in the Hat’, La Jolla, California, April 25, 1957.
A copy of “The Cat’s Quizzer” from 1976 similarly saw its top offer skyrocket to $510 after it was listed for $9.99 on Monday.
All six books were also in short supply on Amazon, where third-party sellers are selling collectible editions for thousands of dollars.', 'Facepalm: As everyone who's desperate for an RTX 3000-series card knows, pretty much the only way of getting one right now is to pay an obscene amount on eBay.
There are numerous RTX 3080/3090 cards on eBay selling under their MSRPs, but it should go without saying that buying one will lead to disappointment; most are for nothing more than images of the products.
What's different with a lot of the graphics card listings is that they warn people not to buy, claiming to be a trap set for bots.
PCMag notes one person selling an "NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3080 Founder's Edition," though the description reveals it's a "New 3D PRINTED PLASTIC MODEL."
If you are willing to buy an RTX 3080 on eBay, expect to pay more than $1,000 for the real thing---and make sure to read the description.']

How To Avoid Getting Scammed - International Business Times', "eBay Raises Fees - It's Complicated - EcommerceBytes", 'eBay Randomly Tells Buyers Seller Does Not Ship to Their Location - EcommerceBytes']
summary:
['First NameLast NameEmail: *Post Code*Subscribe to our email bulletins:Pro Bono Careers | Purpose-driven job alerts & career news.
Sent every Monday and Friday morning.
Accompanied by the latest careers news, including Changemakers and who’s moving where in the sector, you’ll never be out of touch with career developments within the sector.
Pro Bono Resources | Sector specific professional tools & webinar updates.
Get notifications on the latest webinar topics, as well as other Pro Bono Australia professional development resources.', '', 'eBay is raising commission fees, but it buried the news in the Spring Seller Update announcement on Wednesday.
It's also complicated for sellers to determine exactly how the new fees will impact their bottom line.
A year ago, eBay made a major change to the way it charged sellers enrolled in Managed Payments, melding together commission fees and payment processing fees into a single Final Value Fee.
At the time, eBay executive Brian Burke told sellers that under change to the Managed Payments fee structure, "most sellers can expect to see overall savings."
Another change introduced in the 2021 eBay Spring Seller Update: no more credits for sellers to put towards Promoted Listing ads.', 'Dear Ina,There's a problem with eBay - ongoing.
Customer Service Rep confirms reports from all over.
Buyers getting "Seller does not ship to your location" notice when trying to purchase.
I have gotten EIGHT emails from buyers with this problem., eBay CS says for buyer to contact eBay and they will take info so that buyer can purchase.
This has been happening on and off for three weeks.']

summary:
['Marcus started selling toys and then moved into home appliances, desks and gym equipment.
Photo / SuppliedStill in high school, 16-year-old Marcus Pereira managed to make A$60,000 in just a month during a Covid lockdown.
He made the money by spotting popular household items online, marking them up and then reselling them on eBay.
Marcus started selling toys and then moved into home appliances, desks and gym equipment by buying from retailers or wholesalers, marking up the price and reselling the items on his eBay store.
Still in high school, 16-year-old Marcus Pereira managed to make $60,000 in just a month.', '', "Invalid email Something went wrong, please try again later.
eBay users are putting selected commemorative versions of the coins up for sale and asking for millions of pounds.
(Image: ebay)Beatrix Potter coins are another 'must have' it seems, with certain characters being listed on eBay for £5 million, including Mr Jeremy Fisher.
The first Beatrix Potter 50p coins were released in 2016 to mark 150 years since the famous writer and illustrator's birth.
At the top of the list for mintage figures though is 2009 Kew Gardens 50p coin - of which only 210,000 where minted.", 'A piece of the now ruined West Pier is available on the online marketplace for a "buy it now" price of £850.
A surviving column that once stood as part of the famous Brighton West Pier since 1866.
The West Pier Trust website states: "We are restoring an original octagonal 1866 pier kiosk to reinstate on Brighton seafront close to its original site.
"To raise funds, we are selling West Pier fragments and artefacts.
The West Pier in 1997"While there is nothing at all to suggest that the sale of West Pier artefacts is improper, it does highlight the suspicion that the public has," he said.', 'In case you haven’t spotted it already, the term ‘Certified Refurbished’ has been gradually appearing across eBay’s platform.
In the hierarchy of refurbished products, Certified Refurbished sits at the top, letting you know that you’ll be receiving a high-quality item in good working condition.
Can I return Certified Refurbished products?
Unlike Manufacturer Refurbished, Seller Refurbished will not be going anywhere for the time being.
If you want to keep reading about Certified Refurbished, Seller Refurbished or more, then check out Trusted Reviews’ guide on buying refurbished products.', '', '"He did resign, but it was very much a case of jumping before he was pushed.
He is working for himself.
He is genuinely remorseful."', '']

title: ['Darkhold First Appearance, Marvel Spotlight #4 Sells For $500 On ... - Bleeding Cool News', 'EBay removes listings for ‘banned’ Dr. Seuss books - Fortune', 'eBay removing Dr. Seuss books discontinued over racist imagery - Business Insider', 'Embarrassed husband lays green carpet instead of astro turf in garden - Express']
summary:
['', 'It’s about to get even harder to find one of the six Dr. Seuss books the writer’s estate has pulled from publication.
EBay says it will not allow the resale of the books on its marketplace.
The online auction site is delisting attempts to sell the books, according to the Wall Street Journal.
The eBay listings for the Dr. Seuss books that have not yet been removed are gathering a lot of interest.
Before he was famous, Dr. Seuss drew a number of exceptionally racist images and ads, although later in his life, he expressed regret over these early images.', 'eBay told The Wall Street Journal that it was scrubbing its site of six Dr. Seuss books the author's estate pulled this week.
books the author's estate pulled this week.
On Tuesday, Dr. Seuss Enterprises, which manages the catalog of Theodor Seuss Geisel, also known as Dr. Seuss, told Insider's Rachel E. Greenspan in a statement that '"Ceasing sales of these books is only part of our commitment and our broader plan to ensure Dr. Seuss Enterprises's catalog represents and supports all communities and families."
Dr. Seuss Enterprises' announcement of the decision spurred right-wing backlash decrying "cancel culture."
Forbes reported that second-hand copies of the books shot up in price, and several of Dr. Seuss' other books climbed the bestseller charts on Amazon.', 'Pauline 'didn't have the heart' to tell her husband to get rid it after he unveiled his hard workAndy Tremble, 61, shocked wife Pauline, 54, after rolling out the material at their home.
Pauline noticed it was as "rough as sandpaper" and feared someone might 'lose half a leg' if they fell on it.
"I don't have the heart to tell him to lift it, he was so pleased with himself until he saw my face," Pauline told the Daily Record.
"It's probably listed as astro turf but you can see the colour of it, no grass is that shade.
"You would lose half your leg if you fell on it, it's as rough as sandpaper."']

title: ['Cleveland Browns throwback jerseys may have leaked on eBay - Dawgs By Nature', 'eBay Sellers Surprised by International Fee on US Orders - EcommerceBytes']
summary:
["The Cleveland Browns will celebrate their 75th anniversary this fall and part of that celebration will include a throwback jersey.
And that is just what the Browns might be doing if a leak on eBay from a user named originaljersey81 is to be believed.
It looks like another NFL uniform has been leaked.
This time, it's Cleveland's 1946 throwback jersey.
Johnson announced that the Browns would be wearing throwbacks, but did not reveal a date when the jerseys would be revealed.", 'We are starting to get more reports from sellers that eBay is charging them an "International Fee" for some domestic shipments, and eBay reps are giving sellers inconsistent responses when they inquire.
"The seller should NOT be charged this fee especially when the seller's account is set to no International Shipping.
One seller told us that two of his sales in February going to US addresses incurred an international fee.
eBay sellers should keep an eye on this," he said.
As far as we know, there is no way to block an international buyer from making a purchase if they provide a domestic shipping address.']

title: ["San Francisco 49ers' 1994 Throwback Uniform Leaked On eBay - SportsLogos.Net News", 'Bengals new uniforms get leaked on eBay, and they are still ugly - Behind The Steel Curtain', 'eBay Changes How to Deal with Deadbeat Buyers - EcommerceBytes', 'Super Mario 3D World + Bowser’s Fury Will Be 51% Off On eBay Today - Press Start Australia']
summary:
['Just like they have for the last three seasons, the San Francisco 49ers will once again wear 1994 throwback uniforms this fall.
The throwback jersey briefly appeared on eBay via user “originaljersey81,” the same person whose listings included the Cincinnati Bengals’ new jerseys and the Cleveland Browns’ 1946 throwback jersey.
When it comes to the 49ers, the throwback uniforms were originally worn in 1994 as part of the NFL’s league-wide celebration of its 75th season.
The scarlet jerseys feature white numbers with a black drop shadow, as well as three white stripes on both sleeves.
Photos courtesy of originaljersey81 on eBay.', 'The Bengals’ uniforms have long been considered one of the worst in the NFL, mainly due to the panther striped helmets.
NFL teams like to keep their new jerseys on the down low until closer to the NFL Draft, but these uniforms were leaked in the most Bengals way ever.
Did the Bengals new uniforms just get leaked via eBay?
Fans of the Pittsburgh Steelers should be happy their team’s uniforms have been relatively unchanged for decades.
What do you think of the Bengals’ leaked uniforms?', 'Here’s how eBay explains the new process of dealing with deadbeats:“Starting in early April 2021, we’ll begin introducing a new cancel function for unpaid items.
You’ll no longer have to file unpaid item claims or send payment reminders.
The announcement includes the following FAQ:“Can I handle unpaid items manually?
“If you would like to handle unpaid items manually, you can do so by changing your “Preferences for items awaiting payment” at any time.
You can stop purchases from buyers with more than two unpaid item cancellations using your “Buyer management” preferences.', 'eBay Tuesdays are back for another week tomorrow and tomorrow’s deal is a good one.
eBay Plus members will be able to get Super Mario 3D World + Bowser’s Fury for a ridiculous $39 (51% off).
For a game that came out a few weeks ago, this is a great deal.
You’ll need to be an eBay Plus member (30 day free trial here) and head to this page at 10am and 2pm AEDT to take advantage of the deal.
We’ll keep you posted about more eBay Tuesday deals as they hit in the coming weeks.']

title: ['Katie Price slams eBay seller who made thousands selling items ... -  FM104', 'Second-Hand NFT Market for NBA Top Shot Packs Appears on eBay - Cryptonews', "eBay Says Interest in Women's Sports Cards on the Rise - Sports Collectors Daily"]
summary:
['Image via GettyKatie Price has slammed an eBay seller who has reportedly made thousands of pounds selling items mocking her son.
The air fresheners were reportedly being sold for £2.99 each and had almost 1000 purchases.
Tom Purser, Head of Campaigns at the National Autistic Society, added: "Many autistic people and families will be upset and disappointed to see Harvey and Greta treated this way.
Tyla report that the eBay seller also had car air fresheners which mocked 18-year-old climate change activist Greta Thunberg - who has asperger syndrome.
An eBay spokesperson said: "Offensive listings of this nature have no place on eBay.', 'Second-Hand NFT Market for NBA Top Shot Packs Appears on eBayListings for NBA Top Shots have begun appearing on the major eBay marketplace, as holders of the blockchain-based collectibles look to profit from the surging interest in non-fungible tokens (NFTs).
Officially, packs start from USD 9 and rise to USD 230 in the case of 2020 NBA Finals packs (as well as other special packs).
This jump in price is in keeping with the similarly impressive jump in interest NFTs are currently receiving.
With regards to the second-hand marketplace for NBA Top Shot packs, commentators have already pointed out that you can’t actually send unopened packs via NBA Top Shot itself.
Regardless, the seemingly contagious interest in NFTs still might last for some time, if the eBay market for NBA Top Shot packs is anything to go by.', '']

title: ["eBay Standard Envelope Doesn't Deliver on Its Promise - EcommerceBytes", 'Dad scammed on eBay after paying £9,200 for caravan to take daughter on holiday - Liverpool Echo', 'Sold-out M&S Easter Percy Pig toys are being sold on eBay for triple the price - The Mirror']
summary:
['Kudos to eBay for trying to solve a problem for sellers with a unique approach - the eBay Standard Envelope.
eBay Standard Envelope is an "affordable shipping service for trading cards up to $20" that promises to give buyers and sellers the ability to track packages.
The eBay Standard Envelope option promises tracking - but it only allows the buyer and the seller to track such items - and only through the eBay website.
During Wednesday's eBay weekly chat on March 10 , a participant asked about the relatively new shipping option: "Could you explain how tracking works with the new eBay Standard Envelope?
The eBay moderator did some digging and pasted what they found:"Tracking for eBay Standard Envelope is an agreement set up with several of our partners.', 'Invalid email Something went wrong, please try again later.

Paul Simms bought a caravan on eBay last March so that he could take his ten-year-old autistic daughter on holiday to north Wales.
After the transaction went through the seller, who used the eBay id redchelle14, messaged the family on March 22.
“Anyone who is concerned they have been a victim of fraud should get in touch with eBay customer services immediately and report the incident to Action Fraud.”', 'M&S has confirmed the Easter Bunny Percy Pig will be re-stocked (it is available to pre-order now online) and will also be available in stores.
The Marks and Spencer website also has an abundance of Percy Pig Easter themed gifts still available online - including an Easter Egg Hunt with Percy Pig kit (£30), Easter Percy Pig Gift Bag (£30) and Percy Pig and Colin the Caterpillar Easter Eggs (£10).
Should you want to treat members of your family to a Percy Pig treat, M&S has launched a 1kg jar of original Percy Pig sweets, which includes his rabbit friends too.
Percy Pig is arguably one of the most iconic brands within M&S and growing in popularity by the day - sales of all things Percy Pig shot up by 40% in 2020.
Did you manage to get your hands on an Easter Bunny version of Percy Pig this morning?']

title: ['eBay Sellers Stymied as Drafts Listing Function Fails - EcommerceBytes']
summary:
['eBay sellers say a technical issue that impacts their ability to list is wasting their time, and they are having difficulties reporting the issue to eBay customer service.
One seller told EcommerceBytes that the copy feature of the drafts page on eBay hasn't functioned since Wednesday.
The issue impacts sellers who are not using a third-party listing tool.
"TurboLister was a much better option than the Drafts page," the seller told us.
"The "copy drafts" function will not work, and the normal workarounds such as refreshing the page will not work either," he said.']

title: ['Some eBay Sellers Confused over New Page Design - EcommerceBytes', 'Mother to Earth: When an NES prototype lands on eBay and inspires a documentary - Ars Technica']
summary:
['eBay is migrating sellers who use the classic “All Selling” page to the new version in Seller Hub.
“Today I was bumped into a new page view for sellers,” one seller wrote.
You’ll find the overview of all your active, sold and unsold listings as well as your drafts on the new ‘All Selling’ page in Seller Hub.
If you’re currently still using the ‘All Selling’ page in My eBay, the migration to this new page will happen gradually over the course of the coming weeks.
You can expect to be automatically redirected when your account is ready to use the new ‘All Selling’ page in Seller Hub.', '(Disclosure: I once backed a Kickstarter documentary about a group of friends traveling to see LCD Soundsystem play "All My Friends," because...
On paper, Mother to Earth sounds like it belongs among the '50s, not the ones.
It's a video game documentary not about Earthbound, not about the franchise that game belongs to (the Mother trilogy), and not even about the original release in the trilogy that inspires the documentary name.
AdvertisementTo put it bluntly, Mother to Earth is the kind of documentary you almost can't believe exists.
The topic may be narrow, but Mother to Earth explores every facet of it in just over 90 minutes.']

title: ['Seller Sues eBay in Federal Court for Double Taxation - EcommerceBytes', 'Bargain Alert: Nintendo Switch consoles 20% off with eBay’s AfterPay Sale - Vooks']
summary:
['Alexander Gifford filed a federal lawsuit against eBay Inc. on Wednesday.
The imposition of taxes again on the same asset at two different points of time would actually be the definition of double taxation.
EBay, Inc. is collecting taxes on used assets which at the time of original point of sale a tax was collected, hence, the causation of this lawsuit.
An EBay fee, a transaction fee, a sales tax, and then increased shipping costs makes the argument that something is awry and needs correction.
“Attempting to make up deficits through a taxation without adequate representation starts to sound like a constitutional crisis.”Gifford v. eBay, Inc. was filed in Eastern Michigan District Court, case 2:21-mc-50359.', 'AdvertisementIt’s been a long time since we’ve seen some heavy discounts on Nintendo Switch consoles, for obvious reasons.
Now while these deals require the use of AfterPay through eBay, it’s cheap enough to be worth it.
The normal Neon and Grey Switch consoles, ones with Mario Kart included, the Red and Blue Mario Edition.
Even the Monster Hunter Rise console are all discounted.

title: ['Some eBay Sellers Are Unable to List New Items - EcommerceBytes', 'Police warn over scam targeting sellers on Gumtree, Facebook and ... - Surrey Live', 'Man buys Great Yarmouth Pleasure Beach log flume for £140 on eBay - Eastern Daily Press']
summary:
['We noticed several threads on the eBay discussion boards from sellers who are unable to list new items.
According to reports, when sellers attempt to list new items, they get an "unresponsive page" notice.
The following threads are from sellers experiencing the "unresponsive page" listing glitch:1) "cannot list new items" (shastasvintage) 03-20-2021 07:15 PM"I have been trying all evening to list new items and I get a totally unresponsive page.
( Message 1 of 62) "Can't list new items" (tommytreasure) ‎03-20-2021 10:41 PM"As of 3-20-21 I can't list new items.
(dapperdude) ‎03-21-2021 12:02 PM"I can't list new items.', 'Something went wrong, please try again later.
Invalid email Something went wrong, please try again later.
People selling goods on Facebook, Gumtree and eBay are being targetted by scammers - especially people selling high-value items such as watches and mobile phones.
West Midlands Police has warned sellers to check their online banking via a computer or phone their bank to confirm the payment is complete before handing over items.
“Anyone selling goods online should check with their banks that any payments have cleared their accounts before handing over goods.', 'Jason Lawrance, a 28-year-old Lidl warehouse operative from Durham, has visited the attraction on Great Yarmouth's Golden Mile for decades.
Inspired by the man's craftiness, Mr Lawrance tracked down a vintage seller on eBay who happened to have eight Great Yarmouth Pleasure Beach log flumes for sale down in Margate, Kent.
His "cheeky bid" of £140 was accepted, and the flume began the journey from one end of the country to the other.
Explaining why the Pleasure Beach flumes were in Kent in the first place, owner Albert Jones explained he had sold some spare models to the Margate-based amusement park Dreamland years ago.
"We're going to decorate it so it looks exactly like the Pleasure Beach flumes as they are now.']

title: ['Pepe Le Pew Controversy Leads to Unexpected eBay Effect - PopCulture.com', 'Green Deals: WORX outdoor electric lawn tools extra 15% off at ... - Electrek', 'eBay Encourages Buyers to Use Credit Cards and not PayPal - EcommerceBytes', "eBay's UI Framework Marko Adds Optimized Reactivity Model - Q&A ... - InfoQ.com"]
summary:
["✖The controversy surrounding Looney Tunes' Pepe Le Pew has had a surprising impact on the secondhand comic book market.
That means that obscure old comic books featuring Pepe are now selling for exorbitant prices.
According to a report by Bleeding Cool, this comic book was going for $2 on eBay until the controversy hit.
Copies of 1961's Looney Tunes #240 have sold for as high as $81, while 1990's Looney Tunes #9 sold for $90 — up from its $4 price the previous week.
As the bids have risen, so have the asking price — a copy of 2010's Looney Tunes #193 was spotted with a $142 price tag on eBay.", 'WORX via eBay Daily Deals is offering a selection of its electric lawn tools and more at an additional 15% off when you use the code PAYLESS15 at checkout.
Head below for more deals on smart sprinkler controllers, HomeKit thermostats, and of course Electrek’s best EV buying and leasing deals.
Amazon is currently offering the 8-zone Rachio 3 Smart HomeKit Sprinkler Controller for $175.28 shipped.
Normally selling for $230, you’re saving 24% here with today’s offer marking the best we’ve seen since September and coming within $1 of our previous mention.
Today only, Woot offers the ecobee4 Smart HomeKit Themostat for $149.99 with free shipping for Prime members.', 'eBay is running a promotion encouraging buyers to use credit cards to pay.
A reader brought it to our attention, noting that when they placed an order, eBay displayed a coupon offer at checkout called “YOUSAVETEN.”What’s unusual is that the reader saw the offer after they had already hit the buy button – the promotion was displayed during checkout.
Initially the reader was uncertain why eBay was offering a discount, but then, they said, they found the catch – “A buyer must use their credit or debit card to make the purchase – no PayPal.”The popup box read “Get $10 off when you spend $30 or more using your credit or debit card.
Remember it for faster checkout.”“Always an angle with eBay,” they said.
On SlickDeals, eBay users reported seeing the offer as early as March 19 and said it runs through the 26th.', 'Key Takeaways The Marko web application framework, which powers the majority of eBay.com, focuses heavily on performance.
Marko continues today to be heavily used at eBay, which currently employs most of the core members of the Marko team.
InfoQ interviewed Ryan Carniato, Michael Rawlings, and Dylan Piercey, members of the Marko development team, on the new Marko 5 release, Marko’s roadmap, and their vision of front-end development.
On top of that, Babel has a well-established API for writing plugins, which Marko has adopted to make extending the Marko compiler easier.
Finally, Marko’s server rendering performance makes it well suited for Edge computing.']

summary:
["Taco Bell fans are as loyal as they come… and apparently, they really, really love the fast-food chain's hot sauce.
Taco Bell hot sauce packets—either sold as individual packets or in bulk—are selling for ridiculous prices on eBay, according to Fox News.
If you give me money for it I'll probably go to Taco Bell more often tbh.
Make your wildest dreams come true with these LIMITED Edition Taco Bell hot sauce packets.
taco bell hot sauce packetsPeople have taken to Reddit to ask why this trend is even happening, and what about these hot sauce packets deem that they should be sold as opposed to simply collected from Taco Bell for free.", "SEOUL -- A wide bidding war could erupt over eBay Korea, with South Korea's smaller e-commerce platforms seeing the purchase of the country's third-ranked player as their best hope to survive against the two leaders.

Here's Why Sellers Hate It - EcommerceBytes", 'EBay, Etsy, Mercari, OfferUp, Poshmark Announce PASS Coalition - Yahoo Finance', "Shop with confidence for your high-end timepiece through eBay's Authenticity Guarantee - CNN"]
summary:
['Advertiser Disclosure: At Slickdeals, we work hard to find the best deals.
As more and more shoppers turn to marketplace vendors and third-party resellers in favor of major retailers, eBay has experienced a surprising renaissance.
Here are a few popular retailers who maintain an eBay storefront:1. adidasadidas ebayWhile there is some overlap, the adidas eBay store does not represent the full breadth of the apparel retailer’s selection.
Shop Newegg on eBayRather than acting as an outlet or standalone shop, Newegg’s eBay store acts as an extension of its home site.
SweetwaterSweetwater ebaySweetwater, widely beloved audio equipment retailer, has maintained an eBay store for the entirety of its e-commerce career.', 'On top of lowering prices per card sale to U.S. sellers with 1$ USD shipping, eBay has once again introduced a new system to make TCG sales more convenient.
With the continued surge in trading cards on eBay, with stats like 125 trading card listed/98 cards sold per minute, eBay is looking to up its numbers while cutting listing times in half.
This new function is part of the eBay mobile app and lets users scan their trading cards where they will be processed on a listing directly.
This tool will be available to all Magic: The Gathering cards first with both Pokémon and Yu-Gi-Oh!
2 Trainer PSA 9 MINT ($110,100)In other TCG news, KFC Indonesia is the latest fast-food chain to succumb to the Pokémon TCG craze.', 'And actually, if you do plan on buying Taco Bell hot sauce packets through an online auction, you should probably consider your purchases very carefully.
Because selling Taco Bell hot sauce packets at outlandish prices on eBay is apparently a thing—and it's probably not a thing you want to get involved in.
So what do Taco Bell hot sauce packets really go for on eBay?
And yes, a couple of days ago, someone apparently paid $5.50 for "strange twin sealed" hot sauce packets.
But that still doesn't explain how listing Taco Bell hot sauces on eBay reached its joke status.', 'Sellers of antiques and collectibles should be prepared for changes ahead, otherwise their items may become harder for buyers to find.
Beginning in May, eBay is consolidating categories, requiring sellers to use Item Specifics (product attributes) to ensure buyers can find their listings.
eBay announced category changes as part of the eBay Spring Seller Update 2021 on March 3rd, though it didn't draw attention to changes in antiques and collectibles.
eBay stated, "When the category structure changes, your listings may be automatically moved to another category, based on the item specifications that you provided."
If you have thoughts about the changes eBay is making to its category structure on May 11, let us know!', 'eBay is making a change to its feedback system that some sellers say slants the playing field even more in buyers' favor.
"Previously, sellers and buyers could only leave feedback of up to 80 characters," eBay announced on Friday.
If eBay was patting itself on the back, users quickly disabused it of the notion they would welcome the change.
Another seller said the change would be fine if sellers could also leave negatives, "but since we can't this is nothing but bad bad news for sellers."
Another said, "It's bad enough when you see negatives saying "this is garbage and so is the seller" and eBay refuses to remove the feedback.', 'On Tuesday, eBay, Etsy, Mercari, OfferUp and Poshmark said they’ve formed The Coalition to Protect America’s Small Sellers, or PASS Coalition, to address what they see as unfair rules that could harm small sellers.
More from WWDThe act, whose shortened name stands for “Integrity, Notification and Fairness in Online Retail Marketplaces,” would require online marketplaces to disclose third-party seller information to consumers, including name, address, email and telephone, or face civil penalties.
Among them is the new PASS Coalition, which believes that the bill could harm independent sellers and smaller third-party merchants.
Story continuesPASS believes big businesses could deal with the new requirements, creating advantages that would unfairly burden small online sellers and entrepreneurs.
Meanwhile, companies like Poshmark, Etsy, eBay, Mercari and OfferUp have their own interest in keeping individual sellers from becoming collateral damage.', 'That’s why eBay is the ideal marketplace for buying high-end timepieces.
It’s already the go-to site for collectors and merchants, thanks to its unparalleled breadth and depth of inventory both new and used.
But even more important than that, eBay’s new Authenticity Guarantee gives you the peace of mind that the vintage Patek Philippe Calatrava you plan on passing on to your children is the real deal.
eBay Authenticity Guarantee eBayThe Authenticity Guarantee really puts luxury timepieces through their paces.
And the whole authentication process comes at no cost to you; just pay the amount agreed upon for the timepiece itself.']

title: ["Seller Says eBay Offers Buyer 'Money Back, and Keep the Item' - EcommerceBytes", 'Pokémon card listed on eBay for $9.99 sells for over $300000 - Joe UK']
summary:
['After a little bit over a week I got an open case on eBay that the buyer says they received the wrong item (there was no room for error as that was the only item in that category I had).
In this case, I noticed something was wrong, as I only had the options on eBay to "Challenge the dispute" or "Refund the buyer".
If I choose to challenge the claim, I had to prove I sent the right item, and if I lose the case, I will be charged $20 by eBay (and not get my item back).
If I choose "Refund the buyer", they refund the buyer, but I still don't get my item back.
So, that means anybody can buy whatever they want on eBay, receive the item, file a complaint, and get the money and keep the item.', 'We all wanted that card, don’t act like you don’t remember.
While we’ve all heard of these highly rare cards being snapped up by collectors over the years, what’s even more striking is that two more almost identical cards went for even more just last year.
Who knows how much people are still paying for the various other cards in the Pokédex?
Even if you don’t happen to have the rarest card known to man, it’s worth any former ‘Pokémon Trainers’ digging out their old sets of cards seeing what they might be worth.
It would seem Pokémon’s following is just as dedicated as ever and we’ve gotta say, that brings a childlike smile to our faces.']

title: ['eBay order mix-up sparks long-term friendship between two strangers - 9Honey', 'eBay Begins Allowing Sellers to Upload Videos - EcommerceBytes', "Chelsea fans team up in heroic eBay bid to return legend's England cap to family - The Mirror", "eBay International Shipping Set to 'Return to Sender' - EcommerceBytes"]
summary:
['Sandy Weir was relaxing by the pool when she received an eBay notification a seller had replied to her message.
"For the first time in my life I had enough time to actually look at eBay and Gumtree and stuff like this.
The saucepans Sandy Weir bought off eBay that sparked a long-term friendship with Julie in France.
The connection between the pair would soon intensify, with Julie messaging Weir at an odd hour to see if she was awake.
"She has this interesting business in France, I'm from publishing and I spend most of my year in another country," Weir says.', 'eBay is beginning to allow some sellers to upload videos, though they'll only be visible to shoppers on the site's mobile app for now.
Like many announcements about "new" capabilities on eBay, it's confusing, since eBay has encouraged sellers to add videos to listings on and off for over a decade, and since sellers can currently embed videos in listings.
"The vzaar application allows eBay sellers to quickly and easily add video to their eBay listings for a more dynamic shopping experience," it continued.
As always, thank you for selling on eBay,Your eBay TeamWe're very curious about which sellers eBay is allowing in first.
Let us know if you use videos on your product listings, wherever you sell, and whether you would consider adding videos to your eBay listings.', "EXCLUSIVE: More than 100 people clubbed together to ensure legendary Chelsea goalkeeper Peter Bonetti's England cap was returned to his family so his 'grandchildren can treasure it'Chelsea fans team up in heroic eBay bid to return legend's England cap to familyFans have clubbed together to win an eBay auction for an England cap awarded to Peter Bonetti – and have returned it to his family.
When the cap appeared on eBay last month Chelsea fan Hilary Hannington vowed to buy it back for his family.
Do you remember Peter Bonetti flying through air for Chelsea and England?
Image: SUPPLIED BY ANDY LINES) SUPPLIED BY ANDY LINES)She said: “We discovered that Peter’s England cap for the game versus Spain in 1967 was up for sale on eBay.
“His family were desperate to have the cap it so that Peter’s grandchildren can treasure it, but they could not afford it.", 'Is anyone else experiencing unexpected returns from eBay when using its international shipping service?
Today we received an email from a seller who unexpectedly got two orders destined for overseas sent back to them without explanation.
“I have had two separate purchases from different sellers that have gone to the Kentucky shipping center and then suddenly the same notice has appeared on both of them,” the seller explained.
It was processed by the shipping center, an international shipping label was attached to the package, and it used my address as the delivery address.
We advise sellers to check orders sent using “eBay International Standard Delivery” (not to be confused with eBay Global Shipping).']

['Space News space history and artifacts articles Messages space history discussion forums Sightings worldwide astronaut appearances Resources selected space history documentsadvertisementsCommander's cover: An envelope's trip through space, time and eBayApril 2, 2021 — The last time that Richard Truly saw it, it was on board the space shuttle Challenger 38 years ago.

(NASA)The number "3" crew-signed STS-8 space mail cover as was sold on eBay on March 23, 2021 and is soon to be reunited with mission commander Richard Truly.

(eBay)An example of the "Shuttle Flight Folder" with flown STS-8 space mail as sold by the USPS to the public in 1983.', 'CLEVELAND, Ohio (WOIO) - Ohio Attorney General Dave Yost sent a letter Thursday to Twitter, eBay and Shopify about sellers distributing fake COVID-19 vaccination cards on their websites.
When you are vaccinated by a certified distributer, you will be provided with a COVID-19 vaccine certification card.
Yost said people buy fraudulent cards to appear vaccinated without actually being vaccinated.
“Fraudulent vaccine cards simply don’t have a place in the marketplace,” Yost said.
The letter asks that Twitter, eBay and Shopify monitor their sites for advertisements, remove the ads and keep record of the seller.']

That worth is being valued up, in real-time, on eBay.
Currently only listing two items, fairytalerachel is the new account to follow for items of near priceless worth for an avid Disney fan.
Bidding has been ongoing, with the first item’s auction ending on Wednesday, April 7.', 'How-To How to Enable Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) on eBay ByAdding a second layer of security to your eBay account is important and easy to do.
You should enable Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) or 2-step verification on all of your online accounts for increased security.
If you have an eBay account you have a lot of personal info there that is worth protecting.
Add 2FA to Your eBay AccountTo get started launch eBay on your desktop browser and sign in to your account.
2FA and Online SecurityMake sure to enable 2FA on every online account that offers it.', 'Wonderful to look at, this 1970s Rosita Vision 2000 space-age audio system also plays your tunes.
Like the Rosita Commander audio system I featured not long back (and also for sale via eBay) this has the looks of something from the future, but the technology that is very much of a bygone era.
That technology is a radio receiver (and NOT one that picks up DAB) along with a Phillips cassette player.
You are buying this as a piece of stunning 1970s space-age design.
A design classic, if you want it on your home the ‘Buy It Now’ price is £5,425.', "Campus Watch in the Media Anti-Israel Professor Hamid Dabashi Benefited from Ebay Founder Pierre Omidyar's Philanthropy https://www.meforum.org/campus-watch/62188/anti-israel-professor-hamid-dabashi-benefited A new report by The Middle East Forum (MEF) takes an in-depth look into the little known Roshan Cultural Heritage Institute (Roshan, RCI), foundation.
Dabashi serves as Professor of Iranian Studies at Columbia University from where he actively promotes BDS and anti-Israel activity.
It was carefully designed to serve racist white settler-colonists, and racist white settler-colonists only, in perpetuity.
Apparently, the 'colonial settler' label is applicable only if you are a white European.
Elsewhere he writes: ...The European support for Israel, it is crucial to keep in mind, and hatred of Muslims are interconnected.", 'Over the years, eBay has seen quite a few rare Disney oddities listed for sale.
What really piques my interest, though, are blueprints.
Before AutoCAD came along, hand-drawn blueprints just looked great.
There is a great deal of artistry that goes into older Disney blueprints.
That also makes me want to find the blueprints for the long-forgotten Questor simulator ride that used to be at Busch Gardens Tampa.']

title: ['Royal Mail and Hermes respond as parcels sold on eBay - The Argus', "'Lost' Royal Mail And Hermes Parcels Are Being Flogged On eBay For Hundreds Of Pounds - Tyla", "eBay's app will soon be able to scan Pokémon cards to sell them ... - The Verge", "How Mexico's Most Powerful Cartel Used Ebay to Arm Themselves ... - VICE", 'Chicks With Kicks eBay Auction With 2,200 Sneakers to Fetch $1 ... - Business Insider', 'State asks eBay, Shopify, Twitter to curb sales of fake vaccination cards - FOX 17 West Michigan News']
summary:
['One was titled "10x lost returned mail (Royal Mail/Hermes)" and claimed the items were in the original packaging.
Piles of Royal Mail deliveries.
A spokesman said around 15 per cent of undeliverable items were sold off.
A Royal Mail spokesperson told us: "These are not items that are in course of transmission by post and would not have reached eBay via Royal Mail.
"When Royal Mail attempts to deliver items to customers and the items are undeliverable, we return these items to the Delivery Office.', 'Hundreds of 'lost' Royal Mail and Hermes parcels are being flogged on eBay, it has been revealed.
One listing - with bids up to £56 - is described as '10x bundle of lost returned mail (Royal Mail / Hermes - original packaging)' accompanied by an image of the items inside - including reading glasses, LED lights and hair extensions.
Hundreds of 'lost' Royal Mail and Hermes parcels are being flogged on eBay, it has been reported (Credit: Kennedy News and Media)Advert 10In some cases, sellers claim customer data has been removed 'where possible' while others admit they haven't even opened the mail.
"These are not items that are in course of transmission by post and would not have reached eBay via Royal Mail.
When Royal Mail attempts to deliver items to customers and the items are undeliverable, we return these items to the Delivery Office.', 'eBay has announced a new addition coming to its mobile app: soon, you’ll be able to scan trading cards from popular games like Pokémon, Magic: The Gathering, and Yu-Gi-Oh!
The new card scanning feature is set to arrive at the end of April, but it’ll only support Magic: The Gathering when it launches.
Using the new scanning option, sellers will be able to just scan a card, at which point eBay will use the card’s details to help automatically build the listing.
In addition to the new scanning feature, eBay is adding a few other improvements to the trading card purchasing process for both sellers and buyers.
And the company is working on “reviewing its buyer protection policy for trading cards” to better both sellers and buyers in the current market.', "MEXICO CITY - It started with his mom's credit card, claimed Ismael Almada in March 2020, as he voluntarily spilled his guts to U.S. law enforcement officers during an interview in the Mexican city of Guadalajara.
Most of the illegal imports went to the infamous Jalisco New Generation Cartel, known as the CJNG for its Spanish acronym.
Ismael arrived in the U.S. days after he gave his confession in Mexico and voluntarily turned himself over to authorities.
In 2015, CJNG members shot down a military helicopter using a grenade launcher and have repeatedly clashed with law enforcement around Mexico.
On September 28, 2019, authorities raided a house in Guadalajara and arrested Carlos Almada along with three alleged CJNG associates.", 'Three sisters known as The Chicks with Kicks own one of the world's largest sneaker collections.
They partnered with eBay to sell over 2,200 pairs, which are estimated to be worth about $1 million.
But now, the women are auctioning off more than 2,200 rare pairs from their collection for the first time via an exclusive partnership with eBay.
With their eBay auction currently underway, the sisters are just beginning to process having to part with some of their favorite kicks.
"I presume it's going to go very well with eBay," Ariana said.', 'LANSING, Mich. — Michigan A.G. Dana Nessel requests eBay, Shopify and Twitter to curb the sales of fake vaccination cards, according to the state attorney general’s office.
“My colleagues and I are urging Twitter, eBay and Shopify to help prevent the sale of these phony cards and protect the public health.”Genuine vaccination cards are given to patients after they receive the COVID-19 vaccine.
The state warns that fraudulent cards may endanger the health of community members and inhibit the ongoing progress in vaccinating the public.
Nessel is joined by 44 other attorneys general in a letter calling on CEOs of the aforementioned platforms to monitor and remove ads for fraudulent vaccination cards, as well as to make records of the ads and sellers of fraudulent cards.
Follow FOX 17: Facebook - Twitter - Instagram - YouTube']

title: ['eBay Blocks Buyer Messages to Sellers - EcommerceBytes', 'Good News: eBay Stops Hiding Shipping Options from Buyers - EcommerceBytes', 'eBay Kicks-Off New Event Series to Authenticate and Showcase ... - PR Newswire']
summary:
['eBay began blocking some messages sent through its messaging system, according to buyers and sellers.
Buyers and sellers began reporting the issue on the eBay boards as early as Monday, April 5, some referring to a new banner on the eBay messaging page about getting tough on messaging violations.
At least one user even turned to Down Detector to report the problem, writing: "ebay messages are not working.
I checked all my messages and found no messages in my inbox from this buyer.
"Will be interesting to see if anyone else is experiencing this same issue of sending and receiving messages on eBay."', 'eBay acknowledged yesterday that a policy it implemented 2 years ago was not so great after all and said it would stop hiding shipping options from buyers.
“How does showing only some of the shipping options benefit the buyer?” was typical of sellers’ reaction at the time.
The eBay announcement from 2019, explained, “Until recently, shipping options outlined for the buyer did not always promote the best value.
Now buyers can select their preferred carriers, shipping costs, and estimated delivery dates from the options in your listings.
We expect the expanded shipping options will create greater efficiencies for sellers and improve the buyer experience.”', "Addressing the enormous surge in popularity of collectible goods, eBay is hosting events across the country to unearth and authenticate celebrity and enthusiasts’ collections of sought-after and rare sneakers, watches and trading cards.
Collector Events:At each collector event taking place across the country, enthusiasts can bring their own items - including sneakers, watches and trading cards - for authentication and appraisal.
They will leave with an estimation of the item's worth and the option to list their items on eBay.
With the launch of Authenticity Guarantee, eBay has changed the way people buy and sell on the platform.
1Boston Consulting Group Survey, Secondhand Luxury Market; Cowen & Co Survey, Sneaker Resale MarketSOURCE eBay Inc.Related Linkshttp://www.ebay.com"]

title: ['eBay hosts roadshow of watch valuation events with celebrities ... - WatchPro USA', 'Knutsford man buys WW2 warship on eBay to restore it with his family - Knutsford Guardian', 'Seller Puzzled over eBay Reply on Parcel Shipping Options - EcommerceBytes', 'eBay Blocks Buyer Messages to Sellers - EcommerceBytes', 'Shopify, eBay, Facebook clamp down on sale of COVID vaccine cards - Business Insider', "Lil Nas X controversial blood 'Satan Shoes' lists on eBay for $9,000 - TweakTown", "Jupiter's Legacy #1 Jumps to $50 Raw, $224 CGC 9.8 on eBay - Bleeding Cool News"]
summary:
['', 'It began one bedtime at the family home near Gwersyllt when the listing for the 72 foot-long naval harbour defence launch ML1392 caught Simon's eye.
Simon, 41, said: "I've always had a passion for boats and have bought lots of boats on eBay.
It has become a real family project, especially for nine-year-old Emilia who 'loves to get her hands dirty'.
It won't be returned exactly to its 1943 condition because, as Gemma says: "What would we want a warship for?"
"Right now the problem is trying to find somewhere to put her because no posh marina wants a 'project boat'.', "Dear Ina,A buyer selected Parcel Select (Ground Shipping), but I wasn't able to select this when printing out a shipping label.
In fact, Parcel Select was nowhere to be found in eBay's shipping label selections.
I spoke to a Customer Service Rep at eBay and was informed that the USPS no longer permits eBay Sellers to ship anything by Parcel Select.
Fortunately, I was able to ship the buyer's item by Priority Mail without having to cancel the item or be forced to eat any additional shipping fees.
Yet eBay still continues to have Parcel Select as a shipping choice.", 'eBay began blocking some messages sent through its messaging system, according to buyers and sellers.
Buyers and sellers began reporting the issue on the eBay boards as early as Monday, April 5, some referring to a new banner on the eBay messaging page about getting tough on messaging violations.
At least one user even turned to Down Detector to report the problem, writing: "ebay messages are not working.
I checked all my messages and found no messages in my inbox from this buyer.
"Will be interesting to see if anyone else is experiencing this same issue of sending and receiving messages on eBay."', 'Fake and forged vaccine cards are being sold on platforms including Facebook , eBay , and Shopify .
Hundreds of online stores have sold blank and counterfeit vaccine cards, the NYT reports.
AdvertisementThe sudden surge of fake COVID-19 vaccines and forged vaccine cards online have overwhelmed social platforms dealing with scammers taking advantage of pandemic anxieties.
Official US vaccine cards are emblazoned with the logo of the Center Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.
AdvertisementIn a statement to Insider, eBay said it was taking "significant measures to block or quickly remove" fake cards.', 'A week ago, there was quite a lot of controversy surrounding Lil Nas X's new "Satan Shoes", and now that the shoes have been recalled, people that own the shoes are listing them on eBay for ridiculous prices.
2VIEW GALLERY - 2 IMAGESNike has managed to get a judge to order a recall of the "Satan Shoes", and the court has ruled a temporary order to halt MSCHF, the company behind the shoes, production.
Prices on eBay from early buyers that are looking to now sell the shoes for profit are ranging between $2,000 to $9,000.
One listing, in particular, was quite shocking as an eBay user is attempting to size 10.5 Air Max 37 for $9,000 plus a $10 shipping fee.
You'd think if you were buying $9,000 shoes that the owner of the shoes would pay for your shipping.', '']

title: ['Farmer falls prey to £8500 eBay tractor scam - FarmersWeekly', 'Etsy and eBay Sellers Will Have to Report Income to the IRS - MoneyWise', "Lil Nas X's Nike-Branded 'Satan Shoes' Selling for $4000+ on eBay - Digital Music News", 'Auto parts export from India booming on eBay: Top 5 exporter states & top 5 buyer countries - The Financial Express', 'Football fan who sold celebrity autographs on eBay aged 11 is now millionaire - The Mirror']
summary:
['An arable farmer who lost £8,500 in a sophisticated internet sales scam is warning others against paying for a tractor without “physically seeing and touching it”.
Mr Blake had been hunting for a tractor to replace his 1985 Case, but could not afford £20,000 for a good second-hand tractor, so he looked at other options.
He even sent me a copy of the V5 and when I ran an MOT check on it the name of a farm in Hook came up,” Mr Blake explained.
Details Mr Blake has received from the Land Registry show that the address on the fake v5 document is genuine.
The tractor is still listed on eBay as item number 303924941205 under the name Pamelchadwic_5.', '', 'Lil Nas X’s Nike-Branded ‘Satan Shoes’ Selling for $4,000+ on eBayThe Nike-branded “Satan Shoes” that Lil Nas X released late last month are now fetching upwards of $4,000 per pair on Ebay.
But as initially mentioned, footwear fanatics who missed this initial release are shelling out larger sums yet to get their hands on the “Satan Shoes,” to the particular benefit of resellers.
But the shoe selloff could soon come to a close on Ebay if higher-ups opt to prohibit sellers from parting with the products on their platform.
Building upon the point, Nike promptly denied involvement with the shoes and, almost immediately thereafter, sued MSCHF for trademark infringement.
Then, a federal judge yesterday issued a temporary restraining order on the sneakers, ordering MSCHF to halt production.', 'India’s automotive parts exports were valued at around USD 15.35 billion at the end of the fiscal year 2020.
And it was recently brought to our attention that the sale of auto parts and accessories through online portals is on the rise.
India’s automotive parts exports were valued at around USD 15.35 billion at the end of the fiscal year 2020.
Top 10 most purchased auto parts on eBay from Indian sellers?
Auto parts such as Fuel tanks, Saddlebags & panniers, Mud Guards & Fenders, Seats, Helmets, Steering wheels and horns, Headlight Assemblies, Grilles, Diagnostic tools, Silencers, Mufflers, and Baffles.', "Now he's making £610,000 out of Muhammad Ali glovesFootball fan who sold celebrity autographs on eBay aged 11 is now millionaireA man who started selling celebrity autographs on eBay at the age of 11 has turned his idea into a multi-million-pound business.
Image: Firma Stella Sports) Firma Stella Sports)Johnson said he would list the items on eBay after school, earning a little pocket money from his bedroom at home.
Image: Firma Stella Sports) Firma Stella Sports)“There is something really special about collecting memorabilia,” Johnson explained.
Image: Firma Stella Sports) Firma Stella Sports)“When the lift travelled from their floor, I would press the button and hoped it stopped with players in the lift.
Then, aged 11, after England famously won the Rugby World Cup, he began collecting the signatures of players at another local team, Worcester Warriors Rugby Club."]

title: ['You can now shop at Amazon, Ebay, and Walmart with Crypto.com - CryptoSlate', 'eBay Holds Seller Funds for Days Regardless of Tracking - EcommerceBytes']
summary:
['Learn more ›Hong Kong-based Crypto.com will now allow users to shop at global marketplaces Amazon and eBay, and retail giant Walmart after a new partnership with Shopping.io, the firm said in a release.
“Shop at Amazon, eBay, and Walmart via Shopping.io with Crypto.com Pay,” the firm tweeted.
Shop at Amazon, Ebay, and Walmart via @shopping_io with https://t.co/vCNztABJoG Pay!
🛍️ Enjoy an additional 5% discount on purchases💰 Earn up to 10% back in Pay Rewards🎁 USD 20 shipping fee discount for orders outside of the U.S.$CRO #CRODetails👉https://t.co/soNlAhDon1 pic.twitter.com/tm45U4hs18 — Crypto.com (@cryptocom) April 8, 2021The exclusive, limited-time promotion is a result of the integration of Crypto.com Pay (Crypto.com’s payment app) Checkout with Shopping.io.
Crypto.com’s CRO token, on the other hand, has risen 314% in the past year and has a market cap of over $5 billion.', "It seems as though eBay has made another unannounced change that holds a seller's money for even longer.
I was informed today that if a buyer opens an INR dispute the case must remain open for three business days regardless of tracking information.
Then on the 4th day the buyer can escalate and the case will be closed.
So now, even if the seller provides proof of delivery, eBay will not close the dispute until the 4th business day.
Seems the only way eBay can make money is by holding others."]

title: ['eBay removes a listing selling art created in a Japanese American concentration camp - CNN', 'Couple buy 72ft WWII ship off eBay in ultimate restoration project - Liverpool Echo', "Stockton car dealer charged with 'misleading' eBay sales of insurance write-offs - Teesside Live"]
summary:
['“We don’t feel that Japanese American history – particularly around the trauma of racist policies that excluded, forcibly removed and incarcerated 120,000 residents from the West Coast – should be sold or used for profit,” said Rick Noguchi, chief operating officer for the Japanese American National Museum.
After protests by Japanese Americans, the auction house withdrew the items, which were eventually acquired by the Japanese American National Museum.
That sales of objects from Japanese American concentration camps continue to proliferate is just part of that pattern, said David Inoue, executive director of the civil rights organization Japanese American Citizens League.
But numerous other artifacts from the period of Japanese American incarceration continue to be sold on the platform.
Noguchi, the COO for the Japanese American National Museum, says the group would like to see all items associated with Japanese American concentration camps be banned for sale on eBay.', "Speaking to the ECHO, Gemma described the couple’s maiden voyage into the unknown saying: “We didn’t plan on buying a ship but Simon would always sit there at night and look at eBay.
“One night I was brushing my teeth and he was lying in bed and he was like ‘look at this boat’.
So we knew it was going to be a long-term project.”In order to track and document their progress, the couple decided to create a YouTube channel dedicated to the restoration of the ship.
Sign up for a new-look Echo newsletter It's never been more important to stay in touch with the news, so subscribe now to the Liverpool Echo newsletter.
Donations to Gemma and Simon’s restoration journey can be made here and you can follow their progress via their popular Ship Happens YouTube channel.", 'We have more newslettersSomething went wrong, please try again later.
Invalid email Something went wrong, please try again later.
Mark Woodall, of Marwoods Trade Centre in Stockton, faces a total of 19 charges of being a trader engaged in a commercial practice which, by omission, was misleading.
Sixteen of the charges concern sales of cars on the website eBay.
The charges claim that information in adverts failed to state that the cars for sale were insurance write-offs, therefore misleading customers.']

title: ['Is eBay Going to Eliminate Auctions? - EcommerceBytes', "DoE awards flogged on eBay as Prince Philip 'merch' takes off after his death - Metro.co.uk", 'Couple buy rotting WW2 ship used during D-Day on eBay for ultimate restoration project - The Mirror', "Dolly Parton's Charity Ice Cream Going For Insane Prices On eBay - TheRichest"]
summary:
['In fact, eBay CEOs used to brag about how auctions went from 70% of listings to 30% of listings.
They should split off into two entities - eBay Stores, and eBay Auctions."
One reason eBay might have for eliminating auctions is Managed Payments and the third-parties eBay uses to manage payment processing.
He thinks the reason eBay is pushing auctions to fixed-price is because the seller has more options with fixed-price listings, such as running Promoted Listing ads and Best Offer.
But does he think eBay will eliminate the auction format?', 'RIP t-shirts, decorative pillows and signed Christmas cards are among the Prince Philip ‘merch’ being flogged on eBay this week (Pictures: eBay)Duke of Edinburgh badges, signed Christmas cards and a pamphlet from the special remembrance service at Canterbury Cathedral are just some of the wacky ‘memorabilia’ being sold on eBay following Prince Philip’s death last week.
Topping the list is a five-pound platinum coin commemorating the monarch’s 90th birthday, with an asking price of a whopping £11,250.
Meanwhile 11 people have bid on a complete set of Gold, Silver and Bronze DoE award badges, with the price now at £117.
But if you’re looking for something more fashionable, for £6.99 you can get a black t-shirt emblazoned with the Duke wearing a halo and the words ‘Prince Philip 1921-2021’ written below.
The service was led by the Archbishop of Canterbury, Justin Welby, who is also expected to officiate at Prince Philip’s funeral on Saturday.', 'Gemma and Simon Robins, who are camper van renovation specialists, purchased the ‘ML 1392 Medusa’ in January after they ‘fell in love’ with the vessel.
She said: “We didn’t plan on buying a ship but Simon would always sit there at night and look at eBay.
“One night I was brushing my teeth and he was lying in bed and he was like ‘look at this boat’.
She’s a massive boat, she’s 72ft long, she’s got five bedrooms, and she needs totally gutting and starting again.
Gemma, who is a mum-of-two from Huyton, Liverpool, said: “The whole YouTube idea, we only filmed it for the family.', '']

title: ['Can eBay Be Used to Sell Locally? It Thinks So - EcommerceBytes', 'eBay Canada Shakes Up Sneaker Market with Authentication Program - Canada NewsWire']
summary:
["In a blog post about a survey it conducted in January, eBay revealed it is working on tools to help sellers sell locally, which may come as a surprise to people who buy and sell on the marketplace.
Even sites conducive to local selling are no replacement for robust online marketplaces, many sellers report (see the Auction Professor's latest column in EcommerceBytes to see some examples of why).
Is it worth the investment for eBay to try to capture local sales?
What areas would you like to see eBay invest technology resources in when it comes helping you grow your business?
And what do you think about local selling through eBay?", 'Canadian authentication centre opening next month to facilitate eBay 'Authenticity Guarantee' on sneakers over $100Sneaker category is surging: eBay's domestic Canadian sneaker sales increased 325% in 2020TORONTO, April 14, 2021 /CNW Telbec/ - Today, eBay Canada announces the launch of Authenticity Guarantee for sneaker sales on the platform.
To power Authenticity Guarantee, eBay has partnered with Sneaker Con, a leading organization for sneaker authentication, making eBay's sneaker program the only one in the industry using an independent, third-party authenticator.
"We're excited to take our authentication skills and expertise to Canada to help power eBay's Authenticity Guarantee for sneakers."
Verified Returns: For sellers who choose to offer returns, eBay's sneaker authentication program ensures the exact item initially sold is returned to the seller, via a verified returns process.
SOURCE eBay CanadaFor further information: Media Contact: Kelly Scragg, Communications Manager, eBay Canada, [email protected], 780-218-2176; Tom Horn, Senior Consultant, Proof Strategies, [email protected], 416-566-5055Related Linkshttp://www.ebay.ca']

title: ['More eBay tractor scam victims tell us their stories - FarmersWeekly', 'Woman swears by £4 eBay carpet tool which shows you just how filthy your ‘clean’ floors really are... - The Sun']
summary:
['More farmer victims of a sophisticated eBay tractor scam have come forward to share their heart-breaking stories of financial loss.
Mr Lane agreed to purchase a 2010 John Deere 3720 tractor with loader advertised on eBay in February which he believed belonged to Mr Cowell (email: dave@dc-farming,co.uk) for £9,000.
“Having seen the V5, which tied to Warrington, the same location of the eBay seller, I went ahead with the purchase,” said Mr Lane.
Shortly after agreeing to the purchase Mr Lane was sent an email which looked like it was from eBay with a PayPal invoice and checkout button.
Mr Lane got in touch with eBay and it took them five days to take the “fake” advert off their website.', 'IF YOU thought your carpets were cleaner than clean, you might want to think again as one woman has revealed just how filthy they really are using a bargain tool.
3 One woman swears by this bargain carpet cleaner tool Credit: Tiktok/@sxmxnthxhxOne woman shared video evidence of the hidden build-up in her cream carpets while showing off a handy £4 carpet cleaner tool she came across on eBay.
It's great for picking up all the dirt the hoover doesn't quite get too, with the woman revealing: "It’s so addictive I recommend you get one."
Others were completely put off by the huge pile of dirt, with one person commenting: "And this is why I don't have carpets."
They weren't alone, another in favour of no carpets said: "Carpets are the unhealthiest every I DK why you even buy them (sic)."']

title: ['EBay Takes Authentication on the Road With Authentication Nation ... - WWD', 'How to See What Something Is Worth Using eBay - How-To Geek', 'EBay Takes Authentication on the Road - Yahoo Finance']
summary:
['When eBay expanded its authentication service to include sneakers, the company hosted a three-day pop-up in Los Angeles last fall to unveil the service.
This month, the company took the service on the road with Authentication Nation, a traveling pop-up where consumers can have their luxury watches, sneakers and trading cards authenticated on the spot.
“The program itself has gone really well and we’ve seen huge growth since we’ve launched,” said eBay vice president of fashion Charis Márquez.
Although eBay launched authorization for watches in 2018, the extension of that service into sneakers was necessary to keep pace with these other companies.
Looking ahead, she said eBay is exploring adding more categories in the luxury space to its authentication program, including jewelry and handbags.', 'If you’re buying or selling an item and have no idea what it’s worth, don’t worry: By checking the prices of similar sold items on eBay, you can get some idea of an item’s value.
When you see search results, the next step is to narrow them down to items that have been successfully sold.
Place a checkmark beside “Sold Items.” (“Completed Items” will also check itself automatically.)
(By the way, you can also use eBay’s Advanced Search form to search for sold items.
Making Sense of the Search ResultsWhen viewing the highest-priced results on eBay, you want to be careful.', 'When eBay expanded its authentication service to include sneakers, the company hosted a three-day pop-up in Los Angeles last fall to unveil the service.
This month, the company took the service on the road with Authentication Nation, a traveling pop-up where consumers can have their luxury watches, sneakers and trading cards authenticated on the spot.
“The program itself has gone really well and we’ve seen huge growth since we’ve launched,” said eBay vice president of fashion Charis Márquez.
Although eBay launched authorization for watches in 2018, the extension of that service into sneakers was necessary to keep pace with these other companies.
Looking ahead, she said eBay is exploring adding more categories in the luxury space to its authentication program, including jewelry and handbags.']

title: ["eBay Rolls Out 'Luxe Tax' and Escrow Requirement for Watches - EcommerceBytes", 'The story of the family who bought a WW2 warship on eBay - South Wales Argus']
summary:
['The fee hike on sales of watches at any price is to pay for eBay’s marketing of high-priced, luxury watches.
As we continue to focus on the luxury watches experience, we are increasing final value fees in the Watches (260325) category.
Escrow services are customary for many high-value purchases, such as home sales and business acquisitions.
Here’s how it works:Together with Escrow.com, buyers will pay using escrow services on watches sold for $10,000 or more on eBay.
We also recalled that eBay announced in July of last year that it would make escrow services available on eBay Motors and in the eBay Motors App through a new partnership with Escrow.com.', 'MORE NEWS:Mr Robins, 41, said: "I've always had a passion for boats and have bought lots of boats on eBay.
When we bought her, as we both work full-time and have two children, we thought it's going to be a very long-term project."
It won't be returned exactly to its 1943 condition because, as Gemma says: "What would we want a warship for?"
"Right now the problem is trying to find somewhere to put her because no posh marina wants a 'project boat'.
Follow the Robins' epic voyage on the "Ship Happens" YouTube channel at https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCGYfor_-g_k8ib-rBzXOLWgHistory of the ML1392 "Sarinda"']

title: ['Act Now! Rare Piece of Disney History on eBay! - Inside the Magic', 'Do not buy an old e-reader on Ebay - Good e-Reader', "'We bought a rotting WWII boat on eBay and now it's going to cost us more than £50k to repair' - Wales Online"]
summary:
['', 'If you see an old e-reader on Ebay, do not buy it.
The Barnes and Noble Nook Glowlight Plus made in 2015 can have the battery replaced, but not anything after.
The earliest screen technology was “Vizplex,” which was employed by the Sony Reader, MOTOFONE F3, Barnes & Noble Nook, Kindle, txtr Beagle, and Kobo eReader.
If you buy a old Sony e-reader, you won’t be able to buy books on it anymore.
When you are browsing EBAY and looking at older e-readers, whether they are used or new, control yourself.', 'Something went wrong, please try again later.
Invalid email Something went wrong, please try again later.
We've all done it, made late night purchases on eBay that we've regretted the following day.
But, in the case of Gemma and Simon Robins from Wrexham, the notion of impulse buying has been taken to the extreme.
"I never ever wanted a boat that big in my life but it sort of pulled on my heartstrings."']

title: ['Since When Is Saturday a Business Day, eBay Seller Asks - EcommerceBytes', 'Auto Parts & Accessories eCommerce: Amazon and eBay - Dealer Marketing Magazine', "Super Potato, Japan's Legendary Game Store, Opens Its Very Own ... - Nintendo Life"]
summary:
['Dear Ina,Just got a bit of a shock from eBay.
When filing out a listing, "handling time" gives various choices, one being "next business day", which is my standard.
I rarely look at sold notices (just print my label), but today...Friday...
No mention of "next business day."
And yep, my Bulk Shipping page says "Shipping on Sat Apr 17", which obviously ain't the next business day.', "At about 3.5% of the U.S. GDP, there's no denying the importance it plays, even with online sales alone.
The same is true for the parts and accessories portion of this behemoth industry.
Specific to online sales for auto parts and accessories, the year-over-year (YOY) growth is unmistakable.
According to the RevolutionParts 2020 Parts eCommerce Year in Review, sales through just RevolutionParts have grown 117% over the last three years — and they aren't stopping.
Even more stunning, Amazon alone accounted for almost a third of all U.S. eCommerce in 2020.", "One of the world's most famous video game stores, Japan's Super Potato, has finally opened up for international business thanks to its new, worldwide eBay account.
It might seem pretty strange seeing a shop be described as 'legendary', but for gamers everywhere, Super Potato really is as good as a store can get.
The Super Potato brand actually has around ten stores in total, but the main store in Akihabara, Tokyo, has become something of a tourist destination – as well as a frequent stop for Japanese locals.
You can also follow Super Potato on its brand new Twitter account, should you want to keep up to date with new listings.
Have you ever taken the very special trip to Super Potato in Tokyo?"]
