title: ['eBay 450 PSA Graded Vintage Baseball Card Collection Auction - HYPEBEAST', 'Beloved Japanese gaming store Super Potato has opened an eBay ... - The Verge', 'Super Potato, Famous Japanese Video Game Shop, Has a New ... - IGN', 'Thrifty mum transforms cluttered bathroom into trendy jungle-inspired space with eBay & Facebook... - The Sun']
summary:
['eBay has just announced a massive baseball card auction featuring vintage baseball cards.
A total of 450 cards with an emphasis on 1930s Goudey Baseball cards will be split into three listing drops.
Starting at .99¢ USD, each card has no reserve and will be dropped in three batches of auctions that will last a week each.
Check out some of the inventory above and head over to eBay for the complete listings.
In other trading card news, Bandai previews Digimon Card Game’s upcoming Double Diamond [BT06] set.', 'Visiting Super Potato in Akihabara is usually a key reason why many die-hard gamers want to venture to Japan.
The flagship Super Potato store (of the eight total in Japan, according to its Twitter) is nondescript, yet its shelves are covered wall-to-wall in rare yet reasonably priced games and consoles.
I’d expect Super Potato’s eBay listings to change frequently, so it’s a great site to bookmark, especially if importing games is a hobby.
But once the pandemic ends, I highly suggest visiting the store in person if you have the opportunity.
In the elevator, eagerly anticipating the doors opening to Super Potato’s packed shelves.', "One of the world's most renowned video game stores, Japan's Super Potato now has a brand new international eBay storefront .
With over three floors of video games anime, and manga products, with a big focus on rare Japanese games.
Many of these rare games are now available to purchase via the new eBay storefront, but they certainly aren't cheap.
@SuperpotatoG on Twitter, or follow @IGNDeals for even more updates on collectables, video games, and more.
Will you be buying anything from the eBay store, or waiting for your very own visit to the iconic destination?", '6 Nat's cluttered bathroom before the transformation Credit: Latestdeals.co.ukThe mum, 35, from Ilkeston, Derbyshire, had been putting off her bathroom renovation for years after it slowly got more and more cluttered.
After looking for inspiration on Facebook, the mum - who was caring for her newborn at the time - decided to get stuck into her jungle-inspired bathroom.
Next, Nat stumbled upon a shelving unit for her sink for FREE on Facebook Marketplace and simply stripped the colour before adding some new B&Q handles.
She continued: "I found the boxes I used for above the toilet area on the Facebook marketplace.
"We got a radiator from the Facebook marketplace too, a more modern one than what we had before, and that makes a big difference."']

title: ["Mum buys 'wall-sized' feather decorations on eBay and is stunned at what turns up - The Mirror"]
summary:
['EXCLUSIVE: The property manager and DJ from Ruislip, north west London, excitedly ordered the glamorous decorations deciding they'd be ideal for her hallway and would lead up the stairsMum buys 'wall-sized' feather decorations on eBay and is stunned at what turns upWhen a house proud mum spotted some wall-sized feather decorations for sale on eBay she fell in love.
The image of the £12.99 decorations on the eBay listing showed they were large, mirrored-effect decorations which would add the illusion of more space in any home.
Image: DJ Lolly) DJ Lolly)Lolly was wrong.
Image: DJ Lolly) DJ Lolly) Image: DJ Lolly) DJ Lolly)In addition the items were sent from China and not from the UK as the Ebay listing said hence the long wait which ended in disappointment, albeit one with a funny side.
Image: DJ Lolly) DJ Lolly)She explained: "The laugh it gave me and my friends was worth the £12.99.']

title: ['eBay Rolls Out Custom Coupon Capability - EcommerceBytes', 'Aldi egg chair alternatives - Best cheap choices from Amazon, eBay, Argos, and more - Birmingham Live']
summary:
['eBay sellers who pay extra to have a Store on the platform can now customize coupons to entice shoppers to buy.
eBay had announced the new capability as part of the Spring Seller Update on March 3, 2021.
The new coupons, available in Seller Hub under the Marketing tab, lets sellers create and share custom discount codes that buyers can apply at checkout.
Sellers may not offer shipping promotions in coded coupons.
Let us know how you’re using them (or plan to use them) and how effective they are in boosting sales.', 'Egg chairs are the new garden craze - and everyone wants one it seems.
Here are some of the best choices you can get right now:This chair is currently on sale at Amazon for a hefty pricetag but looks perfect if you want a egg chair for your garden.
Argos is selling a grey Rattan chair - and it's probably one of the best looking pieces from the lot.
Ebay is selling various egg chairs from third-party sellers or some people just trying to get rid of their second-hand chairs.
The description reads: "Relax in your back garden with this wonderful hanging egg chair.']

title: ['Rare Blue Peter Olympic 50p coin sells on eBay for £205 – how to check if you have one... - The Sun', "eBay's New Escrow Payment Offering Provides Enhanced ... - PR Newswire", 'Phishing Attackers Exploited Zoom, eBay & Streaming Services in ... - MSSP Alert', 'Retro Gaming Store Super Potato eBay Store Opening - HYPEBEAST', '1970s Sir Peter Blake pop art jacket on eBay - Retro To Go']
summary:
["A RARE coin featuring a picture of the Olympics drawn by a young Blue Peter viewer has sold for £205.
3 There are two versions of the Blue Peter Olympic coin and one is worth more than the other Credit: Royal MintThe Blue Peter Olympic coin shows an athlete doing the high jump and was drawn by nine-year-old Florence Jackson after winning a competition on the kids TV show.
At the time the 2009 Blue Peter coins were made, they could be bought from the Royal Mint for £1.99 and they were never officially put into circulation.
Even if your coin “sells” on eBay for a high price there’s no guarantee that the buyer will cough up.
3 Credit: EBay3 A 2009 Blue Peter Olympic coin has sold on eBay for £205 Credit: eBayBut they have likely slipped into people's pockets since and have been bought and sold too.", "eBay, one of the largest luxury watch marketplaces in the world, adds escrow to its marketplace payment offerings for luxury watches over $10,000.
After launching its Authenticity Guarantee service in September 2020, more than 7,000 luxury watches priced at $10K+ were sold on eBay.
Now, with the introduction of escrow, eBay continues to make shopping and selling high value items like collectible timepieces convenient and simplified.
Escrow joins Authenticity Guarantee as another way eBay is evolving the buying and selling experience for eBay's community of luxury watch enthusiasts.
eBay Luxury Watches By the NumberseBay sold more than 200K luxury watches in 2020.", 'Phishers exploited the COVID-19-caused spike in streaming services in the first few months of 2020 with attackers impersonating top brands such as eBay, YouTube, Netflix and Twitch, Webroot, an OpenText company, said in its latest threat report.
One, %appdata%, saw the infection rate jump 59.2% YoY.
Infection rates by geographyLowest PC infection: Japan (2.3%), U.K. (2.7%), Australasia (3.2%) and North America (3.7%).
Infection Rates by country and industryLowest infection rates: healthcare and social assistance (down 41.4% from the YoY average).
Highest industry infection rates: wholesale trade, mining/oil/gas and manufacturing.', 'Famed Japanese retro gaming store Super Potato has finally opened up an international eBay storefront, saving you a trip to Tokyo in these pandemic-ridden times.
Located in the electrifying hub of Akihabara, Super Potato has gained a reputation for being one of the best retro gaming stores in the region, stocking extremely rare finds ranging from Super Nintendo cartridges to Super Famicom titles.
While you’ll now be able to purchase these vintage gaming gems from Super Potato, the company does point out that shipping may be delayed due to current COVID-19 circumstances.
For those interested in checking out what Super Potato has to offer, you can head over to its eBay storefront.
Elsewhere in gaming, Tokyo’s Pokémon Center megastore has found a way to combat scalpers.', 'However, if you buy via one of the links it may be an affiliate and I may earn a small commission.
This 1970s Sir Peter Blake pop art jacket on eBay might just be a shrewd one if you get it at the right price.
I can’t say for sure if it will be, but you don’t see a lot of these around.
Perhaps because, back in the 1970s, these were designed to be worn and as such, didn’t stand the test of tine like most clothing.
Yes, it has been in storage since 1978, so obviously has something like 43 years of creases in it.']

title: ["Shoppers resell Aldi's Hanging Egg Chair on eBay for crazy prices - Berkshire Live", 'eBay Adds a New Layer of Security to Luxury Watch Sales Over $10,000 - Robb Report', 'Blue Peter Olympic 50p coin fetches £205 on eBay - do you have one in your loose change? - The Mirror', 'EBay "More ways to win" by McCann London - CampaignLive']
summary:
['Invalid email Something went wrong, please try again later.
Get our ultimate guide on things to do in Berkshire with our What's On emailAldi's popular Hanging Egg Chair has been causing a stir among shoppers this spring.
Furious Aldi customers who missed out on getting the egg chair took to social media to share their disappointment.
One shopper said: "Looking to buy an Aldi egg chair today.
And another tweeted: "Woke up at 6.30 to get myself and Aldi egg chair, added it to my basket and the website crashed, now they're sold out fuming".', 'As the market for pre-owned timepieces continues to grow, eBay is adding a new layer of security to its high-end watch sales.
This week, the online retail platform added third-party payment service Escrow to its marketplace for luxury watch sales over $10,000.
According to eBay, the one-time setup ensures that all data is privately shared between Escrow and the buyer or seller.
“We are changing the way people buy and sell luxury items on eBay,” Tirath Kamdar, general manager of luxury at eBay, said in a statement.
In 2020, eBay says 8 million luxury watches were listed for sale on the platform.', "The quirky coin was drawn by nine-year-old Florence Jackson and features an athlete doing a high jump - but it's the 2009 version that could be valuableBlue Peter Olympic 50p coin fetches £205 on eBay - do you have one in your loose change?
A rare 50p that was designed by a Blue Peter viewer for the London 2012 Olympic games has sold for £205 on eBay.
According to change checking website Coin Hunter, around 2,224,000 were minted in 2011.
It was a 2009 version that recently sold on eBay for £205, with delivery included, after attracting two bids.
In 2010 and 2011, 29 new 50p designs were released into circulation to mark the 2012 Olympics games in London.", 'EBay champions savvy shoppers with a campaign starring a wannabe jogger and his dog Nobby.
The ad follows the extensive consumerism behind one man’s road to fitness, from buying trainers to picking up a blender (as recommended by a pair of gym-obsessed twins).
As his doggy Nobby "doesn’t do joggy", the runner picks up a bike and sidecar for his pooch before crashing into the "woman of [his] dreams" and telling her about his top, which he bought from eBay.
It was written by Jenna Morrissey, art directed by Ran Stallard and directed by Tom Kuntz through MJZ.
Last October, Ebay showcased the trials and tribulations of moving home with a campaign titled "Puzzle".']

title: ['McDonald’s to limit new Pokemon Happy Meal toys over eBay resale price hike fears - The Mirror', 'EBay forecasts profit below estimates on stiff competition, shares fall - Reuters', "Car dealer appears in court over alleged 'misleading' eBay sales of insurance write-offs - Teesside Live", 'eBay Classifieds Group UK Partner with LiveRamp to Power People ... - ExchangeWire', 'Rarest Kew Gardens 50p coin sells on eBay for £255 – see if you have one?... - The Sun', 'eBay Earnings, Revenue Beat in Q1 By Investing.com - Investing.com']
summary:
["McDonald's are adding free Pokemon toys to its Happy Meals from next month, but they could be limited due to fears of being resold online for hundredsMcDonald’s is adding Pokemon toys to its Happy Meals from next month, and the food chain is expecting them to be a huge hit with both kids and adults.
The new toy addition comes after the huge demand in the US for collectible Pokemon trading cards which were added to Happy Meals back in February for a limited time only.
Since being added to the meals, the 25th anniversary special edition McDonald's booster pack of Pokemon cards were spotted being sold on eBay for hundreds of dollars, games website Polygon reports.
Due to many Pokemon fanatics burying the Happy Meals in bulk, in the hopes of selling the collectibles for cash, some McDonald’s even placed restrictions on people buying the Happy Meals.
McDonald's has reopened for outdoor seating at hundreds of restaurants in the past few weeks - you can check out the full list here.", "April 28 (Reuters) - EBay Inc's (EBAY.O) second-quarter profit forecast came in below market expectations as it faces fierce competition from bigger rivals including Amazon.com Inc (AMZN.O) for a slice of the pandemic-led online shopping boom, sending its shares down 6%.
While the company's focus on its advertising and payments business and a simpler e-commerce platform have benefited its business, Amazon remains a favorite online shopping destination for most consumers.
The rise of Canada's Shopify Inc (SHOP.TO), , which smashed earnings estimates earlier on Wednesday, has also piled on the pressure on eBay.
EBay said it expected current-quarter adjusted profit in the range of 91 cents to 96 cents per share, below a Refinitiv IBES estimate of $1.02 per share.
The company's operating margin rose to 27.9% in the quarter, from 26.5% a year earlier.", "We have more newslettersSomething went wrong, please try again later.
Invalid email Something went wrong, please try again later.
The 45-year-old made his second appearance at Teesside Magistrates' Court in Middlesbrough to face 19 charges.
The court heard that Woodall is accused of being a trader engaged in a commercial practice which, by omission, was misleading.
(Image: Teesside Live)The charges claim that information in adverts failed to state that the cars for sale were insurance write-offs, therefore misleading customers.", 'eBay Classifieds Group UK, which encompasses classified ads platform, Gumtree, and motoring platform, Motors.co.uk, has today announced a partnership with data connectivity platform LiveRamp® (NYSE: RAMP) to utilise its Authenticated Traffic Solution (ATS) to help improve its data-driven marketing capabilities ahead of third-party cookie deprecation.
Gumtree helps over 11.60 million unique users every month* by connecting buyers and sellers.
Gumtree’s partnership with LiveRamp will leverage this engagement to create a more personalised advertising environment across Gumtree and Motors.co.uk.
Simon Sarahs, commercial director at eBay Classifieds Group UK, says “Gumtree UK has a highly engaged user base, with in-market consumers interacting with each other to trade via our platform.
We plan to build on this user focus across Gumtree and Motors.co.uk through our partnership with LiveRamp to offer the best possible customer experience - for both users and advertisers.', 'A RARE 50p coin featuring a picture of Kew Gardens has been sold on eBay for £255.
Scarcity takes into account how in demand a coin is - and because the Kew Gardens coin is a firm favourite amongst collectors, it’s deemed to be scarce.
The rare Kew Gardens 50p is not to be confused with the same coin which was reissued in 2019.
The rare Kew Gardens 50p not the only rare coin that has been sold for hundreds recently.
Here are the five rarest 50p coins worth up to £707 revealed - and it includes the popular Kew Gardens coin.', '']

title: ['eBay and Walmart Prohibit Use of Amazon Logistics - EcommerceBytes', 'EBay says sales of sneakers and watches have accelerated, and trading cards are next - MarketWatch']
summary:
['The new solution is designed for sellers who list on eBay and Walmart, which prohibit sellers from using Amazon Logistics.
In a post on Thursday, Amazon announced:“We are adding the option to block orders from being shipped by Amazon Logistics, for a 5% surcharge.
Because sales channels like eBay and Walmart prohibit the use of Amazon Logistics, you will be able to block this shipping method at the account level within your FBA settings or for individual orders.”(We wrote about Walmart’s policy in this post from 2017.)
We’ve added the ability to track through AfterShip to ensure Amazon Logistics shipments are trackable on popular channels such as Etsy and Wish.
Check out the announcement and seller comments on Amazon Seller Central.', 'EBay Inc. says it has seen growth accelerate in two key categories, sneakers and watches, and the online e-commerce company is preparing for the sales potential in a new category, trading cards.
“In Q1, sneakers valued above $100 grew at a triple digit rate once again,” said Jaime Iannone, chief executive of eBay EBAY, during the late Wednesday earnings call.']

title: ['Wife’s fury after husband purchases £500 suit of ARMOUR on eBay after downing a few beers... - The Sun', "Tekashi 6ix9ine's Stolen Hat From Concert Listed On eBay For ... - The Blast", 'Gold-plated Nintendo Wii made for the Queen selling on eBay, $300,000 - Business Insider']
summary:
["A DAD surfing eBay after a downing a few beers found his Holy Grail — a £500 suit of armour.
But wife Selina, 45, is horrified because she has to dust and clean it.
He was like a kid.”Dom was inspired to own a suit of armour after a trip to the Netherlands when he was younger.
6 Dom has called the suit Sir-Squeak-A-Lot Credit: Triangle News6 Dom said buying a suit of armour was on his bucket list Credit: Triangle NewsIt is thought to be a 150-year-old reproduction of a suit worn on horseback by fighters.
I dread to think what’s lurking in there!”6 Selina has come to learn to live with Dom's suit of armour Credit: Triangle News", 'Earlier this month, 6ix9ine took to Instagram to revel why he stopped putting out music for a few months as well.
He explained that he wasn’t happy and that money and fame didn’t help that.
“To all my fans I love you … I’m sorry I been away from music.
The fame and the money doesn’t mean anything to me because it doesn’t bring me joy.
He blesses you in life because he sees the good in your heart and with that blessing you learn to bless others.”', 'A 24-karat gold-plated Nintendo Wii made for Queen Elizabeth II is selling on eBay .
The Queen never played the console, which was made by a video game publisher as a publicity stunt.
The seller says experts have valued it at $1 million, but he has set an asking price of $300,000.
AdvertisementA gold-plated Nintendo Wii game console custom-made for Queen Elizabeth II has gone on sale on eBay for $300,000.
THQ , a video game publisher that collapsed in 2013, made the 24-karat gold-plated console in 2009 and sent it to the Queen as a marketing stunt, the seller, Donny Fillerup, told CNN.']

title: ['EBay says open to accepting to cryptocurrencies in future, exploring ... - Reuters', 'Batman/Fortnite #2 $18 On eBay - But Where Do Coordinates Lead? - Bleeding Cool News', 'Sue Bird teams up with eBay in new sneaker campaign - NBC Sports']
summary:
['May 3 (Reuters) - EBay Inc (EBAY.O) is open to the possibility of accepting cryptocurrency as a form of payment in the future and is looking at ways to get non-fungible tokens (NFTs) on its platform, the company said on Monday.
read more"We are always looking at the most relevant forms of payment and will continue to assess that going forward.
In an interview with CNBC, Chief Executive Officer Jamie Iannone said that accepting virtual currency was an option the company was looking at.
EBay, which disappointed investors with a weak second-quarter profit forecast last week, said it was looking at a "number of ways" to get into the NFT space.
read more"We're exploring opportunities on how we can enable it (NFTs) on eBay in an easy way," Iannone said on CNBC.', '', 'The court vision, the consistency, the leadership on and off the court; 20-year WNBA veteran Sue Bird has changed the game in more ways than one.
While Bird has long been a leading activist in social justice causes off the court, she has led the Seattle Storm to four WNBA championships.
Sue Bird x eBay CampaignIt wasn’t until a couple of years ago that Bird realized how much of a sneakerhead she’s become.
Sue Bird x eBay CampaignBut one of the biggest was because of eBay’s guarantee of authenticity.
With training camp well underway, and the regular season just weeks away, what shoes will Bird don on opening night?']

title: ['Payoneer Announces Agreement with eBay - Business Wire', 'eBay Australia Moves To Stamp Out Counterfeit Sneakers ... - ChannelNews', '2021 Topps Star Wars: The Bad Batch Checklist, eBay Exclusive ... - Beckett News', 'Sneakerheads rejoice: eBay to authenticate shoe listings - Yahoo Finance Australia', 'eBay Reports on Most-Sold Items from Puerto Rico, E-commerce ... - The Weekly Journal']
summary:
['With the help of Payoneer, eBay sellers will benefit from faster access to funds, greater flexibility managing multi-currency payments and expanded reach by enabling sellers to list on multiple international eBay sites.
Effective April 2021, Payoneer is managing payouts for eBay sellers from Greater China as eBay expands its management of payments around the globe.
eBay and Payoneer intend to expand the service to additional countries later in the year.
In February 2021, Payoneer entered into a definitive agreement and plan of reorganization with FTAC Olympus Acquisition Corp in a transaction that would result in Payoneer becoming a U.S. publicly listed entity.
Nothing in this press release should be regarded as a representation by any person that the forward-looking statements set forth herein will be achieved or that any of the contemplated results of such forward-looking statements will be achieved.', 'eBay Australia plans to grab a larger slice of the $4 billion-a-year Australian sneaker market, by launching an ‘authentication guarantee’ program that aims to counter the rise of counterfeit sneakers.
The local branch is following the lead of eBay in the US, who implemented this policy after Nike and other companies boycotted the marketplace, over third-party sellers being able to easily sell counterfeit goods on the site.
“Sneakers for younger people are an aspirational luxury good – it’s art for them in the same way that others would collect art,” eBay Australia managing director Tim MacKinnon explains.
“People buy these sneakers and put them on display.”And, like the art world, the market is flooded with fakes.
MacKinnon says a pair of sneakers sells every two minutes in Australia on eBay.', '2021 Topps Star Wars: The Bad Batch Lands on eBay Share:Online exclusives are nothing new for Topps and Star Wars.
Over the years there have been plenty of releases from formal sets to evolving products like the Star Wars Living Set that aren’t distributed through traditional hobby and retail channels.
2021 Topps Star Wars: The Bad Batch takes a similar but different route.
Featuring ten cards, it introduces collectors to some of the characters found on The Bad Batch, the animated series on Disney+.
2021 Topps Star Wars: The Bad Batch trading cards at a glance:Release date: May 4, 2021Set size: 10 cardsPrint run: TBAChecklist1 The Bad Batch2 Echo3 Crosshair4 Wrecker5 Tech6 Hunter7 Fennec Shand8 Clone Captain Grey9 Omega10 Shock Trooper', 'eBay has extended its sneaker authentication process for Australians (Source: eBay)Aussie sneakerheads will be given full confidence that their online purchase is authentic with eBay announcing a free authentication process.
Nearly 90,000 sneaker listings will be authorised by a third party as eBay extends its Authenticity Guarantee program from the US.
From today, Aussies will be able to access sneaker listings directly from the US from highly sought-after sneaker brands.
Those that have been authorised by third party Sneaker Con will carry an “Authenticity Guarantee” badge.
For sneakerheads, this means that most of the badged listings will have free delivery to Australia.', 'Close Get email notifications on {{subject}} daily!
Your notification has been saved.
There was a problem saving your notification.
{{description}}Email notifications are only sent once a day, and only if there are new matching items.']

title: ['eBay Names Stefanie Jay Chief Business and Strategy Officer - PR Newswire', 'eBay reports a double-digit percentage growth in Puerto Rican sellers - newsismybusiness.com', 'Champion Tyson Fury partners with HoDooi.com to make it ‘eBay of NFTs’ - Cointelegraph']
summary:
['SAN JOSE, Calif., May 5, 2021 /PRNewswire/ -- eBay Inc. (NASDAQ: EBAY) today announced the appointment of Stefanie (Stef) Jay as Chief Business and Strategy Officer.
In this newly created role, Stefanie will lead an organization that combines Strategy, Business Operations, Analytics and Communications.
Stefanie will report directly to Jamie Iannone, eBay's Chief Executive Officer, and will join the company on May 10, 2021.
Stefanie possesses more than two decades of experience in global strategy, corporate development and general management.
"I am proud to join the eBay team," said Stefanie Jay, incoming Chief Business and Strategy Officer, eBay.', '((Credit: Alexey Novikov | Dreamstime.com)Online marketplace platform eBay has reported a significant increase in Puerto Rican sellers by a double-digit percent.
The products vary significantly, many of them were previously absent from the website before the pandemic.
“2020 changed our entire way of living, consuming, and doing business, and the increase in sales for these Puerto Rican businesses is just a proof of it,” said Ilya Kretov, general manager for Global Emerging Markets at eBay.
The analysis indicates that the three most prevalent categories in 2020 have remained the same, however, one has now ranked lower.
This year, Mexico substituted China in the fourth place of countries where Puerto Ricans exported the most on eBay.com.', 'Luczynski, now CEO of HoDooi.com, co-founded the successful blockchain travel business Travala.com before leading it to global success and eventually a high-profile merger.
He is now working to make HoDooi.com the one-stop shop to create, buy, sell and resell NFTs.
– World heavyweight boxing champion Tyson Fury training in Las Vegas and finding time to show his support for HoDooi.comSpeaking from Las Vegas where he is currently training, Fury exclaimed:“HoDooi.com will be the official NFT marketplace to launch my NFT collection.
Get ready for the release, you big dossers!”Gaps in marketAfter noticing a gap in the market for a reliable and user-friendly NFT marketplace, Luczynski set up HoDooi.com and organized this partnership, excitedly stating:“We are going to make HoDooi.com the eBay of NFTs.
Hodooi.com is the multi-chain marketplace to create, buy, sell and resell NFTs, secured by blockchain technology and powered by the HOD token.']

title: ['Partnership between Champion Tyson Fury and HooDooi.com launches an “Ebay of NFTs” - Asia Crypto Today', 'Three of the Best Sneakers to Cop on eBay AU Right Now - Complex', 'Warren Buffett wants to invest $80 billion, could buy GM, FedEx, eBay - Markets Insider', 'Marketplaces Reveal CEO Compensation: eBay, Amazon, Etsy - EcommerceBytes', 'eBay Stops Seller from Blocking Bidder Who Retracted Bid - EcommerceBytes']
summary:
['HoDooi.com is set to be the one-stop shop to create, buy, sell, and resell NFTs.
Following its anticipated launch this summer, the platform will allow users to list, auction, and bid on NFTs created anywhere.
Listed as one of HoDooi.com’s first collaborations, the collection of NFTs by Fomolabs will focus on Tyson Fury, also known as the Gypsy King.
An interview with Tyson Fury earlier provided some details about the launch of his NFT collection and sharing with his fans and the users what they have created.
Before moving and being incorporated with other compatible blockchains throughout its growth, HoDooi.com being a multi-chain platform will launch with Binance Smart Chain and Ethereum support.', 'eBay Australia has recently announced the eBay Authenticity Guarantee is now available for Australian buyers.
The giant platform has linked up with Sneaker Con to provide buyers with the piece of mind that what they’re buying is 100% genuine product.
With the stress of potentially copping fakes put to rest, we’re looking at three sneakers available now on eBay – guaranteed authentic – and in a variety of sizes, so nobody misses out.', 'Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway could spend $80 billion on acquisitions.
"We've got probably $70 or $80 billion that we'd love to put the work," Buffett said.
Looking only at market capitalizations — ignoring whether a purchase would be possible, sensible, or even legal — Buffett's $80 billion could buy Duke Energy ($76 billion), Sherwin-Williams ($75 billion), Activision Blizzard ($70 billion), or Colgate-Palmolive ($69 billion).
The conglomerate could comfortably afford Monster Beverage ($50 billion), Ford ($46 billion), Twitter ($43 billion), Chipotle ($40 billion), or eBay ($40 billion).
Buffett might struggle to spend his $80 billion for a while, but it's still worth noting the vast number of companies he could potentially buy.', "Jamie Iannone, who became CEO of eBay on April 27 of last year, received $35 million in total compensation in 2020.
That compares to nearly $1.7 million for Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos and $1.9 million for Etsy CEO Josh Silverman (or $7 million if you take into account Silverman's front-loaded grant - more on that below).
Since 2018, public companies have been required to report the CEO Pay Ratio metric, which highlights the discrepancy between CEO and average employee compensation.
*The annual total compensation of Etsy CEO Josh Silverman, was $1,934,307.
Note that Amazon also disclosed the median employee compensation was $37,930 for all US full-time Amazon employees.", "Dear Ina,Just found out at eBay if a Buyer bids your item and then retracts the bid, meaning they no longer are involved in the auction, they backed-out, and you then block them, eBay allows them to re-bid the item they retracted their bid on, even though the Buyers ID is on the Seller's Blocked Bidder List before they re-bid.
eBay informed me Buyer is only blocked from bidding on future items and can re-bid the auction or item they backed-out of.
In addition, the Blocking Email Contact from Blocked Bidders still does not function and eBay has no intention of making the function a working function as, according to the U.S. CS Rep., this would upset Buyers.
No Seller protection from eBay anymore - and eBay has practically lied, in writing, promising Seller protection which never came to pass."]

title: ["eBay adds tracked envelope option for stamp category - Linn's Stamp News", "Adam Hughes' Pop Kill #4 Cover Sells For Over $1000 On eBay - Bleeding Cool News", 'eBay is officially dropping PayPal – No more middle man - Poc Network', 'Top items to resell on eBay UK now to make a big profit - The Mirror', 'Woman, 51, transforms home with £1 bargains from B&M, eBay, Poundland and Dunelm - Liverpool Echo']
summary:
['May 7, 2021, 9 AMThe online marketplace eBay is offering its new standard envelope with tracking for the stamps category.
The tracking works when the letter-processing equipment scans the Intelligent MailPhilatelic Foreword by Jay BigalkeThe online sales marketplace eBay has extended its new postage option with tracking, called “eBay standard envelope,” to stamps and a few other collectibles as well.
Sellers of stamps, coins and postcards are now able to use this option for shipping, but there are restrictions for all.
For stamps, eBay states that no more than 10 stamps or three postcards or postal history items can be shipped, and that plate blocks are allowed if they fit the standard envelope dimensions.
The shipping option is available for machineable envelopes that weigh up to 3 ounces.', '', 'In fact, it was supposed to happen last year but likely got delayed because of everything the world has been going through.
An email has been making its way to eBay users, informing them of the new change.
eBay signed into an agreement with Adyen back in 2018, to become the company’s official payment processor.
eBay is giving users until May 28 (2021) to update their information so that their accounts are ready to go as things transition.
This will likely be a noticeable blow to PayPal as eBay has been in such a close relationship with the company since 2002.', 'Your unwanted items might be taking up space in your home, but they can also earn you some serious cash on eBayTop items to resell on eBay UK now to make a big profitIf your home is feeling cluttered after months under lockdown, then it might be time to do a big clear out.
New research from eBay UK suggests that Brits are having a mass clear out to help fund their post-lockdown lives.
Now, over one in four are eager to sell their unwanted items to fund pub outings, new outfits or staycations as restrictions ease.
"Now really is the time to sell, as there is a big appetite for pre-loved items on eBay UK.
Five second-hand purchases were made every second in 2021 as customers seek out more sustainable and affordable preloved items, perhaps reinventing their style after a year at home."', 'A woman with her own home-based business transformed her house with £1 B&M and Facebook Marketplace bargains.
She said: "I spent £55 on the furniture and managed to upcycle it for a profit, selling it for £300."
Rachel said: "I got a lot of items from Facebook Marketplace, sales and spare items left from other projects.
"The small dusky blush unit under the stairs was £5, and I painted a radiator cover I bought for £30 on Facebook Marketplace.
"Finding hidden treasures from places such as Facebook Marketplace is ideal for those who see potential in a piece which can be given new life with a makeover."']

title: ['LH, like new: 1994 Chrysler Concorde on eBay Motors has just 987 miles - Autoblog', 'Mrs Hinch shows off ‘amazing’ eBay temporary tattoos for eyebrows – but ends up with creepy ‘hairs’ on her... - The Irish Sun', 'Rare Olympic swimming 50p coin sells for £1,000 on eBay – how to spot if you have one... - The Sun', 'eBay Selling Strategy: Auction versus Buy It Now - EcommerceBytes', 'eBay Rolls Out New Unpaid Item Policy, May 2021 - EcommerceBytes', 'eBay Blocks Sellers from Seeing Who Follows Them - EcommerceBytes']
summary:
["The headline vehicle for that turnaround was the company's trio of LH-platform cars, among them the Chrysler Concorde.
To get a sense of exactly what that car was like, we can't imagine there's a better example than this 1994 Chrysler Concorde for sale right now on eBay Motors.
The Concorde was introduced for 1993 alongside the Dodge Intrepid and the Eagle Vision (remember Eagle division?).
Impressed by the LH sedans' spacious interiors and competent handling, and enthralled with brash-talking, cigar-chomping Chrysler executive Bob Lutz, the automotive media heaped praise on the trio.
Check out the commercial below, to see how Chrysler pitched the '94 Concorde when it was new:", "MRS Hinch has shown off the “amazing” temporary eyebrow tattoos she picked up on eBay - but was left with “growths” on her arm after trying them out.
The cleaning guru, real name Sophie Hinchliffe, shared her bargain beauty purchase with her Instagram followers.
4 Mrs Hinch has revealed the bargain £6 eyebrow tattoos she picked up on eBay Credit: InstagramShe revealed that she had picked up the £6 tattoos from the auction site after spotting them on a beauty Instagram account @danigmakeup.
4 The cleaning guru tried the tattoos out on her arm Credit: Instagram4 But she quickly found that they were tricky to get off Credit: InstagramAnd Mrs Hinch was thrilled with the results.
!”4 Sophie normally has her brows microbladed but can't currently have them done Credit: Mrs Hinch/InstagramHowever, Sophie, who is currently pregnant with her second child, soon encountered a problem when the brows refused to budge.", "A RARE Olympic swimming 50p coin has sold on eBay for almost £1,000 - and you could have one in your change at home too.
But the reason this particular coin is so valuable is that it is actually an error coin.
But remember, there's a difference between a genuine error coin and one that is just imperfect, for example with a design that is not as clear as you'd expect.
Coin Hunter has a tool that reveals how much your rare 50p coin is really worth on eBay.
We've put together a roundup of the rarest and most valuable 50p coins so that you can check your change.", 'Should I sell my items as an auction on eBay?
Prior to a decade or so ago, the only option that was available was an auction format.
When eBay first introduced the BIN format, many people were very reluctant to dive in, having seen so much success from running auctions for so long.
Many times, a BIN listing can sell for 20%, 30% or even more than what an auction listing may sell for.
I have found that the auction format works for these items because it creates a sense of urgency for the buyer.', 'eBay sellers can now cancel orders if the buyer hasn’t paid within 4 days.
In reminding sellers of the new policy, eBay updated one key detail:“In our communication in the 2021 Spring Seller Update, we announced that you would be able to cancel an unpaid transaction after 5 calendar days.
Instead, when buyers haven’t paid, you’ll be able to manually or automatically cancel orders through Seller Hub or My eBay Sold.
If they haven’t paid within that time frame, you can cancel the unpaid order starting on the 5th calendar day.
Other changes announced as part of the eBay Spring Seller Update 2021 are rolling out, you can find EcommerceBytes sellers’ guide to the latest update on this page.', 'eBay stopped allowing sellers to see who "follows" them, which hampers repeat sales, some sellers said.
"I am just one of a number of Sellers who has asked eBay why they did this as well as requested that we be given access to those who Follow us," Mr. L. said.
When it first happened, sellers found a workaround, but by October, eBay had plugged the "loophole" and sellers were again no longer able to see their followers.
"As I list several items, I'll check my favorite "sellers" page to see if I'm listing something of interest."
Mr. L. pointed us to numerous threads where sellers bemoaned eBay's removal of the feature.']

title: ["eBay user flogs rare '50p error coin' marking London Olympics for whopping £1,000 - Daily Star"]
summary:
['Something went wrong, please try again later.
Invalid email Something went wrong, please try again later.
A rare 50p "error coin" marking the London 2012 Olympic Games has sold on eBay for a whopping £1,000.
A total of 29 different 50p designs were created to commemorate the games, each featuring a different sport, the Mirror reports.
The 50p coin making news now was originally listed for 1p on eBay but after receiving 65 bids, 15 buyers had soon pushed it up to £955.']

title: ['Savvy mum creates dream bedroom from items off Amazon and eBay saving nearly £2,000 - The Mirror', 'New eBay rules mean a third party can now remove listings without telling you first - The Mirror', "Tokyo's vintage video game store Super Potato is now on eBay - Time Out"]
summary:
['Elizabeth Miller, 41, used products from Facebook Marketplace, Amazon and eBay to transform the basic room into just what her daughter Lily, 16, wanted - a Gothic paradise.
Finding what my daughter wanted on eBay for just under £2,000 made an upcycle a necessity rather than a choice.
"I started scouring Facebook Marketplace for old furniture I could pull mouldings from and took inspiration from upcycle websites and the Frenchic Fan Forum."
Elizabeth's first big bargain was the bed frame, bought on Facebook Marketplace for £100, reports the Liverpool Echo.
Image: Elizabeth Miller) Elizabeth Miller)"The bed had been a cherished piece of furniture previously and I was nervous about such an extreme change especially as the seller had asked to see the finished piece.', 'Online seller eBay says it is handing regulators the power to take down dangerous listings without consulting the companyNew eBay rules mean a third party can now remove listings without telling you firstEbay is changing its rules to allow third parties to take down listings that could be considered a safety risk or in breach of consumer rights.
The online marketplace, which has more than 27million customers worldwide, has partnered with 50 trading authorities to help filter through its 1.3billion listings.
Investigators have previously found unsafe electrical appliances, toys, and batteries for sale on a wide range of online marketplaces - including Amazon and the Chinese site Wish.
Allowing it to monitor listings means it can block devices which might affect connection for customers in the UK.
Ebay told The Mirror the new measures will speed up the removal of potentially fraudulent or harmful listings.', 'You can now buy retro video games and classic consoles from Japan and have them shipped internationallyGamers never forget their first video game console.
At video game megastore Super Potato, anyone looking to revisit the relics of their childhood can find everything from early editions of Super Mario Bros to rare Japan-only games you’ve probably never heard of.
View this post on Instagram A post shared by スーパーポテト秋葉原店 (@superpotatoakihabara)Luckily, Super Potato has just established an eBay store catering specifically to overseas shoppers.
Those residing in Japan don’t need to use the eBay shop as Super Potato already has an online store with domestic shipping.
The Japanese shop even offers to replace batteries and repair your old consoles that no longer work, so you can keep that video game nostalgia going.']

title: ["You can now buy NFTs on eBay, and 'blockchain-driven collectibles ... - The Verge", 'eBay to launch lending service for sellers struggling to access Covid ... - Guernsey Press', 'eBay embraces NFTs - TechCrunch', 'EBay taps into NFT frenzy, allows sale on platform - Reuters', "eBay DOWN: 'Embarrassing' error message displayed as site offline - Express"]
summary:
['eBay is now allowing NFTs to be sold on its platform, making the digital collectibles available side by side with physical ones.
At the moment, eBay wants to make sure that NFTs are listed by trusted sellers, and only in certain categories like trading cards, music, entertainment, and art.
NFTs allow you to buy and sell ownership of unique digital items and keep track of who owns them using the blockchain.
The first result when searching “NFT” on eBay, to the surprise of no one.
The blog post also mentions future updates to allow “blockchain-driven collectables,” though it doesn’t expand on what that means outside of NFTs.', 'Online retailer eBay is launching a new money-lending service for business sellers on its platform after finding many struggled to access Government loan schemes during the Covid-19 pandemic.
Bosses have teamed up with fintech firm YouLend and will allow 300,000 small and medium-sized firms who use eBay to access loans of between £500 and £1 million.
“It’s been apparent for online businesses that they haven’t had access to the capital that they’ve needed.
The boss added that traditional high street lenders had been overwhelmed with loan applications from businesses that have struggled during Covid-19.
The eBay chief explained: “Traditional routes like banks are more sceptical to businesses that are online or in the marketplace model.', 'eBay is joining the NFT frenzy, telling Reuters today that going forward it will allow the sales of NFTs on its platform, a mainstream embrace that follows billions of dollars in NFT purchases over the past few months.
“In the coming months, eBay will add new capabilities that bring blockchain-driven collectibles to our platform,” eBay exec Jordan Sweetnam told them.
eBay has invested heavily in infrastructure for physical collectibles like trading cards, as well as items like sneakers and watches which they help verify for buyers.
Earlier this week, executives at eBay said they were open to accepting cryptocurrencies in the future.
This news comes as the Ethereum cryptocurrency, which is the primary method of purchase for most NFTs, reaches past all-time-highs, currently trading over $4,100.', 'May 11 (Reuters) - Ebay Inc (EBAY.O)on Tuesday allowed the sale of non-fungible tokens for digital collectibles like trading cards, images or video clips on its platform, the first e-commerce company to tap into the recent frenzy around NFTs.
These could range from something like Kurt Cobain's last photoshoot to historic moments from NBA games.
While anyone can view the NFTs for free, the buyer has the status of being the official owner - a kind of digital bragging rights.
"In the coming months, eBay will add new capabilities that bring blockchain-driven collectibles to our platform," said Jordan Sweetnam, senior vice president and general manager for eBay's North America market.
NFTs are usually bought with the cryptocurrency ether or in dollars and the blockchain keeps a record of transactions.', 'Independent tracking website DownDetector, which monitors mentions across social media to track when web services are offline, is suggesting that hundreds of eBay users are currently experiencing the outage.
In fact, at the time of writing, there are some 900 complaints that users can't access the site.
If you're trying and failing to access eBay this morning, it seems you are not alone.
Some fans of the service can't access the site or app whilst others are seeing an error message which says, "Well this is embarrassing.
My selling page to edit stock listings etc is down currently.']

title: ['Bargain hunter explains eBay hacks to get new jeans and even furniture for 99p - The Mirror', 'Anthony Edwards Rookie Card Roundup, Hottest eBay Auctions - Sports Collectors Daily', 'You Can Now Buy And Sell NFTs On eBay - We are Social Media', 'Former Island Line Train Goes Up For Sale On Ebay - Isle of Wight Radio', 'Pub landlord buys £5k fire engine off eBay and turned it into an attraction - Nottinghamshire Live', "eBay Kills PowerSeller Program: 'A Sad Day Indeed' - EcommerceBytes"]
summary:
['Tom Church, co-founder of Latest Deals, managed to snag a pair of brand new Levi’s jeans for 99p after looking for last-minute itemsBargain hunter explains eBay hacks to get new jeans and even furniture for 99pBargain hunters have explained how to nab 99p deals on bidding site eBay - including new clothes and furniture for a fraction of the RRP.
In one case, he managed to snag a pair of brand new Levi’s jeans for 99p after looking for last-minute items that hadn’t already been bid on.
Finally, be aware of scammers and be sure what you’re bidding on is genuine.
Tom said: “In the fight between eBay and Facebook Marketplace, eBay is still king when it comes to finding the best bargains.
“I bought a pair of new Levi jeans for just 99p when looking for last-minute items without bids.', '', 'After hinting at its interest in cryptocurrencies and NFTs recently, eBay has now announced that you can buy NFTs on its platform.
eBay has always been the best place to go to buy and sell collectibles, and this is extending to digital high-end collectibles as well – NFTs.
Related | EBay May Soon Start Accepting Cryptocurrencies As Form Of PaymentEarlier this month, we wrote that the company was examining the possibility of bringing NFTs (non-fungible tokens) to its platform.
The initial rollout of this functionality will help the company find out more about what its community wants, and in the future, will launch programs, policies, and tools that make buying and selling NFTs easier – across more categories.
In the next few months, eBay says it will “add new capabilities that bring blockchain-driven collectibles” to its platformYou might also likeMore from Tech', 'A former Island Line train has appeared for sale on eBay.
The 1938 Tube Stock London Underground Carriage EMU Class 483 - which served the Island for decades - was removed from the tracks in March.
It served the Island from the late 1980s.
A £26 million upgrade to the South Western Railway network is expected to be completed this summer, following delays.
The train is based in London, where the seller says it can be collected.', 'Something went wrong, please try again later.
Invalid email Something went wrong, please try again later.
"There's a pub in Suffolk that's got a vintage one in the garden," he added.
As well as revamping the main bar, the function room has had a makeover and is now taking bookings.
Outdoor seating has been increased from 40 when he first acquired the pub to 250.', 'It came without warning in the middle of the night - a notice of the death of the eBay PowerSeller program.
"Just received this message from eBay that they are retiring the PowerSeller program, see below.
The eBay email subject line read: "(User name), we're retiring the PowerSeller program."
While the PowerSeller program is part of eBay's heritage and has provided a meaningful badge for sellers, it now exists alongside eBay's Top Rated Seller program.
But the eventual demise of the PowerSeller program seemed inevitable once eBay launched the Top Rated Seller program in 2009.']

title: ['Mansfield manager stole Donington Park Circuit work equipment to sell on eBay - Nottinghamshire Live', "Channel 4 star George Clarke's chest hair selling for £300 on eBay - Metro.co.uk", 'CorningWare dishes selling for thousands of dollars on eBay - 7NEWS', 'Stunning News: eBay Kills off Adult Only Category - EcommerceBytes', 'eBay Continues Advance Into Financial Services With Launch of ... - The Fintech Times']
summary:
['It was at Donington Park motor racing circuit that Adam Bacon, of Mansfield, was first found to be stealing £800 from the sale of scrap metal belonging to his employers, MotorSport Vision (MSV).
The barrister added that Bacon had since sought help, stopped gambling and was abstinent from alcohol.
"His house will be sold and he will walk away with nothing, it caused the end of his marriage," added Mr Varley.
Bacon, of Lindhurst Lane, Mansfield, is now on a £65-a-week work placement scheme, with a view to becoming a self-employed maintenance man.
Bacon was given a 16 month jail sentence, suspended for two years, and will have to carry out 200 hours of unpaid work.', 'George Clarke is selling his ‘used’ chest hair on ebay for charity (Picture: Rex/ebay)George Clarke would consider shaving his head for charity after he was stunned to see people make serious bids on eBay for a bit of his ‘used’ chest hair.
The property expert is definitely game to donate hair from, erm, other areas to charity (meaning his head, obviously).
‘I’m very thankful that I’ve got a very full thick head of hair in my middle age.
I’ve been told I’m never gonna go bald because it’s such a thick head of hair which is good.
I think that’s amazing.’The winning bidder – who put up £310 – will not only get his actual chest hair gift-wrapped in ‘a smart jewellery box’ but some signed books and a thank you video from the man himself.', 'Your old CorningWare dishes stashed in your pantry could be worth thousands of dollars.
Collectors are on the hunt for ‘rare’ CorningWare designs and are willing to pay megabucks for it.
Boomers are decorating with these pieces in their homes.”Your old CorningWare dishes could land you a nice little pay day.
Vintage Cabbage Patch Dolls are selling for big money on eBay in Australia.
An Australian seller has this vintage Cabbage Patch Doll listed for $899.', 'eBay is eliminating the "Adult Only" category in a stunning development.
Not all Adult Only category items will be allowed to be relisted.
To determine which items can be revised and relisted in an appropriate eBay category, please see below.
The email included charts showing which items sellers would be barred from selling entirely and which items sellers could move to other categories.
But in February 2020 , former eBay executive Marni Levine, in addressing questions about Managed Payments category exclusions, said they would all be included eventually.', '']

title: ['eBay Is Banning Hentai and Other Adult Content - VICE', "EBay to close 'adults-only' section - Silicon Valley Business Journal - The Business Journals", '£1 coin with huge minting error sells for £250 on eBay – how to find one... - The Sun', "Was Harry Styles' Puke Really Sold on eBay? - Showbiz Cheat Sheet"]
summary:
['eBay has announced that it will be closing the site’s “adult-only” section and banning the sale of most adult content and items, Adult Video News first reported Thursday.
In a new “Adult Items Policy” posted on eBay’s website, the e-commerce giant stated that “sexually-oriented” content including sexually explicit films, anime, and books would no longer be allowed on the platform.
AdvertisementIn a statement to Motherboard, an eBay spokesperson said the move was in the interest of safety.
“Starting June 15, 2021, items showing sexual content or sexually suggestive poses will no longer be allowed on eBay.com.
No new listings will be allowed in the Adult Only category and good-til-cancelled listings will be ended upon their renewal date.', '', "A RARE £1 coin with a huge minting error on it has sold for over £255 on eBay after collectors locked horns in a bidding war for it.
They tend to be high in demand by collectors, because it's pretty rare if error coins make it into circulation.
The error coin sold was a new £1 coin which replaced the old “round pound” back in 2017.
The best way to find out if your error coin is genuine RARE and valuable coins can go for a hefty sum - but how do you know if your coin is the result of a genuine minting error?
But remember, there's a difference between a genuine error coin and one that is just imperfect, for example with a design that is not as clear as you'd expect.", 'Teen heartthrobs like Harry Styles are nothing new in the music industry, but lately, some fans have taken devotion to young stars to new extremes.
Harry Styles’ fans though were particularly maniacal in their love of the pop star.
After some run-ins with the sometimes ludicrous antics of his fans, Styles knew he had really achieved superstardom.
Harry Styles | David M. Benett/Getty ImagesThird place winnersSo many memories ❤️ Thanks for celebrating with us!
Still, at the astronomical level of success Styles is at, it’s tough to blame fans for being a bit … well, fanatical.']

title: ["Ebay's new adult item ban makes absolutely zero sense - Mashable"]
summary:
['Long story short: Ebay recently announced a new policy restricting the sale of "Adult items" (opens in a new tab) on its online marketplace.
As a marketplace Ebay has the right to determine what can or cannot be sold on its domain, but that doesn't make the specifics of this adult items ban any less bizarre.
Some of the rules have nonsensical exceptions that make almost no sense if the intention is to keep adult items off the site, and the rest of them are simply worded incomprehensibly.
For example, adult magazines are banned except for Playboy, Playgirl, Penthouse, and Mayfair, for reasons the policy does not bother to explain.
The consequences for violating this new ban on adult items ranges from de-listing of the specific item to account suspension.']

title: ['eBay to Let Canadian Sellers Opt for US Dollars - EcommerceBytes']
summary:
['eBay will begin letting sellers in Canada receive payouts in US dollars.
It’s a big deal, since many Canadian eBay sellers do a majority of their business on eBay.com.
“We are pleased to announce that this functionality is rolling out over the coming weeks,” eBay announced.
“Starting May 4th, Canadian business sellers or sellers by invitation will be able to register for this program and choose the payout option that best suits the needs of their business.”But sellers should put thought into their decision, since they won’t be able to change their payout currency after they register.
eBay explains, “If you want to accept both Canadian and US dollars, you will need to operate two separate accounts: one to list on eBay.ca to receive payouts in Canadian dollars; and another to list on eBay.com to receive payouts in US dollars.”Canadian sellers should be aware that they need a US dollar denominated checking account from a Canadian bank if they wish to receive payouts in US dollars.']

title: ['eBay Names Steve Priest Chief Financial Officer - PR Newswire', 'Ebay Motor Scam Explained And How To Avoid It - HotCars', 'EBay Appoints Steve Priest As New CFO - Nasdaq']
summary:
['SAN JOSE, Calif., May 17, 2021 /PRNewswire/ -- eBay Inc. (NASDAQ: EBAY) today announced it has named Steve Priest Chief Financial Officer.
Steve will report directly to Jamie Iannone, eBay's Chief Executive Officer, and will join the company on June 21, 2021.
Most recently Steve served as JetBlue's Chief Financial Officer where he was responsible for all disciplines of the finance function, as well as strategic sourcing and infrastructure development.
"I am proud to be joining the pioneer of ecommerce," said Steve Priest, incoming Chief Financial Officer, eBay.
Interim CFO, Andy Cring, will continue in his role until Steve joins eBay at the end of June.', '', '(RTTNews) - eBay Inc. (EBAY) Monday said it has appointed Steve Priest as its new Chief Financial Officer.
In the his role as Financial Chief, Steve will oversee all global aspects of eBay's financial operations including controllership, financial planning and analysis, tax, treasury, audit, mergers and acquisitions, and investor relations.
Most recently Steve served as JetBlue's Chief Financial Officer where he was responsible for all disciplines of the finance function, as well as strategic sourcing and infrastructure development.
"I am proud to be joining the pioneer of ecommerce," said Steve Priest, incoming Chief Financial Officer, eBay.
I look forward to helping the company pursue its goal of becoming the best global ecommerce marketplace for buyers and sellers."']

['Got Unworn Kicks and Closet Castoffs? Read This Pro’s Top Tips Before You Sell Your Merch - Rolling Stone', 'eBay Adopts AsyncAPI for Asynchronous API Contracts - InfoQ.com']
summary:
['Donating your closet castoffs is one option, but you can also try to get a decent return on your sartorial investment by selling your unworn or gently-used merch online.
And what are the best ways to make sure you get the most money back from your unworn wares?
Related StoriesCommission and selling fees: For sellers listing 200 items or less, eBay does not charge an insertion or listing fee.
For other items that sell, there’s a final value fee of two to 12.85 percent depending on the product’s category.
Commission and fees: Listing fee of 20 cents, five percent transaction fee, payment processing fee of three percent plus 25 cents.', 'eBay recently announced that it adopted AsyncAPI for its external asynchronous API contracts.
In March 2021, eBay launched its first AsyncAPI-based contracts for its new business event notification capabilities.
Late last year, eBay initiated work on a new event notification platform designed to meet current and future demands for asynchronous communication to API partners.
AsyncAPI is an open specification meant to be an industry standard for defining asynchronous APIs.
The Linux foundations announced this March that it would host the AsyncAPI Initiative, providing a forum where individuals and organizations can advance AsyncAPI and nurture collaboration.']

summary:
['The "Fake Tracking Number" scam perpetrated by bad sellers isn't new, but I happened to have been contacted by several eBay buyers in the past 2 weeks complaining about it.
The seller uploads USPS tracking, which shows delivery to YOUR zip.
In 2015, a reader emailed us about the problem of fake tracking numbers .
So why six years later are we still hearing from buyers who were defrauded in this manner and reporting that eBay ruled in the sellers' favor?
The clincher, though, is this story from 2019 about a pair of sellers accused by the Department of Justice of perpetrating fraud using the fake tracking number scam.', '', 'The "Fake Tracking Number" scam perpetrated by bad sellers isn't new, but I happened to have been contacted by several eBay buyers in the past 2 weeks complaining about it.
The seller uploads USPS tracking, which shows delivery to YOUR zip.
In 2015, a reader emailed us about the problem of fake tracking numbers .
So why six years later are we still hearing from buyers who were defrauded in this manner and reporting that eBay ruled in the sellers' favor?

eBay said it's part of their new policy for managed payments.
S.eBayImportant information regarding your payoutsHello (User name redacted),Your payouts have been temporarily placed on hold while we review some details.
Please allow up to 5 days for this review to take place.
It was sent from an address that doesn't accept incoming email.", 'AN eBay seller has made more than £2,500 by selling old empty crisp packets from the 1980s online.
UK sellers have made almost 350 sales of old crisp packets on eBay in the last three months alone, according to MSEBut crisp packets are not the only pieces of vintage rubbish that people can make money from online.
Buyers will spend money on all sorts of old packaging from old toilet roll tubes and empty jam jars.
Chapman told the Sun she is "thrilled and surprised" by how much she's earned from her old crisp packet collection.
This means selling items individually is only worth it if you can flog them for a decent price.', 'About once a month, Sony’s flagship WH-1000XM4 noise-canceling headphones get a $72 price cut at a few retailers.

title: ['eBay Officially Bans Sale Of Adult-Only Anime, Manga, and Video ... - Bounding Into Comics', 'Lindenhurst man accused of stealing school equipment, selling it on ... - Daily Herald', 'Seeking good home for synagogue bimah, found on eBay - The Jewish Chronicle']

According to the new “Adult Items Policy”, which is set to take effect on July 15th, 2021, eBay will soon prohibit “Sexually oriented materials, including items containing nudity and displays of sexual activitys [sic]” from being sold through the popular online auction house.
