Let us know your thoughts on social media or in the comments down below!', '', '']

title: ['eBay and Etsy Send Urgent Pleas to Sellers on Saturday - EcommerceBytes']
summary:
['eBay and Etsy sent urgent emails to sellers over the weekend about legislation in Congress that the marketplaces say would harm small sellers and that Etsy says would put sellers’ safety at risk.
Etsy’s email also asked sellers to contact their senators about the bill that it said would put the privacy, safety, and security of home-based sellers at risk.
On a page on its website, Etsy stated:“The US Senate is considering new legislation called the INFORM Act, which would require Etsy to collect, verify, and display seller contact information on product listing pages.
“Lawmakers have simply not considered how this bill would impact the privacy, safety, and security of Etsy sellers who run their businesses from their homes.
Think they’ll comply?”Both emails linked to pages on the respective marketplaces’ websites that allowed sellers to easily contact lawmakers about the issue through an online form.']

title: ['After finding their old school on eBay, Kan. community works to save ... - Salina Post', 'CoryxKenshin autographed PlayStation 4 hits eBay for US$25000 - Notebookcheck.net']
summary:
['', "Although there is nothing special about it hardware-wise, the Slim 1 TB PlayStation 4 autographed by the popular online player CoryxKenshin is now up for sale on eBay with a starting price of no less than US$25,000.
While a starting price on eBay doesn't necessarily reflect the value of a product, it is worth taking a closer look at what appears to be the most expensive PlayStation 4 so far: no less than US$25,000 starting price for a slim 1 TB console.
The console was taken out only two times: when CoryxKenshin autographed it, and when the seller had to take the shots for the eBay listing.
While we all can agree that the US$25,000 price tag is simply insane, the good part is that the seller is also open to negotiation.
Buy the Sony PlayStation 4 Slim (1 TB) on Amazon"]

title: ['Is eBay safe? Yes, but its protections tend to favor buyers - Business Insider', 'New eBay fees reduce cost but take longer - Punchline Gloucester', 'Ebay scammer tricks teen out of over £8000 for fake tractor - Cornwall Live']
summary:
["eBay is safe thanks to its Money Back Guarantee, but some experts are critical of the protections in place for sellers on the site.
eBay is more than 25 years old and has developed some robust protections for buyers and sellers in its history.
With age often comes maturity and security, but wondering about the safety of using eBay is a valid concern.
eBay is relatively safe to useThe good news is that using eBay, particularly as a buyer, is considered safe.
But eBay's protections aren't as robust for sellers, said Aaron Bossig, a former eBay seller.", "A shake up of payment processing at eBay means it could cost Gloucestershire residents and businesses a little less to use the service but payment will take longer.
eBay is moving its payment processing away from PayPal and will instead handle it themselves.
Paypal currently gets 2.9 per cent and 30p per transaction, with eBay taking up to 10 per cent, depending on the item.
Money will go straight into sellers' banks accounts and sellers can also choose to have these payments scheduled to drop in their accounts daily or weekly.
Money from sales will no longer be paid into your PayPal account and you'll have to connect a bank account to receive payment.", 'An eBay scammer tricked a Cornish teen out of his life savings of thousands of pounds and crushed his dream of owning his own tractor.
That's the message of Rachel Waters from Hayle, whose son Harvey, lost £8,400 through a bogus seller on eBay.
According to Rachel, Harvey has wanted his own tractor since he was a young child.
After raising an incredible £8,400 he spotted an advertisement for a John Deere tractor on eBay.
Meanwhile, Harvey has lost all his life savings and has been left feeling "devastated" with his "confidence in tatters".']

title: ['eBay car scam gang lured victims before attacking them with machetes - trial - Manchester Evening News', 'How To Make Money on eBay: Your 2021 Guide to Selling - GOBankingRates', 'Home teeth whitening kits for sale on Amazon, eBay and Wish ‘can burn gums’, warns Which?... - The Sun', 'We bought a World War II ship on eBay - CNN', 'Ads from eBay, AAMI and Nescafé ranked the most creative by ... - Marketing magazine Australia', "People Are Flogging Aldi's Sold-Out Cat Chair On eBay - Tyla"]
summary:
["A gang used fake eBay car sales to lure innocent users before brutally robbing them, a jury heard.
Jurors at Manchester Crown Court heard how a member of the team would start by placing cheap vehicles for sale on eBay.
Victims were subjected to terrifying violence and robbed of considerable sums of money.”The court heard how different mobile phone numbers were activated before carrying out each alleged scam.
The court heard how he was dressed all in black and had a large machete in his hand.
Once you're there, put your email address where it says at the top, then tick the MEN Court News box.", 'And if you’re not selling and making money on eBay, why not?
There’s an opportunity to make big money on eBay if you know what to sell and when to sell it.
On its website, eBay lists about three dozen categories of merchandise that are the most popular, and sellers are making money on eBay from them.
Reserve price: In some selling categories, eBay will allow you to set a reserve price.
And while you shouldn’t expect such a return, yard sales and garage sales are a great place to spot potential eBay items at rock-bottom prices.', 'TEETH whitening kits that you can easily buy online could be dangerous and even burn your gums, Which?
Kits for sale on Amazon, eBay, Wish and AliExpress were found to contain illegally high or dangerous levels of hydrogen peroxide.
tests were found to have more than 100 times the legal limit for hydrogen peroxide.
was a bleaching gel syringe containing 30.7% hydrogen peroxide for sale on AliExpress for just 85p.
"It's clear that self-regulation is not working, leaving people exposed to a flood of unsafe products online."', 'CNN —Scrolling through eBay looking at listings for broken-down boats is something of a ritual for Simon Robins, who spends much of his spare time rescuing and renovating crumbling vessels.
Preserving historyGemma and Simon Robins bought this 80-year-old former World War II ship from eBay in January.
Andrew Price/View Finder PicturesDuring World War II, as part of the ML Flotilla, the ship served as a navigation leader in Operation Neptune, the pivotal seaborne invasion of northern France known as D-Day.
As he and Gemma have no use for a war ship, the couple aren’t planning to restore the vessel to its original glory.
The old diesel engines on the World War II ship, which served as a navigation leader in Operation Neptune.', 'Kantar Australia announced the 10 most creatively effective ads of 2020 as judged by Aussie consumers.
Ads from eBay, AAMI and Nescafé were the most effective at engaging Aussies during a pandemic-driven year.
These were chosen from more than 100 Australian ads tested using Kantar’s validated ad testing solution, Link.
Katalbas-Hagamann added that those ads that were authentic and focused on having a local lens were the most effective for Australians.
Daren Poole, Kantar’s global head of creative, commented that those advertisers that actively communicate with consumers during critical times have better engagement.', "Aldi is renowned for their affordable and chic furniture products and the latest to be in high demand is the sold-out cat chair.
Advert 10One 'buy it now' listing is selling the cat chair for £69.99.
The cat chair is inspired by Aldi's human-sized hanging chair which is one of their most popular furniture items.
As part of the new Eco Pet range, the cat egg chair is made from hand-woven natural wicker and hanging from a strong metal frame.
Alongside the egg chair, a cat igloo was also available (Credit: Aldi)The chair promises not only to be a secure place for your cat to perch, but also optimum comfort, with a removable inner cushion."]

title: ["The Problem With eBay's Required Item Specifics - EcommerceBytes", "Sunderland fan slammed for selling Adam Johnson's boots for £49 on eBay - The Mirror", "Disgraced Ex-Sunderland Star Adam Johnson's Boots Shockingly Sold On eBay By Fan - SPORTbible"]
summary:
['eBay seller Don Heiden, aka the Auction Professor, discusses his experiences with eBay’s recent changes to Categories and Item Specifics.
That was until eBay started forcing required Item Specifics onto sellers.
I have even struggled with some Item Specifics in categories I have sold in for two decades, or more.
Still other required Item Specifics will only have one single option, which is the case in the record category, also.
In the end, 4,200 listings had all of eBay’s recommend item specifics filled in.', 'The video will auto-play soon 8 CancelA Sunderland fan has been heavily criticised for selling football boots on eBay that belonged to former footballer Adam Johnson, who was charged with child sex crimesSunderland fan slammed for selling Adam Johnson's boots for £49 on eBayDisgraced footballer Adam Johnson's old boots have been sold by a warped fan on eBay.
The winger scored a penalty in the boots - which are bizarrely a size 7.25 - and was still being selected for Sunderland despite his impending trial.
The description read: "Rare Adam Johnson's match worn boots v Newcastle United in Sunderland's 3-0 victory at the Stadium of Light 25/10/15.
The £60,000-a-week ace had been texting the Sunderland fan - who he knew was 15 - and they engaged in sexual activity just weeks before his girlfriend gave birth.
The tricky winger played for Middlesbrough, Manchester City and Sunderland in the Premier League between 2005 and 2016.', 'Published 17:26 , 26 May 2021 BST | Last updated 17:27 , 26 May 2021 BSTDisgraced ex-Premier League star Adam Johnson's footie boots have shockingly been sold on eBay by a Sunderland fan, according to reports.
Advert 10The boots, which were an unusual 7.25 size, were eventually sold on eBay for £49 and a £3.85 postage fee.
Credit: eBayAccording to The Mirror, Johnson's old boots were on sale for £10 and managed to attract a staggering 14 bids.
Advert 10"Rare Adam Johnson's match worn boots v Newcastle United in Sunderland's 3-0 victory at the Stadium of Light 25/10/15," reads the description.
However, the eBay seller was blasted by rival fans for trying to cash in on the convicted paedophile's boots.']

title: ['Amazon and EBay Would Face Counterfeit Liability Under New Bill - Bloomberg', 'Rare £2 error coin sells for £138 on eBay – how to spot one in your change... - The Sun']
summary:
['Why did this happen?
Please make sure your browser supports JavaScript and cookies and that you are not blocking them from loading.
For more information you can review our Terms of Service and Cookie Policy.', "A RARE £2 coin with a minting error has sold for £138 on eBay after eight collectors went head to head in a bidding war for it.
The other side of the coin, which features the “Standing on the Shoulders of Giants” design, also has the same minting error.
The best way to find out if your error coin is genuine RARE and valuable coins can go for a hefty sum - but how do you know if your coin is the result of a genuine minting error?
But remember, there's a difference between a genuine error coin and one that is just imperfect, for example with a design that is not as clear as you'd expect.
A rare HG Wells £2 error coin could be worth up to £1,000 according to experts – here's how to spot if you have one."]

title: ['John Lewis Appoints EBay’s Rosie Hanley As Head Of Brand ... - The Drum']
summary: ['John Lewis has hired eBay’s Rosie Hanley as head of brand and marketing, the latest recruit to fill a gap left by a series of exits from its marketing team.\nJohn Lewis hires Rosie HanleyHanley has been with eBay for seven years, most recently serving as its head of brand marketing where she has led campaigns such as its ’More Ways to Win’ work from McCann, as well as a content partnership with News UK.\nPrior to eBay she was at Tesco data division Dunnhumby as product manager.']

title: ["'Cynical' fraudster stole Rolex watch and jewellery from disabled victims on eBay and Gumtree - North Wales Live"]
summary:
['Sign up to our weekly newsletter for a round up of stories from North Wales courtsA "cynical" fraudster stole a Rolex watch and jewellery worth more than £20,000 from two disabled victims using eBay and the marketplace website Gumtree.
Prosecutor Andrew Green said Brendel had contacted Raymond Kay over the Rolex Submariner watch on eBay in September 2017.
But soon afterwards, the court heard that Mr Kay went online and noticed that the £14,750 was showing as "unavailable" in his account.
On September 6, Mr Kay went online again and found the money had been removed from his account.
And he added: "Mr Kay is to be commended for his investigation".']

title: ['Home Bargains, Poundland and eBay buys transformed dark ... - Cheshire Live']
summary:
['A woman has explained how she spruced up her dark bathroom for less than £100 thanks to bargains from eBay, Home Bargains and Poundland.
Previously, Lisa-Marie’s bathroom featured primarily white tiles with a black and white pattern halfway down the wall.
The floors were dark and this effect, combined with dark netting on the windows, made it difficult for light to come in.
Lisa-Marie added some other stylish touches to the bathroom using supplies from Home Bargains and Poundland.
"In total I only spent £97.50 on the entire room transformation, including the paint, lino and decorations."']

title: ['Yes, eBay Sellers Still Stress about Feedback - EcommerceBytes', 'eBay Calculated Shipping Quotes Are Scaring Buyers Away - EcommerceBytes', 'Some unreleased Apple AirTag accessories might have popped up ... - iMore', 'Used cars are selling in record time as eBay Motors Group reveals ... - Car Dealer Magazine']
summary:
['A reader reached out recently in frustration over the eBay feedback system.
There are a lot of issues that keep online sellers up at night, but should eBay feedback be one of them?
At one time, keeping a perfect feedback record was vital on eBay, but over time, eBay introduced other ways it measures the reliability and trustworthiness of a seller.
The EcommerceBytes reader said he had left over 400 feedback ratings for buyers but had only received 38 positives.
Does it affect your sales when you receive negative feedback on eBay, and do you do anything to try to get buyers to leave feedback for you?', 'A buyer messaged me through eBay asking "is $50.80 an accurate shipping quote to California?"
Thank you eBay.
Prior to this another buyer messaged me about an item asking "Is $19.30 - $52.40 the shipping price?"
It seems that eBay gave the Large Flat Rate box rate, which was accurate, but added an outrageous range.
Is anyone else getting questions from buyers about goofy numbers for the calculated shipping prices on listings?', "What you need to knowAn eBay listing appears to be selling some unreleased AirTag accessories.
AirTag Loop and AirTag Leather Key Rings are available in new colors, assuming the listing is legit.
9to5Mac reports that this seller does have a history of selling unreleased Apple products – so the belief is that these things are legit.
Right now you can order a pretty stunning California Poppy Leather Key Ring as well as Blue and Pink AirTag Loops.
Airtag Accessory Ebay Listing Poppy Leather Loop (Image credit: chargerstore)It's a shame these colors never sold because I'd buy anything in California Poppy.", 'Used cars are selling faster than at any point in the whole of last year as the used car scramble at dealerships continues.
Used car dealers are selling cars in 39.3 days on average, reports eBay Motors Group.
Despite the stock shortages and the widely reported rising used car prices in the wholesale market, prices on forecourts actually dropped in May.
Dermot Kelleher, head of marketing and research at eBay Motors Group, said: ‘This shows the impact of the diminishing volume of used cars being wholesaled, with dealers selling cars faster than before but from depleted inventories.
In the exclusive update for Car Dealer, eBay Motors Group also revealed its Top 10 fastest selling cars in May, the details of which are below.']

title: ['eBay Switches Payments Away From PayPal - Gizmodo', 'eBay Inc. stock rises Tuesday, outperforms market - MarketWatch', "HTC-manufactured Pixel 2 XL prototype 'muskie' shows up on eBay ... - 9to5Google", 'UK competition watchdog approves Adevinta acquisition of eBay ... - Reuters', 'New eBay Bid Retraction Policy. Does It Have Teeth? - EcommerceBytes']
summary:
['It looks like the nearly two-decade-long relationship between eBay and PayPal has quietly come to a close.
Advertisement“When eBay manages payments, you can sell and get paid in one place, on eBay, without a need to pay third party processing fees,” the company wrote in an FAQ about the update.
That said, the company’s promising sellers that whatever cut eBay ultimately takes will usually be lower than the roughly 13% they’re currently forking over to both eBay and PayPal combined.
In the leadup to that fateful day, eBay began rolling out beta versions of an eBay-owned payment processor in 2018.
Hopefully, eBay fixes that hiccup before Managed Payments become mandatory for everyone.', "Shares of eBay Inc. EBAY inched 0.80% higher to $61.37 Tuesday, on what proved to be an all-around mixed trading session for the stock market, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA rising 0.13% to 34,575.31 and the S&P 500 Index SPX falling 0.05% to 4,202.04.
This was the stock's second consecutive day of gains.
eBay Inc. closed $3.74 short of its 52-week high ($65.11), which the company reached on April 19th.
The stock outperformed some of its competitors Tuesday, as Amazon.com Inc. AMZN fell 0.14% to $3,218.65, Walmart...", 'For the second generation of Pixel phones, Google made a relatively last-minute decision to shelve an HTC-made Pixel 2 XL for the LG one that launched.
There were a handful of reports about this change in 2017, but the first pictures of the “muskie” Pixel 2 XL prototype have now emerged.
This “Google Pixel Muskie Prototype Original Unreleased” is on sale for $580.
From these pictures, Google made the right choice in dropping the HTC “muskie” for a Pixel 2 XL from LG.
Google Pixel Muskie PROTOTYPE ORIGINAL!!', "LONDON, June 2 (Reuters) - Britain's competition watchdog on Wednesday approved Norway's Adevinta's (ADEV.OL) planned acquisition of U.S. e-commerce group eBay's (EBAY.O) classified ads business.
The Competition and Markets Authority said in a statement it would not refer the acquisition or eBay's purchase of a minority stake in Adevinta to further investigation.
The two companies said in March they planned to sell three smaller British units in order to secure regulatory approval for a long-planned tie-up of their global classified ads businesses.
read moreAdevinta in a statement welcomed the CMA move, and said it targeted completion of the acquisition in the second quarter this year, subject to regulator approval in Austria.
Reporting by Tom Wilson; Editing by Dhara RanasingheOur Standards: The Thomson Reuters Trust Principles.", 'eBay is changing its bid retraction policy for auctions - in one category, only - and sellers are anticipating what kind of impact it will have.
Sellers may accept or reject auction bid retraction requests at their sole discretion, however, we encourage sellers to use their best judgment and give buyers the benefit of the doubt."
In its email, eBay explained how the new auction bid retraction policy will work:"Starting June 30, if a Trading Card buyer wishes to retract an auction bid, they will need to contact the seller via messaging on eBay to request a retraction.
The seller will, at their sole discretion, be able to accept or reject the buyer's retraction request.
If the seller does not accept the request, the buyer’s auction bid can still win or lose the auction, and they will be accountable for the outcome.']

title: ['So long, AirPods; these Skullcandy earbuds are $29.99 on eBay - Times Union', 'eBay opens platform to 2 million Latin American sellers - Chain Store Age', 'Even eBay Is Fighting Pokemon Scalpers Now - SVG', "EBay's Now Authenticating Luxury Handbags – WWD - WWD", 'eBay Will No Longer Process Payments With PayPal - HYPEBEAST']
summary:
['SkullCandyHere’s a hot take for all you savvy internet content consumers: Apple charges way too much money for their goods and services.
Instead of gouging your wallet or paying a rock bottom price for cheap knock-offs, consider this pair of certified refurbished Skullcandy Indy Fuel True Wireless Earbuds instead.
With up to 30 hours of total play time, these wireless, water-resistant headphones allow users to make calls, skip songs, adjust volume, and access Ambient Mode with simple touch controls and even comes with built-in Tile technology to ensure you never misplace one at a friend’s house.
Unless, that’s the point and you’re pulling a George Costanza to get that coveted second date.', 'eBay is partnering with a Latin American e-commerce services hub to streamline the sale of products and services from the region.
The e-commerce giant is collaborating with StoreON, which operates in Colombia, Perú, and Mexico.
New eBay sellers coming from the StoreON hub will not have to manage English language communications, international logistics, the handling of foreign currencies, or the nationalization of products.
According to eBay, the number of Latin American sellers on its platform grew by over 35% during 2020 compared to 2019, which the company says is a sign of how more businesses in the region have found in cross-border e-commerce as an alternative to reach more buyers.
With our global buyer base of 187 million, eBay offers a reliable platform for businesses to successfully expand and become part of the global economy, especially in critical times like these," said Ilya Kretov, GM of global emerging markets at eBay.', "Learn MoreEven eBay Is Fighting Pokemon Scalpers NowSeeing that scalpers are in the news isn't even a surprise anymore.
As pointed out by GameSpot, this is a fairly common practice on eBay, where a lot of expensive Pokemon cards are sold.
Many scalpers bid on cards that they already have as a way to artificially drive prices up.
Another thing that scalpers do is bid on cards to buy in the hopes that they can resell for more.
This helps protect eBay sellers, since retracted bids can be a major stumbling block in a card (or any item, really) being sold.", 'The service, which launched with premium watches in September and expanded to collectible sneakers in October, now covers high-end handbags as well.
“Before we started authentication, we looked at a lot of consumer data and did a lot of surveys just to understand what our customers want,” Charis Márquez, eBay’s vice president of fashion, told WWD.
“We just wanted to make sure we got it right, so we started with watches and then sneakers,” she continued.
“Demand for luxury items on eBay is soaring — an iconic Hermès Birkin bag was recently sold for $98,000 and our watches business doubled last quarter,” Tirath Kamdar, general manger of luxury at eBay, said in a press statement.
And now, eBay is delivering a more seamless and accessible experience that lets shoppers buy and sellers sell luxury handbags with total confidence.”The focus on authenticating luxury is creating interesting conversations inside the company.', 'eBay and PayPal‘s almost two decades-long relationship has come to an end.
The e-commerce giant updated its terms of service on Monday to inform sellers that any collected funds will no longer be credited to their PayPal account and will instead be deposited into their bank account directly.
“Managed payments helps sellers streamline their business on eBay, and simplifies the end-to-end experience for both buyers and sellers,” the company wrote in an FAQ regarding the update.
However, the company claims that the new value fees will normally remain lower than the approximate 13 percent that eBay and PayPal were previously taking from each sale.
Once PayPal and eBay separated into independent publicly traded companies in 2015, the plan was that the former brand would continue managing eBay’s payments for a five-year period.']

title: ['GeForce RTX 3080 Ti Scalpers Waste No Time Selling Cards On eBay At Stupid Prices - Hot Hardware', 'eBay Offers Concierge Service - But by Invitation Only - EcommerceBytes', 'Ebay sellers can no longer accept payments via PayPal leading ... - Charged Retail', 'Dealer accused of failing to tell eBay customers vehicles were write ... - Teesside Live', 'Nintendo Switch console bundles are discounted at eBay - The Verge', 'eBay Has Expanded its Authentication Services from Watches and ... - The Fashion Law', 'Solo Movie Comic Sells For $35 On eBay - War Of The Bounty Hunters - Bleeding Cool News']
summary:
["At the time of this writing, the GeForce RTX 3080 Ti is barely more than an hour old in the retail market, and there are already dozens of sales on eBay.
Dozens of GeForce RTX 3080 Ti cards have already been sold on eBay for well above MSRPThat's not the case across the board, however.
Another user with a 526 rating shelled out $2,800 to a seller located in Nashville, Tennessee, also for a GeForce RTX 3080 Ti Founders Edition graphics card.
As time goes on, the GeForce RTX 3080 Ti might command even more on eBay.
Interestingly, Best Buy opted to limit sales of the GeForce RTX 3080 Ti Founders Edition to in-store only at certain locations.", 'Did you know eBay offers to intercede on buyers' behalf by contacting sellers to ensure the buyer gets their purchases on time?
And did you know eBay will help sellers manage negative feedback, offer support to help sellers stay "above standard," and that eBay will give sellers 48 hours to respond to any changes so their listings aren't ever removed?
Those are some of the benefits eBay promises buyers and sellers who are enrolled in its "concierge" customer service program.
During Wednesday's weekly chat session, eBay seller "kosmetik.karnival" asked, "Can you please tell me how one would qualify for the Concierge Program and how one would obtain an invitation to join?"
An eBay moderator responded, thanking kosmetik.karnival for their interest in the program, and explaining:"Only customers who have been notified that they are included in eBay Concierge are eligible for this program at this time.', 'Ebay sellers can no longer receive payments via PayPal leading many to threaten a boycott of the online marketplace.
Ebay has updated its terms of use, putting in place new changes which means sellers will now receive payments from Ebay directly into their bank accounts, rather than through PayPal.
Prior to the changes sellers were charged 10 per cent of the final sales price by Ebay, a further fee by PayPal plus a standard rate of 30p.
Under the new system sellers will pay 12.8 per cent to Ebay plus 30p, but will no longer pay any extra fees to PayPal.
Ebay bought PayPal in 2002 and until 2015 the payment giant’s service were closely tied to Ebay’s platform.', 'We have more newslettersSomething went wrong, please try again later.
Invalid email Something went wrong, please try again later.
Get the latest news from Teesside Crown Court direct to your inbox with our free email newsletterA car dealer will go on trial accused of failing to tell customers that vehicles he was selling had been written off.
Mark Woodall, of Marwoods Trade Centre on Alberto Street, Stockton, appeared at Teesside Crown Court on Wednesday.
The 46-year-old is accused of selling insurance write-off cars on eBay in a misleading fashion.', 'At eBay, the highly-rated seller Antonline is listing two Switch bundles that are a little more affordable than it’d be to purchase each of the included items separately.
Animal Crossing Switch bundle $ 379 $ 395 4 % off $ 379 $ 379 $ 395 4 % off At eBay, you can get the limited edition Animal Crossing Switch console, New Pokémon Snap, and a one-year family membership to Nintendo Switch Online for $379 (usually $395 altogether).
Resident Evil Village $ 42 $ 60 30 % off $ 42 $ 42 $ 60 30 % off Resident Evil Village is the latest installment in the horror gaming franchise.
We haven’t tested it out, but it seems like a useful gadget if you want to pretend that your iPad Pro is a desktop monitor.
Satechi aluminum stand and hub for iPad Pro $ 80 $ 100 20 % off $ 80 $ 80 $ 100 20 % off Get 20 percent off of Satechi’s new stand and hub for the iPad Pro until June 6th at midnight PT by entering offer code IPADPRO at checkout.', 'Its sneakers business has grown at “a triple digit rate on a year-over-year basis for several quarters, while its watches business accelerated from 16 percent to 38 percent in Q1” of this year.
Meanwhile, eBay claims that “focusing on these core verticals has, in turn, lifted sales in other categories, as well,” such as handbags.
On average, the company states that there are roughly 1.41 million handbags listings on its platform every day, with five handbags selling every minute.
Reflecting on 2020, the eBay says that it sold over 2 million handbags in North America, with sales of bags from brands like Louis Vuitton, Gucci and Prada up 31 percent on a year-over-year basis.
That case is still underway in a New York federal court, with the two parties agreeing to temporarily put court proceedings on hold in order to participate in a private mediation.', '']

title: ['Tokyo Olympics 50p coins sell for up to £100 on eBay – and their value could rise, according to an ex... - The Sun', 'Why this chicken nugget sold for $100,000 on eBay - Fox Business', 'This Wrecked C8 Corvette on eBay Is a Part-Out Bonanza for Project ... - The Drive', "eBay sellers can no longer use Paypal under new 'simplified' system - and they face higher fees - This is Money", 'Used BTS McDonald’s packaging is already selling fast on Ebay - Dazed']
summary:
['EBAY sellers are flogging Tokyo Olympics 50p coins for up to £100 with experts saying their value could rise even further.
One coin, which was a high-graded 2020 Tokyo Olympics collectors 50p coin released as part of a set, recently sold for £100 on eBay.
1 The 2020 Tokyo Olympics 50p coinOther coins that went into circulation are going for between £20 and £40 on the online auction site.
The Royal Mint released the 2020 coins at the start of last year but only within the Annual Coin Set.
Other coins sought after by collectors include the Beatrix Potter 50p coins.', 'Thought the $14,000 packet of McDonald’s Szechuan sauce was expensive?
A Chicken McNugget went for a mind-boggling $100,000 on eBay Friday due to its resemblance to a character from the mystery video game "Among Us."
Ticker Security Last Change Change % EBAY EBAY INC. 45.63 +1.25 +2.82%BYRON ALLEN SUES MCDONALD'S FOR $10B FOR ALLEGED BIAS AGAINST BLACK-OWNED MEDIAThe edible facsimile was originally listed for $0.99 before blowing up due to its "unmistakable correlation" with one of the roly-poly spacemen from the game.
The snack’s uncanny resemblance reportedly got the attention of the official "Among Us" Twitter account, which tweeted about it midway through the bidding war, writing "There’s a $34,443.43 among us chicken nugget on sale and i don’t know how to feel about it???
In 2017, eBay hawkers sold bottles of McDonald’s special sauce for a mind-boggling $100,000 after receiving the coveted condiment as part of a giveaway.', "Finding parts for a recently released car can be awfully tough during normal times, never mind during a global parts shortage.
Their wait though may now be up, as there's currently a C8 being parted out on eBay.
Listed by seller AZ Cycle Parts are the many components said to be from a 2020 C8 2LT Z51, which appears to have been in a significant frontal collision.
More significant, though, is the presence of the wrecked C8's unibody, for which the seller asks $7,000.
A budget supercar the C8 may be, but a cheap car to maintain, it isn't.", "Ebay will now pay its sellers directly, rather than through PayPal, under new changes.
The process is now on eBay end-to-end, meaning there is no need for a third-party PayPal account and no more PayPal payment processing fees.
Sellers will also get paid directly to their bank account, not their PayPal account, and will be able to access everything they need in one place.
As part of the changes, all eBay sellers will receive an email invitation asking them to complete managed payments registration by a specific date.
We can, therefore, expect a rise in buying activity and an increase in account subscriptions of eBay sellers.'", 'The BTS x McDonald’s collab is here, and fans are going wild for the limited edition combo meal.
So much so that sealed sauces and grease-stained boxes, bags, and soft drink cups are being upped to Ebay to make a tasty profit.
Two sauces are currently going for $35, while a used box which “had nuggets in for one minute” plus two sauces are on offer for AU$500.00 (around £270) – although no bids have been placed so far.
There’s even a “collectible” McD’s receipt listed at $500.
On TikTok, fans can be seen frantically attempting to wash the grease off their BTS meal packaging to make them presentable for sale, while one fan has framed their brown bag and sauce sachet.']

title: ["IKEA's sell-out cushion with unusual feature listed on eBay for almost £100 - Bristol Live", 'eBay Hit with RICO Lawsuit - EcommerceBytes']
summary:
["Something went wrong, please try again later.
Invalid email Something went wrong, please try again later.
FIND OUT WHAT'S ON NEAR YOU WITH OUR NEWSLETTERAn IKEA cushion is being sold second-hand for almost £100 after selling out online and in stores.
Listings have appeared on eBay selling the Swedish furniture chain's new 'Fältmal' pillow, which has been dubbed the 'quillow' due to its unusual dual purpose.
There are already a handful of listings on eBay advertising the product, the cheapest of which is £55 including postage.", 'A Massachusetts man filed a lawsuit against eBay alleging fraudulent acts against him in violation of the RICO Act, which stands for Racketeer Influenced and Corrupt Organizations.
The complaint revolves around what appears to be a growing problem for online shoppers: fake tracking numbers used to provide proof of delivery.
eBay ignores the issue that the package was not addressed to the Buyer/receiver.
In his complaint filed against eBay in Federal court on Thursday, the plaintiff also express frustration with the FBI and US Attorney, characterizing them as "strictly political organizations that care nothing about their obligations to protect the average person."
The plaintiff, Danny M. Kelly, is representing himself.']

title: ["McDonald's Chicken Nugget shaped like Among Us character sold ... - TalkEsport"]
summary:
['Recently, Among Us’ Twitter page shared a photo of a single McDonald’s chicken nugget shaped like one of the Among Us two-legged crewmates.
The little nugget was listed by eBay seller Polizna for auction with a catchy title “McDonald’s Among Us shaped Nugget from BTS Meal”.
Finally, the bidding ended on 3rd June and the Chicken nugget was sold for an eye-watering $99,997.
Since the meal was part of Mcdonald’s special BTS meal it is believed that fans of the band had propped up the price of the nugget.
Whatever be the reason for such price, the winner of the auction was the seller Polizna.']

title: ['Shiba coin and eBay are likely to be the co-partners in the near future - Thewistle', 'Among Us, McDonald’s chicken nugget sells for $99,997 on eBay - Deseret News', 'eBay Seller Hit Hard with Empty-Box and Fake-Tracking Scams - EcommerceBytes', 'Klarna invades Amazon, eBay and more with new buy-now-pay ... - AltFi', 'eBay: Nearly 250,000 Kobe Bryant Cards Sold So Far This Year - Sports Collectors Daily', 'GoDaddy launches new features for ecommerce including ... - Canada NewsWire', 'GoDaddy customers can now sell their products on Amazon and eBay - TechRadar']
summary:
['Shiba Token, known as a Dogecoin Spin-off.
The expert says in case the cryptocurrency market recovers from the crash.
By the underlying assumption Shiba coin will soon hold the entire market.
This will compose an added value to the Shiba coin.
Same in the case Uniswap is primordial for SHIB coin To make your transactions.', 'A McDonald’s chicken nugget recently sold for $99,997 on eBay because it resembles the crewmate character from the Among Us video game, The Verge reported.
How a chicken nugget sold for $100KThe nugget first went for $0.99 on eBay when it was listed on May 28.
But then, two days later, there was a bid for $14,869.69 on the nugget, according to the eBay listings.
So the chicken nugget resembles an Among Us video game character.
But, as The Verge reported, the nugget allegedly came from the BTS meal at McDonald’s, which may have also increased its value.', 'Dear Ina,Not sure if this is newsworthy or not, but I am an eBay seller of 20 years who just got hit HARD by Russian scammers on a single Macbook Air listing - 5 out of 9 sold were scammers who either pulled the "Empty Box" scam or returned an empty envelope to a school in the same zip code using a doctored return label.
eBay is finding against me in all of these cases despite evidence from the postmaster and police reports, and I will lose $4000 as well as my Top Rated Seller standing all from this explosion of fraud on this one listing.
I usually do my due diligence not shipping these high value items to new accounts going to sketchy addresses or Freight Forwarders, but I got complacent this time.', 'From today the fintech’s Klarna Shopping app now lets UK shoppers use Klarna with any online retailer—regardless of whether or not Klarna has a partnership with the shop—and split the cost over three interest-free instalments.
Whether the likes of Amazon or eBay, which have their own BNPL offerings, look to block Klarna’s virtual cards in the coming weeks… we’ll have to wait and see.
“Shoppers now can interact with their favourite retailers without having to leave the Klarna app, to create a smooth, safe and frictionless shopping experience.
Last week, Klarna found itself in a spot of bother after its app had a bug that saw customers able to access other Klarna users’ account details.
The BNPL fintech is also reportedly eyeing up London as the destination of its hotly-anticipated IPO.', '', "Canadian entrepreneurs and small business owners can now sell their products on two of the world's largest online marketplaces, Amazon and eBay, through a single dashboard view.
They can also now use Websites + Marketing to publish posts directly to Instagram, enabling them to easily promote their products and brand online.
Marketplaces IntegrationThe new Marketplaces feature combines GoDaddy's signature Websites + Marketing website builder with a suite of powerful ecommerce tools.
Entrepreneurs can schedule, publish, and monitor their company's Instagram account from the Websites + Marketing dashboard.
To find out more about GoDaddy Websites + Marketing, visit www.godaddy.ca.", "The web hosting (opens in new tab) giant GoDaddy (opens in new tab) has announced that its Canadian customers can now sell their products on Amazon and eBay directly through its Websites + Marketing solution.
For those unfamiliar, Websites + Marketing (opens in new tab) pairs an easy-to-use website builder (opens in new tab) with a suite of marketing tools to help small businesses grow and reach new customers.
Now with GoDaddy's latest Marketplaces feature, entrepreneurs in Canada can sell their products on Amazon and eBay through a single dashboard view.
By using their existing Websites + Marketing product catalog, customers can list products with Amazon and eBay in just a few clicks and everything is kept updated for them.
Entrepreneurs can now schedule, publish and monitor their company's Instagram (opens in new tab) account directly from the Websites + marketing dashboard."]

title: ['eBay Patents a Robo Seller - EcommerceBytes', 'Amazon, Reddit, BBC, eBay and Etsy websites back up after going ... - The Times', "'Greasy' BTS-Branded McDonald's Bags Are Selling on eBay - Promo Marketing", "McDonald's Australia customers re-selling Korean BTS dipping sauces on eBay for as much as $500 - Daily Mail"]
summary:
['eBay thinks a robot can do your job - introducing the Robo Seller.
eBay also imagines the technology could solve another problem it described: "low quality postings can often depress prices, leaving the seller and the online sales platform worse off."
The robotic selling assistant might have cameras, sensors, a robotic arm, a microphone, and a scale.
The Robo Seller might even snitch on their human overlords!
"If the robotic selling assistant determines the seller has intentionally mis-described the item, the robotic selling assistant may alert the online sales platform of potentially fraudulent activity."', 'The New York Times website was among leading media companies to be affected by this morning’s outageWebsites for the UK government and leading media companies including The Guardian, Financial Times and The New York Times briefly went down during a global internet outage today.
The websites for the BBC and the US White House were also temporarily inaccessible, but later returned.
SponsoredAmazon, Etsy, eBay and Vimeo users were among those reporting problems this morning before the sites returned online.
The outage appeared to have been linked to an issue with a content delivery network (CDN), a system used to host websites and their content and serve it to users.
Fastly, a leading CDN, reported a major outage across its global network, which is believed to have caused the issue.', "There’s not a lot of products listed as “greasy,” though.
If you’re shopping for those BTS-branded McDonald's items, however, you might run across a “greasy” product or two that still go for $100.
For real, a greasy McDonald’s bag–like one that food came in–sold for $100 on eBay just because it had the BTS logo on it.
That’s obviously an ambitious ask by the eBay seller, but at the rate people are asking for these bags, it’s not that insane.
With fast food companies exploring reusable packaging, imagine if McDonald's made reusable bags with the BTS logo on them (insert thinking face emoji here).", "McDonald's diners hoping to make a quick profit are attempting to resell their BTS dipping sauces on eBay for as much as $500.
The fast food chain recently launched the highly-anticipated BTS meal after collaborating with the world-famous K-pop phenomenon.
'Contains: McDonald's Australia BTS Chicken McNugget Box - has been cleaned.
4 BTS sweet chilli sauce.
Australian customers can order the BTS Meal in-restaurant, through contactless mobile order and pay in the McDonald's App, at the Drive Thru or via McDelivery."]

title: ['Council mechanic stole trailers from depot before selling them on eBay - Warrington Guardian', 'First Harley Keener Sets W.E.B. Of Spider-Man On Fire On eBay - Bleeding Cool News', "eBay Launches 'Refurb Registry' to Help Couples Start Fresh After a ... - PR Newswire", 'Retro England football kits worth up to £246 on eBay – is yours worth a mint?... - The Sun', 'Cyril Palmer Shares His Biggest eBay Sneaker Shopping Tips - Highsnobiety']
summary:
['Chris Lock, of Strawberry Close in Locking Stumps, sold the two trailers for £400, claiming they were being sold off by Bury Council and they were then listed on eBay.
At Manchester Minshull Street Crown Court Lock, the 54-year-old was given a community sentence after pleading guilty to two counts of theft by an employee.
Lock, who worked for the council’s transport department, will be electronically tagged and made subject to a 7pm to 7am curfew for eight weeks and must participate in rehabilitation and alcohol treatment.
The trailers have been returned to the council.', '', '"No relationship is a guaranteed success, but eBay guarantees each Certified Refurbished product with a two-year warranty."
And, every couple who creates a Registry can enter for the chance to have all the items "gifted" to them by eBay.
To add some levity to the situation, eBay has partnered with comedy's favorite couple and self-appointed relationship experts, Natasha Leggero and Moshe Kasher.
eBay's unique selection of Certified Refurbished products are fully restored by the manufacturer to like-new condition and come with a two-year warranty.
After some very close quality time, they are ready to be honest about what ticked them off during quarantine, and how eBay's Certified Refurbished products have helped.', "ENGLAND shirts at the ready.
13 Vintage England football shirts from the Euros can sell for hundreds onlineBut while a Nike England shirt from this year's kit will set you back £70, it's shirts from previous Euros that could be worth up to £246.
We've taken a look at the most valuable vintage England shirts from the Euros over the years - and how to spot if you have one at home.
This England shirt from the Euros in 2000 ended up selling on eBay for £106 after scoring 25 bids.
The shirt sold for £100 after just three days of bidding.", 'Cyril Roy Palmer’s connection with sneakers started almost as soon as he began skating 15 years ago.
The Los Angeles native is a skater and musician who has since amassed some of the most sought-after kicks in his well-worn sneaker collection.
He also let us know his secret for copping those grails through the years: “I’ve gotten a lot of heaters from eBay.
That’s why we invited Palmer to be part of our eBay Market Mentor series, where sneakerheads in our world give us their best advice for shopping authentic kicks on eBay.
Highsnobiety Highsnobiety HighsnobietyPay attention to the seller’s rating“I pay a lot of attention to the seller’s rating and see if it’s good, bad, or neutral.']

title: ['Scam warning as Royal Mail and Hermes parcels sold on eBay - The Argus', 'Cushty price! Only Fools and Horses script sells for £10k - Kent Online']
summary:
['Undelivered packages from Royal Mail and Hermes are sold on to to third-party companies, who often list the unopened items on eBay.
A pile of Royal Mail deliveries.
Martyn James from Resolver group added: "Most people will be shocked to learn that their undelivered items are being flogged in 'packages' on eBay.
SEE ALSO: Royal Mail customers will be able to choose delivery time in UKEach advert showed parcels laid out on the floor, with dozens of bids being placed.
Royal Mail items are usually kept at a sorting office for three weeks.', 'After a lengthy online bidding war, a script from the famous 'Jolly Boys Outing' episode of Only Fools and Horses has sold for more than £10,000.
The screenplay from the 1989 Christmas Day special, which sees Del Boy and Rodney enjoy a trip down to Margate, was flogged on eBay by the relative of a make-up designer who worked on the legendary sitcom.
"The script is bound in a plastic cover, which has protected it from getting too foxed over the years.
It was the legendary sitcom's eighth Christmas special and drew in 20 million viewers when it originally aired 32 years ago.
The screenplay is hundreds of pages thick and is in the smaller A5 size, rather than the traditional A4 paper size.']

title: ['Nearly 26M Amazon, Facebook, Apple, eBay user logins stolen by hackers - Fox Business', "Sergio Aguero's Range Rover for sale on eBay with proceeds to Chorley charity - Lancs Live"]
summary:
['According to a report by cybersecurity provider NordLocker, a custom Trojan-type malware infiltrated the computers between 2018 and 2020 and stole 1.2 terabytes (TB) of personal information.
The targeted websites include major namesakes such as Amazon, Walmart, eBay, Facebook, Twitter, Apple, Dropbox and LinkedIn.
To steal the personal information, the malware was reportedly able to take screenshots of a person's information and also photograph "the user if the device had a webcam."
Among the stolen database were 2 billion browser cookies and 6.6 million files, including 1 million images and more than 650,000 Word and .pdf files.
GET FOX BUSINESS ON THE GO BY CLICKING HEREMaking up the bulk of the stolen database was "3 million text files, 900,00 image files, and 600,000+ Word files."', 'Invalid email Something went wrong, please try again later.
A Manchester City kit man who lives in Lancashire has put the Range Rover gifted to him by departing club legend Sergio Aguero up for sale on eBay with proceeds going to a local children's charity.
Ally Marland was the lucky recipient of the striker's 2016 Range Rover Evoque following a raffle at the Etihad Stadium last month.
The eBay listing shows that the Range Rover, which has its MOT expiring next month, is nearly brand new with only 10,500 miles on the clock.
The sale post states: "MANCHESTER CITY SERGIO AGUERO RANGER ROVER EVOQUE FORMALLY OWNED BY MCFC & ARGENTINA FOOTBALLER.']

title: ['eBay Requires Buyer to File Police Report to Get Refund - EcommerceBytes']
summary:
["A buyer who filed a claim with eBay saying they never received their order for an iPhone said the company is requiring that they file a police report before it will issue a refund.
I understand that you didn't receive your item however tracking shows item was delivered to your location.
We placed this case on hold for 10 calendar days to give you time to file and send the report.
Once we receive and confirm the report, we'll close the case in your favor and send you a refund.
What do you think of eBay requiring the buyer to file a police report, and is this a new practice?"]

title: ["Just glue it: eBay's shoe cops sniff out fake Nikes - The Times", "Mel C 'shocked to stumble across eBay auction consisting of her personal Spice Girls memorabilia' - Daily Mail"]
summary:
['It is one of the few jobs where glue-sniffing is encouraged.
A new breed of footwear detective is learning to identify cheap knock-offs of expensive trainers by the smell of the glue that binds their soles.
Soaring prices for limited edition and other sought-after trainers associated with athletes and celebrities have prompted the online marketplace eBay to launch its first UK “sneaker authentication centre”.
Experts in trainer provenance and manufacture are subjecting new and used footwear to microscopic scrutiny in an attempt to combat fake merchandise.
SponsoredAny eBay UK user who sells a pair of Nike, Adidas or New Balance trainers worth more than £150 will not get their money until the shoes have been authenticated by eBay’s experts, who will then forward them to', '']

title: ["Did Wheels Come Off of eBay's Shopping Cart? - EcommerceBytes", 'How do eBay check for counterfeit sneakers at its new Authenticity Guarantee centre? - This is Money', 'eBay Selling "Extremely Rare" Groot-Shaped Cheeto for $100 ... - Inside the Magic']
summary:
['Normally I routinely get multi-item orders with all of the items for a given buyer under one order number.
Although some buyers do buy quantities more than one but still always do separate payments for each item type.
This is now universal for my orders seemingly indicating that maybe buyers on phones no longer have the "Add to Cart" option.
I buy on eBay myself and always use the cart on the desktop PC site so I know that platform still works.
Have you heard of any change in the way eBay handles checkout based on the platform and device?', "Through its latest programme, Authenticity Guarantee, the most popular sneaker brands sold on eBay UK for over £150 will be fully vetted and verified by an independent team of industry experts – Sneaker Con.
Rob Hattrell, head of eBay Europe, said: 'This move to launch Authenticity Guarantee in the UK is a big one.
Ebay provide the facilities for SneakerCon so experts can do the authentication with eBay paying for the warehouse.
Their work is ever evolving as there are always new, popular shoes that are copied, and they have to examine and learn about.
So what makes a pair of sneakers popular and worth queuing days for?", '']

title: ['EBay bans sales of adult-only items - Fox Business', "eBay's sex ban wipes out an important storefront for queer collectors - The Verge", 'Rare 20p error coin sells for £57 on eBay – how to spot one in your change... - The Sun', "Delivery workers' strike hits eBay Korea, sparing Coupang - koreatimes", 'Second-hand football shirts selling for £2,300 on eBay - see if you have any of them - The Mirror']
summary:
['EBay sellers won't be allowed to use the marketplace to make a profit off of most sexually explicit materials.
CLICK HERE TO READ MORE ON FOX BUSINESSAlthough, there are exceptions to the rule, "most adult-only items" are prohibited from the marketplace.
"Listings that show nudity are allowed only in limited situations and must follow" specific guidelines, according to eBay.
Nudity, according to the company, is defined as "showing any part of male or female genitalia, anus, or female breasts where the areola or nipple is visible."
However, there are some magazines and books that can be listed in the "Magazines" category "as long as the listing does not show nude images."', 'According to Monir and others, those policies tend to have the harshest impacts on queer communities and especially queer people who produce or buy erotic content outside of mainstream porn.
“There are undisguised evangelical anti-porn groups working extremely hard to ban pornography outright, and especially queer pornography,” says Monir, citing organizations like Exodus Cry.
Megan Gedris, another queer artist who makes erotic comics, has also felt the effects of adult content restrictions.
Since Tumblr’s 2018 adult content ban, they’ve found it much harder to grow and maintain an audience for their work.
It’s important for people who rarely see bodies like theirs in mainstream porn to have access to erotic work that reflects their bodies and experiences.', "A RARE 20p coin that has been minted with an error has sold on eBay for £57 after sparking a bidding war.
2 The 20p coin had been minted with the wrong design, the seller said Credit: EBayThe eBay seller said the coin was minted in 2008 but the date was missing from the design.
Around 120,000 of these error coins entered circulation in 2008 when the Royal Mint changed the design of the 20p.
But remember, there's a difference between a genuine error coin and one that is just imperfect, for example with a design that is not as clear as you'd expect.
Last month, a £2 coin with a rare printing error sold on eBay for a huge £138.", "At facilities where it doesn't have the right to strike, delivery workers delayed their start times by two hours, starting work at 11 a.m.
Meanwhile, the union walkout delayed delivery services for eBay Korea and 11st from minimum two days to maximum five days.
Unlike Coupang and SSG.com, eBay Korea and 11st only run open market platforms and merchants are responsible for sending their sold products to customers.
eBay Korea posted a notice last Thursday about the possibility of delivery delays of up to five days.
Coupang provides car insurance, vehicle and other maintenance expenses to ensure a safe working environment for its delivery workers.", 'Those marking a top club or player are most sought-after, but even worn and damaged shirts are valuable to the right buyerSecond-hand football shirts selling for £2,300 on eBay - see if you have any of themOld football shirts sell for more than £2,000 on eBay, and with the Euro 2020 tournament underway it is the perfect time to check if you own a valuable one.
Here are five of the most valuable British football shirts that recently sold for a fortune.
3) Manchester United 1998/99 shirt, £1,200Image: eBay) eBay)The second of three Manchester United shirts on this list was also sold in pristine condition in its original packaging.
5) Manchester United 1998/99 goalkeeper shirt, £750Image: eBay) eBay)While Manchester United shirts can go for large amounts online, this one is more significant than most.
In the 1998/99 season, the team won not only the Premier League but the FA Cup and UEFA Champions League as well.']

title: ['Scotland vs England tickets flogged for £7.5k on eBay as touts target Euro 2020 fans - Daily Record', 'EBay to sell S.Korean unit for about $3.6 bln to Shinsegae, Naver ... - Reuters', 'Rare 20p coin nets £57 on eBay - and you could have one too - Birmingham Live']
summary:
['Get the latest top news stories sent straight to your inbox with our daily newsletterFootball fans risk being fleeced out of thousands of pounds by touts flogging tickets to the Scotland vs England Euro 2020 game.
The Tartan Army are being charged as much as £7,500 for two tickets on the bidding platform, despite ticket face value being £60 (€70).
(Image: eBay)A description on eBay reads: "These tickets are E-Tickets and will be transferred via your email address through the euro 2020 ticket app, as soon as the payment has been received.
The exploitation of fans comes despite recent legislation passed by the Scottish Parliament banning ticket touting.
But this only applies if the original buyer is transferring their ticket to a friend or family member, via the Euro 2020 app - not general resale.', "SEOUL, June 16 (Reuters) - EBay (EBAY.O) will sell its South Korean business to Shinsegae Group's E-Mart Inc (139480.KS) and web portal operator Naver (035420.KS) for about 4 trillion won ($3.6 billion), local newspapers reported on Wednesday.
EBay Korea is the country's third-largest e-commerce firm with market share of about 12.8% in 2020, according to Euromonitor.
EBay Korea declined to comment.
South Korea represents the world's fourth largest e-commerce market.
Shinsegae and Naver formed a retail and e-commerce partnership in March by taking stakes worth 250 billion won in each other's affiliates.", 'Sign up to our free email alerts for the top money saving stories sent straight to your e-mailGet your hands down the back of the sofa...A rare 20p coin has sold for £57 on eBay - all thanks to a 'huge error' in its design.
And thousands more 20p coins with the same defect are thought to be in circulation.
The seller claims it is a “mule” coin - or “undated 20p” - because it has no date minted on it, reports the Mirror.
This isn’t the only error coin that has sold for a mint on eBay in recent weeks.
The two pence coin - branded "rare" by collectors - sold for an eye-watering 24,250 times its face value.']

title: ['ZoidPay Brings Crypto Shopping to Amazon, Walmart, eBay, and ... - PR Newswire', 'Nottingham couple forced to sell "everything they owned" on eBay now run £1m business - Nottinghamshire Live', "'Rare' McDonald's straws are selling for £5,000 on eBay - My London", 'Alyssa Cutright from eBay is a Silicon Valley Business Journal ... - The Business Journals', 'eBay Reportedly Ceasing Operations in Spain on July 1st - EcommerceBytes', 'Has Apple Banned Grindr? Did eBay Ban Erotica? - The Dispatch', 'England v Scotland Wembley showdown tickets flogged for £7.5k on eBay by unscrupulous touts - My London', "Rare 20p coin sells for £57 on eBay - here's how to check if you have one in your wallet - Glasgow Live"]
summary:
['ZoidPay: A Pioneer For Mainstream Crypto AdoptionZoidPay has begun building an entire ecosystem around the global shopping experience, complete with staking and DeFi mechanisms.
ZoidPay blends shopping with staking and other DeFi integrations, creating a unique, personalized user experience.
ZoidPay users will be able to buy a new laptop from Amazon with Bitcoin, pay their Netflix subscription with BNB, or buy weekly groceries with Ethereum.
Brick and mortar shops can easily accept crypto payments by simply downloading the ZoidPay Wallet that turns any smartphone into a POS, while availing the ecosystem benefits.
The ZoidPay platform offers ease of use, security, low-cost transactions, and other features revolving around a customer-centric model.', 'Self proclaimed "cookie dough fanatics" Olly Martin and Anja Hammond were spurred on to go it alone when they couldn't see a future in their minimum wage jobs.
Now they run Gookie Dough, an edible gourmet cookie dough company.
The couple U-turned and started working on a safe-to-eat cookie dough recipe instead.
"We started piloting recipes for cookie dough that was safe to eat raw – in the final recipe there are no eggs and the flour has been heat treated."
“We plan to counteract this by expanding into retail, food service and wholesale.”The duo are also rebranding the business to launch other sweet treats beyond cookie dough.', 'One of the strangest items going on the marketplace is Mcdonald's plastic straws.
Maybe they're worth something today as some of the vendors are listing their plastic pipes of treasure for as much as £5,000 on eBay.
It continues: "A superb opportunity to acquire a rare plastic McDonalds straw.
Listed presumably as a joke, eBay details three have been sold already and there are six more still available.
One seller has listed their straw for £4999.99 as it's a rare 1986 version with the brown McDonald's writing and retro logo on the straw's covering.', '', 'A Spanish news site says eBay will discontinue operations in Spain on July 1st, news that EcommerceBytes has not confirmed.
However, eBay will not exit the Spanish market.
Ecommerce News obtained the following statement from eBay (translated via Google):“After reviewing the organization of eBay’s business in the Spanish market, the company has decided to discontinue its operations in Spain.
Ecommerce News reporter Samuel Rodriguez said it would negatively impact the 19 eBay Spain employees – see his full story with context on Ecommerce-News.es.
Hat tip to @jordiobdotcomEXCLUSIVA ❗ @eBayESP cesa su actividad en #España, hecho que será efectivo a partir del 1 de julio y que @Ecommerce_es ha podido conocer de primera mano.', 'A viral tweet claims that, among other things, Apple has banned gay dating app Grindr from the App Store and Texas has banned strippers under the age of 21 and abortion in the state:Apple banned Grindr from the App Store.
Starting the day after tomorrow you won’t be able to buy and sell erotica on eBay.
— Americas Boyfiend (@VeeChattie) June 13, 2021The claim regarding Apple came after the tech company updated its App Store guidelines.
As a part of the update, Apple said it would be cracking down on apps that offered prostitution and pornography under the guise of being dating apps.
A spokesman from Apple told website Apple Insider that the guideline change wouldn’t affect Grindr or other dating apps, or indeed dating apps in general as long as their legitimate purpose was facilitating dating.', 'Tickets for the England v Scotland match at Wembley are being flogged for £7.5k on eBay by unscrupulous touts.
Greedy sellers are listing tickets for Friday’s Euro 2020 clash for eye-watering prices 125 times the face value of the tickets on the e-commerce site.
It comes after the Daily Record revealed sellers were targeting Scotland fans with Euro 2020 tickets costing more than 20 times face value.
Notorious super-tout Atle Barlaup’s website was charging Scotland fans more than €1000 (£861) for tickets with a face value of €50 (£43) for the showdown at Wembley.
UEFA has banned the resale of tickets and threatened that tickets flogged outside sites could be cancelled and sellers would face a fine of up to £5,000.', "Don't miss any of Glasgow Live's biggest stories - sign up to our daily email newsletterA rare 20p coin recognisable by an error in its design has sold for a whopping £57 on eBay.
It’s estimated by The Royal Mint that no more than 250,000 coins made it into circulation, according to experts at Change Checker.
As with all rare coins, they are seen as valuable to collectors and this one cold be at the top of some collectors lists.
Bidding for the rare collectors item started at £30 but it ended up selling for almost double last week following a three-day auction in which seven people made a total of 13 bids.
And if you're in doubt, you can get coins verified by the Royal Mint to check they're the real deal."]

title: ['Ebay to withdraw operations in Spain from July - Spanish News Today', 'Seller: Mercari Is Going Down the eBay Path - EcommerceBytes']
summary:
['Ebay to withdraw operations in Spain from JulyARCHIVED ARTICLEThe multinational company will be closing its base in Madrid and managing Spanish operations from DublinEbay has officially confirmed that the company will be stopping its operations in Spain from July 1 and the Spanish Ebay website (ebay.es) will be managed by a team in Europe instead.
The online auction and shopping, or ‘ecommerce’, company made the decision to withdraw from Spain after reviewing their organization and infrastructure within the country.
However, Ebay has stated that they will continue their operations with Spanish buyers and sellers and that they aren’t planning on leaving the Spanish market.
Operations in Spain will now be manged remotely by the European Ebay headquarters in Dublin, with the company ensuring customers and other businesses that this transition has already gone ahead smoothly in other European countries.
However, the 19 staff members who were employed at Ebay’s base in Madrid will not be relocated.', 'Dear Ina,It seems that Mercari has decided to readjust their rules once again.
Buyers are allowed multiple ID's and the ability to change their current ID in circumventing a Sellers Block.
Two of the biggest factors that we were impressed with when leaving eBay for Mercari was the 3 day "Final sale" inspection and the rule that Buyers would only be able to open one ID.
Recently, we have seen an uptick in buyers purchasing from multiple ID's circumventing any type of Block we have in place.
It's unfortunate that Mercari is travelling the same path of eBay, all the while pushing those who have made Mercari the Number #2 selling platform, off to the sidelines.']

title: ['Killer drivers used dummy seat belt clips available on Amazon and eBay in fatal crashes - Liverpool Echo', "Mel C thanks 'incredible' fans who rescued priceless Spice Girls memorabilia from 99p eBay auction - Yahoo Entertainment"]
summary:
['Idiot motorists are risking lives - including their own - by inserting the controversial "dummy latch plates" into seat belt receivers.
The clips, which sell for as little as £2 and often come with a bottle opener, are marketed as both seat belt alarm "silencers" and "stoppers".
"While we know that some people are determined not to wear their seat belt, offering dummy seat belts or "alarm stoppers" for sale only serves as encouragement.
At a trial last month, Smith accepted he wasn't wearing a seat belt and said he was using a "latch plate" - "just like the end of the seat belt".
Airbags are a 'secondary restraint system' (SRS) and will only be effective if a seat belt is worn.', "Watch: Mel C panicked when memorabilia appeared on eBayMel C has shared her relief after eagle-eyed fans helped her to retrieve priceless Spice Girls memorabilia, which was being flogged as part of a 99p auction on eBay.
After the group took a hiatus, Mel C released the album Northern Star in 1999, which became the biggest-selling of any Spice Girls solo album.
The Spice Girls dominated the charts all over the world during the 1990s.
(Fred Duval/FilmMagic)Despite her success, Mel C told the Mirror she doesn't live in a house flooded with mementos and artefacts from the Spice Girls' heyday.
Watch: Mel C hints Victoria Beckham is close to Spice Girls return"]

title: ['eBay Stats on GPU Sales Show Tens of Thousands Sold, Prices ... - PCMag', 'eBay Launches Seller-Friendly Returns Policy for Trading Cards - EcommerceBytes', 'eBay Returns Items Sent Using Its International Standard Delivery - EcommerceBytes']
summary:
['For example, PCMag queried "RTX 3070" for the category "graphics/video cards," and got the results below for eBay.comThe sales volume and average prices for the RTX 3070 card.
The sales volume and average pricing for the RTX 3080 card.
PlayStation 5 sales volume and average pricing on eBay.
(Credit: eBay)That said, third-party prices for PC graphics cards still remain absurdly high on eBay, which takes a cut of the sales.
(Credit: eBay)', 'eBay is giving sellers greater protection in the Trading Cards category by reducing the time buyers have to make a return under certain circumstances.
(Buyers have 60 days when making a claim against a seller who offers a 60-day return policy.)
The current policy allows them to return cards that drop in value within sellers’ return period mandated by eBay, which they see as a problem.
If the seller offers returns, you must request a return within the seller’s return window as stated in the listing.
Sellers may be wondering if eBay would ever consider a 3-day return-request policy for INRs in other categories', "In the past two weeks I have had an issue with eBay's International Standard Delivery and I'm wondering if it is common.
Then this week I received a package back that was supposed to ship to Australia.
When I called today I was told that the item was not accepted to be shipped to Australia.
After relaying this to them I was told that Barbie dolls are not allowed to be shipped to Australia.
I protested and told them it was ridiculous and asked them to contact the International Standard Delivery department for better clarification."]

title: ['eBay has slashed £100 off this Philips 2.1 Dolby Atmos soundbar - TrustedReviews', 'eBay Top Formula 1 Drivers Trading Card Sales News - HYPEBEAST']
summary:
['eBay are offering 33% – that’s £100 – off the asking price for the Philips TAB8405/10, bringing its price down to a more affordable £199.
The Philips TAB8405/10 is a 2.1 channel system – two speakers in the main unit, the .1 referring to the wireless subwoofer – that supports Dolby Atmos.
As there’s no mention of upfiring Atmos speakers, we imagine the Philips achieves the height effect where sounds are placed above the listener through digital processing.
It’s an effect that should provide a soundstage that’s wider and taller than what you’d get from a more conventional soundbar.
£199 is a pretty great price for a Dolby Atmos soundbar, too, and one of the cheapest we’ve come across yet.', 'The world of Formula 1 continues to pick up speed amongst old and new fans alike, and with that has come a new craze in the world of trading cards.
eBay has just recorded a spike in the trading value of certain cards on its selling platform with Lewis Hamilton and Max Verstappen leading the pack.
In its data, a few cards stood out, and while not anywhere near the price of basketball, baseball, or Pokémon cards, these figures are definitely something collectors should be paying attention to.
Below you’ll find some of the most expensive cards sold on eBay this year:2020 Topps Dynasty Formula 1 F1 Max Verstappen Autograph Patch Card- $6,150 USDLewis Hamilton 2020 Chrome Formula 1 Orange Refractor- $7,700 USD2007-08 Pro2.0 Formula 1 F1 Rookie Card Lewis Hamilton- $4,500 USD1984 Panini F1 Ayrton Senna Toleman-Hart TG183 Formula 1 Rookie Card- $3,000 USDIn other trading card news, another GEM MINT 10 1st Edition Holographic Charizard lands on Goldin Auctions.']

summary:
['* What kind of company would do this do a selling partner that has millions in sales, and 100% feedback?
*1a : an absolute ruler unrestrained by law or constitution.
b : a usurper of sovereignty.
Important information regarding your payoutsHello xxxxxx,Your payouts have been temporarily placed on hold while we review some details.
Please allow up to 5 days for this review to take place.', 'It seems that nearly every week this spring, there has been a major development in the landscape of online retail.
Having been in the business since 2001, 1stDibs is a granddaddy in this space.
Shortly after the close of 1stDibs’s public offering, AD PRO sat down with Rosenblatt to see what’s ahead for the company.
1stDibs’s CEO David Rosenblatt Photo: 1stDibsYou have the ear of the design community right now.
Continuing to invest in new categories, like new and custom design, is an extraordinarily important part of what we’re all about.', 'We’re living through the renaissance of Formula 1.
Young Verstappen, however, isn’t the only one in the form of his life right now.
As eBay has just revealed, Formula 1 trading cards are picking up speed when it comes to monetary value.
And as noted by Hypebeast, while the trading cards are still nowhere near the lofty dollar-figures of its NBA, MLB, or even Pokémon counterparts, anyone keen on trying their luck with some alternative investments in light of crypto’s impending crash should start here.
