“Things are good.”AdvertisementThe ‘My eBay’ interface shows that the lucky winning bidder paid $680 (£490.70) for the mini Durst – you can see the screenshot below.
Discussing the band’s decision to scrap the shows, Fred Durst said that “in short, the system is still very flawed”.', '']

title: ['eBay Addresses Problems with USPS Media Mail Labels - EcommerceBytes', 'EBay Brings Luxury Handbag Machines to New York, Los Angeles - WWD', 'eBay Inc in-line as transformation process continues - Proactive Investors UK', 'Ex-Cardiff Blues rugby player sold stolen caravan on eBay - South Wales Argus', 'Belarus Olympic defector Tsimanouskaya auctions medal on eBay - Al Jazeera English', 'Fred Durst Lost An eBay Auction For A Bootleg Action Figure Of ... - BroBible', "If You Invested $1,000 In eBay When It Acquired PayPal, Here's How Much You'd Have Now - eBay (NASDAQ:EBA - Benzinga", 'Rare Olympic error coin sells for £420 on eBay – here’s how to spot one in your change... - The Sun', 'Man turns over £1m a year selling socks on eBay after being inspired on benefits - The Mirror']
summary:
['eBay sellers were having a problem sending certain items via USPS Media Mail, such as a seller who posted in mid-July.
"It's an ongoing issue that eBay is aware of and working on," a seller replied at the time - "They didn't map Media Mail correctly to all the valid categories."
An eBay moderator said a colleague was still working with the shipping team regarding the Media Mail issue, but added some progress had been made: "He's been told that many of the missing categories have been added back in.
If you come across any that qualify for Media Mail but still don't have that option, please be sure to get those reported on the thread you shared so it can be looked into further."
The moderator said it was a known technical issue, but did not have an ETA on a fix.', 'Some residents of New York and Los Angeles may have noticed an intriguing sight Thursday, as eBay opened its first luxury handbag machines in the DUMBO neighborhood of Brooklyn and Silver Lake in Los Angeles.
The installations, available for two days only, are similar to, but not quite the same as, vending machines for cosmetics, headphones or tourist merch in airports.
“EBay’s luxury shoppers are constantly thinking about their next designer handbag,” said Tirath Kamdar, the company’s general manager of luxury.
Once there, they’ll face luxury-based questions designed to test their knowledge of “all-things-handbags,” eBay said.
All of the handbags were verified through the company’s “Luxury Handbag Authenticity Guarantee,” a program that first covered premium watches and collectible sneakers before rolling out to bags in June.', '', 'Ex-Cardiff Blues back Darren Daley knew the Bailey Unicorn caravan, which had been pinched from a house in Cwmbran, was hot.
When they tried to register the caravan they discovered to their horror it was a stolen and contacted the police.
The court was told how both the money and the undamaged caravan have been returned to their owners.
Timothy Evans, mitigating, said: “Between the age of 18 and 33, the defendant was a professional rugby player with Cardiff Blues.
“He played for Cardiff and Aberavon.”Daley played rugby under the name of Darren Ryan and also represented Bedwas RFC.', 'In turn, the foundation will help athletes organise gatherings and competitions,” the 24-year-old sprinter told Al Jazeera’s podcast show, The Take.
I would either be sent to a psychiatric hospital or to jail,” she told Al Jazeera.
Kiryl, a Belarusian living in Vilnius, Lithuania, said he believes the orders to force Tsimanouskaya to return came from the top.
“I believe that Belarus deserves to be stripped of the right to participate in the Olympics under its own flag,” he told Al Jazeera.
And the reaction from the global community is completely deserved.”The Belarusian Sports Solidarity Foundation said it plans to use the money from Tsimanouskaya’s medal to support repressed Belarusian athletes.', 'Getty ImageFred Durst poked fun at himself after losing an eBay auction for a bootleg action figure of himselfThe toy—which was inspired by the Limp Bizkit frontman’s new look—ultimately sold for $680Read more music news hereFred Durst found himself thrust back into the spotlight at the end of last month when he was painted in a less than flattering light in the HBO documentary chronicling the debacle that was Woodstock ’99 before deploying a phenomenal strategy to draw even more attention to himself by introducing a new look best described as “the lovechild of Hulk Hogan and Julian Assange.”Shortly after, the only Limp Bizkit member most people can name reintroduced himself to the world at Lollapalooza, an appearance managed to spawn even more memes than the initial Instagram photo.
Durst’s reinvention also inspired one toymaker to whip up a one-of-a-kind bootleg action figure that recently sold on eBay for a cool $680.
eBayIt’s unclear who the winning bidder was, but it appears we can rule out the man who lent his likeness to it, as Durst poked a little bit of fun at himself when he revealed his max bid of $415 wasn’t enough to land the action figure.
InstagramSay what you will about the internet, but at least it occasionally gives us gold like this.
[Consequence]', 'One of the most well-known internet acquisitions of 2002 was when eBay Inc EBAY announced it was acquiring PayPal Holdings Inc PYPL.
What To Know: eBay announced it was acquiring online payment company PayPal on Aug. 18, 2002.
EBay shareholders received one share of PayPal for each eBay share they owned at the time of the July 20, 2015 spin-off.
The $1,000 purchase of eBay shares would not be made up of 59.40 shares of eBay and 59.40 shares of PayPal.
A $1,000 investment in eBay shares would be worth $20,401.52 today -- not a bad return for 19 years.', "A RARE 50p error coin has sold for £420 on eBay - hundreds of pounds more than its face value.
The coin is already considered rare as it is one of the 29 designs created especially for the 2012 Olympic games.
But the rare error version is harder to come across which is a more popular trait.
It's not just rare coins that can go for a few bob either, as we found a rare Brexit 50p sold for £750 on eBay just because of its design too.
You might find a rare coin of your own in your change, whether it be an error or one that has been specially curated.", '“Socks are rarely donated to those in need like money, coffee or old coats.
We want to fix that problem"Man turns over £1m a year selling socks on eBay after being inspired on benefitsJosh Turner was 24 and surviving on benefits when his work coach inspired him to start a business in 2015 - and it's completely transformed his life.
That means for every pair of socks bought, one is donated to a homeless charity.
Have you got a business idea to shout about?
But surviving on just benefits at the time, Josh said the idea back them felt completely out of reach.']

title: ['INTERVIEW eBay: ‘Brands can be confident the product being sold ... - InternetRetailing', "eBay's Plan Is More Ads - Marketplace Pulse", 'Oscar Mayer listed Hot Doge Wieners on eBay. And then the listing ... - PR Week', 'eBay sells Gumtree - GoAutoNews Premium']
summary:
['“It gives brands a better way of way of protecting their brands on the platform,” he says.
Goods sold through the hub benefit from a 12 month guarantee that all sellers have to provide – and are an average of 30% cheaper.
We’d encourage that and will work with brands to do that.” Brands can opt to have their own eBay store.
Unlike some other marketplaces, eBay does not handle fulfilment for retailers.
It makes sense for brands to be working with marketplaces.”At heart, he says, an eBay strategy is very like brands’ strategy for selling direct online.', 'A standard search results page with 48 organic results has a maximum of 14 promoted listings (a similar ratio to Amazon).
This year, eBay introduced CPC (cost per click) advertising with keyword targeting, promoted listings for auctions, and off-eBay promoted listings on search platforms like Google and Bing.
The latter is similar to Etsy’s offsite ads service, and eBay’s CPC ads use the same model like Amazon’s sponsored products.
With the migration from PayPal as the payments processor to managed payments, payments and advertising are growing eBay’s revenue faster than sales.
Thus eBay has found a short-term plan to grow revenue but still has no answers for declining market share.', 'Oscar Mayer listed Hot Doge Wieners on eBay.
And then the listing was removedMegan Lang, Oscar Mayer’s associate marketing director, shares how the brand quickly pivoted after an unexpected campaign bump in the road.
by Diana Bradley', 'CARSGUIDE, Autotrader, Gumtree and nine other classified businesses have finalised their sale by eBay Classified Group to Norwegian-based multi-national second-hand marketplace ad company Adevinta.
In return, eBay Classified Group will receive the 540 million Adevinta shares plus $US2.5 billion in cash.
Adevinta gets 12 classified brands operating in 13 countries (plus businesses in a further three countries), including Australian automotive classified businesses Autotrader and CarsGuide and general classified site Gumtree.
Autotrader Group was bought from Cox Automotive Australia in June last year by eBay Classifieds Group.
eBay Classified Group already owned Gumtree Australia.']

title: ['Rare 50p error coin sells for £360 on eBay – how to spot one in your change... - The Sun', 'eBay: 2021 Trading Card Sales Have Already Passed All of 2020 - Sports Collectors Daily']
summary:
["A RARE error coin has sold for hundreds of pounds more than its face value on eBay, as coin hunters search their change for the most sought-after.
The 50p error coin sold for £360 yesterday on the site, after 47 bids from eight users who battled it out to claim the auctioned coin.
For the £360 coin, bidding started at 99p six days ago.
Back in July, another coin with the same error sold for almost another £100 as one collector snapped it up for £420.
You can also compare other rare coins on eBay to see how much they have sold for as reference, and check you're not overpaying for a rare error coin.", '']

'Fijian Sunset' by Rolf Harris - flogged for £899 on Ebay (50258080)The user has high reviews on Ebay and no complaints.

'Fijian Sunset' by Rolf Harris - flogged for £899 on Ebay (50258097)When he was jailed in 2014, art valuer Brenda Colahan reportedly said: “He will lose popularity.
They said: "I don't care what people say Rolf Harris is an icon of my childhood".', 'To learn more about how to make a profit, keep reading for tips from expert sellers as well as some of the best-selling items on Facebook Marketplace, Craigslist and eBay.
Tips for Selling OnlineRose Winquest, a Grand Rapids, Michigan, resident, sells on Facebook Marketplace full time.

Almost anything can be sold online, but these 13 categories seem to be top-selling items on eBay, Craigslist and Facebook Marketplace.', 'Rare 50p sells for £360 on eBay... and coin experts say there are hundreds more in circulationIf you have a 50p like this in your purse you could be quids in.

If you do think you've got one of these special coins you can get them verified by the Royal Mint.', 'Kaehler’s Wholesale Liquors was located on the corner of Main (17th) and Canal streets where the Mondo Building stands today.
Bill Halpin, McSwain resident, shows his collection of bottles and souvenirs from Kaehler’s Wholesale Liquors which dated back to the turn of the century.

title: ['Pharmacist arrested for allegedly selling Covid-19 vaccination cards on eBay - CNN', 'Former eBay exec accused of cyberstalking says he was an ... - The Boston Globe', "AEW's Max Caster Deletes EBay Listing After Trying To Sell Ring Gear - WhatCulture", 'DriveWealth Names Former eBay Executive Harry Temkin as Chief ... - Business Wire', "eBay Faces 'Vertical' Setback amid Shill Bidding Scandal - EcommerceBytes", 'Undated 20p coin sells for £56 on eBay and tips on how to identify one - Lancs Live']
summary:
['CNN —A licensed pharmacist was arrested in Chicago on Tuesday for allegedly selling dozens of authentic Covid-19 vaccination cards on eBay, the Justice Department said in a news release.
Tangtang Zhao, 34, allegedly sold 125 Covid-19 vaccination cards from the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention to 11 different buyers for about $10 a card in March and April, the department said.
During the arraignment, Zhao was ordered by US Magistrate Judge Sheila M. Finnegan to inform his employer that he was indicted on a charge of selling certified vaccination cards that he received from his job.
If convicted, Zhao faces up to 10 years in prison for each count, according to the Justice Department.
The Justice Department filed another criminal fraud case last month related to Covid-19 vaccination record cards.', 'Five of the people charged have already pleaded guilty and one was sentenced in July to 18 months in prison.
In a July letter to Baugh’s attorneys, the US Attorney’s Office in Boston said Baugh’s work prior to the events at eBay in 2019 were not relevant to his defense.
The US Attorney’s Office in Boston declined to comment on the new filing from Baugh’s defense team.
Lawyers for Baugh declined to comment, and eBay did not immediately comment.
The couple has also filed a lawsuit against Baugh, eBay, and other former executives named in the criminal complaints seeking damages for their ordeal.', '"Need some extra $ this month," claimed Max Caster in an eBay listing for worn ring gear.
AEWIn what was almost certainly a toll move, yesterday saw AEW wrestler Max Caster post en eBay listing for some of his worn ring gear.
Caster has since taken the listing down as "the item is no longer available," though it is still available here.
The 32-year-old wrote the following description for the white and gold attire:-This set of gear has been worn on AEW Dynamite.
Need some extra $ this month and I don't think I'll be needing this stuff anymore... Get it off my hands!', 'CHATHAM, N.J.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--DriveWealth, a pioneer in fractional investing and embedded finance, is pleased to announce the hire of Harry Temkin as DriveWealth’s Chief Information Officer.
Temkin brings more than 30 years of experience in financial services and e-commerce.
Harry was also a critical member of the DriveWealth management team from 2015-2018, helping design and develop the innovative product and platform features that DriveWealth offers today.
“Harry’s perspective on DriveWealth’s capabilities, deep appreciation for client experience, and understanding of product development will further position DriveWealth as the partner of choice for embedded investing,” said Bob Cortright, Founder and CEO of DriveWealth.
Temkin graduated Cum Laude from Hobart College with a Bachelor of Arts in economics and mathematics.', 'But scandal rocked its vaunted Trading Card category today as eBay accused its partner PWCC of shill bidding.
"PWCC has a deal with eBay that allows them to give a smaller piece of the pie to eBay.
One eBay member wondered whether the Feds would get involved as they had in other cases of alleged shill bidding.
One person tweeted : "How much do you think the eBay / PWCC announcement was eBay trying to head-off PWCC launching their own Selling Platform by saying basically "we've seen the backend... don't trust this company"?"
PWCC goes to great lengths to ensure that its employees follow eBay's rules and PWCC employees do not have access to eBay's bidding records or information."', "A rare 'undated' 20p coin has recently been sold on eBay for a whopping £56 after a flurry of bids - and the good news is there are thousands more 'mule' coins out there.
To check if you’ve got a 'mule' 20p, coin experts at Coin Hunter have issued the following step by step check, reports the Mirror.
This will be an updated 20p.”This particular “mule” 20p sold for £56 on August 11 after receiving 16 bids on eBay following a ten-day auction.
Experts at Coin Hunter estimate that undated 20ps typically sell for between £50 and £60, while we recently saw on fetch £57 on eBay.
The Royal Mint would like to assure the public that these are legal tender.”Download the LancsLive app for free on iPhone here and Android here ."]

title: ['Oregon sports card powerhouse PWCC kicked off eBay, accused of ‘shill bidding’ - OregonLive', 'DriveWealth names former eBay executive Temkin CIO - NJBIZ']
summary:
['In an email to buyers Tuesday, the marketplace said “it was determined that individuals associated with a trading card seller, PWCC, have engaged in ‘shill bidding,’ which is prohibited on eBay.
As a result, eBay has restricted PWCC’s selling privileges and listings, effective today.” The company declined to elaborate on its statement.
PWCC bills itself as “the largest, most complete trading card marketplace in the world.” It promotes baseball, football and basketball cards as an alternative investment comparable to fine art.
The Oregon company lists the cards on its site and on eBay and collects a commission on each sale.
PWCC said at the time it was cooperating with law enforcement to investigate altered cards sold through its marketplace.', 'Financial brokerage services company DriveWealth said Aug. 17 that it hired former eBay executive Harry Temkin as chief information officer.
Temkin was a critical member of the DriveWealth management team from 2015-2018, helping design and develop the innovative product and platform features that DriveWealth offers today.
Most recently, he served as vice president of seller experience at eBay, managing an organization of moer than 300 people and the selling technology platform that supports over 1.5 billion active listings.
“Harry’s perspective on DriveWealth’s capabilities, deep appreciation for client experience, and understanding of product development will further position DriveWealth as the partner of choice for embedded investing,” said Bob Cortright, founder and chief executive officer of DriveWealth.
“We’re thrilled to welcome him back.”Previously, Temkin served as the CEO and partner of KnowVera, as well as executive vice president and global head of equity product development for Thomson Reuters in its development of Eikon.']

title: ['Holiday snaps from 1970s found on eBay give new insight into Hill ... - Jersey Evening Post', "Woman transforms 'boring backyard' with Poundland, IKEA, and eBay finds - Liverpool Echo"]
summary:
['A selection of holiday snaps discovered on eBay showing the Charles Rennie Mackintosh-designed Hill House in the 1970s has given conservation experts new insight into its history.
The pictures, bought from a seller in America, were taken by an architect who enjoyed travelling and visited the Hill House in the 1970s.
The white bedroom in the Hill House has not changed much over the years (Taylah Egbers/NTS/PA)The seller had bought the slides from an architect’s estate sale.
The architect’s wife had told the seller that in the 1970s her husband, who enjoyed photography, spent lots of time travelling around famous places, including Hill House.
The Hill House in Argyll and Bute was designed and built by Mackintosh for publisher Walter Blackie between 1902 and 1904.', 'A woman has transformed her 'boring' back garden using DIY hacks and bargains from shops such as IKEA and eBay.
Angelika has completely transformed her garden, making it into a stylish outdoor space.
All I really wanted was to have a table, chairs and plants - so very minimalistic."
Having cleared the cluttered outdoor space, she then began to search for new products to decorate the garden.
It proves that sometimes all you need to transform a space is a lick of paint and some bargain décor.']

title: ['eBay Inc. stock underperforms Monday when compared to competitors - MarketWatch', "McDonald's, eBay sign up to purchase solar from 345 MW Louisiana ... - pv magazine USA", 'Small businesses on eBay to receive more than £25m in funding - Business Leader', 'OK, So eBay Brand Outlet Is the Fashion-Girl Secret Nobody Is Talking About - POPSUGAR United Kingdom', '2013 Hamann Mi5sion up for grabs on eBay in the UK - BMWBLOG']
summary:
['Shares of eBay Inc. EBAY dropped 0.22% to $73.20 Monday, on what proved to be an all-around great trading session for the stock market, with the S&P 500 Index SPX rising 0.85% to 4,479.53 and the Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA rising 0.61% to 35,335.71. eBay Inc. closed $3.35 below its 52-week high ($76.55), which the company reached on August 16th.
The stock demonstrated a mixed performance when compared to some of its competitors Monday, as Amazon.com Inc. AMZN rose 2.06% to $3,265.87, Walmart Inc. WMT fell 0.66% to...', 'McDonald’s and eBay have both reached agreements with Lightsource bp to purchase power from what is planned to be Louisiana’s largest solar project, located 30 miles northwest of Baton Rouge in Pointe Coupee Parish.
The installation in question is the 345 MW Ventress Solar project, set to start construction by the end of this year and slated for completion in 2023.
Once completed, project would represent a nearly 200% increase in the state’s total installed solar capacity, which currently sits at roughly 190 MW, according to the Solar Energy Industries Association (SEIA).
As for McDonald’s and eBay, the project is expected to help both companies make significant progress toward their emission reduction goals.
The project is also expected to be dual-use in nature, with plans underway to include habitat creation and co-located agriculture at the project’s site.', 'Thousands of small businesses have been approved for more than £25m in funding as part of eBay UK’s finance programme, Capital for eBay Business Sellers (CEBS).
Three months on since the programme launched with its first financing partner, YouLend, eBay has seen strong demand for the initiative, with 17 businesses funded on average per day.
eBay UK is also extending the programme with two further financing partners, Funding Xchange and Wayflyer.
“As a small business, we found that traditional banks were not great at giving us what we needed, so when we were looking to secure additional funding, we turned to the Capital for eBay Business Sellers programme.
We’re seeing a clear demand for capital among small businesses, especially those that have been operating for less than three years and where it’s more challenging to get a traditional loan.', "But there's one I recently came across that's so underrated, I'll be committing a faux pas if I don't share.
I've got three words for you: eBay Brand Outlet.
I'm no stranger to the resell side of eBay and have purchased my fair share of gently used designer goods.
But eBay Brand Outlet is a whole new level and one you need to get on your own radar immediately if you love shopping on-trend brand name items as much as I do.
To seal the deal, I've also culled through hundreds of products to find the best pieces to snag now.", 'It was back in 2013 when BMW’s F10 M5 was tuned by the guys from Hamann and introduced as a completely new creation at the Geneva Motor Show.
Presented in a great light show and with pretty models all around, the Hamann Mi5sion had a lukewarm reception, which definitely wasn’t up to par with what the tuner expected.
The F10 M5 was no exception and is still considered one of the sleekest and most understated M5s ever made.
Power was also an issue, as the Hamann crew fiddled with the S63 engine as well.
If you’re interested, you can find it on eBay, listed for £39,999, located in Newcastle, UK.']

["Here's what it's like to get your hands on verified sneakers from eBay, including the authentication badge.
You can shop tens of thousands of verified sneaker listings on eBay, from both Australia and US sellers.
Here's what you need to know about buying sneakers from eBay.
This service is designed to help you buy and sell sneakers on eBay with absolute confidence.
eBay covers the authentication and delivery costs, so you're not paying anything extra to get verified sneakers delivered straight to your door.", 'EBay Kleinanzeigen, one of Germany’s most visited websites and the No.
1 horizontal in the country, will soon have to change its name following Adevinta’s $9.2 billion cash-and-stock acquisition of EBay Classifieds Group.
Since EBay Kleinanzeigen is now part of Oslo-based marketplace operator Adevinta, it will have to change its EBay brand name by 2024.
“For a period of three years we will be able to use the brand name EBay Kleinanzeigen as it is – with the logo and everything that goes with it,” said Paul Heimann, CEO of EBay Kleinanzeigen.
Ebay Kleinanzeigen is one of Germany’s most popular websites.']

title: ['Potentially dangerous diet pills found for sale on eBay, Wish.com ... - Which?', "We're Just Now Realising How Good eBay Home Outlet Is For Shopping - POPSUGAR United Kingdom", 'Man buys 26-year-old Ford off eBay and turns it into a campervan - Metro.co.uk', "Warning after 'Dangerous' diet pills found on eBay, AliExpress and Wish - Liverpool Echo"]
summary:
["eBay, Wish.com and AliExpress have said they will remove a raft of potentially dangerous weight loss supplements from their platforms after a Which?
Regulation of synephrine is more complicated than that of yohimbine and the MHRA assesses individual products containing the ingredient on a case by case basis.
We bought a selection of nine products containing yohimbine and synephrine.
Each platform had at least a dozen products containing yohimbine or synephrine available for sale at the time of our investigation.
Head of Consumer Protection Policy, said:'It is concerning that our investigation has revealed these slimming supplements containing potentially dangerous ingredients are readily available on online marketplaces.", "With all the time we've been spending in our homes, we'd be surprised if you didn't want to completely overhaul your decor (at least) once a week.
For the majority of us, completely redoing the living room from the ground up might not be entirely feasible, but replacing a larger piece here or there or adding in a new accessory is a more approachable — and, let's face it, affordable — way to make things feel fresh in your space.
Now, before you beeline for your usual homeware stores, we're going to share a well-kept secret we only recently discovered ourselves: eBay Home Outlet.
With a range of discounted home and garden items and overstock from an impressive line-up of top brands, including Made and The White Company, it's a true decor-lover's treasure trove — with free delivery to boot.
Ahead, we're rounding up the best scores that will make any space feel brand new.", '(Picture: Wimbledon Times/SWNS)Staycations have been on the agenda this year and these trips have got us admiring the country’s incredible campervans – particularly homemade ones.
(Picture: Wimbledon Times/SWNS)Room for sleeping, eating and relaxing.
(Picture: Wimbledon Times/SWNS)Chris, a service manager for an engineering company, carried out all the work himself – alongside his job.
(Picture: Wimbledon Times/SWNS)Chris adds that the sought-after model is also the perfect size.
MORE : Woman creates dream walk-in-wardrobe and bedroom space for £1,000MORE : Woman transforms Ikea wooden cabinet into stylish rattan sideboardMORE : Woman transforms property that hasn’t been touched in 30 years into minimalist haven', 'Potentially dangerous weight loss drugs and supplements were found on eBay, Wish.com and AliExpress, according to consumer watchdog, Which?.
While some pills were priced at £2.39 plus postage, others were priced at more than £80.
They were available to be shipped from countries including India, the USA, Ukraine and Poland, with many offering free postage.
In response to the investigation, eBay and AliExpress confirmed that they had removed the product listings found by Which?.
She said: "It is concerning that our investigation has revealed these slimming supplements containing potentially dangerous ingredients are readily available on online marketplaces.']

title: ['eBay reveals trends in online commerce - Bangkok Post', 'Lil Yachty Talks Favorite Watches and Surprising Style Icons in New eBay Video Series - Rolling Stone', "Scalpers are selling the 'Halo' Xbox Series X on eBay for $1000+ ... - NME", 'CeeDee Lamb Rookie Card Roundup; Most Watched eBay Auctions - Sports Collectors Daily', "Bradford police officer 'stole biker boots and sold them on eBay' - Telegraph and Argus"]
summary:
['eBay reveals trends in online commerce(Photo: Reuters)Global e-commerce giant eBay says jewellery, gemstones and watches has been the best-selling category from Thailand via its platform over the past five years while products related to healthy living, express delivery service and new technologies are becoming crucial trends in the online shopping world.
This has pushed up the exponential growth of the global e-commerce market," said Rinlita Srirojpinyo, head of marketing of eBay Thailand, during the event.
She said the company has become aware of three trends in online retail commerce.
They are willing to pay higher prices for express delivery, compared with before the pandemic when they focussed more on low-cost delivery.
This year, eBay will attach more importance to customer services, product category expansion and eBay Managed Payment (MP), she said.', 'The two get together for a chat about clothing, watches and crafting a signature look — whether through beaded braids or oversized glasses.
“I wish I could have spoken to Robin Williams [too],” he adds, about a surprising fashion influence.

appeal a chargeback through PayPal, but not through eBay Payments.

GST/HST/Sales Tax ImplicationsSales tax in Canada comes in three types:Goods and Services Tax (GST) is the federally imposed sales tax.
Provincial Sales Tax applies where the province has its own separate sales tax system and rules.
Provincial Sales Tax is known as Québec sales tax in Québec, Retail Sales Tax in Manitoba and Provincial Sales Tax in the remaining provinces.
Harmonized Sales Tax is where the provincial and federal sales tax are collected and administered together as a single rate.', "This is a small label printer that you can place next to your computer.

title: ['eBay Has Plans for Mexico, Its Biggest Latin American Market - Periódico Digital Centroamericano y del Caribe']

E-commerce giant eBay says Mexico is a priority for the business and that its growth will create employment opportunities in the country, its largest market in the region.
Buying online boomed in 2020, when Mexico became the fourth fastest growing e-commerce market in the world, at 62%, despite an otherwise tumultuous year for the retail industry.
Mexico is likely to account for about 27% of the Latin American market this year at around $35 billion, second only to Brazil.

The rare coin is a copy of the new British pound that was introduced into circulation in 2017, but this particular version is missing the notable silver middle.
Usually error coins will have missing elements, like the rare commemorative WW1 £2 coin spotted recently missing the words "two pounds", or the designed printed may be misaligned.
You can also compare other rare coins on eBay to see how much they have sold for as reference, and check you're not overpaying for a rare error coin.
Another was spotted last year, as a £1 coin with the same striking error was sold for £282.', 'On September 7, 2021, Jae Hyun Lee, Senior Vice President, International of eBay Inc. agreed to step down from his role effective immediately.
Lee will continue in a supporting function to aid transition until September 30, 2021.
Lee joined eBay in 2002 and “pioneered online cross-border exports from China-based sellers to eBay’s global consumer base,” according to his bio on eBay.com.
“This has evolved into a significant channel for entrepreneurs and businesses across Asia.”He most recently was responsible for leading eBay’s core Marketplaces’ international business outside the UK, Germany, France, Italy and Spain.
In 2020, Lee received $6.7 million in total compensation from eBay, down from $8.5 million in 2019.', 'Omagh collector ‘couldn’t be bothered’ getting haul properly deactivatedGUILTY PLEA: David Park had the guns delivered to his home in 2017This is the gun collector and war re-enactment enthusiast who was slammed by a judge for buying machine guns on eBay.

In both versions of the UA, eBay refers users to its cancellation policy.
Of all the sections in the new eBay User Agreement, Section 13 – Returns and Cancellations is the most worthy of attention (and also the hardest to compare).', '', 'The most efficient way to build an AI-driven marketplace is to integrate AI software and AI hardware.
According to Kopru, to build a global marketplace driven by modern, powerful and scalable AI services, enterprises must optimize systems after training models specifically for their AI hardware.
A similarity system The marketplace vendor uses a similarity system to integrate AI hardware, including GPU and CPU chips, with its machine learning and other AI algorithms.
After that, eBay builds a kNN (k-nearest neighbors) index -- a type of similarity system that is used offline during index building.
Using the similarity system helps accelerate latency and throughput performance.', "CountryUnited States of America US Virgin Islands United States Minor Outlying Islands Canada Mexico, United Mexican of the exact same Beanie Babies seemingly selling for thousands, while others are selling for pennies?
“Otherwise it doesn’t make any sense.”AdvertisementBoeker also runs a Facebook group for Beanie Babies, which is often filled with people who show up asking absurd sums for supposedly rare Beanie Babies.
Ultimately, Beanie Babies were and are a mass produced plush toy that sells for a couple of bucks.
“Most sellers on eBay claim their Princess is ‘rare,’ but the sheer number of Princess Beanie Babies available for sale on eBay refutes that claim,” the article said.
Ty has never released that information.”“It’s likely that 98 percent of the sellers on eBay selling Beanie Babies don’t know a thing about Beanie Babies or Beanie Baby values,” Schlossberg said.', 'eBay has teamed up with the ubiquitous sneakerhead and longtime eBay seller to share his tips and tricks for listing, selling and connecting with the sneaker community on eBay.
As the ultimate destination for sneakers, eBay is the original marketplace that puts both its buyers and sellers first.
To inspire more buyers to get in on the selling action, eBay has partnered with ubiquitous sneakerhead and longtime member of the eBay community, Jacques Slade.
"eBay's "Inside Drop" is an amazing way to inspire sneaker buyers to add selling to their repertoire."
eBay Sneakers By the NumbersOn average, there are more than 1.6 million sneaker listings on eBay each day.']

title: ['Rare £1 coin sells for £200 on eBay after pub worker spots it in their change - Daily Record', "Here's How eBay Is Using Optimization Techniques to Scale AI For ... - EnterpriseAI", '18 Allegedly Haunted Dolls You Can Buy On eBay - 929nin.com', 'Joe Burrow Rookie Card Sells For $46k On eBay After 2021 Week 1 - 1130 The Tiger', 'KKK obsessed student built pipe bombs with uranium from eBay - The Jerusalem Post']
summary:
['People are being encouraged to check their loose change after a rare £1 coin sold on eBay for an impressive £205.
The seller was a lucky bartender who spotted that they had been given the rare coin in some change.
So-called errors in coins currently in circulation can be incredibly valuable and often spark a bidding war between five interested collectors.
The Mirror Online reports there were 24 bids for the coin on the global auction site before it finally sold on August 8 for £205.
A spokesperson for coin experts Change Checker has explained why collectors are so interested in error coins.', 'Here’s How eBay Is Using Optimization Techniques to Scale AI For Its Recommendation SystemsGetting the software right is important when developing machine learning models, such as recommendation or classification systems.
But at eBay, optimizing the software to run on a particular piece of hardware using distillation and quantization techniques was absolutely essential to ensure scalability.
Machine learning and other AI techniques, such as natural language processing (NLP), play big roles in scaling eBay’s operations to reach its massive audience.
For text understanding and summarization, eBay uses a custom version of the large BERT transformer model, called eBERT.
eBay uses some of the same techniques to optimize the kNN setup, which is used for image classification.', "Here's a few to check out:30 Allegedly Haunted Dolls You Can Buy On eBay Before Halloween Shockingly, on eBay you can find all sorts of haunted items.
Chris The Haunted DollThis listing on eBay claims that the doll is an 11 year old spirit.
Mary The Haunted DollThis listing on eBay claims that the doll is haunted by a friendly spirit named Mary.
Haunted Doll NickSome haunted dolls seem pretty laid back and chill, Nick is one of those:This is nick!
Haunted Doll JessieIf clowns are creepy, imagine owning a haunted clown doll?", "This past week, a Mike Trout rookie cleared $46,000 on eBay...and that was one of the lowest prices for a 2009 Bowman Chrome Mike Trout rookie autograph card in the last couple years.
A 1949 Bowman Jackie Robinson rookie card (that was also verified authentic) sold for just $18,000.
You can see these crazy sales here:But the focus of our story today is actually that Joe Burrow rookie card.
It's a 2020 National Treasures Joe Burrow autographed jersey rookie card serial numbered out of 10 (that means there are just 10 of this card made by the manufacturer).
Everyone knows Joe Burrow from the greatest season a college quarterback has ever had, when he led LSU to the National Championship.", "A 26-year-old French student has been arrested after his school project was discovered to be four pipe bombs packed with uranium dust he bought on eBay, Le Canard Enchaîné reported on Tuesday.
The report was confirmed by VICE News, who stated that the suspect has had a longtime obsession with neo-Nazis and the Klu Klux Klan.
Concerns over the suspect's far-right ideologies reportedly began on August 26 when the student, who allegedly has developmental disabilities, told classmates that he had successfully built four pipe bombs and loaded them with radioactive dust used in scientific experiments that he had purchased from eBay.
A neo Nazi attends a rally in Budapest October 23, 2009.
Following an emergency clean up, there was no reported leak of radioactive materials or harm to the community once the bombs were dismantled by police."]

title: ['Open Mineral raises $33M Series C funding for its ‘eBay for commodities trading’ platform - TechCrunch', 'DJ Skee Partners with eBay for Post Malone Inspired Exclusive Cards - Den of Geek', 'eBay Suddenly Gives Buyers 6 Weeks to Return Items? - EcommerceBytes', 'Parcelforce driver stole £31,000 worth of parcels to sell on eBay - Wales Online', 'Cheeky Huddersfield cafe that went viral up for sale on eBay for £40,000 - Yorkshire Live', 'Rare Pokemon-Themed Oreo Cookies Being Resold For Crazy Prices On eBay - Clout News']
summary:
['Back in 2018 we covered how Open Mineral (OM), a startup aiming to leverage greater transparency in commodities trading, had raised $2.25 million.
Well, they’ve come a long way, and now the Zug, Switzerland-based, company has raised a $33 million Series C funding round led by Mubadala Investment Company.
The commodities trading market is worth $200 billion and even today there’s still a lot of paper flying around, so digitization is continuing apace.
Open Mineral says its platform has registered more than 900 metals and mining companies across the world, using its pricing algorithms across the commodity supply chain.
Buyers and sellers of base metal commodities can tap into a unique and proprietary data hub to trade more efficiently and capture upside.”', 'Rare card auctions and artist signings are cool, but the best part about conventions is exclusive merchandise.
For Gen Con 2021, eBay is teaming up with music industry titan DJ Skee to give out just under 2,000 MTG and Pokémon style cards remixed with a Post Malone theme.
DJ Skee and eBay have designed four custom cards: two inspired by Pokémon and two inspired by Magic: the Gathering.
Each card will also feature a QR code on the back linking to a curated Post Malone Spotify playlist from DJ Skee.
The Pokémon cards (cleverly titled “Postémon”) feature a Post Malone-inspired character in the style of the classic Pokémon anime.', 'Interestingly, eBay said the glitch caused sellers to see an incorrect return date, but that buyers did not.
eBay is giving buyers 6 weeks to return items, according to a rash of reports by sellers upset about the change they're seeing and the lack of notice to them.
Another reader said it was all over Facebook and several YouTube videos that eBay was now telling sellers in writing that buyers, who return items, have 45 days to do so.
Sellers are also discussing it on the eBay Seller Discussion boards, including the following:"Okay.
How long do buyers have to return item after they file a return?"', 'Keep up to date with the latest stories with our WalesOnline newsletterA Parcelforce driver plundered 244 items in three months, the contents of which was worth more than £31,000, a court has heard.
The goods were sold on eBay - most of which were high value electrical, cosmetic and designer clothing products.
Michal Biernacki was rumbled after a customer complained they had not received their item, which turned up on his eBay account, reports the Birmingham Mail.
Prosecutor Lachlan Stewart said: "During the period the contents of a large number of parcels went missing through Parcelforce's depot in Birmingham.
At the end of the day he takes parcels and puts them on his own eBay account."', 'A Huddersfield cafe that made national news and was even mentioned on Loose Women due to its cheeky name has been put up for sale on eBay.
Tea's Me in Lockwood, Huddersfield has been listed for sale on the auction website and could be yours for just £40,000.
The cafe hit the headlines in 2020 when the owner revealed its naughty-sounding name has led to an unexpected rise in business.
"We've had a few people in who said their partner thought they had been on a dodgy website or something."
The YorkshireLive story was picked up by The Sun and was also mentioned on chat show Loose Women.', 'If all the craziness and hype wasn’t enough, Pokemon Oreos came to the rescue.
Crazy Resell PriceBut there’s always a way out and in this case, Pokemon Oreo resellers were the way out!
The rare collection of Pokemon-themed Oreos is already being listed for resale on eBay for crazy amounts of money, with one listed for as high as $1,000.
Then original price of Pokemon x Oreo was just $3.88 which has now been pumped up by reseller on online marketplaces like eBay.
The top three listings on eBay for ‘Pokemon Oreo’ are a box for $19.99 and two Mew cookies for $100 and $250, with a “Buy it Now” option for $1,000.']

title: ['Is eBay Testing Hiding Seller Feedback Numbers? - EcommerceBytes', 'eBay and Form 1099-K - Lexology', "Lidl's £12.99 trainers are selling on eBay in Nottingham for £50 - Nottinghamshire Live", 'Lidl £12.99 trainers on sale for hundreds of pounds on eBay - Cornwall Live']
summary:
['Add to the strange reports on eBay lately - intermittent hiding of feedback counts.
A thread on the eBay seller discussion board , "View Feedback" now instead of showing the (count)????"
The screenshot shows it occurring in Seller Hub, which while inconvenient to sellers, would not be as bad as if buyers were also seeing it.
Let us know if you've seen feedback numbers on eBay replaced by a hyperlink requiring an extra click, where exactly you're seeing it, and if you think it's a test or a glitch.
And if a glitch, how concerning is it (especially after the return shipping-date glitch eBay acknowledged today)?', 'If your answer is yes, then there is a good probability that you will receive Form 1099-K from eBay at the beginning of the year.
The guide below will help you understand what to do with your Form 1099-K.What is Form 1099-K?
As an eBay seller, you will receive Form 1099-K if you meet certain transaction thresholds:❖ You received $20,000 or more in payments from eBay.
If you meet these thresholds, eBay is required to send you Form 1099-K and also send a copy to the IRS.
If an eBay retailer who meets the thresholds doesn’t report their eBay income on their tax return, the IRS would know automatically because they would have already received Form 1099-K from eBay.', "The video will auto-play soon 8 CancelWe have more newslettersSomething went wrong, please try again later.
Invalid email Something went wrong, please try again later.
Lidl's £12.99 trainers have racked up 135,000 searches since the release was announced, exceeding the demand for both of the designer brands' shoes.
And since their release, they are now being sold in vast swathes on sites such as eBay - some for £50 each in Nottingham.
The 'Lidl by Lidl' collection includes socks, swim shorts, and a foldable shopping tote bag in various designs.", "Something went wrong, please try again later.
Invalid email Something went wrong, please try again later.
It was announced earlier this month that Lidl would be releasing its own clothing range in the UK, complete with its highly sought-after trainers.
One eBay account is selling the trainers with a Buy It Now price of £1,299.
The 'Lidl by Lidl' collection includes socks, swim shorts, and a foldable shopping tote bag in various designs."]

title: ['Most Watched Jarred Kelenic Baseball Cards on eBay - Sports Collectors Daily']

["People Are Selling Oreo's New Pokémon Cookies for Lots of Money on eBay - Thrillist", 'Would you buy garden plants off eBay? - The Independent', 'eBay Luxury Watches Are the Best Hack for Scoring Cartier at 30% Off - STYLECASTER', 'Pokémon Oreos are being resold for a bunch of money on eBay - The Takeout', "Lidl 'investigating' as sold-out trainers appear on eBay for up to £1,000 - Daily Record", 'eBay AU is selling Dell gaming monitors at stupidly low prices again - PC Gamer', 'Teacher jailed for selling £500000 of fake goods from dozens of ... - News Shopper']
summary:
['Just days after Oreo started selling new, limited-edition Pokémon cookies, people are already listing packages—and in some cases, individual cookies—for well over the retail price on eBay.
For background, Pokémon Oreos were released on September 8.
In addition to the cookie packages, several people are selling single Oreos, mostly Mews.
Prices on single cookies vary from $4.25 all the way up to $2,500 from what we saw as of Monday afternoon.
As outrageous as that may seem, people are buying both the packs and the single cookies.', 'Please try again later {{ /verifyErrors }}Garden designer Kate Mason admits that until a few weeks ago, if anyone had told her to buy plants on eBay, she would have been cautious about it.
“I would never have gone to a garden for a client and said, ‘I’m getting everything from eBay’,” says the award-winning designer (kmgardendesign.uk).
Garden designer Kate Mason with her Garden Envy display (Hannah Stephenson/PA)“It’s been a complete education for me.
Most of the plants Mason chose are grown in the UK and many were from a nursery close to her home, which sold on eBay.
But in that situation, contact the seller to double check, and if it’s been wrongly described you can get a refund.”How much are you likely to save by buying plants on eBay?', 'Scroll To See More ImagesThe closest I ever thought I would get to a Cartier Panthère watch was through Cartier’s store window — until now.
The acclaimed “It Girl” watch is available on eBay and it’s discounted, so your dreams of owning a Cartier watch could become a reality.
Cartier isn’t the only kind of luxe watch you can get on eBay, either.
Alas, you can get the watch of your dreams with total confidence that you didn’t end up with a fraud.
Cartier TankIf you want to feel like royalty, invest in a Cartier Tank watch.', 'We’re talking, of course, about the recently released Pokémon Oreos, which feature 16 different characters of varying rarity that you can “discover” in each package of cookies.
Dexerto.com reports that the Pokémon Oreos came out on September 8 and customers were limited to a preorder of three packages.
Resales are typically going for between $10-$15, if you look at completed transactions for past eBay purchases.
This echoes the challenges faced earlier this year by Frito-Lay workers, who’d also gone on strike over pay and long shifts.
Aspiring collectors, don’t worry: You can still buy the Pokemon Oreos at places like Target and Walmart, according to Oreo’s website.', 'Lidl are launching an investigation after shoppers complained that its popular trainers have all sold out - only to appear on eBay for a much higher price.
The popular supermarket 's new inexpensive 'Lidl by Lidl' range went viral before it was launched on September 16 and was a huge hit with shoppers.
The trainers for men and women were priced at just £12.99, while the novelty socks are £1.49.
(Image: Lidl GB Twitter)Some sellers are even asking customers to buy them outright for up to £1,000.
A Lidl spokesperson has said: "With regards to items being sold on eBay, we have been made aware and are looking into this."', 'Whether via eBay sales or from the Dell AU site direct, gaming monitors and laptops are pretty much permanently "on sale," so actually buying anything at RRP is its own (undesirable) challenge.
For thrifty PC gamers, the Dell 27 curved monitor (S2722DGM) (opens in new tab) is down from AU$599 to AU$299 (opens in new tab).
That's a 21:9 affair, so it's a wide one, with a 3840x1600 resolution and 144Hz refresh rate.
(opens in new tab) Alienware 38 curved AW3821DW (opens in new tab) | AU$2,499 AU$1,499 (opens in new tab)An absolute beast of a screen.
It's a 21:9 affair with 144Hz refresh rate, HDR600, and a 3840x1600 resolution.', 'He pleaded guilty to all counts, which also included money laundering and offences relating to the distribution of counterfeit goods.
The court heard Gostling had used 22 eBay accounts, 28 PayPal accounts, and 31 bank accounts, which he set up using around 30 different names to run his business from home.
Southwark Council’s Trading Standards team identified Gostling in 2017, when they flagged one of his eBay accounts.
They seized 2,823 fake DVDs, 633 fake Scholl pedicure rollers and several laptops from the addresses.
“I am pleased that thanks to the investigative skills of our trading standards team, the business was halted and any profits he made are likely to be confiscated.”Anyone wishing to report the sale of counterfeit goods can call Trading Standards or Crimestoppers on 0800 555 111.']

title: ['Rare Kew Gardens 50p coin sells for £234 on eBay – how to spot one in your change... - The Sun', 'Twitch Streamer Ludwig Spends $25,000+ On EBay Shopping Bizzare Products - Clout News']
summary:
["A RARE 50p featuring an image of the Chinese Pagoda at Kew Gardens on one side has sold on eBay for £234.
Because the 50p is one of the most sought after rare coins, it's sold for more than 468 times its face value.
More recently though, one seller cashed in on £142 for another version of the rare coin.
If you discover a similar rare coin in your change and try listing it on eBay, you could find yourself quids-in too.
In Changechecker's latest scarcity index on 50ps, Kew Gardens made top of the charts once again.", 'But there was one product that his Twitch chat linked him to which made the streamer have second thoughts about the whole thing!']

title: ['eBay Is Giving Away 48 PS5 Console Prize Packs - Press Start Australia', 'Pokémon Oreos Are Listed on eBay for Thousands of Dollars - Food & Wine', 'Amazon and eBay ‘super seller’ from the UK, Boulevard bags £2.2M ... - UKTN (UK Technology News', "Fitch Ratings Plans to Withdraw EBay's Ratings - Fitch Ratings", 'eBay Australia is giving away a stack of PS5 bundles again - Gamesradar', "What's behind the strengthened eBay, Bidadoo partnership - Equipment World"]
summary:
['eBay has launched another one of its eBay Plus PS5 giveaways, this time giving away 48 PS5 console packs each valued at $1,602.
Each include a PS5 console, an extra Midnight Black Wireless Controller, Pulse 3D headset, DualSense Charging Station, PS5 Media Remote, PS5 HD Camera and Far Cry 6, FIFA 22, Ratchet & Clank Rift Apart and Spider-Man Miles Morales.
All you have to do to enter is sign up to an eBay Plus free trial (or paid membership) between September 23rd at 10:00am AEST and September 30th at 11:59pm.
You then need to text this number “0480 000 020” with the email address that you used to sign up with.
If you purchase an item with an eBay Plus badge, you’ll also be able to enter a second time as well.', 'Sellers making lots of money on eBay for seemingly pedestrian food items is a surprisingly common occurrence.
In total, 16 different Pokémon characters were embossed onto the cookies, with some being harder to find than others.
Oreo even stressed that "the hardest to find (Mew) is featured on an extremely limited amount of the total cookies produced!"
Courtesy of OREOA search for "Pokémon Mew Oreo" on eBay reveals that the cookies have been posted on the site for as high as $25,000.
Though anyone can put something up for sale on eBay, the tricky part is actually selling it.', 'Additionally, a Statista report notes that one of the biggest e-commerce players, Amazon, generated about $80.5 billion in 2020.
Making a dent in this big sector is the UK-based startup Boulevard, which calls itself an online marketplace “super seller.” It has now raised £2.2 million seed investment.
An aggressive expansionBoulevard raised the latest funds from the early and growth-stage VC, Fuel Ventures.
“Rather than ‘batten down the hatches’ we took the decision to expedite the company’s plans to diversify – avoiding furlough and redundancies of our amazing team,” Portman says.
They changed their offering to help multiple independent brands and businesses, who were looking to quickly make up lost revenue by going online quickly.', '', 'The race to buy a PS5 in Australia is extremely competitive: every time we get a PS5 stock update (opens in new tab) it's usually sold out in a flash.
It's not fun at all, but here's an opportunity that might work out for you: eBay Australia is giving away 48 PS5 prize packs, with a value of AU$1,602 each.
According to eBay you'll "double your chances" of winning if you purchase a Plus item during the competition period.
Full details of the competition will go live here (opens in new tab) at 10am on September 23.
Sure, there's only 48 bundles among tens of thousands of Australians looking for a PS5, but you never know!', 'Saying it is "doubling down" on providing tailored solutions for customer segments, eBay has taken a minority stake in online auction company bidadoo.
While the two companies have had an 18-year partnership, the investment takes things to the next level, says Howard Hawk, bidadoo president.
The companies estimate the value of the highly fragmented used equipment market at $50 billion to $60 billion.
bidadoo For bidadoo the deal "will add new value to both buyers and sellers," Hawk says in comments to Equipment World.
And today's hot used equipment market prompted a 15% to 30% increase in pricing and demand in several asset categories.']

title: ['eBay Announces Strategic Partnership and Investment in bidadoo - For Construction Pros', 'Couple save thousands on DIY wedding with eBay dress and bouquet grown in garden - The Mirror', 'eBay Managed Payments Now Live in All Global Markets - But Will ... - eSeller365', 'EBay Kleinanzeigen introduces mandatory SMS verification - AIM Group']
summary:
['', 'Newlyweds Alex and Dan Lilley searched eBay for the bride's wedding dress and grew their own bouquets in the back garden - slashing an enormous £15,000 from their wedding billCouple save thousands on DIY wedding with eBay dress and bouquet grown in gardenA thrifty couple saved thousands on their wedding by buying a bridal dress on eBay and growing flower arrangements in their back garden.
Image: Maxine Grundy / SWNS) Maxine Grundy / SWNS) Image: Alex Lilley / SWNS) Alex Lilley / SWNS)But the parents to Samuel, four, reckon their clever hacks saved them around £15,000 - and it was the perfect day.
Alex said: "People can pay thousands and thousands for their dream wedding but we couldn't justify it.
Image: Maxine Grundy / SWNS) Maxine Grundy / SWNS)But despite the odds stacked against them with a 130-person guest list, the couple's spending totted up to just over £4,000 - miles below what many couples choose to spend on their big day.
Image: Alex Lilley / SWNS) Alex Lilley / SWNS)They cut costs on music by taking their own sound system and using a seven-day free trial on YouTube to stream it - and dodged paying for a verger as their friend at the church offered to step in for free.', 'eBay announced that it has reached a significant milestone in its efforts to move sellers from PayPal to its end-to-end payments system, also known as eBay Managed Payments.
Finally in April of 2019, PayPal was integrated into eBay Managed Payments, allowing sellers who stayed with the program to accept payments through PayPal again.
eBay Managed Payments was plagued by payout failures (including this year) with many complaints about payout delays and other issues requiring contact with eBay customer support specialized in eBay Managed Payments.
In the blog post eBay posted about reaching the milestone that eBay Managed Payments is now live in all global markets, Alyssa Cutright, VP of Global Payments says, “Sellers can run their businesses in one place, and attract potential buyers with more ways to pay.
However, she does make a better case that some processes may be simpler today because of eBay Managed Payments.', '1 horizontal in the country, has taken additional steps to protect its users by introducing SMS verification.
“For us, SMS verification is a further measure to increase the security of our users on EBay Kleinanzeigen,” said Paul Heimann, managing director of the company.
Initially, five categories require SMS verification, including “babysitters & children”, “mini & part-time jobs”, “animal care & training”, “tutoring” and “internships”.
EBay Kleinanzeigen will then ask users to provide a valid telephone number, upon which a six-digit SMS code for verification will be sent.
EBay Kleinanzeigen is part of Oslo-based marketplace operator Adevinta and currently lists around 48 million ads.']

title: ['A second-hand dress and a homegrown bouquet: Thrifty couple save thousands on their DIY wedding - Yahoo Lifestyle UK']
summary:
['The large group of "feral" youths have been causing havoc across the sleepy Worcestershire town of Malvern Link for the past several months.
One couple living on Cedar Avenue, where house prices average around £320,000, caught the hooded youths on their Ring doorbell camera last week.
"We were driving back home after we found out but we were told by a neighbour that they had already left and had made their way to Malvern Link station.
"I want to make the people of Malvern Link aware of this because things are getting worse here.
Residents say the group was the same that had previously been banned from Malvern Link Station by police at the weekend.']

title: ["eBay's New Loyalty Program Pleases Some, Rankles Those Left Out - EcommerceBytes"]
summary:
['eBay launched a new loyalty program by invitation only available in the US in the Watches and Sneakers categories.
eBay began quietly rolling it out May, and while it has a landing page where sellers can request an invitation, eBay has yet to make a formal announcement of the Top Star program.
One sneaker aficionado detailed his experience with the program in the following YouTube video.
Thank you for being a valued buyer on eBay.”But some disgruntled users say the program locks them out, preventing them from buying certain listings for sale on the site.
— Joshua (@Joshua48290523) September 17, 2021eBay sellers discussed the new Top Star program in this thread from June.']

title: ["Cadbury's Vegemite: Unopened Blocks Are Still Going On eBay For ... - Pedestrian.TV", "The Best Interiors Picks On eBay's Homeware Outlet - Refinery29", '84-Mile 1993 Toyota Pickup Barn Find Fetches $45,000 on eBay - The Drive']
summary:
['Cadbury’s discontinued blocks of Vegemite chocolate, which were gone too soon to be quite honest, are still going on eBay for *checks notes* $500.
That’s right, if you have an unopened block of Cadbury limited edition Vegemite chocolate, it might be best to hold onto it rather than ripping it open and taking a big ol’ bite.
And, nearly seven years later, there’s a limited supply that’s still going for a lot of dollaridoos on eBay.
While someone is listing two blocks for $60, another has started a bid at $50 with a buy-it-now price of $200.
That means that for five unopened blocks of Cadbury’s Vegemite pack on eBay, you could buy 200 normal blocks.', "The issue is, homeware can cost a lot.
Whether you’re replacing an old sofa, in the market for a new mattress or adding to a gallery wall, updating your space can be quite a strain on your bank account.
Luckily, eBay’s brand-new Homeware and Garden Outlet is taking the pressure off.
Bringing together discounted and overstock items from brands like MADE.com Emma and The White Company , you can save up to 30% on the kind of pieces you've long had bookmarked on Instagram Shop.
Items like that green velvet sofa you’ve been eyeing for years, or a stylish mid-century sideboard", 'A few days ago, we published a story about a 1993 barn find Toyota pickup truck that had only 84 original miles on it, predicting this would score a fair amount.
It sold on eBay on Friday for $45,100, with the winning buyer swooping in at the last moment with $100 more than the previous bidder to nab it.
eBayThis unusual find was purchased new in 1993, driven for 80 miles, and then pulled a Sleeping Beauty for 28 years in a New Hampshire barn.
It now has 84 Original Miles On It !!!!!!
!”Except for the battery, fuel tank, fuel pump, and fuel pickup assembly, the truck is all original.']

title: ['Oreo Pokémon cookies are reselling for thousands of dollars on eBay - CBS News', "eBay Return Postage Doesn't Add Up - EcommerceBytes", "eBay Glitch Sabotages Sellers' Offers to Buyers - EcommerceBytes"]
summary:
['Oreo has again sparked a sugar rush on eBay with the release of its latest limited-series cookie, a collaboration with Pokémon.
Some characters' cookies, such as Dratini, Lapras and mythical Pokémon Mew, are "harder to find than others," according to the snacks maker.
To be sure, the Pokémon cookies taste like classic Oreo cookies.
Dani Sanchez, an avid collector of Pokémon trading cards, bought thee sealed packs of Pokémon Oreos at a Ralph's supermarket in Los Angeles.
Hundreds of the Mew Oreo have already been sold, according to eBay listings.', 'Dear Ina,Regarding eBay postage on returns.
I’ve noticed on the last several returns that the return postage I’m being charged by eBay is 50% to 80% over that actual postage the buyer paid to receive the item.
The last one last week buyer paid $11.75 for shipping; they decided they didn’t like the item and filed a not as described complaint.
I accepted the return, they printed out the eBay return label that eBay sent them, and sent the item back.
My account was charged $19.10 for return shipping.', 'eBay Randomly Tells Buyers Seller Does Not Ship to Their Location").
eBay began testing the Seller Initiated Offers feature, which it also calls "Offers to Buyers," in 2018, and officially launched it in 2019.
eBay Glitch Blocks Buyers from Bidding"), writing at the time: "Buyers are being blocked from bidding or purchasing items on eBay due to a glitch that states "The seller does not ship to your location.""
Oddly, the "seller does not ship to your location" glitch is a chronic problem that has mystified sellers for years.
The current glitch is frustrating to sellers who wonder how many buyers would have responded to offers if they hadn't been told told the seller wouldn't ship to them.']

title: ['Business is Booming for eBay Consignment Seller DCSports87 - Sports Collectors Daily', 'Limited edition Pokémon Oreo cookies are being listed for thousands on eBay - CNN', 'Gotta eat ‘em all: Mew Pokémon Oreo cookies are selling off eBay for thousands of bucks - PennLive', '‘Disappointing’: Fury over Woolies promo - news.com.au', "eBay Coaches 'Preferred Sellers' in UK - EcommerceBytes"]
summary:
['', 'For some, the answer could be thousands of dollars – as one hard-to-find Oreo cookie featuring a rare Pokémon is fetching a hefty price tag on eBay.
The new Oreo collaboration with Pokemon debuted earlier this month, with cookies featuring various Pokémon embellished into the chocolate.
But some cookies are more rare than others – with some Oreos featuring the extremely uncommon Mew, a psychic mythical Pokémon.
And, as art imitates life, finding a Mew Oreo cookie is just as miraculous in its own way.
The frenzy over the cookies extends further than interest in the rare Mew cookies – some sellers are simply reselling entire packs of Pokémon Oreos, while others sell a collection featuring all 16 Pokémon cookies.', 'Limited edition Oreos with the psychic Pokémon character, Mew, stamped on them are being sold on eBay for upwards of thousands of dollars, putting a literal spin on the concept of “eating one’s money.”Seriously, no joke—just searching “Pokémon Oreo” on eBay results in plenty of hits, including one new listing that’s selling the mint-flavored Mew Oreo for a total of $5,000.
Kotaku reports that Oreo announced its the release of these Pokémon-themed cookies earlier in the month.
These cookies feature 16 beloved characters total: Bulbasaur, Charmander, Cyndaquil, Dratini, Grookey, Jigglypuff, Lapras, Mew, Pancham, Pikachu, Piplup, Rowlett, Sableye, Sandshrew, Snivy, and Squirtle.
Oreo itself also clearly knew what it was doing marketing-wise, as even its brand description of the Pokémon Oreos stirs public interest in some of the rarer cookies.
Life notes that these super expensive Mew cookies aren’t all that much of a scam; at least the profits off of one account are supposedly going to a charitable cause.', '', 'Earlier this year, we heard eBay reference “priority listings,” and now it’s referencing a class of sellers who are “preferred,” although it isn’t clear which sellers qualify for that distinction.
eBay is seeking an “eBay Category Trading Advisor” in its Dublin office to proactively coach sellers to help them grow their sales on eBay UK, according to a listing on its corporate jobs site.
Some of the responsibilities required for the position provide interesting perspective on how eBay coaches preferred sellers, such as the following:Proactive growth coaching of assigned accounts to review, identify and implement agreed scaling opportunities with the sellers.
The listing explains that the objective of the role is to “proactively coach sellers through our Pro-Trading Programme to grow their GMV on eBay.co.uk, by identifying and implementing agreed account scaling opportunities.”We looked for more information about the eBay Pro-Trading Programme in the UK but found only two references.
Does the eBay UK program sound appealing?']

title: ['Pokemon Mew Oreos selling for tens of thousands of dollars on eBay - MarketWatch', 'British Heart Foundation sees eBay sales increase by 12% - Civil Society Media', 'The best toys to buy this Christmas on eBay - Manchester Evening News', 'Cazoo hires eBay and mobile.de exec Abhishek Roy as MD for Europe - AM', 'Mum transformers her dog-chewed dining chairs using £22 eBay bargains after being quoted £600 to have them... - The US Sun']
summary:
['A previous version of this story miscounted the number of Pokemon species in the franchise.
Is this what they call buying the dunk?
The latest Pokemon craze may be hard for some people to swallow: collectors are hawking a rare Pokemon Oreo cookie for hundreds and even thousands of dollars on eBay EBAY.', 'British Heart FoundationThe British Heart Foundation (BHF) saw an increase in the sales it made on eBay of 12% towards the end of 2020 after reforming its online services.
BHF has the largest network of charity shops in the UK, but was forced to close its stores for months during national and regional lockdowns in 2020.
The charity said in a statement that it worked with the online retail firm Shopiago to create a network of stores that catered exclusively for online retail, and was able to list large items held at its third-party warehouses.
The process of advertising and collecting donations was also changed so that it could be used by staff working from home.
BHF and Shopiago said that the number of items sold on BHF’s eBay store rose 12% in the final quarter of 2020, with sales totalling £100,000 over six months.', 'First of all, the craze for Fidget toys continues, becoming the second most searched term for toys on the site.
LEGO Technic Porsche 911 RSR Sports Car Set (£139.99)(Image: eBay)Celebrate an icon of engineering excellence with the LEGO Technic 42096 Porsche 911 RSR.
LEGO Technic McLaren Senna GTR Model Car (£46.51)Looking for the ultimate gift for a child or teen who loves supercar toys?
And this awesome LEGO Technic toy version is equally impressive.
LEGO Technic sets feature realistic movement and mechanisms that introduce LEGO builders to the universe of engineering in an approachable and realistic way.', 'Cazoo has appointed former eBay and mobile.de executive Abhishek Roy as its European managing director ahead of its planned expansion into France and Germany.
Cazoo founder and chief executive, Alex Chesterman, said: “I am delighted to welcome Abhishek to the Cazoo team.
He recently led the sale of eBay’s leading Nordic ecommerce platforms, dba and bilbasen, where he was chief executive, to the Schibsted Media Group.
Roy has also spent time as chief product officer at Germany’s largest car marketplace, mobile.de, where he helped scale the company.
“I am incredibly excited to be joining the Cazoo team to help create a world-class organisation across Europe that delivers consumers with an exceptional digital car buying and selling experience.”', '35-YEAR-OLD Sophie Mallon from Manchester saved nearly £600 on having to reupholster her leather dining chairs with this hidden DIY secret.
A NEWBIE to the DIY world, Sophie received old dining chairs and gave them a new lease of life with this one little trick.
“After my dog tore into my lovely dining room chairs, I believed that fixing the dreary seats would have me break the piggy bank."
Adding: “So, I decided to do a bit of online research and discovered these affordable and stylish seat covers on eBay.
With a tiny bit of elbow grease they fitted on perfectly over my dining chairs and made them look as good as new," she said.']

title: ['Lawmakers push Google, Facebook, eBay and Amazon to disclose fees they get to host investment scams - Financial News', "Fraudster's stolen car eBay con left buyers thousands out of pocket - Northants Live"]
summary:
['', 'Subscribe today to get the latest Northants headlines straight to your inbox with our free email updatesA man who left buyers thousands out of pocket after selling stolen vehicles on cloned number plates has been jailed.
William Arthur Buckley, 36, tricked at least 10 people after advertising vehicles on various sales platforms including eBay, Autotrader, and Dragon Driving.
The con artist would then meet up with potential buyers to sell them stolen vans and pick-ups - bearing number plates belonging to other vehicles.

title: ["eBay Bans Sellers from Listing Refurbished Phones - What's Next? - EcommerceBytes", "eBay Seller 'Crushed' by USPS Insurance Denials - EcommerceBytes"]
summary:
['Last year, eBay began banning sellers from listing certified refurbished goods in any category, and at the same time it began heavily promoting manufacturer-refurbished goods (“Certified Refurbished”).
Now it’s banning sellers from listing any refurbished goods in one category: Cell Phones & Smartphones.
As of October 9, 2020, eBay began requiring items listed as certified refurbished in any category to be approved by its certified refurbished team.
Sellers can still list refurbished goods without the approval, but only as “seller refurbished.”Taking away the ability for most sellers to list refurbished mobile phones – even “seller refurbished” – may be another step toward suppressing any refurbs except those authorized by manufacturers.
You can read more about the new requirements for refurbished cell phones and smartphones, and let us know what you think.', "Dear Ina,Is USPS insurance for eBay sellers worthless?
Since eBay took over payments from PayPal, I've made 2 insurance claims, both for golf clubs, and both have been denied through the claim and 2 appeals.
The buyer took good pictures, I refunded him, and filed an insurance claim.
1 month later claim was denied, followed by 2 appeals, both denied because I didn't fill out the claim correctly.
I just noticed this and it's too late for me now, but possibly that might satisfy the USPS insurance clerk who is doing what he's told?"]

title: ['UK tax bill shrinks for eBay, but digital levy adds £24m to costs - inews', 'Rare Blue Peter 50p sells for £286 on eBay – see if you have one in your change... - The Sun']
summary:
['Online marketplace eBay paid a smaller tax bill in the UK last year, even as its revenue and profit increased.
Meanwhile pre-tax profits jumped by 11.9 per cent to £34.8m, according to accounts for eBay (UK) Limited filed at Companies House.
At the same time, the UK division paid a dividend of £95m to its Swiss parent company eBay Marketplaces GmbH.
The company also noted that it had paid the newly-introduced digital services tax itself, adding a £23.75m bill to its cost of doing business.
Additionally, unlike some other marketplaces, eBay does not pass the UK Digital Services Tax to sellers in the form of fee increases.', 'A RARE Blue Peter 50p coin has sold for £286 on eBay after one keen coin seller listed it just weeks ago.
The rare coin features a picture of the Olympics as drawn and depicted by a young Blue Peter viewer back in 2009.
In the recent £286 listing, the 2009 date is advertised, so this could explain why it has managed to sell for such a hefty price.
Over seven days, 10 different bidders placed their offers on the rare 50p.
When the Blue Peter coin sold towards the end of September, it had racked up a total of 23 bids, showing collectors were keen.']

The average price on eBay was 142.46.
