August 2021 the average resale price was $118.31.', 'I don’t know about you, but when I see Starbucks cups in the news, I hit the deck.
I found one for a decent price online ... and made the person an offer.
It’s the latest in a string of high-priced fast food resales, including the now-infamous $1,000 Pokémon Oreos.
The scalping scheme may also have been going on for longer than we realized, as I found a “vintage” 2019 cup selling for a whopping $500 on eBay.
But these Starbucks cups don’t have the kind of nostalgic value we associate with Pokémon—so who’s out here shelling out a grand for the full line of Starbucks Halloween merch?', 'Today, eBay is launching its latest certified refurbished sale that’s discounting a selection of tech, home goods, tools, and more by an extra 15%.
Sony’s latest pair of headphones deliver improved active noise cancellation alongside up to 30-hours of playback on a single charge.
Everything in today’s refurbished eBay promotion comes backed by a 2-year warranty alongside added assurance from a full refund guarantee to including accessories and more.
Which of course is only made better by the added savings you’ll find below.
Sony WH-1000XM4 ANC Headphones features:Sony’s intelligent industry-leading noise canceling headphones with premium sound elevate your listening experience with the ability to personalize and control everything you hear.', 'The video will auto-play soon 8 CancelWe have more newslettersSomething went wrong, please try again later.
Sign up for the Hot Topics newsletter for hot style and sex tipsA rare coin has sold for a fortune on eBay after it was listed just a few weeks ago.
The 50p features a picture of the Olympics as drawn and depicted by a Blue Peter viewer back in 2009.
Over the course of seven days, 10 different bidders placed their offers on the rare 50p coin.
When the Blue Peter coin sold towards the end of September, a grand total of 23 bids were made.', 'With the sports card market booming, card auctioneer PWCC Marketplace debuts a new format today—a monthly auction platform for sports cards and other memorabilia with values as little as $10, according to the company.
The new feature comes as PWCC continues to rebuild itself as an independent auction platform after an acrimonious split with Ebay two months ago.
For example, baseball card bidding opens Thursday, followed by basketball Friday, football starting Saturday and so on, with each group closing in similar fashion.
PWCC says the monthly auction will also feature new wrinkles such as extended bidding.
PWCC and Ebay split in August, after Ebay accused the card seller of submitting false bids during auctions to drive up prices.']

title: ['Rare Blue Peter 50p coin sells for £286 after eBay bidding war - check your change - The Mirror', "eBay Find: Turbo-Hemi '70 Challenger Raced By NASCAR's Kurt ... - Dragzine.com", 'Lifestyle News | ⚡Step Aside, eBay: Why Flipspot May Be the Next Big Thing - LatestLY', 'People are reselling Hidden Valley Ranch Crocs on eBay for crazy ... - SFGATE', 'The IRS Is Cracking Down on Small-Time eBay and Etsy Sellers - Money', "How Fashionphile's Sarah Davis Went from eBay Store to Leading a ... - Inc."]
summary:
['Coin collectors will pay big money if you have a 2009 version of this Blue Peter 50p coin, released to celebrate the London Olympic 2012 games in conjunction with Blue PeterA rare Blue Peter Olympic 50p coin has sold for £286 on eBay - a whopping 570 times its original value.
Around 2.2million of the Blue Peter coins were minted in 2011 and released into circulation, but an earlier version of the coin was minted in 2009.
In the eBay listing, the coin sold for £286 after attracting 23 bids over a seven-day auction, with a starting price of just 1p.
The description reads: "RARE 2009 Blue Peter 50p NGC Graded Coin MS 68.
We've previously seen how one of these Blue Peter 50p coins sold for £205 on eBay back in April this year, and before that one fetched £148 on the auction site.', '', 'On a mission to reinvent the e-commerce space, Flipspot has launched the world’s first trading platform for products.
With interactive pricing tools, automated order matching, and AI trading alerts, Flipspot aims to reinvent the way people buy and sell around the world.', 'Crocs/Hearst NewspapersIf you took a hard loss and missed out on getting a pair of Hidden Valley Ranch Crocs, you're not alone.
I didn't get the Lightning McQueen Crocs a few weeks ago and it ruined my day.
But your day doesn't have to remain ruined: You can buy Ranch Crocs on eBay.
Some are selling their Crocs for $270, which is pretty nuts, considering others are selling for $90 (with a "Buy Now" of $120).
eBay is a bidding site though, so there's a chance you get outbid if you try to swoop in on those $90 Ranch Crocs.', 'Starting next year, if you sell a bike or an old camera on eBay, the tax man wants to know.
For now, only sellers who move $20,000 worth of goods and complete at least 200 transactions have their activity automatically reported.
And the reality is that taxpayers were always required to report this income — and pay federal income tax on it — even in absence of a form, she adds.
Nearly one-in-five Americans earn money selling something online, according to a 2016 survey of adults by the Pew Research Center.
There are 19 million global active sellers on eBay, up 5% in the past year, the company disclosed as part of its second-quarter financial results.', '']

title: ['Commemorative Blue Peter 50p coin sold for £286 on eBay - Wales Online', 'How Does Selling on eBay Work, and Can You Really Make Money? - MUO - MakeUseOf']
summary:
['Keep up to date with the latest stories with our WalesOnline newsletterA unique 50p coin, designed as part of a Blue Peter competition to mark the London 2012 Olympic games, has sold on eBay for £286 - a huge 570 times the value.
In the eBay listing, the coin sold for £286 after attracting 23 bids over a seven-day auction, with a starting price of just 1p.
The description reads: "RARE 2009 Blue Peter 50p NGC Graded Coin MS 68.
We've previously seen how one of these Blue Peter 50p coins sold for £205 on eBay back in April this year, and before that one fetched £148 on the auction site.
These are still proving popular with collectors, as a list of rarest 50p coins in circulation in 2021 featured seven Olympic coins in its top ten list.', '']

title: ['Second-hand clothes store wins eBay Sustainable Seller award 2021 - Lancashire Telegraph', 'eBay Shares DJ Skee Doctor Strange Variant Cover at New York ... - Den of Geek', 'Rare Christmas 50p sells for £150 on eBay – do you have one in your change?... - The Sun']
summary:
['Go Thrift which is based in Haslingden now employs 15 staff including apprentices from Burnley college and was honoured with the ‘Sustainable Seller award 2021’.
The company was set up Sarah Dean two years ago and began with a team of just two.
Sarah said: “We have all sold vintage clothing individually in the past and knew each other through this.
Sarah said: “We have not seen a drop in sales since the restrictions lifted which we were concerned about.
“All items we list are of a good quality used standard, and we always list in detail any defects that the item may have.', 'DJ Skee took the psychedelic origins of Doctor Strange to heart when eBay asked him to create a variant cover for the Marvel superhero for New York Comic Con.
“I always try to tie into music especially this year with all my releases… and for this one because he lives on the moon, right?” says DJ Skee regarding his Doctor Strange cover.
“I kind of had a bucket list [item] that happened,” says DJ Skee.
It’s just insane.”DJ Skee signs his variant cover exclusive at the eBay booth at New York Comic Con on Thursday, Oct. 7, 2021.
DJ Skee was particularly honored to be involved with such an important Doctor Strange storyline.', "A RARE Christmas themed 50p coin has sold for just over £150 on eBay.
There's a slight catch though, as for UK coin fanatics its value is only because it's decorative - and you can't actually spend it.
Gibraltar mintage figures are typically much lower than UK coins, which means they are often highly sought-after by collectors too, here or overseas.
The coin sold on eBay comes with a matching commemorative card which also hikes up the resell value.
But remember that on eBay a buyer could pull out, which means the coin won't have sold for the price it appears to have."]

title: ['Dumped man sells old campervan on eBay because ‘slab of misery on wheels’ is a reminder of his ‘terrible’ r... - The US Sun', "Expert Warns eBay Sellers, Don't Blow Through Your Ad Budget - EcommerceBytes"]
summary:
['A MAN is selling a campervan on eBay which his ex-girlfriend convinced him to buy - because it's now nothing but a "sad slab of misery on wheels".
Dumped milnthorpe31584 listed his Bedford CF Motorhome for £300 and described it as "a reminder of some terrible life choices".
But the woman left him, "probably for a man with a much more impressive motorhome than mine", so he decided to get rid of it.
"Fast forward a few months and she decided to up and leave (probably for a man with a much more impressive motorhome than mine) leaving only behind this sad slab of misery on wheels.
4 The van comes with a full wiring kit, water tanks, cladding, and a heater Credit: Ebay / milnthorpe31584', 'When eBay announced a new advertising program for sellers to promote their listings on the marketplace’s search listings, it sent a not-so-subtle message to sellers that paid advertising is going to be an essential element for running a successful shop on the platform.
“This obviously puts pressure on sellers to participate and downgrades the value of the current promoted listings program,” said Greg Sterling, Vice President of Insights at the location marketing platform Uberall.
“Increasingly marketplaces, search and social sites are more aggressively monetizing, which forces sellers to pay for placement and visibility,” Sterling said.
Predictably, eBay emphasizes the benefits for sellers that come from paid search.
Sellers can also check pricing on other marketplaces such as Etsy and Amazon to help with pricing strategy.']

From this month, any wristwatch sold for more than £2,000 on eBay UK must first be sent to this lab so that experts can verify if it is genuine.
Only then will it be sent to the buyer.

Christie’s sold a record £68 million worth of watches last', "Dear Ina,I had eBay customer service do something bizarre yesterday and was wondering if this is something related to the fall seller update.
I disagreed with her (didn't tell her that) but told her she had to open up a return case on eBay.

eBay gave her a refund (eBay's money, not mine) and she is getting to keep the item.

title: ['A2C2 calls on eBay to halt the sale of airbags on its site - Repairer Driven News', 'Wednesbury mum who struggled on handouts now runs thriving business on eBay - Birmingham Live', 'Rare Christmas 50p sells for £150 on eBay – and there are thousands more out there - The Mirror']
summary:
['Share This:The Automotive Anti-Counterfeiting Council (A2C2) has called on eBay to immediately halt the sale of airbags and airbag components on eBay.com, saying that the move is the only effective way to prevent the sale of dangerous counterfeit airbags on the site.
Counterfeit airbags have been a subject of concern to the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA).
According to testing conducted by the organization, counterfeit airbags have shown consistent malfunctions ranging from non-deployment to the expulsion of metal shrapnel during deployment.
Images:A screen capture from a National Highway Traffic Safety Administration test of a counterfeit airbag.
(Automotive Anti-Counterfeiting Council)Twenty-eight states have adopted laws prohibiting the sale of counterfeit airbags.', 'Get the latest Black Country news straight to your inboxA mum whose family struggled on handouts after moving to the UK is now running a successful business on eBay.
Mrs Akinyotu, now living in Wednesbury, began selling gifts on eBay which she didn't need to support her family.
The mother-of-three told Black Country Live: "It was definitely a difficult moment (living on handouts).
Her entrepreneurial success has been recognised by eBay, which has crowned her winner of its annual Family Business Award and awarded her a £5,000 cash prize.
"This year’s eBay for Business Awards has been a celebration of this entrepreneurial spirit that has withstood despite small business reeling from the impact of the pandemic.', 'Rare Christmas 50p sells for £150 on eBay – and there are thousands more out thereA rare Christmas themed 50p coin has sold for £150 on eBay after sparking a bidding war.
However, this particular Christmas coin was actually minted in Gibraltar - which means it is technically not legal tender in the UK.
This Christmas coin has a mintage of 30,000, according to change checking website Coin Hunter.
Do you have a rare coin in your collection?
In more rare coin news, last week we saw a rare Blue Peter Olympic 50p fetch a whopping £286 on eBay.']

To get some design ideas, Tiffany turned to social media, scouring Pinterest and different DIY Facebook groups for inspiration.
Offering advice to those keen to start their own design project, Tiffany said: "Do your research, create Pinterest inspiration boards, compare prices and be patient.
Stuart McClure, money-saving expert and co-founder of LovetheSales.com, said it was “great” to hear Tiffany had tackled her DIY project with “huge success”.', "The rare coin is one of the most popular to collect, as it features an image of Kew Gardens’ famous Chinese Pagoda.
But others have scored copies of the coin for less as one splashed out only £142 for yet another version of the rare coin.
If you happen to discover a similar rare coin in your change, you could try listing it on eBay - and find yourself quids-in too.
That way you'll also be able to check you're not overpaying for a rare coin, or underselling the version you might have.
In Changechecker's latest scarcity index on 50ps, Kew Gardens topped the charts also.", 'A DIY novice managed to save £843 by completing her own bathroom renovation after a £1,000 quote from professionals.
Tiffany Olszweski, from Aberbargoed in South Wales, saved hundreds of pounds on her guest bathroom makeover by taking advantage of deals on eBay, Amazon and B&M.
She said: "In terms of our process, I started by looking on Pinterest and different DIY Facebook groups for inspiration.
(Image: Tiffany Olszweski/LovetheSales.com)Offering advice to those keen to start their own design project, Tiffany said: "Do your research, create Pinterest inspiration boards, compare prices and be patient.
Stuart McClure, money-saving expert and co-founder of LovetheSales.com, commented: "It’s great to hear Tiffany tackling her bathroom project, with huge success.', 'Clint Rodgers pleaded guilty to a misdemeanor count of criminal infringement of a copyright.
On Feb. 4, 2015, Customs and Border Protection agents seized a parcel addressed to Clint Rodgers that contained 200 counterfeit Disney DVDs.
According to Tuesday’s plea agreement, undercover federal agents purchased several counterfeit Disney DVDs from the Rodgers on eBay in February and March 2015.
During the investigation, agents contacted two persons who assisted the Rodgers in selling counterfeit DVDs on eBay.
Agents seized an assortment of counterfeit goods, including numerous counterfeit Disney DVDs.', 'Richard Petty’s 1960 Plymouth Fury is listing for $750,000Richard Petty finished sixth in the Southern 500 at Darlington in 1960 in this Plymouth Fury, which the current owner hopes to sell.
For instance, there’s the car that Richard Petty drove to his second, third, and fourth victories in a NASCAR Cup Series career that featured 200 victories over 34 seasons.
Three races later, however, he switched to the 1960 Plymouth Fury and won his first time out in Martinsville.
Richard Petty won three times in the 1960 Plymouth FuryBesides the Martinsville victory, Richard Petty drove the 1960 Plymouth Fury onto victory lane at Orange Speedway in Hillsboro, North Carolina, in 1960 and Atlantic Rural Fairground in Richmond, Virginia, in 1961.
As for the 1960 Plymouth up for sale, that car has been sitting in the Historic Auto Attractions Museum in Roscoe, Illinois.']

If you're a regular at Primark or have seen the chain's latest trends, you'll know their Snuddie is one of the most popular items coming into winter.
Primark describe their Snuddie as a "snuggly oversized hoodie" which are "designed for those lazy days when your comfiest clothes just don’t cut it.
Their post read: "No wonder I couldn't find any snoodies in Primark today - they're all on eBay for £30+".', "An eBay seller was shocked to learn the buyer, who received his amplifier, claimed it was lostThe buyer requested a refund via eBay.
The Iglu Cruise agent has been notified of the change to the cruise line's booking policy and this customer's particular case.
'John Lewis could have Apple products far longer and all the time the Apple guarantee is getting shorter without the consumer knowing.
'However, John Lewis were brilliant and just replaced the headphones even though I feel it should have been Apple.'
Sounds like Apple needs to take a bite out of John Lewis customer service levels.", 'In a bid to help microbusinesses grow their online presence, domain registrar (opens in new tab) and web hosting (opens in new tab) giant GoDaddy (opens in new tab) has teamed up with eBay to help SMBs find new customers.
The new partnership will mean that UK entrepreneurs and microbusiness owners using GoDaddy can now sell their products on eBay through a single dashboard.
Small business owners will be pushed to expand their ecommerce store offerings and find new customers through the GoDaddy Websites + Marketing platform.
With no additional add-ons or plug-ins needed, GoDaddy customers will have the ability to list their products with eBay, using their existing online store product catalogue.
“The new integration with eBay makes it easier and quicker for busy business owners to keep track of, and manage, orders all from one central place.', 'eBay also commits to reduce value chain (scope 3) emissions from downstream transportation and distribution by 20% in the same timeframe.
Separate from the science-based target, eBay is also committing to be carbon neutral for its offices and data centers (scope 1 and 2) by the end of 2021.
"We congratulate eBay on setting science-based targets consistent with limiting warming to 1.5°C, the most ambitious goal of the Paris Agreement," said Alberto Carrillo Pineda, Managing Director, Science Based Targets at CDP, one of the SBTi partners.
"By setting ambitious science-based targets grounded in climate science, eBay is taking action to prevent the most damaging effects of climate change."
From eBay's SBT baseline year of 2019 to 2020, eBay's has already reduced scope 1 and scope 2 greenhouse gas emissions by 19% primarily due to increased investment in renewables.']

title: ['EBay "When you buy a thing, sell a thing..." by McCann London - CampaignLive', 'Wigan eBay scammer must pay back £60000 or face jail - Wigan Today']
summary:
['EBay has unveiled a new campaign by McCann London highlighting how buying and selling on its platform extends the life of products and helps people live more sustainably.
Launching today (15 October), a 40-second spot directed by David Wilson through Riff Raff Films and produced by Lauren Highman delivers the message in the style of a musical.
The spot, created by the agency in partnership with Craft, is being supported by activations on YouTube and radio through the rest of October.', 'A Wigan man who ran a phoney car accessories scam on eBay has been ordered to stump up more than £60,000 by the courts.
Ian Cronin was given a six-month suspended sentence a year ago after admitting to the online racket and was also made the subject of a 90-day curfew.
But now he has returned to Bolton Crown Court to be hit hard in the pocket too.
The court heard that when the authorities pounced on November 11 that year, they found hundreds of vehicle badges, plate sets, tyre sets and keyrings.
Advertisement Hide AdAdvertisement Hide Ad']

title: ['This BMW E36 3-Series Truck On UTV Tires And An Ebay Turbo Looks Like Lots Of Fun - CarScoops']
summary:
['That’s still the normal part because the next plan was to convert it into an off-road capable truck.
So, a cut-off back half, a 2-inch lift, rally wheels, and a set of UTV tires later, the E36 off-roader truck was born.
The truck definitely looks the part as an off-roader, but as you might have imagined, the good old-fashioned E36 suspension that came with the Bimmer was never meant to see anything more than a few potholes and the occasional speed bump.
A few jumps into the trail, and almost everything associated with the rear suspension was completely destroyed, which is when the Grind team decided to do some suitable replacements.
With beefier suspension, it was almost ready to get back on the road, or rather gravel.']

While counterfeit airbags are typically comprised completely of counterfeit components, A2C2 pointed out that another variety of counterfeit airbags have been found to be comprised of certain used OEM components cobbled together with counterfeit components so as to appear to be complete OEM airbags.

Watch the Volvo Gasser in Action on the Dragstrip!', "Instead, the seller sent a package weighing two pounds to the wrong address.

Please try again later {{ /verifyErrors }}A microwave signed by Chris Eubank Jr is selling for tens of thousands of pounds on Ebay.
The microwave has now been auctioned on Ebay and had reached a bid of £65,900 as of Thursday afternoon.
Eubank Jr has since said he will match the winning bid and donate the proceeds to a charity of the bidder’s choosing.
“Been sent a link to an eBay auction that's selling the microwave I signed in Newcastle,” he said.", 'When Chris Eubank Jr was returning to his hotel in Newcastle after a training session last week, he didn't expect to be asked to sign a microwave.
He also didn't expect that agreeing to scribble his autograph on the item would later cost him £66,000.
Chris Eubank Jr's classy gesture as signed microwave is sold on EbayChris Eubank mugged in London as £400 Louis Vuitton bag takenAfter learning the microwave was up for auction Eubank Jr, 32, pledged to match the winning bid with a donation to charity.
He tweeted "Been sent a link to an eBay auction thats selling the microwave I signed in Newcastle.
His classy gesture duly prompted frenzied interest as bids suddenly ramped up, and on Thursday night the device was seemingly sold for £66,000.', '', "Whether you're getting your Christmas presents finished early or treating yourself to a new vacuum, eBay has 20% off its bestselling refurbished Dyson products for a limited time onlyeBay slash 20% off refurbished Dyson products - but the sale won't last longStarting from today, you can get a huge 20% off certified refurbished Dyson products on eBay with an exclusive discount code.
Ranging from a refurbished Dyson Supersonic Hairdryer for only £191.92 normally retailing at £299.99, through to their ever popular, refurbished Dyson Hot + Cool Fan Heater for £259.99, usually £399.99, you can find like-new Dyson favourites for a fraction of their original price.
To get 20% off Certified Refurbished Dyson products, all customers need to do is apply code ' BAG10NOW ' at checkout.
Certified refurbished products are products that were previously returned by shoppers and restored to work like new and approved by the brand.
eBay’s Certified Refurbished hub is a destination to shop high-quality refurbished items at great value prices - and it's also great way to shop if you're switching to a greener lifestyle.", 'Someone is selling Malta’s sand from beaches all over the island on eBay, and environmentalists are worried.
Yes, you read correctly.
The matter was flagged on the local environmental social media platform ‘FAA Facebook Group’, where a member pointed out that Malta’s sand is being exported overseas.
The sand appears to be being sold according to the location that it was acquired from, including from Għajn Tuffieha, Imgiebaħ Bay, Marsaxlokk Bay, Golden Bay, and even Santa Marija Bay in Comino.']

title: ["A Look at eBay's Patent for a Robotic Auto Listing System - eSeller365", 'Chris Eubank Jr. signed microwave returns to eBay with massive bid - World Boxing News']

eBay Patent: Auto Posting SystemeBay was granted a patent this year for a robotic selling assistant that could relieve sellers of listing and order fulfillment duties.
For electronic devices, the robotic selling assistant could plug into the item (ie.
The patent also describes a process in which the robotic selling assistant could use seller-supplied item information and highlight potential discrepancies between the seller-provided data and the assistant’s determination.
An intriguing option in the patent application is that the robotic selling assistant could be an autonomous vehicle that picks up and delivers items, including the use of drones.', 'The infamous Chris Eubank Jr. microwave is back on eBay with an enthusiastic fan’s massive bid of $80,000 plus.

title: ['Contemporary Nudes Now Allowed on eBay? - EcommerceBytes', 'What Is Bid Sniping on eBay, and How Do I Beat It? - How-To Geek', 'Rare error £1 coin sells for £206 on eBay – how to spot one in your change... - The Sun']
summary:
["Sellers are speculating that eBay will now allow them to list contemporary nude art photographs in the Collectibles category after banning them over the summer.
eBay eliminated its entire Adult Only category this summer, but allowed sellers to move certain adult items to other categories as long as they didn't contain sexual content.
They can be listed only in the following categories:- Art categories- Collectibles > Paper > Pin Up > Vintage (Pre-1970)- Collectibles > Postcards > Non-Topographical Postcards- Collectibles > Photographic Images > Risqué > PhotographsAs can be seen, the fourth category no longer restricts listings to pre-1940 vintage and antique items.
eBay made changes to the Collectibles category on October 12th.
Did it mean to change its policy around nudes by modifying a sub-category?", 'Bid sniping is the tactic many bidders use to swoop in and win an auction at the very last second.
They do this by placing a bid higher than the current bid just seconds before the auction ends.
eBay vs. Craigslist vs. AmazonTake Advantage of Automatic BiddingYou can use automatic bidding in each and every eBay auction you participate in, and you can take full advantage of it without having to adjust any special settings since automatic bidding is a built-in feature in every eBay auction.
If you set $5,000 as your maximum bid, but are only hoping to pay $300, and then someone comes and bids $4,900, eBay will automatically bid $5,000 for you.
Note that your maximum bid doesn’t consider shipping in the equation—that’s handled separately.', "A RARE £1 coin with a notable minting error has sold on eBay for £206.
Only last month a similar coin sold for almost the same price as a buyer walked away from the online auction after paying £205 for a coin with the same fault.
Though these errors were notable and somewhat comical to collectors, error coins can easily slip into your own change too, and they're often overlooked as the faults can be sometimes hard to spot.
Compare other rare coins on eBay to see how much they have sold for as reference, and check you're not overpaying for a rare error coin if you buy one yourself.
Online tools from change experts like Coin Hunter are helpful to see how much it could be worth too."]

title: ['EBay Slides After Disappointing Forecast for Holiday Sales - Yahoo Finance', 'EBay revenue outlook disappoints as pandemic-led boom fades - Reuters', 'Tractor seller blackmailed by disgruntled Ryton eBay customer - Chronicle Live']
summary:
['(Bloomberg) -- EBay Inc. worried investors with a holiday sales outlook that suggests shoppers are abandoning the online marketplace and resuming pre-pandemic spending habits.
Earnings, excluding some items, will be 97 cents to $1.01 a share, in line with estimates of 99 cents.
Story continuesThe company also said it will expand its stock buyback program to $7 billion from $5 billion.
In June EBay said it will sell just more than 80% of its South Korean online marketplace to local retailer E-Mart Inc. for $3 billion.
(Updated with third-quarter performance in the fifth paragraph)Most Read from Bloomberg Businessweek©2021 Bloomberg L.P.', "Oct 27 (Reuters) - EBay Inc (EBAY.O) on Wednesday projected holiday-quarter revenue below market expectations, another sign that the online shopping boom fueled by the pandemic was tapering as consumers returned to stores.
The company was a big corporate winner in 2020 when lockdowns forced people to shop on its online marketplace, but growth has slowed since then as vaccinations encourage consumers to step out.
EBay said it expected fourth-quarter revenue between $2.57 billion and $2.62 billion, well below analysts' average estimate of $2.65 billion, according to Refinitiv IBES data.
The company also reported a 5% decline in the number of active buyers on its marketplace in the third quarter.
Gross merchandise volume, the total dollar value of sales on eBay from which the company takes a percentage, fell 10%.", 'Simon Hutton had travelled to buy the machine in the North West after was advertised for sale for £695 on eBay.
The victim, who is in his 60s, ignored that but then a month later Hutton rang him and was abusive.
Hutton then started sending the increasingly worried victim texts.
"I don't understand why he did what he did, I don't understand his motives.
"His actions have really concerned me and I don't understand why he picked on me in this way."']

The player sample Air Jordan 1 “Chicago” from 1985.
Fans can also learn more about eBay’s 3D true view tech by clicking here.']

title: ['A Signed 1985 Nike Air Jordan 1 Player Sample Just Landed on eBay for $250,000 - Robb Report', 'eBay Raises Shipping for Items Going to Australia, New Zealand - EcommerceBytes', 'Rare £1 error coin sells for £156 on eBay – check your change to see if you could be quids-in too... - The Sun', 'Natick couple’s lawsuit against eBay misses the mark, company says - The Boston Globe', 'These are the most popular Halloween costumes for 2021, according to Google and Ebay - image.ie', 'FTC approves Emart acquisition of eBay Korea - The Korea JoongAng Daily']
summary:
['A prototype pair of 1985 Nikes made specifically for the Michael Jordan just hit the resale market.
The pre-owned sneakers are a player sample and come with the NBA legend’s signature on the right shoe.
Now up for auction on eBay for $250,000, the Nike Air 1 OG Chicago Player Sample—with a left shoe in size 13 and a right in 13.5—was kept in multiple safe deposit boxes to keep the kicks in pristine condition.
To keep things on the up and up, the Air Jordan 1 listing is being managed on eBay by Auction Cause, and the sneakers will be authenticated before being shipped to the buyer, according to eBay.
Earlier this year, an equally pristine pair of the Nike Air Jordan 1s listed on eBay with the asking price of $1 million.', 'eBay is raising shipping rates for packages going to Australia and New Zealand using its eBay International Standard Delivery Service (not to be confused with eBay’s Global Shipping Program).
The company blamed “increased international shipping costs” to those countries as the reason for the rate increase.
And, we will continue to post shipping updates throughout the holiday season.”eBay International Standard Delivery Service supports shipments to over 210 countries.
“As a result, there may instances where you are provided a USPS international shipping label and will ship the package directly to your international buyer.
In other situations, we will provide you with a USPS domestic service shipping label addressed to eBay’s trusted warehouse partners.', "A RARE £1 error coin has sold on eBay for over £150, because it's missing one crucial element.
2 The pound coin is missing one crucial element Credit: eBay2 Over 20 bids were placed on the rare error coin Credit: ebayThis happened in the minting process of the coin, and actually makes it resemble more the old style pound coins that stopped being legal tender back in 2018.
The minting fault means the coin is missing the silver nickel plated alloy middle that's seen on all the modern British pound coins we use everyday.
Error coins are still legal tender - so long as the original coin is still in circulation too.
Sellers can often make big money exchanging rare error coins on sites like eBay.", 'Much of a Natick couple’s lawsuit over a bizarre harassment and cyber stalking campaign conducted by former eBay employees should be dismissed, the company said on Friday in a filing in federal court.
Advertisement“Nowhere in this motion or elsewhere does eBay intend to minimize the conduct alleged in the complaint,” the company’s lawyer wrote.
“eBay recognizes that the Steiners likely are entitled to some fair and appropriate recovery for that conduct.
In August 2019, several eBay employees traveled to Boston and repeatedly drove past the Steiners’ house and followed the couple using rented vehicles.
The company apologized to the couple in a statement after the lawsuit was filed in July.', 'To be honest, us neither, costume and facepaint and ticketing all sounds like a lot of work… maybe too much work.
But clearly some people have parties to attend and costumes to make because “Halloween costumes” has been a popular search term these last few days – probably with panicked parents furiously trying to pull something together from bits of paper and an old pair of tights.
According to Google, most people are keeping it traditional, with “witch costume” being the most popular search term in the US (unfortunately, Google is not providing data for outside the US).
You can see the full list below, but more zeitgeisty is Ebay.ie’s costume list, opening with a cultural current take on proceedings of Squid Game at the top.
Most search 2021 Halloween costumes on Google:Witch Rabbit Dinosaur Spider-Man Cruella de Vil Fairy Harley Quinn Cowboy Clown ChuckyMost-searched 2021 Halloween costumes on Ebay.ie:', 'FTC approves Emart acquisition of eBay KoreaThe Fair Trade Commission (FTC) approved Emart’s share acquisition of eBay Korea on Friday.The antitrust body said it gave the green light for the deal because it “concluded [the acquisition] will not limit competition in the online shopping or related markets.”The approval was announced four months after Emart said it will acquire 80 percent of eBay Korea shares for 3.44 trillion won ($2.9 billion).Emart runs offline marts as well as e-commerce site SSG.com.eBay Korea runs e-commerce sites Gmarket, Auction and G9.The FTC said it categorized Emart’s business into five different models: Online shopping, open market, online grocery shopping, simple payment and offline shopping.In open market, individual sellers sell products on the platform and are charged a commission.“We concluded that concerns for limiting competition in all these categories [of business] are low,” said the FTC in a statement.
It added that there isn’t yet a dominant online shopping player in the domestic market.In the 161-trillion-won online shopping market in Korea, Naver Shopping leads with a 17 percent market share, followed by Coupang with 13 percent, eBay Korea with 12 percent and 11st with 7 percent.In the United States, Amazon leads the market with 47 percent, and in China, Alibaba leads with 56 percent.“As a latecomer, SSG.com’s market share only stands around 3 percent, so the business combination [with eBay Korea] will not raise its market share significantly,” said FTC.It added that it will be difficult for the online seller to significantly raise commissions charged to individual sellers, as “competition to attract more sellers to their platform is fierce” amongst e-commerce operators.The rapid market growth of direct purchases from overseas and specialized online malls are other factors that make the online shopping market heated.Specialized malls refer to sites like Ohouse and Market Kurly that are focused on a specific theme of products, according to the antitrust body.Direct overseas purchases made in the first quarter totaled 1.41 trillion won, up 442 percent on year.“A new competition is expected to arise from this approval, like strengthening online competitiveness by traditional offline retailers and [an effort by the traditional retailers to] actively connect online and offline platforms,” said the FTC in a statement.Apart from the eBay Korea acquisition, Emart acquired fashion platform W Concept for 265 billion won, the SSG Landers baseball club for 135.2 billion won and additional shares of Starbucks Korea from Starbucks this year.
It agreed to sell its headquarters in Seongsu-dong, eastern Seoul, to a consortium led by game developer Krafton for around 1 trillion won.SSG.com is planned to go public.
It chose Mirae Asset Securities and Citigroup Global Markets Korea Securities as the lead underwriters of its IPO.“Expanding delivery capacity has become necessary,” especially since the capacity of its NEO distribution centers is almost full, said Yoo Seung-woo, an analyst at SK Securities.BY JIN MIN-JI [jin.minji@joongang.co.kr]']

title: ['A Trick to Bring Your eBay Sales Back from the Dead - EcommerceBytes', "Grandparents create 'hobbit shed' with items from Home Bargains, eBay and charity shops - Liverpool Echo"]
summary:
['In an aptly timed post this Halloween, Don Heiden, aka The Auction Professor, has a trick to bring your sales back from the dead.
It first started with the loss of the ability to list new items in the effected categories, and then sellers' views, watchers, and sales all jumped off the cliff.
Views, watchers, and sales all started rolling back in, almost immediately.
In the end, a simple trick many resellers had used in the past worked like a charm to rejuvenate most effected resellers' views, watchers, and sales.
Firstly, by using "Sell Similar" you are creating an entirely new listing, which means it will count towards your store's listings limits.', 'May and Rod Proctor bought cheap items from eBay, Home Bargains and charity shops to help create the perfect look.
"Our other supplies largely came from eBay or the local charity shop.
We picked up two large tins of paint from the charity shop for £12 and the fabric we used for the curtains and cushion cover came from eBay for £10.
In the charity shop we also picked up a lamp to go in the shed for £2.99 and the artificial grass was £25 from eBay.
(Image: LatestDeals.co.uk)“I bought all of the plants and pansies to line the gravel path from Home Bargains and put them in old teapots we found in the charity shop.']

title: ['Matthew Rhys on why he restored a wreck he bought on eBay - The Times', 'Walmart and eBay Trail Amazon in Online Sales - EcommerceBytes']
summary:
['From his home in Brooklyn the Perry Mason star Matthew Rhys explains that his fellow Welshman, the director Marc Evans, believes that there are two kinds of Welsh songs.
One is “standing on the dock, waving goodbye to the boat”.
The other is “standing on the boat, waving goodbye to your homeland”.
All this is apropos “hiraeth”, the Welsh word that Rhys, a 46-year-old living in America who shares his life with a Hollywood actress, defines as a longing for “something that once was and can never be again”.
With detectable pride and in his Welsh baritone, Rhys says that if melancholy were an Olympic sport, the Welsh would be gold medal-winners.', 'Amazon has a 41% market share in the US retail ecommerce space, according to eMarketer data released in late October.
Its nearest rival comes in at only 6.6% market share – Walmart.
eBay comes in third, with 4.2% market share.
Unlike eBay, Amazon also sells goods directly.
The fact that no other online-selling entity has double-digit share according to eMarketer is astounding.']

title: ['JJ CoComelon doll listed for DOUBLE on eBay after must-have Christmas toy SELLS OUT in shops like Argos... - The Sun', 'Cordless drill impact driver on sale at Ebay - mySA', 'A BTS Meal Chicken Nugget Sold on eBay for Almost $100,000 - Showbiz Cheat Sheet', 'eBay is Giving Away Sneaker Collector’s Best Grails at ComplexCon - Complex', 'The Adidas Ebay store is running a BOGO half off deal - SFGATE', 'eBay Dropped After Earnings: Should You Consider It? - The Motley Fool']
summary:
['The JJ CoComelon doll is out of stock at many retailers and already selling for £20 over its recommended retail price on eBay.
5 The CoComelon JJ doll is a Christmas must-have this year5 Kids can feed the doll or sing a long to nursery rhymes with itThe interactive doll stands at 12 inches tall and is a popular character from the CoComelon YouTube series.
The Sun checked online at retailers including Smyths Toys, The Entertainer, The Toy Shop and Argos and the doll was out of stock.
It added that were still other toys in the Cocomelon range available online and in The Entertainer shops.
None of the major retailers we checked currently had the CoComelon doll in stock online, but you could always call your local branch to see if they have any in store.', '', 'They’re also the boy band behind the McDonald’s BTS Meal.
Last summer, a chicken nugget sold with the BTS Meal sold on eBay for $100,000, according to a BTS fan Twitter account.
The limited-edition BTS meal sauces are no longer available at McDonald’s, although they are available via eBay for about $20 per set.
Additionally, “Crew T-Shirts” worn by the actual McDonald’s employees while the BTS Meal was sold are available through eBay.
“Butter,” BTS’ single released just days before the BTS Meal, is currently available on most major music streaming platforms, including Spotify.', 'After a two-year hiatus, ComplexCon is finally returning to Long Beach this weekend (November 6-7).
Throughout the weekend, eBay will be showcasing exclusive sneakers from the personal collections of avid collectors DJ Skee, Melissa Chanel, and Kenny Gonzales.
Allowing attendees to get in on the action, eBay is giving away several grails—all backed by their Authenticity Guarantee—during ComplexCon as well.
The exclusives don’t stop there as eBay is also bringing a first-of-its-kind vending machine to Long Beach.
Whether you’re a newbie or an avid collector, the eBay activation is where you need to be this weekend.', "I used to regret insisting to my wife we register the Adidas ebay store and only the Adidas ebay store for our wedding, but with this buy 1 get 1 for 50% deal, it looks like daddy will be having the last laugh after all!
Time to figuratively kick off your holiday shopping spree with a s-w-e-e-t deal on more than 8,000 adidas shoes, clothes, accessories, and sporting goods for men, women, and kids.
From thousands of men’s and women’s shoes to hundreds of items $17 and under like this adidas Originals Relaxed SST Strap-Back Hat Men's ($13) and a camo fanny pack ($14), this sale has adidas for everyone.
Peep hot ticket items like these HYKE Ultraboost AH-001 Men's Shoes ($168) or this extremely cozy Utilitas Hooded Women’s Parka ($128) for surviving a blizzard in style.
Shop the buy-1-get-1-half-off sale at the Adidas ebay store before the deal ends on November 8!", "eBay (EBAY 2.82%) stock slid immediately following the release of its third-quarter earnings results on Oct. 27, despite posting strong revenue and earnings numbers.
Nonetheless, eBay now retains a higher percentage of that transaction volume as revenue, which grew 11% to $2.5 billion.
Unfortunately, this top-line growth wasn't enough to drive profits higher as earnings per share fell 50% year over year to $0.43.
For the current period, management is guiding for revenue growth of just 3% to 5%.
Why eBay still has room to runA key factor investors should consider is the change in the company's direction under CEO Jamie Iannone."]

title: ['Like New 552-Mile 1987 Buick GNX Offered For Sale On eBay - GM Authority', 'eBay Requires Buyers to Pay Now for Best Offers - EcommerceBytes', 'State’s Unclaimed Property Division has success with eBay auctions - Seymour Tribune', 'A2C2, General Motors Ask eBay to Stop Selling Counterfeit Airbags - GM Authority', 'eBay Confirms Test of Immediate Pay on Best Offers - EcommerceBytes']
summary:
['', 'eBay is requiring some buyers to pay immediately if a seller accepts an offer on an item, known as Best Offers.
During last week's earnings call, eBay CEO Jamie Iannone told Wall Street analysts that eBay had effectively eliminated "Unpaid Items" on Fixed Price transactions and had "continued to reduce this issue for Best Offers."
Now eBay has virtually eliminated it in Fixed Price, he said, and "we're doing so in Best Offer, and so sellers won't have to face that issue, and it takes friction out of the platform."
Iannone said at the time , "Changes have already been implemented to Fixed Price sales, where 99% of transactions are now paid upfront.
And to help ensure that you get paid on Best Offer sales, we'll soon start to ask buyers to provide a payment source at the time their offer is made."', 'The Office of the Indiana Attorney General’s Unclaimed Property Division has ventured into a new method of monetizing physical items — offering them for auction on eBay.
Once unclaimed property is in its custody, the division conducts an outreach effort to locate the rightful owners or heirs.
Then we will be listing them on the eBay auction site.”To follow the division’s eBay auctions, visit indianaunclaimed.gov/app/auctions.
Be sure to search your name and the names of friends and family at the Unclaimed Property Division’s database at indianaunclaimed.gov.
Year to date, the Indiana Unclaimed Property Division has returned more than $35 million with the average claim amounting approximately $990.', '', 'Some buyers who make an offer on an item are forced to pay immediately upon the seller accepting the offer.
eBay confirmed it is a test.
So for every offer the buyer in fact has to confirm the payment option, shipping details before they submit the offer.
For every offer the buyer does have the ability to edit/add new payment method as well as shipping address and choose from the delivery options available.
This is the current behavior for the test group.”Check out the EcommerceBytes Blog for a link to a video about the feature, and leave a comment.']

title: ["Rare Kew Gardens 50p coin on sale for £220 on eBay – and there's loads out there - Daily Star", 'iPhone With USB-C Port Is Attracting $100000 Bids on eBay - PCMag']
summary:
['Sign up for the Hot Topics newsletter for hot style and sex tipsRare coin collectors know just how valuable the Kew Gardens 50p is.
Recently we saw the rare 50p coin sell for around 300 times its face value on eBay.
However, last month an old 50p coin rare and harder to find than the Kew Gardens was revealed to be worth a lot.
The EC 50p coin was released between 1992 and 1993 by the Royal Mint to mark the completion of the Single Market.
Only 109,000 of these rare 50p coins were minted, which is far less than the Kew Gardens coin that has 210,000.', "Original Story:The robotics student who modified an iPhone X with a USB-C port last month has put the device up for auction(Opens in a new window) on eBay — and it’s already attracting some eye-popping bids.
The modified iPhone X comes from Ken Pillonel, who’s studying for a Master's degree in Robotics at the Swiss Federal Institute of Technology.
Last month, he uploaded a video of his custom device, which ditches the Lighting port for a USB-C slot, making the iPhone compatible with standard USB-C cables and chargers.
On Monday, he uploaded a more in-depth 13-minute video(Opens in a new window), explaining the steps he took to retrofit the iPhone X with a USB-C port.
If you'd like to mod your own iPhone with a USB-C port, Pillonel has open-sourced(Opens in a new window) the techniques he used by posting them on Github."]

title: ['eBay Australia appoints new chief as former MD and one-time CMO ... - CMO', 'eBay Inc. stock underperforms Friday when compared to competitors - MarketWatch', 'For the Holiday Shopping Season, eBay Is Selling Rare Sneakers From DJ Skee, La La Anthony and Jacques Slade for ‘The Sleigh Drop’ - Footwear News', "EBay sellers cash in on parents' desperation with massive mark-ups ... - inews"]
summary:
["The retail digital marketplace appoints head of product and shipping to VP and managing director for AustraliaDavid RamadgeEbay has appointed a new A/NZ VP and managing director following the departure of former and chief and one-time CMO, Tim Mackinnon, to Providoor.
While in the US, he worked for eBay as director of local commerce then director of entrepreneurship and venture outreach.
In a statement, eBay senior VP of Asia-Pacific, Joo Man Park, said Ramadge is tasked with taking the eBay Australia business to the next level.
In a LinkedIn post, Mackinnon confirmed he is now joining Australian restaurant marketplace, Providoor, as its chief executive officer.
You can also follow CMO on Twitter: @CMOAustralia, take part in the CMO conversation on LinkedIn: CMO ANZ, follow our regular updates via CMO Australia's Linkedin company page", "Shares of eBay Inc. EBAY shed 0.93% to $75.57 Friday, on what proved to be an all-around favorable trading session for the stock market, with the S&P 500 Index SPX rising 0.37% to 4,697.53 and the Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA rising 0.56% to 36,327.95.
The stock's fall snapped a two-day winning streak.
eBay Inc. closed $5.62 below its 52-week high ($81.19), which the company reached on October 22nd.
The stock underperformed when compared to some of its competitors Friday, as Amazon.com Inc. AMZN rose 1.21% to $3,518.99,...", 'Today, eBay is launching “The Sleigh Drop,” its holiday sneaker sale delivering exclusive access to the collections of famed collectors to its shoppers.
For this event, sneakerheads can pick up looks from the likes of La La Anthony, DJ Skee and Jacques Slade.
“The Sleigh Drop” will be series of drops, which begins today with some of DJ Skee’s sneakers.
After Skee, the drops will continue through December, with Slade starting Dec. 3 and Anthony starting Dec. 17.
He anticipates posting 700-plus pairs for “The Sleigh Drop,” and he wears size 11 and 12.', 'ExclusiveOpportunistic eBay sellers are buying up popular Christmas toys and listing them online for more than double the recommended retail price.
has an RRP of £39.99 but eBay sellers are listing the product at £66, £69.99 and £79.99 variously.
One user openly admitted when approached that they were selling the doll at nearly double the retail price because of “the lack of stock” available elsewhere.
Natasha Crookes, director general of the Toy Retailers Association, advised parents to shop around before making their purchases in light of i‘s findings.
An eBay spokesman said: “We understand that high prices for popular toys can be frustrating for parents.']

title: ["Danger Mouse's Danger Car is for sale on eBay - and it could be yours - Birmingham Live", 'Online Sellers Guide on What Not to Sell on eBay - EcommerceBytes']
summary:
['Get the latest Black Country news straight to your inboxIt's one of the coolest cars you've never seen - but now a real-life version of Danger Mouse's Danger Car is on sale in the Midlands.
The car, designed over an existing 1999 Mazda MX5, is being sold by Wednesbury -based dealership Emerald House of Cars.
None of the original car, the Mazda MX5, you can't even see any of the original car.
"Our aim was to win best car at the rally - they do awards for different things - and we were able to win best car, but we won the judges' choice overall (too)."
The dealership will also be releasing a small documentary series about the special Danger Mouse car build, which can be viewed on their YouTube channel.', 'Just as important as knowing what to sell on eBay these days is knowing what not to sell.
A big question I am always asked by those interested in reselling is what should they sell on eBay, or, really, any site.
With the VERO program, a business, artist, or other entity can register their products, names, and other aspects with eBay.
When a reseller lists one of those items, or uses one of their brand names, eBay can and will remove the listing; eBay usually suspends your account for three days or more.
Velcro and Onesie are registered trademarks and both entities are part of eBay’s VERO program.']

title: ['As eBay Sales Decline, One Category Grows by Double Digits - EcommerceBytes']
summary:
['As eBay sales decline, there is one product category on its platform that is growing by double digits.
A week after eBay reported a 10% decline in third-quarter sales, it issued a press release in which it bragged that sales in its Sneakers category continued to grow at double-digit rates.
eBay runs special sneaker promotions that get media attention, like the one it announced on Friday.
And eBay charges no commission fees on sneakers that sell for over $100 to attract listings for sought-after goods.
But what if you don’t sell sneakers (or watches, trading cards, or handbags)?']

title: ['Head of eBay Collectibles Departs for New Kind of Trading Platform - EcommerceBytes', 'eBay, bidadoo Strategic Partnership, Announcement : CEG - Construction Equipment Guide', 'Tim Mackinnon Named CEO of Providoor, eBay Welcomes New MD - Power Retail', "Defunct Tati Beauty's eyeshadow palettes are now selling for $400 ... - Cosmetics Business", 'Rare Charles Dickens £2 with an error sells for £350 on eBay – but is it really worth a mint?... - The Sun', 'Cheeky eBay sellers list packets of Walkers crisps for £7 a bag as shortages hit supermarket shelves... - The Sun', "Fitch Affirms eBay at 'BBB' with a Positive Outlook; Withdraws Ratings - Fitch Ratings"]
summary:
['eBay lost a key executive to a rival platform with the departure of Nicole Colombo, head of eBay Collectibles, who is joining Alt where she will oversee strategy, marketing, customer experience, and business development.
Cutler’s departure served as a wakeup call to eBay, and it began launching an “innovation playbook” in vertical categories such as Sneakers, Trading Cards, Luxury Watches, and Handbags.
eBay poured resources into the Trading Card category with the help of Colombo.
Alt credited Colombo with growing eBay Collectibles 144% with the launch of “new experiences for collectibles enthusiasts during her tenure as General Manager of eBay Collectibles and Trading Cards.
I’ll be rooting for my friends and collogues at eBay and I’ll always be a proud eBay buyer/seller!”', 'The strategic partnership combines the powerful platform and global reach of eBay with the capabilities and experience of bidadoo.
Through this partnership, eBay and bidadoo will deliver industry-leading solutions for buyers and sellers by bringing together the core strengths of each company.
eBay's Chris Prill elaborates on eBay's and bidadoo's shared objective to become the leading heavy equipment solution in the market.
"We are excited to deepen our partnership with eBay to expand our remarketing andauction solutions," said Howard Hawk, president of bidadoo.
"For over 18 years on eBay, bidadoo has been committed to delivering the best buying and selling experience in the industry.', 'eBay Australia has a new Vice President and Managing Director – David Ramadge, as Former Chief and one-time CMO, Tim Mackinnon, becomes the CEO of Providoor.
Ramadge has been working for eBay for several years, rejoining the company in 2017 as Senior Director of Product and Shipping.
“Dave has been on the Australian leadership team for four years and has unparalleled knowledge and passion for eBay having led Product, eBay Plus, Shipping, Payments, Trust, Consumer Selling and Luxury Verticals,” he said.
After a ten-year stint at eBay, he will be starting a new role as CEO of Providoor.
I feel as daunted as I did over four years when I was asked to lead eBay and make sure it remained the market leader.', "8-Nov-2021The make-up brand founded by influencer Tati Beauty and Seed Beauty announced its closure last weekOpportunistic resellers are taking advantage of the recent closure of Tati Beauty by listing now defunct products at more than 700% over the original price.
Leading online retailer eBay has seen a rise in the number of Tati Beauty listings, as the influencer brand's debut eyeshadow palette is now on sale up to US$400 versus the RRP $48.
The majority of the new prices for Tati Westbrook's Textured Neutrals Volume 1 Palette are five times the retail price, selling in the region of $250.
This is a small extract of the full article which is available ONLY to premium content subscribers.
OrSubscribe now to premium content on Cosmetics BusinessCompanies", "The Charles Dickens themed coin has an error but, as any coin-hunter knows, that often only makes the currency more valuable.
2 Have you got a Charles Dickens coin in your change?
2 One coin hunter has paid £350 for this Charles Dickens coin Credit: EBayIndeed, last month a rare £1 coin with an error sold for a whopping £206 through the online auction site.
The Charles Dickens coin doesn't feature in the Royal Mint's list of top 10 rarest and most valuable coins.
If you're buying a rare coin then comparing can help you avoid overpaying for a rare error coin.", "CHEEKY snack fans are hoping to bag a profit as they list crisps for up to £7 a bag amid a shortage.
The Sun spotted Walkers products listed as out of stock on Morrisons, Tesco and Ocado's websites.
The Sun spotted a single 32.5g pack of Walkers Salt & Vinegar crisps listed for a whopping £6.89.
Crisps are the latest in a long line of products shoppers are struggling to get their hands on at the moment.
3 This pack of Squares would only usually cost £1 Credit: EBayShoppers face empty supermarket shelves where Walkers crisps usually sit and spot out-of-stock notices onlineWe pay for your stories!", '']

title: ['Seller Visibly Upset over eBay Handling of Scam - EcommerceBytes', "eBay Launches 'Refurbished' Offering - PR Newswire", 'MCU Head Of Visual Development Reveals How eBay Helped ... - Looper', 'Crisp hoarders sell packets of Walkers for £8 on eBay amid nationwide shortage - The Mirror']
summary:
['An online seller was visibly upset over eBay's handling of a scam she said she experienced at the hands of a buyer.
Doyle called eBay back, which said there was nothing it could do, at which point, Doyle asked the eBay rep, "What could I have done differently?
On October 19th, she posted, "How To Have Your Ebay Scammer Charged with Fraud and Theft - Why Selling On Ebay is Such A Gamble."
The first video received nearly 55,000 views, 2,100 likes (and 50 thumbs-down), and over 1,100 comments.
Doyle's videos show how a passion for buying and selling on eBay can turn quickly into distress and distrust.', "SAN JOSE, Calif., Nov. 9, 2021 /PRNewswire/ -- eBay, one of the world's largest online marketplaces, today announces eBay Refurbished , a new destination for like-new products.
Building on last year's Certified Refurbished program, eBay Refurbished now includes multiple condition grades and a wider range of price points on like-new products.
Building on this offering, eBay Refurbished now includes multiple condition grades and a wider range of price points on like-new products.
In addition to broader selection and better value, 66% of Americans believe gifting refurbished items is also a way to shop sustainably.
More condition choiceAll items featured in eBay Refurbished come directly from premium brands or top-rated sellers who are thoroughly vetted to meet rigorous performance standards.", 'Learn MoreMCU Head Of Visual Development Reveals How eBay Helped Shape Captain America: The First Avenger - ExclusiveOut of every MCU project to date, there's no argument that "Captain America: The First Avenger" has the most historically significant details than any other movie.
Sure, if you're looking for a fire '80s soundtrack, "Captain Marvel" is your girl, but Captain America's time in the '40s took a bit more research for everyone involved — including the MCU's head of visual development, Ryan Meinerding.
You might be wondering just how much went into designing the film — whether it's a massive '40s aircraft or minor detailing on a helmet.
When it comes to a movie maintaining historical accuracy, even the smallest stitches can make all of the difference, and that's where Meinerding made a difference.
The massive two-part book includes a slew of concept art and quotes, including Meinerding explaining how he helped design "Iron Man" and his continued work on the franchise today.', 'Crisp hoarders are selling packs of Walkers for around £8 as the shortages continue and demand is high, reported the Daily Star.
One eBay trader from Leicester, where Walkers crisps are originally from, is listing a 32.5g pack of Walkers Salt & Vinegar crisps for £6.89 that would usually cost about 60p.
Image: Leicester Mercury / Chris Gordon) Leicester Mercury / Chris Gordon)Another opportunist is trying to sell a 68g bag of Walkers Salt & Vinegar Squares for £7.89.
A Walkers spokesman said: “We’re doing everything we can to increase production and get people’s favourites back on shelves.
Image: Alamy Stock Photo) Alamy Stock Photo)The Walkers crisp shortage has now been going on for several weeks and a spokesman for the Poundstretcher group recently said they had seen deliveries of Walkers products plummet.']

title: ['eBay Glitches Are Slamming Sellers and Buyers - EcommerceBytes', 'eBay UK adds NFC-enabled authenticity guarantee for pre-owned ... - NFC World', 'Elden Ring network test keys are being sold on eBay - Eurogamer.net', 'eBay Inc. stock outperforms competitors despite losses on the day - MarketWatch']
summary:
['eBay sellers are experiencing problems printing shipping labels, listing items, and other functionality.
eBay's System Status board also shows problems in the following areas: Buying, Selling, Shipping, and Sign-in.
It's rare for eBay glitches to make it to the System Status board - with 4 out of 9 areas experiencing problems, it may be fair to call it a meltdown.
Sellers had reported problems with shipping labels a few days ago - the labels were printing in landscape mode instead of portrait.
eBay posted a message on the Technical Issues board : "We're aware that some members are experiencing issues trying to access various pages on eBay, including shipping, selling and checkout pages.', 'GUARANTEE: eBay issues a certification card with an embedded NFC chip to authenticate each watchUK consumers who purchase pre-owned luxury watches from online auction site eBay can now authenticate their purchase via an NFC chip embedded in a certification card issued with the watch.
The NFC-enabled card allows a purchaser to link to information about the watch and a guarantee of authenticity showing that it has been inspected and checked by a third-party verification service prior to delivery.
“Authenticity Guarantee is designed to help buyers shop with confidence,” eBay says.
“After an eBay authentication partner receives the watch and any collateral materials, including but not limited to box and papers, the partner will confirm the item is consistent with the listing title, description, and images,” it adds.
“Professional authenticators verify dozens of inspection points, including the movement, crown, bezel, dial, case, clasp/buckle, hands, end links and serial number.', "Elden Ring keys are on sale on eBay ahead of the network test this weekend.
Bandai Namco is running the test ahead of the game's release next year, with keys sent out to select players who signed up.
No PC codes appear to be available.
Elden Ring is one of the most anticipated games of 2022 so it's no surprise to see scalpers jump on an opportunity, even if selling access to a limited time network test really is a new low.
Elden Ring will be released on 25th February 2022 across PlayStation and Xbox consoles, plus PC.", 'Shares of eBay Inc. EBAY slipped 0.99% to $73.23 Wednesday, on what proved to be an all-around rough trading session for the stock market, with the S&P 500 Index SPX falling 0.82% to 4,646.71 and Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA falling 0.66% to 36,079.94. eBay Inc. closed $7.96 below its 52-week high ($81.19), which the company achieved on October 22nd.
The stock demonstrated a mixed performance when compared to some of its competitors Wednesday, as Amazon.com Inc. AMZN fell 2.63% to $3,482.05, Walmart Inc. WMT fell 0.90%...']

title: ['Alt Secures $75 Million After Poaching Top eBay Exec Nicole ... - eSeller365', 'Ebay removes Harps Poppy badges - Donegal News']
summary:
['Earlier this week we covered the news of how former General Manager for Collectibles and Trading Nicole Colombo had left eBay and joined Alt.
Nicole joined the new collectibles startup as their President, which was formally announced on their LinkedIn on November the 8th.
Don’t MissWell, today it appears that she may have been privy to some insider information which may have swayed her decision to jump ship, as Alt has just announced a $75 Million Series B round in the industry’s first-ever community-led funding round.
The funding round features some well-known names including serial investor Naval Ravikant as well as professional athletes Tom Brady and Giannis Antetokounmpo.
The Alt Series B Funding Announcement“Today, we’re excited to share that we’ve raised a $75 million Series B in the industry’s first-ever community-led round.', 'POPPY badges bearing the Finn Harps crest have been removed from eBay following a complaint from the club.
The badges, which show the Finn Harps logo alongside a poppy and accompanied by the words ‘Lest We Forget’, were listed for £11.99.
“Brand new never seen anywhere before it has the Finn Harps club crest in the centre alongside a 2021 poppy.

title: ["World's first USB-C iPhone sells on eBay for $86001 - The Verge", 'This limited-edition golf ball is selling on eBay for $300 a dozen - GolfDigest.com', 'Box of Walkers crisps sells for £123 on eBay after no end date given for shortage - The Mirror', 'Paramedic who stole defibrillators from ambulance service and sold them on eBay jailed - The Mirror']
summary:
['A modified iPhone X that has a USB-C port instead of a Lightning port has sold on eBay for the princely sum of $86,001.
The phone, which is the work of robotics engineering student Kenn Pillonel, can use the physical connector for both charging and transferring data.
The fact that the mod has sold for over eighty times its original sale price shouldn’t come as much of a surprise.
Although the prototype has now been sold, Pillonel has previously said he intends to continue working to improve elements like the USB-C iPhones’ fast-charging, waterproofing, and adding support for USB-C accessories.
With the design open-sourced, and the prototype released into the world, it’s a project that’ll hopefully become a team effort.', '', 'The on-going shortage of Walkers crisps has prompted sellers to list single packs for almost £7 each on eBay, while boxes of the favourite crisps have actually sold for £123Box of Walkers crisps sells for £123 on eBay after no end date given for shortageWalkers crisps are being flogged for hundreds of pounds on eBay amid an ongoing shortage of the snack.
Opportunistic sellers are listing single packs for almost £7 each, while boxes of the favourite crisps have actually sold for £123.
Meanwhile, The Mirror spotted boxes of 32 bags of 37.5g Walkers Oven Baked cheese and onion crisps that had sold for £123.49.
"We’ve not had walkers crisps in our Tesco for weeks.
"I can tolerate no bog roll, petrol and all the other nonsense but a shortage of Walkers crisps is too much for me," said another.', 'Scott Sutherland, 48, took lifesaving equipment while working for North West Ambulance Service in 2017 and 2018, a court heard.
He then returned to the area to take more in 2020Paramedic who stole defibrillators from ambulance service and sold them on eBay jailedA former paramedic who stole thousands of pounds worth of defibrillators from an ambulance service and sold them on eBay has been jailed for three years.
Scott Sutherland, 48, took lifesaving equipment while working for North West Ambulance Service in 2017 and 2018, a court heard.
He then returned to the area to take more in 2020, after he had transferred to South Western Ambulance Service, Liverpool Crown Court heard.
Sutherland, of Pearse Gardens in Modbury, pleaded guilty to two counts of theft and two of burglary at an earlier hearing.']

title: ['eBay Completes Transfer of its Businesses in Korea to Emart - PR Newswire', 'Do Spoofer Accounts Put Amazon and eBay Sellers at Risk? - EcommerceBytes']
summary:

"By joining Emart, the eBay Korea business has an enormous opportunity ahead.
Forward-Looking StatementsCertain statements herein are "forward-looking statements" within the meaning of Section 27A of the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, and Section 21E of the Exchange Act.
The forward-looking statements in this document address a variety of subjects including, for example, the potential benefits of the transaction.
The forward-looking statements in this document speak only as of this date.', 'The government stated: "Spoofer accounts are granted to Amazon employees with specific job responsibilities that require them to view and edit third-party seller accounts.
Using their assigned Spoofer accounts, Amazon employees can manually authorize refunds for items ordered from third-party sellers.
The Spoofer account activity of Amazon employees is logged and monitored by Amazon for abusive conduct."
The concept that some marketplace employees have the ability to make changes to seller accounts may be both reassuring and concerning.
We wrote about another high profile case involving former Amazon employees in September 2020 in which the government alleged that six defendants paid bribes to at least ten different Amazon employees and contractors.']
