title: ['Vintage Soviet-era TA-68 telephones on eBay - Retro To Go', "A bargain buy? Go North East flogging buses on eBay (and they're ... - The Northern Echo", 'Walkers crisps listed on Ebay for £6 a bag following shortages and empty supermarket shelves - Chronicle Live']
summary:
['I keep seeing these vintage Soviet-era TA-68 telephones on eBay and if I’m honest, I am quite fascinated with them.
But sales of retro and vintage phones are still strong.
After all, if you are going for a retro setting or creating a retro room, then the small details matter.
Plenty of different retro shades (well, retro today) were available and you could get the phone with a dial, but more often, without one.
As I said, plenty available on eBay right now, with most coming from former Easter Bloc countries seemingly unused and still in their original boxes.', 'Go North East is claiming to offer a "rare" opportunity to purchase one or more of 27 older vehicles on the online marketplace.
With prices around the average cost of a brand new hatchback, the company is hoping to find a buyer for its older Mercedes and Scania-built vehicles.
Read more: Behind the scenes at Go North East's depot in Consett in County DurhamListed for the price of a brand new family hatchback, Go North East has priced them between £11,000 and £15,000 plus VAT each.
It has promised the prospective buyer will see the vehicles "pay for themselves" in just a few months under the right owner.
Meanwhile, earlier this month Martijn Gilbert, managing director at Go North East, revealed the firm only tended to keep buses for around 15 years.', 'Sign up for free to get the latest North East news and updates delivered straight to your inboxCrisp lovers faced with empty supermarket shelves are paying up to £6 for a bag of Walkers crisps to get their fix.
Opportunistic sellers are listing single packs for almost £6 each, while boxes of the favourite crisps have sold for £123.
The Mirror has reported that 32 bags of 37.5g Walkers Oven Baked cheese and onion crisps had sold for £123.49.
Crisps including classic ready salted Walkers to Quavers have been in short supply, with customers struggling to get hold of packs in supermarkets.
Supermarket shelves have been pictured with few Walkers crisps around the country and they are out of stock on Tesco, Morrisons and Ocado websites.']

title: ['eBay to Open "Hard to Find" Holiday Gift Shops - PR Newswire', 'When Your eBay Order Arrives in an Amazon Van - EcommerceBytes', 'How to Sell Items With Crypto? Ethair Market Offers Users Ebay/Etsy ... - Bitcoin News', 'Sold-Out Reese’s Peanut Butter Cup Thanksgiving Pies Show Up on eBay With Big Price Tag, Remember It’s the Season of Giving to Yourself - Mandatory']
summary:
['The Hard to Find Gift Shops will be just that - hard to find.
With the perfect holiday gifts more out of reach than ever, eBay is hooking up shoppers with the season’s most sought after items through its speakeasy-style Hard to Find Gift Shops.
The shops will bring the hottest authentic sneakers, handbags, watches, trading cards and collectibles to enthusiasts.
Trading Cards & Collectibles:eBay's Trading Cards category is growing significantly faster than the total marketplace.
1 "Early Bird Holiday Shoppers Are Already Reporting Supply Chain Challenges," Morning Consult, October 2021.', 'eBay sellers are still using Amazon as a drop shipper, according to a buyer who was describing what they called one of their worst buying experiences.
In a thread on the eBay discussion boards yesterday, the buyer said they thought it was strange when an Amazon driver delivered their eBay order in Amazon packaging.
"That would indicate that the seller violated both eBay and Amazon policy and had the CD shipped through his Prime account."
But they also noted there were a growing number of sellers who sell on both eBay and Amazon and use Amazon for fulfillment.
The eBay buyer confirmed there was an Amazon gift receipt inside the package, indicating the seller may have used their Amazon Prime account in order to get free shipping.', 'Ethair Market Offers Users Ebay/Etsy AlternativesponsoredThe beta version of Ethair Market that launched on Monday, November 8th allows sellers to list their items early and get buyers acquainted with the site before their full release.
In an effort to entice sellers, Ethair is currently running a giveaway for the first 1,000 sellers to sign up and list an item on the platform.
Ethair Market is focused on improving user’s e-commerce experiences.
For every ‘Final Value Fee’ Ethair gives both sellers and buyers points.
Furthermore, users which hold the token on Ethair Market will have the governance power to vote on certain important matters regarding the utilities and distribution of the token.', 'We don’t know why the geniuses at Reese’s didn’t think of this sooner, but you may have heard recently about the debut of the Peanut Butter Cup Thanksgiving Pie.
It’s a 9-inch, 3.25 pound solid peanut butter cup.
Basically, think a deep-dish pizza, but made of that trademark crumbly peanut butter and smooth chocolate combination.
You can thank us later.”Three thousand of these beauties went on sale for $44.99 – and sold out within hours.
“Let’s face it, homemade pies are great, but a giant Reese’s Peanut Butter Cup is better … The holidays are stressful, but winning Thanksgiving doesn’t have to be,” Jones said.']

title: ["Ebay's top predictions for Black Friday 2021 - Yahoo Finance UK", 'InPost partnership grants eBay sellers access to UK locker network - Parcel and Postal Technology International', 'Ebay has Playstation 5s available - SFGATE', 'Purple Heart earned by Morristown WWII veteran recovered on eBay - Daily Record']
summary:
['Three quarters of Brits are planning to do their Christmas shopping on Black Friday in 2021, according to eBay.
On Black Friday last year, 40 items were sold each second on eBay UK (EBAY), with 90% of those purchases made from a small business selling through the online platform.
eBay is home to more than 300,000 UK small business sellers as almost a third (30%) of Brits are also planning on selling unwanted items ahead of this Black Friday.
Here, the experts at eBay share their top predictions for Black Friday 2021:Shop smallTwo-thirds (66%) of Brits are planning to buy Christmas gifts from small businesses on Black Friday, which falls on 26 November this year.
Santa’s come earlyBrits are eager to get ahead this year, with 3 in 4 people (77%) planning to do their Christmas shopping on Black Friday in 2021.', "Online marketplace eBay has signed a new partnership agreement with InPost to provide its sellers with access to a network of more than 2,500 parcel lockers throughout the UK.')
} // --> ') } else { console.log ('nompuad'); document.write('') } // -->For the first time, eBay sellers will be able to drop off parcels at lockers for onward delivery to buyers’ homes.
Research published by eBay in March 2021 highlighted that two thirds (67%) of UK sellers started to sell pre-owned goods during the pandemic to earn extra cash.
In accordance with the agreement, InPost will brand 250 lockers across the UK with the eBay logo.
Jason Tavaria, CEO at InPost UK, said, “We’re thrilled to have partnered with eBay to ensure that marketplace sellers have access to a convenient, flexible and time-saving delivery option that genuinely works in tandem with their normal routines.", "sonyI don't want to cause a panic here, but it's time to swarm.
Ebay’s got a killer deal on a Sony Playstation 5 Disc Version Console + three DualSense controllers for $999 that you're gonna have to hustle to buy before it’s sold out.
Easily the best PlayStation disc console since Sony released the PS1 (don’t @ me) this dynamic gaming system offers truly insane graphics and cinematic audio with lightning-fast load times to dramatically improve gameplay.", 'Purchased through an eBay transaction, a Purple Heart medal earned by World War II veteran Edmund Vance is back where it belongs: in Morristown.
The Purple Heart is a medal awarded in the name of the president to military personnel wounded or killed while serving.
After the war, Vance returned to Morristown, where he lived until his death on Feb. 18, 1985.
Corporal Vance’s story is being added to that list today, thanks to the Purple Hearts Reunited.”Anyone may enroll a Purple Heart recipient in the national database, but documentation is required.
"We've been around for about a decade, so we have a pretty heavy footprint with the 'Purple Heart' search term."']

title: ['Why eBay Is The Place To Buy and Sell Sneakers in 2021 - Complex', 'eBay partners with InPost in the UK - Ecommerce News']
summary:
['On top of tapping Mississauga-born NBA star and eBay sneaker shopper RJ Barrett to promote the Authenticity Guarantee program, this year eBay appointed a Head of Sneakers in Canada, Shireen Edross.
But overall, I am solely responsible for really making eBay the top destination for sneakers in Canada, for buyers and sellers.
Make the case for me: Why is eBay the place to buy and sell sneakers right now?
I know eBay recently opened up the authentication program to include southbound selling for Canadians so they can sell sneakers to Americans.
Now we’re really giving Canadian businesses and Canadian sneaker sellers access to one of the world’s largest sneaker-buying markets.', 'Sellers on eBay now get access to InPost’s parcel lockers throughout the UK.
Earlier this year, popular marketplace eBay rolled out an end-to-end fulfillment service for eBay business sellers in the UK.
67% of UK sellers on eBay started selling during the pandemic to earn extra cash.
The agreement gives these sellers access to InPost’s network of more than 2.500 parcel lockers throughout the UK.
InPost aims for 3.000 lockers by the end of 2021InPost will brand 250 lockers across the UK with the eBay logo.']

title: ['eBay Buyer Leaves Neg after Seller Denies Partial Refund - EcommerceBytes', 'Rare Kew Gardens 50p coin sells for £250 on eBay – how to spot one in your change... - The Sun']
summary:

The customer contacted us on Friday evening claiming that a second set of canopies, the plexiglass cover that goes over the cockpit, wasn't included with the item.
We indicated that we would check with our supplier on Monday morning to see if the item was supposed to contain a second set.
He was looking for a discount by claiming the item was supposed to contain something that he knew wasn't included with the model.
Mind you when I spoke to the first CSR he indicated the feedback would be removed within 24-48 hours.", "A RARE 50p, that keen collectors commonly know as the Kew Gardens 50p, has sold for 500 times its face value.
The rare coin sold for £250 on online auctioning site, eBay, six days ago.
The Kew Gardens coin tops the Royal Mint's rarest collection too as it was third place amongst all coins in the last update.
The coin features an image of the Chinese pagoda from the popular London attraction, Kew Gardens.
There is a whole collection of rare Olympic 50p coins for example that we've found sell over face value on eBay."]

And we’ll be keeping you updated as soon as we hear of the latest deals too - so stay tuned and read on.
For those who want the best, early Black Friday deals right now?', 'Some eBay sellers are reporting that items that sold in the past are selling again after being mysteriously relisted.
Unless or until one of their sold item sells again, sellers may not realize some of their sold items have been relisted.
Today when I went to relist unsold items I discovered 4 out of 16 items there were sold.
So my usual click on relist all unsold items was relisting sold items also, thus implying to eBay buyers that I had more..."They say it is high priority known glitch but that should be advertised since many of you may also automatically relist unsold items and now you are unknowingly relisting sold items also!"
In "eBay glitch," a seller wrote, "I've had a problem with an eBay glitch for the past month.', 'A Grimsby businessman is facing ruin and having to make staff redundant because of what he claims is an eBay hacking scam.
More crime news hereBut the Nunsthorpe businessman was shocked to discover listed on his eBay account were Rolex watches, speedboats, bicycles and rare Pokemon cards.
Surely when checks are done they must have realised I don't sell Rolex watches.
They paid money and nothing arrived.
"When all this is happening eBay recognised the account had been compromised but still took money from my account.', 'FINANCE eBay Completes Majority Sale of eBay KoreaeBay announced it has completed the transfer of an 80.01 percent stake in its Korean businesses for approximately $3 billion to E-mart, a South Korean retail chain.
With the deal, Shinsegae Group, the parent company of E-Mart, gets a boost in the Korean e-commerce sector while eBay Korea gains a powerful backer after years of underperforming.
eBay will retain a 19.99 percent interest in the Korean businesses.
eBay first entered the Korean market in 2001 when it became a majority shareholder in Internet Auction Co. and invested in G-Market in 2009.
In 2020, eBay repurchased roughly $5.1 billion of its common stock and said it remains committed to buying back up to $7 billion of shares.', 'Global e-commerce giant EBay has completed the sale of a stake in Adevinta, the Oslo-based marketplace operator, for approximately €2.1 billion ($2.3 billion U.S.).
The deal was initially announced in mid-July, when EBay revealed it would sell a 10.2% stake in Adevinta to Permira for approximately $2.3 billion.
In a statement issued at the time of the announcement, EBay said the transaction would reduce its ownership stake in Adevinta from 44% to 34%.
If Permira exercises the option, EBay’s ownership in Adevinta will reduce to 33%,” added the company during the summer.
The price represented a 7% discount to 10-day volume weighted average price, EBay said.', 'For exceptional deals across a range of brands, make eBay your Black Friday destination.
The site has kicked off its Black Friday offers, with as much as 50 per cent off selected items.
Thanks to eBay’s jaw-dropping Black Friday discounts, you can spoil them all without starting the New Year in the red.
Give their toolbox an upgrade this Christmas with this multi-tool from Makita, now 34 per cent off on eBay.
Buy now (£19.99, eBay)Head to eBay for great savings this Black Friday', 'But the Grimsby businessman was shocked to discover listed on his eBay account were Rolex watches, speedboats, bicycles and rare Pokemon cards.
"We later found eBay had debited our bank account by around £14,000 for charges but they were unable to state what charges."
Image: Getty Images for eBay) Getty Images for eBay)"Ebay know it is not my fault, but froze my account.

title: ['DDR5 RAM Prices Top $2000 on eBay Amid Shortage - PCMag', 'eBay CEO Uses LinkedIn to Talk to Sellers - EcommerceBytes']

Could I be quids-in with a rare error coin?
Often times error coins will sell for a lot more than their face value.
Error coins are still legal tender - so long as the original coin is still in circulation too.', 'With cash flowing in mostly one direction (straight out of your pocket), the holidays can be a tough time to stay on a strict budget.
But with a little help, and some perfect timing, you can still gift friends and family some elaborate gadgets and technology with cutting-edge functionality—just not for this decade.

["Around 25 million of the Benjamin Bunny coins were struck for circulation in 2017 - so it isn't impossible that a mistake could have happened.
Here's what to look out forRare 50p coin sells for £255 on eBay because of huge error - check your piggybankA rare Benjamin Bunny 50p coin has sold for £255 on eBay because of a huge error in its design.
It is worth noting this particular Benjamin Bunny 50p only ended up attracting two bids on it after a five-day auction.
Around 25 million of the Benjamin Bunny coins were struck for circulation in 2017 - so it isn't impossible that a mistake could have happened.
A regular version of the Benjamin Bunny 50p coin would only fetch between £1 and £1.54 on eBay, according to Coin Hunter.", 'eBay currently has Xbox Series X consoles in stock for eBay Plus members (free trial here).
There’s 300 bundles up for sale for $1,250 at this link using code PLUSXBOX and each includes:At first glance, it does seem a bit expensive, but given it includes a console, Elite controller and a few new release games, as well as the fact that you probably won’t find an Xbox Series X anywhere else this year, it’s not a bad deal.
With 300 in stock, no doubt these will go quick, but hopefully you manage to snag one.', "Ring Fit Adventure, considered a spiritual successor to the Wii Fit, became an overnight hit last year thanks to lockdowns across the world which left many people exercising indoor and looking for substitutes for the gym.
Similar to Wii Sports and Wii Fit, the game uses motion sensors inside the Nintendo Switch's Joy-Con controller to measure your movement when undergoing physical activity.
That means you can grab Ring Fit Adventure on Nintendo Switch for only £49.49 in a number of eBay outlets, including Currys and AO.
Ring Fit Adventure comes with all-new Ring-Con and Leg Strap accessories, which detect and measure your real-world movements and turn them into in-game actions.
Fancy your hand at Ring Fit Adventure but don't own a Nintendo Switch?"]

title: ['The Jaguar XJ220 supercar for sale on eBay for £399,950 - Coventry Live', 'Sellers Wonder if Weekend eBay Payouts Are Permanent - EcommerceBytes']
summary:
['Our free email updates are the best way to get headlines direct to your inboxA rare example of a Jaguar supercar - which was once the fastest road car on the planet - is up for sale and the price has been cut.
The Jaguar XJ220 is being sold on eBay with an asking price of £399,950.
The eBay sales particulars say: “Finished in black with grey full leather, this stunning example is currently in a private collection and is viewing by appointment only.
They say: “It was at the 1988 British Motor Show in Birmingham, appropriately, that the sensational Jaguar XJ220 concept prototype was first revealed to the public and, as expected, orders and the required £50,000 deposits flooded in from all corners of the world.
The eBay sales particulars conclude: “Production of the car began the following year in a purpose-built factory at Bloxham in Oxfordshire with the first cars delivered in July.', 'Sellers are wondering if weekend eBay payouts are permanent after receiving Managed Payment disbursement notifications for the first time over the Thanksgiving Day weekend.
A seller who told EcommerceBytes they received notice of eBay payouts on Saturday and Sunday wondered, "Is eBay doing payouts 7 days a week now?
The eBay payouts are a relatively new phenomenon for many sellers who had previously received funds directly from buyers into their PayPal accounts - instantly.
Note that daily payouts do not mean sellers receive funds from *that* day's sales.
Others were waiting to see if it was a one-time event or if eBay was working to speed up payouts to sellers.']

title: ['eBay Acquires Sneaker Con Authentication Business - PR Newswire', 'EBay Acquires Sneaker Con Authentication Business – WWD - WWD', "People Are Already Flipping Justin Bieber's Timbiebs Merch on eBay - Exclaim!", "Ebay's Cyber Monday deals include £100 off a Nintendo Switch and a cut-price Dyson hairdryer - HELLO!", 'Rare Kew Gardens 50p sells for £165 on eBay – check your own change now... - The Sun']
summary:
['"We partnered with Sneaker Con to launch sneaker authentication on eBay last year because the team shared our passion for the category – with best-in-class capabilities to deliver what our customers want most.
"We respect eBay's commitment to the sneaker culture and are honored that Sneaker Con's authentication business will be incorporated into their platform," said Brad Fried, the company's Co-Founder.
Sneaker Con launched its authentication business in 2018 to complement the events business and provide industry-leading authentication services to further support the sneaker community.
"While Sneaker Con's events business is not part of this transaction, these events will continue to represent the global sneaker community," said Alan Vinogradov, CEO and co-Founder of Sneaker Con.
Details on the TransactioneBay is acquiring Sneaker Con Digital, Sneaker Con's authentication business, and the companies have signed and closed the deal as of November 24, 2021.', 'The global resale marketplace on Monday said it had acquired Sneaker Con’s authentication business.
Sneaker Con was established in 2009, hosting events for a community of sneaker enthusiasts to buy, sell and trade sneakers.
EBay launched its watch authentication service in the same year.
“While Sneaker Con’s events business is not part of this transaction, these events will continue to represent the global sneaker community,” said Alan Vinogradov, chief executive officer and cofounder of Sneaker Con.
“EBay is the industry pioneer and the marketplace was my first exposure to the sneaker community.', '', 'Cyber Monday is here and there are some amazing deals there for the taking – especially at eBay!
Visit their Cyber Monday hub for the latest offers and deals.
And the ultimate hero deal is here - the Nintento Switch at £100 off - hurry while stocks last!
We’ve done the hard work and rounded up the best deals, keep scrolling for our top picks, and if you see something you like, don’t hang about – most of the deals have a limited quantity of stock available.
Best eBay Black Friday dealsNintendo Switch, RRP £299 now £199, eBayThis sold out quickly last year - hurry to grab a bargain.', "A RARE 50p, with an image of a famous London landmark printed on the design, has sold for well over £100 on eBay.
The rare coin is more commonly known to collectors as the Kew Gardens 50p, and one version has sold for as much as £165, or 330 times its face value.
2 The 50p is still in pretty good condition considering it's been in circulation2 Over 20 bids were placed on the coin, so we can see collectors were keenThe Kew Gardens 50p is one of the rarest to collect.
Not only does the Kew Gardens design go for big money, but a number of other commemorative style coins often sell in their hundreds too.
There is a whole collection of rare Olympic 50p coins for example that we've found sell over face value on eBay."]

title: ["EBay acquires Sneaker Con's shoe authentication business - Retail Dive", 'Success of Surrey lockdown hot tub business which started from eBay - Surrey Comet', "Bargain Hunt fleece is being sold on eBay for £499 and people can't believe irony - Daily Star", 'eBay Auction Fee Takes Seller by Surprise - EcommerceBytes', 'An unreleased Mortal Kombat game has popped up on eBay - Digital Trends', 'Spider-Man: No Way Home tickets are being scalped on eBay for ridiculous prices - CNET']
summary:
["Dive Brief:As e-commerce companies vet more products sold on their platforms, eBay has bought Sneaker Con Digital's sneaker authentication arm for an undisclosed sum, according to a Monday press release .
EBay said it has nearly 2 million sneakers for sale on its site daily, and the Sneaker Con authentication acquisition will increase users' trust in purchasing and selling shoes on their platform.
Sneaker Con will retain ownership of its events business, Alan Vinogradov, CEO and co-founder of Sneaker Con, confirmed in a statement.
As eBay invests resources into sneaker authentication, Poshmark has also waded into the space with its recent acquisition of Suede One, an online sneaker authentication company.
The company folded Suede One's authentication tools into its Posh Protect and Posh Authenticate programs as part of the deal.", 'Leo Sargent and Luca Quirici, both 23, started the Surrey Bubbles hot tub business during lockdown.
They discussed how people were stuck indoors and requesting for hot tubs throughout lockdown.
The pair decided to ditch their full time jobs and hire a hot tub from eBay to then rent out to customers.
Leo Sargent, co-owner of Surrey Bubbles, told the Surrey Comet how his business grew from there.
The duo have been featured on Channel 5’s show Hot Tub Brits: More Bubbles please!', 'Sign up for the Hot Topics newsletter for hot style and sex tipsA Bargain Hunt fleece is being sold on eBay - but ironically not for a bargain price.
Currently, a “used” Bargain Hunt fleece is being flogged on eBay for a whopping £499.00.
They sarcastically captioned the post: “Ironically that’s not a bargain.”(Image: @NoContextBrits/Twitter)The red fleece can be seen hanging upon a door frame along with the recognisable Bargain Hunt logo.
Nothing screams warmth like a red Bargain Hunt jacket after all!
Stunned at the hefty price tag, many people fled to the comments to have their say on the non-bargain, Bargain Hunt jacket.', 'A seller was surprised when eBay charged them a commission fee after they cancelled an auction listing.
How can a commission fee apply if the item didn't sell?
eBay began charging sellers commission fees (FVFs) on cancelled auctions in 2017 over fears that sellers would attract bidders and then take the transaction off-site to avoid paying eBay fees.
Another seller said an eBay "bot" likely detected behavior that looked like the seller was taking the sale off eBay - the seller got a message, cancelled the bid, and ended the listing.
Another seller said they were hit with a commission fee after cancelling an auction listing because they discovered they had accidentally thrown out the item listed for sale.', 'The latest case of an ultra-rare unreleased vide ogame being sold on eBay has been sighted in the form of a prototype of the infamous Mortal Kombat spin-off Mortal Kombat: Special Forces.
Unreleased Mortal Kombat Special Forces GameplayMortal Kombat: Special Forces was supposed to be a continuation of the Mortal Kombat platformer groundwork laid by Mortal Kombat Mythologies: Sub Zero and is seen as a predecessor to Mortal Kombat: Shaolin Monks.
However, many Midway staff members left the project for various reasons, including Mortal Kombat co-creator John Tobias.
Related VideosThe version on eBay is the only known original prototype of the initial build that still includes playable Sonya and more levels.
Mortal Kombat: Special Forces‘ story is shared by countless other unreleased games that were thrown on eBay before being dumped online for the sake of preservation.', 'Marvel and MCU fans may remember that the release of tickets for Avengers: Endgame did a number on cinema ticket sites across the US in 2019.
Spider-Man: No Way Home did precisely the same thing late Sunday, with fans online saying AMC, Fandango and many other sites were down as a result of the demand.
As of early Monday, the websites of AMC, Atom, Fandango, Cinemark and Alamo Drafthouse all appeared to be up and running again.
But now, after tickets for opening night are all sold out, scalpers have appeared to take advantage of the tremendous demand for Spider-Man: No Way Home tickets.
Spider-Man: No Way Home hits theatres on Dec. 17, with some early showings on Dec. 16.']

title: ['Beatrix Potter 50p coin with rare mistake sells for £255 on eBay - so is there one in YOUR wallet? - Daily Mail', 'eBay Releases New Features for Promoted Listings Advanced BETA - eSeller365']
summary:
["A 50p Beatrix Potter coin with a rare minting error sold on eBay for £255.
Which rare 50p coin is worth the most money?
The Benjamin bunny coin was one of four 50p pieces - along with coins depicting Peter Rabbit, Tom Kitten and Jeremy Fisher - released in 2017 in celebration of children's author Beatrix Potter.
The listing description for the coin reads: 'In the picture you will see the rotation error where the Queen's head is.
'That's how far the rotation is on the coin, when you flip it round it should be facing up the same way as the Benjamin bunny.", 'eBay has launched new features for its Promoted Listings Advanced BETA cost-per-click (CPC) marketing product just in time for the busy holiday season.
Don’t MissPromoted Listings Advanced was introduced earlier this year to complement the marketplace’s original Promoted Listings Standard solution and align eBay with many other eCommerce platforms that offer CPC-style marketing products.
Sellers can now use the Reports tab to download and schedule reports for their Promoted Listings Advanced BETA campaigns.
More eBay Promoted Listings Advanced Features in DevelopmenteBay is planning to release more updates and enhancements to Promoted Listings Advanced BETA over the next couple of weeks and months.
To access Ads Academy, click on the link at the top right of the Promoted Listings Advanced BETA campaign management page.']

title: ['eBay Fee Hike Going into Effect for International Selling - EcommerceBytes', 'Keyboard from Nuclear Missile Command Center Sold on eBay - Nerdist', 'eBay Fears Tax Reporting May Curb Casual Selling - EcommerceBytes', '"Take Her Down”: Inside eBay\'s Stalking Campaign against a Natick ... - Boston magazine', 'Rare £2 coin sought by collectors sells for £115 on eBay – and you could have one too - The Mirror', 'Maine couple finds black widow spider in eBay package - NewsCenterMaine.com WCSH-WLBZ']
summary:
['An eBay fee hike is going into effect for UK members selling to other European countries.
UK sellers also currently pay fees to shipments going to other countries – 1.8% to US and Canada, and 2% to all other countries.
The higher eBay international fees will take effect on January 1, 2022, regardless of when the item was listed, relisted, or renewed.
So can UK sellers prevent receiving orders from buyers who specify a delivery address in those locations?
And it defined Northern European countries as follows: Denmark, Iceland, Norway, Sweden.', '', 'We are continuing to highlight the undue impact this increase will have on small sellers on eBay, and are urging an increase to the reporting threshold."
That means line items like refunds are not deducted - so the 1099K figure is unlikely to match the gross revenue sellers report to the IRS.
But as far as eBay is concerned, it seems worried that casual sellers may curb their activity on its marketplace.
For example, if you bought a bike for $1,000 a few years ago, and then sold it on eBay today for $700, that $700 you made generally would not be subject to income tax.
- Targets casual sellers who are not set up to handle this kind of tax reporting.', '“Take Her Down”: Inside eBay’s Stalking Campaign against a Natick CoupleAmazon.
Lots of companies appeared in David and Ina Steiner’s E-commerce newsletter.
As David steered around a bend, briefly out of the van’s sightline, the friend told David to slam on the brakes.
An investigator told Ina that he’d run the plates and that the vehicle was a rental.
“They can crush us,” Ina told David.', 'The coin was made to be a "practice-like" piece and has been dubbed by experts at Change Checker as "the coin that never was".
This particular version of the coin sold for £114.75 on November 8 following a three-day auction - although it only received three bids in total.
The coin was minted in 1994 and is the very first version of the modern bi-metallic style £2 coin.
And this rare version of a £2 coin launched to mark the centenary of the First World War could be worth up to £500.
Meanwhile, a coin expert said how this HG Wells £2 coin could be worth up to £1,000 due to a minting error.', "The York couple said they gave the spider a 'proper burial.'
When she opened the package from Philadelphia, Crystal noticed a couple of spiders in the box and asked him to take care of them for her.
Jonathan noticed one was still alive ... and was clearly a black widow.
They notified the seller and he was shocked to hear there was a spider, let alone a black widow, in the box he sent.
A black widow spider's bite is much feared because its venom is reported to be 15 times stronger than a rattlesnake's, according to National Geographic."]

title: ['Adyen issues 1.25% shares to online marketplace eBay exercising ... - Silicon Canals', "eBay opens 'hard to find' pop-up shop in Houston - Houston Chronicle", 'Clearing up a Burning Question about Recent eBay Category ... - EcommerceBytes', 'Ultra-rare £2 Mayflower coin sells on eBay for £115 - Wales Online', 'Ebay UK sales boom in run up to Christmas as used items listings surge - Yahoo Finance UK']
summary:
['In 2018, eBay signed an agreement with Amsterdam-based fintech unicorn Adyen to become its main payments processing partner.
As a part of the agreement, “eBay is entitled to acquire a fixed number of shares in a series of four tranches (each a “Tranche”) for cash, at a specified price per share upon the terms and conditions set forth in the warrant agreement.”', 'An online giant has a new brick-and-mortar store in Montrose, where Houstonians can find rare trading cards and comic books on sale for as much as $110,000.
The speak-easy style store, which eBay launched without signage Friday at Westheimer and Dunlavy, is open only two days — Friday and Saturday, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. — as a way for the company to market itself as a platform for people searching for rare and unique gifts for their loved ones during the holidays.', 'Recent eBay category changes had many sellers of collectible postcards scrambling when they rolled out on October 12.
Sellers said eBay rolled up the subcategories and left them to select one of two: Topographical Postcards and non-Topographical Postcards.
Instead of shoppers perusing subcategories, eBay expected sellers to add product attributes (called Item Specifics) to help shoppers narrow down results when searching for postcards on its marketplace.
Neither of these terms are United States postcard terms.
If you sell postcards and are interested in learning more, you can find the seller’s question and the eBay moderator’s responses here.', 'Something went wrong, please try again later.
Invalid email Something went wrong, please try again later.
The Mayflower £2 coin was created by the Royal Mint in 1994 and was the first £2 coin with a bimetal design - a golden ring around a silver centre.
The coin sold for £114.75 following a three-day auction.
It features an image of the Mayflower ship on one side, but the coin was never officially released into circulation and was never technically legal tender.', 'The large group of "feral" youths have been causing havoc across the sleepy Worcestershire town of Malvern Link for the past several months.
"We were driving back home after we found out but we were told by a neighbour that they had already left and had made their way to Malvern Link station.
"One said they were too scared to let their children play out after a boy was beaten up by them.
"I want to make the people of Malvern Link aware of this because things are getting worse here.
Residents say the group was the same that had previously been banned from Malvern Link Station by police at the weekend.']

title: ["How eBay's new CEO turned it into a pandemic winner - CNN", 'eBay Accidentally Cancels Bids and then Suspends Accounts en ... - EcommerceBytes']
summary:
['New York CNN Business —When PayPal split off from eBay a few years ago, eBay was considered to be the less exciting company.
Shares of eBay (EBAY) have surged more than 30% this year, while PayPal (PYPL) has stumbled more than 20%.
CNN Business spoke to eBay CEO Jamie Iannone, who rejoined eBay in April 2020, about the firm’s transformation into an enthusiast-focused retailer.
The pivot to collectibles that have passionate, younger buyers has been a big win for the company.
“Some of the [power buyers] wake up, get a cup of coffee and turn to eBay,” Iannone said.', 'eBay accidentally cancelled bids on some users’ accounts, and then suspended the accounts altogether.
eBay exited the third quarter with a 5% decline in the number of active buyers (and a 10% decline in sales, year-over-year).
The issue should be resolved in the next few hours and any sellers who need to take action will be contacted.
(We saw buyers mention cancellations were on bids on auctions that had already ended.)
eBay locked the thread, leaving buyers and sellers impacted by the technical glitches who might have questions high and dry.']

title: ['Rare error 50p coin sells for £140 on eBay – could one be lurking in your change?... - The Sun', 'Danny Amendola Talks eBay Pop Up Shop, Jersey Swaps, His ... - Sports Collectors Daily', "eBay accidentally suspended 'a small number' of users - The Verge", "70s superfan transformed his 'magnolia' home for just £2,500 with eBay bargains and Facebook freebies - Yorkshire Live"]
summary:
['A RARE 50p with a peculiar fault has sold on eBay for almost 300 times its face value.
The 50p sold for £140 last month after 15 bidders jostled to claim it for their own.
Could I make a mint from other rare error coins?
Most error coins are still legal tender so you could easily come across one in your change too and sell it on.
One rare £1 error coin sold on eBay in October for £156, because it was missing a part of the design.', '', 'eBay inadvertently suspended an unspecified number of users on December 3rd.
The platform has since acknowledged the incident, noting that users who were accidentally suspended have received a notification so they can resolve the issue.
Users across social media began reporting that they’ve been suspended from eBay on Friday, despite not knowingly breaking any rules on the platform.
“On December 3rd, a small number of eBay accounts were inadvertently suspended,” said eBay spokesperson Trina Somera in a statement to The Verge.
We regret any concern this may have caused.”Although eBay has acknowledged the issue, we still don’t know how many users were accidentally suspended, as well as why this occurred.', 'The latest Sheffield news and updates delivered to your inboxA man has transformed his home into a groovy 70s inspired home for just £2,500.
I have a large west German lamp in my living room which looks more than £20.
"The kitchen wallpaper was £10 and the yellow floral wallpaper in my bedroom was £20.
Everything from the bath rug to dinnerware in Ben's house is 70s inspired.
“I have a wooden cabinet in my living room and I have stuck 70s inspired vinyl wallpaper to the back of it," he said.']

title: ["People are selling Timbiebs boxes and merch on Ebay and it's ... - 101.5 The Hawk", 'eBay accidently deletes several user accounts - Notebookcheck.net', 'Behold, The "Rare Finds" Gift Guide - InsideHook']
summary:
['I know what you’re probably thinking, because I thought the same thing: “but are they selling?
I can’t believe it either (or should that be Belieber it…..that was terrible, I’m sorry.)', 'eBay accidentally deleted several user accounts on December 3.
eBay is now notifying banned users about recovering their accounts.
4 ReviewseBay accidentally deleted several user accounts on December 3, 2021.
However, eBay resolved the issue the following day and has since started reinstating suspended accounts.
On December 4, the company announced on Twitter that users who inadvertently got kicked out are getting notified about recovering their accounts.', 'As the story goes, it was polo that provided the inspiration for the first reversible watches of this style.
If you’re swinging a mallet from horseback there’s a good chance your delicate wristwatch wouldn’t survive a match — especially back in the 1930s — so watchmakers came up with a design that could be flipped over so the watch face was hidden.
The stately Otis from Hamilton is not the original, but that doesn’t make it any less desirable.
In fact, due to limited production of this line, these are hard to come by in good condition these days.']

title: ['eBay introduces an interactive 3D sneaker viewer - The Verge', 'Oddly-shaped Pringle listed for sale on eBay for a whopping £650... - The Sun', "eBay's secret AirPods Pro deal has come at the perfect time - TrustedReviews", 'Zach LaVine Rookie Card Picks, Most Watched eBay Auctions - Sports Collectors Daily', 'Rare £2 error coin sells for £255 on eBay – how you might miss one in your own change... - The Sun']
summary:
['eBay now lets you get a 360-degree look at some of the sneakers it has for sale, all thanks to its handy new 3D viewing tool, called eBay 3D true view.
While the feature is only available to a limited number of sellers currently, eBay plans to expand it in 2022.
Any sneaker sellers interested in using the 3D feature can sign up for the waitlist.
The feature is live on the site right now, and if you’re on mobile, you can start viewing sneakers in 3D from here.
It appears that not every listing has the 3D viewer right now, though, so you might have to tap a few different ones before you find a listing that uses 3D true view.', 'AN odd-shaped Pringle which folds back on itself at one end has been put up for sale on eBay — priced at £650.
The incorrectly-formed snack is described as “extremely rare” on the listing.
The optimistic seller reckons its originality due possibly to a manufacturing defect is worth the price tag.
But a 200g tube, which contains roughly 100 of the crisps, can be bought for around £2.50 at most shops.
Anyone desperate to land the Pringle who cannot afford it now can get financing from £31 a month over two years.', 'You can snatch up the Apple AirPods Pro for under £200 this Christmas thanks to an amazing deal from eBayWe’re officially in the run-up to Christmas and we can’t think of anyone who wouldn’t be thrilled with a new pair of AirPods Pros with active noise cancellation.
Typically, a pair of AirPods Pros would set you back £249, but they can be yours right right now for the reduced price of £189.
Even though the deal is available via eBay, the AirPods are in new and unused condition, with a year’s warranty to boot for additional peace of mind.
The AirPods Pro are a step above the regular AirPods, with noticeably deeper bass and more details in the vocals.
During our review, we rated the AirPods Pro a highly recommended 4.5-stars, with the verdict reading: “AirPods Pro are excellent earbuds and easy to recommend, especially if you’re deep in the iOS ecosystem.', '', "The rare error coin is part of a set though, so you're actually getting four coins in total, in their mint condition, for the £254.99.
The error coin in question though, has a noticeable fault in the design that makes the inner silver part not look complete.
What about other rare error coins?
Most error coins are still legal tender so you could easily come across one in your spare change.
One rare £1 error coin sold on eBay in October for £156, because it was missing a part of the design."]

title: ['eBay stock forecast: Will e-commerce keep roaring? - Capital.com', 'eBay Publicly Displays How Much Sellers Have Sold - EcommerceBytes', 'Scotland Yard looks at opening Amazon and eBay stores to boost ... - inews']
summary:
['eBay stock forecast: Will e-commerce keep roaring?
All things considered, the technical setup for eBay stock (as of 8 December 2021) is bearish.
The consensus eBay stock price target stood at $78.07 a share, resulting in a 16.1% upside potential based on the price of $67.23 a share.
Its eBay stock price prediction expected the price to hit $95.028 by the end of 2023 and $122.877 by the end of 2025.
You should conduct your own eBay stock analysis, taking in such things as the environment in which it trades and your risk tolerance.', 'This week, eBay began publishing how much a seller has sold on their eBay Stores homepages for all the world to see.
eBay now publicly displays how much sellers have sold since opening their Stores.
“Since when has eBay announced how much the store makes,” a reader asked EcommerceBytes upon noticing the change to her eBay Store homepage on Monday.
Some sellers believed eBay was displaying their dollar sales while other said they eBay was displaying was the number of items the seller had sold.
Using Google’s eBay Store as an example, on Monday, eBay displayed “179K Sold.” By Wednesday, eBay was displaying “179K Items sold.” “What a big difference a missing word makes,” a reader posted in the EcommerceBytes blog comments.', 'ExclusiveThe Metropolitan Police is considering opening Amazon and eBay stores to sell branded merchandise and souvenirs as it seeks to expand its income from an online range of gifts, including handcuff lapel badges and hip flasks, i can reveal.
But the story on this side of the Atlantic has been so far somewhat less eye-catching.
In a move perhaps inevitably to be dubbed “Amazon Crime”, a “pre-procurement notice” for the beefed-up venture was published in recent weeks seeking the private sector expertise to produce “a high-quality public facing online store” along with a “simultaneous Amazon/eBay store”.
It said: “The majority of sales are of low-priced small goods such as badges and mugs.
The Metropolitan Police confirmed it was looking to expand its currently “very limited” selection of merchandise, which currently generate around £30,000 a year in revenue.']

title: ['eBay has top-rated JBL wireless headphones on sale now - SFGATE', "eBay's GM of Trading Cards Bob Means Discusses Pop Up Shops ... - Sports Collectors Daily", 'How eBay is catalysing the global export business for local Indian ... - YourStory']

Right now, two of the brand's top styles are on sale: The JPL LIVE 500BT over-ear headphones and the JBL TUNE 500BT, each of which are currently at some of the lowest prices we've seen.

These JBL TUNE headphones will give you 16 hours of playback time with a quick charge that powers you up to an hour of playback in just five minutes, as well as quality sound and hands-free calls.", '', 'The growth of the ecosystem has enabled small businesses and entrepreneurs to explore the world of opportunities in the global trade market.
According to data collated by eBay’s India Small Online Business Report 2021, only 8.8 percent of traditional businesses in India export their products, as compared to 100 percent of the eBay-enabled small businesses.

The prices we saw ranged from $888 to $1,600 for the coffee table-style book of 300 photos and handwritten captions.

An Atari 2600 console in original 1977 box with a full set of games can sell for between £2,600 and £4,000.
Other toys from yesteryear are doing brisk business too – like Action Man, which cost just £2.23 in 1970.
Sign up for the free Mirror newsletterImage: Getty Images/Maskot) Getty Images/Maskot)Last week eBay had a rare Action Man Lancer doll for £1,100 and a Colditz play set for £850.
Image: Getty Images) Getty Images)Toy collector Mark Newbold, editor in chief of Star Wars website Fantha Tracks, said: “There is a huge amount of nostalgia.']

title: ['All eBay Stores Can Now Upload Videos - EcommerceBytes', 'Scalpers, Scalpers Everywhere: Tesla’s Cyberquad For Kids Hits eBay For Up To $17,000 - CarScoops', 'Aldi, eBay, Amazon, Halfords and more issue safety warnings and recalls - Liverpool Echo']
summary:
['eBay announced in March it was adding the ability for sellers to add video to their Stores, and on Thursday, it announced the capability was available to all sellers with an eBay Store.
Many ecommerce platforms allow sellers to upload videos to their product listings.
Videos are a popular format and are known to drive more engagement and purchases, eBay told sellers.
“To upload a video to your store, visit the Edit Store page.
2) Go to the About section and select Add video.', 'A search on eBay reveals dozens of listings for the ATV from those that secured an order and are expected to take delivery in the coming weeks.
Tesla briefly sold the Cyberquad for Kids priced at $1,900 but you’d be hard-pressed to find one online for anything less than double that.
There is also one listed on eBay with a Buy It Now price of $12,900.
advertisement scroll to continueMost of the Cyberquad for Kids listed on eBay range from $4,000 to $6,000, which is still upwards of three times the quad’s original price.
Driving the Cyberquad for Kids is a 36-volt lithium-ion battery pack that’s good for 15 miles (24 km) of range.', 'Amazon, eBay, Aldi and more have recalled several products amid health and safety fears.
The product does not meet the requirements of the General Product Safety Regulations 2005.
The product does not meet the requirements of the Toys (Safety) Regulations 2011.
This product does not comply with the Electrical Equipment (Safety) Regulations 2016.
The product does not meet the requirements of the Electrical Equipment (Safety) Regulations 2016.']

title: ['Cooper Kupp Rookie Card Roundup and Hottest eBay Auctions - Sports Collectors Daily', 'Lachlan Morton puts Alt Tour jersey up for sale on eBay - CyclingWeekly', 'Cancelled LEGO Christmas 2021 free gift turns up on eBay - Brick Fanatics', 'eBay Sends Requests to Sellers for IRS Form W-9 - EcommerceBytes', 'eBay & Sneakers: Can It Really Become the New StockX? - Highsnobiety', 'eBay Inc. stock outperforms market despite losses on the day - MarketWatch']
summary:
['', 'Lachlan Morton is selling the EF Education-Nippo Rapha jersey he wore to complete his Alt Tour this summer on eBay (opens in new tab).
Morton cycled the entire 2021 Tour de France route by himself on his Alt Tour, setting off from Brittany on the opening stage of the event on the same day as the peloton.
Now though, the EF Education-Nippo cyclist is selling the jersey he wore to complete the Alt Tour, which, at the time of writing, has a current highest bid of $3,300.
Morton explained on Instagram (opens in new tab) his decision to sell the jersey: "This is the jersey I wore for the entirety of the Alt Tour.
The Australian is selling the jersey on his own personal eBay account, which only has a 75 per cent feedback rating.', 'The second of this year’s LEGO Christmas 2021 gifts-with-purchase – which was officially cancelled by the LEGO Group – has popped up on eBay.
40489 Mr. and Mrs. Claus’s Living Room was originally intended to follow 40484 Santa’s Front Yard as the second seasonal GWP in 2021, but was ultimately shelved for not meeting the LEGO Group’s ‘strict quality standards’, whatever that means.
At least one copy of the festive set has made it out into the wild, however, because it’s now up on eBay in Poland.
Regardless, for those of us without the deepest of pockets, the eBay listing does at least give us a better look at what’s included in the vignette – including Santa’s naughty list.
Support the work that Brick Fanatics does by purchasing your LEGO using our affiliate links.', "I have MULTIPLE accounts on eBay, all with IDENTICAL business info, and only the one account received this message.
eBay is now requesting a W-9 form (taxpayer identification number request) to prove I am who I say I am, I guess.
A 25-year eBay seller here, and they’ve had the same business info for me since they first requested it back in the day!
J.Dear Ina,Seems like a good topic to post about: various users being requested of W9 forms even though all their info is correct ( link to eBay discussion board thread ).
IRS hasn't contacted anyone but eBay, supposedly.", 'A digital marketplace where everything has value, even when it doesn’t, and where “stuff” really is the operative word.
From used cars to garden sheds to clothes to memorabilia – there’s pretty much nothing you can’t find on eBay.
More than this, though, it begs not only the question of whether eBay can make an entry into the high-end sneaker market but also of how we should view that insurgence.
For one thing, does the market really need a new volume-based competitor to further encourage big-ticket bot purchasing?
One thing is certainly clear from all of this: the sneaker resale marketplace is flourishing.', 'Shares of eBay Inc. EBAY shed 0.30% to $66.69 Monday, on what proved to be an all-around grim trading session for the stock market, with the S&P 500 Index SPX falling 0.91% to 4,668.97 and Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA falling 0.89% to 35,650.95. eBay Inc. closed $14.50 below its 52-week high ($81.19), which the company reached on October 22nd.
The stock demonstrated a mixed performance when compared to some of its competitors Monday, as Amazon.com Inc. AMZN fell 1.54% to $3,391.35, Walmart Inc. WMT rose 1.80% to $143.57,...']

title: ['eBay launches ‘Small Business Shopfronts’ shoppable digital OOH ... - MobileMarketing Magazine', 'eBay Does More to Protect Sellers from Bad Buyers - EcommerceBytes', 'I flogged items on eBay to pay for a £10k ‘mummy makeover’ in Turkey – I can’t wait to unveil the new me th... - The US Sun', 'Rare Kew Gardens 50p coin sells for £171 on eBay – how to spot one in your change... - The Sun']
summary:
['In support of the 300,000 small businesses on its platform, eBay and McCann London have teamed up with window display designers from CLM Agency to create ‘Small Business Shopfronts’, a shoppable digital OOH campaign encouraging consumers to shop small in the run up to Christmas.
Five of eBay UK’s Small Business Award winners were chosen to have their own shop fronts designed and photographed, each celebrating the seller’s unique products and personalities.
Each of the digital windows for ‘Small Business Shopfronts’ reflects the one-off finds from small businesses on the marketplace.
The interactive OOH ads are also shoppable, with QR codes on each display allowing people to buy direct from the ad.
“We know our customers want to do their bit to support small businesses and we’re proud to bring small business power to the forefront of consumer’s minds this year through the creation of these shoppable OOH windows.”', 'eBay is doing more to protect sellers from bad buyers, including ramping up detection of abusive buyers and expanding seller protections, it told sellers in the UK on Monday.
eBay has two types of sellers in the UK: Business sellers and Private (non-business) sellers.
On the page where it directed consumer sellers, eBay said it had heard feedback from sellers: "You said, when you report a buyer, you want it to be taken more seriously."
On the page where it directed business sellers, eBay said it had heard seller feedback.
Have you seen any improvement in this or other areas mentioned in eBay's Monday announcement to UK sellers?', 'She says: "It was last year’s lockdown that made me realise I needed a mummy makeover.
"She told me who her surgeon was and I used savings, sold items on eBay and Facebook and worked extra hours to pay for the £4,000 gastric sleeve surgery.
She decided to get a tummy tuck and breast augmentation for Christmas this year because she hated her post-pregnancy body.
In lockdown last year I planned a surgical mummy makeover in time for Christmas 2021.
This Christmas I can’t wait to put on a party dress and see friends and family, Covid rules permitting.', 'A RARE coin featuring the famous Kew Gardens has sold for hundreds of times its face value.
The rare Kew Gardens 50 pence coin has sold on eBay for £170.99 after more than 30 bids from interested collectors.
In the latest rankings of the rarest 50p coins, Kew Gardens once again topped the chart.
How much is the Kew Gardens 50p coin worth?
Only 210,000 of them were ever made and put into circulation in 2009 - far fewer than most other 50p coins.']

title: ['Limited edition mince-pie flavored Christmas crisps selling for £145 on eBay... - The Sun', 'East Lansing will have a new marijuana provisioning center, shopping center and hotel by 2025 - FOX 47 News Lansing - Jackson', 'Rare £1 ‘egg’ error coin sells for £267 on eBay – how to spot the peculiar fault... - The Sun', 'Riff Raff Says His Air Jordans Were Banned From Ebay | Full Size Run - Complex', 'La La Anthony Reveals the Sentimental Gifts She Gifts Her Son Kiyan, the Struggles of Wearing Heels and eBay’s ‘The Sleigh Drop’ - Footwear News', 'Eric Clapton wins legal case against woman selling bootleg CD on ... - NME']
summary:
['A RARE assortment of Christmas crisps has been selling on eBay for £145.
The Walkers mince pie, smoked pigs in blankets and roast potato flavour snacks cost the equivalent of nearly £10 a bag.
However, the mince pie flavour was withdrawn by Walkers last week as the allergen milk was not listed on the ingredients.
For buyers happy to take a chance though, the eBay bags do not expire until March 2022.
Last night, the Kent-based seller still had three lots available — at a knockdown £125.', "EAST LANSING, Mich. — The vacant lot at the corner of Merritt and Park Lake was once used for East Lansing's Department of Public Works, but soon it will be home to a medial marijuana provisioning center, shopping center and hotel.
The first phase of the project is a 7,000-square-foot medical marijuana provisioning center along Merritt Road.
East Lansing Planning and Zoning Administrator Peter Menser said construction for that is set to begin this spring.
East Lansing Mayor Pro Tem Jessy Gregg said the tenants for the project have not yet been announced.
The third and final phase will be a 107-room hotel on three acres behind the provisioning center.", 'A RARE £1 coin has sold for £257 on eBay because of an error on it that coin collectors lose their bacon over.
But this error coin has been mis-struck, meaning the centre ring is not perfectly lined in the centre.
That egg-like £1 coin sold for £112, while this version garnered more than double that value at £257.52.
Their mistake is highly praised by the coin collecting community though, who were eager to get their hands on the rare example.
Keep forgetting a pound coin for the trolley- TRY THIS - Tiktok juniperjanecraft', "Sole Collectors'sFull Size RunSeason 11 December 16, 2021Riff Raff Says His Air Jordans Were Banned From Ebay | Full Size RunFull Size Run is Sole Collector's weekly sneaker talk and debate show featuring co-hosts Brendan Dunne, Matt Welty, and Trinidad James.
This week the crew is joined by the neon icon Riff Raff to talk about his history in sneakers, why eBay banned his custom Air Jordans, his signature sneaker, The Dale Dan Tony, and his legendary style.
If you like this show, subscribe to The Complex Sneakers Podcast now.
Full Size Run hosts Matt Welty and Brendan Dunne are joined by Sneaker Shopping’s Joe La Puma to discuss the most important sneaker news every week in a voice that can only be told authentically from Complex.
Apple: https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/the-complex-sneakers-podcast/id1487701689 Spotify: https://open.spotify.com/show/0R4V3NB5VSdyX3YP8i8HGf?si=rsZ3gzIzTW-3iVFHl5Lhkg", 'Ebay has offered exclusive access to some of the world’s best sneaker collections since November through “The Sleigh Drop.” Although the sale will soon come to a close, one more high-profile sneakerhead is set to part ways with some gems: La La Anthony.
Prior to Anthony, eBay’s “The Sleigh Drop” — which kicked off Nov. 5 — offered sneakers from the collections of DJ Skee and Jacques Slade.
For him, I always try to go the sentimental, meaningful route when it comes to his journey in basketball.”What does someone get La La Anthony for Christmas?
Now as an adult, seeing people finally take notice is really cool.
But to be a female in a space, I can hopefully inspire and motivate other females to step up and do some cool things in the space as well.”', 'Eric Clapton has won a legal case against a German woman who attempted to sell a bootleg CD of his on eBay.
AdvertisementThe 55-year-old said that her late husband told her he had purchased the CD in 1987 at a well-known department store.
The court has now asked the woman to pay the legal fees of both parties, which is around €3,400 in total (£2,889).
If she continues to offer the CD for sale, she faces a fine of €250,000 (£212,353) or six months in prison.
The defendant’s lawyer, Klaus Günther, told German newspaper Bild: “We will appeal again.”Meanwhile, Eric Clapton has faced backlash over the course of the COVID pandemic due to his anti-vaccine views and criticisms of lockdown measures.']

A high-quality Bluetooth chip offers 35 feet of range for easy streaming from your phone, laptop, or tablet while an aux input allows you to connect your TV or record player with ease.', 'Over the holiday period, there is an estimated 1.3 billion cards that pass through the USPS system which has made counterfeit stamps a huge problem for not just the post office, but for the likes of eBay and Facebook too.

“We’re receiving a run-around with USPS in trying to figure out the Holiday hours for Christmas Eve.

['', "Find your groove with this frankly incredible deal on JBL headphones: The company's 500BT wireless pair are just $39.95 on sale right now — offering a $100 savings.
JBL LIVE 500BT Wireless Bluetooth Over-Ear Headphones With Built-In Microphone - $39.99, was $149.95The headphones are the real deal too — no scratch-and-dent here.
They're brand new and in unopened packaging (making them very giftable), and they're tricked out with a ton of features.
While you listen to your music you can also take advantage of the Google Assistant features, as well as AmbientAware and TalkThru technology that offers super-clear handsfree calls.
Scoop them up now for just $39.95 while the deal's still on on eBay.", '', 'Coins that have been made with mistakes on them are called "error coins" and are extremely valuable to collectors.
Last week, The Mirror reported on another "misalignment" error coin after a minting mistake left a £1 coin looking like a fried egg.
This error coin sold for £257 after attracting 31 bids during a seven-day auction on eBay.
Do you have a rare coin in your collection?
Meanwhile, a coin expert said how this HG Wells £2 coin could be worth up to £1,000 due to a minting error.', 'I wake up and I’ve got emails and text messages from people trying to buy, sell, trying to trade, trying to do stuff with shoes.
And then not being there to go through the stuff, right?
Esquire: When you’re trying to search for a pair of shoes, how willing are you to invest a lot of time and energy?
There are a few guys out there who if I don’t get ‘em, they’re usually right there trying to get ‘em.
They must kinda love knowing they’re trying to outbid you.', 'eBay must collect social security or ITIN numbers from sellers who sell over a certain threshold, it warned on Monday.
eBay stated: “Starting on January 1, 2022, U.S. tax reporting requirements will require all online marketplaces and businesses like eBay which process payments, to issue a Form 1099-K to sellers who receive $600 or more in gross payments.
Previously, only sellers with 200 or more transactions and at least $20,000 in annual sales received a Form 1099-K.
The new requirements may impact the 2022 tax return that you will file in 2023.”Beginning in January, once sellers’ sales reach $600, eBay will ask them to provide their full 9-digit Social Security number (SSN) or Individual Tax Identification Number (ITIN) before allowing them to continue selling on eBay.
In the meantime, you can learn more in our FAQ about Form 1099-K and how they affect you.”You can find the full post on the eBay Seller Announcement board.']

['eBay Announces Mandatory Collection of Social Security Numbers for These SellersGeorge Sheldon / Shutterstock.comeBay announced on Dec. 20 that the online marketplace will be required to collect Social Security numbers — or Individual Tax Identification numbers — from all sellers who sell product (over the course of the year) worth more than $600.
Find: How To Make Money on eBay: Your Guide to SellingEffective Jan. 1, 2022, eBay sellers will receive a 1099-K if they sell at least $600 of goods through the e-commerce platform in 2022, with no minimum transaction level.
Once the $600 threshold in annual sales is reached, eBay will require sellers to provide their full 9-digit Social Security number or Individual Tax Identification Number before they can continue to sell on the platform.
This new tax reporting law is part of IRS efforts to streamline 1099 reporting and tax compliance.
For example, if you bought an item for $500 the previous year and then sold it online for $250, it’s unlikely that you will be subject to income tax.', 'You can see where the second strike has taken place and is slightly off centre, with the words “2017 ELIZABETH” appearing twice on the coin.

title: ['Three cheap infrared thermometers from Amazon and eBay fail ... - Which?', 'Is eBay Driving Off Small Sellers? CEO Tells CNBC No - EcommerceBytes', 'Ebay: embedding circularity into fashion retail - Drapers', 'Rare Blue Peter 50p coin sells for £257 on eBay – how to find one... - The Sun', "Boots' viral £1.99 curl cream selling for £50 on eBay – but has it been discontinued? - OK! magazine"]
summary:
["Three dangerously unreliable infrared thermometers bought from Amazon and sellers on eBay have failed to measure temperatures accurately in our tests.
The least accurate thermometer - bought from Amazon for £6.37 - reported temperatures that were more than 1.5°C hotter than what they actually were.
After 44 temperature tests the readings provided were on average 1.5°C hotter than they actually were.
What is a CE mark and which thermometers failed our CE mark assessments?
The CE mark on the left displays all of the information needed for a medical device, the mark on the right doesn't.", 'eBay CEO Jamie Iannone was forced to defend his strategy of focusing on high-volume sellers in an appearance last week on CNBC's Closing Bell.
But at the same time, has that had an effect of driving some smaller sellers to other rival platforms like Etsy?"
One of the beauties of eBay is a brand-new seller could sell alongside a larger seller.
"So no, it's been a great opportunity for people to bring products that they have onto the platform, get started.
And in fact, most of our small businesses started as what I call an accidental entrepreneur.', 'Jemma Tadd, head of fashion at Ebay UK, says end-of-life resales are an open goal for brands – and can support the environment, the bottom line, and shopper loyalty.
The reasons for this are twofold: sustainable shopping is more accessible than ever before, and second-hand products are more reliable than they have ever been.
The second-hand market is an open goal: almost every item (95%) of discarded clothing can be re-used or upcycled, says sustainable fashion innovation platform Fashion for Good.
Experts physically inspect goods before they’re sent to the buyer or returned to the seller, providing confidence in high-value pre-loved items.
At Ebay, pre-loved is part of our DNA – and we’re looking forward to seeing more fashion retailers making it part of theirs, too, in the year ahead.', "A RARE Blue Peter 50p coin has sold for hundreds of pounds more than its face value at auction site eBay.
The nostalgic rare coin sold on December 20 for £256.86, which is over 512 times more than its official worth.
The Blue Peter 50p was designed by fan, Florence Jackson, after she won a competition that saw more than 17,000 entries on the kids TV show.
The rare coin features a picture to show an athlete in the Olympics, as drawn and depicted by the young viewer back in 2009.
The Blue Peter coin is no different, and the 2009 date marked on the coin will often be what buyers look for when they're on the hunt for the latest addition to their collection.", 'Let’s face it, 2021 hasn’t been the easiest of years – which is why some haven’t taken very well to the rumours that Boots’ cult favourite Essentials Curl Creme, usually £1.99 here , has been discontinued.
The situation is getting drastic for some fans though, who have been reporting empty shelves and no online stock for weeks.
(Image: Getty)We understand your need for a bargain, so we reached out to Boots to address the rumours on it being discontinued.
There you have it – you might have to wait a few weeks but the curl cream is on its way back to shelves.
Noughty Wave Hello Curl Taming Cream, £4.99 hereThis comes a close second to the Essentials Curl Creme on Boots, with nearly 1,000 people giving it glowing reviews on Boots for its ability to define and hold curls, without leaving residue.']

title: ['eBay launches a massive sale on hot weather gadgets and games - Daily Mail', 'Ebay Alternative Platform Ethair Market Launches Its Token, Sellers ... - Bitcoin News', 'Rare error 20p coin sells for £430 on eBay because one side is completely BLANK... - The Sun']
summary:
["eBay Australia has curated a number of seasonal must haves for customers with the $169 Bestway Inflatable Canoe Raft and $79.95 Keezi Kids Beach Toys Sandpit coming out on top as the perfect implements for a long, hot day in the sunshine.
To entertain the kids on the sand opt for the beach toys sandpit, which is currently 61 per cent off its original price at $79.95.
If a BBQ is your summer scene you'll be nowhere without the $999 Bestway Inflatable Lay-Z-Spa Massage Hot Tub, which can comfortably seat seven guests.
It's the professional quality customers have come to expect from eBay sales and the perfect product to start 2022 off with a bang.
eBay is hosting a 10 per cent off Boxing Day coupon on selected items with the code BD10OFF.", 'Ebay Alternative Platform Ethair Market Launches Its Token, Sellers Can Now Accept Crypto for GoodssponsoredEthair Market has listed ETHR token on Uniswap as a result of its first governance vote by the holders.
On top of the proprietary token, Ethair Market currently supports fiat and cryptocurrencies such as: Bitcoin, Ethereum, Litecoin, Stellar and USDC, and more.
What’s the ETHR token utility?
Governance VotingAll Ethair Market users with any amount of ETHR in their accounts are eligible for governance voting rights on certain token matters.
However, the creation of additional tokens is directly tied with users’ marketplace transactions.', "A RARE 20p coin has sold for a whopping £430 on eBay, all because one side is completely blank.
The error coin is missing the design on one of its faces - The Queen's head is still intact, but there is no telling where the coin's tail has got to.
So somewhere out there there's another 20p with this coin's missing design on, twice.
But in the grand scheme of things, the number of rare error coins out there is still very small.
Error coins are still legal tender, so there's always a chance one will show up in your change."]

title: ['eBay Removes Popular Image Search Function from IOS and ... - eSeller365', 'How to Tell If eBay, Amazon, and Facebook Marketplace Items Are ... - Lifehacker']
summary:
['eBay has disabled the Search by Image function in the latest update of its mobile apps.
The Search by Image function is also supported through its developer API, which enables developers to build apps to enhance the eBay marketplace, adding even more functionality to the API function as recently as November.
But now for reasons unknown, eBay has removed the feature from its own apps, as confirmed by an eBay staff account in the eBay Community Forums.
“The image search functionality has been temporarily turned off for both the iOS and Android apps.” eBay StatementNo additional information was offered by eBay on why the feature was removed and no ETA was provided about its return.
This week, eBay also sent out a last warning to eBay Partner Network developers to migrate off APIs and the company updated its user privacy policy (effective December 23) that includes some new data protection policies.', 'These spaces operate more like virtual flea markets—except without the option of inspecting the items (in person) yourself.
For this, and other reasons, it’s not uncommon for stolen goods to end up for sale on these sites.
If you’re not sure how much it typically goes for, Scambusters recommends checking prices of similar items that have already been sold.
You can do this on eBay by clicking “sold listings” in the left-hand panel of the product listings page.
The seller asks you for personal informationAccording to Coopwood, this happens most often when sellers don’t provide any identifying information about themselves.']

title: ['Rare 50p coin sells for £155 on eBay and there are thousands more - check your change - The Mirror']
summary:
['After its release in 2009 to mark 250 years since Kew Gardens opened in 1759, the Royal Mint estimate around 210,000 of the silver heptagonal bits of cash were madeRare 50p coin sells for £155 on eBay and there are thousands more - check your changeA rare 50p coin that recently sold for £155 could be in your purse or pocket.
Change-checking website Coin Hunter puts the average resale price for the Kew Gardens 50p between £150.89 and £161.50.
Royal Mint described the 50p piece as "arguably the most sought after" coin on its website.
If you find a Kew Gardens 50p in your change, the first thing you should do is check the date on it.
This is because the Royal Mint reissued a batch of the coins in 2019 to celebrate 50 years of the 50p.']

title: ['JOAN Creative, Director Amy Nicholson Proclaim "Let\'s Ride" For ... - SHOOT Online']
summary:
['J. Shia, an internationally known small business owner and custom motorcycle builder, stars in this spot for eBay Motors, part of a campaign which is the first created by agency JOAN Creative for the client.
JOAN focused on the insight that eBay represents a human-centered antidote to “big tech,” and designed the “Let’s Ride” campaign to celebrate the people, rather than the technology.
The campaign is part of a larger platform that taps into eBay’s community to tell the true stories behind the sales.
“We went deep on eBay Motors and realized that it is full of a bunch of real-life characters, buying and selling parts and talking shop about their obsessions.
I mean, the blog is hilarious.” said Jaime Robinson, co-founder and CCO, JOAN.']

title: ['eBay Lets Buyer Keep Refund for Late Arriving Package - EcommerceBytes', 'Why Is eBay Linking to WayBack Machine and Slack? - EcommerceBytes', 'Ebay Is Adding Fees to Sneaker Transactions - Sole Collector', 'Cheetos crisp in the shape of Loch Ness Monster goes on eBay for £630k - The Mirror', 'eBay launches New Year’s sale with extra 15% off DualSense PS5 controllers, Philips Hue, more - 9to5Toys']
summary:
["Come Dec 22, it was seemingly lost (USPS tracking showed it never left the origin facility) and the customer filed a request through eBay for a refund, which I issued.
I contacted eBay to have the refund reversed and they said no.
eBay forces me to issue a refund - STRIKE to my seller account.
eBay's typically unhelpful CS rep suggested I contact the customer and ask him to send back the refund.
I told the smug little unmentionable that of course, I've already done this, and of course, still silence on the customer's end.", 'eBay sent out an email advertising a New Year's sale: "Get your hands on an extra 15% off for New Year’s essentials."
The email linked to a landing page where it included links to WayBack Machine and Slack, for some very odd reason.
The top of the eBay email advertised "Extra 15% off - save on essentials until 1/3, Get the coupon."
The link leads to a landing page offering 15% off through January 3rd on items in four categories: Electronics; Fashion; Home and Garden; and Sporting Goods.
But the two links to the program page actually goes to the May 18, 2021 entry for the page on WayBack Machine.', 'Around this time in 2019, Ebay announced that any sneaker sold at $100 or more will not be subjected to any fees for the transaction, but that will soon change.
Earlier today, the e-commerce platform revealed that new changes are coming to the final value fees for men’s and women’s sneakers that are listed in the Athletic Shoes category.
Starting on Jan. 19, the final value fee for sneakers sold over $100 will be at 8%, while insertion fees will continue to be waived for listings with a starting price over $100.
For sneaker transactions under $100, final value fee rates will remain unchanged.
Ebay revealed that the implementation of the fees will allow the platform to bring new features as well as improvements to its existing programs like Authenticity Guarantee and 3D true view.', 'A Cheetos crisp in the shape of the Loch Ness Monster has gone up on eBay for an incredible £630,000 - and the owner said he wouldn't recommend eating the valuable item, but you could if you wanted toCheetos crisp in the shape of Loch Ness Monster goes on eBay for £630kA Cheetos crisp in the shape of the Loch Ness Monster has gone on sale on eBay - for a staggering £630,000.
As the Daily Star reports, there are two crisps in the shape of the Loch Ness Monster available - and the other is more reasonably priced at £210.
How much would you pay for the Loch Ness lookalike crisp?
In the eBay advert, the seller said: "This Cheeto reminds me of Nessie the Loch Ness Monster.
Meanwhile, sightings of a 'Loch Ness Monster' have been on the rise in Cornwall as locals claim the coast is being stalked by a huge surviving species of plesiosaur.', 'Be sure to Be sure to follow us on Twitter for the latest deals and more.
Sure this isn’t the just-announced colors, but it is still Sony’s DualSense Wireless Controller.
eBay New Year’s sale highlights:Though if none of our other picks are really catching your eye, you can just shop the entire sale on this landing page.
Playstation DualSense Wireless Controller features:Discover a deeper, highly immersive gaming experience¹ that brings the action to life in the palms of your hands.
The DualSense wireless controller offers immersive haptic feedback, dynamic adaptive triggers, and a built-in microphone, all integrated into an iconic comfortable design.']

title: ['Is eBay Stock a Smart Buy for 2022? - The Motley Fool', 'How To Check Your eBay Gift Card Balance - GOBankingRates', "Kanye West's French Montana-Gifted Sneakers Wind Up On eBay ... - HipHopDX", 'The unwanted Christmas gifts being sold on Ebay - with some still in their wrapping - Daily Mail']

Despite the customer losses, eBay's stock is up 29% year to date, but that does not ensure it will have similar success in 2022.
That can partly explain eBay's stock price rise in 2021 despite the lower buyer totals.
That being said, eBay's stock is not expensive, trading at a price-to-free cash flow ratio of 17.
Consistent profits, an inexpensive valuation, and an asset-lite business model trounce the lack of innovation and make eBay a stock to buy for 2022.", 'How To Check Your Ebay Gift Card BalanceDaniel Krason / Shutterstock.comeBay gift cards make great gifts because you can buy almost anything — including gift cards to other retailers.
