53 if you think your eBay gift card is fraudulent or suspect that someone used your gift card balance to make a purchase.', "Kanye West revolutionized sneaker culture in Hip Hop with the various kicks he released with Nike and Adidas.
The Bronx rapper was seen presenting Kanye with a pair of his sneakers at the gym, which the Donda rapper graciously accepted with a semi-awkward smile.
related news Kanye West's Signed 'Donda' Bulletproof Vest Fetches $75K At Auction December 14, 2021According to an alleged screenshot of the eBay listing, the sneakers were being sold for just 99 cents.
Adding insult to injury, some fans speculated that Kanye West left the sneakers behind on purpose.
Kanye West is no stranger himself when it comes to handing out pairs of sneakers to his friends.", "People who were left disappointed with their Christmas gifts have wasted no time in offloading them - by listing them for sale on Facebook Marketplace and Ebay.
Designer goods, children's toys and top-of-the-range electrical equipment are just some of items that have been listed over the last few days under 'unwanted Christmas gifts' on the online retail sites.
Others made no bones about the fact that they simply didn't like what they'd opened on Christmas day.
For canny shoppers looking to spend Christmas money but still bag a decent deal, there are plenty of bargains to be had, with many sellers seemingly happy to flog their unwanted gifts at a cut-price.
The coffee maker was listed on Ebay for £20 including £20 worth of free coffee."]

title: ["eBay Brings Back Fees on Sneaker Sales – Will This Impact Its 'High ... - eSeller365"]
summary:
['The free ride for many eBay athletic sneaker sellers is coming to an end in January as the company will reintroduce final value fees on January 19, 2022.
When eBay launched the no selling fees promotion for eligible sneaker sales, it didn’t specify an end date, but now after two years, the free ride is over for sellers.
To date, eBay has authenticated about 2 million sneakers globally, with a pair of sneakers purchased every four seconds.” eBay StatementSource: eBayWill New eBay Sneaker Fees Impact Sales?
But with eBay now re-introducing final value fees to sneakers over $100, competitors may target sellers by offering promotions to at least temporarily reduce the final cost to sellers.
This will be a tricky time for eBay as it will need to justify its investment by offering free final value fees for two years and acquiring Sneaker Con Digital.']

title: ['eBay Will Require Full Social Security Numbers in 2022 - EcommerceBytes']
summary:
['eBay will require sellers to provide their full social security numbers for 2022 activity.
The seller said eBay displayed a message about 1099 forms in the Seller Hub overview page on December 20th.
It gave me a huge sense of trust.”But the discrepancy in information eBay provides to sellers when it changes policies fosters feelings of mistrust, the seller said.
An eBay moderator confirmed that the notification displayed at the top of Seller Hub is correct – “we will eventually need your complete 9-digit Social Security number.
Rival marketplace Etsy is similarly requiring sellers to provide their social security numbers and, in fact, some sellers ran into problems in early December when they received a notice from Etsy to update their information and had their accounts frozen.']

title: ['Amazon and eBay are selling one of Jihadi John’s favourite terrorist books... - The Sun']
summary:
['AMAZON and eBay are selling one of British IS executioner Jihadi John’s favourite books.
Mohammed Emwazi, who beheaded his victims, was caught at Heathrow with the book about Afghan guerrilla warfare — one of a string of terrorist works sold by tech giants.
1 Jihadi John was caught at Heathrow with the book about Afghan guerrilla warfareDr Alan Mendoza, of anti-extremism think tank the Henry Jackson Society, said: “Amazon haven’t done their homework.
"One book even contains the word ‘terrorist’ in the title.”Amazon declined to comment and eBay said the books were legal.

Happy Holidays,B.", 'A DIY-savvy dad has transformed his "falling apart" caravan into a stylish holiday home.

In 6th year in 1999, I was pretty much the only girl to do an extracurricular new computer course, donated by Intel to my school Coláiste Chiaráin.', 'An Nvidia GeForce RTX 3090 Founders Edition board has been listed on eBay for more than four times its MSRP of US$1,499.
A listing for an Nvidia GeForce RTX 3090 Founders Edition card has a “buy it now” price of an astounding US$6,102, which is almost 4.1x MSRP.
The RTX 3090 card in question is obviously new and apparently unopened, with the unit being supplied by a Japanese store.

The used mining rig is going for the astonishing amount of US$16,000, although the seller claims none of the GPUs are older than five months.', 'Boba Fett got a surprising number of toys, which you can find on eBay, including…Vintage Boba Fett Action Figure: The bounty hunter Boba Fett made his cinematic debut in Star Wars: Episode V - The Empire Strikes Back.

title: ['Are Annual Payment Holds a New Reality for eBay Sellers? - EcommerceBytes', "eBay launches 'Dream Transfer' campaign to bring football's ... - MobileMarketing Magazine"]
summary:
['A seller said eBay placed a hold on his payments for 5 days while it reviewed their account - and was told it's part of eBay Managed Payments policy.
The seller wrote on the eBay discussion boards : "Once a year, sellers are going to have their accounts reviewed and payout held, until eBay completes a review that may take up to 5 days.
I quote "there are no triggers, or nothing wrong with your account, this is just the new standard to safe guard our buyers and sellers on eBay."
"I have asked many times WHY eBay does this and WHY do they have to hold ALL funds for 3-5 days.
That leaves sellers forced to guess about eBay practices and policies - which is especially concerning for policies impacting sellers' funds.', 'To celebrate football’s January Transfer Window, when clubs can buy and sell players, eBay UK is giving football fans across the country the chance to sign football legends Roberto Carlos and Eni Aluko to their Sunday League teams for one match with its ‘Dream Transfer’ campaign.
World Cup winner and former Real Madrid star Roberto Carlos, and ex-Juventus and Chelsea women’s star Eni Aluko have both ‘listed themselves’ complete with bespoke, playful write-ups.
All participants need to do is enter via a £5 raffle ticket with all proceeds being donated to social inclusion charity Football Beyond Borders.
Influencers including Sky Sport’s Kelly Cates, Chris Kamara and transfer gossip icon Fabrizio Romano feature throughout the campaign.
“Bringing communities together who have a shared passion is what eBay’s marketplace is all about,” said eBay UK Chief Marketing Officer, Eve Williams.']

If buyers didn't know about an extended return period, then eBay and its sellers would not have benefitted from such a policy.', 'That’s what the vendor claims anyway, though they did not say anything about the things that do not work.

title: ['eBay Threatens Collections after Seller Loses Dispute - EcommerceBytes', 'Couple Buys 1970s Milk Float for $2700 on eBay, Becomes Zero ... - autoevolution', 'Mum transforms kitchen for just £197 using bargains from Amazon and eBay - Liverpool Echo', 'eBay under fire after distasteful tweet to Juventus following Federico Chiesa injury - The Mirror', 'Pivot AM launches eBay-style auction site for used 3D printing ... - 3D Printing Industry', 'eBay Lists Soccer Legends So Fans Can Bid For Their Talents - Adweek']
summary:
["Dear Ina,I found your information online while searching for organizations that know how to handle disputes with eBay and was hoping you knew how to help.
I used to be a seller on eBay until my last transaction.
Sold a computer last August, and the buyer had buyer's remorse and wanted a refund.
The eBay dispute team said since there is no way they can verify that the computer was working when I sent it, they defaulted to siding with the buyer.
They then proceeded to take money out of my account (until I blocked the transaction) and close my account.", 'Lisa Jones and her husband Stephen Thomas (Thomo) spotted a 1970s milk float on eBay on a Sunday morning.
The asking price was £2,000 (approximately $2,700), and they bought it before they could talk themselves out of it.The milk float was built in 1972, but it was retired from deliveries.
The upside was that it was still functional.When it arrived, they were surprised to find it was in serious need of extra work, and they contacted milk float restorer and repairer John Lenehan, based in Oxford.
"It's not the fastest milk float in the West, it has to be said," Lisa told My London News .
They usually keep Ernie in one place for “street visits,” and have added a new vehicle for delivers.', 'A mum has managed to transform her kitchen for less than £200 using bargains from online retailers and high street shops.
Thanks to bargains from Amazon, Wilko and eBay, Laura was able to renovate the kitchen for just £197.
I painted all my tiles around the kitchen using a roller and white tile paint from Wilko.”(Image: LatestDeals.co.uk)For the kitchen walls, Laura chose the shade Grey Whisper from Johnstone which she purchased on Amazon.
“Frenchic paint is amazing to work with and a little goes a long way.
The lino cost £100 with fitting, the Frenchic paint and brush cost £30, the Johnstone paint cost £16, the tile paint cost £10, the rose gold handles cost £23 and the DC Fix cost £18.', 'The American company has sparked a wave of backlash from furious Juventus fans in response to a particularly controversial tweet seemingly making light of Chiesa's injuryeBay under fire after distasteful tweet to Juventus following Federico Chiesa injuryeBay have prompted a wave of a angry responses from furious Juventus fans after the online marketplace platform uploaded a tweet that appeared to joke about Federico Chiesa's season-ending injury.
"During yesterday's match, Federico Chiesa felt a blunt trauma sprain to his left knee," a statement from the club read.
Response to the tweet was as many would have expected as a number of Juventus fans slammed the disrespectful nature of making light of such a serious injury.
His sentiments were echoed by Federico Bernardeschi, who wrote: "Day after day, I am always by your side."
Juventus currently sit fifth in the Serie A table, outside of the coveted Champions League qualification places after 21 games played.', 'Pivot AM Service, a US provider of refurbished 3D printing equipment and services, has launched a new specialist auction site for the buying and selling of used professional 3D printing hardware.
The company also sells new and refurbished printers across all 3D printing technologies and can refurbish and upgrade used equipment itself.
A selection of used 3D printers currently listed on the Pivot AM Auction site.
Subscribe to our YouTube channel for the latest 3D printing video shorts, reviews and webinar replays.
Featured image shows a selection of used 3D printers currently listed on the Pivot AM Auction site.', 'The January transfer window in soccer —the period of the year when teams can buy, sell and transfer players—is normally an exclusive time reserved for the sport’s elite, but eBay is trying to democratize it.
This month, the e-commerce platform will give U.K. fans a chance to sign soccer legends Roberto Carlos and Eni Aluko to their Sunday league teams—amateur teams that play in communities every Sunday.
Anyone on a local team can bid for the players by purchasing a $6 (£5) raffle ticket on eBay’s marketplace.']

title: ['Khalifa Fund for Enterprise Development partners with eBay for the ... - My Startup World', "How to block buyers on eBay - Tom's Guide", "How to retract a bid on eBay - Tom's Guide", 'You Can Sign Roberto Carlos To Your Sunday League Team For £5 ... - The18']
summary:
['Under the Abu Dhabi Inspires programme, the Khalifa Fund for Enterprise Development has partnered with eBay as the latest partner of the e-Empower initiative.
Medium-large enterprises will be eligible to receive a personal training program with eBay experts, higher selling limits, complementary eBay store subscription for a quarter, as well as integration subsidy and marketing benefits.
Jenny Hui, General Manager of Global Emerging Markets at eBay said: “We are thankful for the opportunity to cooperate with Khalifa fund to support and grow SMEs in the UAE.
As one of our target markets, we see great potential in the UAE and wish to assist local SMEs go global and ease their journey.
With over 159M buyers worldwide in 190 markets and 250M searches a day, eBay opens the door to any local business to become a global player.', "If you know how to block buyers on eBay, your experience as a seller is likely to drastically improve.
Here, we'll show you how to block buyers on eBay, as well as how to look at how you can manage potential buyers and even stop a bid in its tracks before an auction ends.
So, here's how to block buyers on eBay.
(Image credit: eBay)If you don't want to go so far as to block buyers, eBay offers tools to manage who can potentially buy from you.
(Image credit: eBay)Now you know how to block buyers on eBay, you may also want to know how to retract a bid on eBay.", "If you've got bidder's remorse, understanding how to retract a bid on eBay should solve your problem.
With all that in mind here's how to retract a bid on eBay if it really is what you want to do.
To find the “Retracting a bid” page, type “retract bid” in the search box.
In general, the sooner you retract a bid, the better for you, the seller, and other eBay users.
Now you've mastered how to retract a bid on eBay, you may also want to know how to block buyers on eBay.", 'Sick of showing up for your Sunday League match with half your team hungover and the other half 15 minutes late?
Footballing legends Roberto Carlos and Eni Aluko are currently up for grabs on eBay as part of a charity campaign by Football Beyond Borders.
From today you can enter the @ebay_uk #DreamTransfer competition to sign me to play for your Saturday or Sunday League team.

Get ready lads, this World Cup Winner is coming for the real trophy: Sunday League Football.']

title: ['Get this Zippo multipurpose outdoor tool for $15.95 from eBay - SFGATE', 'Pointe Coupee solar farm that will power McDonald’s, eBay begins construction - The Advocate', 'Empty bottles of premium whisky on ebay snapped up by ... - The Drinks Business', 'Roberto Carlos: Selecao-Ikone bietet sich bei Ebay für den guten Zweck zum Schnäppchen-Preis an - Eurosport DE', 'Air Jordan Sneakers Dominate on eBay for Celebrity Collaborations - WWD', 'This $150 Cuisinart coffee maker is just $60 on eBay right now - SFGATE']
summary:
["eBayA multipurpose tool is always handy to have on hand if you find yourself in a tight spot, especially in the outdoors when your lighter gives out.
Yep, this tool starts fires, too.
Right now, you can get Zippo's solid fire-starting multi-tool for $15.95 on eBay—and considering what it packs inside its compact frame, that's a heck of a deal.
This multi-tool has everything you need to get a fire going, including a flint and fire paracord, as well as a host of tools including a double cut saw blade, flathead screwdriver, bottle opener, bail, and more.
It comes new and in its original package, so you can be sure it's in good condition at this incredible price.", 'Construction has begun on a giant solar production farm in Pointe Coupee Parish after the San Francisco-based firm behind the venture closed on a $533 million package to finance several projects in its portfolio.
Known as Ventress Solar, the 345-megawatt facility covers 2,732 acres near New Roads at 13330 Ventress Road and will supply renewable energy to McDonald’s and eBay, Lightsource bp announced Wednesday.
Lightsource bp, a subsidiary of energy giant BP, touted the development as the biggest solar farm in Louisiana.
The firm expects the project to create 400 construction jobs over roughly two years and provide $30 million in increased tax revenues to Pointe Coupee as the facility is built.
It also estimates the clean energy generated will curb about 450,000 metric tons of greenhouse gas emissions annually, or the equivalent of 99,000 fuel-burning cars.', 'NewsBy Sarah NeishUsed whisky bottles are summoning princely prices on selling sites, as criminals buy and refill with budget spirits before passing them off as the real deal.
Empty whisky bottles of premium brands such as Pappy Van Winkle, Old Fitzgerald and Macallan are fetching up to US$380 for a single bottle on selling sites such as ebay.
Many distilleries package their bottles with common shrink-wrap seals that easily be replicated, making counterfeiting their product relatively simple.
Products include an umbrella, hairbrush, tampon holder, sunscreen lotion bottle and shampoo bottle, each of which are designed to conceal various quantities of booze.
The selling site has claimed it’s at risk from ‘false counterfeit claims’, where buyers request a refund for a genuine product as a way of getting double bubble.', 'Allerdings können bei der Aktion nur englische Amateurteams mitbieten.
Die Organisation setzt sich für hilfsbedürftige Kinder in England ein.
Januar könnt Ihr in den Traumtransfer-Wettkampf bei Ebay einsteigen und mich für Euer Ligaspiel am Samstag oder Sonntag gewinnen."
Der Linksverteidiger hatte seine internationale Karriere 2015 in Indien bei den Delhi Dynamos beendet.
Kehrer verhindert Boateng-Heimsieg: PSG nur remis in LyonThe Emirates FA Cup Magerkost in Manchester: United schleppt sich eine Runde weiter UPDATE 10/01/2022 UM 21:52 UHR', 'The resale sneaker market changes by the second, but as of Tuesday, Air Jordan 1 sneakers clocked in as the bestselling celebrity sneaker collaboration on eBay.
Like collectibles, the sneaker resale market has boomed during the pandemic, winning over an audience well beyond sneakerheads.
Last year the research firm Piper Sandler estimated that the sneaker resale market was $10 billion with a 120 percent increase in new sellers.
Ranking third through fifth respectively were the Nike Air Jordan 11, which sold on eBay for as much as $6,160, the Nike Air Jordan 4, which tallied up to $9,999 for one purchase and the Nike Air Jordan 12, which topped off as high as $1,600 on the resale platform.
With 35 variations to choose from on eBay, Air Jordan sneakers dominate on eBay, according to the company.', "eBayIf your coffee maker's been a bit on the unreliable side lately, don't keep tempting your caffeinated fate: Snatch up this deal on a 12-cup Cuisinart coffee maker on eBay.
It's sitting pretty (but not for long!)
at a cool $90 off.
Not only does it look great on the counter with its clean lines and stainless steel exterior, but it lets you brew a big batch for the family or flatmates, and you can even adjust the strength of the brew for the desired kick.
Auto-shutoff kicks in just in case you head out without turning off the machine first."]

title: ['BTS member-made sold out merch resurfaces at whopping rates on eBay; fans demand action - Republic World', 'Kanye West’s Red Wing Work Boots Skyrocket as They Sell for $3,000 on eBay - Footwear News', "Tesla's Cyberquad for kids selling for up to $4,000 on Ebay - Business Insider", 'eBay bid for Hearts v Liverpool programme revealed long-lost family - The Times', 'eBay launches Dream Transfer in partnership with Football Beyond ... - Charity Today News']
summary:
["BTS member, V's self-designed bag reportedly made history after becoming the world's fastest bag to get sold out as fans bought it within seconds.
However, a few fans noticed that the sold-out items were being sold on another website at an exorbitant price rate.
BTS merch resurfaces on eBayAs the evidence presented by fans, called ARMY, in form of screenshots, BTS members sold-out merch products resurfaced on the popular website eBay at rates much higher than their original price.
One fan posted a screenshot of V's Mute Boston Bag being sold on eBay at a whopping price.
Like the heartache, the disappointment that majority of ARMYs feel & then we see the merch on ebay being sold at exorbitant prices?!", 'Kanye West’s latest fashion era has arrived, courtesy of one specific pair of work boots—which have just sold for over $3,000 on eBay.
West’s Yeezy and Balenciaga-filled wardrobe has been paired with black Red Wing boots since the year began.
Identical to West’s pair, user mjean80 sold a size 13 pair for $3,050 on Jan. 12.
CREDIT: SplashWhat remains to be seen is if work boots resultantly take off as a top menswear trend this year—or if Red Wing possibly brings the style back.
The American brand is known for their long-lasting, utilitarian work boots, which could prove ideal for the cold winter and spring months ahead.', "Tesla 's Cyberquad for kids is being listed on eBay for over twice its original price.
's Cyberquad for kids is being listed on for over twice its original price.
AdvertisementAfter Tesla's Cyberquad for kids sold out, resellers on eBay are betting that people are willing to pay as much as $5,000 for the product, with some completed listings going for as high as $4,000.
The product sold out within a week.
AdvertisementOne YouTuber decided to try out the cyberquad for kids, which has a 150 pound weight limit, himself.", 'Buying a football programme led to Ross Colquhoun meeting his sister Erin for the first timeAn SNP staffer got more than he bargained for after an eBay purchase reunited him with his long-lost family.
Ross Colquhoun, the party’s head of digital, had tried to purchase a Hearts v Liverpool match programme from his estranged father on the website two years ago.
SponsoredThe seller got in touch with offering him a refund and sent a message to his son explaining their connection.
Now Colquhoun, 37, has written publicly about the strange coincidence, after meeting his sister for the first time.
In a Twitter post, Colquhoun described how he and his sister “felt like we’d known each other', 'THIS Transfer Window Season, eBay is giving football fans across the country the chance of a lifetime to sign football legends Roberto Carlos and Eni Aluko to their Sunday League teams for one unforgettable match.
Founded in 2013, Football Beyond Borders (FBB) is an education charity, which uses football as a tool for engagement to tackle the root causes of low educational attainment, poor school attendance and challenging behaviour.
Matt Pywowar, Head of Fundraising at Football Beyond Borders said:“We’re so happy to partner with eBay for Charity on Dream Transfer to raise important funds to support young people across the UK.
We are incredibly proud to be working with them on Dream Transfer and hope that the activity will mean that many more people get to hear about their work.”Roberto Carlos said:“I’ve been back in training for weeks to get match fit for the eBay Dream Transfer, and I’m a little nervous about my first game after a 6-year break!
Dream Transfer means anybody can get involved in the Transfer Window and get stuck into the action.']

['Emptied whiskey bottles are being filled with cheap liquor and sold on eBay for hundreds of dollars.
According to the New York Times, bottles from brands such as Pappy Van Winkle, Old Fitzgerald, and Macallan are being sold daily on websites such as eBay for significantly higher prices.
Counterfeiters are paying as much as $380 for a bottle and reselling them with cheap alcohol at "way over $2,000," Hollywood writer and producer Adam Herz told Inside Edition in May.
"Part of the problem is the culture I see around bourbon, where it is about bragging rights and being able to Instagram a bottle you just bought," Herz told the New York Times.
However, most whiskey producers are not involved with the current situation, according to the New York Times.', '', 'Then one crafty person thought up something new and original–posting a “bad sketch” of the popcorn bucket to raise money for charity.
Sadly, the auction for the “bad sketch” was ended early as there started to be some suspicious bidding.
My husband calls them a different kind of NFT (Not FigmenT) popcorn bucket.
There are a bunch of listings now, rivaling the number of actual popcorn bucket listings.
The winner today is the Jar of Popcorn Air Near a Figment Popcorn Bucket.', '']

title: ['Royal Navy sailor jailed after stealing SBS watches to sell on eBay - Wales Online', 'No Changes to eBay Partner Network Payouts Due to GMV ... - eSeller365', "eBay Adds Check as Payment Option to Seller's Surprise - EcommerceBytes"]
summary:
['Keep up to date with the latest stories with our WalesOnline newsletterA Royal Navy sailor has been locked up after stealing specialist diver watches used by elite SBS commandos and selling them for hundreds of pounds on eBay.
A court martial heard the 26 year old had racked up debts after 'living outside his means' and resorted to selling the CWC SBS watches online for £300 to £500 each.
He was finally caught out in February 2021 when eBay buyers contacted the MOD to check the validity of the watches.
He said: "He obtained six new CWC SBS diving watches and the total value that he acquired was £1,642.
A Royal Navy Seaman salary is approximately £25,970 per year.', 'Don’t MissOn Friday, the company sent out an email to its eBay Partner Network (EPN) users explaining that the GMV definition change will not impact EPN users as this is not a change to the definition of Gross Merchandise Bought (GMB).
The new GMV definition will align with eBay’s customer money flow and its monetization model the company said.
No Change to eBay Partner Network PayoutsHowever, as much as GMV and GMB appear to be the same metric, there are key differences eBay wanted to point out to avoid confusion.
“Your current pricing won’t change as a result of this and we’ll continue to pay partners the same way as before.
The eBay Partner Network is eBay’s affiliate program enabling digital marketers to promote eBay products on their websites, social media channels, and other digital platforms.', 'An eBay seller noticed that their listing is showing "check" as a payment option, even though it's not allowed in the category in which the item is listed.
According to this eBay policy page , "Checks, money orders, and bank wire transfers aren't allowed for most eBay purchases.
The seller's item is not listed in any of the allowed categories, nor does the listing appear to offer local pickup.
The concerns: is eBay losing sellers' listings?
An eBay moderator wrote"I do see an issue going on where sellers supplied us the required info and then that's it.']

title: ['eBay to Raise Threshold for Free Shipping Program in AU - EcommerceBytes', 'eBay App Offers Easy Pricing, Will Revamp Visual Search - EcommerceBytes']
summary:
['eBay will raise the threshold for free shipping for members of the eBay Plus membership program in Australia, which has some similarities to Amazon Prime with a major difference: eBay sellers are responsible for shipping items to eBay Plus members.
The eBay Plus free-shipping threshold is increasing to items priced at $9.90 effective February 8, 2022.
Previously, members of eBay Plus could get free Express shipping on items priced as low as $2.50.
eBay Australia said it had heard from many sellers that it was not viable to offer free Express shipping on low-value items.
eBay added in its announcement, “From February 8, 2022, eBay will be reversing the Express shipping subsidy that was paid if an item has in fact been sent with Standard Post rather than Express.”Buyers have two eBay Plus plans from which to choose: one plan for $4.99 per month, and an annual plan for $49 per year.', 'eBay offers a clearance feature called eBay Easy Pricing, and it got some attention when a seller called in to a recent eBay for Business podcast to ask about it.
The caller said he saw the prompt for Easy Pricing when listing an item on his phone.
Griffith also addressed other questions from listeners of the podcast, including one about eBay’s removal of the Visual Search feature from the mobile app.
So that version of the Visual Search, they should have it back up and running very soon.
“But he also told me that they actually planned to relaunch a new and improved version of Visual Search later this year in 2022.']

pic.twitter.com/5QqO3GqZiq", 'eBay is making a change to billing cycles, moving everyone to the 1st of the month.
This week, eBay informed sellers that beginning in March, it would generate all financial statements on the 1st of the month.
(Financial statements include a summary of selling activity and a detailed view of transactions, including information on claims, refunds, payment disputes, payouts.)
We’ll no longer be supporting the mid-month cycle for invoices and financial statements.

['EBay recently sat with experts who weighed in on how the next few years could look for sneakers, and most expect past styles to reemerge.
Sneaker collector Anthony Levine said that trends are cyclical and noted the dad shoe hearkening to ’90s sneaker styles.
He expects the prevailing 1990s and 2000s trends to remain, but make way for styles from the 2010s to return.
We’ve seen more specific footwear sizing from brands like Atoms that produces full, half, quarter and three-quarter sizes and mixes and matches sizes for commonly mismatched feet.
She told eBay that she predicts manufacturers to become the new retailers and brands will no longer be in-charge of production.', "Dear Ina,Well now I can not get anyone at eBay on the phone.
Maybe if you got 20 layers deep you could contact someone - but I can't find out how???
Buyer left me a negative after wanting a discount or partial refund - which I don't do.
I offered a full refund including shipping, but no - item was very bad, but they didn't want to return the item??
They left me a long negative.", 'An eBay seller pleaded guilty to selling stolen goods and will be sentenced on April 19, 2022.
The charge of “transportation of stolen goods in interstate commerce” carries a maximum penalty of 10 years in prison and a $250,000 fine.
The seller owned and operated a pawn store in Rochester, New York.
The government noted that the store employee was previously convicted in connection to the case and is awaiting sentencing.
A 2019 news article from Rochester First said three other people had also been charged.']

Here, in the “Personal Info” section, click “Personal Information.”On the “Personal Info” page, next to “Username,” click “Edit.”Your “Username” field is now editable.', "The counterfeit product was sold on eBay and is reported to have a high risk of electric shocks.

title: ['eBay Launches Authentication for Trading Cards - PR Newswire', 'eBay will now authenticate trading cards worth $750 or more - TechCrunch', 'After Booting PWCC, eBay Launches Its Own Trading Card ... - EcommerceBytes', 'AliExpress to eBay Dropshipping – The Complete Guide - Business Review', "eBay's Aging Seller Population - Marketplace Pulse", 'Help! eBay accepted my return but never sent a refund - Elliott Advocacy', 'Do Etsy Offsite Ad Fees Make eBay Seem More Appealing? - EcommerceBytes', "Rare 50p coin sells for a hundreds of pounds more than it's value - others could have one - Express"]
summary:
["SAN JOSE, Calif., Jan. 25, 2022 /PRNewswire/ -- eBay today announced the launch of its Authenticity Guarantee service for trading cards.
With the addition of trading cards to eBay's Authenticity Guarantee service, the company now offers authentication in four key enthusiast collector categories, including sneakers, watches, handbags and now trading cards.
eBay now offers its Authenticity Guarantee service for trading cards, where single, ungraded trading cards (including collectible card games, sports and non-sports) sold for $750+ in the U.S. will be authenticated.
Details on the trading card authentication process include:Thorough Inspection : Referencing an extensive database, authenticators inspect the overall condition and general quality.
eBay Trading Cards By The NumberseBay's Trading Cards category is growing significantly faster than the total marketplace.", 'Online marketplace eBay is once again expanding its authentication service, this time to include support for authenticating valuable trading cards.
On the flip side, nearly a quarter-million buyers on eBay have used the Price Guide tool in search to visualize trends for their favorite trading cards, eBay said.
The eBay website notes the trading card authentications are being handled by experts at the Certified Collectibles Group’s affiliates, CGC Trading Cards and Certified Sports Guaranty (CSG).
The authenticator has two days to authenticate watches or trading cards and three business days for sneakers or handbags.
But with trading cards, eBay faces new competition from a variety of dedicated trading card apps and services, like Alt, Whatnot, Loupe, Topps and others, including those that serve to help collectors determine what their cards are worth, like WorthPoint or CollX.', 'After booting PWCC from its marketplace over the summer, eBay launched authentication for trading cards on its platform.
The service, which is currently available for sneakers, watches, and handbags on eBay, will expand to trading cards priced at $750 and above (in the US).
And according to an article in Sports Collectors Digest last week, PWCC Marketplace has launched several new platforms in the intervening months, including a new app for buying, selling and trading.
Interestingly the landing page on eBay for the “PWCC Vault” now redirects to eBay’s main Trading Card category page.
According to eBay’s announcement today (Tuesday), it will roll out Authenticity Guarantee service for trading cards as follows:“Beginning now, single ungraded trading cards (including collectible card games, sports and non-sports) sold for $750+ in the U.S. will be authenticated.', 'One of the best ways is dropshipping from aliexpress to ebay.
Mirroring AliExpress Dropshipping TermsAnother vital part of running a business is establishing a consistent service for your customers.
For example, AliExpress and eBay are different “marketplaces” that customers visit, and naturally, eBay needs to do everything to keep their market safe.
The reason why we want to do this is to find out more about their shipping terms.
Shipping terms vary from one company to another, and you want to find one that fits your budget.', 'According to Marketplace Pulse research, 55% of top sellers on eBay have been on it for ten or more years.
Only 28% of the top sellers joined over the past five years.
Because new businesses are not flocking to eBay, its seller population is aging.
More than 40% of eBay’s top sellers joined before 2010, twelve years ago.
On Amazon, half of the top sellers joined over five years ago; on eBay, half joined more than ten years ago.', 'When Gloria Lenoir received approval from eBay to return a recent purchase, she expected a prompt refund.
I returned the item to the eBay seller about a month ago but I did not get my refund.
When I tried to enter the USPS tracking number, the eBay website would not accept it.
This isn’t the first time we’ve had a nonresponsive eBay seller.
Although eBay wouldn’t reveal what went wrong with your refund, the company promptly refunded your $29.', 'A longtime eBay seller who no longer wanted to have all their eggs in one basket also began selling on Etsy a few years ago.
But then, Etsy began assessing extra fees through its Offsite Ads program .
Etsy charges 15% for Offsite Ads fee on top of the regular commission on selling price-plus-shipping plus payment processing fees.
"eBay managed payments are working for me as they did with Etsy," and they called eBay fees of 12% up to £450 and 2% after that "fair."
"Let's hope eBay doesn't go down the same path" as Etsy with its Offsite Ads, the seller added, which is a fear other eBay sellers who have experienced Etsy Offsite Ads have expressed.', '50p coins to mark Brexit Day on 31st January 2020Coins with special messages engraved on them were created in January 2020 to mark the UK leaving the European Union.
A rare 50p coin has been sold for more than a thousand times its value.
Released into circulation in January 2020, millions of coins were made to mark Brexit.
This means that other Britons could be in with a chance of gaining hundreds of pounds for their rare coins.
The rare 20p coin was bought for a whopping £90.']

title: ['We bought Hovis lorry for £3k on eBay & turned it into dream home- it was cheaper than a house & we did it... - The Sun', 'How I turned £1 Poundland bargain into £513 profit with eBay selling trick – and you can do it too... - The Sun', 'eBay reveals major change to how Pokemon & Yu-Gi-Oh cards are ... - Dexerto', 'Dangerous fake Dyson Airwrap hair styler found on eBay - SecuringIndustry.com', 'eBay introduces Authenticity Guarantee program for Pokemon TCG ... - InvenGlobal']
summary:
['LET'S be honest - we mostly use eBay to bulk-buy cheap cleaning supplies and bargain second-hand clothes.
Martin explained: "About [six] years ago after a few too many beers I thought about buying a big American RV.
The kitchen appears to have all the mod-cons, including an oven and hob and a varnished wood work surface.
And they have no plans on settling down, with Martin selling his house and bar in Nottingham to live in the lorry full-time.
They said they use the five tonne lorry while they are out there as it is cheaper than most accommodation.', 'A PROFESSIONAL eBay seller has revealed how he turned a £1 purchase in Poundland into £513 profit in just seven days - and you can do it too.
Before doing anything else, Zain suggests checking the Poundland website to see what products are available and then seeing if the same products are selling on eBay.
Zain then uses an online eBay/ Paypal calculator to work out what the seller’s profit would be after shipping cost and eBay’s commission.
With every two units sold, the seller makes a profit of £5.97.
There are plenty of eBay success stories out there - like the woman who made up to £30,000 by selling her clothes on the website.', 'Popular auction site eBay has announced that they will require in-house authentication for trading cards listed for over $750, which includes Pokemon TCG and Yu-Gi-Oh items.
Another product that has taken over the site as it’s gained popularity over the last few years is trading cards.
As cards gain value, counterfeit copies of the most popular cards have made their way onto eBay, potentially scamming people out of hundreds or thousands of dollars.
Due to this, eBay has added trading cards to their authentication service to help buyers maintain confidence in the high-dollar purchase they are making.
eBay launches authentication for trading cardsAccording to PRNewswire, eBay is immediately launching its in-house authentication service for trading cards over $750 in value.', 'UK Trading Standards has warned of a counterfeit version of Dyson's popular Airwrap hair styling product that could pose "a serious risk of electric shock."
Purchasers would have received a device with inadequate internal wiring – with insufficient creepage and clearance distances – that could lead to wiring failure and lead to the product becoming live.
Aside from the risk of shock, wiring failure could also raise the risk of fire, says Trading Standard, which advises anyone with the knock-off to stop using it immediately and contact the distributor for redress.
The specific product sold by nana_6036 – a Chinese seller whose account has been cancelled – was listed as "Dyson Airwrap Complete Hair Styler Gift Edition Copper Gold."
A look at the feedback for the account reveals hundreds of reviews for Dyson and Apple products.', 'eBay has announced a new "authenticity guarantee" program aimed at sniffing out fake Pokemon cards after Logan Paul's tragic yet stupid $3.5 million scam.
The Pokemon TCG community was unsure what to make of Paul's admission that the "one of a kind" case of original Pokemon boxes ended up being fake and full of G.I.
On a serious note, some true Pokemon TCG collectors felt that the scam was a bad thing, meaning many previously authenticated rare cards could be fake.
eBay introduces Authenticity Guarantee for high-value Pokemon cardseBay has just introduced a new program that will have "professional authenticators" authenticate high-value trading cards for no extra cost.
This will provide an "authenticity guarantee" check on sales that have gone through this process.']

title: ["Inside eBay's new Authenticity Guarantee for trading cards: 'It'll be a ... - Sporting News", 'Rare 20p coin sells for £70 on eBay after error spotted on it and there are thousands more out there - Lancs Live']
summary:
['MORE: Inside the "absolutely insane" trading card boomWith the boom came issues, of course — problems always follow the money.
We had questions (as we always do), so we chatted with Bob Means, who is the director of trading cards at eBay.
BOB MEANS: What’s important to recognize is that we’re on six years of growth for trading cards.
Trading cards — and that’s sports trading cards, but we also include collectible card games in there, like Magic the Gathering and Pokemon, and non-sports trading cards, which would be Star Wars and Garbage Pail Kids and all of that — we’ve seen growth in all three categories.
Trading cards has been on about a six-year tear of consistent growth.', 'Don't miss out - sign up for our free daily newsletter todayA rare 20p coin has sold for £70 because of an error - and there are thousands out there.
The mule coin is undated and became the first in more than three centuries to enter circulation with no date.
It came about when the new Royal Shield 20p coins were struck for circulation in 2008, with no date on the reverse.
The seller listed the item as a "Genuine Rare Undated 20p Coin Royal Mint Error Coin no date 20 pence mule" and listed postage costs at £2.06.
The Royal Mint would like to assure the public that these are legal tender.”What is happening where you live?']

title: ['Natick cyberstalking case delves into conduct of top eBay executives - The Boston Globe']
summary:
['Five people who worked for Baugh and Harville were also charged, but their superiors, including Wenig, were not.
But a lawyer for eBay at the hearing said the company wasn’t hiding anything and shouldn’t have to turn over more interviews.
AdvertisementAssistant US Attorney Seth Kosto said the government never asked eBay what top executives such as Wenig said during the company’s internal investigations.
Under Justice Department policy, prosecutors are not to ask companies to waive attorney-client privilege for materials like the eBay interviews when conducting an investigation, though companies can voluntarily surrender protected materials.
“We did not ask eBay what Miss Jones or Mr. Wenig said in their interviews with eBay investigators,” Kosto replied in questioning from Judge Saris.']

title: ['eBay Suspends Seller after He Updates His Account Information - EcommerceBytes', 'Lucid Air Dream Editions Emerge On eBay: All Priced Over $200,000 - InsideEVs', "'Barbaric' ear cropping kits for dog owners removed from Ebay and Etsy after outrage - Daily Star", 'Fake Dyson Airwrap sold on eBay causing fires - Devon Live']
summary:
['Dear Ina,As you had some "fun" with eBay, I wanted to see if you might have an idea why eBay cut me off after 21 years being at least "above standard."
I joined in 2000 and never had any warnings, still have (number redacted) positive feedbacks displayed.
However, in August of 2021, I got the innocently looking request from eBay to verify my info by providing a photo of my drivers license and a scan of my bank account.
I of course obliged, but before I followed the advice in that eBay message and changed my short name (redacted), that I used for 21 years, to my full legal name (redacted) to match my drivers license and bank account.
I was in shock and contacted CS to hear changing explanations, which were all bizarre.', 'As it turns out, for those who would really want to own the top-of-the-line Lucid Air, not all is lost, as basically new cars are available on eBay.

President Justine Shotton wrote a letter to express her members' concerns 'about the easy availability of ear straightening or correcting accessories'.
Dr Shotton said: "We took action after being made aware by a few vets about the availability of ear cropping kits on eBay UK.
The charity said ear cropping should be banned across the world.
“Ear cropping is a painful process to remove part or all of a dog’s ear for cosmetic reasons.', 'Something went wrong, please try again later.

title: ['Second-Hand Lucid Air Dream Editions Are Appearing For Sale On eBay Motors - Torque News', "DIY renovation couple transforms 'dark and narrow' kitchen into a 'light' space with eBay - Express"]
summary:
["Lucid's first Air Dream Edition customer deliveries kicked off on October 30th 2021 with the inaugural Lucid Rally and now the 1111 horsepower luxury EVs are starting to pop up for sale online.
There are four Dream Editions currently available to purchase on eBay Motors.
$225,000This Air Dream Edition is #34 off the production line and is located in Oklahoma.
$239,000Yours for MSRP plus $70,000, Dream Edition #240 is unique as the only car here presented with Stellar White paint.
A Stellar White Dream Edition recently popped up at Ford's Dearborn, Michigan facility, and this could be that car.", "A couple has shared the results of the DIY renovation of the kitchen in their Victorian terraced house in North London.
Homeowners can add £10,000 to their home with one interior changeSharing their progress on their Instagram account @cluelessrenovators, the pair extended and redecorated the kitchen, entirely transforming the space.
Writing on the account, renovator and journalist Jess Alavi-Ellis detailed just how different the kitchen used to be.
She wrote: “When we first moved in the footprint of the house, with its various modifications over the decades, was long dark, and narrow - a familiar story with a Victorian terrace!
