title: ['100 Most Watched Beckett Graded Cards for Sale on eBay - Sports Collectors Daily', "'Inspired by an eBay Story' Makes Users Center of Campaign - Adweek", "eBay Listings Missing in Seller's Store Search Results - EcommerceBytes"]
summary:
['', 'Ecommerce site eBay wants users to think of it as a place where they can find anything, with a customer base filled with stories of their passions and interests, which its latest campaign in Italy aims to convey.
Created by creative network Dude, the campaign aims to celebrate the marketplace’s community through its “Inspired by an eBay story” creative platform targeting the country’s private seller consumer market.
Running until March 27, the multichannel campaign tells the story of one user who buys himself a new phone, only to end up winning an identical one when he visits a carnival.', "Dear Ina,I have been selling on eBay for about 9 years and have an eBay store with over 1,700 items.
Because eBay changed the way items are listed I decided to take 40 of my listed DVDs and search for them through my eBay store to see what they look like.
Out of the 40 DVDs, 9 would not come up in the search and 1 showed up in the search but when I clicked on it, it showed 0 found.
I can't help but wonder that if 10 out of 40 of my listed items do not come up in my eBay store search, how many more items out my over 1,700 will not be found.
This is a warning to all eBay sellers who have an eBay store, do not trust that eBay is doing everything correctly."]

title: ['Active Buyer Losses Are Accelerating at eBay - The Motley Fool']
summary:
['Buyer losses are partly a result of a strategic shiftAs of the end of the fourth quarter, eBay boasted 147 million active buyers on a trailing-12-month basis, down 9% from the 162 million it had a year prior.
That also was a loss of 5 million active buyers from the previous quarter.
We ended 2021 with 147 million active buyers on a trailing 12-month basis, representing a 9% year-over-year decline.
The expected decrease in active buyers was primarily driven by low-value buyers, which fell 9% versus Q4 of 2019.
Unsurprisingly, that has meant fewer total active buyers.']

title: ['Star Wars: Galactic Starcruiser Merchandise Already Being Sold On ... - Pirates & Princesses', 'Star Wars: Galactic Starcruiser Exclusive Merchandise Being Resold ... - WDW News Today', 'EBay Might Take Crypto Payments, Already Accepts NFTs - TheStreet', 'Seller Satisfaction Survey: Visibility on eBay - Part 3 - EcommerceBytes']
summary:
['Disney has just kicked off the media blitz, letting the social media influencers and actual media into the Galactic Starcruiser last week.
Well to add to the drama, it seems that the exclusive merchandise is already going on eBay.
Now, it doesn’t mean that it’s all influencers who got a free trip, but the merchandise is going for crazy prices on eBay before it even officially opens!
This came to our attention last night:So… influencers already selling the lightsaber on eBay?
— Scott Gustin (@ScottGustin) February 27, 2022the influencers only got 4 hours on the ship with the shop being roped off.', 'Here is your Daily Recap for Sunday, February 27, 2022.
Walt Disney WorldEPCOTWalt Disney World Resort HotelsStar Wars: Galactic Starcruiser hasn’t even officially opened to guests yet, and exclusive merchandise from the resort is already being resold on eBay.
Tokyo Disney ResortQuite a bit of attractions are scheduled for their two-week refurbishments through September 2022 at Tokyo Disney Resort.
Disney Cruise LineLighthouse Point will be a new Disney-owned and -managed port of call for Disney Cruise Line.
New MerchandiseEntertainment and MediaDisney+WDW News TodayThat’s it for today; we hope you enjoyed this Daily Recap.', '', 'In Part 3 of the Seller Satisfaction survey on eBay visibility, EcommerceBytes presents the findings on the tools sellers use to increase traffic to their listings.
eBay sellers had quite a bit to say about tools in our recent Seller Satisfaction survey conducted in February, which we cover here in Part 3.
In part one of the survey, we provided information about the over 1,000 eBay sellers who participated over a 5-day period.
You can find more information in this article on EcommerceBytes: “Seller Satisfaction Survey: Visibility on eBay – Part 1.”In part two, we reported on seller satisfaction with their visibility on eBay.
We also asked sellers which eBay tools were worth the cost.']

title: ["Celeste developer's missing Game Awards trophy turns up on eBay - Eurogamer.net", 'E-Commerce Giant eBay To Accept Crypto For Payments - Cryptosrus', "10 Surprising Household Items You Can Buy 'Certified Refurbished' On eBay - HuffPost UK", 'Not Your Father’s Auction Site: eBay Moves Toward An Immersive Shopping Journey - Forbes', 'Smugglers Already Running Star Wars Galactic Starcruiser Merch ... - Gizmodo', 'eBay Could Announce Decision on Crypto Payments March 10 - PYMNTS.com']
summary:
["The developers of Celeste have been reunited with their Game Awards trophy after it turned up on eBay.
Spotted by PC Gamer, YouTuber PrestigeIsKey is a big fan of Geoff Keighley's award show and was looking for a replica trophy.
Once the trophy arrived, he checked the bottom to find out it was the award for Best Independent Game won by Celeste developer Extremely OK Games in 2018.
PrestigeIsKey agreed to send the trophy back to Extremely OK Games; in return the team will now reimburse his money and send some signed copies of Celeste.
On his channel, PrestigeIsKey then goes on to unbox the trophy - fans of The Game Awards should take a look!", 'E-commerce giant eBay might be jumping into cryptocurrency payments soon.
eBay CEO Hints At Crypto PaymentsIn a recently-conducted interview with TheStreet, eBay CEO Jamie Iannone had some bullish remarks about the crypto and NFT market.
Shopping.io is another big e-commerce player that officially integrated crypto payments on its platform back in November 2020.
The fact that the commerce provider allows for crypto integration is a big deal for its 2.1 million daily active users.
Now, other top dogs like Amazon have yet to announce any sort of official crypto integration.', 'Oh, and FYI — prices are accurate and items in stock as of time of publication.
If you think of eBay as a place just for vintage furniture finds and discounted designer shoes, you’re missing a major household hack.
It’s also somewhere you can save money on pricey homeware on its ‘Certified Refurbished’ section.
And the reassuring news is that all items, as you’d obviously hope, are backed by a one-year guarantee.
We’ve rounded up a selection of delightful if surprising kit that you can find on the site – but believe us, there’s so much more when you start looking.', '', 'It’s only been a few days since Disney’s lavishly priced Star Wars Galactic Starcruiser attraction previewed for invited media, influencers, and guests—yet eBay listings are already being promoted for exclusive items from the experience.
AdvertisementThe Galactic Starcruiser exclusive Droid Depot SK-620 remote-controlled droid, which retails for around $100, is being listed for $900 starting bid (super surprised beeps).
For exclusive items purchased in the Halcyon’s specialty shop, each cabin is only allowed to buy two of specially marked limited edition items.
And on ShopDisney.com, select Galactic Starcruiser costuming and gear is only available for purchase with the use of an email tied to a booked reservation aboard the ship.
Despite the paywall, resellers may not be deterred if they find a way to scalp any scrap of Star Wars to eager fans who can’t make the journey to Walt Disney World themselves.', '']

title: ['Lost Game Award For Celeste Discovered On eBay By Youtuber - IGN', '“Bored Ape Yacht Club” NFTs selling on eBay for less than $50, what’s the catch? - CryptoSlate', '8 Mistakes to Avoid When Selling on eBay - MUO - MakeUseOf']
summary:
['The Game Awards is a big celebration for video games that are put on at the end of every single year.
Thousands of viewers watch it every year and so video game developers love to have their own games showcased on it.
He always wanted a replica of the Game Award trophy, so he scoured eBay for the past five years to see if there were any.
It turned out to be the actual trophy that Extremely Ok Games won at the 2018 Game Award for Best Independent Game with Celeste.
For his generosity, Ryan says that Extremely Ok Games will offer him signed copies of Celeste, as well as reimburse him for the amount he paid for the eBay listing.', '“Off brand” Bored Ape Yacht Club (BAYC) NFTs are selling on eBay for just £34.99 ($47).
But a dig deeper reveals these non-fungibles are from the much less desirable Sweet Ape Yacht Club (SAYC) collection.
Imitation NFTs are the sincerest form of flatteryBAYC is a collection of 10,000 bored ape collectibles living on the Ethereum blockchain.
But is selling SAYC NFTs on the platform wrong?
Observers expect more details on eBay Investor Day 2022, March 10, which will feature presentations from senior eBay execs.', '']

title: ["You Should Get Pokémon Cards Authenticated On eBay While It's ... - Screen Rant", 'Sellers Share Their Strategies on Gaining Greater Visibility on eBay - EcommerceBytes', "Shopper spots creepy warning for painting listed on eBay - as man claims it's 'cursed' - The Mirror", 'eBay has donated £150,000 to The Sun’s Ukraine Fund in aid of the Red Cross... - The Sun', 'Knockoff eBay NFTs Are Kind of Based, Actually - Futurism']
summary:
['', 'In the final installment of our Seller Satisfaction Survey: Visibility on eBay, we take a look at the third-party tools as well as the strategies sellers use to gain greater visibility on eBay.
I follow successful resellers on YouTube and try their adviceVideo tool that I use to feature product videos on eBay listings.
Some sellers indicated tried-and-trued strategies no longer worked for them and blamed eBay Promoted Listings, which boosts visibility for listings for sellers willing to pay extra.
It seems that for many sellers, eBay is not a “set it and forget it” platform.
SummaryIn part one of the survey findings, we provided information about the over 1,000 eBay sellers who participated over a 5-day period.', 'Determined to get rid of the painting once and for all, Dan is now flogging it on eBay with a starting price of $50.00 (£37).
Image: eBay) eBay) Image: eBay) eBay)Get the news you want straight to your inbox.
Dan claims that the picture initially made him think of "rebirth" but he's since changed his mind and feels the picture "only represents the ends of things".
The product description on eBay reads: "BEWARE CURSED Vintage Painting Dolls Art Creepy Eerie WARNING 1967.
Image: eBay) eBay) Image: eBay) eBay)He goes on to claim that soon after taking the painting home he hit an "epic losing streak", feeling chills, becoming unable to sleep and discovering a gruesome insect infestation in his property.', "ONLINE auction site eBay has donated £150,000 to The Sun’s Ukraine Fund, in aid of the Red Cross.
3 Online auction site eBay has donated £150,000 to The Sun’s Ukraine Fund, in aid of the Red Cross3 It comes on top of donations from you, our big-hearted readersDonate here to help Sun's fundHow to donate by text TEXT TO 70141 £3 — text SUN£3£5 — text SUN£5£10 — text SUN£10 Texts cost your chosen donation amount (e.g.
Ukrainian Red Cross teams are providing shelter, food and water for those still trapped in bombed-out towns and cities, while workers with the International Committee of the Red Cross are striving to restore water supplies and give support to medical facilities.
Your generous donations will help Red Cross workers in countries surrounding Ukraine to assist the predicted FOUR MILLION evacuees.
British Red Cross chief executive Mike Adamson said last night: “Your donations will help us reach people with food, water, medicine, medical equipment and other essentials.", 'Auction website eBay is quietly becoming a major NFT marketplace.
And, unsurprisingly, a lot of the NFTs being sold on the platform are complete scams, blockchain blog CryptoSlate reports — well, kind of.
Some of these "Bored Ape" NFTs are being sold for as much as $47 on eBay, a hefty premium considering that similar NFTs are being sold for the equivalent of just $2 on mainstream NFT marketplace OpenSea.
There's one big catch, though: many of eBay's "Bored Apes" are actually "Sweet Apes," an entirely different collection of NFTs, as CryptoSlate points out, that shamelessly knock off the real thing hook, line, and sinker.
READ MORE: “Bored Ape Yacht Club” NFTs selling on eBay for less than $50, what’s the catch?']

title: ["'Russian tanks' being sold on eBay for thousands as people flock to bid - Express", 'Chevrolet - An eBay-Bought Ferrari 458 Engine Helped Chevrolet ... - Car Throttle', "Man desperate to sell painting on eBay after previous owner warned of 'curse' - Daily Star", 'Ukrainians are selling confiscated Russian tanks on Ebay - Marca']
summary:
['Ukraine: People try to stop tanks in Chernihiv regionA number of new listings on the selling site show Russian T72 and T-14 tanks for sale with one already receiving 21 bids.
The listings ask that buyers pick up from Ukraine and say all the money goes towards helping in the crisis.
Although the listings are likely a joke, footage circulated on social media has shown Ukrainians seize Russian equipment and tanks since the conflict began eight days ago.
One Ukrainian TikToker even filmed a series of tutorials demonstrating how civilian volunteers can mobilise captured or abandoned Russian tanks.
Several Russian tanks have been listed on eBayThe corruption-fighting body urged citizens to continue fighting for their land while easing concerns about significant changes in property status".', 'In 2014, however, it seems it was a little too early in the development life of Chevrolet’s C8 Corvette Z06-bound LT6 V8 to warrant getting a whole car, so instead, engineers bought just an engine.
Specifically, a 4.5-litre V8 from a wrecked Ferrari 458 Italia.
Before Chevy created the LT6, a flat-plane V8 with a high redline was unknown territory for the company.
Points of interest in the engine included the small size of the bearings and Ferrari’s methods for isolating things like the electronics against the potentially damaging vibrations associated with a high-revving flat-plane engine.
Also, both the LT6 and F156 feature dry-sump lubrication setups, helping the engine stay nicely oiled even during hard cornering on track.', 'Sign up for the Hot Topics newsletter for hot style and sex tipsA man who collects "weird things" has revealed he's selling a "cursed" painting on eBay.
(Image: Ebay)Now in a bid to get rid of the painting, Dan is flogging it on eBay with a starting price of £37 ($50).
The product description on eBay reads: "BEWARE CURSED Vintage Painting Dolls Art Creepy Eerie WARNING 1967.
"As for the painting, it looked adorable, with two innocent-seeming dolls portrayed in it… but she was right – don't be deceived.
With this in mind, Dan hopes to sell the "cursed" painting.', 'As far as we know, Ebay has a rule that makes it illegal to sell weapons but a Russian tanks is technically a vehicle.
How much is a Russian tank going for on Ebay?
In reality, Ukrainian citizens truly have no clue of how much a Russian tanks canbe sold online.
Also, their dark, twisted sense of humor is blossoming on social media with stories like this one of putting a Russian tank for sale on Ebay.
The spoils of war are not always terrible as Ukrainians keep showing the world since this senseless invasion started.']

title: ['Chevy Corvette Z06 Engineers Bought a Ferrari 458 Engine on ... - The Drive', "Eerie warning: Man selling 'cursed' painting for Rs 3,754 on eBay claims it wrecked his life - Times Now", "Chevy Turned to eBay to Develop the Corvette's Z06 V8, Spent $25 ... - autoevolution", 'Man selling creepy painting for $50 on eBay claims it ruined his life. Read full story here - India Today', 'Fact or Fiction: eBay listing for used Russian tank seized by Ukrainians? - ABC 10 News San Diego KGTV', "I bought Elden Ring runes on eBay so you don't have to - Eurogamer.net"]
summary:
['It's no wonder General Motors' small-block engineers had to get creative when designing the new Corvette Z06's 5.5-liter, flat-plane crank V8.
Lee went on to explain that when development started on the project back in 2014, the team was most interested in what made Maranello's engines tick.
"We wanted a Ferrari 458 engine, to take a look at their components and see what they did," he specified.
However, straight-up buying a 458 only to extract its engine apparently wasn't on the table that early in the development process.
The LT6 engine from the new Z06 Corvette., ChevroletLater in the vehicle design process—once a C8 test mule was actually on the road—benchmarking of the prototype versus an actual 458 did take place.', 'The allegedly cursed painting listed for £37.
|Image courtesy: eBayKEY HIGHLIGHTS Dan Smith, the eBay seller found the painting which he claims is cursed in a flea market.
“BEWARE CURSED Vintage Painting Dolls Art Creepy Eerie WARNING 1967,” reads the description for the artwork featuring two children dolls sitting next to each other.
A man who collects “weird things” is trying to sell an allegedly cursed painting on eBay for just £37 or around Rs.
The painting features two children’s dolls sitting side by side in pink and green with very subtle swirls of light blue in a predominantly blue/green background.', 'The reason is simple, as GM had never made such a lump before, never mind one that could rev so high, so the team behind the project had to take a look at the ‘competition’ to see how they do it.
As a result, they decided to buy the engine of a Ferrari 458 , and the perfect candidate was found on eBay.“We were able to buy a wrecked car engine from Poland on eBay.
We sent them a check for something like $25,000, and we were all pretty pleased and thrilled that the engine actually did show up,” chief engineer Jordan Lee said during a presentation of the LT6, quoted by TheDrive So, where do you think they had it sent to?
Not at a secret location, but their Michigan engineering facility, and immediately started disassembling it.
Corvette’s chief engineer, Tadge Juechter, stated that they were surprised of “how small their bearings were.” From there, the team wanted to discover how Ferrari protected the ignition and electronic components from vibrations, coming up with their own solutions, though “examining engines like the [F136 – Ferrari’s 4.5L V8] was beneficial,” spokesperson Trevor Thompkins added.An early Corvette C8 prototype was benchmarked against a real Ferrari 458 that the bowtie brand bought for the R&D process, “in large part because of the engine,” said Thompkins.', 'Dan Smith was drawn to the strangeness of the painting and bought the artwork from a woman at a flea market.
By Shubhi Mishra: A man went through an eerie experience when he bought a painting from a flea market.
Dan was drawn to the strangeness of the painting and bought the artwork from a woman at a flea market.
Although the woman warned him against buying it, he chose not to listen.
“BEWARE CURSED Vintage Painting Dolls Art Creepy Eerie WARNING 1967,” reads the description of the painting on eBay.', '(KGTV) — An image going around social media claims to be an eBay listing for a used Russian tank recently seized by Ukrainians.
We searched "Russian tank" on eBay and found a whole lot of toys and models, but no actual tank.
The image used in the fake eBay listing is an actual Russian tank.
But it certainly wasn't captured recently.
The photo of the Russian T-72 tank has been circulating online for more than a decade.', "A quick look on eBay is enough to see that runes are being sold for actual, real-life money.
Runes - like souls in the Dark Souls games - are the currency of Elden Ring.
But, of course, levelling in Elden Ring isn't quite that simple.
Worse, as with all Souls games, die and you risk losing those runes if you're unable to recollect them.
Elden Ring is the most approachable Souls game and there's no one way to play it."]

title: ['Crypto donations to Ukraine top $37M, eBay eyes crypto payments ... - Cointelegraph', 'Seller Says eBay Is Overcharging Buyers for Shipping - EcommerceBytes', "Man Puts Up 'Cursed' Painting He Bought From A Flea Market On eBay - Indiatimes.com", 'New taxes make reselling side hustles more complicated: eBay seller - Business Insider']
summary:
['Top Stories This WeekCointelegraph compiled data this week for crypto donations sent to the Ukrainian government, military and charities amid the country’s ongoing conflict with Russia.
By Monday, total crypto donations to the Ukrainian government and charities linked to it had reached $37 million.
According to the group’s annual report, it processed $69.64 million in crypto donations in 2021, with roughly $12.3 million coming from NFT projects.
Also this week: Cointelegraph launches Innovation Circle — A private membership service for industry leaders[adinserter block=”1″]Winners and LosersAt the end of the week, Bitcoin (BTC) is at $40,617, Ether (ETH) at $2,667 and XRP at $0.73.
But the crypto market today has a market capitalization of about $2 trillion in round numbers, which tells you that I haven’t been right on this call.', "Dear Ina,eBay has been for the past 2 months consistently overcharging buyers for packages over a couple of lbs.
To protect yourself, a screen shot must be taken of package info you put in BEFORE listing.
After listing it mysteriously disappears.
Unfortunately this last sold item was put up before screen shots.
The big thing, even though the seller refunds the overcharged amount, eBay won't refund the fees.", 'A person has claimed that this painting had turned everything dark around him while putting it up on eBay, and listed it as 'cursed'.
According to reports, the painting was bought was from a fleaa market, and the seller has priced it at USD 96 (Rs 7,336) on eBay.
eBayThe painting features two weird dolls, “Beware cursed vintage painting dolls art creepy eerie warning 1967,” reads the title of the painting.
In its description, the seller has explained how he came about to buy the 'cursed' painting, and the effects it had on his life.
When he hung it up in his living room, he realised that the woman from the flea market was right - the painting is "cursed".', '"During that first spring, garage sales started popping up, and it seemed like good timing."
"I would go to garage sales on a Saturday and come home with a variety of items I never would have thought of," he said.
"If I were only sourcing from garage sales and thrift stores, it would take two weeks to get that much inventory," he said.
"As much as our bandwidth allows, we buy in bulk and supplement with thrift stores and garage sales because we like doing that."
I pay my taxes, and I run it like a business," Clayton said.']

title: ["Do eBay Buyers Feel Insulted by the CEO's Remarks? - EcommerceBytes"]
summary:
['At least one seller is concerned about the way eBay CEO Jamie Iannone characterizes buyers they called the lifeblood of the marketplace.
In a thread about what eBay was doing to stem the decline in buyers (and sellers and sales), the seller said they believed the CEO's remarks about "low value" buyers were insulting:"It doesn't help that current management has openly disparaged most of the sellers and buyers here saying they are low value.
Most of eBay's sales are on items $100 or less, and about half are under $30-35.
Iannone added, "I've got the whole organization pivoted to focusing on those high value buyers; buyers that are buying over $800, buying six times a year, or buyers who sell."
There's a truism that applies to online marketplaces: buyers are sellers and sellers are buyers.']

title: ['eBay Points Toward Crypto Embrace - ETFdb.com', 'Joe Exotic Condoms Are Going for More Than $1,000 on eBay - MEL Magazine', '5 Best Nissan Z Parts To Buy On eBay Motors - Motor1', '5 Best Ford F-150 Parts To Buy On eBay Motors - Motor1', 'Getting eBay Fairings for Your Motorcycle Might Be Worth It, They ... - autoevolution', 'eBay authenticates 1.5m pairs of sneakers with NFC tags - NFC World']
summary:
['However, there was some other news relevant to bitcoin and the crypto universe at large that investors might want to consider.
There’s growing speculation that eBay (NASDAQ:EBAY) could soon announce that it will accept bitcoin and other digital coins as forms of payment.
“There is ongoing speculation that eBay could announce an initiative to accept Bitcoin or other cryptocurrencies as a form of payment.
Should the e-commerce marketplace embrace bitcoin and other major cryptos, the decision could have implications for exchange traded funds, including the Valkyrie Balance Sheet Opportunities ETF (VBB ).
Even if eBay splits the difference and accepts bitcoin as payment while not holding it as an a potentially appreciating asset, VBB could benefit because in that scenario, eBay would be enhancing the bitcoin usage case.', 'The Absurdly Expensive Hunt for Joe Exotic CondomsThere are several things from the first COVID lockdown that should never exist outside of quarantine.
Twenty-six-year-old Garrett from Dallas acquired his Joe Exotic condom in 2015, when he visited the G.W.
Even before Exotic ran for Oklahoma governor, and long before Tiger King premiered, Facci knew who Exotic was.
“But I definitely laughed at myself before using it.”There were also unofficial Joe Exotic condoms, like the ones sold by London-based online retailer Firebox.
Honestly, Joe Exotic was on to one thing- putting his face on condoms is more effective birth control than abstinence.', 'With the seventh-generation Nissan Z about to launch, here are the five best parts to check out on eBay Motors for past generations of this iconic Japanese sports car.
Shop for Nissan Z performance exhaust on eBay Motors.
Shop for Nissan Z short shifter on eBay Motors.
Shop for Nissan Z brakes and suspension parts on eBay Motors.
On the outside, you can get everything from a carbon fiber bumper, hood, and spoiler, and the selection of interior carbon fiber pieces is even more vast.', 'The Ford F-150 (along with the entire F-Series lineup) has been the best-selling truck in the US for 44 years straight.
Combine these facts with how much truck owners love to customize and modify their pickups, and it isn’t surprising the market for Ford F-150 parts and accessories is so vast.
eBay Motors is the go-to source for all parts with a selection that is practically limitless, so here are the five best parts to consider for your Ford F-150.
The Ford F-150 Raptor unknowingly created a design trend that features a blacked-out grille with LED marker lights and block lettering.
Shop for F-150 tonneau covers at eBay Motors.', "As you can imagine, aftermarket fairings for motorcycles are not exactly free either, but at least they are cheaper than a set of new ones for your bike.
If you happen to own an older model sport bike, which has not been made for many years now, you have better get used to the idea of not being able to buy new fairings for it.
While his favorite suppliers for aftermarket fairings do not supply products for the KTM 390 RC , he decided to test the quality of aftermarket fairings found on eBay.He contacted a supplier from Thailand, who makes fiberglass fairings for the KTM RC , and eventually ordered a set to check it out.
As you can observe, it takes a bit of effort to install, as it is not entirely bolt-on, but it will do the job.If you cannot afford to buy aftermarket fairings for your motorcycle, try getting used ones with minor faults (such as cracks) and have them repaired by a local fiberglass specialist.
The alternative is to have a set made with molds from your bike's fairings, which will be lighter and ensure a proper fit, although they might cost a bit more than repairing cracked used fairings.", 'AUTHENTIC: eBay authenticators add NFC tags to sneakers to guarantee to buyers that they are genuineAuction site eBay has added NFC tags that enable buyers to authenticate their purchases with a tap of their smartphone to 1.5m pairs of sneakers worldwide since adding sneakers to the products eligible for its Authenticity Guarantee service in 2021.
The Authenticity Guarantee service for sneakers is currently available to eBay customers in Australia, Canada and the US for purchases of more than US$100 for new sneakers and over US$150 for pre-owned pairs.
eBay has also now expanded the service to include sneakers in both youth and grade school sizes, Ragtrader reports.
“eBay’s Authenticity Guarantee is a service designed to protect sellers and allow buyers to shop with confidence,” eBay says.
“Finally, an eBay Authenticity Guarantee tag will be attached and programmed with the unique details of the shoes.”eBay UK added NFC-enabled authenticity guarantees for pre-owned luxury watches in November 2021.']

title: ["eBay to remove items that express support for Russia's Vladimir Putin - Business Insider", "The Batman Collectibles: An eBay Buyer's Guide - Den of Geek", 'Podcast Episode 21: eBay director shares more details on local ... - Appliance Retailer', 'Fact-checking if Ukrainians are selling used Russian tanks on eBay - NewsWest9.com', 'Elden Ring: Players are selling millions of Runes on eBay - GIVEMESPORT', "I'm an eBay Sleuth—Here's How I Find the Coolest Fashion Items on ... - Who What Wear"]
summary:
['eBay says will remove any items that express support for Russian President Vladimir Putin .
says will remove any items that express support for Russian President Vladimir .
AdvertisementOnline retailer eBay told Insider on Tuesday that it will remove items that express support for Vladimir Putin after the Russian president ordered his country's military to invade Ukraine .
Accordingly, "merchandise that may indicate support for Vladimir Putin is prohibited on eBay."
But that hasn't stopped it from listing items that express support for dictators, such as Syria's Bashar al-Assad.', 'Compared to the high-end books, The Long Halloween is a steal under $100.
Don’t expect it to hang around that low for long, though—if this movie is a hit, this book will catch fire.
In the face of a serial killer brutalizing Gotham’s underworld, Batman is forced to work with Joe Chill to stop him.
3 – Batman: EgoThe late Darwyn Cooke is one of the best people to ever make comics, and one of the finest artists to ever work in the medium.
For High-End CollectorsEveryone knows Action Comics #1 or Detective Comics #27 is going to pull in some cash.', 'In episode 21 of the Appliance Retailer Podcast, we speak to Hayat Horma, director of shipping at eBay Australia about eBay’s new local fulfilment program in partnership with global logistics experts, Orange Connex.
She discusses the key benefits of the program including faster delivery, more competitive rates, enhanced seller protection and full eBay integrations.
Hayat then shares her thoughts on the shipping landscape, the importance of returns as part of delivering a truly seamless e-commerce experience and the increasing adoption of Buy Now, Pay Later.', 'Next up in 5Example video title will go here for this video', '', "In the grand scheme of secondhand shopping and online shopping in general, eBay tends to be my last resort.
Only if I'm particularly desperate do I turn to eBay.
She's a pro at sourcing the best fashion finds on the site, and one look at the collection of designer items she's amassed—from Prada heels to a matching Pleats Please Issey Miyake set—tells you all you need to know.
And who among us wouldn't want to score their most coveted wish-list items at unthinkable discounts?
Ahead, Reilly is sharing her insider knowledge for uncovering the very best finds, so get ready to roll up your sleeves and dive into the world of eBay."]

title: ['Fact check: Russian tanks not for sale on eBay, company says - USA TODAY', 'The battle of the resale site: will eBay, Depop or Asos emerge ... - Retail Gazette', 'Skin Whitening Creams Containing High Levels of Mercury Sold on ... - Happi', 'Putin piggyback suit on eBay for £35 could be most offensive party outfit ever - Daily Star']
summary:
['A Facebook post shared March 2 shows an image of what appears to be an eBay listing.
The purported listing has an image of an apparent Russian T-72 tank that is "fully functional" and "used."
USA TODAY found a listing that claims to advertise a Russian T-72 tank, but Somera said the product was a toy.
Fact check roundup: What's true and what's false about the Russian invasion of UkraineThe image in the post shows a Russian T-72 tank, but it was not taken in last month's invasion of Ukraine.
A company spokesperson told USA TODAY the listing is fake.', '“The pre-owned clothing market has shifted from charity shops and thrifting, to online retail and resale platforms,” he says.
Add to that the many brands, from Levi’s to Adidas to PrettyLittleThing, that are launching their own resale sites and eBay has got stiff competition for its resale crown.
Hedges explains that younger adults are already starting to expand the list of second-hand sites they use.
GlobalData apparel analyst Pippa Stephens agrees that despite the recent surge in popularity of fashion-specific resale platforms, eBay is still the most favoured online resale site, according to GlobalData’s latest monthly consumer survey.
With the resale market predicted to grow so rapidly over the next decade, the battle to win market share will be hotly contended.', 'Skin whitening products containing high levels of mercury continue to be sold on the world's biggest e-commerce platforms, including websites run by eBay, Amazon and Alibaba, according to a study by Zero Mercury Working Group (ZMWG).
ZMWG purchased and tested 271 skin lightening products from more than 40 e-commerce sites in 17 countries across Europe, Asia, Africa and the Americas.
Of these, 129 products in 16 countries were found to have high levels of mercury and were being sold on more than 30 different sites.
"When we started looking at these products online, there was such widespread use," said Michael Bender, executive director of the Mercury Policy Project and a coordinator for ZMWG.
All but La Tia Mana had been identified in previous ZMWG reports but continue to contain high levels of mercury and be available online, according to the latest report.', 'A Vladimir Putin piggyback fancy dress costume may just be the most offensive party outfit ever.
(Image: Ebay)Beneath the item on both eBay and BargainFox.com reads: "Fetch your rifle and take a ride on our piggyback Vladimir Putin costume and create the illusion of being carried around on this Russian leaders shoulders!
"Our funny piggyback Vladimir Putin suit comes with attached and stuffed fake human legs, an elasticated waist and a corded belt so you can adjust it as necessary.
Following an approach for comment by the Daily Star however the Pembrokeshire based company has decided to discontinue sales of the costume.
Di Di who sells arts and crafts on Etsy under the name BadCherrybyDD, told the Daily Star that Putin is already proving popular with 150 dolls sold.']

title: ['EBay expects revenue growth of up to 6% in 2023, launches digital ... - Reuters', 'Oxfam gets eBay boost with major marketplace update - Charged Retail', 'Score this sleek red baking stand mixer for 50% off on eBay - SFGATE']
summary:
['March 10 (Reuters) - E-commerce company eBay Inc (EBAY.O) said on Thursday it expects revenue to grow between 5% and 6% in fiscal 2023, and launched its first digital wallet.
Analysts polled by Refinitiv estimated 2023 revenue of $10.95 billion, which indicates a growth of 5.5%.
The company also launched eBay Vault, a digital marketplace and storage facility for trading cards and collectibles, which is expected to launch in the United States in the next quarter.
The company expects adjusted profit to rise about 10% in 2023, it said at its investor day.
For fiscal 2024, eBay forecast revenue to grow in the range of 7% to 8%, and adjusted profit to rise about 15%.', 'Oxfam has boosted its online focus by streamlining its operations across online marketplaces including eBay, Shopify, Etsy and ShipEngine.
The new fully integrated software will help Oxfam centralise its activity across the ecommerce marketplaces and grow online sales by reaching a wider audience, selling items faster and at a higher price.
Having a single presence in each marketplace will also allow the charity to build up its feedback profile and maintain relationships with existing customers.
The trial will begin in Oxfam’s two major processing centres in April and some shops in May.
It is a great privilege to not only support Oxfam in helping to fund their vital work, but also to enable more reuse and less landfill.”', 'eBayKitchenAids look incredible on the counter, to be sure, but for us amateur bakers, dropping upwards of $200 on a mixer isn’t really something that jives with our budget.
Instead, check out Geek Chef’s lookalike stand mixer, which comes in a cherry red and rings up right now at just $64.34.
Usually ringing up at $130.99, the Geek Chef stand mixer is perfect for a range of baking projects, from pizza to bread, cookies, and crepes.
It comes with everything you need to get started, too, including a beater, dough hook, and balloon whisk that’ll tackle whatever recipe you’re starting down.']

title: ["eBay Digital Wallet: What's In It for Sellers? - EcommerceBytes", 'eBay to Allow Wire Transfers for Certain Payments - EcommerceBytes', 'Fake Posts On Ukrainians Selling Russian Tank On eBay Go Viral | BOOM - BOOM', 'Dangerous levels of mercury found in skin creams sold on Amazon ... - Environmental Working Group', 'How eBay plans to double its advertising revenue to $2bn by 2025 ... - Charged Retail', 'Diamond ring made from ranch dressing — no, really — sparks furious eBay bidding war - New York Post', 'Pick up an Xbox Series S bundle for $270 from eBay - Manistee News Advocate']
summary:
['Sellers will be able to pay for selling expenses using the eBay Digital Wallet that was announced at yesterday's Investor Day.
And eBay is giving sellers more options in how they receive payouts, promising faster payout options and new payout providers.
Loeger told analysts that with the eBay Digital Wallet, "earnings will be available almost immediately."
- With the eBay Digital Wallet, sellers will be able to use proceeds from their sales to fund eBay purchases.
Let us know what you think of the eBay digital wallet from the seller point of view.', 'eBay will soon allow buyers to make wire transfers to pay for certain types of goods, according to the company’s Chief Growth Officer Julie Loeger.
Loeger said eBay was improving the experience for buyers by offering additional choices for high-ASP transactions (Average Selling Price).
For the first time, eBay will offer more payment solutions such as wire transfers and split payments.
“All these customers will soon have more payment options to choose from,” she said.
And eBay is working to expand payment options even further.', 'An image that appears to show an eBay listing for a Russian tank has been shared tens of thousands of times on social media alongside a claim Ukrainians are selling armoured combat vehicles after seizing them.
The post features an image that appears to show an eBay listing for a "used Russian T-72 tank" alongside a caption claiming "Ukrainians are selling used Russian Tanks on eBay".
The image circulated online after reports of Ukrainians capturing Russian weapons in the wake of a Putin-led invasion of the former Soviet country.
An eBay spokesperson told AFP in a March 10 email the image does not show a genuine ad found on eBay.
The eBay website states here the sale of military items on the platform is "restricted" to surplus items like body armour, but "explosives and military ordnance aren't allowed on eBay".', 'WASHINGTON – A new report from the Zero Mercury Working Group finds almost half of skin lightening creams tested contained dangerously high levels of mercury but continue to be sold by online retailers like Amazon, eBay and Flipkart.
Of the skin creams tested, 129 products had mercury levels over 1 part per million, or ppm.
Cosmetics with mercury are often marketed as skin lightening creams and anti-aging treatments that remove age spots, freckles, blemishes and wrinkles.
Global Industry Analysts, Inc., estimates the global market for skin lightening creams is $8.8 billion in 2022 and projected to grow to $11.8 billion by 2026.
Most of the skin creams tested were manufactured in Asia, especially in Pakistan, Thailand, China and Taiwan.', 'Ecommerce giant eBay is planning on doubling its advertising revenue to $2 billion by 2025, according to Alex Kazim, the company’s head of global advertising, on its investor day.
The plans include a strategy to roll out an ad format for brands to drive traffic to virtual storefronts.
The ecommerce marketplace made $1 billion from advertising revenue in 2021 and Kazim is hoping that the revenue stream will eventually make up 3% of all transactions on its platform.
If achieved, the $2 billion goal would put eBay’s ad revenue on par with Walmart’s $2.1 billion it reported in 2021.
The key format behind eBay’s advertising business is something it calls Promoted Listings Standard which charges sellers a fee based on a percentage of sales.', 'Hidden Valley has created a manmade diamond out of its famous ranch seasoning, and the novelty jewel is now up for sale on eBay.
And graphite is what’s needed to go inside the diamond press in order to transform it into a diamond,” the geologist explained.
The jewel was subsequently polished to perfection before being set in a white-gold band with the initials HVR LVR — for “Hidden Valley Ranch Lover” — engraved on the side.
In this case, we’ve created the Hidden Valley Ranch diamond in five months,’ VandenBiesen stated.
The company has now put the diamond up for auction on eBay, sparking a furious bidding war between ranch lovers.', 'If you’ve been thinking about getting an Xbox or wanting to upgrade to an all-digital 512GB Series S, now’s the perfect time to do so.
Why is the Xbox Series S so great?
The Series S is the smallest, sleekest, lightest, and fastest Xbox ever made, that’s why!
The 512 GB SSD allows the Series S to load games faster while also being able to play games on ultra-high graphics settings.
Head on over to eBay today and grab your own Xbox Series S bundle today before the deal comes to an end!']

title: ['£100 picture found hidden in charity shop - Kent Online', 'Glitch Strikes as eBay Preps New Messaging Platform - EcommerceBytes']
summary:
['A chance find in a charity shop has led to a picture by a 19th century Hungarian painter being sold to a collector in his homeland.
Jan D'Arcy went shopping at the Barnardo's store in New Street, Ashford, looking for a picture frame she could remove the glass from to repair another framed work.
Ms D'Arcy said: "It was very exciting to discover the origins of the picture.
Sophie Denne, Barnardo’s store manager said: "We are delighted that Ms D'Arcy was able to purchase what she needed from the store and in doing so made such a terrific find.
Barnardo’s store manager Sophie Denne, left, accepting the £110 donation from customer Jan D’Arcy"We are extremely grateful to Ms D'Arcy for donating the money from the picture back to Barnardo's.', 'eBay is building a new messaging platform and will launch it in the Spring, it announced on Thursday.
“eBay messaging system has been broken for 2 weeks at least and eBay rep is saying the possible fix date is the month of MAY,” a reader told EcommerceBytes.
The reader said it’s crucial for eBay to include a link to the listing in the buyer’s message.
It used to be that the item they were sending a question about would be linked under the message.
Just a sec, I’ll send you an offer with the updated total.”Source: eBay Investor Day slide']

title: ['EBay creates digital wallet, plans storage vault for collectibles - Retail Dive', 'eBay Expands Coupon Feature for Stores - EcommerceBytes', 'Following eBay Policy to a T Still Fraught with Peril - EcommerceBytes', '5 new eBay scams every buyer and seller needs to know about - Komando', 'EBay ranked best retail media network by ad buyers - AdAge.com']
summary:
['The company also announced the forthcoming launch of the eBay Vault, a storage facility and digital marketplace for trading cards and other collectibles.
Dive Insight:With the eBay Vault, the veteran e-commerce platform is building upon its previous efforts to foster greater trust in its marketplace.
In October 2020, the company announced that it would enlist third-party experts to authenticate shoes sold for more than $100 as part of its Authenticity Guarantee initiative.
The retailers said that the law would disincentivize the sale of stolen goods on online marketplaces.
After initial opposition, eBay also endorsed the bill, along with some other e-commerce marketplaces.', 'eBay announced today it has expanded its coupon feature for Stores.
Since launch, sellers have been able to show coupon codes publicly on eBay.com or share them privately – and they can send a printed coupon codes inside orders to encourage repeat purchases.
Flexibility: Buyer groups give you more control and flexibility to offer discounts without lowering the item’s price.
Open up new opportunities: Define category-specific buyer groups to use when your seasonal inventory has the most potential to sell.
In the future, you’ll see additional reporting capabilities that you’ll be able to use to measure the success of your campaigns.”The following YouTube video explains how coded coupons work on eBay.', 'I typed "adult" and selected "Adult items policy."
For example, on this currently listed item, we drew a "bra" on the model.
We felt very confident that we were within the guidelines of eBay's very clearly written policy.
The email stated that one of our Playboy listings was removed because it didn't follow the restricted adult items policy.
I won't relist on eBay without written permission from eBay but feel frustrated that we worked so hard to follow the written policy very carefully and still were unfairly punished.', 'While phishing remains an effective attack method, online e-commerce websites like eBay are lucrative hunting grounds.
It might take a bit more time than a typical online scam, but criminals often try to trick more than one victim simultaneously to maximize their ill-gotten profit.
Read on for the most common scams on the e-commerce platform and what you can do to stay safe.
The most common hustle on eBay is seller fraud, which comes in various forms.
It’s getting a lot easier on eBaySix online auction websites to try if you love buying and selling on eBay', 'Despite all the newer retail media networks popping up, it’s one of the more established players that is resonating with advertisers.
In its first benchmark report of U.S. retail media networks, eMarketer ranked eBay Ads as the best overall performer.
The ranking was developed from how a group of 145 ad buyers viewed major retail media networks based on key attributes such as traffic, first-party data, return on ad spend, and ease of use of the platform.
The report also looked at the media networks of retailers including Amazon, Kroger, Best Buy and Macy’s.
“It’s easy to forget eBay Ads has been around for a while,” said Andrew Lipsman, principal analyst of Insider Intelligence at eMarketer.']

title: ['Ms Marvel #5 Second Print Embiggens On eBay After Trailer Drops - Bleeding Cool News', 'EBay, Of All Places, Is the Best Place to Cop Your First Designer Bag - InsideHook', 'eBay and Klarna partner to bring flexible payment options to Germany - AltFi']
summary:
['', 'Nota bene: If you buy through the links in this article, we may earn a small share of the profits.
There’s no question about it: the perfect designer bag is hard to find.
From the largest monogrammed duffle to the smallest calfskin cardholder, a luxury leather bag tops our accessory list every time.
These two seemingly opposing dogmas (the “good luxury bag” scarcity principle and the “must have a good luxury bag” decree) seem irreconcilable.
Gucci GG X-Large Duffle Travel Bag Monogram CanvasLouis Vuitton Pallas Compact Monogram Canvas and Calfskin WalletPrada Saffiano Black Business BagSaint Laurent Brown Monogram Briefcase Travel Shoulder BagValentino VLTN Men’s Backpack', 'Digital BankingeBay and Klarna are partnering to bring additional flexible payment options to German shoppers.
In a potential blow to PayPal, eBay is partnering with Klarna to bring new flexible payment options to German shoppers.
The two new Klarna payment options being added to eBay.de will supplement the existing payment methods, which include Klarna’s Pay Now service (Sofortüberweisung).
Customers will now also be able to access Pay Later (Invoice) and Financing, giving them several options to choose from on every purchase, whether that’s paying immediately or at a later time.
The roll-out of both options is being phased in, starting with select sellers over the coming weeks and following with a wider roll-out later this year.']

title: ['New USPS Surcharge Fees Apply to eBay and Etsy Sellers - EcommerceBytes', 'eBay taps Klarna to bring more flexible payment options in Germany - The Paypers', 'Unbundling eBay - Marketplace Pulse', 'Did eBay Renege on Pledge to Refund Fees for Canceled Orders? - EcommerceBytes', 'Met Police forensics worker admits stealing cameras to sell on eBay - Evening Standard']
summary:
['The USPS is instituting stiff new surcharge fees on April 3rd that will devastate sellers of certain types of goods.
eBay and Etsy sellers who had held out hope the marketplaces would be able to negotiate a deal with the Postal Service to exempt their packages got bad news this monthEtsy informed sellers today about the new fees, and an eBay moderator finally confirmed on March 10 in a follow-up in the Weekly Chat that the fees would indeed apply to eBay sellers who purchase shipping labels through the marketplace.
As we reported in December, the USPS delayed the surcharge fees temporarily after shippers found them buried in its 2022 rate-hike schedule released in November.
It’s possible eBay made an announcement on the boards, but there’s been no alert on its Seller Announcement Board as of today.
Despite wishful thinking, marketplace sellers will have to pay the surcharge fees for nonstandard fees if they continue to use USPS.', 'OKFor optimum operation, this website makes use of cookies.
For more information click here', 'Hundreds of companies took a category on eBay and improved selection, experience, or business model.
During eBay Investor Day 2022 event, Steve Priest, Chief Financial Officer at eBay, shared a slide that eBay’s vertical competitors like StockX, Etsy, Wish, Farfetch, and fifteen more combined are smaller than eBay.
Justine Moore, of a venture firm CRV, found over a hundred companies that had verticalized eBay categories in 2018.
The clothing app figured out how to connect Chinese garment factories to shoppers in the West better than Amazon, eBay, Wish, and even stores like H&M.
Many of the same factories were sellers on Amazon, eBay, and Wish.', 'When eBay announced a fee increase last month that took effect on March 1, it softened the blow with some good news : it would begin providing prorated Final Value Fee credits for partial refunds starting in May.
eBay also said it would provide a 100% final value fee credit, including the 30-cent per-order fee, when sellers approved buyer cancellation requests, effective March 1st.
But sellers say eBay is not fulfilling its promise.
They began right on time March 1 charging the .3 final value fee increase on the variable portion, they didn't miss that part of the update."
But you have to go back to February to learn there is a loophole in the policy that lets eBay out of its promise to refund the 30-cent fee.', 'A Metropolitan Police forensic specialist has admitted stealing cameras from work to sell on eBay as he battled debts worth £16,000.
Three cameras were found at his home by investigators, while a trawl of Brinklow’s eBay account revealed the sale of a Nikon D700 digital camera and two lenses.
“Mr Brinklow was at the time working with the Metropolitan Police Service within the forensics unit”, said prosecutor David Burns.
“His colleagues became suspicious as Mr Brinklow received a number of packages through work.
“He feels he has let everyone down, let himself down, let his wife down, and let his colleagues down”, said Brinklow’s solicitor.']

title: ['Bizarre harassment of Natick couple by eBay was ‘clearly criminal ... - The Boston Globe', 'GPU prices continue to crash as average board price on eBay falls ... - Notebookcheck.net', "Improving eBay's Development Velocity - InfoQ.com", "eBay's most profitable items to sell and make money - Wales Online", 'Best Of The eBay Brand Outlet: Top Spring/Summer Trends - Refinery29', 'eBay Australia Offers Sellers $200 Off Retail Fest 2022 Ticket Price - eSeller365']
summary:
['But they told lawyers in the US attorney’s office in Boston that the government should not charge eBay itself with criminal misconduct.
AdvertisementThe March 2021 meeting took place after federal prosecutors had already charged seven former eBay employees with criminal cyberstalking and witness tampering, and five of them had pleaded guilty.
Baugh “hand-picked people he thought he could control from different teams within the unit,” eBay said in its 2021 presentation.
The 2021 presentation also shed new light on the actions of eBay’s former top executives during and after the harassment campaign against the Steiners.
But his words were extremely reckless and irresponsible.”AdvertisementIn one text message included in the criminal case, Wymer told Baugh of Ina Steiner: “I want her DONE.', "GPU prices on eBay have dropped almost 9% in the first two weeks of March 2022 according to Tom's Hardware.
4 ReviewsTom’s Hardware’s analysis of GPU prices for the first two weeks of March 2022 has revealed that eBay prices for both Nvidia and AMD GPUs are plummeting fast.
According to the site, eBay listings show a 25% reduction in average GPU prices since December 2021.
However, even with the current price drops, GPU prices remain inflated, coming in at 68% above MSRP for Nvidia and 45% for AMD.
For instance, RTX 2080 Ti’s average eBay pricing depreciated by 4.2%, resulting in an average selling price of US$935.", "Turning this around and improving our velocity is going to be a huge advantage for us.
It was really just this joint effort across the horizontals and verticals that I think have really made these things work well.
We have separate organizations, my organization, Randy's organization, and in the past those platform and applications team didn't really work that closely, or iteratively.
That's really worked well.
I think that's been just instrumental and just making sure we understand what's going on in each other's worlds.", 'Top of the table, watches were the biggest earners for eBay sellers, with £249.4 million grossed from the sales of 5.7 million items between 2021 and February this year - £43.6 million grossed from Rolex sales alone.
A roll of fabric sells for an average price of £17.01, with 92 per cent of rolls sold classed as ‘new’.
Women’s dresses generated £84.1 million from nearly seven million sales at an average price of £12.45, with just over half in new condition.
Men’s t-shirts made £42million from 3.7 million individual sales at an average price of £11.13, with 84 per cent ‘new’.
Media and Electronics also featured in the top 10, with DVDs (£65.6 million) and headphones (£63.7 million) generating 6.8 million and 2.1 million sales, respectively.', 'At Refinery29, we’re here to help you navigate this overwhelming world of stuff.
All of our market picks are independently selected and curated by us.
All product details reflect the price and availability at the time of publication.
If you buy or click on something we link to on our site, we may earn a commission.', 'eBay Australia has today announced that they will be the community sponsor of the upcoming Retail Fest 2022 at the Gold Coast Conference and Exhibition center from the 11th to the 14th of April 2022.
Don’t MissAs the community sponsor, eBay is offering their sellers an exclusive discount code which will give them a huge $200 off the normal ticket price of attending the Retail Global Conference at Retail Fest 2022.
You can see the direct announcement from eBay Australia regarding Retail Fest 2022 below.
Meet eBay at Retail Fest 2022“This year the eBay team will again be heading up to the Gold Coast to attend Retail Fest 2022.
As we’re the community sponsor of this year’s event, you can get $200 off your tickets to Retail Fest with the discount code EBAY200.']

title: ['Steam Deck prices reach $3000 on eBay - TechSpot', 'Couple transform dull and old bathroom for £550 using Gumtree and eBay to save thousands - My London', 'Steam Deck Scalpers Are Charging Outrageous Prices On Ebay Because Of Course - Hot Hardware', '16 most popular items bought on eBay last year and how to make a ... - inews']
summary:
["When something is experiencing short supply and high demand, you can almost guarantee it'll appear on eBay at prices way above the MSRP.
So, it should come as little surprise to learn that the auction site is awash with Steam Decks, the most expensive of which reaches $3,000, or almost five times the normal selling price.
PCMag reports that there are tons of Steam Decks on the site going for obscene amounts.
Checking the Steam Deck eBay listings, it appears that the most expensive in-hand unit---as in, not still on pre-order---is up for $1,799 (+$70 shipping) for a 256GB variant.
Most eBay sellers don't even have their Steam Decks; they're just selling the pre-order confirmations.", 'I bought a drawer unit from Gumtree for £40, replaced the handIes with copper pipes and fittings from B&Q and painted them black.
I bought a quarry cast bath from Gumtree for £150, which was sanded and polished.
I also bought a freestanding bath tap from Amazon for £140, and a sink tap for £25 from ebay.
I used old parquet floor tiles as wall tiles from Gumtree, and they were free.
“They have saved an absolute fortune by doing all the labour themselves, not to mention the ingenious Gumtree upcycling.', 'Scalpers have been making out like gangbusters during the silicon shortage by selling things like graphics cards and game consoles at high markups on eBay.
You can add Valve's recently released Steam Deck to the pile.
That's not a new develop, but now that Steam Decks are out in the wild, scalpers are cashing in with "in-hand" listings at obscene prices.
And looking at current listings, scalpers are optimistic they can score a huge payday on in-hand Steam Deck consoles.
The first few listings that pop up having 'Buy It Now' or high bid prices of $1,399 or higher.', 'Below, are the top 16 items sold on eBay and the most money made from a one-off purchase in each category.
The top grossing product overall was the RoadHog E-Bike which usually retails for hundreds of pounds.
Hex Dumbbells were the top grossing whilst the most expensive sold were a Jordan Dumbbell Set for £3,651.66.
DVDsMedia and electronics also featured in the top 10, with DVDs generating 6.8 million sales totalling £65.6m.
Unbranded computer and gaming chairs made up the bulk of sales whilst the most expensive items bought were Fully Restored Ralph Lauren Cigar Brown Leather Dining Chairs for £12,619.88.']

The eBay authenticity program is supposed to cure this problem, at least for high-value and luxury goods, by having a third party (eBay or a vendor) confirm authenticity and condition.
eBay originally reported 183 million active buyers at the end of Q4 2019, which included StubHub (~9 million) and its Korean operations (~20 million).', 'Fashion Flair – run by husband and wife duo Adewumi and Samuel Akinyotu - now sells second-hand and new clothing and shoes from high street and designer brands.
Image: Fashion Flair) Fashion Flair)So she began renovating and listing used fashion online, and made her first sale in May 2012.
Image: Fashion Flair) Fashion Flair)"Then it will keep multiplying.
Her husband Samuel was the main photographer for Fashion Flair, but has gone back to teaching, while two of her sons help with packaging and storage.
Last year the firm won the family business award category at the eBay for Business Awards.', 'Online marketplace eBay.co.uk is the ‘worst’ UK ecommerce site for carbon emissions, generating three times more CO2 than Amazon.co.uk, according to the latest data from Banc Digital.
eBay.co.uk was found to be the worst emitter across the UK, generating 907.8 tonnes of CO2 per month in the UK alone.
Banc Digital’s report revealed that businesses can generate carbon emissions from performing even the simplest tasks, ranging from Zoom calling to sending emails.
Websites can also carry a large carbon footprint if they have a lot of large files and high definition videos.
How to reduce the carbon footprint of your websiteThe analysis also includes tips on reducing the carbon footprint of a website.', 'The favorite holiday among sneakerheads, Air Max Day, is just a few days away.
What’s more, eBay said Air Max sales saw a spike last year around Air Max Day.
Following the Air Max 2090 and the Air Max 90 was the Vapormax (76%), the Air Max 1 (72%) and the Air Max 95 (69%).
The most popular styles include the Patta x Nike Air Max 1 Waves collab, the Air Max 1 Ultra 2.0 “Air Max Day,” the Concepts x Air Max 1 collabs and the Parra x Air Max 1.
Also, the sought-after Air Max 90 “Bacon” and the Air Max Pre-Day made the list.', 'If you watched the 2022 Indianapolis Supercross—or own a social media account—you probably saw the mid-race fight between Alex Ray and Deven Raper following a collision between the two in the second heat race.
They were getting up, but then Theodore “Bubba” Pauli accidentally ran over Ray’s bike and into Ray himself.
Then Raper and Ray exchange words and get into a brawl.
If you live under a rock, you can watch it below.', 'East Anglia’s Children’s Hospices (EACH) has 44 bricks and mortar shops across the region, including one in North Road, Clacton.
But the charity would love to hear from anyone interested in helping in the store there, by going through donations, spotting sellable items and listing them on eBay and Amazon.
The role would involve taking pictures of items and sending them to EACH’s ecommerce base in Thetford.
Clacton shop manager Nigel Entwistle said: “Selling goods online has become a big and fast-growing income stream for EACH.
“We’d love some extra help and, ideally, would like to find two dedicated eBay volunteers and another two to help on the Amazon front.']

title: ['Can an eBay User Transfer Account to New Country? - EcommerceBytes', 'eBay Buyer Slandered Seller in Feedback Left for Other People - EcommerceBytes', 'eBay, Next and Twitch: the sites generating the most CO2 when in use - InternetRetailing', 'Eyeing Growth, NFT Publisher Taps Former Google, eBay Lawyer ... - Law.com']
summary:
["Dear Ina,I opened an eBay account 13+ years back when I was a student in the USA.
Back then, eBay nor PayPal had any issues with foreigners opening accounts with them and so I did.
Due to eBay and PayPal breaking up and eBay enacting new policies, I am now not able to sell on eBay anymore as I am not a US citizen, nor resident, nor I live there.
Is there anyway that you guys could help or help redirect me to someone who could?
All I'm asking is to be able to speak or write to someone who could verify that I am the owner of the USA account and follow up with me as I create my new eBay account and transfer my feedback over to there.", 'Dear Ina,eBay has allowed a buyer whose "exit scam" attempt failed when he tried it on us.
He left wacky negative feedback as "revenge", and eBay DID remove that.
However, he also left feedback for 3 other sellers stating our username and slandering us.
So does eBay now allow an 'anything goes' feedback statement to be made WITHIN the expanded field now?
The buyer, BTW, leaves negatives for any seller who doesn't play his "partial refund" game, as is a common scam for buyers.', 'Web design agency Banc has assessed just how much energy leading websites generate when being used and found that eBay is the UK site with the highest monthly emissions, producing 907.8 tonnes of CO2 every month.
Despite it receiving more site traffic each month (some 282 million), Amazon UK generates fewer CO2 emissions than eBay.
eBay US is also the ecommerce site generating the most emissions monthly worldwide (1430.3 CO2 tonnes per months, roughly equivalent to 127,460 gallons of diesel being consumed, while Macy’s is the world’s highest emitting fashion site, generating 276.9 tonnes of CO2 monthly.
BBC Good Food was the worst offender for food websites, producing the highest emissions (58.8 CO2 tonnes) and Twitch was the gaming site with the highest emissions both in the UK and the world, creating 140.4 CO2 tonnes per month in the UK and 3,444.8 CO2 tonnes worldwide.
In fact, Twitch’s is that popular its CO2 tonne emissions were over double the emissions of Steam Community, the UK’s second highest gaming site.', 'Concept Art House, a San Francisco-based content developer and publisher of video game art and nonfungible tokens, has tapped a former Google and eBay lawyer as its first general counsel, the company announced Wednesday.
Najeeb Kudiya joins as part of a cohort of new executive hires, which includes a chief of staff to CEO James Zhang, chief technology officer, vice president of human resources, chief business officer, vice president of marketing, and senior vice president of product.']

How to Make an eBay Synchrony Bank Credit Card PaymentThere are several options to make an eBay credit card payment.', 'Ecommerce giant ﻿eBay﻿ has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with Madhya Pradesh Industrial Development Corporation Limited (MPIDC) to enable local micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs) to launch their online export businesses via eBay marketplace websites.
As part of this initiative, eBay will help Madhya Pradesh based small businesses with the sign-up processes as well as other onboarding procedures.
Additionally, the ecommerce brand will also conduct training, webinars, and workshops to educate and enable MSMEs do grow their business and enhance their scalability.
The MoU was signed in the presence of Rajvardhan Singh Dattigaon, Minister of Industry Policy and Investment Promotion, Government of Madhya Pradesh.
"Our partnership with eBay India will benefit thousands of small businesses and industries to provide a boost to the growth of local industries and artisans, accelerating socio-economic development and the digitalization of MSMEs in the state.', 'Additional eBay Selling Fees to ConsiderIn addition to the standard fees that come with many listings and accounts, sellers can opt for certain upgrade fees to increase visibility or access extra features.
But there are eBay fee calculator options, including those from Final Fee Calculator and Wise.
Set item prices: eBay final value fees are charged as a percentage of the purchase price.
So either build it into your prices, or add shipping separately before determining final value fees.
eBay Selling Fees ExampleFor an individual seller listing vinyl records on eBay, the final value fee for a $30 listing would come to $4.17, since that is 12.9 percent of the sale, plus $0.30.']

One morning looking at my shipping dashboard, there was a note saying the item was un-deliverable and was being returned to me.
I informed him I could not, but I would refund him and he could re buy it and correct his address.
The buyer never re-purchased the item, but did leave negative feedback.
I went thru the new eBay feedback removal system, gave the tracking number, and the information of what the buyer wanted me to do...12 hours later, the negative feedback was gone and I blocked the buyer.', '', 'Many a sneakerhead dreams of a world where limited-edition Dunks and Aime Leon Dore collabs sit on the shelves of their local Footlocker for weeks after release.
With many a savvy shopper making a pretty penny from buying with the intention to sell for a profit, the resale market is at an all-time high.
A market leader in this particular shopping sphere, eBay predicts the sneaker resale market could be valued at as much as £4.3 billion by 2025, with a pair of sneakers selling every 9 seconds on its marketplace in 2020.
Similar to its competitors, its Authenticity Guarantee programme outsources the vetting process of any shoe sold for more than £150 to an independent team of industry experts, Sneaker Con.
With hyped, box-fresh releases from Nike to New Balance available, the resale market is increasingly becoming the first port of call for those who can’t keep up with a relentless sneaker release calendar.', 'Belair also won’t be selling Lynch’s hair on eBay.

summary:
['An eBay seller who uses the CrazyLister listing tool filed an Ecommerce EKG alert yesterday reporting the service had been down for 5 days due to an eBay API problem.
CrazyLister documented the ongoing problem on its website:As of the first week of April, there is an ongoing issue with eBay that is affecting the ability of users to:Publish listingsApply templatesRevise listingsConnecting / Removing eBay accountsOur team is in communication with eBay for a resolution, yet at this time we do not yet have an ETA.
CrazyLister said sellers must post listings directly on the eBay platform until the problem is resolved.
Sellers use a host of third-party tools to help them sell on eBay, including CrazyLister (you can see the results published on EcommerceBytes).
You can report any issues you’re experiencing with third-party eBay tools in the comments below and through the Ecommerce EKG website.', '', 'When Leigh Capel, the director of Belle Epoque Fine Art, searched on eBay for portraits to display in his Sydney gallery last September, he came across an interesting piece.
As it turns out, the piece of art he purchased on eBay is a genuine piece of priceless artifact stolen from The Briars historic homestead in Mount Martha in 2014.
After receiving the artifact from Capel, the gallery confirmed it was the stolen piece and now as put it back on public display.
eBay Prohibits Stolen Items to Be Offered for SaleeBay prohibits sellers from listing stolen items on its marketplace.
Items stolen from the late Broncos wide receiver Demaryius Thomas were sold on eBay earlier this year by a seller that just opened an account and with zero feedback.', 'But, have you ever taken a moment to ask yourself what the ‘e’ in eBay actually stands for?
Formerly called AuctionWeb, there is a reason why the site’s founder decided to call the company eBay.
Photo by Justin Sullivan/Getty ImagesWhat does e in eBay stand for?
The letter ‘e’ in eBay stands for Echo.
The company was then named eBay, a shorter version of EchoBay.']

title: ['Why Consumers Buy and Sell Used Goods on eBay - EcommerceBytes', 'What does the e in eBay stand for?... - The US Sun']
summary:
['Consumers buy and sell used goods on eBay (“pre-owned” items) primarily for financial reasons, but sustainability is also important, according to eBay’s second annual Recommerce Report.
48% said they now sell more pre-owned goods than in the last several years.
eBay surveyed nearly 4,500 “consumer-to-consumer” sellers in the US, UK, Canada, Germany, France, Italy, and Australia in October 2021 and asked them about their buying and selling habits of secondhand goods.
The majority of female respondents, 52%, cited economic reasons for selling pre-owned goods.
“But having an extra income stream, while welcome, isn’t the only reason for the thriving market in secondhand goods.', "EBAY is well known for being the first online auction site allowing person-to-person transaction.
1 eBay is well known for being the first online auction site allowing person-to-person transaction.
Credit: AlamyWhat does the e in eBay stand for?
eBay was founded in California on September 3, 1995, by Pierre Omidyar but it wasn't always called that.
It's name was changed to eBay in 1997 which is an acronym for Echo Bay Technology Group."]

title: ['These Montreal Brothers Turned a $98K Legal Battle With eBay Into a Sneaker NFT - Complex', 'AMZN: Amazon.com vs. eBay: Which Stock is a Better Buy? - StockNews.com']

You’re going to get the NFT and the sneaker and a copy of our court case.

On March 15th, Lee Horowitz, an analyst from Deutsche Bank, started coverage of eBay with a “Buy” rating.
Its Non-GAAP EPS came in at $27.75, significantly above the analysts’ estimates of $3.54.
In the fourth quarter, ended December 31st, 2021, eBay’s revenue increased 5.2% on a year-over-year basis to $2.61 billion, beating analysts’ estimates by $6.31 million.
The Bottom LineWhile Amazon and eBay should benefit from the e-commerce industry’s growth in the long term, I believe AMZN stock is a better investment at the moment based on its strategic acquisitions, better financials, and better growth prospects.']
