title: ['How Do You Appeal an eBay Account Suspension? - EcommerceBytes', 'Bugatti Chiron Parts for Sale on eBay, Get Ready to Feel Poor - autoevolution']
summary:
['A seller recently asked us how they could appeal a permanent eBay account suspension.
It also stated, "If your eBay account is restricted or suspended, we'll email you with the steps you need to take to have your account reinstated."
But according to the seller, eBay did not tell them why it suspended their account, nor did it tell him how to get the account reinstated.
We found a 2020 blog post from eDesk with some interesting perspective:"In an effort to protect its reputation, as well as its customers, eBay account suspensions are on the rise.
eDesk warns of a possible repercussion of account suspensions: "One account suspension can also lead to eBay shutting down other accounts associated with your household."', 'Thus, the only place left where you can still find one for grabs is the good old used car market.
The rear engine cover retails for nearly $95,000, whereas a grille and the lower section of the bumper will set you back $77,000.
The rear bumper is another $74,000, the diffuser costs $56,000, the front hood is over $46,000, and for the side skirts, you are looking at more than $24,000.
Heck, even that rear wing is very expensive at almost $14,000.
Before clicking the aforementioned link, answer this: would you ever consider blowing several million dollars on a Bugatti if you had the funds?']

title: ['The Dyson Ball Multi Floor Vacuum is on sale from eBay - SFGATE', "'Greedy' eBay sellers flog £94 Barbie of the Queen for £800 before her Platinum Jubilee - My London", 'Ex-eBay exec pleads guilty over bizarre harassment campaign - Business Insider', "eBay Seller Pet Peeve: I Saw You Don't Want Offers, But... - EcommerceBytes", 'eBay Adds FedEx to Shipping Label Program in Canada - EcommerceBytes', 'eBay Auction vs. Buy It Now: Which Selling Strategy Is Best? - MUO - MakeUseOf']
summary:
['EBAYDysons are the gold standard among vacuum cleaners.
When I was a kid and had no real responsibilities (those were the days), I remember asking my parents to buy a Dyson Ball.
I’m not sure why that was what I was into as a kid, but here we are.
While I never did convince them to buy one back then, I might end up buying one myself today since they’re on sale at eBay for $299.99.
Let’s start with what made the Dyson Ball so famous right out of the gate – the Ball!', 'Something went wrong, please try again later.
Invalid email Something went wrong, please try again later.
One of the somewhat stranger and unexpected tributes came from toymaker Mattel as they transformed The Queen into a Barbie Doll.
Royal Historian, Kate Williams, said of the doll: "Queen Elizabeth II's reign has been one of extraordinary impact, holding a position that few women have.
"The longest-reigning British monarch, and the first to reach a Platinum Jubilee, The Queen has dedicated herself to service and duty and seen the world change immeasurably.', 'A former Ebay executive admitted to his role in a conspiracy to harass a pair of bloggers in 2019.executive admitted to his role in a conspiracy to harass a pair of bloggers in 2019.
The former director of global resiliency is the last of the seven people involved to plead guilty.
The guilty plea signals the end of a high-profile case that brought negative publicity for eBay and resulted in the company firing the employees involved.
The sent items included a bloody pig Halloween mask, a preserved fetal pig, a funeral wreath, and a book on surviving the loss of a spouse.
Ebay said it learned of the scheme from law enforcement in August 2019, launched an internal investigation, and fired Harville and the others in September.', 'Dear Ina,The biggest annoyance for eBay sellers that's rarely if ever discussed is unsolicited lowball offers.
By definition if a seller doesn't have Best Offer on a fixed price listing, ALL offers for that item are unsolicited.
My listings clearly state my prices are not negotiable but lowballers still say, "I saw you don't want offers BUT ..."Even deleting every one is a major annoyance and waste of my time.
If I wanted offers I'd use Best Offer.
I don't know any sellers who like getting constantly lowballed when their conscious choice not to use Best Offer speaks for itself.', '“The integration of FedEx technology gives eBay sellers a seamless, on-platform experience to access FedEx domestic and international shipping tools and services – all at preferential rates,” eBay announced.
eBay sellers can purchase a new label on a desktop computer or on the mobile app – whichever is most convenient for you.
eBay sellers will save time and resources by printing multiple labels in bulk.
For multiple orders to the same buyer, eBay sellers can save money by purchasing and printing only one shipping label instead of multiple labels using the “Combine” feature.
eBay linked to a landing page describing its eBay Labels offerings, and you can find the press release on the eBay Canada Announcement board.', '']

title: ["'Extremely rare' 50p coin sells for £175 on eBay with thousands more out there - The Mirror", 'eBay Says Tax Reporting Rules Complicate Selling Your Old Bike - EcommerceBytes', 'Thai market holds promise for eBay - Bangkok Post', 'Funko: Bullish on Q1-2022 Results and eBay Investment - TipRanks']
summary:
['The Kew Gardens 50p features the famous Chinese Pagoda from the London park being intertwined by a leafy climber.
However, finding a Kew Gardens 50p coin doesn't necessarily mean you're about to make a fortune.
According to Coin Hunter, the 2009 Kew Gardens 50p piece normally sells for between £150.89 and £161.50.
With the Kew Gardens 50p, you also want to check for a sharp "pointy" roof on the top of the pagoda.
These lines can indicate a fake coin, however, they are also visible on Proof and Brilliant Uncirculated versions as well.', 'eBay is rallying the troops to try and change 1099-K tax reporting rules, issuing a message to its community of sellers this week.
eBay used an example of someone selling a personal item on its marketplace to bolster its argument:“Imagine selling an old bike for $800 that cost you $1,500 a few years ago.
Go to our eBay Main Street website and tell Congress to act now to support Americans selling online.
According to the Pappas press release, the legislation would do the following:Raise the reporting threshold from $600 to $5,000.
Require entities to issue a plain-language description of the taxability of income reported on Form 1099-K to reduce confusion among online sellers.', 'Mr Naini says Thailand serves as a major export market for eBay in Asean.
Thailand serves as a major export market for eBay in Asean, which can potentially supply products to the world, he said.
Mr Naini said strong growth of export products on eBay from Asean, particularly Thailand, included jewellery, watches, auto parts, collectable trading cards, and furniture.
The site's trading or collectable cards category is growing faster than the overall marketplace, said Mr Naini.
Collectable cards exported by Southeast Asian sellers via eBay has been growing in double-digit figures," he said.', 'The company’s stock price rallied recently from news of an investment in Funko by The Chernin Group and a consortium of investors, including eBay (EBAY).
Although greater market volatility is bringing down the price of Funko stock, I rate the company as bullish in the long term.
eBay will become the preferred secondary marketplace for Funko, and Funko will make exclusive limited-edition Funko Pops for eBay.
Stock Price VolatilityFunko’s stock price has dropped 18% over the last 12-months, but it is up 7.4% year-to-date and 11.8% over the past three months.
The stock price rallied over 17% when the news was released about the Chernin investment and eBay agreement.']

title: ['The eBay exec preaching transparency - POLITICO - POLITICO', "Supergirl's Melissa Benoist Focus of eBay-Exclusive CZX Crisis on ... - Beckett News", 'Barn Find Chevrolet Corvette With 34,000 Now On Ebay - HotCars']
summary:
["The eBay exec preaching transparencyVERBATIMRenee Morin leads eBay's sustainability efforts.
In her role, Morin toggles among tasks ranging from calculating and showing the company’s progress on carbon emissions reductions to interacting with shareholders.
How can we, as eBay, better present options online so our consumers are informed around a decision around transportation?
And not necessarily just offsetting that by purchasing carbon offsets.
Can you speak to what eBay’s thinking and strategy is when it comes to carbon offsets?", 'Supergirl’s Melissa Benoist Focus of eBay-Exclusive CZX Crisis on Infinite Earths Autographs, Memorabilia Cards Share:The 2022 Cryptozoic CZX Crisis on Infinite Earths checklist isn’t quite complete.
The set is getting some rare eBay-exclusive memorabilia and autographed memorabilia cards.
The first group of four cards are all about Supergirl and the show’s lead, Melissa Benoist.
Here’s a list of the first four cards, which go on sale through Cryptozoic’s eBay page starting on May 24, 2022 at 1 PM PST.
CZX Crisis on Infinite Earths Oversized Memorabilia CardsOS-01 Melissa Benoist as Kara DanversPrint run: /99Cost: $149.99CZX Crisis on Infinite Earths Oversized Autographed Memorabilia CardsOS-MB1 Melissa Benoist as Kara DanversPrint run: /5Cost: TBD (auction closes on May 29)OS-MB2 Melissa Benoist as Kara DanversPrint run: /25Cost: $499.99OS-MB3 Melissa Benoist as Kara DanversPrint run: /25Cost: $499.99', '']

title: ["The Crossover You Didn't Think You Needed: eBay Users Can Now ... - Gizmodo", 'New eBay Guidelines on Jewelry - Too Onerous, Say Sellers - EcommerceBytes', "Snake Island 'f*** you Russian warship' stamps are selling for up to ... - Joe UK", 'eBay to Sponsor Next Series of Love Island - HYPEBAE', 'This Week’s Best eBay PC Deals, Including 45% off on a Samsung 980 Pro SSD - Kotaku Australia', 'How To Buy Pre-Loved Designer Bags On eBay - Refinery29', 'Love Island Dumps Fast Fashion Sponsor For Ebay - British Vogue', 'Sherborne Facebook and eBay seller caught with van full of fake Nike trainers, Adidas clothes and handbags - Dorset Live']
summary:
['A new feature on Snapchat will let users share their eBay listings with their followers by integrating them into their snaps.
Here’s how it will work, you’ll have to start on the eBay website by selecting the listing you want to share, then by clicking share, a Snapchat option will now pop up.
The new Snapchat option will open up the app’s camera, with an automated eBay sticker that includes a picture of the item and a description.
Whether it’s a personal snap sent to other users, or posted on a snap story, people can then click on the eBay sticker to be redirected to the listing on the website.
So it’s no wonder that eBay is trying to get in on the action.', 'eBay is instituting new guidelines in the Jewelry category next week, and sellers say they will impact a majority of listings.
For example, sellers of a lab-created stone must include the term “lab-created” in the title immediately preceding the stone name.
Another example: sellers of a natural stone that has been dyed to enhance the color must state the gemstone is “treated” in the listing title.
Secondary stones can include either fine or fashion materials.”“Simulated gemstones are considered fashion jewelry.
We will move items with simulated main stones from fine jewelry into fashion jewelry in October.”You can find the thread containing eBay’s notification email and comments on the eBay seller discussion board.', 'In response to Russian soldiers ordering Ukrainian border guards on the small island territory of Snake Island to stand down, the border guards simply replied ‘Russian warship, go f**k yourself.’The moment, captured by radio transmission, went viral across the world as a symbol of Ukrainian resolve.
Then on April 12, the Ukrainian postal service printed a set of limited edition stamps depicting the Russian warship and a Ukrainian soldier making an offensive gesture at it.
Some people are calling it Ukrainian Bitcoin.”Stanislav fled his hometown of Kharkiv, after months of Russian shelling forced residents to live underground.
I can’t afford anything else right now.”Another seller, Sergei, estimates that he’s made more than £2,000 from the Snake Island stamps.
“It was a very brave act, they sent those pig-dog Russian soldiers in the right direction and made it clear that they will not be able to break our spirit.”Cover image credit: Leon Neal/Getty Images.', 'U.K. reality TV show Love Island is making a big change for Season 9, which is set to launch this June.
Instead, eBay will be the new series sponsor, dressing the islanders in secondhand clothing.
Working on the partnership is celebrity stylist Amy Bannerman, whose previous clients include Dua Lipa, Sophie Turner and Jonathan Van Ness.
The contestants will have access to a shared, pre-loved wardrobe, curated by Bannerman.
“We’re so excited to partner with Love Island this year and put pre-loved fashion, center stage,” eBay U.K.’s Head of Fashion Jemma Tadd said in a press release.', "This Week’s Best eBay PC Deals, Including 45% off on a Samsung 980 Pro SSDAt Kotaku, we independently select and write about stuff we love and think you'll like too.
Take this Alienware 34-inch curved gaming monitor for instance.
Razer is one of our top picks for PC gaming accessories and they won’t disappoint.
Best mouse dealsIf you’re a PC gamer, you’ll know that the right mouse can give you a great advantage whilst gaming.
Use the code AFTERPAY10 for an extra $10 off eligible items:Best headset dealsIn need of a new wireless gaming headset?", 'The thing is, finding pre-loved, legit designer handbags – especially from in-demand labels – can be a real struggle.
Happily, eBay’s latest innovation, the Handbag Authenticity Guarantee , is here to save the day.
If you buy a bag marked with an Authenticity Guarantee badge (a blue tick sticker), it will be sent by the seller to an independent and professionally trained team of authenticators who, using dozens of inspection points, check the packaging, handbag details and accessories to make sure your purchase is legit.
Once it has the green light, the authenticator ships your handbag directly to you via two-day, signature-required delivery.
Included with your purchase is a unique authentication card detailing information about your item.', 'Move over I Saw It First and Missguided, Love Island’s head has been turned.
After facing public backlash for promoting fast fashion, the reality show has inked a deal with Ebay to kit out this year’s contestants in pre-loved clothing.
Fast fashion has finally given Love Island “the ick”.
“The impact of Love Island and its stars across the UK is undeniable and together we want to inspire the nation to choose pre-loved first when shopping,” added Jemma Tadd, head of fashion at Ebay UK.
“Even if this means buying or selling one or two pre-loved items to start with, it’s a step in the right direction.”Many critics claim that fast fashion is an addiction, which has been fuelled by advertising on shows like Love Island.', "Weymouth Magistrates' Court heard how police seized the goods and passed them to Dorset Council Trading Standards to investigate.
Trading Standards officers obtained evidence from the trademark owners that the goods were illegal copies.
The brands represented included Nike, Adidas, Stone Island, Armani, North Face, Hugo Boss, Moncler and Michael Kors.
Hampson, of South Avenue, Sherborne, pleaded guilty to four offences under the Trade Marks Act 1994 at an earlier hearing.
Martin Thursby Principal Trading Standards Officer at Dorset Council said, “The maximum penalty for selling counterfeit goods is 10 years imprisonment."]

title: ['EXCLUSIVE COMMENTS: Love Island eBay partnership signifies ... - just-style.com', 'eBay opens first-ever sneaker store that rewards sneakerheads for ... - PR Newswire', "Will Love Island's eBay partnership spell the end for fast fashion? - The Face", 'The Wachowskis Bring Matrix Comics Back To Print After $200 eBay ... - Bleeding Cool News', 'Woman accidentally posts her nude photo on eBay while listing her ... - YabaLeftOnline News']
summary:
['Love Island’s new eBay partnership is in contrast to its previous pairings with fast fashion retailers such as I Saw It First and Missguided, however it is said to support the growing shift towards buying secondhand.
eBay explains the collaboration comes after it produced new research and data that shows a fifth (20%) of Brits admit to buying more second-hand fashion items compared to two years ago.
Plus, many of the contestants landed fast fashion ambassador deals once the show ended, such as Molly-Mae Hague becoming the UK and EU creative director of PrettyLittleThing.
This year’s resale fashion partnership will see the ‘Islanders’ wearing pre-loved eBay clothes that will be picked out from a shared wardrobe.
Hopefully they listened to some conversations and have paid attention to the fashion and younger community.”Stephens makes the point that young consumers are already the most invested in resale.', 'eBay’s Wear ‘Em Out Store, open on Fairfax Avenue in Los Angeles throughout Memorial Day weekend, offers exclusive pricing on collectible kicks to those who wear them out of the store.
eBay’s Wear ‘Em Out Store, open on Fairfax Avenue in Los Angeles throughout Memorial Day weekend, offers exclusive pricing on collectible kicks to those who wear them out of the store.
eBay’s Wear ‘Em Out Store, open on Fairfax Avenue in Los Angeles throughout Memorial Day weekend, offers exclusive pricing on collectible kicks to those who wear them out of the store.
"The Wear 'Em Out Store celebrates a love of sneakers, while acknowledging that sneakerheads are often balancing what they wear with what they keep in the box.
Stay tuned to @ebaysneakers on Twitter and Instagram to learn more about eBay's Wear 'Em Out Store and unparalleled sneaker offering.', 'It’s finally happened: fast fashion has been dumped from Love Island.
Yes, Love Island, the show built on its unmistakable fast fashion aesthetic that revolutionised TV marketing, namely by turning its contestants into walking mannequins for brands like Boohoo and Missguided.
Love Island has just announced that its sponsor for this summer’s series is… eBay.
It makes sense that Love Island would want to move onto greener pastures (and safeguard its ever-precarious PR reputation).
So if anything can convert staunch fast-fashion addicts, it’s probably Love Island.', '', 'A woman has apparently been left embarrassed after she accidentally posted an unclad photo of herself while listing her air fryer for sale on popular e-commerce site eBay.
She took the effort to add the model number and four photographs of each piece of the utensil in the description.
Instead of another zoomed-in photo of the air fryer, the vendor unintentionally published a photo of herself in just her underwear.
Hundreds of bidders are believed to have been spurred by the final photo, which was not intended for the advertisement.
In other news, embattled Nigerian socialite, Hushpuppi is currently being talked about on Twitter after Chris Brown referenced him in a new song.']

title: ['eBay UK Security Update: Adding 2FA When Requesting Payouts - eSeller365', 'Stumped by eBay Account Suspensions, Part 2 - EcommerceBytes', 'Old Apple products can fetch thousands on eBay – check if you have these discontinued devices... - The US Sun']
summary:
['eBay UK has announced an important security update affecting sellers and is urging all users to double-check the phone number they have on file in their account and also ensure it has the capability to receive text messages.
You can see the full announcement from eBay UK below:“Dear sellers,We have an important update headed your way.
Soon, you’ll get even more flexibility in deciding when you receive payouts from eBay.
As we enhance the security of your account, you’ll receive requests for authentication as you continue selling on eBay—including text messages that help us verify your identity as the account holder.
If you need to update your phone number, select Edit.', 'Last week we blogged about eBay account suspensions and included a video from a seller whose account was suspended for 72 hours for having products that had out-of-date expirations that were in "out of stock" mode - in other words, the items were not available for sale, so she didn't know she was violating policy.
"The reasons for these are due to the activity performed in the usage of the account, this may also have something to do with the information registered on the account.
In addition, the first two reps were incorrect in telling the seller her account could not be reinstated - the third rep did reinstate her account.
It turns out that when eBay suspended her account, it closed her store.
We can't say what percentage of sellers are blindsided by suspensions or who get the runaround by eBay reps when they encounter suspensions.', "Families all around the world accumulate years worth of Apple tech that starts to become outdated the moment it hits the shelves.
First Generation iPod7 Apple priced the iPod at $399 Credit: Apple7 Apple Founder Steve Jobs with an iPod Credit: ReutersWhen the iPod was first released, it was an instant hit - it became a window into someone's personality.
Macintosh 128K7 Steve Jobs personally oversaw the original Macintosh division at Apple Credit: WikipediaThe original Macintosh computer was a feat of design, engineering and marketing excellence rallying around one product.
Selling a first generation Shuffle won't make you rich - one eBay listing has it priced at just $13.
If you have any outdated Apple tech and intentions to sell, be sure to check the market - you don't want to undersell a nugget of Apple history."]

title: ["'Broke' teen who quit McDonald's now earns £28,000 a month from eBay business - Daily Star"]
summary:
['A teenager has ditched her job at McDonalds to enjoy a life of designer clothes, travel and luxury thanks to starting her own business on eBay.
Olivia Percoco, from Melbourne in Australia, decided to launch a new business in 2020 before Covid hit.
Olivia used to work at McDonalds before launching her online store and says she was “completely broke”.
“I hated working, it wasn’t fun, so I googled ways to make money online and came across drop shipping” she said.
The key to making money and success with drop shipping is focusing on the demand for the product and then decide whether it’s worth adding to your store.']

title: ["Mum flogging her own prosthetic leg on eBay as an 'antique' for £2k - Coventry Live", 'Love Island coupling up with eBay sends out powerful message ... - Independent.ie', "Florida woman jokes about hissing 'puppy' from eBay after finding alligator in garage - FOX 35 Orlando", 'Daily Deals: This Refurbished Tech Sale at eBay is Amazing - IGN', 'What is eBay Plus: price and benefits explained, and is it worth it? - TechRadar', 'eBay launches its first collection of NFTs in partnership with web3 platform OneOf - TechCrunch', 'eBay Launches First Collection of NFTs in Partnership with Green ... - PR Newswire', 'eBay Drops First NFT Collection on Polygon - Crypto Briefing', 'eBay To Open First U.S. Pop-Up Store On Fairfax Avenue - The Real Deal']
summary:
['Our free email updates are the best way to get headlines direct to your inboxA mum is flogging her own leg for £2,000 on eBay - her first-ever prosthetic leg that she's kept for 39 years in a bid to raise funds for a new one.
I've just never got on with them, so I've never used a prosthetic arm.
She said she hasn't had a new prosthetic leg made for around 12-15 years and that the one that she currently has was initially well suited but recently has been causing her problems.
(Image: Kennedy News and Media)Carly said: "I started wearing a prosthetic leg when I was nine months old.
Just recently my prosthetic leg is not comfortable.', '‘You’ve got a text!” And it reads as follows: Haven’t you heard that Love Island shall henceforth be known as ‘Pre-Loved Island’?
Well, sort of.
The reality dating show caught everyone by surprise (in a good way) last week when it announced the main sponsor for the next series would be the resale platform eBay.
To the uninitiated, this sounds like an incremental and relatively unimportant piece of industry news.
But if you’ve been following the show, either as a fan or a hater, you’ll appreciate what it signifies.', 'articleA Florida woman had some fun with a scary situation after finding a large alligator in her garage recently.
"When I put his collar and leash on him, he growls, hisses, and then rolls and rolls… Does anyone know if Cesar Milan works with this new breed Chihauhator or Gatohauhau?"
Credit: Cindy FrasierShe kept the joke going, saying the 7 ½-foot ‘puppy’ is a "little nasty" and just wants it "to be more respectful."
If you encounter an alligator, call the Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission's toll-free Nuisance Alligator Hotline at 866-392-4286.
The FWC will dispatch one of its contracted nuisance alligator trappers to resolve the situation.', "You're getting the piece of tech you're after, without the troubling costs to resources.
So, massive sales on refurbished items should be music to your ears, there are some great deals to check out, and it keeps your purchases as carbon neutral as possible.
eBay has up to 30% off a great range of refurbished tech right now, including discounts on Apple AirPods, smartwatches, desktops, mobiles and more.
This is a great sale, with PS5 games, Xbox consoles, and more available at a big discount.
It's still IGN's top pick for the best 4K TV for gaming as well, so for what you're getting this is an absolute steal.", '', 'eBay is the latest company to enter the NFT business, as the online marketplace announced today that it’s launching its first collection of NFTs in partnership with web3 platform OneOf.
The company’s new “Genesis” NFT Collection will feature 3D and animated interpretations of the iconic athletes featured on Sports Illustrated covers over the years.
The first NFT collection, which is available starting today, will feature Canadian hockey player Wayne Gretzky.
The NFTs start at $10 and contain a 3D rendering or animation of Gretzky making a signature move on the ice.
Instagram recently announced that it will start testing NFTs with select creators in the United States.', '"Through our partnership with OneOf, eBay is now making coveted NFTs more accessible to a new generation of collectors everywhere.
This builds upon our commitment to deliver high passion, high value items to the eBay community of buyers and sellers."
OneOf and eBay are bringing transformative Web3 technology to the next 100M non-crypto-native mass consumers."
A longtime leader in the collectibles space, eBay continues to introduce new tech capabilities and greater confidence to enthusiasts.
In addition, OneOf donates portions of proceeds from every NFT collection to its artist or athlete partner's preferred charity.', 'Key Takeaways eBay has launched its first-ever NFT collection in partnership with the OneOf NFT marketplace.
Share this article URL CopiedeBay has launched its first-ever NFT collection in collaboration with the green NFT marketplace, OneOf.
eBay Releases NFTs on PolygonAfter Meta, Twitter, Adidas, Visa, and a host of other multinational companies, eBay is getting into NFTs.
The global e-commerce giant announced in a Monday press release that it had launched its first NFT collection via a strategic partnership with the multi-chain NFT marketplace OneOf.
The first drop of the NFT collection is already available for purchase on eBay.', 'The e-commerce online auction house is opening a bricks-and-mortar store at 455 North Fairfax Avenue this week to sell sneakers, the company announced last week.
Pop-up stores have become a popular trend during the pandemic as a way for landlords to boost revenue.
A stretch of several blocks along Fairfax Avenue between Melrose Avenue and Beverly Boulevard has become home to a number of streetwear pop-ups.
The company opened a month-long pop-up for local businesses in the U.K. in 2019Not all e-commerce companies have found success with physical stores.
Amazon recently said it would shut all of its physical pop-up, toy, home goods and bookshops in the U.S., after its revenues from physical stores failed to grow alongside its other businesses.']

title: ["eBay 'Refreshes' Its Foundation Board of Directors - EcommerceBytes", 'Heinz limited edition Spaghetti Junction pasta tins listed on eBay for ... - Express & Star', '‘This Is a Deep Cut’ – Serena Williams’ Husband Alexis Ohanian Pities eBay Founder Over Jeff Bezos’ Massive Net Worth - EssentiallySports', "Angry fans auction off Zlatan's nose on eBay - News24", "Love Island's eBay styling could change second-hand buying habits - BBC", 'eBay sneaker store rewards customers for wearing kicks - just-style.com', 'eBay is having a Memorial Day Sale through the end of May - SFGATE', 'eBay Sellers Desperate after GoDaddy Bookkeeping Ends Support - EcommerceBytes', 'eBay UK Bans Single-Use Plastics From June 1st Thanks To New ... - eSeller365', 'How eBay Motors makes it easier to find in-demand parts - http://www.indiegarage.ca', 'Restored 1987 Ford Mustang GT On eBay - HotCars', 'Notorious B.I.G. MetroCard Listed at $4899 on eBay - Curbed', 'eBay Launches LA Store That Rewards Sneakerheads For Actually Wearing Their Kicks - Cassius', 'Technology News | ⚡eBay Launches Its First Collection of NFTs - LatestLY']
summary:
['eBay has been “refreshing” its leadership team and board, and now it’s giving the same treatment to the eBay Foundation.
Today it added three executives to the foundation’s board of directors and said it has been implementing a “new strategic vision” over the past year.
Two of the three new appointments are especially significant as they mark the first time the eBay Foundation added board members from outside eBay.
“This marks an important step in how we are deepening the experience and expertise of our governance, staying authentic in our work and providing learning opportunities for all,” according to eBay Foundation President Allie Ottoboni, who made the announcement on the eBay corporate blog.
The eBay Foundation current board members are the following:Beric Alleyne: Global head of Diversity, Equity and Inclusion, eBayJoe Billante: VP, Investor Relations, eBay – eBay Foundation board chairpersonKen Ebanks: VP and deputy general counsel, Markets, eBay – eBay Foundation board secretaryCathy Foster: VP, Global Government Relations and Public Policy, eBayPatrice Green: Program officer, Inclusive Economies, Surdna FoundationJonathan Jayes-Green: Nonprofit and philanthropy executiveJulie Simpson: VP, Internal Audit, eBay – eBay Foundation Board CFOAndrew Sullivan: VP, Total Compensation and Rewards, eBayEve Williams: Chief marketing officer, eBay U.K.', 'Spaghetti Junction, and one of the limited edition cansHeinz released the specially branded cans of spaghetti to celebrate the 50th anniversary of the Spaghetti Junction connecting the M6 and A38(M), which passed this week.
However, due to the limited amount selling out so fast, Heinz released a further 250 on Tuesday, which have now also sold out.
Photo dated 23/05/72 of Spaghetti Junction in Birmingham.
People have been snapping up the cans, and some have even gone to the lengths of selling the limited edition cans on eBay.
"It’s been incredible to see the nation’s demand for these very special tins, celebrating the 50th anniversary of Spaghetti Junction.', 'NEW YORK, NEW YORK – MAY 06: Serena Williams and Alexis Ohanian attend The 2019 Met Gala Celebrating Camp: Notes on Fashion at Metropolitan Museum of Art on May 06, 2019 in New York City.
Like her husband, Alexis Ohanian, Serena is a successful entrepreneur with businesses like Serena Ventures, and S by Serena in her portfolio.
Earlier this week, news surfaced about the comparison of market capitalization of industry leaders, eBay and Amazon.
However, their market capitalization has grown at a different rate, which prompted Alexis Ohanian to react on Twitter.
via Getty Serena Williams goes down injured during her first round ladies’ singles match against.', 'Angry Swedish football fans are auctioning replicas of the sawn-off nose of a Zlatan Ibrahimovic statue to protest against the commercialisation of the sport and what they perceive as the star's betrayal.
Bids on website eBay hit $610 (568 euros) on Tuesday.
The statue's nose was sawn off in December 2019, with the feet going the following month, causing it to collapse against the barrier protecting it.
Malmo FF fans said they had put three replicas of the original nose -- which is still missing -- up for auction "because choosing money over love can cost you dearly".
Ibrahimovic "chose money over love of his hometown and the club where he began his career", they wrote on the specially-created website www.vararnasan.se, Swedish for "where is the nose".', '"Regardless of whether [viewers] are ready to make a change, there's going to be a change forced upon them as previously you could buy what [contestants] were wearing immediately after or even during the show whereas you're not going to be able to do that anymore."', 'The new eBay ‘Wear ‘Em Out Store’ on Fairfax Avenue, Los Angeles is said to be stocking exclusive and coveted sneaker styles for up to 70% off market price, with lower prices for shoppers who choose to wear their purchases when walking out the door.
“The Wear ‘Em Out Store celebrates a love of sneakers, while acknowledging that sneakerheads are often balancing what they wear with what they keep in the box,” said Garry Thaniel, GM of Sneakers at eBay.
eBay explains the store will feature a selection of what it sees as the season’s most coveted styles, including new releases that would normally only be available at deadstock prices.
eBay says it has long been the go-to destination for shoppers to find highly coveted and authentic sneakers, with 14 pairs of sneakers sold every minute.
UK television show, Love Island, announced this year’s sponsorship is with eBay as opposed to a fast fashion brand.', 'ebayLike many other companies and websites out there, eBay is joining the fray and offering big savings this week with its very own Memorial Day Sale.
When you use the Promo Code MEMDAY15OFF, you can save 15% on select products across the site.
Even though it’s not Memorial Day just yet, the sale is active now, so head over to eBay and take a look at what you can get your hands on.
eBay’s Memorial Day Sale isn’t limited to just one specific category of items, but it’s not exactly site-wide either (wouldn’t that be something).
The main categories that are part of this sale are:', 'Online sellers are scrambling after learning today they'll no longer be able to use GoDaddy Bookkeeping to track expenses and prepare their taxes.
eBay sellers in particular are desperately seeking alternatives.
GoDaddy sent the following message to customers this morning:Online Bookkeeping will retire in 30 days.
At that time, the Online Bookkeeping tool will stop importing transactions from your connected channels and your existing data will be archived.
Some sellers discussing the news online were skeptical, fearing it was a phishing email, but in a faq on its website ("Why is GoDaddy Online Bookkeeping being discontinued?', 'A new Scottish law has passed which means that from June 1st, 2022 single-use plastic items will be banned.
Interestingly eBay UK has chosen to carry this ban over to the entire UK marketplace and not just Scotland.
“We are turning promise into action and banning some of the most problematic single-use plastic items in Scotland.
Every year, hundreds of millions of pieces of single-use plastic are wasted in this country.
The eBay UK Single Use Plastics Announcement“As you may be aware, Scotland has passed new laws banning environmentally damaging single-use plastic items.', 'But, with ongoing supply chain issues and inflation, getting the right parts at the right time, and at the right price, is more challenging than ever.
Long-time automotive service professionals often experience moments of concern when trying to make sure their customers’ vehicles are road-ready on time and on budget.
eBay Motors is the perfect solution to meet the needs of automotive service professionals.
Ryan Baltjes, Head of Motors at eBay Canada, says that the easy lookup is only part of the story.
In fact, nearly 30 parts and accessories are being added every minute in Canada, and across North America, three automotive parts are sold every second!', '', 'Photo: MTAThe limited-edition MetroCard has become a New York City tradition, and so has the resale hype market that immediately follows.
Last weekend, to commemorate what would have been the Notorious B.I.G.’s 50th birthday, the MTA released 50,000 commemorative MetroCards in three Bed-Stuy subway stations.
The current line of people trying to get a Biggie (B.I.G) MetroCard at the Barclays Center subway entrance.
Absolutely insane… pic.twitter.com/jgpTBpCj9Y — Finnley S. (KR Vail#0566) (@FinnleySt) May 21, 2022If you missed out, a bunch are up for sale on eBay.
But one intrepid seller is reaching for the stars, listing the MetroCard for $4,899, expedited shipping included.', 'The e-commerce site is pushing further into the sneaker game with a brick-and-mortar store located on Los Angeles’ Fairfax Avenue.
The exclusive sneaker store will reward buyers with up to a 70% off discount for wearing their kicks out of the store.
Appropriately dubbed “Wear ‘Em Out,” the rare kicks are available to cop through Memorial Day Weekend.
“eBay is my go-to place to find the kicks you can’t find anywhere else,” said curator and rapper Offset.
“The Wear ‘Em Out Store celebrates a love of sneakers while acknowledging that sneakerheads are often balancing what they wear with what they keep in the box.', 'E-commerce platform eBay has launched a series of exclusive non fungible tokens (NFTs) through a strategic partnership with OneOf, a premier green NFT platform for communities across music, sports, and lifestyle.']

title: ['Vintage CorningWare collections are selling for thousands on eBay - 7NEWS', '1971 Hurst Jeepster Commando For Sale On Ebay - HotCars', 'Crossrail: Free Elizabeth line Oyster cards being sold for £300 on eBay - My London', 'Suzahdi on eBay Australia in Warm Winter Leather 2022 - Digital Journal']
summary:
['Australians are being urged to check their old CorningWare collections, with vintage pieces now fetching as much as $15,000 on buy and sell sites.
But now a demand in specific vintage CorningWare designs from collectors has seen an influx of listings on eBay.
“Now it’s making us more money than I ever dreamed.”Current listings on eBay for rare vintage CorningWare shows demand is high.
Credit: eBayOne of the most desirable CorningWare patterns for collectors is the Spice Of Life range, which features a distinctive design incorporating various vegetables, greenery and the words “L’Echalote La Marjolaine”.
“One piece of CorningWare, in a pattern not widely produced, sold on eBay recently for $US7,000 (AUD$9.8k),’”says glass expert Dean Six.', '', "Invalid email Something went wrong, please try again later.
Limited edition Oyster cards made specially for the launch of the new Elizabeth line railway yesterday are being sold online on eBay for as much as £300, with opportunist traders cashing in on the collectible nature of the special cards.
The Oyster cards, which feature the new unique seat moquette pattern for the Elizabeth line, were made available by TfL at the launch of the new line yesterday (May 24), attended by transport enthusiasts and commuters alike.
Around 1.2million of the limited edition pay-as-you-go Oyster cards were made for the big day.
The cards' only difference to a normal Oyster is cosmetic, with the limited edition versions functioning the same as any other pay-as-you-go Oyster card.", 'The warm, fashionable choices include leather jackets and vests are made to order just for each client.
Our veteran online bespoke leather jackets and leather vests are available on Suzahdi.com, Facebook store, Bonanza, eBay USA, and now, very excited to add eBay Australia,” says Suzanne Bowen, Suzahdi and Elegant Group Inc co-founder.
Our Suzahdi team of expert tailors lovingly handcraft leather jackets inspired by Jackman’s Logan character in the X-Men Origins: Wolverine distressed brown with orange-rust stripes’ leather jacket, the X-Men: Days of Future Past brown leather jacket, and the Wolverine Logan suede leather jacket.
Suzahdi.com and its presence on eBay Australia is the go-to for the selective classic and cosplay leather jacket market.
About Suzahdi.com and Suzahdi on eBay AustraliaSuzahdi.com, on eBay Australia, is a multiculturally-owned business with a passion for serving clientele with fresh leather jacket and vest designs.']

title: ['41 charged in luxury clothing, goods that resold on eBay - WCBS 880', 'A Ritz-Oreo mashup treat is now selling for $600 on eBay - MarketWatch', 'eBay has an Xbox Series X bundle in stock and on sale - SFGATE', 'eBay has an Xbox Series X bundle in stock and on sale - The Pioneer', 'What you missed at the Vogue Business and eBay Technology Forum - Vogue Business']
summary:
['According to an indictment, 41 people were charged for their roles in this crime ring that stole luxury clothing and goods and thousands of items from drug stores that were then resold on eBay.
Rubinov regularly provided his employees with cash to pay for the stolen property, which was allocated to promote the ongoing procurement of stolen property.
Ana Balaceanu, Fathi Negadi, Caroline Gallego, and Patrice Collins inventoried and organized the stolen property at the stash locations in Queens.
Balaceanu, Yasaroglu, Collins, and Gallego then posted the stolen property for resale on Rubinov’s Treasure-Deals-USA eBay store.
Since 2017, the Treasure Steals USA Operation has sold more than $1,373,728 of stolen property via Rubinov’s eBay store.', 'Are you ready for another sweet-and-salty mashup?
Mondelēz International MDLZ, the food giant behind the Oreo and Ritz brands, has rolled out a snack combining the two treats in one, available through a limited-time mail offering.
How limited?
There were 1,000 boxes of the Ritz X Oreo combo up for grabs, starting Thursday at noon.
But they...', 'EBAYThroughout their entire production, the Xbox Series X has been hard to find in stock, largely due to supply chain issues with microchips.
But as we reported last month, it looks like Microsoft paid for priority access to new microchips, which has enabled the company to restock the Series X faster than expected.
With the consoles getting back in stock, sellers are starting to offer deals and bundles to entice new buyers.
And with this deal from eBay, you can get a new Xbox Series X, an extra controller, and "Halo Infinite" for just $576.99 (20% off).', 'EBAYThroughout their entire production, the Xbox Series X has been hard to find in stock, largely due to supply chain issues with microchips.
But as we reported last month, it looks like Microsoft paid for priority access to new microchips, which has enabled the company to restock the Series X faster than expected.
With the consoles getting back in stock, sellers are starting to offer deals and bundles to entice new buyers.
And with this deal from eBay, you can get a new Xbox Series X, an extra controller, and "Halo Infinite" for just $576.99 (20% off).', 'To receive the Vogue Business newsletter, sign up here.
And, with all of the hype surrounding Web3, NFT drops and digital worlds, real strategies are forming to guide luxury to the next phase of the internet.
At the Vogue Business and eBay Technology Forum, industry leaders joined senior innovation editor Maghan McDowell to discuss the future of fashion in Web3.
Read on for the highlights from each conversation, and become a Vogue Business Member today to join our next event.
Fashion’s role in shaping our metaverse identitiesIn the Web3 future, the best avatars will enable representation, rather than characterisation.']

title: ['Offset, eBay Team Up to Offer Most Coveted Sneakers at Affordable ... - Los Angeles Magazine', "Love Island's stylist snaps up used bikinis and watermelon visor on eBay for new cast - The Mirror"]
summary:
['', "A Love Island fan and eBay seller couldn't believe her eyes when she saw that her watermelon shaped straw hat had been bagged by the show's stylist Amy BannermanLove Island's stylist snaps up used bikinis and watermelon visor on eBay for new castLove Island's stylist has already started snapping up second hand bikinis and quirky straw hats from eBay ahead of the new series, which kicks off next month.
But one seller on eBay spotted that one of their items had been bagged by Love Island's stylist Amy Bannerman, who uses the buyer name loveisla-87.
Image: @lucy_earnshaw_/TikTok) @lucy_earnshaw_/TikTok) Image: @lucy_earnshaw_/TikTok) @lucy_earnshaw_/TikTok)She then shared a photo of the hat, which isn't what you'd usually see on the prime time show.
She then shared the address that her watermelon hat was going to be dispatched to and noticed that it said eBay.
Love Island changed its strategy after it was hit with backlash from environmental groups and sustainability advocates who said that the programme encouraged a disposable attitude to fashion."]

title: ['Your old gaming consoles could be worth thousands on eBay – check if your device could make you money... - The US Sun', 'eBay Launches Its First NFT Collection - Prestige Online Hong Kong']
summary:
["OLD gaming consoles might seem like bulky hunks of plastic, but some devices carry shocking re-sale value.
eBay sellers are pulling in real dollars for their old consoles - you can too by listing some of these tech fossils.
Don't bet the farm on your Pong profits - a used but functional 1976 Pong console is on the eBay market for $99.99.
The rarest of the rare will fetch over six digits on eBay - but the standard black N64 system is worth about $50.
Beatles Rock Band for Xbox 3608 Rock Band and its predecessor Guitar Hero stepped outside of the traditional set up of joystick-wired-to-console gaming Credit: XBoxBeatles purists, look away!", 'On 23 May, eBay launched its first exclusive NFT drop, starting at USD 10, as shared by the company on Twitter.
This highly-anticipated collection is in partnership with the web3 platform OneOf, ice hockey legend Wayne Gretzky and sports media company Sports Illustrated.
While eBay is launching its first NFT collection, the limited Sports Illustrated x Wayne Gretzky drop is the fourth for OneOf.
The Sports Illustrated x Wayne Gretzky collection, which showcases Canadian hockey player Wayne Gretzky in a digital avatar, is available online as green, gold, platinum and diamond-tier NFTs.
The range begins from USD 10 for basic green NFT and goes up to USD 1,500 for the diamond tier one.']

title: ['A Google Pixel 7 prototype popped up for sale on eBay - The Verge', 'Wickes launches new store on Ebay as it enters marketplace - Retail Gazette', "Buying eBay Refurbished is the Savvy Shopper's Dream Come True - The Kit", '50p coin sells for 200 times its value on eBay with 17 million in circulation - Lincolnshire Live', 'eBay UK research shows secondhand surging as inflation bites - ww.fashionnetwork.com']
summary:
['An alleged prototype of Google’s upcoming Pixel 7 smartphone has been posted on eBay, giving us our first look at the new phone in the wild months ahead of its scheduled fall release (via Android guru Mishaal Rahman).
Google just revealed the phone a few weeks ago at Google I/O, and what we can see in the prototype matches up with what Google has already shown.
The distinctive camera bar is back, and this year it’s an aluminum bar with cutouts for the cameras.
One of Google’s official Pixel 7 and Pixel 7 Pro images — including that deep black.
Image: GoogleThe eBay listing includes a few photos of the front, back, and sides of the device, though there’s not much to see that you can’t already spot on Google’s official renders.', '// Wickes launched its own store on eBay// It has curated a range of over 4,000 products to target eBay’s visitorsWickes has launched its own store on eBay as it takes its first step into the marketplace.
The home improvement business has curated a range of over 4,000 products to target eBay’s visitors.
Wickes’ eBay range includes its best-selling flooring, internal doors, tiles, paint, ready to fit kitchen and garden products.
“We’re customer curious at Wickes and do a great deal of work to understand why and how our customers shop,” Wickes chief marketing and digital officer, Gary Kibble said.
“By launching with eBay we can introduce even more home improvers to the Wickes brand and help them feel house proud.', 'eBay Refurbished delivers deep discounts on quality refurbished items from brands like Apple, Bose and Miele.
And all this while shopping sustainably; eBay Refurbished products reduce harmful waste by extending the life of a product.
OK, so you’re convinced on shopping refurbished but don’t know where to start?
eBay Refurbished has got you covered with a selection of refurbished Miele vacuums that will make cleaning up a breeze.
Savvy shoppers looking for quality refurbished products can go to ebay.ca/eBayRefurbished.', "Sign up to our free email alerts for the top daily stories sent straight to your e-mailA 50p minted more than 17 million times has sold for £100 on eBay.
Despite being seen as a 'common' coin, the unusual design has commanded a higher-than-average price among buyers.
A winning bid of 200 times the coin's value was placed on the eBay listing.
A total of 17,649,000 Dictionary 50p coins were minted in 2005, making it an extremely common coin to collect.
There is a massive market online for coin selling, with many 50p coins being worth hundreds of pounds.", 'eBay UK research shows secondhand surging as inflation bites ByNigel TAYLOR PublishedMay 30, 2022The rising cost of living and climate consciousness are driving changes in UK shopping behaviours, “creating new opportunities for retailers in the circular economy”, according to a report by Ads.
Image: PexelsAs prices rise across multiple consumer staples, more UK consumers are turning to shopping and upcycling in order to make ends meet – as well as minimise their environmental impact, it says.
Overall, some 25% of UK consumers were buying secondhand fashion in 2021, the report notes.
The research, which surveyed 1,000 UK respondents, found that consumers’ interest in buying secondhand is part of a wider growth of the circular economy.
This is supported by insights from eBay Ads UK, which finds that interest in secondhand items was rising fast at the beginning of this year.']

title: ['I’ve finally put something on eBay that people want – now I wish I hadn’t - The Guardian', 'Here’s Your Last Chance to Snag up to 60% Off Home, Fashion and Tech Thanks to Ebay Plus’ Weekend Sale - Lifehacker Australia', 'Technology News | ⚡Google Pixel 7 Prototype Spotted on eBay Ahead of Its Launch: Report - LatestLY', 'Snapchat: How to Share an eBay Listing in a Snap - Adweek', 'Should eBay Automatically Refund Fees for Cancelled Orders? - EcommerceBytes', 'eBay’s Hosts ‘Wear ‘Em Out’ Pop-Up for Los Angeles Sneakerheads - Sourcing Journal']
summary:
['It was so exciting when eBay first started, a final reckoning with the fact that we all, between us, had enough stuff.
I’d end up with a closing bid of £1.28, having gifted myself administrative posting tasks that would reach into the following month.
And so, years in, I’ve finally posted something for sale that people want.
Instantly, people were going round the back, messaging privately, playing hardball.
Finally, I have figured out what old-school capitalism had going for it – frictionless trade.', "Here’s Your Last Chance to Snag up to 60% Off Home, Fashion and Tech Thanks to Ebay Plus’ Weekend SaleAt Lifehacker, we independently select and write about stuff we love and think you'll like too.
Our friends over eBay have spent the last week rewarding its Plus members with a massive eBay Plus weekend sale.
What is eBay Plus Weekend?
When is eBay Plus Weekend?
For more neat eBay deals outside of eBay Plus weekend, it’s also worth stopping by our eBay coupon page here.", "An alleged prototype of Google's upcoming Pixel 7 smartphone has been offered on eBay, giving the audience a sneak peek at the device months before its official release.", 'Snapchat now allows users to share eBay listings in Snaps on the social networking platform.
When someone shares an eBay listing in a Snap, viewers will be able to tap the listing to view it on eBay.
Our guide will show you how to share an eBay listing in a Snap on Snapchat.
Step 1: In the eBay app, tap the “Share” icon near the top-right corner of the listing you want to share.
Step 2: Tap “Snapchat.”Step 3: Your device may ask you to give permission to the eBay app to open the Snapchat app.', "eBay sellers probably agree they should not have to pay fees for cancelled orders, and for the most part that's true.
However, a seller told us that eBay did not automatically refund their Promoted Listing ad fee when a buyer cancelled a sale.
However, it does not say if it will refund fees for Promoted Listings Express (for auction listings) or Promoted Listings Advanced (cost-per-click ads).
If you've opted to run Promoted Listing ads, does eBay automatically credit you the following month (or ever) for cancelled orders?
What about the other frees eBay credits for cancelled orders?", 'Union LA x Nike Dunk Low PistachioImage Credit: Courtesy“We weren’t 100 percent sure we wanted to wait, but I think it was worth it,” David Ark said after scoring the Union LA x Nike Dunk Low in the Pistachio color way.
Attendees were not apprised of which sneakers would be on display at the event, and simply showed up on the hope that they might find a great deal in their size.']

title: ['eBay Expands Seller Protection for Damaged Returns - EcommerceBytes', 'Ebay Tops BofA List of Companies with High Free Cash Flow - TheStreet', 'The Ghostbusters: Afterlife Crew Created Secret eBay Accounts To ... - /Film', 'eBay Seller Encounters Unexpected Limit on Combined Invoice - EcommerceBytes', 'Crack open a cold one with this beverage insulator from eBay - SFGATE']
summary:
["Here's what the policy page says on the US website (note that it applies to sellers who offer free returns):An item is returned after it was used or damaged by the buyerSellers who offer free returns and who are not Below Standard are eligible for this protection- You can deduct up to 50% from the refund to recover the lost value of the item- We will take care of any issues directly with the buyer for you, including removing any negative and neutral feedback, defects, and open cases in service metricsIf we are asked to step in and help, you will no longer be able to issue a partial refund to the buyer.
Learn more about refunding the buyer.", '', 'The Ghostbusters: Afterlife Crew Created Secret eBay Accounts To Track Down Vintage PropsWe may receive a commission on purchases made from links.
Jason Reitman's 2021 film "Ghostbusters: Afterlife," the fourth Ghostbusters film and the third in the continuity of the 1984 original, was a playground for those audiences members keen on rolling around in a warm blanket of nostalgia.
"Afterlife" was a film built specifically for people who had watched the original film enough times to have memorized it.
Some critics bristled at the nostalgic pandering (especially at the posthumous appearance of Ramis, recreated with CGI over actor Bob Gunton), but "Afterlife" was an enormous hit, making almost $200 million internationally.
As was described in Ozzy Inguanzo's book "Ghostbusters: Afterlife: The Art and Making of the Movie," a lot of these details were culled from collectors, investigated on fan forums, and even purchased on eBay using several secret accounts set up solely for this purpose.', 'I just found out the hard way there is a 40 item limit when combining items into one invoice on eBay.
Once you combine those items any additional items to the same buyer cannot be invoiced.
When you try to invoice any extra items, the system displays the original 40 item invoice and you have no way of generating another invoice.
I’m assuming I should be able to generate a second invoice after the buyer pays the first invoice but I haven’t been able to try it yet.
Really seems strange they would limit this but hey it gets them more transactions fees right?', 'eBayHallelujah, June is finally here.
And with it comes sunny days, hot weather, and time spent outdoors.
No matter what you’re doing when you’re outside, you need to stay cool with an ice cold drink.
That’s where a 12-ounce can insulator comes in, like this stainless steel one from Thermos that’s on sale right now at eBay for just $11.']

title: ['The eBay of Web3: Interview With Colle, The Luxury Goods Marketplace Bringing Digital Inventory To Ethere - Benzinga', 'Adult bed rails sold at Walmart, Amazon, eBay linked to multiple deaths, feds say - Fox Business']
summary:
['Colle announced plans to accrue $15 million in digital inventory for its luxury marketplace exclusively with Benzinga.
Colle plans to bootstrap its digital inventory with NFTs representing luxury goods, focusing on high-end watches upon launch.
The Colle marketplace is a Web3 startup designed for luxury collectors.
The purpose of Colle is to integrate traditional collectibles with the digital world in a way that empowers sellers and protects buyers.
Colle plans to use Ethereum at launch, and it is exploring other chains to operate on in tandem.', 'The U.S. Consumer Product Safety Commission (CPSC) is calling on consumers to "immediately stop using" certain Mobility Transfer Systems adult portable bed rails have been linked to three elderly deaths.
The independent federal regulatory agency's warning covers 10 models, approximately 285,000 bed rails, which can "create an entrapment hazard and pose a risk of serious injury or death to users," according to the warning notice.
During an evaluation of the bed rails, which were sold at major retailers across the nation, the agency found "that consumers can become entrapped between the bed rail and mattress, or within portions of the bed rail itself, leading to asphyxia."
Still, the two companies that manufactured and sold the bed rails since 1992, Mobility Transfer Systems Inc. manufactured followed by Metal Tubing USA Inc., have yet to "recall the bed rails and to offer a remedy to consumers," the agency said.
The bed rails were sold online through various retailers including Walmart.com, Amazon.com, MTSMedicalSupply.com, VitalityMedical.com and Alimed.com, according to the warning notice.']

title: ['24" Widescreen CRT (FW900) From Ebay arrived,Comments. | Page ... - HardForum', 'Rare Apple-1 Signed by Steve Wozniak Up for Auction on Ebay - The Mac Observer', "EBay Wear 'em out sneaker store sold collectible kicks at discount - AdAge.com", "Offset on eBay’s Wear 'Em Out Store, Virgil Abloh, and His Grail Sneaker - Complex"]
summary:
["When it all arrives and I get to test them, I'll report here.I also spent quite some time trying to figure out all the solutions we have to output interlaced resolutions.
I thought well, I don't remember ever testing interlaced resolutions on that PC, let's try that out!
I was able to output something interlaced, but none of my DisplayPort adapters were able to produce any useable picture.
Which might mean the GPU really can't output proper interlaced resolutions from the DisplayPort interface.- That previous experiment led me to an idea.
To start off, I had to have a monitor (or at least a dummy HDMI plug or something) also plugged in to the recent card.", 'An original and functional Apple-1 computer is currently up for auction on eBay.
The model currently available through auction is known as the “Schlumberger 2” Apple-1 and has had a full restoration to working condition.
Original ‘Schlumberger 2’ Apple-1 on eBayAs this is one of only dozens of Apple-1 computers remaining, the device is said to contain “one of the few remaining Apple-1 boards that is almost completely original and in an operational state”.
This particular Apple-1 goes by “Schlumberger 2” Apple-1.
The particular Apple-1 for sale features a signature by Steve Wozniak from 2021, who chose to sign the CPU.', 'Once registered, you can:- Read additional free articles each month- Comment on articles and featured creative work- Get our curated newsletters delivered to your inboxfirst_name:last_name:email:Register NowBy registering you agree to our privacy policy, terms & conditions and to receive occasional emails from Ad Age.
You may unsubscribe at any time.
Are you a print subscriber?
Activate your account.', 'Two blocks are filled with people lined up waiting for eBay’s Wear ‘Em Out store to open.
The hype is real, with exclusive pricing on collectible kicks to those who wear them out of the store.
The outside of eBay’s Wear ‘Em Out store.
I was like R.I.P., like he’s gone, so I didn’t want to wear ‘em but me knowing my boy Virgil, he would want me to wear ‘em so I threw them on and this is my first day wearing them.
You just got a Virgil tattoo, can you speak to the influence he had on you and the sneaker world as a whole?']

title: ['eBay Vault is the Future of Ownership and Collectible Investing - PSFK', 'eBay Works on Mending New Listing Tool but Hits a Snag - EcommerceBytes']
summary:
['The popular online platform is pinning its future to an innovative reimagination of the eBay marketplace as a self-contained e-commerce ecosystem.
The potential of this innovative, high-value asset marketplace is significant for both buyers and sellers.
Within the eBay Vault, sellers will have the ability to sell partial or fractional ownership of their collectibles, enabling buyers to own a piece of collectible and even sell that fractional ownership to another buyer on eBay.
The most likely path for this style of fractional ownership will be through object-tethered NFTs on the eBay digital marketplace.
+++This article originally appeared in the PSFK iQ report, Fractional Ownership.', 'Sellers have pleaded for weeks for eBay to fix its new listing tool foisted upon them last month, and last week, they reported signs of improvement in the tool.
One vocal critic of the listing tool praised eBay on Thursday for changes that rolled out last week:"I have been very vocal and critical of the new unified listing tool as it was released on a desktop so I wanted to give credit where credit is due.
"They just updated the Item specifics section to more closely resemble the classic listing tool.
), but this listing tool must work and function as efficiently as the classic and be optimized to give us a superior desktop experience."
Let us know if eBay requires you to use the new listing tool and if you have any problems with it.']

title: ['Love Island 2022: How and why Ebay is kitting out the contestants - British GQ', 'EBay’s First Love Island Ads Put Second-hand Clothing In The ... - The Drum', "EBay urges Love Island viewers to find 'pre-love of your life' - CampaignLive", 'Get a new Xbox Series X bundle from eBay and save $150 - SFGATE', "PSA: Please don't buy a Pixel 6a from a random online Facebook or ... - Chrome Unboxed", 'Google Pixel 7 Prototypes Are Being Sold On eBay, Facebook Months Before Launch - Indiatimes.com']
summary:
["In previous seasons of Love Island the contestants have worn, among their own items, pieces of clothing given to them by fast-fashion giant I Saw It First, which sells clothes for as little as £2.80.
In a surprise shift, ITV has ditched its relationship with the Boohoo-owned brand and has instead partnered with eBay for the upcoming season of the popular dating show.
For the next two months fans of Love Island, which lands back on screens tonight at 9pm, can expect to see both male and female contestants in pre-loved clothing sourced from the world's biggest resell site.
How did the partnership between Love Island, yourself and eBay come about?
This was about two months ago and it's been non-stop since - I was asked to source pre-loved clothing across menswear and womenswear for Love Island.", 'To mark its first partnership with hit show Love Island, eBay has launched a campaign to showcase the benefits of pre-worn clothing.
For years the stars of reality show Love Island have been clothed in the newest wares from some of the biggest fashion brands.
It is part of a wider campaign to highlight the benefits of previously-worn clothing, both from a style and sustainability point of view.
Crucially, in order to help spread the message that sustainable clothing is accessible to everyone, ITV is also integrating a link to eBay’s clothing page via the ’Shop the Show’ tab on the official Love Island app.
Shoppers can also dress like the Islanders and get their own ‘Pre-Love Island look’ on the dedicated Love Island hub.', 'EBay urges Love Island viewers to find ‘pre-love of your life’Show contestants will have access to eBay pre-loved wardrobe in the villa.
by Ben Bold', 'EBAYThe Xbox Series X has been notoriously hard to find in stock ever since its release.
With this deal from eBay, you can get a 1TB Xbox Series X with a few extra goodies for $152 off the normal price.
The Xbox Series X is the fastest and most powerful Xbox console ever produced and enables you to play your favorite games at the highest settings.
This includes 4K UHD and 120 frames per second thanks to the 12 teraflops of processing power it has.
It also creates advanced 3D spatial sound that will make you feel like you’re truly in the game you’re playing.', 'For most people, this goes without saying, but given the events of the last week concerning Google’s two upcoming phones, I feel like we need to state it anyway: don’t buy unreleased phones from Ebay or Facebook if you actually intend to use the device for anything.
After the random Pixel 7 being sold on Ebay (and then being remotely wiped by Google afterward), it looks like a Google reseller in Malaysia decided to take their inventory and put it on Facebook right away.
Google has already shown the ability to remotely shut down their phones, and I don’t think they will hesitate to do so every time this happens.
We know just as much as anyone else that getting your hands on new tech before others is a bit of a rush.
Long story short, exercise a bit of patience with these things and don’t waste your hard-earned cash on something that will likely be useless in a matter of days.', "Google Pixel 7 Pro prototypes are being sold on eBay, the Facebook marketplace, reveal reports by The Verge.
While it isn't surprising that Google’s Pixel devices have a tendency to leak in the most bizarre of ways, this truly is a rather weird one.
In case you didn’t know, this wasn’t the first Pixel 7 device to be sold unofficially online.
A few days back, someone on eBay had reportedly revealed that they were selling a Pixel 7.
This isn't surprising considering Google has safeguards in place to protect its confidential data."]

title: ['eBay Launches Its Vault for Trading Cards - PR Newswire', 'eBay Opens the Vault to Collectible Trading Cards - EcommerceBytes', 'Love Island gives peek at eBay pre loved-looks set to feature in ITV ... - Oxford Mail', 'eBay Forces Refund Despite Buyer Giving Wrong Address - EcommerceBytes']
summary:
['Beginning today, single, graded trading cards $750+ are eligible for eBay vault access.
eBay launches its vault for trading cards, a 31-thousand square foot, 24/7 secured, temperature controlled facility and digital marketplace for collectors.
The eBay Vault for Trading Cards: How it WorksWhen a service-eligible purchase is made, the buyer instantly becomes the owner once the card passes authentication, and can choose to keep their card stored in the eBay vault or withdraw.
Shop trading cards and learn more about the eBay vault at www.ebay.com/vault .
eBay Trading Cards By the NumbersIn 2021, Trading Cards GMV more than doubled pre-pandemic levels.', 'eBay officially launched its new eBay Vault program that allows buyers and sellers to store their collectible trading cards in a physical warehouse operated by the marketplace.
Beginning today, single, graded trading cards that sell for $750 or higher are eligible for eBay vault access – and soon, eBay Vault will accept direct submissions.
eBay will display a badge next to listings that are stored in the eBay Vault to provide them with greater visibility.
eBay launches its vault for trading cards, a 31-thousand square foot, 24/7 secured, temperature controlled facility and digital marketplace for collectors.
Starting today, single, graded trading cards sold for $750+ are eligible for the service.', "As a result of this partnership, Love Island has ended its previous deal with the chain I Saw It First.
I’ve said it every year “I wish the islanders would wear preloved clothes” - I can’t believe you’re making it happen.
eBay x Love Island partnership.
It wouldn't be 2022 fashion without Harry Styles whose personal style will influence the Blurred Lines edit.
Love Island x eBay pre loved clothes partnership.", 'The buyer filed an item not received claim.
It was closed in my favor because the buyer gave an incorrect / invalid shipping address.
When the buyer does this they are not covered by the eBay money back guarantee so it was found in my favor.
Number of days later, eBay reversed the outcome for the item not received claim and stole my money and gave it all to the buyer.
I phoned eBay (again) and explained they violated their own money back guarantee rules and policies.']

title: ["Even Sellers Don't Know How to Sign up for eBay Store Newsletters - EcommerceBytes", "Pair of 'UK's rarest' 50p coins sells for £350 on eBay amid 'collecting craze' - Lincolnshire Live", 'Oasis mega fan bags £60k on eBay for blades of grass from Liam Gallagher gig - Daily Star', 'Woman Accidentally Posts Nude Selfie on eBay Selling Air Fryer - PopCrush', 'EBay Sellers Face 1099-K Tax Headache Under New IRS Rule - Bloomberg', 'Love Island 2022 partners with eBay for pre-loved fashion - our top five picks - Daily Record', "James Blunt Sold His Sister on eBay, but That Isn't the Most ... - Showbiz Cheat Sheet", 'eBay’s vault protects physical trading cards so you can buy and sell ... - The Verge', 'eBay Lets Buyer Wait 548 Days to Report Item Not Received - EcommerceBytes']
summary:
['One of the benefits of paying a subscription fee to have an eBay Store is that you can send newsletters to customers who choose to sign-up to receive them.
But during a chat session hosted by eBay on Wednesday, it became clear even sellers don’t know how to sign up to receive newsletters.
Chuck Van Pelt is Product Operations Manager for eBay Stores and was answering questions during the chat session.
He has been at eBay for 6 years and joined the eBay Stores team in June of 2021.
If I started getting newsletters from every one of those sellers I would stop following them or opt out of all e-mails.', 'The pair of 2009 Kew Gardens coins are the latest in a long list of super-rare coins making their owners a small fortune in 2022.
The Kew Gardens 50p is described by the Royal Mint as "one of the most iconic and loved" coins to ever be minted.
The coin was released in 2009 to mark 250 years since Kew Gardens opened in 1759.
The Royal Mint suggests that the Kew Gardens 50p is the coin that "collectors go crazy for."
And it's easy to see what they mean when you look at just how many of these coins have sold for high amounts on eBay already this year.', "An Oasis mega fan could receive a whopping £60,000 after he put blades of grass from a Liam Gallagher gig on eBay.
David Watson, from Stourbridge, West Midlands, was left gobsmacked after he jokingly uploaded the unusual memorabilia and started to gain more than 100 bids.
(Image: David Watson / SWNS)And when he got home, on Sunday (June 5), he decided to stick the grass on the online auction site for a laugh as he had promised.
(Image: David Watson / SWNS)“It went to about £50, and I text my girlfriend and said, 'You’ll never believe this'.
Starry-eyed David said he began reading up on eBay’s terms and conditions concerning buyers' obligations after the price of the grass began to skyrocket.", 'A British woman was left "shaking with panic" after she mistakenly posted a naked selfie while trying to market and sell her air fryer on eBay.
According to The World News, Jones scrolled back to her post to see what it was in her advertisement that would have prompted such odd responses.
She was horrified to realize she mistakenly posted a full-length naked mirror selfie as the fifth image in her listing.
"I checked the list after about 24 hours, but I had only 5 views and wasn't interested," Jones said.
According to The World News, Jones deleted the nude photos immediately, but her post continued to gain popularity, leading her to eventually delete the entire listing.', 'Why did this happen?
Please make sure your browser supports JavaScript and cookies and that you are not blocking them from loading.
For more information you can review our Terms of Service and Cookie Policy.', "Love Love Island?
And that's not all that is new this year, as Love Island has officially decided to ditch fast-fashion and go sustainable with pre-loved clothing.
To help style the pre-loved collection eBay UK enlisted the help of celebrity stylist and second-hand enthusiast Amy Bannerman, whose clients include Dua Lipa, Rita Ora and Jonathan Van Ness.
Shoppers interested in changing their shopping habits can head to the Love Island app or eBay website where they can find second-hand outfits inspired by this year's looks.
You can shop the full Love Island x eBay collection on the eBay website or through the Love Island app.", "James Blunt Sold His Sister on eBay, but That Isn’t the Most Surprising Part of the StoryJames Blunt burst onto the music scene in 2004.
James Blunt shot to stardom with the song ‘You’re Beautiful’James Blunt in 2011 | Hayley Madden/WireImageBlunt is an unlikely star, but his love for music runs deep.
'”What did James Blunt say about selling his sister on eBay?
Singer James Blunt auctioned his sister off on eBay.
That was the stupidest thing I’ve ever sold on eBay — my sister.”Other bizarre celebrity auctionsJames Blunt isn’t the only celebrity involved in a weird transaction.", 'Consider dusting off your attic shoeboxes filled with baseball cards; eBay might have a new home for some of them soon.
The pioneering online marketplace site built a new 31,000-square-foot facility, called the eBay Vault, which is open now to house graded trading cards that are valued at over $750 and, in the future, physical collectibles of all kinds.
The launch of the eBay Vault comes hot on the heels of its Authenticity Guarantee push, where it expanded from validating sneakers over $100 to partnering with Professional Sports Authenticator (PSA) to grade trading cards valued at over $2,000.
eBay is so far only accepting trading cards purchased on their site that are already graded by a list of reputable organizations like PSA and Sportscard Guaranty Corporation.
Unlike NFTs, you can withdraw and smell your aging cardboard cutoutOnce a trading card purchase happens, the buyer can have the trading card sent to the eBay Vault, where it will not only be stored but also be available to resell without shipping the asset around.', "A seller awoke today to find an Item Not Received claim for an eBay order.
The kicker: he mailed the item 548 days ago.
30 days to let the seller know they didn't receive their item: We immediately checked eBay's help page for buyers who haven't received their item.
eBay states buyers haveto let the seller know they didn't receive their item:Let the seller know your item hasn't arrivedIf the estimated delivery date for your item has passed, and you still haven't received your item, let the seller know.
You have 30 days from the estimated delivery date to inform the seller that you didn't receive your item."]

title: ['Camera sale shemozzle puts focus on how eBay policies affect sellers - CBC.ca', 'Lakshimi Duraivenkatesh of eBay is a 2022 Women of Influence ... - The Business Journals', 'Save on an Xbox Series S bundle from eBay with this promo code - SFGATE']
summary:
['Alan Tessier sold a Canon 90D camera on eBay in late February, but the buyer said it wasn't what they wanted and received a refund.
Tessier was in limbo for months without the camera or payment, until Monday when eBay sent him his money back.
The Ottawa resident sold his Canon 90D camera in late February and shipped it to the buyer, who purchased it through the eBay marketplace.
The person in London, Ont., who bought the camera shared pictures with Tessier showing the camera was dirty, not the "pristine" condition he'd mailed it in.
Alan Tessier holds the camera he purchased after selling his Canon 90D on eBay.', '', 'EbayWith the global shortages of gaming consoles, we’re always happy to see a great sale on a console that doesn’t have scalper prices.
Thankfully, this Xbox Series S is going for $253.30 with promo code "TECHGIFTSFORDAD" on eBay and comes with "Fortnite," "Rocket League," 1,000 V-Bucks, 1,000 "Rocket League" credits, and a few other perks.
If you’re unfamiliar with the difference between Xbox Series S and Series X, the long and short of it is that the Series S is not as powerful as the Series X, with the former having 4 TFLOPs of power and the latter having 12 TFLOPs.
The other big difference is that the Series S comes without a disc drive, which means all your gaming content is delivered through your internet rather than a disc.']

A third fed-up person said: "Trying to explode everyone who got a Hellfire Club shirt with my mind.', "These include a chance to save on Sonos speakers, iPhone 13, iPad keyboards, and other products that could make good gifts for Father's Day.

Another lamented: "Every Primark in my whole county is sold out of Hellfire Club t-shirts.
