title: ["You Can List Items on eBay that Aren't Yet Available - EcommerceBytes"]
summary:
['The reason for eBay allowing such long handling time has to do with sought after items like PlayStation consoles.
While manufacturers and brands allow customers to place pre-orders to reserve products prior to their scheduled release date, eBay allows sellers to also cash in on new-product hype through its Presale policy.
On July 8th, an eBay moderator responded to questions raised on its discussion board about the longer handling time and said eBay would be updating the presale policy to reflect the new 40-day timeframe.
Sellers can get peeved when they see what looks like abuses of eBay’s Presale policy.
An eBay moderator replied and said, “Reporting an item will result in a review and appropriate action taken.']

title: ["Microsoft's secret plastic Surface Duo leaks on eBay - The Verge", "Riding High on SEA's E-Commerce Revolution: 68% of eBay ... - PR Newswire Asia", 'eBay UK Goes Nuclear on VAT Compliance Issue - EcommerceBytes', 'Miles Teller chooses $25K worth of iconic baseball cards to be stored in eBay vault - KTLA Los Angeles', 'Charities urged to enter eBay Business Awards with £10000 prize ... - UK Fundraising']
summary:
['Microsoft was reportedly planning to launch a more affordable plastic version of the Surface Duo 2, and images appear to have leaked on eBay of the device.
Microsoft was reportedly making changes to the form factor of the Surface Duo 2 to position this as a lower-cost model.
The leaked Surface Duo 2 plastic device.
This isn’t the first time Surface Duo photos have leaked, with images appearing online ahead of the Surface Duo 2 launch last year.
Microsoft is now working on bringing Android 12L to existing Surface Duo 2 devices instead of shipping this more affordable Surface Duo 2 later this year.', "Across the six countries featured in the Report, an astounding 68% of eBay-enabled small businesses exported to 10 or more international markets.
As a whole, the region's eBay-enabled small business community made sales in 214 international markets in 2020.
These SMEs exporting on eBay have the reach of large enterprises, serving customers in an average of 25 different international markets on an annual basis.
The top 5 export markets for SMEs in Southeast Asia on eBay are United States, Australia, United Kingdom, Germany, and Canada.
That's why we organized a joint programme entitled 'Empowering SMEs: E-commerce Exports in Southeast Asia' to help increase awareness and bring together industry experts and government partners.", "UK sellers say eBay removed all of their listings over a VAT compliance issue they blame on the company, which had previously told them a notice of noncompliance was a glitch.
On gov uk my vat registered name is (Redacted) on eBay my business name is (Redacted) followed by my name so because they didn't match I was wiped off eBay all my sales history watchers etc.
Sellers shared how they were impacted on the eBay UK discussion boards.
However the VAT registered name is my personal name.
We did not find a response on the boards from eBay UK itself.", 'The MLB All-Star break is underway, and actor Miles Teller kicked it off by collecting some legendary baseball cards.
“Baseball cards, you know it’s the same thing, man.
“For any baseball fan who collects cards, or any card collector, the vault is a big move forward in the collectible industry,” Director of Trading Cards at eBay Bob Means explained.
Just last month he shocked fans with his talent when he threw out the first pitch at a Phillies game.
The All-Star Game is being held at Dodger Stadium this year.', 'Charities urged to enter eBay Business Awards with £10,000 prize availableThe eBay for Business Awards are back and open to charities to enter for 2022, with a cash prize of £10,000.
The eBay for Business Awards celebrate and reward business owners, social enterprises and charities.
eBay is keen for as many charities to apply as possible, and applications close at midnight on 27 July.
Entry is free of charge via the eBay for Business Awards page, and this page also includes guidance, tips on how to optimise your entry, and the awards application form itself.
A package of tailored business benefits including a free anchor store subscription and enhanced growth support from dedicated eBay team members.']

title: ['eBay Reassures Sellers that USPS Discounts Will Remain - EcommerceBytes', 'California warns of potential eBay scams | Scam of the Week - Chico Enterprise-Record', 'Collectables cash in: Woolworths Fix-ems on sale for hundreds online - 9Honey']
summary:
['An article in Linn’s Stamp News on Friday had online sellers scrambling to find out if they would lose postage discounts when they purchase USPS labels on online marketplaces and postage providers.
Amazon told EcommerceBytes on Saturday that the end of the USPS Reseller program scheduled for October would have no impact to Amazon or its sellers, and on Tuesday, eBay posted the following announcement on the Shipping area of its online discussion boards:“Hi everyone!
We know there has been some chatter and concern over the possibility of the USPS ending discount programs and we’d like to assure you that any changes made will not impact the eBay label rates for USPS.”As we had reported on Friday, there’s a difference between the USPS Reseller program that incentivizes companies for bringing business from “smaller” shippers that the USPS’s own sales force does not attract and the ePostage and PC Postage Provider programs like those from Stamps.com (Auctane), Pitney Bowes, and online marketplaces that accommodate shippers such as online sellers.
Auctane has yet to respond to our request for comment; Pitney Bowes declined to comment.', 'CHICO — Continuing from last week’s column regarding Facebook Marketplace and Craigslist, this week let’s turn our attention to scammers on eBay.
Some ways to avoid this kind of scam, besides always being vigilant, start with staying on eBay’s website where there are safeguards, direct payment methods and some level of accountability.
If you think you’ve been scammed or you think someone is trying to scam you, report them to eBay’s customer support page.
Scam of the Week generally runs every Tuesday.
Readers are welcome to contact reporter Jake Hutchison to report scams and potential scams they have come in contact with by calling 828-1329 or via email at jhutchison@chicoer.com.', "Just weeks after Woolworths launched its new collectables range, savvy parents are attempting to sell them online for hundreds of dollars.
A search today found a set of Woolworths Fix-ems on sale on eBay for an eye-watering $399 while another seller was offering 50 unopened packs for $200.
READ MORE: Disney adult shares creative baby name planParents are attempting to cash in on their Woolworths and Coles collectables.
READ MORE: Osher Günsberg's confession about the mental load of fatherhoodParents are attempting to cash in on their Woolworths and Coles collectables.
Customers receive one free Coles Magical Builder character with every $30 spent in one transaction at Coles supermarkets, Coles Online and Coles Express."]

title: ['eBay Store No Longer Worth the Fees for One Seller - EcommerceBytes', 'eBay Seeks Strategic Partners for Its Affiliate Program - EcommerceBytes', 'eBay Launches Authentication for Fine Jewelry - PR Newswire', 'eBay Store No Longer Worth the Fees for One Seller - EcommerceBytes', 'eBay Missing-Description Glitch Could Result in SNAD Claims - EcommerceBytes', "'Arghh' you looking for a boat? Well, a Gasparilla pirate ship was going for $25K on eBay - WTSP.com", 'What do TikTok, Bunnings, eBay and Netflix have in common? They’re all hyper-collectors - The Conversation Indonesia']
summary:
["Dear Ina,After 15+ years I closed my eBay store.
I finally got fed up with the constant fee hikes, paying a monthly store subscription and eBay's not caring about Sellers and a variety of issues.
I'm continuing to list on other sites and may even occasionally list on Greedbay.
Yes, Greedbay does have better exposure than other venues but their competitors don't charge listing fees and no final value fees for shipping.
I'm tired of seeing the money I make on sales go mostly for fees.", 'eBay has a new head of business development for its affiliate program.
David Ferrell joined eBay last month and, according to his bio, is charged with spearheading the growth of eBay’s Partner Network base by identifying and onboarding new, strategic partnerships.
In an email to affiliates on Tuesday, the director of the eBay Partner Network (ePN) Reanne Berkstresser said Ferrell would “focus on building our network, diversifying our product offering to enable expansion with current partners, and develop new marketing partnership opportunities.”Berkstresser also said third-quarter holiday planning was in full swing, and she said eBay was planning “exciting updates and improvements” for the affiliate program for 2023.
The better eBay can incentivize affiliates to drive shoppers to the site, the better for sellers – will a new team (Berkstresser became director of ePN in March) revitalize the program?', '"Collaborating with eBay on its Authentication Guarantee extends our mission, helping to protect the millions of eBay fine jewelry buyers and sellers."
By the end of 2022, jewelry authentication will roll out to all eligible listings and identified brands on the platform, making it easier and more trusted than ever to browse and buy fine jewelry on the marketplace.
Details on the jewelry authentication process are as follows:Multi-point inspection by experts: Jewelry is examined for authenticity by GIA experts with years of industry experience and knowledge.
Shoppers can visit eBay.com/authenticjewelry to browse and buy from a selection of new and pre-owned fine jewelry marked with an Authenticity Guarantee badge.
eBay Jewelry By the NumbersOn average, there are 7.8 million fine jewelry listings on eBay every dayeBay sold 8 fine jewelry items every minute in 2021In 2021, eBay sold over 4.2 million fine jewelry itemsPurchases of fine jewelry from brands like Chopard, Harry Winston and Hermes are +38% YoY in the past six monthsand Hermes are +38% YoY in the past six months Sales of poplar herringbone style bracelets and necklaces are up 48% and 26% respectively YoYAbout eBayeBay Inc. (Nasdaq: EBAY) is a global commerce leader that connects people and builds communities to create economic opportunity for all.', "Dear Ina,After 15+ years I closed my eBay store.
I finally got fed up with the constant fee hikes, paying a monthly store subscription and eBay's not caring about Sellers and a variety of issues.
I'm continuing to list on other sites and may even occasionally list on Greedbay.
Yes, Greedbay does have better exposure than other venues but their competitors don't charge listing fees and no final value fees for shipping.
I'm tired of seeing the money I make on sales go mostly for fees.", 'eBay sellers worried about the problem of Item Not as Described ("SNAD") claims just had their anxiety levels raised after eBay acknowledged a glitch impacting mobile shoppers.
There are at least 7 posts on the eBay Technical Issues board as of early this morning reporting the same problem: missing descriptions when viewing eBay listings on mobile devices.
Having our listings show the details we spent a lot of time measuring and typing would be super helpful with growth."
Sellers might do well to document sales they make during the event and refer to it if they receive claims from customers reporting the items were not as described.
Sellers began reporting the problem late on Tuesday evening.', 'Example video title will go here for this videoTAMPA, Fla. — Picture this: You're scrolling aimlessly on eBay, looking for something to open your wallet for and suddenly you come across something you've only dreamed of — a Gasparilla pirate ship float.
In a listing titled "Parade Float Pirate Ship Float," the used ship was going for $25,000.
Tampa Bay Times explains the pirate ship float, named Vanity, actually belongs to the Bonney-Read Krewe, which is a 28-year-old all-woman krewe.
And they are planning on building a new float for Gasparilla hence why this boat was up for sale.
“I did show our float to a business who was interested, but they wanted a building and not a ship,” she said to the media outlet.', 'By failing to take our digital privacy seriously – as former human rights commissioner Ed Santow has warned – Australia is “sleepwalking” its way into mass surveillance.
When you watch Netflix, for example, the company knows what you watch, when you watch it, and how long you watch it for.
Digital privacy laws and hyper-collectionHyper-collection is a major problem in Australia for three reasons.
Unlike a physical store, we don’t get a lot of choice about consenting to digital companies’ privacy policies and how they collect our information.
No matter which option we take, Australians need to start getting more savvy with their data privacy.']

title: ['The Best Hyped Collabs To Cop On eBay Right Now - Complex', 'Miles Teller Just Scored $24,000 Worth of Baseball Cards on eBay - Yahoo Entertainment', 'How much extra eBay charges sellers in hidden fees on returned items - inews', "How to cancel bid on eBay: It's possible, what you need to know - USA TODAY", 'Good Reason To Install The Ebay App On Your Mobile Phone - Brand Spur - BrandSpur Nigeria', 'Exclusive: Durban venture capitalists buy Gumtree SA from eBay ... - Moneyweb']
summary:
['Thanks to the rise of the internet, exclusive sneaker collaborations can no longer be perceived as hidden secrets confined to Reddit pages or exclusive raffle releases.
That’s where eBay comes in.
The online marketplace has long been the go-to for sneaker drops, with its wide range of listings and super niche releases.
With this in mind, we took to eBay to look for the slickest recent collaborative kicks.
Scroll down to check our top 5 picks, available on the site right now.', 'Before he was flying fighter jets in Top Gun: Maverick, Miles Teller wanted to be a pro baseball player.
Although his dreams of the diamond may have been sidelined, Teller recently revisited his love for trading baseball cards: eBay tapped Teller to help launch its new vault, a climate-controlled, insured, and security-protected storage facility trading cards worth more than $500.
Whether you’re buying sports cards or valuable game cards, traders can now buy cards online, have them authenticated by eBay, and store in the vault for safekeeping.
More from Rolling StoneMiles Teller with Chase Utley - Credit: eBayeBayBuy:Trading CardsateBayTo kick off the vault’s opening, Teller and Phillies legend Chase Utley picked out five baseball cards worth almost $24,000 to keep in the eBay vault, in front of an audience in downtown Los Angeles.
“My dad and I would always get a box of cards for Christmas, and I bought and sold cards off eBay throughout the years,” says Teller.', 'The 4 per cent fee totalled £45.32 – an amount he otherwise would have been able to bank.
He said: “This fee is totally excessive and is in addition to the normal eBay fees charged.
One person said: “On my selling ID, I am suddenly being charged “Additional 4 per cent fee for Very High ‘Item not as described’ rates”.
An eBay spokesperson said: “At eBay, we have high expectations for the level of service our sellers provide.
When sellers improve their performance then these measures will be removed.”What are the normal eBay fees?', 'Can’t find the “cancel bid button” on the item listing page?
How to cancel a bid on eBayAfter you’ve submitted your bid, you won’t see a cancellation option on the product page.
How to cancel an eBay orderCan I cancel my eBay bid?
According to eBay, you’re allowed to retract your bid if the seller changed the item description significantly or if you accidentally bid the wrong amount.
But if fewer than 12 hours remain, you can only cancel a bid you placed within the last hour, according to eBay.', 'It is a kind of silent frustration that affects our work performance, our mood, and more generally every practical aspect of our lives.
A simple solutionThe good news is that the solution is at hand, and accessible to anyone.
It may sound paradoxical, but the potential of our mobile phones is still hugely underestimated.
Others just use it as a substitute for the TV, even using it on board trains or public transport to watch their favourite shows.
All of them are not only wasting countless amounts of useful time, they are blatantly using their mobile phones in a totally improper and unproductive way.', '']

title: ['eBay Silences Sellers Who Apply to Its Refurb Program - EcommerceBytes']

When Bumstead was forced to either change his listings for refurbished goods to "used" condition or else stop selling them on eBay entirely, he decided to apply for the program.
This would prevent him from talking about the program for 3 years - even if eBay did not ultimately accept him into the program.
"Refurbishers can apply for "eBay Refurbished", but to do so they must abandon their right to free speech for 3 years, something I personally find unacceptable," he said.']

title: ['Where Is Option for USPS Insurance on eBay Shipping Labels? - EcommerceBytes']
summary:
['Dear Ina,I noticed today when I printed a label on eBay that I could no longer choose USPS insurance, only Shipsurance.
Previously there was a dropdown menu that gave me a choice.
I liked using USPS, even though it is more expensive, because it included the word "Insured" on the label, where Shipsurance purchased insurance doesn't show up on the label.
Also, I don't have the same confidence about a claim with Shipsurance as I do with my local PO where I have known my Postmaster for more than a decade.
I wonder why they took that option away?']

title: ["Don't Bid on Choco Tacos on eBay Just Yet - The Takeout", 'Is eBay Stock a Buy Right Now? - The Motley Fool', 'EBay’s former Chinese subsidiary EachNet to close down - AIM Group']
summary:
['People wasted no time listing the Choco Tacos they had stored away in their freezers on eBay for big markups.
AdvertisementChoco Taco eBay listings are piling upWithin just a few days of the announcement of the Choco Taco’s demise, listings for the last remaining ones on the market went up on eBay, as well as listings for Choco Taco– related merchandise.
It’s evident some Choco Taco fans are trying to stock up on the frozen treats while they still can.
One listing on eBay has a box of 24 Choco Tacos priced at $140.50 (plus $9.85 for expedited shipping) with six bids already in place.
Another listing has 25 Choco tacos listed for $152.50 and has one bidder already willing to pay that exact price.', "eBay (EBAY 2.82%) is one of the pioneers of e-commerce.
It's easy to forget that for several years eBay controlled a more significant share of the online sales market than Amazon.
Let's look at its performance, weigh that against its valuation, and answer if investors should buy eBay's stock right now.
eBay has room to expand profitsThe primary reason why investing in eBay is less risky than Amazon is because eBay runs an asset-light business model.
For these reasons, it can be a wonderful time to buy eBay stock.", 'According to an announcement, consumer auction site EachNet.com will cease operations in mid-August.
“We have adjusted our company’s operating strategy and decided to close the EBay network platform (EachNet.com) down,” read a notice available on EachNet.com, formerly owned by EBay.
In April 2012, the group, however, divested from EachNet by selling it to Chinese media conglomerate Tom Group, according to the site’s information.
South China Morning Post, citing a case study in 2008, said Alibaba-owned Taobao.com had 80% of the Chinese c-to-c market.
By 2012, its market share had climbed to 95%, whereas EachNet’s share had tumbled to 0.01%, according to PanDaily.']

title: ['How eBay is ramping up AI use in ecommerce behind the scenes - VentureBeat', 'Will eBay Offer Phonecheck Certification for Apple Watches Soon ... - eSeller365', 'eBay sees high growth potential in Malaysia, Thailand - Tech Wire Asia', 'Ebay assists Malaysian SMEs to export overseas - Digital News Asia']
summary:
['Learn MoreLow-code and no-code artificial intelligence (AI) tools and immersive 3D visualization are heralding the next age of ecommerce.
With low-code and no-code tools, sellers can scan items with their phones; images are then uploaded to the eBay cloud and converted to a 3D asset.
“They don’t need professional equipment of any kind,” said Nitzan Mekel-Bobrov, chief AI officer at eBay.
As Mekel-Bobrov explained, these next-generation ecommerce tools are enabled via the use of computer vision, image recognition, convolutional neural networks and fine grain image analysis.
Democratizing AIMekel-Bobrov pointed out that eBay sellers are widely diverse — ranging from professional brands and large businesses, to mom-and-pops, to occasional sellers, rummagers and garage-sellers.', 'Earlier this year, eBay partnered with Phonecheck to enable eligible sellers to list refurbished Phonecheck-certified mobile devices on the marketplace.
Later in the release, the company said: “Consumers will begin to see Phonecheck Certified Apple Watches on popular refurbished marketplaces and websites in the coming weeks and months.”What About eBay?
Eligible eBay sellers can already list Apple Watches on the marketplace with the ‘eBay Refurbished’ badge if they meet eBays’ refurbished program conditions.
The Apple Watch Phonecheck service would provide additional features and trust for buyers if eBay picks up the new service.
Update 8/1/2022We heard back from a Phonecheck representative and they said Phonecheck service for Apple Watches is now available to eBay users as well.', 'Out of the six countries covered in the Southeast Asian market, 68% of eBay-enabled small businesses exported to 10 or more international markets.
The scenario however seems to be different in Southeast Asia, especially among countries like Indonesia, Malaysia, the Philippines, Singapore, Thailand, and Vietnam, according to eBay themselves.
HOW E-COMMERCE INTEGRATION HAS TRANSFORMED ONLINE RETAIL“Regionally, 99% of all eBay-enabled small businesses, many of them small firms, export.
In Indonesia, Thailand, and Vietnam, exporting is universal among eBay-enabled small businesses, while export rates exceed 97% in the other three markets studied.
When asked which country in the Southeast Asia region holds the most potential, Vidmay suggested Malaysia and Thailand.', "It noted that in Malaysia, SMEs account for 97.2% of total business establishments, contributing 38.2%, or more than US$115 billion (RM512.8 billion), to the country's GDP in 2020.
eBay said its global marketplace is uniquely positioned to offer Southeast Asian SMEs e-commerce export opportunities.
The report noted that seven of the top ten export markets for eBay-enabled small businesses in Malaysia are not in the top ten for traditional exporters.
It said the top five product categories exported by Malaysian sellers on eBay were: auto parts, home & garden, health & beauty, cell phones & accessories and collectibles.
The report indicated Malaysian sellers on eBay have seen strong growth in a number of categories in 2021."]

title: ['Walmart Joins eBay and Amazon in Promoting Certified Refurbs - EcommerceBytes']
summary:
['Walmart announced a new program called Walmart Restored offering like-new refurbished goods – and they won’t be tucked away in a corner of the website.
Walmart will display refurbished products in search results – and “online now and in select stores later this fall.”Walmart said all Walmart Restored products will be professionally inspected, tested and cleaned, and they will come with a 90-day free return window.
Rival Amazon.com has offered refurbished goods for years through Certified Refurbished on Amazon, which it rebranded to Amazon Renewed in 2017.
With supply chain issues, inflation, and fears of recession, refurbished goods are a golden opportunity for online marketplaces.
But sellers who don’t qualify for their certified programs must list their refurbs as “used” – will savvy shoppers catch on?']

title: ['EBAY: Bid for our 2022 Pride Jerseys! - Glasgow Clan', 'How to Scare an eBay Seller: Free-Shipping Display Glitch - EcommerceBytes', "I've Made Over $2,000 in 6 Months Flipping Legos on eBay - Business Insider", "eBay Blames End of Lockdowns for a 'Little' Drop in Sales - EcommerceBytes"]
summary:
['AllEBAY: Bid for our 2022 Pride Jerseys!
January 17, 2022We celebrated Pride Week 2022 on Friday 14th vs The Nottingham Panthers in our limited edition Pride jerseys, designed by Kirkpatrick Designs and produced by Warrior.
We thought they looked fantastic and you can get your hands on your favourite players game worn jersey NOW!
All of the jerseys are available NOW to bid on via our official eBay account HERE.
The auction will run for one week so get your bids in quick!', 'eBay found out how to scare sellers: display “free shipping” on their listings where they don’t offer it.
A seller who reached out to EcommerceBytes wrote, “On the mobile app, it shows that all my orders sold with FREE shipping.
“I never do free shipping and I didn’t notice when I printed shipping label.
She returned to the thread to report that eBay had collected shipping despite eBay showing free shipping on her sold listings.
eBay “free shipping” glitches are not unprecedented.', "When my son and I moved last year, I asked him to choose some old Legos to sell to make space.
I learned that eBay buyers will pay top dollar for certain sets and minifigures, so I started flipping them.
I figured if we could at least get some of the money back that we'd spent on these old sets, it'd be a good deal.
They often sell minifigures and sets at or above their value.
I've made over $2,000 in 6 monthsSince starting this project in February, I've made about $2,400 flipping Legos.", 'eBay said its sales as a whole have decreased a little, blaming it on the end of lockdowns worldwide and saying it saw the decline "across the board with online sales" in what appeared to be a reference to an industrywide trend.
The response from a forum moderator came in a thread that a seller started on the eBay discussion boards on May 18 titled, "Sudden drop in sales May 2022."
The moderator had compiled a list of sellers who asked eBay to look into why their sales had dropped and forwarded it to an "appropriate team" for review.
We speculate this is related to the end of lock-downs across most of the world as we see this across the board with online sales.
Both threads are well worth studying to understand what eBay sellers are reporting in terms of visibility to their listings.']

title: ["Why Does eBay's Strategy Result in Fewer Buyers? - EcommerceBytes", 'Selling on eBay get a collection & delivery? - Delivery Quote Compare', 'eBay’s Traveling Back To The Future In Style With Nike Dunk “DeLorean” Auction - Cassius', 'BMW 1-Series named fastest-selling used model by eBay Motors ... - Car Dealer Magazine']
summary:
['Is eBay's focus on high value buyers paying off?
But it begs the question, why would focusing on high value buyers turn other buyers away?
I've got the whole organization pivoted to focusing on those high value buyers; buyers that are buying over $800, buying six times a year, or buyers who sell."
Meanwhile Etsy CEO Josh Silverman and Chief Financial Officer Rachel Glaser have a different approach to buyers and are focused on retaining existing buyers, getting new buyers, and reactivating buyers.
In its earnings report last week, Etsy shared slides showing the total number of active buyers along with repeat buyers and habitual buyers - a more granular approach (and less offensive to buyers).', 'In this case, having an eBay delivery service come to your house can make things easier for both parties involved.
eBay collections and deliveriesYou can arrange a collection and delivery from delivery quote compare.
An eBay collection and delivery is a courier service provided by eBay to customers.
You can arrange for an eBay collection and delivery service by visiting delivery quote compare.
ConclusionHopefully, this blog post has helped you to understand what an eBay collection and delivery is.', 'Cassius Life Featured Video CLOSEIn 1981, the DeLorean Motor Company produced only one car during its initial seven-year existence, the DMC-12.
By the end of the following year, the DeLorean Motor Company was bankrupt, and the DMC-12 was considered one of the most expensive business flops ever.
So thanks to avid shoe collector Jordan Geller, creator of the sneaker museum ShoeZeum, fans of the film franchise can bid to win a DMC-12 of their own and land a matching pair of Nike 6.0 DeLorean Dunks, too.
According to the history report on eBay, this DeLorean has had five owners in its lifespan and no accidents.
Look at the pictures below to get a close-up look at the DMC-12 and Nike 6.0 DeLorean Dunks, and make your bid fast by clicking here!', 'The BMW 1-Series was the fastest-selling used car in July, according to new data from eBay Motors Group.
Statistics seen by Car Dealer reveal a strong customer demand for compact vehicles, with the top ten dominated by hatchbacks and city cars.
Also in the top ten were the Kia Sportage (17.9 days), the Peugeot 3008 (18.7 days) and the Vauxhall Adam (18.8 days).
Earlier today (August 1), eBay Motors Group revealed that days to sell across the board fell in July.
Used car prices fell for a sixth month in a row but remain well up on the same point last year.']

title: ['PRWeek 40 Under 40 2022 - Emilie Furda, eBay - PR Week', 'Pimp My Ride Resurrected As Branded Content Vehicle For EBay - The Drum', "Primark's new Greggs range being sold on eBay for five times its original price - Liverpool Echo", "Laura Whitmore's Love Island final outfit from eBay as host stuns fans with revelation - Chronicle Live"]
summary:
['', 'Pimp my Ride, MTV’s motoring makeover series from the early noughties, is being resurrected for modern audiences as part of a branded content push.
Sponsored by eBay, the returning show will screen as a six-part series on MTV UK’s YouTube channel from August 19, presenting new and returning fans with 15-minute mechanical makeovers overseen by rapper Lady Leshurr.
Announced hours after ITV’s resurrection of Big Brother, the surprise reprise – which will be supported by TV commercials running on Paramount UK channels – will show how historic vehicles can be made roadworthy again while surfacing eBay’s specialism in sourcing car parts and accessories.
Lindsey Jordan, head of media creativity at MediaCom UK, said: “Pimp My Ride completely changed how audiences viewed car ownership and fix-it-yourself improvements.
And this wasn’t just a unique opportunity to bring a renowned show back to our screens, but a chance to connect a global marketplace on eBay with a wider car-loving audience.', "Shoppers are cashing in on Primark's popular new range - and selling products for as much as five times their original price.
Over the last week, Greggs x Primark clothing has been appearing on eBay - with prices significantly higher than the original.
A number of sellers have also listed Greggs x Primark clogs for £26, despite being priced at £6 by the retailer.
A pair of Primark's Greggs logo shorts are listed at £20, though the retailer has them priced at £12.
The new Greggs x Primark collection launches in all stores nationwide on Friday, August 5.", 'Laura Whitmore stunned Love Island fans by revealing that the attention-grabbing outfit she wore for Monday's final was in fancy a second hand find from eBay.
And, rather than have to decide between 'love or money' after their winning moment, the couple knew they'd be getting a 50/50 split right from the start of the show, after Laura announced the 'split or steal' twist had been axed.
READ MORE: Laura Whitmore 'ruins' Love Island final with statement seconds inThe news did not go down well with Love Island fans online and just like Laura's big announcement at the top of the show, her final outfit also became a real talking point online.
Posting pictures of herself posing up a storm in the jumpsuit to her Instagram, Laura wrote "Right let’s do this….
Last year's Love Island finalist Faye Winter told her: "Unreal," while Cara Delivigne described the look as "Ridiculously amazing!!!"']

It arrived on 1 June but I was unable to get the pump fitted immediately due to the garage being full.

However, it re-iterated that as the issue was outside of the 30 days, it could not do anything further.
“Unfortunately in this case, your reader did not contact the seller within 30 days, so is not covered by the eBay Money Back Guarantee.']

Your opinion is always important to us, so feel free to share it in the comments area down below.', 'Music making retail giant Sweetwater (opens in new tab) has entered the online second-hand gear fray, launching its own Gear Exchange marketplace to challenge established forces like Reverb and eBay.
In fact, the service requires detailed shots of the actual gear on sale, and will reward trusted, verified sellers with badges displaying the length of their Gear Exchange tenure.

Sweetwater are aiming to get the Gear Exchange up and running by waiving all selling fees until October 31 if Sweetwater Gift Cards are the form of payment.
To find out more, head over to the Sweetwater Gear Exchange (opens in new tab).', 'Sign up to our free email alerts for the top daily stories sent straight to your e-mailOne of the rarest and most valuable 50p coins in circulation in the UK has sold for £270 on eBay.
The Kew gardens 50 pence piece has sold for 540 times its original value, and there are still thousands currently in circulation.
The extremely valuable 2009 coin has a mintage of just 210,000, making it one of the rarest and most valuable coins out there.
According to the change-checking website Coin Hunter, the Kew Gardens 50p piece normally sells for between £150.89 and £161.50.

title: ['eBay sees huge potential in Malaysia - New Straits Times', 'eBay Springs Feedback Surprise on Sellers - EcommerceBytes']
summary:
['', 'eBay made changes to how users leave feedback, but there was no mention of the change in the latest Seller Update, nor did eBay announce the new feature when it launched late last week.
On Friday, an eBay moderator confirmed in a thread on the discussion boards that what a seller described as a new feedback flow they encountered was an intentional change, not a glitch.
The eBay moderator responded , "You should still have the option to use your pre-filled feedback by accessing your feedback history and clicking on the feedback link on the bottom of the page."
On Saturday, some sellers reported being unable to leave feedback at all.
It's unclear if eBay consulted with any of its buyers and sellers prior to making the change to the feedback flow - and the failure to announce the changes to the feedback flow was clearly troubling to sellers.']

title: ["Ebay electronics resellers cry foul on new 'refurbished' rules - PCWorld", '“Staffer” Washington Capitals Stanley Cup Ring Available On eBay - NoVa Caps']
summary:
['According to an investigative report, Ebay’s recent efforts to establish more stringent standards for “refurbished” goods are creating a lot of trouble for smaller resellers.
Earlier this year Ebay began its Ebay Refurbished program, a means by which the gigantic reseller now more tightly controls which sellers can claim that their goods are “refurbished” instead of merely “used.” The program also includes a standard Allstate product warranty of one to two years.
But a report by KnowTechie is casting doubt on the program, which restricts the “refurbished” label to only sellers that are approved by the company.
The NDA covers not just the standards by which Ebay measures a seller’s right to label their products as “refurbished,” but the process by which the seller becomes vetted.
It’s easy to see that large corporations who use Ebay as a marketplace for refurbished goods, like Best Buy, Dell, and Lenovo, are better positioned to take advantage of the new system.', 'Want a Washington Capitals Stanley Cup ring?
Now may be your chance to grab one of the rings presented to Washington Capitals staff in 2018.
The eBay post states that the ring retails for $18,000, was appraised for $12,005 by Jostens back in 2018, and comes with a certificate of authenticity from Jostens.
The size 9 ring include a “staffer” name on the side, although the eBay post eradicated the name for privacy concerns.
The seller states the ring is ultra rare, for whatever that’s worth.']

title: ['From eBay to false Email address: The most bizarre facts about Filip Kostic - JuveFC', "Subway auctions off Steph Curry's stained jersey on eBay - AdAge.com", 'Amazon, eBay and AliExpress urged to do more to stop sales of dangerous items - Yahoo Finance UK', 'How to sell on eBay: Tips and average prices for your stuff - YOU Magazine', 'Selling Your Kicks? These Are the 5 Most Wanted Sneakers on eBay - Highsnobiety', "eBay Stock's Value Is A Trap (NASDAQ:EBAY) - Seeking Alpha"]
summary:
['While Filip Kostic is on the verge of becoming Juve’s newest signing, la Gazzetta dello Sport (via ilBianconero) provided us with some of the most interesting and bizarre facts about the player.
Following Stuttgart’s relegation in 2016, the club’s supporters attempted to sell Kostic on eBay!
Yet, the player was repeatedly linked with various Serie A clubs in the past few years.
While the player was set to sign for the Biancocelesti on deadline day, the official offer from the club never reached Frankfurt, as Lazio sent it to a wrong email address.
The legend says that the Germans gave the Italian club the wrong address on purpose as they never intended to sell Kostic in the first place.', 'Once registered, you can:- Read additional free articles each month- Comment on articles and featured creative work- Get our curated newsletters delivered to your inboxfirst_name:last_name:email:Register NowBy registering you agree to our privacy policy, terms & conditions and to receive occasional emails from Ad Age.
You may unsubscribe at any time.
Are you a print subscriber?
Activate your account.', 'Online platforms Amazon, eBay and AliExpress said they had removed the listings reported to them by Which?.
Photo: Matt Cardy/GettyAmazon (AMZN), eBay (EBAY) and AliExpress have been told to take more responsibility and carry out better checks after an investigation discovered illegal items being sold on the platforms.
found illegal weapons are being sold by third-party sellers on the online marketplaces including AliExpress, Amazon Marketplace, eBay and Wish.
"It’s clear that online marketplaces need to take more responsibility and prevent illegal weapons appearing on their sites."
said it had carried out simple searches for banned offensive weapons on popular online marketplaces, including zombie and flick knives, swords and batons.', 'One of the simplest and most sustainable ways to bring in extra cash is by selling your old stuff.
eBay UK has shared the average selling price of key items around the home, which show that you could make over £1,000 by giving your unwanted pieces another home.
Choose the right category for your productIt might sound obvious but it’s very important to always choose the most specific category to sell in.
Make sure if you are selling old children’s clothes, to sell in the children’s fashion category, rather than just fashion in general.
Try searching for similar items on eBay to make sure you’re going for the right price and always ask yourself ‘would I pay this price for this item?’', 'Among them is eBay, which, although it has been around since the ‘90s, is quickly becoming a trusted leader in the sneaker reselling space.
As such, anyone new to sneakers and flipping kicks may well opt to sell on eBay because they’re familiar with the process.
But in the last two years, the site has taken steps to ensure it’s also a trusted site among versed sneaker collectors too.
Firstly, it’s put in place Authenticity Guarantee, a rigorous process that ensures the sneakers you are purchasing are the real deal.
In partnership with Sneaker Con, eBay opened six authentication centers globally where experts check for signs of counterfeits on the product and packaging.', "Justin Sullivan/Getty Images NewsIf you've been an investor in eBay (NASDAQ:EBAY) stock over the past decade, my condolences to your portfolio.
First, let's look at eBay's Y/Y revenue growth dating back to 2019 - with forward estimates courtesy of analysts.
However, we are now seeing the impacts of higher gas prices and spending back into travel categories take away eBay's pandemic era high-teens revenue growth.
Could eBay reaccelerate its revenue growth?
The company needs to increase revenue, expand margins, and/or pull off an acquisition à la PayPal in order for the market to care."]

title: ["The Feeling's Dan Gillespie Sells furnished his house through eBay - Metro.co.uk", 'Love at second sight: Pre-loved fashion sees boost following eBay x ... - Euronews', 'Man scammed after buying three-bedroom holiday home in Bulgaria on eBay - Wales Online', 'Birmingham 2022 Commonwealth Games merchandise appears on eBay - including badges for £50 - Birmingham Live']
summary:
['As his fame rocketed in the noughties, Dan cultivated a neat little East End home as a perfect base to explore the thrills of London life.
He spills all about it, and explains why eBay was a life-saver when it came to furnishings.
Tell us about your first propertyIt was a small but very cute 1980s-built terrace house in east London with two bedrooms, one bathroom, a tiny kitchen, a narrow garden and a driveway.
I furnished the whole place (via eBay) while I was away on tour.
My fave part of that first house was the garden because it was so rare to have outdoor space in Zone 1.', 'Demand for pre-loved clothing has soared thanks to eBay’s partnership with UK reality TV show ‘Love Island’.
How has Love Island’s partnership with eBay impacted the pre-loved clothing market?
Less than a month after the series launched, e-commerce platform eBay reported a 700 per cent increase in searches for ‘pre-loved fashion’.
Live eBay listings increased by 1,026 per cent within three months of the Love Island partnership being announced, according to e-commerce analysts at Optiseller.
Love Island is watched by millions of Brits thanks to its primetime slot in the evening.', 'A 58-year-old dad has lost thousands of pounds after buying a holiday home in Bulgaria which turned out to be s scam.
The man, who has asked not to be named, paid £7,000 for the three-bedroom home in Dolna Lipnitsa after finding it on eBay.
Throughout lockdown he paid £300 a month for the property and was sent a set of keys.
But when he was finally able to travel to Bulgaria he found it was a scam.
He said he made the payments for the holiday home as business payments from his Halifax and Barclays bank accounts, which he believed would give him protection.', "The Birmingham 2022 Commonwealth Games store may have launched a 50 per cent off sale days before it closes- but Games merchandise has started to appear on eBay - with some high prices.
The megastore, which has taken over part of Centenary Square, has been selling merchandise throughout the lead up to the Games.
Read more: This is when the Commonwealth Games megastore in Centenary Square officially closesBut despite the cheap prices available in store - it hasn't stopped some sought-after merchandise making its way to eBay.
(Image: eBay)However, an opening ceremony pin you could pick up for £10 in the megastore or at the Alexander Stadium.
You can view Birmingham 2022 merchandise for sale on eBay, here."]

summary:
['Engineering samples of Nvidia GeForce GTX 2080 are up for sale on eBay for US$360 each.
4 ReviewsFancy yourself a never-released GeForce GTX 2080?
The card also has the “GeForce GTX” label printed on the frame rather than the usual “GeForce RTX”.
Upon testing the card with GPU-Z, the tool labeled the GTX 2080 the “NVIDIA GeForce RTX 2080”.
All in all, the GTX 2080 looks like a prototype RTX 2080.', 'A rare 50p coin has sold on eBay for nearly £140.
The Royal Mint released the rare coin back in 2009 to mark 250 years since Kew Gardens opened - in 1759.
According to its eBay listing, the "Kew Gardens 50p genuine 2009 circulated coin Good Condition Fifty Pence Rare" had a starting price of just 99p.
Have you got any rare coins?
If you find a Kew Gardens 50p in your change soon, the first thing you should do is check the date on it.', '']

title: ['Snapchat-eBay alliance opens new marketing opportunities - Newsday', "eBay and Etsy 'Shipping Tax' Takes Effect October 2nd - EcommerceBytes"]
summary:
['In fact, fueled by Gen Z and millennial social media users, shopping on social media platforms is expected to reach $1.2-trillion globally by 2025, according to Accenture.
Younger buyers generally Gen Z and millennials (roughly age 10-41) are spending most of their time on social media, she says.
In fact, Gen Z and millennial social media users will account for 62% of global social commerce spent by 2025, according to Accenture.
How it worksThis new alliance offers a seamless way to promote eBay listings on Snapchat, McCracken says.
“I really think it’s for the younger Gen Z audience to sell to other Gen Z,” she says.', 'As a result, when shipping carriers raise fees during the holidays, sellers end up paying online marketplaces what could be characterized as a "shipping tax."
A one-pound Priority Mail package going to Zone 9 will jump from $16.39 to $17.19 (Commercial Base) - an increase of 80 cents.
While sellers can use calculated shipping to pass along the higher shipping costs to buyers (or change shipping costs manually), that won't spare them the extra fees they pay to marketplaces.
(Sellers who offer "free" shipping face the same higher commission fees if they raise their prices to account for higher shipping costs.)
It would be fascinating to hear from sellers on how eBay and Etsy's "shipping tax" will impact them.']

CHECK OUT THIS VIDEO ON HOW TO GET A PONTIAC TROPHY 4 CYLINDER RUNNING FOR THE DYNO.', 'eBay told sellers it’s working to protect them from bad buyers, though it also downplayed the scale of the problem.
During the recent Seller Check-in event this month, eBay Senior Director, Head of Protections Ian Bednowitz said his team was developing technology to help crack down on eBay bad buyers using a “predictive approach.”eBay will also use third-party vendors to identify shoppers who are engaging in bad buying behavior on platforms outside of eBay.
Bednowitz described three types of “bad buyer” behavior:1) The buyer files a false SNAD claim (the buyer files a not-as-described claim when in fact it’s a remorse return).
But eBay needs sellers’ help, Bednowitz said, and he called on them to report bad buyers.
You can watch the full Seller Check-in video or jump to the part of Bednowitz’s presentation on bad buyers at about minute 21:14 in the video below.', 'eBay Australia is giving sellers an advance warning about rising postage rates that will go into effect on 5 September 2022.

listings and searches for Funko Pop on eBay.", 'An Ebay seller out of Mattawan, MI has just listed a "Key to the City of Kalamazoo" and it's up for grabs to the highest bidder!

If you’re wanting a wearable piece of memorabilia, you can find all the Commonwealth Games uniform listings on eBay here .
Read more about the Commonwealth Games", 'ITHACA, N.Y. — You can find anything on eBay and Amazon — including rare and endangered insects that are illegal to sell.
Endangered Species List.
During their online sale searches, researchers found 79 species listed across the three lists, including seven species on the Red List, which names just the critically endangered insects.

title: ['Are Time-Saving Features Disappearing from eBay? - EcommerceBytes', 'eBay launches Global Xpansion Program for Indian businesses - BusinessLine', 'Get an RTX 3060 GPU for £279 thanks to this Ebay code - Rock Paper Shotgun']
summary:
['After eBay made unannounced changes to feedback over a week ago that caused some SNAFUs described in this August 7th EcommerceBytes blog post , a feature designed to save sellers' time when leaving feedback for buyers disappeared.
When the seller attempts to leave feedback for buyers, their prefilled comments are no longer available, meaning they must type in feedback from scratch.
We couldn't find anything about the prefilled comments (auto-save) function in eBay's help file (it's not the same as eBay's automatic feedback settings).
But sellers used to be able to start typing feedback and eBay would display feedback previously left by the seller, which they could then choose if they wished.
For example, typing the letter T might bring up "Thank you for your order," "Thanks," "Thanks for being a great customer," etc.', 'eBay, a global ecommerce company, has launched the Global Xpansion Program (GXP) exclusively for Indian brands, aggregators and manufacturers, which will provide Indian brands support in scaling their business beyond borders.
Pavan Ponnappa, Head - Categories, Acquisition & Marketing (India - Cross Border Trade), said, “The GXP aims to provide a plethora of opportunities and benefits to India’s brands, aggregators, and manufacturers in scaling their business to over 190 countries on the eBay platform.
Currently, eBay’s marketplace has 1.6 billion live listings, which are consistently in demand from 138 million buyers across 190 markets.
In India, eBay’s marketplace is said to have seen a surge of demand across Gems & Jewellery, Home Décor & Furnishings, Health & Beauty, Business & Industrial, Fashion, and Auto Parts.
Founded in 1995 in San Jose, California, eBay is said to have enabled over $87 billion of gross merchandise volume.', "Ebay is running a promotion today that knocks 15% off the price of brand-new items when you use the code BANK15 at the checkout, and you can use this to pick an RTX 3060 12GB for just £279.
The RTX 3060 got a fairly positive review from erstwhile hardware editor Katharine, who rated it highly as a drop-in replacement for folks with GTX 1060 and RX 580 graphics cards.
It's certainly the next-gen card that makes the most amount of sense for people with 1920x1080 monitors at the moment... this is certainly the best value next-gen graphics card for 1080p gamers, and it's also a good budget option for those after a 1440p capable graphics card as well.
Of course, it was nigh-impossible to find an RTX 3060 at £299, RRP be damned, so I'd argue this still represents a (small) improvement on the situation of the past two years.
We may not see lower-end next-gen cards for quite some time - potentially this time next year, even!"]

$83.88 (was $299)More eBay Afterpay Day dealsHere are a few more eBay Afterpay Day deals that have already been released in the lead-up to the 2022 event.
Check out even more of the best sales of Afterpay Day 2022", 'There, small- and medium-sized ecommerce businesses can thrive, and as eBay’s new report shows, they’re thriving in impressive and unexpected ways.
eBay’s newly released report, the Southeast Asia Small Online Business Trade Report, looks at the performance of eBay-enabled small businesses (sales of at least $10,000 annually) in six countries in 2020.
Only about 11 percent of traditional businesses export their wares in the six Southeast Asian countries studied in our report, combined.
For those on eBay, though, that’s 99 percent, and sellers export to an average of 25 different countries.
Small businesses are vital to eBay’s purpose — to connect people and build communities to create economic opportunity for all — and in Southeast Asia, it’s clear that sellers are embracing the global marketplace that eBay provides.', 'Sellers can now purchase UPS shipping on the eBay mobile app, eBay announced on Wednesday.
“We’ve been hard at work to improve the eBay app so that all domestic shipping services you are used to selecting when using your desktop are now available on the eBay app.”eBay had already offered USPS and FedEx shipping options on mobile, and it said Wednesday it was also making available “eBay standard envelope” on the app.
In the meantime, sellers have been reporting a problem with printing shipping labels since July.
But the additional time for doing my shipping is a real issue.” The seller pointed to the eBay Technical Issues thread where it shows eBay added it to the list of problems on July 25.
“Is there a way to push harder on this problem as it is a real problem for some of us,” they asked.', 'One of those constants is that the nicest Pontiac Sunbird Convertible on Earth costs less than this signed 8x10 Photo of Elon Musk wearing a spacesuit that I found on eBay.
For sale in my home state of New Jersey is this MINTY 1989 Pontiac Sunbird GT Convertible.
That’s just about $1,000 less than this autographed 8x10 photo of Elon Musk wearing a spacesuit that I found on eBay.
The same cannot be said for this signed 8x10 photo of Elon Musk wearing a spacesuit that I found on eBay.
But, on the other hand, this signed 8x10 photo of Elon Musk wearing a spacesuit that I found on eBay doesn’t have a turbo or pop-up headlights.']

title: ['Pimp My Ride on MTV: Lady Leshurr on ‘greener’ reboot with eBay - Metro.co.uk', 'eBay Flaw Could Cost Sellers an Extra $15 - EcommerceBytes', 'Why Is eBay Advertising PayPal Credit on Listings? - EcommerceBytes', 'Xbox Series X Restock August 2022: eBay, Amazon, Microsoft Store, and Best Buy - Tech Times']
summary:
['To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 videoLady Leshurr has outlined how MTV’s reboot of Pimp My Ride will be ‘greener’ than the original through its collaboration with eBay.
Fans of Pimp My Ride will remember the original US version was hosted by rapper Xzibit, and ran from 2004 to 2007.
But it’s now making a comeback, with Lady Leshurr helming a new six-part series, with the first episode landing today, August 19.
‘It’s in collaboration with eBay, so they recycle a lot of the parts.
The show, as much as possible, uses supplies provided by eBay’s dedicated car parts and accessories division.', 'eBay confirmed a "known issue" that could result in sellers paying $15 out of their own pockets for USPS shipping labels if they aren't careful.
Sellers pointed out a flaw that eBay's shipping team initially disavowed but later confirmed, calling it a known problem it was working to resolve.
For flat rate shipping, sellers can use the shipping calculator to decide how much to charge for shipping.
The moderator returned on Friday with a follow-up response from the eBay shipping team: "Thank you for the clarification.
We would have expected to have heard more about surprise fees if it was impacting a significant number of people given how steep the fees are - a $15 surprise is hard to miss.', "Dear Ina,I noticed this listing, and I am sure it is one of millions, that has an offer from PayPal Credit prominently featured near the price.
You would think that by now, long after the PayPal split, eBay would have been able to point buyers to its own financing product, or financing ally.
They are deferring a lot of interest dollars to PayPal, at strong rates.
They just don't know how to do it???", 'The Xbox Series X restock has been extremely difficult to purchase despite being almost two years since it launched.
Check Out Where the Xbox Series X Restock August 2022 is Most Likely to Drop:Amazon Xbox Series X RestockThe next wave is expected to be sent on August 19 to qualifying customers.

Best Buy Xbox Series X RestockBuyers can "Check Stores" to see if it is available.
One way to increase the chances of buying the Xbox Series X restock is by following Xbox Series X restock trackers on Twitter in order to be alerted the moment new stock comes to different retailers.']

So, we’ve compiled a list of some of the most peculiar items listed on eBay in south London.
Old Nokia 2650 - Silver Mobile Phone:Old Nokia 2650 (Photo credit: eBay)Looking to upgrade your phone?
This seller near Biggin Hill is selling this Nokia 2650 phone for only £8.
This seller from London is selling this replica of a human skull.', 'The large group of "feral" youths have been causing havoc across the sleepy Worcestershire town of Malvern Link for the past several months.
Footage shows the intimidating gang swarming their driveway before they went into the garden and stole their son's £1,000 bag and £300 bike from their cabin.
"We were driving back home after we found out but we were told by a neighbour that they had already left and had made their way to Malvern Link station.
"I want to make the people of Malvern Link aware of this because things are getting worse here.
Residents say the group was the same that had previously been banned from Malvern Link Station by police at the weekend.', 'Dear Ina,This week as part of my eBay inventory management, I performed a daily end/sell similar task to refresh my inventory.

title: ['I’m an eBay expert – how to make £1,106 by selling unwanted items from around the house... - The Sun', 'Infinity Train DVD Prices Skyrocket on eBay Following HBO Max ... - CBR - Comic Book Resources', "What Happened to eBay's Loyalty Program? - EcommerceBytes"]
summary:
['SELLING unwanted items from around the house could easily make you more than £1,000, one eBay expert has revealed.
And research by eBay found that the average person has more than £1,100 worth of unwanted stuff lying around the house.
Clare said knowing that old items are going to buyer who will appreciate them can make it easier to sell things on that have nostalgic value.
If you're selling clothes, describe the fit of the item or the feel of the material.
Clare said: "I've been surprised by how much some of my items have sold for.', '', 'eBay launched a new loyalty program one month after decimating its eBay Bucks program last year, but what’s startling is how narrow it is: the eBay Top Star new program is available in only two categories, according to its website.
eBay all but eliminated its longtime loyalty program for buyers called eBay Bucks in April 2021.
The eBay Top Star program calls itself “Our invite-only loyalty program for watches and sneakers.” The landing page describes three benefits of membership:Seasonal CollectionsExclusive access to a curated collection of covetable sneakers.
While eBay CEO Jamie Iannone referenced the strategy in his second-quarter post-earnings call with Wall Street analysts on August 3, he didn’t specifically mention the Top Star loyalty program.
Let us know if you’ve encountered the Top Star program on eBay and if you believe the end of eBay Bucks’ main benefit has had an impact on your sales.']

['Well, that dreaded 'hangxiety' probably doesn't compare to one UK businessman, who decided to purchase a sculpture on a whim after downing a bottle of wine.
However, the drunken shopper is now set to sell his drunken eBay purchase for a whopping £100,000.
Gareth also still sees his artwork purchase as a worthy investment, especially as he bought it for nearly a quarter of the original price.
Credit: SWNS"It’s going to auction with an estimate of £20,000-£30,000 but I think it’s worth £100,000."
Karl Martin, valuer at Hansons, said: “It’s an incredibly impressive work of art and, as Gareth says, deserves to be on public display.', 'eBay Inc. (Nasdaq: EBAY), a global commerce leader that connects millions of buyers and sellers around the world, and TCGplayer, a trusted marketplace for collectible card game enthusiasts, today announced they have entered into an agreement for eBay to acquire TCGplayer.
Today, TCGplayer employs more than 600 team members, serving millions of hobbyist buyers, and tens of thousands of online sellers and brick-and-mortar retailers through the TCGplayer Marketplace and its Authentication Center.
A purpose-driven company, TCGplayer prides itself on creating a culture that fosters camaraderie, embraces diversity and exudes passion.
Forward-Looking StatementsCertain statements herein are "forward-looking statements" within the meaning of Section 27A of the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, and Section 21E of the Exchange Act.
Such forward-looking statements reflect eBay's current expectations or beliefs concerning future events and actual events may differ materially from historical results or current expectations.', '', 'Internet giant eBay announced this morning that it has entered an agreement to purchase the collectibles marketplace TCGPlayer for $295 million.
The purchase of TCGPlayer strengthens eBay’s position in the collectibles market, building on the recently launched the eBay Vault product, a verification and storage service for collectibles.
“TCGplayer will continue operating independently,” TCGPlayer’s Founder and CEO, Chedy Hampson, said in his own statement.
TCGPlayer’s sale to eBay comes just over a month after TCGPlayer acquired fellow online TCG retailer ChannelFireball and BinderPOS for an undisclosed sum.
As a result, two of the largest Magic: The Gathering retailers for the last 15+ years are now owned by eBay.', 'eBay will acquire TCGplayer, an online marketplace for trading cards, the companies announced today.
The deal, worth up to $295 million, marks eBay’s latest push into the growing trading card market, which experienced a huge boom during the pandemic.
TCGplayer is a popular buying and selling platform for trading card games like Pokémon, Yu-Gi-Oh!, and Magic: The Gathering.
eBay has rolled out a number of programs focused on collectible trading cards in recent months leading up to its purchase of TCGplayer.
In June, the company launched eBay Vault, a sprawling 31,000-square-foot, temperature-controlled facility where buyers and sellers can store their graded trading cards.', '']

summary:
["Dear Ina,I have been an eBay member for over 20 years and eBay seller for over 9 years.
Buyers can look at a seller's feedback, but a buyer's feedback, if the buyer is not also selling, is 100%.
A buyer's nonpayment should result in being blocked from eBay after 3 times within a six-month period.
If a buyer takes more than 5 days to pay, then the buyer's feedback shows a negative 2% and says due to late payment with the date it occurred, and thus reducing the feedback.
This idea will give seller's the opportunity to look at a buyer's feedback and decide whether to accept a buyer's offer.", 'The billionaire is partnering with Girls Inc. to give one fan a truly unique piece of art.
Created by Motiva art, the piece features some of Buffett's most memorable quotes overlaid on a classic portrait of the billionaire.
The so-called "Oracle of Omaha" has pledged to give away an astounding 99% of his wealth to charitable initiatives, mainly through Berkshire Hathaway stock.
"The one universal characteristic is that they feel the money is going to be put to very good uses."
As of Wednesday afternoon, Buffett's portrait auction had already fetched $32,000 in bidding.', 'A sophisticated tractor scam has returned to retailing platform eBay after the same fraudulent advertisement snared 18 farmers last year.
See also: More eBay tractor scam victims tell us their storiesSimon Lane fell victim to the fraud last year, and contacted Farmers Weekly when he noticed that it had recently resurfaced.
I later received an invoice that looked like it had been sent from eBay, containing a PayPal button in it.
Farmers Weekly has contacted eBay for comment.
It is essential that when purchasing any type of vehicle on eBay, buyers view it in person before handing over any money.', 'eBay Inc. (Nasdaq: EBAY), a global commerce leader that connects millions of buyers and sellers around the world, today announced the appointment of Aparna Chennapragada to its Board of Directors effective immediately.
The company also announced that Katie Mitic has decided to step down from the Board of Directors effective September 15, 2022.
"We are excited to have Aparna join our Board of Directors," said Paul Pressler, Chairman of the Board, eBay Inc. "Aparna will bring extensive experience in consumer products and businesses powered by foundational technologies such as AI, Augmented Reality and Blockchain.
“Separately, we want to thank Katie for her service to the Board of Directors,” continued Pressler.
Following these changes, eBay Inc.'s Board of Directors will be composed of nine directors, eight of whom are independent.', 'DUBLIN--(BUSINESS WIRE)--The "E-Commerce Market: Global Industry Trends, Share, Size, Growth, Opportunity and Forecast 2022-2027" report has been added to ResearchAndMarkets.com's offering.
The global e-commerce market reached a value of US$ 13 Trillion in 2021.
Furthermore, increasing internet penetration and usage of devices, such as smartphones, laptops and tablets to access e-commerce portals, is also providing a boost to the market growth.
Additionally, the advent of private-label and direct to consumer-based business models is also creating a positive outlook for the market growth.
Key Market Segmentation:The publisher provides an analysis of the key trends in each sub-segment of the global e-commerce market, along with forecasts at the global, regional and country level from 2022-2027.']

title: ['Did You Know eBay Notifies Your Watchers of a Price Drop? - EcommerceBytes', 'How Edge Data Centers are Used by eBay, National Australia Bank ... - Enterprise Storage Forum', 'Shoppers can get a Dyson Airwrap for £270 in huge eBay flash - Liverpool Echo']
summary:
['Have you ever bought an item you'd been eying for a while because you received a notification that the price dropped?
But do eBay and Etsy notify shoppers who are watching or have favorited your items when you've dropped the price?
In a recent podcast, eBay claimed it does, but it doesn't seem to be a well known feature.
During the August 23rd eBay for Business podcast , Jim "Griff" Griffith responded to a question from a seller who asked if eBay notifies shoppers about price drops of items they're watching.
Griffith explained that eBay does send email alerts to buyers who have watched or viewed an item or has an item in their shopping cart when the seller lowers the price by a certain minimum percentage of the original selling price.', 'Edge technology’s edge data centers also help collate data by connecting distributed facilities to hyperscale data centers.
Rather than building its very own cloud infrastructure, Symfact uses a third-party edge data center solution, DartPoints, to store and backup client data.
National Australia BankNational Australia Bank operated on power-intensive data centers, accounting for major carbon offsets in the atmosphere.
NAB had an in-house data center to configure clientele needs, but in a bid to maximize its governance structure, they wanted to move away from building to simply coordinating their data center needs.
“Developers in Amsterdam, Munich, and Warsaw can locally access Ori’s platform with the services in our edge data centers.', 'In true bank holiday style, eBay is launching a flash sale on all of its refurbished Dyson products.
Shoppers can make the most of the discount from 10am on Thursday August 25, for 24-hours only.
Included in the sale is the popular Dyson Airwrap, and shoppers can buy this for 49% off the standard retail price and 25% off the certified refurbished cost.
The Dyson Cyclone V10 cordless vacuum is also being sold at a discounted price, giving shoppers a saving of £172.49.
Find out more, or purchase the Dyson Airwrap here.']

['Listen 2 min Comment on this story Comment Gift Article ShareEBay has put up a $295 million bid for a piece of the trading card market.
The e-commerce giant announced its plans to acquire TCGplayer, an online marketplace for collectible trading cards such as Magic: The Gathering and the Pokémon Trading Card Game, via a press release on Aug. 22.
AdvertisementTCGplayer, an online platform that specializes in the trading card market, announced its acquisition of ChannelFireball, a market and strategy hub for card games, and BinderPOS, an inventory management system for hobby stores, on July 11.
In the collectible space, TCGplayer is seen as a competitor to eBay.
EBay and TCGplayer announced that the deal is expected to close in Q1 2023.', 'COMICS RELEASING ON 8/31Harley Quinn 2022 Annual #1We sold 65 copies of Cover C homage cover, and 67 copies of Cover C Szerdy variant.
Superman Warworld Apocalypse #1We sold 12 copies of Cover A, and 8 copies of Cover C.Why is this hot?

We sold sold 5 copies of the 1:25 for $34.99.
Moon Knight: Black, White & Blood #4We sold 20 copies of Cover A and 20 copies of the Lozano variant.', 'But Kutten-Cottrell and many other casual resellers might soon call it quits on their reselling hobby due to a new tax reporting requirement.
In the past, the platforms only gave tax reporting forms to sellers who operated at a larger scale, those who brought in $20,000 in revenue and had more than 200 sales in one year.
People who receive a form 1099-K must pay self-employment tax of 15.3% in addition to income tax.
Ecommerce platforms are bracing to lose millions of sales due to the new 1099-K reporting requirements.
“Raising the reporting threshold will ensure sellers of used goods are not subject to burdensome or confusing reporting requirements, which could result in overpayment as well as ineligibility for certain tax benefits,” said Pappas in a statement.', 'Listed on French eBay and spotted by Consolevariations.com, video game uber-enthusiast Kaori30’s sale includes some 2,400 consoles, “from the first to the very last,” a number of games for said consoles, and a bunch of fun statues and other video game collectibles.
A Google translation of the eBay listing reveals that Kaori30 began collecting in the early ‘90s, before collecting might’ve been considered a thing.

That twist is what leads them to this gargantuan collection of a majority of consoles ever made all in one place.
As they say on their eBay auction, they do not believe it’s possible to find some of these items anymore, even if one had the financial means.', 'Click here to learn more about Etsy Success Events and how to register for this one.

Although eBay took the progressive step of banning any ivory items on their website over 10 years ago, ivory items were still being listed on their site in late 2021.
Following the release of our report, eBay reached out to us, and we shared with them our data on recent ivory listings in the UK, which included now-illegal elephant ivory items.
The trade in ivory, even if it is genuinely antique, increases the risk to elephant populations by providing cover for the illegal trade in newly poached ivory, and by perpetuating demand.
You can help by supporting Born Free’s work to save elephants and bring the ivory trade to a permanent end.', 'Get ready to feel old, as it has officially been 27 years since the first-ever eBay item sold.

This equipment should be going to the soldiers battling on in Ukraine but instead is going towards lining the pockets of corrupt military personnel.

Eventually you end up in a very bad situation where the body armour they [the conscripts] do have available is rotten, destroyed, or just not there."', "A 50p coin has gone on sale on eBay with an asking price of £10,000 - and you may want to look out for them as there are more in circulation.
The rare coin has turned up on eBay and is valuable because of an error most would miss.
This particular 50p piece was brought out to mark the 1918 Representation of the People Act in 2018.
The coin is not particularly rare, and around 9million were made.
They aren't the only valuable 50p pieces either."]

The research shows that nearly half of Love Island viewers said they would consider buying pre-loved over new items after watching this year’s series.
Following the appointment of Love Island contestant Tasha Ghouri as eBay UK’s first ever Pre-Loved Ambassador, the online marketplace is now encouraging consumers to continue buying and selling pre-loved items through its ongoing support of Oxfam’s Second-Hand September campaign.
Furthermore, there have also been 881% more searches for ‘ebay preloved’ on Google and 359% more for ‘ebay pre-loved clothes’ compared to before the show.
In addition, 23% of Love Island viewers have admitted to making their first ever pre-loved purchase this summer.']

title: ['eBay Flexi-Kapital: iwoca und eBay lancieren innovative Finanzierungslösung für Händler*innen - presseportal.de', 'eBay Becomes USPS Compliant, No More Media Mail for Magazines - EcommerceBytes', "AnZ Comic's Ebay Pulse 9/7 2022 - CBSI Comics", "Ebay Motors Powers HOT ROD Drag Week's 2022 Race to Crown ... - PR Web"]
summary:
['iwocaeBay Flexi-Kapital: iwoca und eBay lancieren innovative Finanzierungslösung für Händler*innenBild-InfosDownloadFrankfurt a.M./Dreilinden (ots)Erstmals bringen der auf Kleinunternehmen und Selbstständige spezialisierte Online-Kreditanbieter iwoca und eBay mit eBay Flexi-Kapital by iwoca eine Finanzierungslösung auf den Markt, die Onlinehändler*innen auf dem eBay-Marktplatz direkten, unkomplizierten und schnellen Zugang zu kurzfristigen Betriebsmittelkrediten ab 2.500 bis 1 Million Euro ermöglicht.
eBay Flexi-Kapital verhilft dem Einzelhandel bei eBay zum ErfolgAus der Partnerschaft zwischen eBay und iwoca ergeben sich somit klare Vorteile für eBay-Verkäufer*innen in Deutschland.
Für das neue eBay Flexi-Kapital-Angebot steuert das Fintech-Unternehmen iwoca seine eigene Infrastruktur für die Kreditfinanzierung bei und deckt die gesamte Wertschöpfungskette im eigenen Haus ab.
Dank der iwoca-Schnittstelle können gewerbliche Verkäufer*innen auf eBay die Finanzierung direkt aus dem Verkäuferportal heraus beantragen und erhalten.
Dank des neuen Kreditangebots und der nahtlosen Integration in unsere Plattform holen wir unsere gewerblichen Verkäufer*innen dort ab, wo sie ihr Geschäft betreiben.', 'eBay recently became compliant with USPS rules around Media Mail, according to employees during a recent podcast.
The statement was prompted by a question from a seller who wondered why he could no longer print Media Mail shipping labels through eBay for magazines he sells.
“As you know, magazines technically have never qualified for media mail,” the seller asked in part.
“However, I’ve been selling magazines on eBay for more than a decade with media mail because when I started selling them, I could see that all my competitors were using media mail and I wasn’t.
If your item was listed in the magazine category, when you go to print, media mail will not be an option that’s available to you.', 'COMICS RELEASING ON 9/7Batman #127Cover A we sold 95 copies, Cover B 25 copies, and we sold the 1:50 for $50.

['eBay Seller Claims To Have Nicki Minaj’s Press-On Nail From The VMAs, Bidding Closes At Over $55,000Nicki Minaj might have a chokehold on her fans, especially if someone was willing to dish out thousands for an item she allegedly wore!

This, among several others, is going a long way to show that solar energy is not always related to just panels.', 'Today, eBay has announced a new partnership with Reskinned, sustainable preloved clothing repair and resale specialists, to expand the online marketplace’s offering of preloved items and reduce growing fashion waste.

“Through this partnership with eBay, the original home of preloved, we hope to increase our reach and offering of our brand partners, ensuring preloved items find new owners, and realise a more sustainable fashion future.”Shoppers can browse Reskinned’s Joules shopfront here.
