Here’s a first look at the outfits up for grabs:“I’ve always enjoyed being playful with clothes,” Tasha said about the collection.
For all the latest Love Island news and gossip and for the best memes and quizzes, like The Holy Church of Love Island on Facebook.']

title: ['Amazon poised to dethrone eBay as Australia’s top online retailer - The New Daily', "Only on eBay: These Rare Memorabilia Show Serena Williams's ... - eBay Inc.", 'eBay Stock: A Value Trap With Poor Growth (NASDAQ:EBAY) - Seeking Alpha', "Brit lists £50 note with Queen's face on eBay for £10,000 - The Mirror"]
summary:
['Australia’s e-commerce industry is standing at the precipice of a monumental shift, as new data predicts Amazon is on track to dethrone eBay as the country’s top online shopping website.
If these trends persist Amazon will overtake eBay as the No.1 retail website in Australia, measured by online visitors, Mr Gilbert said.
This, coupled with Amazon Prime – which makes delivery free for an annual fee – is driving its meteoric rise up the e-commerce rankings.
“Amazon has been the biggest mover this year, lifting share by more than 40 per cent since December to July,” Mr Gilbert said.
“Customers find it easy to navigate their way through the platform – eBay is not up to scratch in this area,” Dr Grimmer said.', 'It’s not every day you come across a piece of U.S. Open venue memorabilia, particularly one used by a tennis legend like Serena Williams.
“eBay gets more eyes than anybody.” And that’s a huge advantage for a seller of memorabilia with a global appeal.
Behind the NetsMeiGray has sold lots of game-used — technically, match-used — memorabilia from the U.S. Open, but the nets are highly unusual.
”Somebody with a tennis court, who likes the idea of having the actual net that was used in the U.S. Open,” says Barry.
These might be the best tennis nets in the world, but tennis court size is standardized these days, and these nets should fit on just about every court.', "JHVEPhotoInvestment ThesisI think eBay (NASDAQ:EBAY) is a value trap.
Declining GrowthThe story of eBay's last decade has been one of uninspiring revenue growth and mediocre fundamentals.
The company stagnated for years, struggling to find a sustainable growth strategy.
Etsy (ETSY), MercadoLibre (MELI), and even Amazon (AMZN) are still reporting solid year-over-year revenue growth.
The company has to find a way to generate scalable organic revenue growth.", '45 minutes after the world was told the UK's longest living monarch had passed away, one Brit decided to auction off the last released bank note that features her faceBrit lists £50 note with Queen's face on eBay for £10,000A Brit has listed a £50 note with the Queen's face on eBay for a staggering £10,000 - just moments after she passed away.
But now a change in monarch will see the Queen's face on legal tender and stamps replaced with King Charles III.
The listing reads: "£50 Note Uncirculated AA01 089063 Last Denomination Note With The Queens Face On.
But as the currency with the Queen's face gradually fades out - including notes and coins - collectors will be keen to get their hands on copies as souvenirs.
On the other side, it features World War II code-breaker Alan Turing, who is best known for cracking Enigma to decrypt Nazi messages - shortening the war by four years.']

title: ["What's Behind Some of the Baffling Item Specifics on eBay? - EcommerceBytes"]
summary:
['But that's what one eBay seller saw when they attempted to fill out Item Specifics on a new listing.
In the post titled, "LAUGHABLE Item Specifics ... Something to brighten your day," the seller described four mismatched product attributes.
The seller indicated that, jokes aside, they were frustrated that eBay had introduced such "nonsensical drivel" in many categories last year.
While incongruous Item Specifics may be humorous or maddening (or both), it's definitely baffling how eBay missed the mark.
Let us know if you have any theories and whether eBay is getting better at Item Specifics options, and feel free to share any humorous-but-maybe-not-so-funny stories about mismatched attributes.']

title: ['Lenovo sale Australia: Get 20% off everything at eBay - finder.com.au', 'Chinese businessman flogged illegal impotence remedies made ... - Northampton Chronicle and Echo', "Marvel's Free D23 Expo Amazing Fantasy #1000 Go For $330 on ... - Bleeding Cool News", 'This May Be Why eBay Collection Is Still in Beta - EcommerceBytes', 'Someone is selling a £50 note with Queen’s face on for more than £10,000 on eBay - Proper manchester']
summary:
["If you love your tech, you don't want to miss these deals on essential Lenovo electronics at eBay.
With the code LNNV20, you can get 20% off Lenovo, store-wide.
Here are our top picks from this eBay Lenovo sale.
eBay Lenovo sale AustraliaThinkPad P16s | $3,709 $1,976.78 (save $1,732.22) This thin, light workstation is ultra versatile in form and in function.
View dealThinkCentre Neo 50s | $1,719 $1,357.20 (save $343.80) Portability and versatility may be all the rage, but sometimes you need pure computing power.", 'An alert Northamptonshire Police officer trawling eBay spotted a Chinese businessman flogging pangolin scales and illegal impotence remedies made from dead seahorses.
Advertisement Hide AdAdvertisement Hide AdBut rural crime officer PC Chloe Gillies became suspicious after spotting the items online and tracked them down to the 54-year-old’s home.
Officers discovered Zheng was selling remedies made from pangolin scales, rare orchids, seahorses and valuable deer musk.
Advertisement Hide AdAdvertisement Hide AdRaids were carried out on Zheng’s properties at Holkham Close and Epsom Walk, Corby.
Advertisement Hide AdAdvertisement Hide AdSimon Hunka, defending, told the court Zheng, who moved to the UK 20 years ago, is a family man with a son in law school.', '', 'The premise of eBay Collection, currently available only in the Trading Cards category, is explained on the Collection Hub of the eBay website : "You can now upload, manage, and track the value of up to 1,000 cards that you own, buy, and want all in one place."
"I think this is the message that you get when eBay doesn't have any pricing information because eBay isn't finding past transaction(s) in that card.
I have cards in my collection that eBay is valuing at zero, but I know the value should be higher."
Four months later, Colombo left eBay to become President at collectible card trading platform Alt.
eBay also said it was working to add Marvel and Star Wars trading cards.', 'One Brit has decided to cash in on the passing of Queen Elizabeth by listing a £50 note featuring her portrait for an eye-watering £10,000.
Just two days after the Queen’s passing, an uncirculated £50 note was listed onto eBay for auction with a starting price of £10,000.
Remarkably, the bank note has had three bids since its listing over the weekend, pushing up the buying price to £10,600.
The listing reads: “£50 Note Uncirculated AA01 089063 Last Denomination Note With The Queens Face On.
£50 Polymer Note Uncirculated AA01 089063.']

title: ['eBay UK Will Host a Live Webinar on Wednesday To Help Sellers ... - eSeller365', 'Tasha Ghouri has released her first eBay pre-loved collection and ... - Heat World', 'eBay Tops List of Ecommerce Apps that Require Personal Info from ... - Retail TouchPoints', 'Arthur Lih, CEO of LifeVac Commends eBay for Protecting the ... - PR Newswire', 'GBK Brand Bar and eBay Host a Two-Day Luxury Celebrity Gift ... - Celeb Secrets']
summary:
['eBay UK will hold a live webinar on Wednesday, 14 September, to help sellers prepare for the peak holiday season.
Don’t MissWhile eBay will also hold an eBay Open event in the UK later this month, there is no virtual option for UK sellers to participate.
eBay Open events somewhat double as holiday season prep events as they offer many workshops that can help sellers get ready for peak season.
eBay UK Prepare for Peak InfoDate: Wednesday, 14 September 2022Time: 10:30am to 11:30amHow: Zoom WebinarThe webinar is free, and interested sellers can register here.
Subscribe to Our Newsletter Submit Please enable JavaScript in your browser to submit the form We do not sell your information.', "It's no secret that Tasha Ghouri was the complete style icon of Love Island 2022.
Low-rise jeans, feather crop tops and everything in between highlighted Tasha's amazing wardrobe and even better now, you can shop her second-hand collection with eBay.
So, in exciting news, we've seen Tasha's exclusive collection on eBay go live and all proceeds will go to national hearing loss charity, RNID.
The sustainable queen recently announced her partnership with eBay as the first ever pre-loved ambassador.
Even some of our fave bits have already been sold, so if you don't want to miss Tasha Ghouri's Pre-Loved Picks you'll have to shop it right now.", 'eBay is the “nosiest” ecommerce platform, mandating that customers provide 21 required personal data segments.
It’s also the only ecommerce app to require access to a user’s contact list, on top of requiring relatively uncommon permissions such as browsing history, search history and purchase history.
Shopify required the second-most number of personal data segments at 18, followed by WordPress at 14.
The two platforms that required the least personal data were IONOS and ShipStation, Mobile, which each require two segments.
Learn more about which ecommerce websites and apps collect the most and least data in this infographic from OnDeck.', 'FDA registered, clinical studies and third-party testing confirms LifeVac to be highly effective and safe to use during a choking emergency.
The LifeVac Home Kit is $69.95 and comes with an adult mask, a pediatric mask, and a practice mask.
LifeVac also sells a LifeVac Travel Kit, a LifeVac School Kit, and LifeVac EMS Kit, and a LifeVac Home & Travel Kit Bundle.
One LifeVac kit covers adults and children, never expires, and includes a free replacement when used in a choking emergency.
The Home kit comes fully equipped with an adult mask, a pediatric mask, and a practice mask.', 'On Friday and Saturday (September 9 & 10), nominees, winners and other special guests gathered at the elegant Beverly Wilshire Hotel in Los Angeles to attend eBay & GBK Brand Bar Luxury Lounge, where they received over $60K in gifts and trips.
Aside from all of the extravagant items present at the event, GBK Brand Bar CEO Gavin Keilly made it a point to give back.
There was even a house DJ at the event spinning music the whole time, making the entire gift lounge one big party.
You can learn more about GBK Brand Bar and the events they put together by visiting their website here.
For more coverage from The Emmys, click here.']

title: ["GameStop's DnD rings sell out, then hit eBay at double price - Wargamer", 'Nike SB And eBay Are Literally Putting The Pieces Of Their Dunk Low Back Together - Sneaker News', "AnZ Comic's Ebay Pulse 9/14 2022 - CBSI Comics", 'New eBay Listing Tool Lacks Priority Mail Small Flat-Rate Option - EcommerceBytes', '@HPCpodcast: AWS, Sun, eBay, Netflix (and Others) Vet Adrian ... - insideHPC']
summary:
['It appears some users have swooped in quickly and snatched up copies to resell, as multiple eBay users are now selling the accessory for more than double its $39.99 retail price.
These eBay listings began to crop up mere hours after the rings sold out.
The rings are real life versions of six DnD magic items, and are pretty varied in appearance.
It seems to be a big year for DnD jewellery.
Just last month, Wizards of the Coast and RockLove Jewellery unveiled a line of necklaces for each DnD class.', 'Back in 2003, Nike SB took to eBay to auction off a special pair of Dunk Lows colored to resemble the marketplace’s signature logo.
To honor the life of the late Sandy Bodecker, who’s responsible for building up Nike SB to what is today, the Swoosh is literally putting the pieces of the above-mentioned Dunk Low back together.
The rest of the construction is faithful to the original colorway, however, representing eBay’s signature red, blue, yellow, and green palette.
In addition, an image of Bodecker himself is printed onto the sockliner of the left foot; the right opts for an on-foot image of the original, ripped apart eBay Dunk.
For a detailed look at the upcoming eBay x Nike SB Dunk Low, see below.', 'COMICS RELEASING ON 9/14Batman Vs. Robin #1 Middleton VariantWe sold 24 copies.
I wish this cover was a ratio because this cover is simply too good for a cover B.
Flash The Fastest Man Alive #1We sold 18 copies of cover A, and sold the 1:25 for $74.99.
Godzilla vs Mighty Morphin Power Rangers #5We sold 50 copies of Cover A, and 12 copies of the 1:10 for $24.99.
We sold 78 copies of cover A, 176 copies of the Anka variant, and 40 copies of the 1:10.', 'eBay is continuing to roll out versions of its new listing tool to additional sellers, some of whom took to the eBay boards to report a problem with shipping options.
One seller explained, “The new listing experience is lacking the ability to select USPS small flat rate box as a shipping option.
All other flat rates are available from flat rate envelope to large flat rate box…..but no small flat rate box.
An eBay moderator shared a response from the shipping team, which asked if the seller was listing the package dimensions within the maximum for USPS Priority Mail Flat Rate Small Box (8.6875″x 5.4375″x 1.75″).
However, the small flat rate box does appear to show up if a package size is manually entered.”The eBay moderator replied, “Thank you for this updated information.', 'Cool stories and valuable insights abound in this @HPCpodcast episode as we get together with tech veteran Adrian Cockcroft.
He recently joined OrionX having served at a vice president at Amazon Web Services for the past several years.
As vice president at AWS and Amazon Sustainability Architecture he represented Amazon on the board of the Cloud Native Computing Foundation and the Open Source Climate foundation.
In our converesation with Adrian, we start with Netflix’s move to the cloud, a significant event that helped put cloud computing on the map.
And we talk about accessing the Amazon Sustainability Data Initiative (ASDI) and its petabytes of data, including weather observations, ocean temperatures, climate projection data and satellite imagery, used by researchers and scientists.']

title: ['eBay selling Platinum Jubilee Heinz items for up to £50 after Queen’s death - Bristol Live', 'I quit my eBay job and turned my tea side hustle into a career – now my company is worth MILLIONS... - The US Sun', 'eBay Chief Technology Officer Mazen Rawashdeh Talks Culture ... - eBay Inc.', "Mid-life whim leads to 'Mad' magazine purchase on eBay, then ... - Seacoastonline.com", "10 Things We Just Learned About EBay And MTV's New Season Of ... - HotCars", "People bemused as 'Cornish' granite stones are for sale on eBay for £3k plus - Cornwall Live", "90 Day Fiance's Andrew Kenton sold Amira's engagement ring on ... - Reality Titbit - Celebrity TV News"]
summary:
["Some popular products featuring the late monarch’s royal coat of arms and other affiliations have surfaced online on sites such as eBay, selling at shockingly high prices.
Other Platinum Jubilee-related items include the Heinz Queenz Beanz, which are retailing for up to £50 for just one tin.
Meanwhile, a watercolour painting of the famed Heinz ketchup bottle with the coveted coat of arms sold on eBay for £19.99.
Approximately 30 Royal Warrants are granted per year and the same number are equally withdrawn.
Heinz has displayed the Queen's coat of arms on all its packaging for over 70 years, as Heinz was granted with a warrant in 1951.", "A FORMER eBay worker has revealed how she turned her tea-inspired side hustle into her full-time career.
Sashee Chandran, of California, left her digital marketing career and launched her business Tea Drops in 2015, which is now worth millions.
2 Sashee Chandran swapped her eBay career to pursue a tea-inspired side hustle Credit: My Tea Drop2 She launched Tea Drops after realizing that making loose leaf tea at work was 'cumbersome' Credit: My Tea DropThe savvy businesswoman has received at least $8million from investors, according to Entrepreneur.
Chandran used to juggle her side hustle alongside her career in Silicon Valley before deciding to pursue it full-time in 2015.
Chandran launched Tea Drops on her own and admitted that she was comfortable taking the risk.", 'As eBay’s Chief Technology Officer, you’d expect Mazen Rawashdeh to have lots to say about tech, the backbone of eBay’s business.
Mazen discussed what makes eBay a fascinating place to work, why artificial intelligence and machine learning are so vital to the marketplace, and how to build a good corporate culture.
“You know you’ve built a good culture when people do the right thing when you’re not watching,” he noted.
“You know you’ve built a good culture when people do the right thing when you’re not watching,” he noted.
Upon returning to eBay, he took ownership of the technology vision, strategy, and implementation across the company.', 'In a fit of midlife foolishness – and because I cannot afford the proverbial red sports car convertible – I recently made my first-ever purchase on eBay.
I bought a used copy of the very first issue of “Mad” magazine I remember reading when I was 8 years old.
I opened the magazine and went right to the “Popeye” parody.
In my late thirties, I once stopped by the magazine racks at Walmart and spotted the current issue of “Mad.” On a whim, I started leafing through it.
And now I’ve got this old issue from when I was 8.', '', 'People have been left bewildered after two hefty pieces of granite, referred to as prehistoric Cornish standing stones, were listed on eBay for between £3,000 to £4,000.
There were concerns over the validity of a sale for such a historic feature and how the stones would be delivered.
The two eBay listings advertised "natural" and "weathered" Cornish granite "boulders" which the seller described as menhirs, or standing stones.
However, Twitter users have been left bemused over the validity of the listing if they were in fact prehistoric standing stones, questioning the legalities of such a sale.
There were also concerns over the location of the granite, with them being listed for sale in Fareham, Portsmouth - a 200 plus miles from Cornwall.', 'Andrew Kenton sold a piece of 90 Day Fiance’s history after putting Amira Lollysa’s engagement ring and wedding band on eBay.
That’s exactly what Andrew Kenton did, and gained a little cash back in the process.
The 90 Day Fiancé alum has officially left things in the past as he placed Amira’s engagement ring and wedding band on eBay in late August.
Screenshot from official 90 Day Fiancé YouTube channel – How Andrew Met Amira | 90 Day FiancéAmira Lollysa’s ring sold for more than $2KAndrew’s sister, Connie Kenton, was listed as the seller of the eBay auction entitled 90-Day Fiance Amira’s Engagement Ring And Wedding Band.
WATCH 90 DAY FIANCÉ SUNDAYS AT 8/7C ON TLCAND GET FREAKY WITH US ON INSTAGRAM AND FACEBOOK']

title: ['Deal alert: 20% off Razer gaming gear on eBay - finder.com.au', 'eBay launches the Global Xpansion Program (GXP) to accelerate global growth for fast growing Indian Business.. - ETRetail', 'Studies Have Shown That eBay Is the Cheapest Resale Platform - HYPEBEAST']
summary:
["Gamers, now is the time to score big savings on essential Razer products from eBay.
Razer gaming eBay saleKishi V2 Android gaming controller | $169 $135.20 (save $33.80) If you take your mobile gaming seriously, you know that relying solely on your phone controls simply won't do.
View dealBarracuda X wireless headset | $119 $95.20 (save $23.80) Tired to run through tinny old headsets that barely last a month?
It's time to get the Barracuda X wireless headset with an ergonomic design, advanced microphone technology and crystal-clear audio.
Then you'll get plenty of value out of this Razer gaming eBay deal on a top-shelf webcam.", 'We use cookies to ensure best experience for youWe use cookies and other tracking technologies to improve your browsing experience on our site, show personalize content and targeted ads, analyze site traffic, and understand where our audience is coming from.
You can also read our privacy policy, We use cookies to ensure the best experience for you on our website.
By choosing I accept, or by continuing being on the website, you consent to our use of Cookies and Terms & Conditions.', 'In a recent study from VoucherCodes, the website has collected data analyzing the cost of 20 of the most popular fashion brand items this year.
In the search for items like the Dior Saddlebag, the Jacquemus Bambino, as well as the hottest Nike or YEEZY sneakers, it appears that each resale platform has a great variance of prices.
The data found was compared across three re-sale sites including DePop, eBay and Vinted.
Amongst the three, the prices for similar items saw great variance, with eBay being the least expensive for pre-owned fashion products.
Savings Expert at VoucherCodes, Anita Naik said, “Many people also don’t know that you can use discounts on items sold through resale platforms.']

title: ["eBay bans sale of wristbands from Queen's lying in state queue after bids reach into thousands - Sky News", 'How clever mechanics keep 50-year-old BART trains running: Windows 98, eBay, and scraps - The Mercury News', 'BMW M1 Wheels With Original Tires Show Up on eBay For $18,700 - BMWBLOG', 'NVIDIA RTX 3090 Going for ~$700 on eBay or Less than Half its Price, RTX 3080 for $499 [Used] - Hardware Times']
summary:
['eBay has banned the sale of second hand wristbands given out to people queuing to see the Queen lying in state - after bids for some of them reached into the thousands on the online marketplace.
Mourners had speedily posted their used wristbands on the auction site after paying their respects to the Queen.
The highest listed price reached £199.99 (although many had accepted "Best Offers" meaning the exact sale figure is not listed).
The DCMS website explains the process for queuing, saying the band is "a record of when you joined the queue".
The site goes on: "Wristbands are specific to each person joining the queue, and are strictly non-transferable.', 'BART mechanics rely on Frankensteined laptops operating with Windows 98, train yard scraps and vintage microchips to keep Bay Area commuters on the rails.
“We have literally started with a picture and scoured different manufacturers and eBay looking for an oddball part,” said John Allen, a mechanic who specializes in breathing new life into broken down BART trains.
BART inspired train networks in Washington, D.C., and Atlanta, yet its specific mechanics were never widely replicated.
Today, the transit system is an outlier, with everything from wheels to windows crying out for custom-built attention.
The Western Railway Museum in Solano County is also fundraising to save historic BART cars for a new exhibit.', 'They’re all cheaper than a set of BMW M1 wheels that has emerged on eBay for a hefty $18,700.
The rare items are located in Jacksonville, Florida and represent a full M1 wheel set with the corresponding Pirelli P7 Cinturato tires.
The seller could have at least cleaned the wheels and tires given the steep asking price.
It is a good opportunity for those who own a BMW M1 to have a spare set of alloys.
In 2008, BMW unveiled the M1 Hommage as a tribute to the legendary sports car and gave it a retro-modern body along with a fresh take on those Campagnolo wheels, but considerably wider and with chunkier tires.', 'The NVIDIA RTX 3090 can now be had for as low as $709.97 with multiple listings selling the top-end Ampere card for under $800.
Keep in mind that these are used GPUs but if they work on the first boot, you should be good for the time being.
The RTX 3090 Founders Edition starts at $740 on eBay with most units located in the US.
The GeForce RTX 3080 starts at just over $500 on eBay for AIB variants and close to $600 for Founders Edition cards.
One particular seller is selling the RTX 3080 for $499 but they have absolutely zero reviews so I’d recommend a fair bit of caution before considering this listing.']

title: ['As I Listed My Atari on eBay, I Was Shocked at the Game Prices - 99.9 KTDY', "eBay bans sales of Queen Elizabeth's lying in state wristbands - Insider"]
summary:
["I recently listed my Atari 2600 gaming console for sale and, within minutes, I had a bid on the item.
On atarisandmore's profile on eBay, he lists an Atari 2600 (4-switch) with 20 games as a package for $199.
Well, here's to hoping that I'll get some more bids on my Atari 2600 console and the games.
For instance, the Atari 2600 Beam Rider game is selling online right now for around $65.
via eBay via eBay loading...How about this Atari 2600 factory-sealed E.T.", 'eBay is removing listings for wristbands for the queue to view Queen Elizabeth II's coffin from its website.
In a statement to Insider, a spokesperson for eBay said the items go against the site's policies.
According to the outlet, some wristbands drew bids of up to £70,000, which equates to about $80,755.
A spokesperson for eBay told Insider that the wristbands are "against our policies and we are removing them from our site."
"Queen Elizabeth II Lying In State Gold Queue Wristband.']

title: ['At eBay, Lurid Crimes and the Search for Punishment - The New York Times', 'eBay Australia Updates Prescription and Over-the-Counter ... - eSeller365', 'Recommended Viewing: Fake (?) Peruvian Magritte Drawings on ... - Glasstire', 'Seller Finds a Way to Access the Old eBay Listing Tool - EcommerceBytes']
summary:
['If you’re the big boss and say “take her down” are you off the hook because you didn’t get into details?
If your previous career involved doing “arguably unlawful” things, should your managers be able to plead innocence when you then go out and do unlawful things?
In two of them, members of the eBay security team are being sentenced for stalking, witness tampering and other crimes.
EBay at that time was on the defensive, under pressure from a hedge fund to perform or else.
Public criticism was not something the chief executive wanted to hear.', 'eBay Australia has updated its prescription and Over-the-Counter (OTC) medication policy which will go into effect on 19 October 2022.
Changes to the Prescription and Over-the-Counter Medication Policy include:Only Australian business sellers will be allowed to list Over-the-Counter (OTC) Medications.
When sellers list medications, the relevant Australian Register of Therapeutic Goods (ARTG) number (AUST R or AUST L) must be provided and clearly displayed.
Australian sellers that list in the Read the Over-the-Counter Medications & Treatments category should read over eBay’s updated OTC Medications & Treatments Policy.
eBay Australia To Remove Private OTC Medication ListingsBeginning 19 October 2022, private sellers will no longer be allowed to list OTC medication and all listings will be automatically removed by eBay, including listings that were launched prior to this date.', '', 'Dear Ina,I have found a workaround/ hack that enables me to swap between the SYI Form and the new tool.
I can move back to the SYI for using a different browser or FireFox.
My main browser is Chrome.
Works for me in the UK and I hope it works for everyone.
If you need more info please ask.']

title: ['Famous Redwood Log House Motorhome Is for Sale on eBay for ... - autoevolution', "AnZ Comic's Ebay Pulse 9/21 2022 + EXCLUSIVE Drop - CBSI Comics", 'CHANNELX WORLD Murray Lambell of eBay on Love Island, the ... - InternetRetailing', 'eBay Sellers Running a Business with No Access to Their Funds - EcommerceBytes', 'eBay Offers Seller Protections for Shipping Delays to Puerto Rico ... - eSeller365', 'eBay Offers Seller $500 in Ad Credits but Rescinds the Offer - EcommerceBytes', 'SFLMaven Projecting Higher Sales with eBay Authenticity Program - GlobeNewswire', 'eBay Shipping Label System Crashed Tuesday Evening - EcommerceBytes', 'Ebay Announces Changes to Sneaker Shipping, Authentication, and Fees - Complex', 'What is the Wilmington area selling on eBay? - StarNewsOnline.com']
summary:
['The redwood tree was measuring 267 feet high, with a 14-foot wide stump.The owner lived in the house for seven years before putting the giant log up a trailer and making it mobile so it could travel.
The world-famous house has been on public display for over 70 years.The house in the logs has three rooms.
The Redwood Log House has electricity but no plumbing.
However, the recent rise in fuel prices has taken its toll so it has been put up for sale.
So after more than half a century of crisscrossing America on a flatbed trailer, the Redwood Log House is looking for a new owner.The price of the entire mobile build is directly proportional to its uniqueness but also its age – it costs $11,500,000.', 'AdviceThese are always good long term holds but I would not go overboard as it takes awhile for the book to increase in value.
AdviceI like this book as a long term hold.
AdviceAgain early cover art may do well long term, not many great Starfire covers either.
Buy and hold long term.
AdviceHot Harley covers tend to do well both short and long term.', 'Lambell is a keynote speaker at the first ChannelX World, a conference with a focus on new channels from marketplaces to social media, which is to be held in London on October 13.
Register to attend ChannelX World to book your seat at the keynote session, which also features Priyanka Wadhawan of Amazon UK and Patrick Nommensen of TikTok.
eBay UK general manager Murray Lambell: Consumer sentiment is the lowest it’s been since records began, we’ve seen that in various formats and it’s really clear.
CD: You are presenting at ChannelX World in October, what can retailers expect to learn?
Register to attend ChannelX World to book your seat at Murray Lambell’s keynote session – and much more.', 'Dear Ina,I emailed you before and told you that I felt like you are the voice of sellers.
But then a couple others chimed in and said well no my payouts are not being deposited either.
They also said that eBay's "bank reference number" that eBay attaches to their payouts on the seller hub is a meaningless number.
What I need for my bank to resolve it is the 15 digit ACH trace number, which of course eBay does not provide.
The unhelpful guy on the phone from eBay told me that "it's just the payouts from this weekend that are affected" well no I call bullshit on that.', 'eBay is offering seller protections for shipping delays to and from Puerto Rico due to most of the island experiencing flooding and power outages from Hurricane Fiona.
This is significant as most eBay sellers likely use the US Postal Service to ship to and from Puerto Rico.
eBay Seller ProtectionseBay issued a notice to sellers that they do not need to worry about their seller performance rating being impacted by weather-related issues, including Hurricane Fiona.
Businesses impacted by this natural disaster we will automatically have their seller performance rating protected, including:Late shipment rate.
eBay will also remove any associated negative and neutral feedback and these cases will not impact a seller’s service metrics rating.', "eBay is back with another promotion to encourage sellers to pay extra to advertise their listings.
Last month eBay offered a similar promotion, offering some sellers $500 in ad credits for Promoted Listings Standard ads.
(You can find an explanation of eBay Promoted Listing Advanced ads on this Teikametrics blog post .)
Sellers appeared confused about how last month's promotion worked, finally receiving details in this response from a moderator on the eBay boards.
Let us know if you've taken advantage of eBay ad credits and how it has worked out for you.", "With tens of thousands of 5-star reviews on eBay, SFL Maven is projecting even higher sales as online sales have grown significantly since the pandemic.
The new authenticity program from eBay is an excellent way for SFLMaven to continue providing its customers with the high-quality products they expect.
“The ultimate goal of the eBay store is to reach over $100,000,000 in annual revenue one day.” - Joseph Ladin.
Famous for its Thursday Night Auction events on eBay, SFLMaven has driven over $140 million in sales since inception, earning more than 100k positive reviews.
FORWARD-LOOKING STATEMENTS: This press release may contain forward-looking statements, including management's view of SFLMaven Corp.'s future expectations, plans, and prospects.", 'eBay sellers were unable to print shipping labels on Tuesday evening.
The Technical Issues board was inundated with reports of problems beginning around 3:30 pm.
eBay displayed the following message when sellers tried to print labels:“Something went wrong.
One seller wrote at 6:02 pm, “Double charged for shipping label.”eBay updated its master list of technical issues on this thread on the discussion boards on Tuesday, adding the following entry: “Some sellers may have difficulty printing or paying for shipping labels.
We did not see anyplace where eBay addressed seller protections for problems resulting from the glitch.', 'Ebay has shared updates that are being implemented to the sneaker shopping experience on its e-commerce platform in October.
Users were notified via email today about the changes, including additional silhouettes being added to its “Authenticity Guarantee” program, more efficient shipping, and a fee increase.
For a full rundown of all the sneakers eligible for Ebay’s “Authenticity Guarantee” program, click here.
Ebay also confirmed that the shipping logistics for both buyers and sellers are receiving an upgrade.
Buyers will now pay a flat shipping fee of $14.95 in the US.', "And if you're into finding various treasures that connect to the Wilmington area, eBay is also a place to find a host of unique items.
Michael Jordan cardOf course we all know Michael Jordan as the Wilmington native who went on to basketball superstardom as a six-time NBA champion.
More:What we've learned about Michael Jordan's impact in his hometown of WilmingtonMore:What does Michael Jordan mean to Wilmington?
Coca-Cola and WilmingtonAn eBay seller based in Manteo has this Coca-Cola bottle made in Wilmington for sale.
New Hanover yearbookNew Hanover High School is celebrating its 100-year anniversary."]

title: ['eBay Motors Launches the Ultimate Road Trip to Celebrate Car ... - PR Newswire', "Be part of eBay's fantastic Community Challenge event! - AFC Wimbledon", 'Disney Lorcana trading cards are already selling for thousands on eBay - Polygon', 'eBay Launches Brand New International Shipping Program to ... - EcommerceBytes', '“Your mom sold you on eBay for two pounds”: IShowSpeed slams a random stranger after being compared to YouTuber Vikkstar - Sportskeeda']
summary:
["The 'Parts of America' tour will take eBay Motors to twelve automotive enthusiast events across the country - from car meets and cruises to tractor pulls and rock crawls.
At each stop, eBay Motors will feature one-of-a-kind vehicles that bring to life the local car culture and the passionate builders behind these remarkable rides.
The eBay Motors ‘Parts of America’ hauler is stopping in small towns across the country to pick up eight rides, customized by partner builders with parts from eBay, which represent the best of US car culture.
Throughout the tour, eBay Motors' hauler will collect and transport eight bespoke vehicles that show what's possible using parts and accessories from eBay Motors, and represent America's diverse and remarkable auto cultures.
'Parts of America' RouteeBay Motors 'Parts of America' tour will kick off Sept. 21 in Hickory Corners, MI, at the Gilmore Car Museum's Wednesday Night Cruise-In.", 'eBay and EFL partner to support local communities across the country.
eBay has been donating its advertising spaces across EFL grounds to local businesses, in local communities, all over the country.
As part of eBay’s Small Businesses United campaign, they’re working with the Club to offer fans the opportunity to attend a unique evening of entertainment, bringing together local communities, Clubs and fans alike, to see who will be crowned Community Champion.
eBay champions local Clubs and local businesses believes that the heart of football is community.
From the tradesmen to the small business owners, these people came together to mould the community and thus the origins of our beloved clubs.', 'The first cards for Disney Lorcana, a new collectible card game from Ravensburger, were unveiled at Disney D23 less than two weeks ago.
Speculation in the trading card market is nothing new, but it reached new heights during the pandemic.
First came a sudden interest in the Pokémon Trading Card Game, leading many to cast about for older collections they could sell for quick cash.
Aging tech companies and decades-old card game publishers aren’t the only ones getting in on the action, however.
SolForge Fusion, an upstart card game with roots in crowdfunding, is also making a big push with its marketing.', 'eBay is launching a brand new international shipping program.
It appears it replaces the current Global Shipping Program.
It states on the landing page: “At launch, all new, eligible listings will automatically default to eBay International Shipping.”And in the FAQs, it states:“If you’re currently using the Global Shipping Program, you will be automatically enrolled and your listings will default to eBay International Shipping.
And as a result, your inventory will be seen by millions more buyers around the world.”eBay uses a third-party company (Pitney-Bowes) to power the current Global Shipping program.
The new program is called eBay International Shipping, or EIS.', 'Controversial YouTuber Dareen "IShowSpeed" recently had a fan interaction go viral on social media, which might cause yet another controversy for the streaming phenomenon.
In a clip that has been making rounds on the internet, the Ohio-native slammed a random stranger as he compared Speed with none other than popular American YouTuber Vikkstar.
As per the stranger himself, Vikkstar is way better than Speed.
However, according to several viewers, the 17-years-old took it too far as he humiliated a stranger simply because he compared him to popular American YouTuber and content creator Vikkstar.
In the clip, when the stranger approached Speed and started comparing him to Vikkstar, IShowSpeed began to rage and humiliate the guy, commenting on his fashion nous.']

title: ['eBay & aBlogtoWatch Celebrate The Watch Collecting Hobby In Los ... - aBlogtoWatch', "Potentially dangerous 'energy-saving boxes' on Amazon and eBay ... - Which?", 'eBay Announces New Features at Day 2 of Seller Conference - EcommerceBytes', 'Commerce . eBay se retire du Black Friday - Le Progrès']
summary:
['Sponsored post presented on aBlogtoWatch for advertiserDespite being a company that was originally founded upon the premise of online auctions and completely digital transactions, eBay has increasingly been exploring the landscape of in-person events.
Advertising MessageEBay’s partners on site included:WatchboxTimetitansMQLuxeAdorethecoutureGuests at our event with eBay in Los Angeles also received a discount code to help sweeten the deal of any timepiece they were considering purchasing.
Sponsored Posts are a form of advertising that allows sponsors to share useful news, messages, and offers to aBlogtoWatch readers in a way traditional display advertising is often not best suited to.
All Sponsored Posts are subject to editorial guidelines with the intent that they offer readers useful news, promotions, or stories.
The viewpoints and opinions expressed in Sponsored Posts are those of the advertiser and not necessarily those of aBlogtoWatch or its writers.', "Amazon and eBay appear to have delisted dozens of so-called ‘energy-saving boxes’ from their websites, after a Which?
We first spotted so-called energy-saving devices for sale on Amazon and eBay in February, and published our first investigation into the devices in Which?
In our first investigation we tested two energy-saving devices from eBay and two from Amazon.
While both Amazon and eBay say they have removed energy-saving boxes from their sites, we have already seen other near identical products reappearing.
'The government urgently needs to give online platforms greater legal responsibility to prevent the sale of unsafe products.", 'eBay announced several new features for sellers during the first keynote address at day 2 of its eBay Open virtual conference related to shipping and marketing.
Zhang also provided more details about a new international shipping program referenced by eBay CEO Jamie Iannone during his keynote address the day before.
Zhang said the goal is to make international shipping as hassle-free as shipping an item domestically with less risk and lower cost than existing programs.
You can find details (and seller reaction) about the new eBay International Shipping program in our reporting from Wednesday (“eBay Launches Brand New International Shipping Program to Replace GSP“).
He also said videos are now “retail standard,” and said eBay began allowing sellers to upload videos last year.', 'Vous avez choisi de refuser le dépôt de cookies, vous pouvez à tout moment modifier votre choix, ici.
Le contenu de ce site est le fruit du travail de journalistes qui vous apportent chaque jour une information locale de qualité, fiable, complète, et des services en ligne innovants.
Ce travail s’appuie sur les revenus complémentaires de la publicité et de l’abonnement.']

summary:
['The Up & Running Grant program annually awards 50 notable eBay sellers each with $10,000 plus customized mentorship, training and tools.
The Up & Running Grant program annually awards 50 notable eBay sellers each with $10,000 plus customized mentorship, training and tools.
Meet eBay's Class of 2022 Up & Running Grant winners:Through Hello Alice, all grant recipients are enrolled in an online community of similar businesses for peer-to-peer mentoring, networking and support for all stages of business.
About the Up & Running Grant ProgramIn April 2020 eBay announced Up & Running, a $100 million small business accelerator program to address the devastating impacts of COVID-19 to small, local retail businesses.
In November 2020 – to expand on its "Up & Running" pledge – eBay introduced the Up & Running Grant program in partnership with Hello Alice.', 'All the stories from the cost of living crisis alongside financial hints and tipsAn extremely rare 50p coin is up for grabs on eBay.
The EC 50p coin entered circulation courtesy of the Royal Mint between 1992 and 1993.
It’s now so hard to come by that it’s harder to get your paws on than the Kew Gardens coin, and will set you back £1,295.
By comparison there were 210,000 Kew Gardens 50p coins made, meaning the EC 50p is almost twice as rare and harder to find.
The EC 50p was stamped on an older, bigger 50p design that was removed from circulation in 1997 and replaced by a smaller version.', '', "With the PlayStation 5 console available for as little as $800 on eBay, now is the perfect time to buy.
Buy PlayStation 5 console for $800 on eBay At the time of writing, the PlayStation 5 Disc Edition is available on eBay for just $800, which is the product's recommended retail price (RRP).
The PlayStation 5 is available on eBay right now for just $800.
At the time of writing, the PS5 Disc Edition is available for $800, with a $20.05 shipping fee.
The Standard Edition, also known as the Disc Edition, has the capacity to play physical Blu-ray discs."]

title: ["Roger Federer retirement sparks eBay frenzy as limited edition 'RF' hat booms in price - Express"]
summary:
["Roger Federer fans have seemingly cashed in on the 20-time Grand Slam champion's retirement with his iconic 'RF' logo cap being sold for 10 times the retail price at The O2.
That's been the case at the 2022 Laver Cup too with a special edition hat quickly selling out earlier in the week.
With Federer announcing the tournament this week would be his last before retirement, fans descended on the capital to grab what merchandise they could.
Retailing at £36, fans quickly snapped up the hats before they sold out with fans now turning to eBay to make a huge profit on their initial investment.
One fan outside The O2 wearing the in-demand cap was seemingly unaware of the price it now fetches."]

title: ['Summary of New Features Announced at eBay Open - EcommerceBytes']

At Thursday’s eBay Open keynote, eBay said it was continuing to expand the availability of spendable funds to US sellers this year.

title: ["Macy's enters marketplace competition with Amazon, Walmart, eBay - Chain Store Age", 'eBay Hikes Sneaker Fees, Will Charge Buyers $14.95/pair Shipping - EcommerceBytes', "eBay Set to Raffle Hyped Sneakers with 'OG Drops' Campaign - PAUSE Online"]
summary:
['Department store retailer Macy’s Inc. is officially launching a new digital marketplace on its e-commerce site.
The marketplace runs on a Mirakl enterprise marketplace technology platform that has been customized by Macy’s digital, merchant and technology teams.
Marketplace is designed to offer customers a cohesive and integrated Macy’s digital experience.
Customers will also be able to purchase marketplace products while having full access to their Star Rewards loyalty benefits, in addition to standard Macy’s returns.
According to Macy’s, sellers and brands will be chosen to ensure alignment with business needs and Macy’s product and fulfillment standards.', 'eBay will charge buyers a flat $14.95 shipping fee for sneakers sold through its Authenticity Guarantee program, and sellers will have 3 days to ship the items to the eBay authentication hub.
eBay explained in Monday’s post:“We’re removing the complexity tied to shipping for both sellers and buyers.
The change will apply to new and revised listings and eBay shipping will be the default domestic shipping service.
Buyers will pay a flat shipping fee of $14.95 in the US.
“We’re aligning the final value fee for sneakers sold between $100 and $150 with those for sneakers sold for less than $100.', 'Global buying and selling platform eBay is giving back to sneaker culture once again as the titans of the e-commerce industry unveil their ‘OG Drop’ campaign, which looks to raffle an array of hyped sneakers for a fraction of their resale price.
eBay have set up both a £1.00 online raffle and an in-store sneakers and music quiz in their Manchester outlet to give people the chance to bid for their favourite sneakers, all the while giving back to charity as eBay donate the money raised from their online raffle to Manchester’s Olympias Music Foundation.
Taking place on September 29th, eBay will be undertaking a raffling event at the eBay UK Sneaker Store in Manchester’s Stage and Radio, with the event set to be hosted by rapper and singer IAMDDB as well as television and radio presenter Yasmin Evans.
Some of the sneakers currently available to bid on include the IAMDDB Nike Jordan 1 Mid Kentucky Blue, Nike Air Jordan 4 Travis Scott, and the Yeezy 350 Oxford Tan.
Check out some shots of what’ll be on offer below and head over to the eBay website for more information.']

title: ['eBay sellers cash in on new Netflix Jeffrey Dahmer series by selling dupes of his clothing - Wales Online', 'eBay Motors to Sponsor Sarah and Bridget Burgess in Historic ... - eBay Inc.', 'Queen lying in state wristband for sale on eBay for huge amount ... - Hereford Times', "EBay Kleinanzeigen launches 'buy direct' option - AIM Group", 'Your old iPhone could be worth $5,000 on eBay – but it’s all down to the model... - The US Sun', 'eBay deep dives: Elton John and the celebrity owners of the NASL - The Athletic']
summary:
['Ghoulish Ebay sellers are trying to cash in on the new Netflix series about serial killer Jeffrey Dahmer - by selling sick merchandise and even dupes of his loafers.
The description includes: "These are the same brand, style and colour of shoes Jeffrey Dahmer wore which can be seen in the home videos his father recorded before his arrest."
The new Netflix show 'DAHMER - Monster: The Jeffrey Dahmer Story' was released on the popular streaming website last Wednesday (September 21) and currently holds the UK number one spot in TV Programmes Today.
With viewers gripped by the show that details the story behind serial killer Jeffrey Dahmer who famously murdered 17 teen boys and young men, clothes in tribute to the criminal have appeared on Depop and etsy.
Other products on etsy include an 'If you can't beat em, eat em - Jeffrey Dahmer' t-shirt for £14.43 and a birthday card featuring the words 'I love you so Dahm much' for £2.66.', 'eBay Motors, the parts and accessories destination used by millions of car lovers, wrenchers, racers and mechanics, today announces its sponsorship of Sarah and Bridget Burgess for the Oct. 14 ARCA Menards West Series race at The Bullring, Las Vegas, NV.
“It’s incredible to have the support of eBay Motors.
And now, after years of supporting her daughter’s racing aspirations, Sarah is joining Bridget on the oval for the ultimate competition - both sporting the eBay Motors logo.
Bridget and Sarah Burgess“The eBay Motors team is made up of car enthusiasts like Sarah,” said Ron Jaiven, GM of P&A, eBay Motors.
As the platform of choice for gearheads and casual maintainers alike, eBay Motors offers unrivaled selection and value, helping shoppers to find the right part at the right price.', 'The wristbands, which are given out to mourners, are appearing on sites like eBay and Facebook Marketplace.
OTHER NEWS:An unbroken purple wristband is now for sale on eBay by user mefr71, based in Monmouth.
There are four days left on the listing which says: "Queen's lying in state wristband - purple unbroken.
OTHER NEWS:There is also a broken wristband for sale with a Worcester-based account.
Seller lucylunt17 said: "These items were previously removed I have written permission that I am permitted to sell these on eBay."', 'Germany's largest online classified portal, EBay Kleinanzeigen, will offer a new "buy direct" function, allowing private buyers and sellers to do business directly without having to contact each other first.
How it worksSellers select the "buy dir...', 'A first-generation iPhone, for instance, is listed for $23,000 on eBay.
Apple introduced the iPhone in 2007Apple celebrated the 15th anniversary of the first-generation iPhone in June 2022.
The first-generation iPhone on eBayBoxed and mint-condition products are unsurprisingly more profitable than their dinged counterparts.
At 15 years old, the first-generation iPhone is an ancient relic as far as gadgets go.
4 Steve Jobs died of pancreatic cancer four years after debuting the iPhone in 2011 Credit: Getty Images - Getty', 'AdvertisementThe North American Soccer League, in particular, was rife with big name owners and players.
The Aztecs entered the NASL in 1974 and very quickly left their mark, winning the NASL Championship in their very first season.
In reality, it was never really clear how much of the Aztecs John owned, if any of it.
It would be reincarnated again in 1987, used by a franchise in the American Soccer League for a few years.
More recently, the Diplomats have been reborn in the “National Soccer League,” an organization that still somehow feels entirely imaginary.']

title: ['eBay fumes after copping massive fine and 40 penalty notices for NRL grand final ticket scalping - 7NEWS', 'Two Former eBay Executives Sentenced to Prison for Cyberstalking - Department of Justice', 'Heron Preston Releases Personal Sneaker Collection on eBay - PR Newswire', "There's More to eBay's Nostalgic French 'Comeback' Ad Than First ... - Adweek", '7 Nostalgic Foods You Can Get on eBay Right Now - The Takeout', 'Two former eBay executives sentenced to prison for involvement in cyberstalking scheme - CNBC', 'Single mum stashed stock in toilets at work to flog on eBay - Nottinghamshire Live']
summary:
['E-commerce giant eBay has hit back after being slapped with $44,000 in fines for having overpriced tickets to Sunday’s sold-out NRL grand final on its platform.
NSW Fair Trading on Friday said it had issued eBay with 40 penalty infringement notices for publishing prohibited advertisements about NRL grand final tickets, in breach of ticket scalping laws.
WATCH THE VIDEO ABOVE: Panthers, Eels face off ahead of grand final.
Grand final coaches Ivan Cleary and Brad Arthur during the NRL’s Fan Fest at Martin Place on Thursday.
The crackdown comes after the consumer watchdog publicly warned about the risks of ticket scalping at major events such as the NRL grand final.', 'BOSTON – The former Senior Director of Safety & Security at eBay, Inc. and the company’s former Director of Global Resiliency were sentenced to prison today for their roles in a cyberstalking campaign targeting the editor and publisher of a newsletter that eBay executives viewed as critical of the company.
David Harville, 50, of Las Vegas, Nev., was sentenced to two years in prison and two years of supervised release.
The harassment campaign arose from communications between those senior executives and Baugh, who was eBay’s senior security employee.
The defendants and their co-conspirators executed a three-part harassment campaign intended to intimidate the victims and to influence their reporting about eBay.
After learning of the police’s investigation, Harville and Baugh deleted digital evidence related to the cyberstalking campaign.', '', 'In recent years big budget TV campaigns have embraced the trend of “sadvertising”—telling audiences emotive stories, typically soundtracked by a twinkling piano score and punctuated with a meaningful message.
Retail marketplace eBay has turned this format on its head in a fresh ad from Paris-based agency Artefact 3000.
“The Camera,” directed by Vincent Lobelle, starts off innocuously enough, showcasing a young girl on a mission to revive her father’s passion for photography after finding out he used to be a keen amateur.', 'But e B ay is one of those sites that still feels a bit like the Wild West.
Selling and buying food over e commerce websites is, first and foremost, a funny proposition.
Besides, e B ay really shines as a place to buy very weird and/or very old food.
There are rules for selling food on the platform, however .
”This leaves the door open for old food that is packaged and unopened, which means a stroll through eBay’s current listings can unearth some fascinating foodstuffs— relics of the past that can’t be bought anywhere else.', "Two former eBay executives were given prison time Thursday for their involvement in a cyberstalking scheme that targeted a couple behind an e-commerce blog that was perceived as critical of the company.
EBay executives repeatedly sent the couple harassing and threatening messages on Twitter .
An eBay spokesperson didn't respond to a request for comment.
A spokesperson for Wenig said an independent investigation has shown the former eBay CEO had no knowledge of the harassment campaign.
The Steiners have filed a separate lawsuit against eBay, Wenig and former senior vice president Steve Wymer.", 'A single mum was flogging pub stock from work on eBay because she "thought everybody was taking the items as well", magistrates heard.
Kay wiped away tears as she pleaded guilty to theft by an employee when she appeared at Nottingham Magistrates' Court on Thursday (September 29).
"There was a bit of a culture within the company, Intaspec, which subcontracted for Interserve," said Miss Rooks.
Unused items were either weighed or sold on, sometimes "quite openly", added Miss Rooks.
"She really got carried away, observing some other people doing it, the seed has been planted and she has done it herself," Miss Rooks went on.']

title: ['eBay Black Friday sales 2022: What to expect - finder.com.au', 'Former eBay exec gets 5 years in jail for sending spiders and cockroaches in the mail to online critics - Fortune', 'After eBay harassment sentencing, blame game continues as ... - GBH News', 'Ex-eBay security execs imprisoned for stalking journalists who cover eBay - Ars Technica', "Stadia's Exhibit Of Historic Gaming Blunders Is Now On eBay ... - Kotaku", 'The Best Basketball-Inspired Sneakers to Cop on eBay Right Now - Complex', "Follow the eBay Tribes in Pursuit of a Bargain in 'That's the eBay ... - Little Black Book - LBBonline", 'How to get Apple, Dyson and more for less at eBay’s Refurbished hub - The Independent', 'Two Former eBay Officials Put Behind Bars for Cyberstalking - Yahoo Finance']
summary:
["What can you expect during eBay's Black Friday sales in 2022?
Best eBay Black Friday 2021 salesHere are some of the best deals we saw from eBay during Black Friday 2021.
eBay Plus Black Friday exclusive dealsA trend you might notice among last year's deals are some major discounts exclusively for eBay Plus members.
Best eBay deals September 2022Want to enjoy what eBay offers without waiting until November?
You can expect to see Black Friday sales continuing at least until the end of November.", '“This was a bizarre, premeditated assault on our lives … with buy-in at the highest levels of eBay,” Steiner told the judge.
The scheme was hatched in August 2019 after Ina Steiner wrote a story about a lawsuit brought by eBay accusing Amazon of poaching its sellers.
That executive sent Wenig’s message to Baugh and called Ina Steiner a “biased troll who needs to get BURNED DOWN.”Soon, Ina Steiner began receiving harassing and sometimes threatening Twitter messages.
Ina Steiner began receiving dozens of strange emails from groups like an irritable bowel syndrome patient support group and the Communist Party of the United States, authorities say.
Baugh told the Steiners he hopes that they will forgive him some day.', 'Intense finger-pointing between former eBay executives continued this week over who, ultimately, was to blame for a bizarre and terrifying harassment campaign carried out by former employees against a Natick couple.
But Baugh’s attorneys argue that higher-up employees should share in the blame — and criminal liability.
But blame game aside, the facts of the case — and the traumatic impact it had on the couple — are not in question.
“These Fortune 500 companies that have endless amounts of money get treated differently in the U.S. attorney’s office than everybody else,” Scappichio told GBH News Friday.
The U.S. attorney’s office also did not answer questions Friday about that meeting, referring instead to the public statement released after the sentencing of Baugh and Harville.', 'Two former eBay executives were sentenced to prison yesterday for cyberstalking and harassing journalists whose news coverage had rankled the eBay CEO.
One other former eBay employee was sentenced last year, and four others await sentencing.
James Baugh, 47, eBay's former senior director of safety and security, was sentenced to 57 months in prison and two years of supervised release, a Justice Department press release said yesterday.
David Harville, 50, eBay's former director of global resiliency, was sentenced to two years in prison and two years of supervised release.
The harassment campaign arose from communications between those senior executives and Baugh, who was eBay's senior security employee," the Justice Department said.', 'Outside of the 2019 Game Developers Conference, before anyone had ever heard the phrase “Google Stadia,” sat a small display outlining the history of gaming.
All proceeds are going to the Video Game History Foundation.
Buy for $72 Amazon AdvertisementIt was never quite clear what message Google intended to send with the odd display.
“No clue where this is going but I’m intrigued #GoogleGDC19,” gaming insider Nibel tweeted when the exhibit was revealed at the time.
ET: The eBay auction has concluded with a winning bid o f $2,050.', 'Basketball sneakers have come a long way since the first Chuck Taylors in the 1960s.
And then, of course, there’s the matter of style.
Naturally, they pair well with streetwear-inspired looks, loud colourways working with bold graphic tees and relaxed denim, whereas muted monochrome iterations can complement more minimal ‘fits.
With the summer heat showing no signs of slowing down, there’s no better way to spend the day than on the court.
We hit the stacked pages of eBay to round up 5 Authentically Guaranteed basketball shoes available to buy right now*—scroll through below.', "'That’s the eBay way' highlights the business’ renewed commitments to enable ways to buy and sell that benefit all.
The platform’s launch campaign features a series of TVCs, where a range of eBay tribes are introduced: the ‘Bargain Hunters’, ‘Style Seekers’ and ‘Experts’.
Complementing the TV campaign is a nationwide buy for OOH and Press, as well as full social and digital cover, celebrating the behaviours that make up “The eBay Way”.
The TV campaign and OOH campaign was written and art directed by senior creatives Ben Buswell and Jo Griffin, with the brand look and feel developed by Karen Jane, Design Director, with McCann Design London.
The campaign will continue to roll out during October including AV, Social and Digital.", 'Big-name brands are constantly working to update their products to meet our ever-growing standards, but this of course comes at a cost.
Head to the eBay Refurbished hub for discounts on big-name brandsAnd it just gets better because you can snap up products from big-name brands, including the likes of Apple, Dyson, Shark, and more, with savings of up to 30 per cent.
Refurbished Simba(Simba foam & spring mattress topper: Now £141.98, ebay.co.uk)Simba is one of the leading bed-in-a-box brands, and for good reason too.
Shop Dyson refurbished on eBayRefurbished Apple(iPhone 12 pro max: £669.95, Ebay.co.uk)As tech brands go, Apple needs little introduction.
Shop refurbished Panasonic on eBayVisit ebay.co.uk now for more discounts on big-name brands', "The U.S. Department of Justice sentenced two former eBay Inc (NASDAQ: EBAY) executives to prison for their roles in a cyberstalking campaign targeting the editor and publisher of a newsletter that eBay executives viewed as critical of the company.
Prosecutors said former eBay CEO Devin Wenig and other leaders inside the company were outraged by their company coverage.
eBay executives repeatedly sent the couple harassing and threatening messages on Twitter Inc (NYSE: TWTR) platform.
Baugh, Harville, and others also traveled from California to the Steiners' home to surveil the couple, prompting them to call the police.
The Steiners have filed a separate lawsuit against eBay, Wenig, and former SVP Steve Wymer."]

title: ['eBay fined over NRL grand final ticket scalping as officials hit Sydney office - Fox Sports', 'Murray Lambell of eBay UK: ‘I was not comfortable to be out at work … and that limits you’ - The Guardian', 'Liverpool couple living in ambulance they bought on eBay - Liverpool Echo', 'Your old Apple products can earn you THOUSANDS on eBay – exact models revealed including rare original i... - The US Sun']
summary:
['Crowds at the 2022 NRL Fan Fest at Martin Place in Sydney ahead of this weekend’s NRL Grand Final.
Picture: Richard DobsonE-commerce website eBay has been fined by NSW Fair Trading after NRL grand final tickets with marked-up prices appeared on its website.
NSW Fair Trading commissioner Natasha Mann said the strict rules were in place to ensure tickets stayed at a reasonable price.
Crowds at the 2022 NRL Fan Fest at Martin Place in Sydney ahead of this weekend’s NRL Grand Final.
“Earlier this month, I published a public warning about the risks of ticket scalping at major events like the NRL Grand Final.”Parramatta Eels player Mitchell Moses meets with fans on the week of the NRL Grand Final.', 'But Murray Lambell, the UK boss of US online retail giant eBay, can draw on personal experience of the importance of how a business cares for staff.
I didn’t feel comfortable to be a complete person at work and then that limits you.”So what emboldened him?
Until now, Lambell has been speaking briskly, beneath vivid images from graphic designer Alba Blázquez in the bright surroundings of eBay’s UK headquarters in west London.
Best advice he’s been given “Deliver, deliver, deliver,” from the former eBay chief customer officer Wendy Jones.
A lonely-looking table-football unit is the only nod to tech work culture, and each meeting room has a pointedly British name and theme (we sit in Bond, a silhouette of 007 etched into the glass).', 'Liverpool couple travelling the world in an ambulance aim to make new world record after buying it on eBay.
"One day Rachel called me and said she found an ambulance on eBay and we fell in love with it.
Lawrence, a veterinary surgeon, told the ECHO : “We are super thrilled to set the minimum distance asked by Guinness.
"Peggy is living her best life as well, she's loving it and meeting new people, she's in her element.
Certain countries, their attitudes to dogs differ to the UK, some don't see dogs as pets as such."', "VINTAGE Apple products can go for thousands of dollars in the online marketplace if sellers have a rare item to offer.
Some buyers may have unknowingly bought a short-lived gadget that is now coveted by Apple collectors and historians.
The pair debuted Apple's first product, the Apple I computer, on April 11, 1976, and priced it at $666.66.
One ambitious seller on eBay has an Apple I listed for a stunning $1.5million - they claim the computer once sat in the Byte Shop among the other originals.
A first-generation iPad in good working condition can fetch you about $55 on eBay."]

title: ['Do Customer Claims Kill Your Ranking in eBay Search? - EcommerceBytes', 'North-east business crowned winner at national eBay for business ... - Grampian Online']
summary:
['An eBay seller became concerned about the impact that customer claims could have on his visibility in search after listening to a presentation at the eBay Open conference last month where executives described the latest factors that influence search ranking.
When a buyer searches for a product, eBay’s search engine identifies matching listings.
This “Best Match” search determines the default sort order of listings on the search results page, called ranking.
During the eBay Open presentation, Pravesh Katyal, eBay’s Director of Product Management, Search, stated:“The customer service that you provide which gets reflected in your history.
And let us know if delivery estimates are realistic and whether customer claims impact your visibility in search results.', 'The eBay for Business Awards is an annual celebration of the best and most inspiring of eBay’s hundreds of thousands strong army of small and medium sized businesses in the UK.
This year, six deserving small businesses beat out almost 1000 other applicants to be crowned winners at Friday’s eBay Open seller conference in Birmingham.
More recently, eBay’s sponsorship of Love Island, which saw eBay become the hit reality show’s first ever pre-loved clothing partner, has led to an 881 per cent rise in searches for ‘eBay preloved’ on Google.
Murray Lambell, General Manager of eBay UK, said: “Each year I’m blown away by the calibre of the small businesses who enter the eBay for Business Awards.
“Building a successful business is a fantastic achievement: it takes real knowledge, skill and determination to weather the types of challenges I know our small businesses have faced.']

title: ['Heron Preston on eBay’s Decades of Success, His New Auction and Bidding on Sneakers in 2001 - Footwear News', 'Market Watch: Bowie and Elvis records among top-sellers on eBay - Goldmine Magazine', 'eBay Launches ‘From the Collection’ Collaborative Capsules - Sourcing Journal', 'eBay for Charity launches its Charity Connect Programme for 2022 - UK Fundraising']
summary:
['Before the auction, Preston spoke with FN about the auction’s charitable component, pairs he second-guessed putting up for auction and his future with eBay.
Those moments when I would win an auction on an original, OG pair of sneakers and unbox those were everything.
I would put my sneakers on the shelves, tuck the boxes away and go to sleep looking at my sneakers.
I really want those back, those Zoo York Dunks.”Some of Heron Preston’s sneakers that will be auctioned off on eBay.
CREDIT: Courtesy of eBayWere there any pairs of sneakers that are part of this auction that were particularly tough to give up?', '', 'The e-commerce marketplace has launched “From the Collection,” a series of product capsules taken straight from the closets of a range of tastemakers.
The project was introduced with an exclusive assortment from designer Heron Preston, a Nike veteran who worked with Kanye West on fashion projects before launching his own streetwear label.
Sneakerheads will have the chance to bid on 50 pairs of Preston’s collectible sneakers, with offers starting at 99 cents.
All of the proceeds from the sale of Preston’s shoes will be used to fund scholarships and grants for young creatives through the Heron Preston L.E.D.
CourtesyWhile Preston’s drop is decidedly sneaker-centric, the GM said that future From the Collection releases will include items from eBay’s other popular categories.', 'eBay for Charity launches its Charity Connect Programme for 2022Charity Connect is a free course that offers charity retailers, of all sizes and experience on eBay, training to boost online revenues.
The programme will help digitally upskill charities so they can increase their fundraising and runs for 12 weeks from January 2023.
This is the third year of the programme, and eBay for Charity hopes to help more charities raise unrestricted funds this year.
eBay for Charity currently connects over 13,000 UK charities to supporters.
In 2021, £38mn was raised by the eBay UK community and, to date, over $1 billion has been raised globally through eBay for Charity, with over £230 million raised for UK charities since 2007.']
