Category Analysis - Saudi Arabia E-Commerce Market8.1 Beauty, Health, Personal & Household Care8.2 Beverages8.3 Electronics8.4 Fashion8.5 Food8.6 Furniture8.7 Media8.8 Toy, Hobby & DIY9.", 'But a new report is urging people to think twice before buying Christmas lights online.
investigation has found that illegal lights are being sold on popular sites including AliExpress, Amazon, eBay and Wish.
But a new report is urging people to think twice before buying Christmas lights online (stock image)The consumer champion tested a range of Christmas tree lights priced at £15 or less on AliExpress, Amazon, eBay and Wish.
Overall, 10 of the 12 sets of lights – including two being sold on Amazon and two from eBay - failed compliance checks and cannot be sold in the UK legally.
In response to the findings, AliExpress, Amazon, eBay and Wish all said they had removed the illegal products from their platforms.', "Another week, another great AMD CPU deal on American Ebay.
This time it's on the Ryzen 7 5700X, a powerful eight-core 16-thread processor with the same basic design of the 5800X - at a significantly lower price.
This model debuted at $300, but is now available for just $190 when you buy it from Antonline on Ebay.
So what exactly is the difference between the 5700X, which remains un-reviewed by RPS, and the 5800X, which has had a full work-up?
In short, don't consider the 5800X if it's at all more expensive than the 5700X - pick this up instead, and enjoy great performance at a lower cost.", "Read our ethics policySave 20% on select Dyson products.
For a limited time only, save 20% on a number of Dyson stick vacuums, air purifiers and hair styling tools direct from Dyson on eBay.
Using promo code DYSONSAVINGS, shoppers can save an extra 20% at eBay.com on 22 Dyson products.
The items range from popular stick vacuums like the V11 to upright vacs like the Animal Pro.
The coupon is capped at $100 off, but it's a great way to save on Dyson products for the holidays — and well into the New Year.", 'Pitney Bowes finds itself under pressure to divest itself of a unit that exclusively powers eBay’s international shipping programs.
Hestia Capital went nuclear today with a press release announcing its intention to overhaul Pitney Bowes’ board and accusing the company of engaging in what it called “seemingly bad faith and unethical tactics” and trying to “go behind our back.”Hestia said it was the third largest stockholder of Pitney Bowes with a beneficial ownership position of approximately 7.1%, but denied it was an activist investor.
Hestia’s Founder and Chief Investment Officer Kurt Wolf said in a letter to shareholders that it had proposed the addition of three new independent directors but accused Pitney Bowes of contacting its proposed candidates “in a seemingly harassing manner.”An article in Reuters cited “sources” who said Hestia had proposed candidate replacements for Pitney Bowes CEO including former ShippingEasy.com chief Katie May and former Stamps.com CEO Ken McBride.
The full Hestia press release is available on BusinessWire.
Update 12/13/2022: Updated to remove the reference to Hestia’s advisors at its request.', 'eBay UK has launched Certified Refurbished Peloton bikes at £995 - £350 off the new RRP- just in time for your fitness focused resolutions.
The home of refurbished and pre-loved goods, eBay sells a refurbished product every 10 seconds in the UK.
Kirsty Keoghan, Senior Director of Trading at eBay says: “Peloton makes an excellent addition to our Certified Refurbished offering here at eBay.
Combining technology, fitness and content Peloton brings captivating workouts to people at home or anywhere they choose to workout.
A category innovator at the nexus of fitness, technology, and media, Peloton’s first-of-its-kind subscription platform seamlessly combines innovative hardware, distinctive software, and exclusive content.', '', 'Snipe bidding used to be a competitive sport on eBay, and believe it or not, it continues to be controversial.
Everyone has their own opinion about snipe bidding.
Since Dave Eccles created CricketSniper in 1997, eBay has waged war on and off against sniping software that automates snipe bidding.
eBay's policy also addresses "Automated bid sniping software":"Many websites and software packages offer automated bidding based on the end time of an eBay auction.
eBay also provided the following tip: "Instead of bid sniping, set up automatic bidding for listings where you want to maximize your chances of winning."']

title: ['eBay reveals over half of UK shoppers will turn to second-hand ... - Charged Retail', 'eBay Australia Issued New Seller Protections for Late Deliveries - eSeller365']
summary:
['Over half of UK shoppers, 52%, will be looking to purchase second-hand or refurbished items this festive season, according to new research by online marketplace eBay.
The research reveals that consumers are intending to spend over £100 less on average, with shoppers opting for pre-loved items to offset costs.
In addition, consumers are searching for “top-quality gifts at excellent prices” in the festive run up, with 38% saying that getting bang for their buck was amongst their top priorities this year.
“We’re anticipating a shift to pre-loved gifting this Christmas and we want to celebrate it,” eBay senior director of trading Kirsty Keoghan said.
“From luxury watches, to signed football shirts and rare trainers, pre-loved gifts are the answer to all of your Christmas shopping stresses.”', 'eBay Australia issued a curious late notice (December 13!)
stating it is protecting seller reputations from late deliveries on orders sent over the Black Friday shopping week.
Don’t MissWhat it means: eBay Australia seller protections will apply to all domestic parcels in Australia sent between Wednesday 23 November, and Friday 2 December 2022.
We’re here to support you, so we’ve put seller protections in place.”What else is important: Along with the above Black Friday week seller protection notice, the company also reminded sellers of another seller protection measure that’s still in place due to a previous rail network outage.
But if you sold on eBay and your shipments are running late and they are from the eligible dates, eBay will protect you.']

title: ['New UK marketplace launched to offer post-Brexit alternative to ... - InternetRetailing', 'Codisto Unveils New API Integration to Boost Sales for Shopify and ... - Business Wire', 'Barracuda Networks names eBay exec Joe Billante as new CFO ... - The Business Journals', 'Amazon, Walmart, eBay, other sellers, targeted with scam that could compromise your accounts - NJ.com', 'AMD Radeon RX 7900 XTX video cards now available on eBay for ... - Notebookcheck.net', "'Export Ka Expert': eBay enabling e-commerce exports and solving for key pain-points - Economic Times", 'This Instagram Account Collects Images Of The Weirdest Things ... - Bored Panda']
summary:
['A new, zero-fee UK marketplace has gone live to offer sellers a better way to sell competitively in the UK and abroad post-Brexit.
UK Marketplace (UKM) – which went live on 12 December – says it is set to provide a competitive new alternative to the established digital marketplaces, such as eBay, Etsy, and Not on the Highstreet.
Differentiated by a model that works solely with UK-registered businesses and a value-driven transaction cost, UKM will provide a space dedicated to the support of UK businesses and UK communities.
Originally devised as a means to support British businesses post-Brexit, UKM will operate on a zero-fee policy.
Instead, British sellers – whether businesses or budding entrepreneurs – will be able to realise the true value of their products.', 'Codisto is the only ecommerce developer that can be natively installed on a retailer’s Shopify platform to integrate seamlessly with eBay’s REST API.
This development ensures that Shopify merchants using eBay’s Shopify integration can seamlessly migrate their eBay channel management to Codisto, avoiding any disruption to their operations during the holiday period.
Since eBay’s announcement to discontinue its Shopify connector on October 4, Codisto has seen an increase of 26% in sign-ups to its eBay integration.
For more information on Codisto’s eBay integration, visit https://codisto.com/platforms/shopify/, or to install Codisto, visit https://apps.shopify.com/codisto-linq.
Codisto facilitates over US$2 billion in sales for over 30,000 global retail customers each year.', '', 'It’s a scam in which third-party sellers from online marketplaces such as Amazon, Walmart and eBay — the three largest — try to boost their rankings in the hopes of getting more people to see their online stores and buy their wares.
On eBay, under “My eBay,” click “summary.” In the upper right hand corner, you’ll see your eBay name with a hyperlink.
Walmart’s online review process is a little different.
It’s unclear if you can remove reviews once they’re posted, and Walmart didn’t immediately respond to requests for comment.
Walmart didn’t respond to our requests.', 'Sadly, the reference RX 7900 XTX design with its list price of US$999 is far behind the custom cards listed on eBay.
4 ReviewsUnsurprisingly, the brand-new AMD Radeon RX 7900 XT and Radeon RX 7900 XTX are nearly impossible to find at the official launch prices of US$899 and US$999.
Right now, the most interesting eBay listing of a RX 7900 XTX is that of a limited edition card, namely the PowerColor Red Devil 7900 XTX.
On Amazon, for example, there are many RX 7900 XTX products listed with a "Currently Unavailable" status and no "Back in Stock" date.
Buy the PowerColor Red Devil AMD Radeon RX 6950 XT on Amazon', 'They mainly deal with exports of apparel, gems and jewellery, home and textiles, and more.
Many marketplaces tend to assume control over exporters’ pricing strategies, making it very difficult for sellers to run their businesses the way they want.
On various occasions, marketplaces have also ended up copying the well-performing products of the exporters, becoming more competitive and less partnership-focused.With its ‘Export Ka Expert’ campaign , eBay aims at solving these long-standing pain points of Indian exporters.
Through its ad film, it highlights the challenges that exporters face while doing their cross-border export business.
Without becoming their competitor, eBay provides its partner sellers with guidance on shipping, payment, etc.', "Would you be interested in purchasing a haunted paranormal doll?
How about a gorgeous painted bust of “Tex the Reptile Man”?
You look like the type of person who needs an LED USB rechargeable horsetail light.
If you would never purchase those things in a million years, don’t worry.
Then if you’re looking for even more bizarre items that you can make a bid on, you can find Bored Panda's last article featuring eBayBae right here!"]

title: ['Buying An Eames Chair On eBay, I Met The Wunderkind Of Vintage Furniture Restoration. Now I’m Obsessed With His Company, Rarify. Here’s The Amazing Story Of A Teen Collector Turned Millennial Design Authority - Forbes', 'Nike x eBay SB Dunk Low "Sandy": Where to buy, price, release date, and more explored - Sportskeeda', 'eBay UK Orders May Not Arrive in Time for Christmas - EcommerceBytes', 'eBay to Pay for Parts Returns for Sellers Who Enable Fitment - EcommerceBytes']
summary:
['', 'Nike is joining forces with eBay to release a special and limited-edition SB Dunk Low makeover to honor Sandy Bodecker, the designer of the swoosh label's skateboarding line, Nike SB.
The upcoming Nike x eBay SB Dunk Low "Sandy" sneakers honor SB sub-label's patriarch Sandy BodeckerThe upcoming Nike x eBay SB Dunk Low "Sandy" sneakers honor SB sub-label's patriarch Sandy Bodecker (Image via Sportskeeda)The swoosh label is bringing back the "eBay" dunk colorway, which was released under the SB label's patriarch Sandy Bodecker.
The eBay Dunk Low adds the final piece to the impossible puzzle together and offers a little transparency."
Now, to honor Sandy Bodecker, the SB team has re-created the iconic OG eBay SB Dunk Low.
We don't say he's the man who put the SB in Nike SB for no reason."', 'Many items are already showing post-Christmas estimated delivery dates, eBay warned sellers in the UK on Wednesday and suggested they use couriers to fulfill orders – though it didn’t suggest who should pay for the expedited delivery costs.
“By opting to use faster, tracked services, this will enable items to show estimated delivery dates before Christmas, which could help to boost last-minute sales,” eBay told sellers.
“Just remember to upload tracking information before the latest estimated delivery date.”eBay blamed ongoing strike action by members of the CWU at Royal Mail and Parcelforce for the delays.
“We recommend using eBay delivery by Packlink where you can purchase Tracked labels at a discount,” it said.
eBay said it would automatically protect sellers’ performance until December 31, see the full announcement on the eBay UK seller announcement board.', 'eBay is betting its investments in fitment technology will pay off – if it can get sellers in its eBay Motors Parts & Accessories category to adopt it.
In an email on Thursday, eBay dangled a significant carrot: free returns for sellers who add fitment and adopt its new returns API update.
“I’m floored they would ever offer any scenario where they give a free shipping label,” a Top Rated eBay seller told EcommerceBytes.
eBay Motors Parts & Accessories is one of eBay’s largest categories, generating over $10 billion in annual GMV – and it’s also one of eBay’s “focus” categories.
One month later, eBay Motors General Manager Chris Prill and the head of eBay Motors product and engineering Paul Stathacopoulos gave a presentation at the eBay Open seller conference where they explained how they were integrating fitment into search for a better shopping experience for buyers.']

title: ['eBay In Music: By The Numbers - Genius', 'Creating Celebrity Style: How Mike Cooke Took Sterling Forever from eBay to the Red Carpet - E! NEWS', 'eBay CEO: ‘I supported the American Rescue Plan–but a little-known provision will hurt millions of Americans who buy and sell used goods online’ - Fortune', 'For Rare Sneaker Finds, eBay Reigns Supreme - InsideHook', "Zadeh Kicks' Remaining Sneakers Are Up for Sale on Ebay - Complex", 'Lego, Nike, eBay and more: Snapchat picks top campaigns of 2022 - CampaignLive', 'How eBay Employees Are Teaming Up with Nonprofits to ... - eBay Inc.', 'OneOf, eBay And Globe Entertainment Team Up To Release Led ... - XTZ News', 'Why eBay Downgraded a Top Performing Seller - EcommerceBytes']
summary:
['We at Genius decided to crunch the numbers on eBay’s lyrical mentions over the last 20-plus years and examine some of the ways in which artists reference the site.
2010s: eBay on the (Lyrical) RiseIn the 2010’s, eBay’s mentions rose significantly, and it wasn’t just American artists leading the charge.
At Blue Flame throwin’ green Ben FranklinsComme des Garçons off of eBay, uhIn all, eBay was referenced in more than 500 songs during the 2010s.
Perhaps that’s why eBay has racked up nearly 200 lyrical mentions from 2020 to the present.
If this trend continues, eBay will have its biggest decade ever in pop music.', 'Just ask Mike Cooke, owner of Sterling Forever.
Sterling Forever is a jewelry brand focusing on celebrity designer style and ready-to-wear accessories.
Sterling Forever has been making waves since 2012, and Mike Cooke is well aware of the triumphs and challenge that come with "playing with the big guys."
Mike Cooke started the business that would become Sterling Forever at 15 years old, selling his mother's old jewelry in his parent's basement.
He took the profits and sourced more jewelry and kept growing the business from there.', 'This is where online marketplaces play a critical role.
The vast majority of Americans selling online are not running businesses, but rather are casual sellers who occasionally sell used or pre-owned goods to make a little extra money.
Today, online marketplaces have taken on even greater significance amid the economic challenges of the past two years.
We are committed to promoting the interests of casual sellers as we educate policymakers about the important role re-commerce (the reselling of pre-owned goods) plays in helping hard-working individuals and families.
And, if they don’t have proof of the original price, then they could be liable for income tax on those sales.', "Your Email (required) Please enter a valid email address.
Your First Name (required) Please enter your first name.
Your Last Name (required) Please enter your last name.
Friends' email At least one valid email address is required.", 'Malekzadeh, who sold and took advance preorders for sneakers under his Zadeh Kicks brand, was charged in July with wire fraud, conspiracy to commit bank fraud, and money laundering.
While he awaits his day in court, the receivership in charge of Zadeh Kicks’ remaining 60,000-sneaker inventory has been looking for ways to sell off the shoes.
According to a report from Nice Kicks, the court-appointed receiver, David Stapleton, has found a partner in Ebay.
“The receiver has determined to use the Ebay marketplace as an avenue to sell Zadeh’s remaining inventory,” Ebay’s GM of sneakers Garry Thaniel tells the website.
As an online marketplace, Ebay does not manage any listings or sales on our platform.', "Lego, Nike, eBay and more: Snapchat picks top campaigns of 2022Snapchat's top 10 campaigns of 2022 involved an AR queer art exhibition and a virtual careers fair.", "“It has helped me become a stronger leader with more passion for our community of employees and charity partners.
The grantmaking program supports inspiring nonprofits worldwide that work to foster entrepreneurship in local communities.
eBay employees share their knowledge of technology and product development with the center's teenage participants.
“The excellent advice and tips eBay employees share with the teens, help them turn their idea into something real,” said Matan Edry, Netanya Unistream Entrepreneurship Center Manager.
As part of volunteering with Unistream, eBay employees provided speed dating career sessions for Jewish and Arab students to help them prepare for job interviews.", 'OneOf, the mass-consumer Web3 company empowering iconic brands, artists, and athletes, today announces their Legends of Rock: Led Zeppelin digital collectibles series in partnership with eBay and Globe Entertainment and Media (Globe), custodian of the world’s most famous archives.
The Legends of Rock: Led Zeppelin Collection features a unique collection of three photos taken by photographer Jay Thompson, capturing Robert Plant, Jimmy Page, John Bonham and John Paul Jones during the famous 1969 photo shoot at Hollywood’s Chateau Marmont.
The tickets, which were exclusively printed for the special concert series and would surely become an important piece of Led Zeppelin memorabilia, were never sold and the Led Zeppelin era came to an untimely end.
“Led Zeppelin is my favorite band of all time and I could not be more excited about this collection,” says Joshua James, Co-Founder & COO, OneOf.
The Diamond tier ($399) will offer 5 fans a 30 x 24 professionally framed and engraved photograph of Led Zeppelin as well as four tickets from the Chicago Stadium Led Zeppelin concert.', 'As a seller on eBay, I would like to know what you make of the following:I have been selling on eBay for 18 years, most of them have been as Top Rated Seller.
Last month I was downgraded to "above standard", which did not make any sense to me since my customer service is excellent.
Then, this morning, I received the following email:Top Rated Seller status updateHi James,Unfortunately, your account no longer meets one or more of the Top Rated Seller requirements based on US seller performance standards and your grace period has ended.
Visit your seller standards dashboard to find out which areas need attention and get your account back on the Top Rated Seller track.
I told the lady that my performance with my customers was excellent, but evidently I could not satisfy money-hungry eBay.']

title: ['Warning after danger Christmas lights sold online, including on Amazon and EBay - Chronicle Live', "New tax rule for eBay and Venmo will cause 'significant confusion,' CPAs say - MarketWatch"]
summary:
["Nearly every set of Christmas lights bought for safety tests on online marketplaces should not have been on sale in the UK, a shocking new report has found.
Ten sets of lights failed to come with instructions or were missing key markings covering things like how to dispose of the lights and what their electrical ratings are.
LED string lights bought through AliExpress - £10.49Listed product name on AliExpress: 100M LED String Lights Fairy Green Wire Outdoor Christmas Lights Tree Garland For New Year Street Home Party Wedding Decoration.
Christmas LED lights bought through Wish - £8.98Listed product name on Wish: The Christmas Lights 200 Ultra Bright LED String Chaser, Blue.
What the online marketplaces saidAliExpressTotal number of lights which failed test: 3Total number of lights which passed test: 0AliExpress said: 'The items identified as part of the investigation by Which?", 'As Congress concludes 2022 with a sprint to pass laws and a spending deal, tax accountants are joining a chorus of e-commerce companies and pay platforms who say a revamped tax form is about to cause serious confusion unless legislators make quick changes.
Without higher money thresholds to trigger the form, there could be “significant confusion in the tax system in the next several months” and the chance of exacerbating an IRS backlog “that still haunts the tax system,” the American Institute of CPAs said in a letter Friday.']

title: ['Could you find your dream Christmas gift on the eBay for toffs? The elite social network for items - Daily Mail', 'Is eBay Requiring Sellers to Provide Their Cell Phone Number? - EcommerceBytes']
summary:
["Then you need to become a member of Britain's most elite social network.
These proposers and seconders fill out a testimonial form, illustrating that person's 'character', and 'what you think they might bring to the Radio H-P community'.
He dubbed it Radio H-P after his surname, and it's grown ever since.
Although the idea of a posh, private online club may enrage class warriors and it's all too easy to poke fun of, Radio H-P does a lot of good, too.
So what kind of treasures can you find on Radio H-P?", 'eBay sellers are trying to determine if they need to provide eBay with their cell phone numbers after the marketplace began issuing warnings to sellers this fall to update their contact information and verify their accounts.
One seller who does not have a cell phone wrote : "The eBay agent basically said I had to purchase one or I would be unable to receive payments in February."
An eBay moderator responded to sellers' questions in one of the threads, but sellers remained uncertain about whether they needed to have a cell phone in order to continue selling on eBay.
One seller marveled that eBay might require sellers to enter their cell phone numbers, saying their financial institution offered three ways of receiving a verification code:- Phone call to me and the code is provided in a message.
- Email the code to me- Text the code to meAnother eBay Seller replied, "Send an account verification code to an unverified cell phone via text to verify the account.']

title: ["Nintendo 64 selling for £205,000 on eBay - the seller says it 'smells like 1996' - Daily Star", 'Nike raises $350,000 for Bodecker Foundation through eBay SB ... - The Business Journals', 'UKM: New UK Marketplace Challenges Amazon, eBay, Etsy, and ... - eSeller365', 'Painting bought for £40 on eBay sells for £130,000 - The Times', "Ebay nuovo sponsor di manica dell'Inter: al club 5 milioni a stagione - La Gazzetta dello Sport", 'FCIN1908 / Inter-eBay, accordo esteso a Primavera e Femminile. Ecco le cifre - FC Inter 1908', 'EBay targets Gen Z with first brand campaign in three years - AdAge.com']
summary:
["Videogame collectors had better start remortgaging their homes—a Nintendo 64 is currently being flogged on eBay for an eyewatering $250,000 (£205,000).
A US-based seller is offering a 'launch edition' N64 sealed in its original, unopened box for a quarter of a million dollars.
(Image: MICHAEL REYNOLDS/EPA-EFE/REX/Shutterstock)According to the seller, the Nintendo 64 in question is factory sealed with all its original fixings in place.
(Image: LightRocket via Getty Images)If it's authentic, the console in question was launched at a time when there was only two games for Nintendo 64: Super Mario 64 and Pilotwings 64.
Near-mint condition Nintendo 64s routinely go for around £5095 on eBay, but nowhere near as much as £205,000.", '', 'What you need to know: A new marketplace in the UK is trying to take on the likes of eBay, Etsy, Amazon, and OnBuy by differentiating itself to work solely with UK-registered businesses.
How British Centric is UK Marketplace?
UKM location: While UKM’s homepage says “Proudly British,” the company behind the UK-centric marketplace is UK Marketplace FZC LLC, located in the United Arab Emirates (UAE).
The site is hosted on UK servers, and UKM says it follows all UK and European regulations.
There are no integrations with marketplace facilitators or other ecommerce multi-channel solutions to help business sellers list products on the platform quickly.', 'White Roses in a Glass was bought for £40 on eBay.
The artist Helene Schjerfbeck painted it in St Ives, CornwallA painting of roses in a glass bought for £40 on eBay has fetched £130,000 at auction after it was found to be a lost work by a leading European artist.
The work was obscured by grime and flecks of white paint used to recolour the original gold gilt frame.
SponsoredIt was snapped up by a buyer in Edinburgh who thought it would look nice on his wall.
The Scot, who wishes to remain anonymous, posted online a photograph of the faint signature in the lower right-hand corner.', "In attesa di definire la questione del main sponsor, la società di viale della Liberazione ha trovato un'intesa biennale, con opzione di rinnovo per un anno in più, con il famoso sito di vendita e aste onlineIn attesa di risolvere la vicenda DigitalBits, togliendo dalla maglia per inadempienza contrattuale la società di blockchain che si occupa soprattutto di cripto-valute, l'Inter ha trovato il nuovo sponsor di manica: si tratta di eBay, sito universalmente noto di vendita e aste online.
Tra l'Inter ed eBay c'era già una partnership che aveva portato il brand leader nel commercio globale a diventare Official Marketplace del club nerazzurro per la stagione calcistica fino al 2024.
Adesso la collaborazione è stata allargata visto che il marchio apparirà sulla manica della prima squadra maschile (sia in Italia sia in Champions), femminile e delle giovanili.", "L'Inter ha trovato un nuovo sponsor di manica.
Si tratta di eBay, che era già partner nerazzurro come Official Marketplace per 2 stagioniL'Inter ha trovato un nuovo sponsor di manica.
Si tratta di eBay, che era già partner nerazzurro come Official Marketplace per 2 stagioni.
Ora l'accordo si arricchisce e il marchio finirà sulle divise della prima squadra, dell'Inter Primavera e anche dell'Inter Femminile.", 'Once registered, you can:- Read additional free articles each month- Comment on articles and featured creative work- Get our curated newsletters delivered to your inboxfirst_name:last_name:email:Register NowBy registering you agree to our privacy policy, terms & conditions and to receive occasional emails from Ad Age.
You may unsubscribe at any time.
Are you a print subscriber?
Activate your account.']

title: ['eBay and Etsy CEOs Call for Lawmakers to Act on Small-Business ... - EcommerceBytes', 'Bride spends £491 on dream wedding thanks to eBay, Asos and Morrisons - Wales Online', 'eBay UK Thanks Sellers After Enduring a Challenging Year 2022 - eSeller365', "Inter Milan land '€5m a year' EBay sleeve deal after terminating ... - SportsPro Media", 'You can grab some Frankie’s Pizza By The Slice memorabilia on eBay - Tone Deaf', 'Thrifty DIYer saves HUNDREDS upgrading his dated fireplace using eBay and Gumtree bargains - Daily Mail']
summary:
['As the year wound down, the CEOs of eBay and Etsy called on US lawmakers to take action to help small-business owners who sell on their respective platforms, but each executive had his own priority.
For eBay CEO Jamie Iannone, it was concern over new tax-reporting requirements that will take effect when sellers file their income taxes in April for sales revenue received in 2022.
And, he said, budget-conscious consumers could be impacted due to fewer used items being available for sale on marketplaces like eBay.
Meanwhile, Etsy CEO Josh Silverman made a trip to Washington DC in early December to advocate for government-supported child care and family leave that don’t rely on employer benefits, according to Axios.
We reached out to Etsy to learn more about CEO Silverman’s recent lobbying on sellers’ behalf and have yet to receive a response.', 'Keep up to date with the latest stories with our WalesOnline newsletterA bride has shared how she planned her "dream wedding" on a budget for just £491 - including eBay accessories, ASOS dress and Morrisons bouquet.
I wanted a fun cool dress that represented my personality and I got one off ASOS for £110.
My veil was off ASOS in the sale for £15 and I wore a pair of Nike Airforce ones I already had, paired with £3 eBay sunglasses.
"The staff were so lovely they gave us a free game of some golf and some visors - we had our first dance to This Charming Man by the Smiths at Junkyard Golf, Leeds.
All in all, the couple spent £73 marrying in the registry office, £110 on the wedding dress, £15 on the veil, £10 on flowers, £3 on sunglasses, £180 on wedding rings from H Samuels and £100 on their activities - totalling £491.', 'eBay UK thanked sellers after enduring a challenging year selling on the marketplace as inflation and the Royal Mail postal worker strike have impacted just about everyone in Britain.
Don’t MissIn a video posted by eBay, Murray Lambell, General Manager of eBay UK, said, “It’s somehow nearly the end of another year, and what a year it’s been.
“Small businesses are not only the beating heart of eBay, but also they’re the beating heart of the UK economy.
Enhanced Seller Protections is another area eBay UK spotlighted in its year-end wrap-up.
eBay UK General Manager Murray Lambell Year-End VideoSubscribe to Our Newsletter Submit Please enable JavaScript in your browser to submit the form We do not sell your information.', 'Inter Milan have agreed a deal with EBay that sees the ecommerce platform become the Italian soccer giants’ new sleeve sponsor.
The agreement builds on the partnership that was signed at the start of the 2022/23 season that saw Inter launch a dedicated ecommerce portal on EBay.
However, last month Inter confirmed plans to terminate their €85 million (US$90.38 million) agreement with Zytara Labs, the parent company of DigitalBits, after multiple missed payments left the blockchain brand owing the club €17 million (US$18.08 million).
Alessandro Antonello, Inter chief executive: “We’re delighted to announce this new and significant development in the agreement between Inter and EBay, following on from the start of the partnership a few months ago.
“This bond was further strengthened today with eBay gaining visibility on the club’s shirt, one of its most important commercial assets.', 'Sydney said a sad goodbye to Frankie’s Pizza By The Slice earlier this month, with Australia losing one of its finest – and most unrelentingly raucous – live music venues.
But if you’re a super fan of Frankie’s already dearly missing the place, fear not: a bunch of Frankie’s memorabilia is currently up for auction over on eBay.
You have three days to bid on bits and pieces from the Frankie’s Pizza cave.
Big ticket items include the official Frankie’s Pizza drum kit for a whopping $750 and Teagan Presley’s PENTHOUSE picture for $600.
There’s still some time remaining to get your hands on some iconic Frankie’s memorabilia here.', '']

title: ['eBay, BFC announce circular fashion fund winners | Fashion ... - Ecotextile News', 'eBay Offers Seller Protection from Storm-Delay Fallout - EcommerceBytes', '5 Bo Bichette Prospect and Rookie Card Picks, Hottest eBay Auctions - Sports Collectors Daily', 'eBay Users Are Having Problems with Combined Shipping - EcommerceBytes', 'eBay "Manifesto" - SHOOT Online']
summary:
["LONDON – Secondhand product marketplace eBay and the British Fashion Council have today announced the six winners of their first Circular Fashion Innovator's Fund.
The winners, who share £100,000 (US$120,000), are: By Rotation, Circular Textiles Foundation, The Seam, Sages, Pip and Henry, and Circular Inc – one of which will be crowned an overall winner and receive an additional £10,000.
Lucy Peacock, eBay’s head of pre-loved, said: “Circularity is the future of fashion, and over recent years start-ups and small businesses have been at the forefront of solutions to make it a reality.
The winners of the Circular Fashion Innovator’s Fund epitomise this.”", 'eBay said it would offer protection to sellers whose packages get delayed by the severe winter storm hitting much of the country this week.
The announcement came Wednesday afternoon as the National Weather Service was forecasting a “significant and disruptive storm system” followed by plunging temperatures.
FedEx said on its website Wednesday that it was “closely monitoring the severe winter weather expected across much of the country” and said it contingency plans in place.
However, it noted that the severe weather forecast for its hub cities of Indianapolis and Memphis could cause delays throughout the network.
Sellers are vulnerable to delivery days that are outside of their control at the best of times.', '', 'People are reporting problems with eBay's "combined shipping" feature, and we're curious about how widespread the issue may be, although we're not sure if sellers are always aware when buyers encounter the problem.
The latest report came from a reader this week who said:"For many years on eBay, I would look over a seller's site to see if there were other items that I wanted from them after winning an auction.
But, in the last couple of months and more frequently this month, I've gotten many notices from eBay stating that the seller will not combine any shipments.
Another reader said they encountered the problem last week, writing in a news tip, "I just wanted to report that there appears to be a problem with eBay not charging shipping, i.e., eBay only charging the buyer for one item's shipping, when multiple items were purchased, as happened to me last night."
It's hard for us to know whether this is a problem stemming from sellers not understanding how to set up combined shipping; whether buyers aren't adding multiple items to their cart before purchasing; or if there is a technical issue.', 'eBay “Manifesto,” celebrating positivity and ingenuity, was directed by Rocio Crudo (represented in the US by Easy Mondays), created via Achtung, and produced by E+P, with support from service company Chelsy on location in Vienna.
Vignettes depict everyday life disrupted by challenges, with each solution facilitated on eBay.']

title: ['eBay’s best Boxing Day sales 2022: Up to 73% off tech, fashion and more - finder.com.au', 'EBay, PayPal, Others Ask Yellen to Delay Tax Reporting Change - Bloomberg Law', 'eBay UK and BFC unveil circularity innovation grant recipients - ww.fashionnetwork.com', 'Netherlands-based EuroStocks links with Ebay Kleinanzeigen - AIM Group', 'eBay works with Pinterest creators to reach shoppers with an ... - InternetRetailing']
summary:
['Top 4 eBay Boxing Day dealsFor dedicated consumers, Christmas is simply the final obstacle in the way of one of the biggest sales events of the year – Boxing Day.
There are plenty of early Boxing Day deals available from storefronts like eBay right now.
Here are the top early Boxing Day eBay deals for your shopping pleasure right now.
Early Boxing Day eBay deals on techEarly Boxing Day eBay deals on fashion and beautyEarly Boxing Day eBay deals on homewares and appliancesHungry for more bargains?
Check out our complete guide to all the best sales of Boxing Day 2022.', 'A coalition of eBay Inc., PayPal Inc., Etsy Inc., and others urged Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen Thursday to delay a tax reporting change that they say will create confusion among their platform users.
A provision of the 2021 pandemic aid law set to take effect for the coming tax filing season will require e-commerce platforms to send a Form 1099-K to taxpayers with more than $600 in business transactions, instead of the previous $20,000 threshold.
After a last-minute push in Congress to add an amendment delaying the change failed, a coalition of 20 platforms said Treasury should put off the ...', 'eBay UK and BFC unveil circularity innovation grant recipients BySandra Halliday PublishedDec 22, 2022By Rotation, Pip & Henry and the Circular Textiles Foundation are among the six winners of UK and the ’s first Circular Fashion Innovator’s Fund.
Pip & HenryThe fund aims to help grow small businesses that are providing more sustainable fashion solutions, and will deliver £100,000 in grants.
Each of the six winning businesses will receive mentoring from industry leaders and a £15,000 grant to accelerate their growth.
An overall winner will also be announced soon and will get an additional £10,000 grant.
Finally Circular Inc Ltd is a business providing circular design and sustainable manufacturing to accompany radio frequency identification (RFID)-assisted commercial repair and upcycling of clothing.', 'However, when advertising vehicles or products on Ebay Kleinanzeigen, sellers in the Netherlands must provide an address in Germany — a Dutch address cannot be used to create an Ebay Kleinanzeigen account.
The first sellers that EuroStocks has connected to Ebay Kleinanzeigen are those located close to the German border.
Customers can use EuroStocks, which was founded in 2019, to set up their own webshops via the platform and connect with mobile.de, Marktplaats, 2dehands.be and now Ebay Kleinanzeigen.
EBay Kleinanzeigen was a part of EBay Classifieds Group until June 2021, when it was purchased by Norway-based Adevinta.
The two largest marketplaces in the Netherlands and Belgium, Marktplaats.nl and 2dehands.be, are already cooperating with Ebay Kleinanzeigen.', 'eBay has worked with Pinterest creators for the first time in order to reach potential customers looking for DIY and festive inspiration for their homes.
Thanks to Pinterest, I have the opportunity to partner with big retailers such as eBay and do just that.
Alex Allcott, brand director at eBay UK, says: “We are delighted to be partnering with Pinterest for our ‘Christmas Your Way’ campaign.
Handing over the creative power to three brilliant Pinterest creators known for their interior inspiration has helped shape up authentic content that could only come from creators who understand our audience.
Recently we’ve seen a particular spike in searches for ‘Christmas decor DIY’, which gives eBay the perfect opportunity to highlight the variety of products that can be bought or upcycled on the marketplace, to create those beautifully personal gifts.”']

title: ['eBay Boxing Day deals: 20% off Dell, $400 off Dyson vacuums, $69 ... - Gadgetguy.com.au', 'eBay: Illogical Round Trip (NASDAQ:EBAY) - Seeking Alpha', 'How eBay and PayPal Handle 1099K Commingling Problems - EcommerceBytes']
summary:
['Alongside the many other retailers with big Boxing Day sales, there are also big savings on offer as part of the eBay Boxing Day event.
Plus, these are just the eBay Boxing Day deals available now: no doubt there will be plenty more available when 26 December actually rolls around.
eBay Boxing Day deals highlightsTake a further 20% off Dell’s eBay storeIf you’re in the market for a new PC or laptop, 20% off storewide at the Dell eBay store is a great starting point.
Here are some of the standouts:Get up to $400 off Dyson cordless vacuumsDyson also has plenty of bargains included in the eBay Boxing Day deals.
More eBay Boxing day dealsAs we get closer to Boxing day, keep an eye out on the tech deals section on eBay, as more retailers join in on the sales.', "JHVEPhotoAs with most stocks, eBay (NASDAQ:EBAY) has made a complete round trip to the pre-Covid levels.
Source: eBay Q3'22 presentationThe retail sector faces a tough period, so any reported growth now versus 2019 remains impressive.
Step by step, the company is working to expand the service offerings where eBay can offer solutions to build upon a simple auction service.
Source: eBay Q3'22 presentationInvestors should be amazed that eBay has maintained a $4+ EPS target in the face of a tough retail environment.
TakeawayThe key investor takeaway is that eBay shouldn't be facing a scenario where the stock trades at pre-Covid levels.", 'Note: The following letter is an update to a situation we wrote about in September , "A 1099-K Notification from PayPal Alerts Seller to Unanticipated Problem."
Dear Ina,1099-K UPDATE: I just got off the phone with a PayPal 1099-K specialist and I told him how the 1099-K they will soon send me will commingle corporate income with self-employment (Schedule C) income.
Warn your readers that they will soon get ONLY ONE PayPal 1099-K showing ALL earned income (other than friend and family gift payments) and will have to hassle the IRS and State governments to solve the problem.
Note: The seller sent a follow-up that shows how eBay is handling commingling according to an : The seller sent a follow-up that shows how eBay is handling commingling according to an eBay help pageForm 1099-K and multiple eBay accountsIf you have multiple eBay accounts associated with the same Tax ID, your thresholds are calculated by combining all payment transactions.
For example, you may have two eBay seller accounts associated with the same Tax ID.']

title: ['For Sale on eBay: A Military Database of Fingerprints and Iris Scans - The New York Times', 'Somehow, U.S. Military Biometric Data Ended Up For Sale on eBay - InsideHook', 'Military device with biometric database of 2K people sold on eBay for $68 - Ars Technica', 'eBay Buyer Promo Backfires as Reward Bucks Fail to Appear - EcommerceBytes', "UPS takes $1,200 from eBay Seller's Checking Account - EcommerceBytes", 'Riddle of the bags of Charles 50p coins on eBay for twice their value - This is Money']
summary:
['The shoebox-shaped device, designed to capture fingerprints and perform iris scans, was listed on eBay for $149.95.
The device’s memory card held the names, nationalities, photographs, fingerprints and iris scans of 2,632 people.
Most people in the database, which was reviewed by The New York Times, were from Afghanistan and Iraq.
Many were known terrorists and wanted individuals, but others appeared to be people who had worked with the U.S. government or simply been stopped at checkpoints.
Metadata on the device, called a Secure Electronic Enrollment Kit, or SEEK II, revealed that it had last been used in the summer of 2012 near Kandahar, Afghanistan.', 'A group of security researchers in Germany has been at work on an important task: reviewing the types of devices used to collect biometric data in Afghanistan in the early 21st century.
A recent New York Times article details the surprise that one such researcher received after buying a former military device on eBay for $68: biometric data for over 2,600 people.
What’s especially alarming is that no one seems to know why the data wasn’t deleted from the device between then and now.
The Defense Logistics Agency told the Times that biometric data collection devices are supposed to be destroyed outright after the military is finished using them.
“It is a disaster for the people whose data is exposed,” Baker told the Times.', 'When a German security researcher, Matthias Marx, found a United States military device for sale on eBay—an instrument previously used to identify wanted individuals and known terrorists during the War in Afghanistan—Marx gambled a little and placed a low bid of $68.
But win he did, and after that, he had an even bigger surprise coming, The New York Times reported.
AdvertisementCurrently, no one’s sure how many times the device has traded hands since it was last used in 2012 near Kandahar, Afghanistan.
Marx has shown abundant caution with the data, declining to share the database electronically with The Times.
“We also imagined the data would be useful to investigate how the devices ended up online and to derive who else is potentially endangered,” Marx told Ars.', 'That may be the reason eBay decided to run an eBay Bucks promotion the day after Christmas, but something went terribly wrong.
Some EcommerceBytes readers may be wondering, didn’t eBay discontinue the eBay Bucks program?
I activated the 5% eBay bucks this morning, purchased 3 items and now it shows that I received $0.00 Earned for the 3 items on my eBay bucks page.
“All 3 listing pages clearly stated that I would receive eBay bucks on the purchases so I know they were included in the promotion.
Update 12/28/2022: A reader who saw the story wrote to us to report eBay credited his account today (the 28th) for the eBay Bucks that failed to show up on the 26th.', 'We sometimes see reports from eBay sellers who say UPS or FedEx charge them extra shipping fees after they purchase shipping labels, but there was an extreme case described by a seller in a post on the eBay discussion boards today.
The eBay seller wrote: "Let me know about class action if someone starts one.
Ups just took 1200.01 out of my checking 5 days after delivery I'm sick to my stomach.
The mystery is why UPS didn't require the seller to enter the package dimensions and weight and provided the correct shipping cost *before* the seller purchased the label and shipped the package.
If you have any shipping horror stories, let us know - and is there something marketplaces and shipping carriers can do to prevent sellers from incurring surprise fees?', 'Sealed bags containing 20 of the new 50p coins depicting King Charles are selling online for more than double their face value.
Money Mail understands the Post Office is looking into how the bags have ended up on eBay, and could issue new advice to its branches.
The Post Office is now urging people not to buy the bags being listed on eBay.
One bag of the 50p coins sold for £17 with 11 auction bids, while a single coin sold for £2.55 with six bids.
Following tradition, His Majesty faces left on the new 50p coin — the opposite direction to his late mother.']

title: ['eBay Demands for Photo IDs Leave Sellers Uncomfortable - EcommerceBytes', 'IRS Delays $600 Tax Rule for Venmo, eBay Sellers - PCMag', 'For sale on eBay: US military devices used in Afghanistan and Iraq - ABC News', 'I’ve made hundreds selling my Christmas presents on eBay – I’m not fussy but I’d prefer money for my bills... - The Sun']
summary:
['Not long ago we received a raft of emails from readers expressing concerns that eBay was requiring them to upload images of their driver’s license.
“eBay is now requiring a photo id along with all of the information I have supplied in the past,” one seller wrote.
This was fun until eBay decided they wanted everything but my first born child.” The seller said eBay required them to supply either their passport or their driver’s license.
“Online activity of any kind is not possible without risk,” one person replied to a seller who expressed their objections in an eBay seller discussion board thread.
The recent INFORM Consumers Act puts additional requirements on marketplaces like eBay to verify sellers’ identities.', "The Internal Revenue Service (IRS) has just issued a reprieve for anyone who gets paid for their goods and services via e-commerce apps like Venmo, PayPal, or CashApp.
Congress reduced the tax reporting threshold for business transactions to $600 from $20,000 in 2021, but after concerns from some lawmakers, the electronic transactions industry, and the tax community, the IRS announced it would delay chasing taxes until 2024.
The new reporting requirements would have required payment apps like Venmo and CashApp to send 1099-K forms to taxpayers with more than $600 in business transactions this year.
In a bid to alleviate some concerns, some House Democrats introduced legislation to raise the tax threshold(Opens in a new window) to $5,000 earlier this year.
This will allow Congress more time to correct this regulation that puts undue burden on our small businesses.”Editors' Note: This story was updated to clarify that the apps send 1099-K forms to sellers.", '', "But rather than regifting unwanted presents, Phoebe Millican, 23, from Kettering, sells hers on for a profit.
But the Senior Development Technician doesn’t feel an ounce of guilt as she feels the gifts would otherwise be wasted.
She says: “I don’t spend the money on anything specific, it just goes into my bank account to help towards my bills and mortgage.
“Any sales I make from this year's presents will most definitely go towards things such as petrol and the food shop but also my electricity bills.
“In total over the last four years I have been old enough to sell my Christmas gifts on eBay, I’d say I’ve made just over £150 which is not to be sniffed at!”"]

title: ['eBay UK and British Fashion Council to award £100k to small ... - eBay Inc.', 'How to Sell on eBay: 10 Tips to Get You Started - PCMag', 'Get set for the January pinch - eBay finds brits have just £5 a day to ... - eBay Inc.', 'For sale on eBay: A military database of fingerprints and Iris scans - The Indian Express']
summary:
['eBay UK and the British Fashion Council have today announced the six winners of the first Circular Fashion Innovator’s Fund, which is aimed at helping grow small businesses providing more sustainable fashion solutions, and will deliver £100,000 in grants.
Each of the six winning businesses, which all provide circular fashion solutions, will receive mentoring from industry leaders and a £15,000 grant to accelerate their growth.
Tim Cross, Founder of Circular Textiles Foundation, said: “We are honoured to be recognised by eBay and the British Fashion Council as champions of circular fashion.
ENDSNotes to editorsAbout the British Fashion Council:The British Fashion Council (BFC) is a not-for-profit organisation set up in 1983 with the role to strengthen British fashion in the global economy as a leader in responsible, creative businesses.
The BFC promotes British fashion internationally and does so through fashion weeks, exhibitions and showcasing events.', "Selling items on eBay isn't quite as easy as it sounds, at least not if you want to be good at it.
Whether you've already tried selling stuff on eBay or haven't yet given it a shot, these tips can help you in your quest to be a successful seller.
Search eBay for the item you're selling by entering the UPC code, ISBN number, or name.
Sell on eBay for Free(Credit: eBay/Lance Whitney)By default, eBay grants you a certain number of free listings per month(Opens in a new window), up to 250 zero-fee listings for basic sellers and 1,000 or more for those with eBay storefronts.
Time Your Auction Properly(Credit: eBay/Lance Whitney)Does it matter what day and time of day you kick off and close out an auction listing?", 'New research from eBay UK finds surveyed Brits have £184 on average to see them through from Boxing Day to January payday, £5.26 of disposable income daily1.
A third of respondents (29%) are setting savings goals and one in five (20%) are selling items online to generate some extra cash.
This comes after research, carried out by Opinium, found the average household believes they could make £477 by selling items they no longer need3.
The ReSELLution aims to help a nation concerned about their finances by selling unused and undesired items in their home.
Shoppers can also choose to donate a percentage of their sale earnings to one of the 13,000 charities registered on eBay.', 'AdvertisementA Secure Electronic Enrollment Kit, or SEEK II, purchased by German researchers on eBay, in Hamburg, Germany.
(Andreas Meichsner /The New York Times) A Secure Electronic Enrollment Kit, or SEEK II, purchased by German researchers on eBay, in Hamburg, Germany.
Advertisement“It was disturbing that they didn’t even try to protect the data,” Marx said, referring to the U.S. military.
The second SEEK II, with location metadata showing it was last used in Jordan in 2013, appeared to contain the fingerprints and iris scans of a small group of U.S. service members.
After the analysis of the biometric devices is complete, he and his fellow researchers plan to delete the personally identifiable data.']

title: ['eBay to Provide Sellers with a Guide to 1099K Tax Reports - EcommerceBytes', 'eBay Holds $4K in Funds in Yearly Performance Review - EcommerceBytes', "Isle of Wight listings of KSI and Logan Paul's Prime on eBay - Isle of Wight County Press"]
summary:
['eBay promised on Thursday to provide sellers with a guide to the reports they’ll need to file their taxes for the 2022 tax year.
eBay will make the guide available in January and said it would explain to sellers where they can download their Form 1099-K report along with information about their refunds and expenses.
eBay also explained the criteria it would use for sending the 1099-K forms to the IRS:“For tax year 2022, only eBay sellers who: 1) exceed the reporting threshold of $20,000 and 200 transactions, 2) had backup withholding applied in 2022, or 3) are residents of states that have a lower reporting threshold will receive a Form 1099-K.”Throughout 2022, IRS guidance stated companies like eBay that process payments on behalf of sellers would have to issue Form 1099-Ks to sellers who met a $600 threshold, but after Congress failed to change the law, the IRS changed its guidance on December 23, 2022 to revert back to the higher threshold.
However, the reversion only applies to 2022.
Sellers will receive 1099-Ks for tax year 2023 under the new $600 threshold unless Congress takes action in the New Year.', "Dear Ina,Do you know anything about this?
FEEbay is holding about $4k of my money so far, apparently it's a yearly performance review.
There is limited info on the web and the poor CSR woman I talked to in India couldn't do anything about it or provide any details, including where in the user agreement is this policy.
Thanks,D.", "Promoted by social media influencers KSI and Logan Paul, there was chaos in some parts of the country yesterday (Monday), when Prime went on sale.
The You-tube sensation was being sold at Aldi for around £2 per bottle.
Today (Friday), Ebay sellers listed at addresses in Newport, on the Island, are selling the product for an auction starting price of £5 and a Buy It Now price of £8.
The drink is said to contain coconut water, electrolytes, vitamins and antioxidants.
All six flavours of the drink have sold out on the product's official website - where a 12 pack would set you back $29.99."]

The site said the definition of the word weird allows for a wide range of items to be included."]

title: ["eBay Becomes Love Island's First Ever Pre-Loved Fashion Partner - ITV Media"]
summary:
['Giving the Love Island wardrobes a total refresh this Summer, Islanders will wear pre-loved items this season, with a shared wardrobe situated in the new villa for the first time ever.
Viewers can expect to see Islanders wearing fashion that reflects their personalities and individuality this summer, while doing their bit to extend the life cycle of clothes.
eBay UK has recruited celebrity stylist and secondhand enthusiast, Amy Bannerman, to style this year’s Islanders.
This kicks off a broader commercial partnership, whereby eBay will have a presence on itv.com and Love Island’s social media channels.
To get even closer to the Love Island experience, viewers will be able to explore eBay’s Preloved Fashion via the ‘Shop the Show’ tab on the official Love Island app and get access to Islanders through eBay’s social content, direct from the villa.']
